paragraph.leadIn: if—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: there is evidence that the service of documents at an address contained in an application under section 49(1) as the correspondence address is not effective to bring them to the notice of the director, reserve director or company secretary in question; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: it is necessary or expedient for the withheld address to be disclosed in connection with the enforcement of an order or decree of a court; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the Court is satisfied that it is appropriate to make the order.

subsection.leadIn: The Court may make an order for the disclosure by the Registrar of a withheld identification number—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if it is necessary or expedient for the number to be disclosed in connection with the enforcement of an order or decree of a court; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the Court is satisfied that it is appropriate to make the order.

subsection.leadIn: An order under subsection (1) or (2) may be made on the application of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a creditor of the company in respect of which the document containing the withheld information is delivered to the Registrar for registration under this Ordinance, the Companies (Winding Up and Miscellaneous Provisions) Ordinance (Cap. 32) or the predecessor Ordinance; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any other person appearing to the Court to have a sufficient interest.

subsection.content: An order under subsection (1) or (2) must specify the persons to whom, and purposes for which, the disclosure is authorized.

subdivision.name: SD2
subdivision.heading: Protection of Residential Address and Identification Number Contained in Certain Documents

section.name: s53
section.heading: Interpretation

subsection.leadIn: In this Subdivision—
subsection.def: protected address (受保護地址) means, subject to subsection (2)(a), an address that falls within section 54(2)(a);
protected information (受保護資料) means a protected address or a protected identification number;

def.name: RelevantCorrespondenceAddress
def.leadIn: relevant correspondence address (有關通訊地址), in relation to a director of a company, means the address contained, as the correspondence address of the director, in whichever is the most recent of the following—

def.name: Company
def.leadIn: in the case of a company other than those falling within paragraph (a) or (b) of the definition of company in section 20(1)—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: an incorporation form delivered to the Registrar for registration under section 67(1)(b) in relation to the formation of the company or a re-domiciliation form of the company delivered to the Registrar under section 820B(2); (Amended 14 of 2025 s. 4)

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: a notice delivered to the Registrar for registration under section 645(1) or (2) in relation to the appointment of a director, or the nomination of a reserve director, of the company;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: a notice delivered to the Registrar for registration under section 645(4) in relation to a change in the particulars contained in the register of directors of the company;

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: a notice delivered to the Registrar for registration under section 684(1)(d) in relation to the appointment of a director of the company; or

subparagraph.name: v

def.name: Company
def.leadIn: in the case of a company falling within paragraph (a) or (b) of the definition of company in section 20(1)—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: an application to the Registrar under section 776(2) or (3) for registration of the company;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: a return delivered to the Registrar for registration under section 791(1) in relation to a change in the directors of the company; or

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: a return delivered to the Registrar for registration under section 791(1) in relation to a change in the particulars of the directors of the company delivered to the Registrar under Part 16.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of this Subdivision—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an address of a person does not cease to fall within section 54(2)(a) just because the person ceases to be a director of the company; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a reference to a director includes, to that extent, a former director.

subsection.content: Subsection (2)(b) does not apply to a reference to a director in section 55 or 56.

section.name: s54
section.heading: Registrar must not make residential address and identification number available for public inspection

subsection.leadIn: Subsection (2) applies if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: a document—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: is delivered to the Registrar for registration in respect of a company under this Ordinance or the Companies (Winding Up and Miscellaneous Provisions) Ordinance (Cap. 32) and is in a form prescribed by or under, or specified under, the relevant Ordinance; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: is delivered to the Registrar for registration in respect of a company under a provision of the predecessor Ordinance having a continuing effect under Schedule 11 or by virtue of section 23 of the Interpretation and General Clauses Ordinance (Cap. 1) and is in a form specified under section 914(6)(a) or (8)(a);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: any part of the document is required by the relevant Ordinance to contain, and contains—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the usual residential address of a director of the company; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the full number of the identity card or passport of any person; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the Registrar records the information contained in the document for the purposes of section 27(1).

subsection.leadIn: The Registrar must not make available for public inspection under section 45(1)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an address contained, as the usual residential address of a director of the company, in any part of the document that is required by the relevant Ordinance to contain that usual residential address; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a number contained, as the full number of the identity card or passport of any person, in any part of the document that is required by the relevant Ordinance to contain that full number.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: relevant Ordinance (有關條例), in relation to a document or any part of a document, means the Ordinance under which the document is delivered to the Registrar for registration.

section.name: s55
section.heading: Registrar may make protected address available for inspection

subsection.leadIn: Despite section 54(2)(a), the Registrar may make a protected address available for public inspection in accordance with section 56 if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: communications sent by the Registrar to the director, and requiring a response within a specified period, remain unanswered; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: there is evidence that the service of documents by the Registrar at the relevant correspondence address of the director is not effective to bring them to the notice of the director.

subsection.leadIn: The Registrar must not make a decision under subsection (1) unless the Registrar—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: has notified the director and the company that he or she proposes to make the protected address available for public inspection under subsection (1); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: has considered any representation made within the period specified under subsection (3)(b).

subsection.leadIn: A notice under subsection (2)(a)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: must state the grounds for the proposal; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: must specify a period within which representations may be made before the protected address is made available for public inspection under subsection (1).

subsection.leadIn: A notice under subsection (2)(a) must be sent to the director—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: at the protected address; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if it appears to the Registrar that service at the protected address may not be effective to bring it to the notice of the director, at the relevant correspondence address of the director.

section.name: s56
section.heading: Provision supplementary to section 55

subsection.leadIn: If the Registrar is to make a protected address available for public inspection under section 55(1), he or she must proceed as if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a notice had been delivered to the Registrar for registration under section 645(4) stating that the correspondence address of the director is changed to the protected address; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a return had been delivered to the Registrar for registration under section 791 stating that the correspondence address of the director is changed to the protected address.

subsection.leadIn: The Registrar must give written notice of having done so—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to the director; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to the company.

subsection.content: A written notice must also state the decision date in relation to the protected address.

subsection.leadIn: A written notice under subsection (2)(a) must be sent to the director—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: at the protected address; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if it appears to the Registrar that service at the protected address may not be effective to bring it to the notice of the director, at the relevant correspondence address of the director.

subsection.content: On receipt of a written notice, the company must enter the protected address in its register of directors as the correspondence address of the director.

subsection.leadIn: If, within 5 years after the decision date for a protected address, the director notifies the company of another address as his or her usual residential address—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the company must enter that other address in its register of directors as the usual residential address and the correspondence address of the director; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the company must proceed with the notice or return under section 645(4) or 791 as if the correspondence address of the director was also changed to that other address.

subsection.leadIn: During the period of 5 years after the decision date for a protected address—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: the company must not enter in its register of directors as the correspondence address of the director any address other than—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the protected address; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: if, after the protected address is made available for public inspection under section 55(1), an address is notified by the director to the company as his or her usual residential address, the address so notified; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the company must not state in the notice or return under section 645(4) or 791 that the correspondence address of the director is changed to any address other than—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the protected address; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: if, after the protected address is made available for public inspection under section 55(1), an address is notified by the director to the company as his or her usual residential address, the address so notified.

subsection.leadIn: Subsections (5), (6)(a) and (7)(a) do not apply to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a non-Hong Kong company registered under section 777(1); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a company that was, at any time before the commencement date of Part 16, registered in the register kept under section 333AA of the predecessor Ordinance.

subsection.content: If a company contravenes subsection (5), (6) or (7), the company, and every responsible person of the company, commit an offence, and each is liable to a fine at level 4 and, in the case of a continuing offence, to a further fine of $700 for each day during which the offence continues.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: decision date (決定日期), in relation to a protected address, means the date on which the Registrar decides to make the protected address available for public inspection under section 55(1).

section.name: s57
section.heading: Restriction on use or disclosure of protected information
section.leadIn: The Registrar must not use or disclose protected information except—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: as permitted by section 58; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in accordance with section 59.

section.name: s58
section.heading: Permitted use or disclosure of protected information by Registrar

subsection.leadIn: The Registrar may use—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a protected address for communicating with the director in question; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a protected identification number for communicating with the person in question.

subsection.content: The Registrar may use protected information for the purpose of or in connection with the performance of the Registrar’s functions.

The Registrar may, on application made for the purposes of this subsection, disclose protected information to a person specified by regulations made under subsection (5)(e). A disclosure may only be made in accordance with regulations made under subsection (5).

subsection.leadIn: An application for the purposes of subsection (3) must—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: be accompanied by the documents required by regulations made under subsection (5)(b); and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: be accompanied by a fee prescribed by regulations made under subsection (5)(c).

subsection.leadIn: The Financial Secretary may make regulations—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: providing for the information to be contained in an application made for the purposes of subsection (3), including any information specified by the Registrar for such an application;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: providing for the documents to accompany such an application, including any document specified by the Registrar for such an application;

paragraph.name: c
d
paragraph.content: providing for the powers of the Registrar to require additional documents and information to be provided to the Registrar for the purposes of determining such an application;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: specifying the persons to whom protected information may be disclosed; and

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: providing for the conditions in accordance with which protected information may be disclosed to such persons, including the extent to which such information may be disclosed to them.

section.name: s59
section.heading: Disclosure under order of Court

subsection.leadIn: The Court may make an order for the disclosure by the Registrar of a protected address—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: if—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: there is evidence that the service of documents at the relevant correspondence address of the director is not effective to bring them to the notice of the director; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: it is necessary or expedient for the protected address to be disclosed in connection with the enforcement of an order or decree of a court; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the Court is satisfied that it is appropriate to make the order.

subsection.leadIn: The Court may make an order for the disclosure by the Registrar of a protected identification number—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if it is necessary or expedient for the number to be disclosed in connection with the enforcement of an order or decree of a court; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the Court is satisfied that it is appropriate to make the order.

subsection.leadIn: An order under subsection (1) or (2) may be made on the application of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a creditor of the company in respect of which the document containing the protected information is delivered to the Registrar for registration under this Ordinance or the Companies (Winding Up and Miscellaneous Provisions) Ordinance (Cap. 32); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any other person appearing to the Court to have a sufficient interest.

subsection.content: An order under subsection (1) or (2) must specify the persons to whom, and purposes for which, the disclosure is authorized.

section.name: s60
section.heading: Extent of prohibition
section.leadIn: If a prohibition under this Division applies by reference to information deriving from a particular description of document, the prohibition does not affect—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the availability for public inspection of the information through other means; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the availability for public inspection of the information deriving from another description of document in relation to which the prohibition does not apply.

section.name: s61
section.heading: Registrar may issue certificates in any manner

subsection.content: The Registrar may issue a certificate under this Ordinance in any manner the Registrar thinks fit.
Without limiting the powers of the Registrar under subsection (1), the Registrar may issue a certificate in the form of an electronic record.

section.name: s62
section.heading: Registrar not responsible for verifying information
section.leadIn: The Registrar is not responsible for verifying—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the truth of the information contained in a document delivered to the Registrar; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the authority under which a document is delivered to the Registrar.

section.name: s63
section.heading: Immunity

subsection.leadIn: Neither the Registrar nor any public officer incurs any civil liability, and no civil action may lie against the Registrar or any public officer, in respect of anything done, or omitted to be done, by him or her in good faith—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the performance, or purported performance, of functions under this Ordinance; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the exercise, or purported exercise, of powers under this Ordinance.

subsection.leadIn: Where, for the purposes of this Ordinance, a protected person provides a service by means of which information in electronic form is supplied to the public, or supplies information by means of magnetic tapes or any electronic mode, the protected person is not personally liable for any loss or damage suffered by a user of the service or information by reason of an error or omission appearing in the information if the error or omission—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: was made in good faith and in the ordinary course of the discharge of the protected person’s duties; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: has occurred or arisen as a result of any defect or breakdown in the service or any equipment used for the service or for supplying the information.

subsection.leadIn: Where, for the purposes of this Ordinance, a protected person provides a service or facility by means of which documents may be delivered to the Registrar by electronic means, the protected person is not personally liable for any loss or damage suffered by a user of the service or facility by reason of an error or omission appearing in a document delivered to the Registrar by means of the service or facility if the error or omission—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: was made in good faith and in the ordinary course of the discharge of the protected person’s duties; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: has occurred or arisen as a result of any defect or breakdown in the service or facility or in any equipment used for the service or facility.

subsection.content: The protection given to a protected person by subsections (2) and (3) in respect of an error or omission does not affect any liability of the Government in tort for the error or omission.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: protected person (受保障人) means a person authorized by the Registrar to supply the information or provide the service or facility.

section.name: s64
section.heading: Discrepancy between document and certified translation

subsection.leadIn: This section applies if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a certified translation of a document is delivered by a company to the Registrar for the purposes of section 31(1)(b) to accompany the document in a language other than English or Chinese; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: there is a discrepancy between the document in that language and the certified translation of the document.

subsection.content: The company may not rely on that translation, in so far as it relates to the discrepancy, as against a third party.

subsection.leadIn: A third party may not rely on that translation, in so far as it relates to the discrepancy, as against the company unless the third party—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: had no knowledge of the contents of the document in that language; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: had actually relied on that translation in so far as it relates to the discrepancy.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: third party (第三者) means a person other than the company.

section.name: s65
section.heading: Offence for destruction etc. of registers, books or documents

subsection.leadIn: A person commits an offence if the person dishonestly, with a view to gain for the person’s own self or another, or with intent to cause loss to another, destroys, removes, alters, defaces or conceals—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any register, book or document belonging to, or filed or deposited in, the office of the Registrar; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any electronic record, microfilm, image or other record of such register, book or document.

subsection.content: A person who commits an offence under subsection (1) is liable on conviction on indictment to imprisonment for 7 years.

subsection.leadIn: A person commits an offence if the person wilfully or maliciously destroys, removes, alters, defaces or conceals—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any register, book or document belonging to, or filed or deposited in, the office of the Registrar; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any electronic record, microfilm, image or other record of such register, book or document.

subsection.leadIn: A person who commits an offence under subsection (3) is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on conviction on indictment to a fine of $150,000 and to imprisonment for 2 years; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on summary conviction to a fine at level 5 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

part.name: P3
part.heading: Company Formation and Related Matters, and Re-registration of Company

section.name: s66
section.heading: Types of companies
section.leadIn: Only the following companies may be formed under this Ordinance—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a public company limited by shares;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a private company limited by shares;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a public unlimited company with a share capital;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: a private unlimited company with a share capital;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: a company limited by guarantee without a share capital.

section.name: s67
section.heading: Formation of company

subsection.leadIn: Any one or more persons may form a company by—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: signing the articles of the company intended to be formed; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: delivering to the Registrar for registration—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: an incorporation form in the specified form; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: a copy of the articles.

subsection.content: A company may only be formed for a lawful purpose.

section.name: s68
section.heading: Content of incorporation form

subsection.leadIn: An incorporation form must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in relation to the company intended to be formed, contain the particulars and statements specified in section 1 of Schedule 2;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in relation to each founder member of the company, contain the particulars specified in section 2 of Schedule 2;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: in relation to each person who is to be a director of the company on the company’s formation, contain—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the particulars specified in section 3 of Schedule 2; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the statement specified in section 4 of Schedule 2;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: in relation to each person who is to be the company secretary, or one of the joint company secretaries, of the company on that formation, contain the particulars specified in section 5 of Schedule 2;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: contain the statements specified in section 7 of Schedule 2; and

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: contain the statement of compliance specified in section 70(1).

subsection.content: If the company intended to be formed is a company limited by shares or an unlimited company, the incorporation form must also contain the statement specified in section 8 of Schedule 2.

section.name: s69
section.heading: Signing of incorporation form
section.content: An incorporation form must be signed by the founder member named in the form or, if 2 or more founder members are named, by any one of those members.

section.name: s70
section.heading: Statement of compliance to be contained in incorporation form

subsection.leadIn: The statement specified for the purposes of section 68(1)(f) is a statement certifying that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: all the requirements of this Ordinance in respect of the registration of the company intended to be formed have been complied with; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the information, statements and particulars contained in the incorporation form are accurate and consistent with those in the company’s articles.

subsection.content: The Registrar may accept the statement of compliance as sufficient evidence that all the requirements of this Ordinance in respect of the registration of the company have been complied with.

section.name: s71
section.heading: Issue of certificate of incorporation on registration

subsection.leadIn: On registering an incorporation form and a copy of the articles delivered under section 67(1)(b), the Registrar must issue a certificate of incorporation certifying that the company—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is incorporated under this Ordinance; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: is a limited company or an unlimited company.

subsection.content: A certificate of incorporation must be signed by the Registrar.

section.name: s72
section.heading: Conclusiveness of certificate of incorporation
section.leadIn: A certificate of incorporation is conclusive evidence that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: all the requirements of this Ordinance in respect of the registration of the company have been complied with; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the company is registered under this Ordinance.

section.name: s73
section.heading: Effect of incorporation

subsection.content: On and after the date of incorporation stated in the certificate of incorporation, the founder members, and any other persons who may from time to time become the company’s members, are a body corporate with the name stated in the certificate or, if a change of name has effect under section 107, 110, 770 or 772, with the new name.
On and after the date of incorporation, the body corporate is capable of exercising all the functions of an incorporated company, and has perpetual succession.

On and after the date of incorporation, the founder members, and any other persons who may from time to time become the company’s members, are liable to contribute to the assets of the company in the event of the company being wound up as is mentioned in the Companies (Winding Up and Miscellaneous Provisions) Ordinance (Cap. 32).

section.name: s74
section.heading: Delivery of director’s written consent

subsection.content: Each consent given for the purposes of section 4(b)(ii) of Schedule 2 in relation to a company intended to be formed must be delivered in the specified form to the Registrar for registration not later than 15 days after the date of incorporation of the company.

If subsection (1) is contravened, the company, every responsible person of the company, and the founder member who signs the incorporation form for the purposes of section 69, commit an offence, and each is liable to a fine at level 4 and, in the case of a continuing offence, to a further fine of $700 for each day during which the offence continues.
In any proceedings against a founder member for an offence under this section, it is a defence to establish that the founder member took all reasonable steps to secure compliance with subsection (1).

section.name: s75
section.heading: Articles prescribing regulations for company
section.content: A company must have articles prescribing regulations for the company.

section.name: s76
section.heading: Language of articles
section.content: A company’s articles must be in English or Chinese.

section.name: s77
section.heading: Form of articles
section.content: A company’s articles must be divided into paragraphs and the paragraphs must be numbered consecutively.

section.name: s78
section.heading: Financial Secretary may prescribe model articles

subsection.content: The Financial Secretary may, by notice published in the Gazette, prescribe model articles for companies.

subsection.leadIn: Any amendment of model articles under this section does not affect— (Amended 14 of 2025 s. 6)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a company incorporated before the amendment takes effect; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a body corporate registered under section 820C(1) before the amendment takes effect. (Amended 14 of 2025 s. 6)

section.name: s79
section.heading: Adoption of model articles
section.content: A company may adopt as its articles any or all of the provisions of the model articles prescribed for the type of company to which it belongs.

section.name: s80
section.heading: Application of model articles to limited company

subsection.content: On the incorporation of a limited company or the registration of a limited company under section 820C(1)(a) or (b), the model articles that are prescribed for the type of company to which the company belongs and that are for the time being in force, so far as applicable, form part of the company’s articles in the same manner, and to the same extent, as if those model articles had been registered as the company’s articles. (Amended 14 of 2025 s. 7)
Subsection (1) applies if the company’s registered articles do not prescribe any regulations for the company.
If the company’s registered articles prescribe any regulations for the company, subsection (1) applies in so far as the articles do not exclude or modify the model articles.

section.name: s81
section.heading: Company name

subsection.content: If a company has both an English name and a Chinese name, its articles must state both the English name and the Chinese name.
If a company has only an English name or a Chinese name, its articles must state the English name or the Chinese name.

section.name: s82
section.heading: Company’s objects

subsection.content: If a licence is granted under section 103(2) to an association intended to be formed as a limited company or under section 103(4) to a limited company, then during the period when the licence is in force, the articles of the company must state the company’s objects.
The articles of any other company may state the company’s objects.
Subsections (1) and (2) do not affect any requirement relating to the articles of a company specified in any other Ordinance.

section.name: s83
section.heading: Members’ liabilities

subsection.content: The articles of a limited company must state that the liability of its members is limited.

For an unlimited company that is formed and registered under this Ordinance or a re-domiciled company that is registered under section 820C(1)(c) or (d) as an unlimited company, the articles of the company must state that the liability of its members is unlimited. (Amended 14 of 2025 s. 8)

section.name: s84
section.heading: Liabilities or contributions of members of limited company

subsection.content: The articles of a company limited by shares must state that the liability of its members is limited to any amount unpaid on the shares held by the members.

subsection.leadIn: The articles of a company limited by guarantee must state that each person who is a member of the company undertakes that if the company is wound up while the person is a member of the company, or within one year after the person ceases to be such a member, the person will contribute an amount required of the person, not exceeding a specified amount, to the company’s assets—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: for the payment of the company’s debts and liabilities contracted before the person ceases to be such a member;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: for the payment of the costs, charges and expenses of winding up the company; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: for the adjustment, among the contributories, of their rights.

subsection.content: Subsection (1) does not apply to the articles of an existing company that is deemed to be a company limited by shares under section 4(3) of the predecessor Ordinance.

section.name: s85
section.heading: Capital and initial shareholdings

subsection.content: The articles of a company with a share capital must state the information required under section 8 (except subsection (1)(d)(iv), (v), (vi) and (vii)) of Schedule 2 to be contained in the company’s incorporation form.
The articles of a company (including a re-domiciled company) with a share capital may state the maximum number of shares that the company may issue. (Amended 14 of 2025 s. 9)

section.name: s86
section.heading: Effect of articles

subsection.leadIn: Subject to this Ordinance, a company’s articles, once registered under this Ordinance or a former Companies Ordinance—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: have effect as a contract under seal—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: between the company and each member; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: between a member and each other member; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: are to be regarded as containing covenants on the part of the company and of each member to observe all the provisions of the articles.

subsection.leadIn: Without limiting subsection (1), the articles are enforceable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: by the company against each member;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: by a member against the company; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: by a member against each other member.

subsection.leadIn: Money payable by a member to the company under the articles—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is a debt due from the member to the company; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: is of the nature of a specialty debt.

section.name: s87
section.heading: Company may alter articles

subsection.content: Subject to this Ordinance, a company may alter its articles.
Except as provided in Division 8, a company must not alter in its articles any statement mentioned in section 83 or 84(1).
Subject to section 180, a company with a share capital must not make any alteration to its articles that is inconsistent with any rights attached to shares in a class of shares in the company.
Subject to section 188, a company without a share capital must not make any alteration to its articles that is inconsistent with any rights of a class of members of the company.
A company limited by guarantee must not alter in its articles the information required under section 84(2) other than to increase the specified amount.

section.name: s88
section.heading: Alteration by special resolution or ordinary resolution

subsection.content: Subject to this Ordinance, this section applies to the alteration of a company’s articles.
Subject to subsection (3) and any other provisions of this Ordinance, a company may only alter its articles by special resolution.
An alteration in articles to the maximum number of shares that the company may issue may be made by ordinary resolution.
Subject to this Ordinance, an alteration made in accordance with this section is as valid as if the alteration were originally contained in the articles.

subsection.leadIn: Within 15 days after the date on which an alteration takes effect, the company must deliver to the Registrar for registration—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a notice of the alteration in the specified form; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a copy, certified by an officer of the company as correct, of the articles as altered.

subsection.name: 5A
subsection.content: Subsection (5) does not apply to an alteration by a special resolution to change the name of a company passed under section 107 or 770. (Added 35 of 2018 s. 9)

If a company contravenes subsection (5), the company, and every responsible person of the company, commit an offence, and each is liable to a fine at level 3 and, in the case of a continuing offence, to a further fine of $300 for each day during which the offence continues.

section.name: s89
section.heading: Alteration of company’s objects

subsection.content: This section applies to an alteration of the objects of a company as stated in the company’s articles.

subsection.leadIn: The company may, by special resolution of which notice has been given to all the members of the company (including members who are not entitled to such notice under the company’s articles), alter the objects by—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: abandoning or restricting any of the objects; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: adopting any new object that could lawfully have been contained—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: in the case of a company that is formed and registered under this Ordinance or that is a re-domiciled company, in the company’s articles when the articles were registered; or (Amended 14 of 2025 s. 11)

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: in the case of an existing company, in the company’s memorandum of association when the memorandum was registered.

subsection.content: If a relevant company passes such a resolution, a notice of the resolution must also be given to all holders of the relevant debentures of the company, and the notice must be the same as the notice mentioned in subsection (2).

For the purposes of subsection (3), if there is no provision regulating the giving of notice to the holders of the relevant debentures, the provisions of the company’s articles regulating the giving of notice to members are to apply.

If a relevant company passes a special resolution altering its objects, an application to cancel the alteration may be made to the Court in accordance with section 91, and if an application is made, the alteration does not have effect except in so far as it is confirmed by the Court.

subsection.leadIn: After passing a special resolution altering its objects—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the case of a relevant company, if no application is made under subsection (5), the company must, within 15 days after the end of the application period, deliver to the Registrar for registration the documents specified in subsection (7);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: in the case of a relevant company, if an application is made under subsection (5), the company—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: must immediately give notice of that fact to the Registrar; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: within 15 days after the date of any Court order cancelling or confirming the alteration or, if an extension of time is granted under subsection (8), within the extended period, must deliver to the Registrar for registration an office copy of the order and, in the case of an order confirming the alteration, the documents specified in subsection (7); or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: in the case of a company other than a relevant company, the company must, within 15 days after the date of passing the resolution, deliver to the Registrar for registration the documents specified in subsection (7).

subsection.leadIn: The documents are—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a notice of the alteration in the specified form; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a copy, certified by an officer of the company as correct, of the company’s articles as altered.

subsection.content: The Court may at any time by order extend the period for delivery of any documents under subsection (6)(b).

If a company contravenes subsection (6), the company, and every responsible person of the company, commit an offence, and each is liable to a fine at level 3 and, in the case of a continuing offence, to a further fine of $300 for each day during which the offence continues.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—

def.name: RelevantCompany
def.leadIn: relevant company (有關公司) means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a private company; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a company limited by guarantee that, immediately before the commencement date# of this Division, was a private company as defined by section 2(1) of the predecessor Ordinance in force at that time;

subsection.def: relevant debentures (有關債權證) means any debentures, secured by a floating charge, that were issued or first issued before 15 February 1963 or that form part of the same series as any debentures so issued.

section.name: s90
section.heading: Alteration of certain articles by existing company

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (2), this section applies to an alteration of any provision of the articles of an existing company if the provision—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: was, immediately before the commencement date# of this Division, contained in the company’s memorandum of association (whether registered before, on or after 31 August 1984); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: could lawfully have been contained in the company’s articles instead of in the memorandum of association when the memorandum was registered.

subsection.leadIn: This section does not apply if any provision of the articles of an existing company—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: was, immediately before the commencement date# of this Part, contained in the company’s memorandum of association (whether registered before, on or after 31 August 1984); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: provides for or prohibits the alteration of any provision mentioned in subsection (1).

subsection.content: An existing company may by special resolution alter any provision mentioned in subsection (1).

If a relevant company passes such a resolution, an application to cancel the alteration may be made to the Court in accordance with section 91, and if an application is made, the alteration does not have effect except in so far as it is confirmed by the Court.

subsection.leadIn: After passing a resolution under subsection (3)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the case of a relevant company, if no application is made under subsection (4), the company must, within 15 days after the end of the application period, deliver to the Registrar for registration the documents specified in subsection (6);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: in the case of a relevant company, if an application is made under subsection (4), the company—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: must immediately give notice of that fact to the Registrar; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: within 15 days after the date of any Court order cancelling or confirming the alteration or, if an extension of time is granted under subsection (7), within the extended period, must deliver to the Registrar for registration an office copy of the order and, in the case of an order confirming the alteration, the documents specified in subsection (6); or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: in the case of a company other than a relevant company, the company must, within 15 days after the date of passing the resolution, deliver to the Registrar for registration the documents specified in subsection (6).

subsection.leadIn: The documents are—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a notice of the alteration in the specified form; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a copy, certified by an officer of the company as correct, of the company’s articles as altered.

subsection.content: The Court may at any time by order extend the period for delivery of any documents under subsection (5)(b).

If a company contravenes subsection (5), the company, and every responsible person of the company, commit an offence, and each is liable to a fine at level 3 and, in the case of a continuing offence, to a further fine of $300 for each day during which the offence continues.
This section does not authorize any variation or abrogation of the special rights of any class of members.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—

def.name: RelevantCompany
def.leadIn: relevant company (有關公司) means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a private company; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a company limited by guarantee that, immediately before the commencement date# of this Division, was a private company as defined by section 2(1) of the predecessor Ordinance in force at that time.

section.name: s91
section.heading: Application to Court to cancel alteration

subsection.leadIn: An application under section 89(5) to cancel an alteration of the objects of a company may be made—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: by the holders of at least 5% in aggregate of the number of the issued shares in the company or any class of the company’s issued share capital or, if the company is not limited by shares, by at least 5% of the company’s members; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.def: by the holders of at least 5% in value of the company’s debentures that are mentioned in the definition of relevant debentures in section 89(10).

subsection.content: An application under section 89(5) may be made on behalf of the persons mentioned in subsection (1)(a) or (b) by any one or more of them appointed in writing by all of them for the purpose.

An application under section 90(4) to cancel an alteration of a provision of the articles of an existing company may be made by the holders of at least 5% in aggregate of the number of the issued shares in the company or any class of the company’s issued share capital or, if the company is not limited by shares, by at least 5% of the company’s members.

subsection.name: 3A
subsection.content: For the purposes of subsections (1)(a) and (3), any of the company’s issued shares held as treasury shares are to be disregarded. (Added 1 of 2025 s. 4)
An application under section 90(4) may be made on behalf of the persons mentioned in subsection (3) by any one or more of them appointed in writing by all of them for the purpose.
An application under section 89(5) or 90(4) may only be made within 28 days after the date of passing the relevant special resolution.

subsection.leadIn: On an application under section 89(5) or 90(4), the Court—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: may cancel or confirm the alteration (either wholly or in part), on any terms and conditions it thinks fit;

paragraph.name: b
c
paragraph.content: may give any directions and make any order that it thinks expedient for facilitating or carrying into effect any such arrangement.

section.name: s92
section.heading: Certain alterations not binding on members

subsection.leadIn: Despite any provision in a company’s articles, a person who is a member of the company is not bound by any alteration of the articles that takes effect after the date on which the person became a member, if and so far as the alteration—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: requires the person to take or subscribe for more shares than the number of shares held by the person on the date on which the alteration takes effect;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in any way increases the person’s liability as at that date to contribute to the company’s share capital; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: in any way increases the person’s liability as at that date to pay money to the company.

subsection.content: Subsection (1) does not apply if the person agrees in writing before, on or after the alteration taking effect to be bound by the alteration.

section.name: s93
section.heading: Company must incorporate alteration into articles

subsection.content: If an alteration is made to a company’s articles, the company must incorporate the alteration in every copy of the articles issued on or after the date on which the alteration takes effect.
If a company contravenes subsection (1), the company, and every responsible person of the company, commit an offence, and each is liable to a fine at level 3.

section.name: s94
section.heading: Alteration affecting status of private company

subsection.content: If a private company alters its articles so that the articles no longer comply with section 11(1)(a), the company ceases to be a private company on the date on which the alteration takes effect.

subsection.leadIn: In addition to the documents required under section 88(5), the company must, within 15 days after the date on which the alteration takes effect, deliver to the Registrar for registration—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a notice of the change of the company’s status in the specified form; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: a copy (certified by an officer of the company to be true) of the company’s annual financial statements that are—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: prepared in accordance with section 379; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: prepared for the financial year immediately before the financial year in which the alteration takes effect.

subsection.content: If a company contravenes subsection (2)(a), the company, and every responsible person of the company, commit an offence, and each is liable to a fine at level 3 and, in the case of a continuing offence, to a further fine of $300 for each day during which the offence continues.

If a company contravenes subsection (2)(b), the company, and every responsible person of the company, commit an offence, and each is liable to a fine at level 5 and, in the case of a continuing offence, to a further fine of $1,000 for each day during which the offence continues.

section.name: s95
section.heading: Alteration affecting status of public company

subsection.content: If a public company alters its articles so that the articles comply with section 11(1)(a), the company ceases to be a public company on the date on which the alteration takes effect.

In addition to the documents required under section 88(5), the company must, within 15 days after the date on which the alteration takes effect, deliver to the Registrar for registration a notice of the change of the company’s status in the specified form.

If a company contravenes subsection (2), the company, and every responsible person of the company, commit an offence, and each is liable to a fine at level 3 and, in the case of a continuing offence, to a further fine of $300 for each day during which the offence continues.

section.name: s96
section.heading: Notifying Registrar of alteration by order of Court

subsection.content: If any provision of a company’s articles, or the effect of any provision of a company’s articles, is altered by an order of the Court, the company must, within 15 days after the date on which the alteration takes effect, deliver to the Registrar for registration a notice of the alteration in the specified form.

subsection.leadIn: A notice of alteration must be accompanied by—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an office copy of the order; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a copy of the articles as altered by the order.

subsection.content: Subsection (2)(a) does not apply if the company is required to deliver an office copy of the order to the Registrar under another provision of this Ordinance.

If a company contravenes subsection (1) or (2), the company, and every responsible person of the company, commit an offence, and each is liable to a fine at level 3 and, in the case of a continuing offence, to a further fine of $300 for each day during which the offence continues.

section.name: s97
section.heading: Copies of articles to be provided to members

subsection.content: A company must, on request of a member of the company, provide, without charge, the member with an up-to-date copy of the company articles within 7 days after it receives the request.
If a company contravenes subsection (1), the company, and every responsible person of the company, commit an offence, and each is liable to a fine at level 3.

section.name: s98
section.heading: Conditions of memorandum of association of existing company to be regarded as provisions of articles

subsection.content: A condition that immediately before the commencement date# of this Division was contained in the memorandum of association of an existing company and was in force is, for all purposes, to be regarded as a provision of the company’s articles.

If a memorandum of association is registered on or after the commencement date# of this Division under the provisions having a continuing effect under Schedule 11, a condition contained in that memorandum is, for all purposes, to be regarded as a provision of the company’s articles registered under the predecessor Ordinance.

If, before the commencement date# of this Division, a special resolution altering a condition of the memorandum of association of an existing company was passed under section 8(1) or 25A(1) of the predecessor Ordinance and the alteration takes effect on or after that date, then the altered condition is, for all purposes, to be regarded as a provision of the company’s articles registered under the predecessor Ordinance.

subsection.leadIn: Despite subsections (1), (2) and (3), if a condition mentioned in subsection (1) or (2), or an altered condition mentioned in subsection (3), states—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the amount of share capital with which the existing company proposes to be registered or is registered; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the division of the share capital of the company into shares of a fixed amount,

subsection.continued: the condition is, to the extent that it relates to the matter mentioned in paragraph (a) or (b), for all purposes, to be regarded as deleted and not to be regarded as a provision of the company’s articles.

subsection.leadIn: In any Ordinance in force immediately before the commencement date# of this Division, or in any other document made before that date—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a reference to the memorandum of association of an existing company is a reference to the company’s articles; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a reference to a condition of the memorandum of association of an existing company is a reference to a provision of the company’s articles.

section.name: s99
section.heading: Articles of company limited by guarantee

subsection.leadIn: This section applies to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a company limited by guarantee registered under a former Companies Ordinance on or after 1 January 1912 that does not have a share capital; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a company registered as a company limited by guarantee under this Ordinance.

subsection.content: A provision in the company’s articles, or in any resolution of the company, purporting to give a person a right to participate in the company’s divisible profits otherwise than as a member is void.

For the purposes of a provision of this Ordinance relating to the articles of a company limited by guarantee, a provision in the company’s articles, or in any resolution of the company, purporting to divide the company’s undertaking into shares or interests, is to be regarded as a provision for a share capital.

section.name: s100
section.heading: Company must not be registered by certain names

subsection.leadIn: A company must not be registered by—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: subject to subsection (1A), a name that is the same as a name appearing in the Index of Company Names; (Amended 14 of 2025 s. 12)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a name that is the same as a name of a body corporate incorporated or established under an Ordinance;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a name the use of which by the company would, in the Registrar’s opinion, constitute a criminal offence; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: a name that, in the Registrar’s opinion, is offensive or otherwise contrary to the public interest.

subsection.name: 1A
subsection.leadIn: Subsection (1)(a) does not apply to a company if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the registration by the name is for the purposes of Part 17A (registration);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the company was a registered non-Hong Kong company immediately before the registration; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the name concerned was the corporate name or approved name of the company immediately before the registration. (Added 14 of 2025 s. 12)

subsection.leadIn: Except with the Registrar’s prior approval, a company must not be registered by—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: a name that, in the Registrar’s opinion, would be likely to give the impression that the company is connected in any way with—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the Central People’s Government;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the Government; or

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: any department or agency of the Central People’s Government or the Government;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a name that contains any word or expression for the time being specified in an order under section 101; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: a name that is the same as a name for which a direction has been given under—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: section 108, 109 or 771; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: section 22 or 22A of the predecessor Ordinance on or after 10 December 2010.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: approved name (經批准名稱) has the meaning given by section 774(1);
corporate name (法團名稱) has the meaning given by section 774(1). (Added 14 of 2025 s. 12)

section.name: s101
section.heading: Financial Secretary may specify word or expression for section 100(2)(b)
section.content: The Financial Secretary may, by order published in the Gazette, specify any word or expression for the purposes of section 100(2)(b).

subdivision.name: SD2
subdivision.heading: Limited Company Name with “Limited” as Last Word etc.

section.name: s102
section.heading: Limited company must not be registered without “Limited” as last word of name etc.
section.leadIn: A limited company must not be registered by—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if the company has an English name only, a name without “Limited” as the last word of the name;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the company has a Chinese name only, a name without “有限公司” as the last 4 characters of the name; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: if the company has both an English name and a Chinese name—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: an English name without “Limited” as the last word of the name; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: a Chinese name without “有限公司” as the last 4 characters of the name.

section.name: s103
section.heading: Registrar’s licence to dispense with “Limited” etc.

subsection.leadIn: The Registrar may exercise the power under subsection (2) in respect of an association intended to be formed as a limited company, if it is proved to the Registrar’s satisfaction that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the company is to be formed for promoting commerce, art, science, religion or charity or any other useful objects;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the association intends to apply the company’s profits or other income in promoting its objects; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the association intends to prohibit the payment of dividends to the company’s members.

subsection.leadIn: The Registrar may, by licence, permit the association to be registered as a limited company by—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if the company has an English name only, a name without “Limited” as the last word of the name;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the company has a Chinese name only, a name without “有限公司” as the last 4 characters of the name; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: if the company has both an English name and a Chinese name—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: an English name without “Limited” as the last word of the name; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: a Chinese name without “有限公司” as the last 4 characters of the name.

subsection.leadIn: The Registrar may exercise the power under subsection (4) in respect of a limited company, if it is proved to the Registrar’s satisfaction that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: the objects of the company are restricted to—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: promoting commerce, art, science, religion or charity or any other useful objects; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: objects incidental or conducive to the objects mentioned in subparagraph (i);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the company is required by its articles to apply its profits or other income in promoting its objects; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the company is prohibited by its articles from paying dividends to its members.

subsection.leadIn: The Registrar may, by licence, permit the limited company to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if the company has an English name only, change the name to delete from it the word “Limited”;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the company has a Chinese name only, change the name to delete from it the characters “有限公司”; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: if the company has both an English name and a Chinese name—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: change the English name to delete from it the word “Limited”; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: change the Chinese name to delete from it the characters “有限公司”.

subsection.content: A change of company name under a licence mentioned in subsection (4) may only be made by special resolution, and section 107(2), (3), (4), (5) and (6) applies to such a change as it applies to a change of company name under section 107.

subsection.leadIn: To avoid doubt, a company registered by a name under a licence granted under this section—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: has the privileges of a limited company; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: subject to section 105(1), has the obligations of a limited company.

section.name: s104
section.heading: Terms and conditions of licence

subsection.content: A licence under section 103 may be granted on any terms and conditions the Registrar thinks fit.

subsection.leadIn: The terms and conditions—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: are binding on the company; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: are to be incorporated in the articles of the company if the Registrar so directs.

section.name: s105
section.heading: Effect of licence

subsection.leadIn: The company to which a licence under section 103 relates is exempt from—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: section 102;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: regulations made under section 659 in relation to the use of the word “Limited” as part of its English name or use of the characters “有限公司” as part of its Chinese name; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: section 662 in relation to the delivery of particulars relating to members to the Registrar.

subsection.content: While a licence under section 103 remains in force, the company must not alter its articles except under a direction given under this section or section 104(2)(b) or with the Registrar’s prior written approval.

On granting an approval under subsection (2), the Registrar may vary the licence by making it subject to any terms and conditions he or she thinks fit, in addition to or in place of the terms or conditions to which the licence was subject immediately before the variation.

subsection.leadIn: The terms and conditions imposed under subsection (3)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: are binding on the company; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: are to be incorporated in the articles of the company if the Registrar so directs.

section.name: s106
section.heading: Revocation of licence

subsection.leadIn: The Registrar may at any time revoke a licence granted under section 103 on being satisfied that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the company has failed to comply with any of the terms or conditions to which the licence is subject; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any one or more of the requirements specified in section 103(1) or (3) (as the case may be) are no longer met.

subsection.leadIn: Before revoking a licence, the Registrar—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: must notify the company in writing of the Registrar’s intention to do so; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: must give the company an opportunity to be heard.

subsection.content: If a licence is revoked, the Registrar must give the company a notice in writing of the revocation.
On the revocation of a licence, the company ceases to be entitled to the exemptions mentioned in section 105(1).

subsection.leadIn: Within the period specified in the notice of revocation, the company must change its name by special resolution to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if the company has an English name only, add “Limited” as the last word of the name;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the company has a Chinese name only, add “有限公司” as the last 4 characters of the name; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: if the company has both an English name and a Chinese name—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: add “Limited” as the last word of the English name; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: add “有限公司” as the last 4 characters of the Chinese name.

subsection.content: Section 107(2), (3), (4), (5) and (6) applies to a change of company name under subsection (5) as it applies to a change of company name under section 107.

subsection.leadIn: If the company fails to comply with subsection (5), the Registrar must in the Companies Register—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if the company has an English name only, add “Limited” as the last word of the name;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the company has a Chinese name only, add “有限公司” as the last 4 characters of the name; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: if the company has both an English name and a Chinese name—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: add “Limited” as the last word of the English name; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: add “有限公司” as the last 4 characters of the Chinese name.

section.name: s107
section.heading: Company may change name by special resolution

subsection.content: A company may change a company name by special resolution.
Within 15 days after the date of passing the special resolution, the company must deliver to the Registrar for registration a notice in the specified form of the change of company name.

subsection.leadIn: After receipt of a notice under subsection (2), the Registrar must, unless the new name is a name by which the company must not be registered under section 100—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: enter the new name in the Companies Register in place of the former name; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: issue to the company a certificate of change of name.

subsection.content: The change of the name has effect from the date on which the certificate of change of name is issued.

A change of name under this section does not affect any rights or obligations of the company or render defective any legal proceedings by or against it. Any legal proceedings that could have been commenced or continued by or against it by its former name may be commenced or continued by or against it by its new name.

If a company contravenes subsection (2), the company, and every responsible person of the company, commit an offence, and each is liable to a fine at level 3 and, in the case of a continuing offence, to a further fine of $300 for each day during which the offence continues.

section.name: s108
section.heading: Registrar may direct company to change same or similar name etc.

subsection.leadIn: The Registrar may by notice in writing direct a company to change, within the period specified in the notice, a name by which the company is registered under this Ordinance or the predecessor Ordinance if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the name is, as at the time of the registration, the same as or in the Registrar’s opinion too like a name that appeared or should have appeared in the index of names kept under section 22C of the predecessor Ordinance or in the Index of Company Names;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the name is, as at the time of the registration, the same as or in the Registrar’s opinion too like a name of a body corporate incorporated or established under an Ordinance;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: it appears to the Registrar that misleading information has been given for the company’s registration by the name;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: it appears to the Registrar that any undertaking or assurance given for the registration by the name has not been fulfilled; or

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: the name is a name by which, as at the time of the registration, the company must not be registered because of section 100(2)(a) or (b).

subsection.leadIn: The Registrar may by notice in writing direct a company to change, within the period specified in the notice, a name by which the company is registered under this Ordinance or any former Companies Ordinance if, after the company is registered by the name—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a court makes an order restraining the company from using the name or any part of the name; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an office copy of the order, and a notice in the specified form, are delivered to the Registrar for registration by a person in whose favour the order is made.

subsection.leadIn: A direction may only be given—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the case of subsection (1)(a) or (b), within 12 months after the date of registration by the name;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the case of subsection (1)(c) or (d), within 5 years after the date of registration by the name; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: in the case of subsection (1)(e), within 3 months after the date of registration by the name.

subsection.content: The Registrar may, before the end of the period specified in a notice given under subsection (1) or (2), by notice in writing extend the period.

If a company fails to comply with a direction within the period specified in the notice or, if the period is extended under subsection (4), within the extended period, the company, and every responsible person of the company, commit an offence, and each is liable to a fine at level 6 and, in the case of a continuing offence, to a further fine of $2,000 for each day during which the offence continues.

section.name: s109
section.heading: Registrar may direct company to change misleading or offensive name etc.

subsection.leadIn: The Registrar may by notice in writing direct a company to change a name by which the company is registered under this Ordinance or any former Companies Ordinance if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Registrar is of the opinion that the name gives so misleading an indication of the nature of the company’s activities as to be likely to cause harm to the public; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the name is a name by which, as at the time of the registration, the company must not be registered because of section 100(1)(c) or (d).

subsection.content: The company must comply with a direction within the period of 6 weeks after the date of the direction or, if the period is extended under subsection (4), within the extended period.
A company may, within 3 weeks after the date of a direction, appeal to the Administrative Appeals Board against the direction.
The Registrar may, before the end of the period of 6 weeks after the date of the direction, by notice in writing extend the period.

If a company contravenes subsection (2), the company, and every responsible person of the company, commit an offence, and each is liable to a fine at level 6 and, in the case of a continuing offence, to a further fine of $2,000 for each day during which the offence continues.

section.name: s110
section.heading: Registrar may change company name in case of failure to comply with direction

subsection.leadIn: This section applies if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Registrar directs a company to change a name under section 108(1) or (2) or 109(1) or, on or after 10 December 2010 under section 22 or 22A of the predecessor Ordinance; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the company fails to comply with the direction—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: in the case of a direction under section 108(1) or (2), within the period specified in the notice or, if the period is extended under section 108(4), within the extended period;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: in the case of a direction under section 109(1), within the relevant period specified in section 109(2);

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: in the case of a direction under section 22(2), (3A), (3B) or (4) of the predecessor Ordinance, within the period specified by the Registrar or, if the period is extended under section 22(5) of that Ordinance, within the extended period; or

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: in the case of a direction under section 22A(1) or (1A) of the predecessor Ordinance, within the period specified in section 22A(2) of that Ordinance or, if a period is specified by the court under section 22A(3) of that Ordinance for the direction, within the period specified by the court.

subsection.leadIn: Without limiting section 108(5) or 109(5), or section 22(6) or 22A(4) of the predecessor Ordinance (as the case may be), the Registrar may change the name to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the case of an English name, a name that consists of the words “Company Registration Number” as its prefix, followed by the registration number of the company as stated in the certificate of incorporation or the certificate of re-domiciliation;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the case of a Chinese name, a name that consists of the characters “公司註冊編號” as its prefix, followed by the registration number of the company as stated in the certificate of incorporation or the certificate of re-domiciliation; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: in the case of a name consisting of both an English name and a Chinese name—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: an English name that consists of the words “Company Registration Number” as its prefix, followed by the registration number of the company as stated in the certificate of incorporation or the certificate of re-domiciliation; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: a Chinese name that consists of the characters “公司註冊編號” as its prefix, followed by the registration number of the company as stated in the certificate of incorporation or the certificate of re-domiciliation. (Amended 14 of 2025 s. 13)

subsection.content: The Registrar must enter the new name in the Companies Register in place of the former name.
The change of name has effect from the date on which the new name is entered in the Companies Register.

subsection.leadIn: Within 30 days after the date of entering the new name in the Companies Register, the Registrar—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: must by notice in writing notify the company of—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the fact that a name of the company has been changed;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the new name; and

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: the date on which the change takes effect under subsection (4); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: must by notice in the Gazette notify that fact, the new name and that date.

subsection.content: A change of name under this section does not affect any rights or obligations of the company or render defective any legal proceedings by or against it. Any legal proceedings that could have been commenced or continued by or against it by its former name may be commenced or continued by or against it by its new name.

section.name: s111
section.heading: Determining whether name is same as or similar to another name

subsection.leadIn: This section applies in determining—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: whether a name is the same as another name for the purposes of section 100(1)(a) or (b) or (2)(c) or 108(1)(a) or (b); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: whether a name is too like another name for the purposes of section 108(1)(a) or (b).

subsection.content: If the definite article is the first word of the name, the definite article must be disregarded.

If any of the words, expressions or characters specified in subsection (4), or an abbreviation of any of them, appears at the end of the name, the word, expression, character or abbreviation must be disregarded.

subsection.leadIn: The words, expressions or characters are—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: “company”;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: “and company”;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: “company limited”;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: “and company limited”;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: “limited”;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: “unlimited”;

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: “public limited company”;

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.content: “公司”;

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: “有限公司”;

paragraph.name: j
paragraph.content: “無限公司”;

paragraph.name: k
paragraph.content: “公眾有限公司”.

subsection.leadIn: The following must be disregarded—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: type or case of letters;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: spaces between letters;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: accent marks;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: punctuation marks.
