subsection.leadIn: The following expressions are to be regarded as the same—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: “and” and “&”;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: “Hong Kong”, “Hongkong” and “HK”;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: “Far East” and “FE”.

subsection.content: A Chinese character is to be regarded as the same as another Chinese character if the Registrar is satisfied, having regard to the usage of the 2 characters in Hong Kong, that the 2 characters can reasonably be used interchangeably.

section.name: s112
section.heading: Members of company

subsection.content: A founder member of a company is to be regarded as having agreed to become a member of the company.
On the registration of a company, a founder member of the company must be entered, as a member, in the company’s register of members.
Any other person who agrees to become a member of a company and whose name is entered, as a member, in the company’s register of members is a member of the company.

section.name: s113
section.heading: Members of holding company

subsection.leadIn: Subject to this section—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a body corporate cannot be a member of a company of which the body corporate is a subsidiary; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any allotment or transfer of shares in a company to a body corporate that is a subsidiary of the company is void.

subsection.leadIn: Subsection (1) does not apply if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the body corporate is a member of the company as a personal representative; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the body corporate is a member of the company as a trustee, and the holding company or any of its subsidiaries is not beneficially interested under the trust.

subsection.content: For the purposes of subsection (2)(b), a company or subsidiary is not beneficially interested under a trust if it is interested under the trust only by way of security for the purpose of a transaction entered into by it in the ordinary course of a business (including the lending of money).
Subsection (1) does not prevent a body corporate that was, on 31 August 1984, already a member of a holding company of the body corporate from continuing to be such a member.
Subsection (1) does not prevent a company that on the date it becomes a subsidiary of another company is a member of that other company from continuing to be such a member.

subsection.leadIn: Subsection (1) does not prevent a body corporate from becoming a member of a holding company of the body corporate, or prevent an allotment to a body corporate of shares in a holding company of the body corporate, by virtue of the exercise by the body corporate of any rights of conversion—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: attached to any shares in the holding company held by the body corporate on 31 August 1984; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: under any debentures of the holding company held by the body corporate on 31 August 1984.

subsection.content: If a body corporate is a member of a holding company of the body corporate, subsection (1) does not prevent the body corporate from accepting or holding further shares in the holding company if those shares are allotted to the body corporate as fully paid up as a consequence of a capitalization of reserves or profits by the holding company.

subsection.leadIn: If a company makes an offer of shares to its members, the company—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: may sell, on behalf of any of its subsidiaries, any such shares that the subsidiary could, but for this section, have taken by virtue of shares in the company that are already held by the subsidiary; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: may pay to the subsidiary the proceeds of the sale.

subsection.leadIn: Even though a body corporate is a member of a holding company of the body corporate, it has no right to vote at—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: meetings of the holding company; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: meetings of any class of members of the holding company.

subsection.content: Subsection (9) does not apply if the body corporate is such a member in the circumstances described in subsection (2).
In this section, a reference to a body corporate includes a nominee for the body corporate.

In this section, a reference to shares, in relation to a holding company that is a company limited by guarantee or an unlimited company, includes the interest of the company’s members, whatever the form of the interest and whether or not the company has a share capital.

section.name: s114
section.heading: Notifying Registrar of increase in number of members of company limited by guarantee

subsection.content: If a company limited by guarantee increases the number of its members beyond the registered number, the company must, within 15 days after the increase is resolved by the company or takes place (whichever is the earlier), deliver to the Registrar for registration a notice of the increase in the specified form.

If a company contravenes subsection (1), the company, and every responsible person of the company, commit an offence, and each is liable to a fine at level 3 and, in the case of a continuing offence, to a further fine of $300 for each day during which the offence continues.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—

def.name: RegisteredNumber
def.leadIn: registered number註冊人數) means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the number of members with which the company proposes to register, whether contained in the incorporation form for the purposes of section 1(e) of Schedule 2 or stated in the articles under section 10(2) of the predecessor Ordinance; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the increased number of the company’s members last notified to the Registrar under subsection (1).

section.name: s115
section.heading: Company’s capacity etc.

subsection.content: A company has the capacity, rights, powers and privileges of a natural person of full age.

subsection.leadIn: Without limiting subsection (1), a company—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: may do any act that it is permitted or required to do by its articles or any Ordinance or rule of law; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: has power to acquire, hold and dispose of land.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: land (土地) includes any estate or interest in land, buildings, messuages and tenements of any nature or kind.

section.name: s116
section.heading: Company’s exercise of powers limited by articles

subsection.content: If the objects of a company are stated in its articles, the company must not do any act that it is not authorized to do by its articles.
If any power of a company is expressly modified or excluded by its articles, the company must not exercise the power contrary to that modification or exclusion.
A member of a company may bring proceedings to restrain the company from doing any act in contravention of subsection (1) or (2).
Proceedings must not be brought under subsection (3) in respect of any act to be done in fulfilment of a legal obligation arising from a previous act of the company.
An act by a company (including a transfer of property to or by the company) is not invalid only because the company does the act in contravention of subsection (1) or (2).

section.name: s117
section.heading: Transaction or act binds company despite limitation in articles etc.

subsection.content: Subject to section 119, in favour of a person dealing with a company in good faith, the power of the company’s directors to bind the company, or authorize others to do so, is to be regarded as free of any limitation under any relevant document of the company.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsection (1)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a person deals with a company if the person is a party to any transaction or any other act to which the company is a party;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a person dealing with a company is presumed, unless the contrary is proved, to have acted in good faith;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a person dealing with a company is not to be regarded as acting in bad faith by reason only of the person’s knowing that an act is beyond the directors’ powers under any relevant document of the company; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: a person dealing with a company is not required to inquire as to the limitations on the power of the company’s directors to bind the company or authorize others to do so.

subsection.content: This section does not affect any right of a member of the company to bring proceedings to restrain the doing of an act that is beyond the directors’ powers.
Proceedings must not be brought under subsection (3) in respect of any act to be done in fulfilment of a legal obligation arising from a previous act of the company.
This section does not affect any liability incurred by the directors, or any other person, by reason of the directors’ exceeding their powers.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—

def.name: RelevantDocument
def.leadIn: relevant document (有關文件), in relation to a company, means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the company’s articles;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any resolutions of the company or of any class of members of the company; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: any agreements between the members, or members of any class of members, of the company.

section.name: s118
section.heading: Transaction or act involving directors or their associates is voidable

subsection.leadIn: This section applies if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a company enters into a transaction; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the transaction binds the company because the power of the directors to bind the company, or authorize others to do so, is to be regarded under section 117 as free of any limitation under any relevant document of the company.

subsection.leadIn: The transaction is voidable at the instance of the company if the parties to the transaction include—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a director of the company or of a holding company of the company; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an entity connected with such a director.

subsection.leadIn: The transaction ceases to be voidable if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: restitution of any money or other asset that was the subject matter of the transaction is no longer possible;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the company is indemnified for any loss or damage resulting from the transaction;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a person who is not a party to the transaction has acquired rights in good faith and for value, and without actual notice of the directors’ exceeding their powers, and those rights would be affected by the avoidance of the transaction; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the transaction is affirmed by the company.

subsection.leadIn: Whether or not the transaction is avoided under subsection (2), any party to the transaction falling within subsection (2)(a) or (b) is liable, and any director of the company who has authorized the transaction is liable, to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: account to the company for any gain that the party or director has directly or indirectly made from the transaction; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: indemnify the company against any loss or damage resulting from the transaction.

subsection.content: A person who is not a director of the company is not liable under subsection (4) if the person shows that, at the time of the transaction, the person did not know that the directors were exceeding their powers.
Subject to subsection (7), this section does not affect the rights of any party to the transaction not falling within subsection (2)(a) or (b).
The Court may, on application by the company or a party covered by subsection (6), affirm, sever or set aside the transaction on any terms it thinks just.
This section does not exclude the operation of any other Ordinance or rule of law by which the transaction may be called in question or any liability to the company may arise.
In subsection (2)(b), the reference to an entity connected with a director has the meaning given by section 486.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: transaction (交易) includes any act.

section.name: s119
section.heading: Section 117 not to apply to certain cases

subsection.leadIn: Section 117 does not apply to any act of an exempted company except in favour of a person who—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: does not know at the time of the act that the company is an exempted company; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: gives full consideration for the act and does not know—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: that the act is not permitted by any relevant document of the company; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: that the act is beyond the powers of the directors.

subsection.leadIn: If an exempted company purports to transfer or grant an interest in property, the fact that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the act was not permitted by any relevant document of the company; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the directors exceeded any limitation on their powers under any relevant document of the company,

subsection.continued: does not affect the title of a person who subsequently acquires the property or any interest in it for full consideration without actual notice of any of the circumstances set out in paragraph (a) or (b).

subsection.leadIn: In any civil proceedings arising out of subsection (1) or (2), the burden of proving that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a person knew that the company was an exempted company;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a person knew that the act was not permitted by any relevant document of the company; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a person knew that the act was beyond the powers of the directors,

subsection.continued: lies on the person who asserts that fact.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—

def.name: ExemptedCompany
def.leadIn: exempted company (獲豁免公司) means a company—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to which a licence under section 103 relates; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: that is exempt from tax under section 88 of the Inland Revenue Ordinance (Cap. 112);

def.name: RelevantDocument
def.leadIn: relevant document (有關文件), in relation to a company, means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the company’s articles;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any resolutions of the company or of any class of members of the company; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: any agreements between the members, or members of any class of members, of the company.

section.name: s120
section.heading: No constructive notice of matters disclosed in articles etc.
section.leadIn: A person is not to be regarded as having notice of any matter merely because the matter is disclosed in—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the articles of a company kept by the Registrar; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a return or resolution kept by the Registrar.

section.name: s121
section.heading: Contracts made by or on behalf of company

subsection.leadIn: This section applies to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a contract that would be required by law to be in writing and under seal if made between natural persons;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a contract that would be required by law to be in writing, and to be signed by the parties to the contract, if made between natural persons; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a contract that, though made orally and not in writing, would by law be valid if made between natural persons.

subsection.leadIn: A contract specified in subsection (1)(a) may be made by a company—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in writing under the company’s common seal (if any); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in writing executed in accordance with section 127(3) and expressed (in whatever words) to be executed by the company.

subsection.content: A contract specified in subsection (1)(b) may be made on behalf of a company in writing signed by any person acting with the company’s authority (whether express or implied).
A contract specified in subsection (1)(c) may be made on behalf of a company orally by any person acting with the company’s authority (whether express or implied).

subsection.leadIn: A contract made in accordance with this section—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is effective in law; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: binds the company and its successors and all other parties to the contract.

subsection.content: A contract made in accordance with this section may be varied or discharged in the same manner in which it is authorized by this section to be made.

section.name: s122
section.heading: Contracts made before company’s incorporation

subsection.content: This section applies if a contract purports to have been made in the name or on behalf of a company before the company was incorporated.

subsection.leadIn: Subject to any express agreement to the contrary—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the contract has effect as a contract entered into by the person purporting to act for the company or as an agent for the company; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the person is personally liable on the contract and is entitled to enforce the contract.

subsection.leadIn: After incorporation, the company may ratify the contract to the same extent as if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the company had already been incorporated when the contract was entered into; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the contract had been entered into on the company’s behalf by an agent acting without the company’s authority.

subsection.content: Despite subsection (2)(b), if the contract is ratified by the company, then on and after the ratification, the liability of the person mentioned in that subsection is not greater than the liability that the person would have incurred if the person had entered into the contract after the company’s incorporation as an agent acting without the company’s authority.

section.name: s123
section.heading: Bills of exchange and promissory notes
section.content: If a bill of exchange or promissory note is made, accepted or endorsed in the name of, or by or on behalf or on account of, a company by a person acting with the company’s authority, the bill or note is to be regarded as having been made, accepted or endorsed on the company’s behalf.

section.name: s124
section.heading: Company may have common seal etc.

subsection.content: A company may have a common seal.
A company’s common seal must be a metallic seal having the company’s name engraved on it in compliance with subsection (2A) in legible form. (Amended 35 of 2018 s. 10)

subsection.name: 2A
subsection.leadIn: A company’s common seal must be engraved with—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if the company has both an English name and a Chinese name—the English name or the Chinese name or both; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the company has only an English name or a Chinese name—the English name or the Chinese name. (Added 35 of 2018 s. 10)

subsection.content: If subsection (2) is contravened, the company, and every responsible person of the company, commit an offence, and each is liable to a fine at level 3.

If an officer of a company or a person on behalf of a company uses, or authorizes the use of, a seal that purports to be the company’s common seal and that contravenes subsection (2), the officer or person commits an offence and is liable to a fine at level 3.

section.name: s125
section.heading: Official seal for use abroad

subsection.content: A company with a common seal may have an official seal for use outside Hong Kong.
Such an official seal must be a replica of the company’s common seal, but have engraved on it in legible form the name of every place where it is to be used.

A company with an official seal for use in a place may, by writing under its common seal, authorize any person appointed for the purpose to affix, in that place, the official seal to any deed or any other document to which the company is a party.

subsection.leadIn: As between a company and any person dealing with an executing agent of the company, the authority of the agent continues—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if the authorization mentions a period during which the authority is to continue, until the end of the period; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the authorization does not mention such a period, until a notice of revocation or termination of the agent’s authority has been given to the person.

subsection.content: The person affixing an official seal must, on the deed or other document to which the seal is affixed, certify in writing the date on which, and the place at which, the seal is so affixed.
A deed or other document to which an official seal is affixed binds the company as if it had been executed under the company’s common seal.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: executing agent (簽立代理人), in relation to a company, means a person authorized by the company under subsection (3).

section.name: s126
section.heading: Official seal for sealing share certificates etc.

subsection.leadIn: A company with a common seal may have an official seal—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: for sealing securities issued by the company; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: for sealing documents creating or evidencing securities issued by the company.

subsection.content: Such an official seal must be a replica of the company’s common seal, but have engraved on it in legible form the word “securities” or the characters “證券” or both such word and characters.

subsection.leadIn: A company that was incorporated before 31 August 1984 and that has such an official seal may use the seal for sealing any securities or documents mentioned in subsection (1), despite anything in—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any instrument constituting or regulating the company; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any instrument, made before that date, relating to securities or documents sealed with the seal.

section.name: s127
section.heading: Execution of documents by company

subsection.content: A company may execute a document under its common seal.
If a company executes a document under its common seal, the seal must be affixed in accordance with the provisions of its articles.

subsection.leadIn: A company may also execute a document—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the case of a company with only one director, by having it signed by the director on the company’s behalf; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: in the case of a company with 2 or more directors, by having it signed on the company’s behalf by—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the 2 directors or any 2 of the directors; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: any of the directors and the company secretary of the company.

subsection.content: For the purposes of subsection (3), if a person is to sign a document on behalf of 2 or more companies, the person must sign the document separately in each capacity.
A document signed in accordance with subsection (3) and expressed (in whatever words) to be executed by the company has effect as if the document had been executed under the company’s common seal.
In favour of a person specified in subsection (7), a document is to be regarded as having been executed by a company if the document purports to have been signed in accordance with subsection (3).

subsection.leadIn: The person is a purchaser in good faith for valuable consideration and includes—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a lessee;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a mortgagee; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: any other person who for valuable consideration acquires the property.

subsection.content: This section also applies to a document that is executed, or purports to be executed, by a company in the name of or on behalf of another person whether or not that other person is also a company.

section.name: s128
section.heading: Execution of deeds by company

subsection.leadIn: A company may execute a document as a deed by—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: executing it in accordance with section 127;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: having it expressed (in whatever words) to be executed by the company as a deed; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: delivering it as a deed.

subsection.content: For the purposes of subsection (1)(c), a document is presumed, unless the contrary is proved, to be delivered as a deed on its being executed in accordance with section 127.
If there is any conflict or inconsistency between this section and the provisions of any other Ordinance, this section prevails over those provisions to the extent of the conflict or inconsistency.

section.name: s129
section.heading: Execution of deeds or other documents by attorney for company

subsection.content: A company may, either generally or in respect of any specific matter, by an instrument executed as a deed, empower any person as its attorney to execute a deed or any other document on its behalf in Hong Kong or elsewhere.
A deed or any other document executed by an attorney on behalf of the company binds the company and has effect as if it were executed by the company.
This section does not affect the operation of any other Ordinance as to the execution of powers of attorney.

division.name: D8
division.heading: Re-registration of Unlimited Company as Company Limited by Shares

section.name: s130
section.heading: Unlimited company may apply for re-registration as company limited by shares

subsection.leadIn: A company registered as an unlimited company on or after 31 August 1984 may be re-registered as a company limited by shares if the company—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: passes a special resolution specified in subsection (2); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: delivers to the Registrar for registration an application in accordance with section 131.

subsection.leadIn: The special resolution—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: must resolve that the company is to be re-registered as a company limited by shares;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: must state the manner in which the liability of the members is to be limited on the re-registration;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: must provide for the alterations to the company’s articles that are necessary to bring the articles into conformity with the requirements of this Ordinance in respect of the articles of a company to be formed under this Ordinance as a company limited by shares;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: must contain a statement specified in subsection (3); and

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: may state the maximum number of shares that the company may issue.

subsection.leadIn: The statement—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: must state the total number of shares in the company issued before the re-registration, and the total number of shares that the company proposes to issue on the re-registration;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: must state the total amount of share capital subscribed by its members before the re-registration, and the total amount of share capital to be subscribed by its members on the re-registration;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: must state the amount to be paid up or to be regarded as paid up, and the amount to remain unpaid or to be regarded as remaining unpaid, on the total number of shares issued before the re-registration, and on the total number of shares that the company proposes to issue on the re-registration;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.leadIn: if the share capital is to be divided into different classes of shares on the re-registration, must also state the classes and, for each class—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the particulars specified in subsection (5);

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the total number of shares in that class issued before the re-registration, and the total number of shares in that class that the company proposes to issue on the re-registration;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: the total amount of share capital in that class subscribed by its members before the re-registration, and the total amount of share capital in that class to be subscribed by its members on the re-registration; and

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: the amount to be paid up or to be regarded as paid up, and the amount to remain unpaid or to be regarded as remaining unpaid, on the total number of shares in that class issued before the re-registration, and on the total number of shares in that class that the company proposes to issue on the re-registration; and

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.leadIn: must state, in respect of each member—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the number of shares that the company issued to the member before the re-registration, and the number of shares that the company proposes to issue to the member on the re-registration; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the total amount of share capital subscribed by the member before the re-registration, and the total amount of share capital to be subscribed by the member on the re-registration.

subsection.content: If the shares proposed to be issued to a member on the re-registration belong to 2 or more classes, the information required under subsection (3)(e) must be stated in respect of each class.

subsection.leadIn: The particulars for the purposes of subsection (3)(d) are—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: particulars of any voting rights attached to shares in the class, including rights that arise only in certain circumstances;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: particulars of any rights attached to shares in the class, as respects dividends, to participate in a distribution;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: particulars of any rights attached to shares in the class, as respects capital, to participate in a distribution (including on a winding up); and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: whether or not shares in the class are redeemable shares.

section.name: s131
section.heading: Application for re-registration

subsection.leadIn: An application under section 130(1)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: must be in the specified form; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: must be accompanied by a copy of the company’s articles as proposed to be altered by the special resolution.

subsection.content: Such an application may only be delivered to the Registrar on or after the date on which the Registrar receives a copy of the special resolution delivered under section 622.

section.name: s132
section.heading: Issue of certificate because of re-registration

subsection.content: On registering an application and a copy of the articles delivered under section 131(1), the Registrar must issue a certificate certifying that the company is a company limited by shares. (Amended 14 of 2025 s. 14)
The certificate must be signed by the Registrar.

subsection.leadIn: On the issue of the certificate—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the company becomes a company limited by shares; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the alterations to the company’s articles as provided for in the special resolution for re-registration under section 130(2)(c) take effect despite anything in this Ordinance.

subsection.leadIn: A certificate issued under subsection (1) is conclusive evidence that— (Amended 14 of 2025 s. 14)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: all the requirements of this Ordinance in respect of re-registration of the company have been complied with; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the company is re-registered as a company limited by shares under this Ordinance.

section.name: s133
section.heading: Winding up of company re-registered as company limited by shares

subsection.leadIn: This section applies if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a company is re-registered as a company limited by shares under this Division or section 19 of the predecessor Ordinance; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the company is wound up.

subsection.content: Despite section 170(1)(a) of the Companies (Winding Up and Miscellaneous Provisions) Ordinance (Cap. 32), a person who is not a member of the company but was a member at the time of the re-registration is liable to contribute to the assets of the company in respect of debts and liabilities of the company contracted before the re-registration if the winding up commences within 3 years beginning on the day of the re-registration.

Despite section 170(1)(c) of the Companies (Winding Up and Miscellaneous Provisions) Ordinance (Cap. 32), a person who was a member or a past member of the company at the time of the re-registration is liable to contribute to the assets of the company in respect of debts and liabilities of the company contracted before the re-registration if every person who was a member of the company at that time is no longer a member of the company.

Subsection (3) applies even though the existing members of the company have satisfied the contribution required to be made by them under the Companies (Winding Up and Miscellaneous Provisions) Ordinance (Cap. 32).

Despite section 170(1)(d) of the Companies (Winding Up and Miscellaneous Provisions) Ordinance (Cap. 32), there is no limit on the amount that a person is liable to contribute under subsection (2) or (3).

part.name: P4
part.heading: Share Capital

section.name: s134
section.heading: Nature and transferability of shares

subsection.content: A share or other interest of a member in a company is personal property.
A share or other interest of a member in a company is transferable in accordance with the company’s articles.

section.name: s135
section.heading: No nominal value

subsection.content: Shares in a company have no nominal value.
This section applies to shares issued before the commencement date# of this section as well as shares issued on or after that date.
subsection.statutoryNote:
Note—
Division 2 of Part 4 of Schedule 11 contains transitional provisions relating to the abolition of nominal value.

section.name: s136
section.heading: Numbering of shares

subsection.content: Each share in a company must be distinguished by an appropriate number, except as provided by subsection (2) or (3).

subsection.leadIn: If, at any time—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: all the issued shares in a company are fully paid up and rank equally for all purposes; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: all the issued shares of a particular class in a company are fully paid up and rank equally for all purposes,

subsection.continued: none of those shares is required to have a distinguishing number as long as it remains fully paid up and ranks equally for all purposes with all shares of the same class for the time being issued and fully paid up.

subsection.content: If new shares are issued by a company on the terms that, within a period not exceeding 12 months, they will rank equally for all purposes with all the existing shares, or with all the existing shares of a particular class, in the company, neither the new shares nor the corresponding existing shares are required to have distinguishing numbers as long as all of them are fully paid up and rank equally for all purposes.
If subsection (3) applies and the shares are not numbered, any share certificates for the new shares must be appropriately worded or enfaced.

section.name: s137
section.heading: Share certificate to be proof of title in the absence of contrary evidence
section.content: In the absence of evidence to the contrary, a certificate issued by a company specifying any shares held by a member in the company is proof of the member’s title to the shares.

section.name: s138
section.heading: Repeal of power to issue stock
section.content: A company does not have power to convert its shares into stock.

paragraph.content:
Note—
Sections 174 and 175 contain provisions relating to the reconversion of stock into shares.

section.name: s139
section.heading: Repeal of power to issue share warrants

subsection.content: A company does not have power to issue a share warrant.

The bearer of a share warrant issued before the material date is entitled, on surrendering it for cancellation, to have the bearer’s name entered in the register of members of the company. (Amended 14 of 2025 s. 15)

If the company enters the bearer’s name in the register of its members without the share warrant being surrendered and cancelled, the company is liable for any loss suffered by a person as a result of the bearer’s name being entered in the register.
The company must enter the date of surrender of a share warrant in the register of its members.
If a company’s articles so provide, the bearer of a share warrant may be regarded as a member of the company, either to the full extent or for any purposes specified in the articles.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—

def.name: MaterialDate
def.leadIn: material date (關鍵日期)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: for a company that is not a re-domiciled company—means 3 March 2014; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: for a re-domiciled company—means the re-domiciliation date. (Added 14 of 2025 s. 15)

section.name: s140
section.heading: Exercise by directors of power to allot shares or grant rights

subsection.leadIn: Except in accordance with section 141, the directors of a company must not exercise any power—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to allot shares in the company; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to grant rights to subscribe for, or to convert any security into, shares in the company.

subsection.leadIn: Subsection (1) does not apply to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an allotment of shares, or grant of rights, under an offer made to the members of the company in proportion to their shareholdings;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an allotment of shares, or grant of rights, on a bonus issue of shares to the members of the company in proportion to their shareholdings;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: an allotment to a founder member of a company of shares that the member, by signing the company’s articles, has agreed to take; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: an allotment of shares made in accordance with a grant of a right to subscribe for, or to convert any security into, shares if the right was granted in accordance with an approval under section 141.

subsection.content: For the purposes of subsection (2)(a), the offer is not required to be made to any member whose address is in a place where the offer is not permitted under the law of that place.
A director commits an offence if the director knowingly contravenes, or authorizes or permits a contravention of, this section.
A director who commits an offence under subsection (4) is liable to a fine at level 5 and to imprisonment for 6 months.
Nothing in this section or section 141 affects the validity of an allotment or other transaction.

section.name: s141
section.heading: Allotment of shares or grant of rights with company approval

subsection.leadIn: The directors of a company may exercise a power—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to allot shares in the company; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to grant rights to subscribe for, or to convert any security into, shares in the company,

subsection.continued: if the company gives approval in advance by resolution of the company.

subsection.content: Approval may be given for a particular exercise of the power or for its exercise generally, and may be unconditional or subject to conditions.

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsections (4) and (5), an approval expires—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: if the company is required to hold an annual general meeting, on the earlier of—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the conclusion of the annual general meeting held next after the approval was given;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the expiry of the period within which the next annual general meeting after the approval was given is required to be held;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the company is not required to hold an annual general meeting because of section 612(1), on the date on which the requirements of that section are satisfied; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: if the company is not required to hold an annual general meeting for any other reason, on the date specified in the approval, which must not be more than 12 months after the approval was given.

subsection.content: An approval may be revoked or varied at any time by resolution of the company.

subsection.leadIn: The directors may allot shares or grant rights after an approval has expired if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the shares are allotted, or the rights are granted, under an offer, agreement or option made or granted by the company before the approval expired; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the approval allowed the company to make or grant an offer, agreement or option that would or might require shares to be allotted, or rights to be granted, after the approval had expired.

section.name: s142
section.heading: Return of allotment

subsection.content: Within one month after an allotment of shares, a limited company must deliver to the Registrar for registration a return of the allotment that complies with subsection (2).

subsection.leadIn: A return—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: must be in the specified form;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: must include a statement of capital, as at the time immediately after the allotment, that complies with section 201; (Amended 35 of 2018 s. 11)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: must state—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the number of shares allotted;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the name and address of each allottee; and

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: if the company’s issued share capital is increased as a result of the allotment, the amount of the increase;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.leadIn: for any shares allotted for consideration (whether wholly or partly cash consideration or non-cash consideration)—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: must state the amount paid or regarded as paid on each share and the amount (if any) remaining unpaid or regarded as remaining unpaid on each share;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: in the case of an allotment wholly or partly for non-cash consideration under an arrangement made under Division 2 of Part 13, must contain particulars of the order of the Court sanctioning the arrangement; and

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: in any other case of an allotment wholly or partly for non-cash consideration, must contain particulars of the contract for sale, or for services or other consideration in respect of which the shares were allotted; and

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.leadIn: for any shares allotted credited as fully paid up (whether on or without a capitalization)—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: must state the amount regarded as paid on each share; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: must contain particulars of the resolution authorizing the capitalization or allotment.

subsection.content: If a limited company contravenes subsection (1), the company, and every responsible person of the company, commit an offence, and each is liable to a fine at level 4 and, in the case of a continuing offence, to a further fine of $700 for each day during which the offence continues.

If a limited company fails to deliver a return that complies with subsection (2) within one month after an allotment of shares, the Court may, on application by the company or a responsible person of the company, extend the period for delivery of the return by a period determined by the Court.

subsection.leadIn: The Court may extend a period under subsection (4) only if it is satisfied—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: that failure to deliver the return was accidental or due to inadvertence; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: that it is just and equitable to extend the period.

subsection.content: If the Court extends the period for delivery of a return, any liability already incurred by the company or a responsible person of the company for an offence under subsection (3) is extinguished and subsection (1) has effect as if the reference to one month were a reference to the extended period.

section.name: s143
section.heading: Registration of allotment

subsection.content: A company must register an allotment of shares as soon as practicable and in any event within 2 months after the date of the allotment, by entering in the register of its members the information referred to in section 627(2) and (3).

If a company fails to register an allotment of shares within 2 months after the date of the allotment, the company, and every responsible person of the company, commit an offence, and each is liable to a fine at level 4 and, in the case of a continuing offence, to a further fine of $700 for each day during which the offence continues.

section.name: s144
section.heading: Issue of share certificate on allotment

subsection.content: Within 2 months after an allotment of shares, a company must complete the certificates for the shares and have the certificates ready for delivery.
Subsection (1) does not apply if the conditions of issue of the shares provide otherwise.

If a company contravenes this section, the company, and every responsible person of the company, commit an offence, and each is liable to a fine at level 4 and, in the case of a continuing offence, to a further fine of $700 for each day during which the offence continues.

section.name: s145
section.heading: Order of Court for delivery of share certificate

subsection.content: If a company contravenes section 144 in relation to an allotment of shares, a person entitled to the certificates for the shares may serve a notice on the company requiring it to deliver the certificates to the person within 10 days.

If a company on which a notice has been served under subsection (1) does not deliver the certificates within 10 days after service of the notice, the person may apply to the Court for an order under subsection (3).

On an application under subsection (2), the Court may make an order directing the company and any officer of the company to deliver the certificates to the person within the period specified in the order.
The order may provide that all costs of and incidental to the application are to be borne by the company or by an officer of the company responsible for the contravention.

section.name: s146
section.heading: Validation by Court of issue or allotment

subsection.leadIn: This section applies if a company purports to issue or allot shares and—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the issue or allotment is or may be invalid for any reason; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the terms of the issue or allotment are inconsistent with or not authorized by—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: this Ordinance or any other Ordinance; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the company’s articles.

subsection.content: The company, a creditor of the company or a holder or mortgagee of any of the shares may apply to the Court for an order validating, or confirming the terms of, the issue or allotment.
The Court may make an order under subsection (2) if the Court is satisfied that it is just and equitable to do so.
On delivery of an office copy of the order to the Registrar, the order has effect from the time of the purported issue or allotment.

section.name: s147
section.heading: General prohibition of commissions, discounts and allowances

subsection.leadIn: Except as permitted by section 148, a company must not apply any of its shares or share capital, either directly or indirectly, in payment of any commission, discount or allowance to a person in consideration of the person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: subscribing or agreeing to subscribe (whether absolutely or conditionally) for shares in the company; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: procuring or agreeing to procure subscriptions (whether absolute or conditional) for shares in the company.

subsection.content: It is immaterial how the shares or share capital are applied, whether by being added to the purchase money of property acquired by the company or to the contract price of work to be executed for the company, or being paid out of the nominal purchase money or contract price, or otherwise.
Nothing in this section affects the payment of brokerage by a company.

section.name: s148
section.heading: Permitted commissions

subsection.leadIn: If the conditions in subsection (2) are satisfied, a company may pay a commission to a person in consideration of the person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: subscribing or agreeing to subscribe (whether absolutely or conditionally) for shares in the company; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: procuring or agreeing to procure subscriptions (whether absolute or conditional) for shares in the company.

subsection.leadIn: The conditions are that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the payment of the commission is authorized by the company’s articles;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the commission paid or agreed to be paid does not exceed the lesser of—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: 10% of the price at which the shares are issued;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the amount or rate authorized by the articles; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: if the shares are not offered to the public for subscription, the company, before making the payment—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: delivers to the Registrar for registration a notice in the specified form disclosing the amount or rate of the commission and the number of shares (if any) that persons have agreed for a commission to subscribe for absolutely; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: discloses the amount or rate of the commission and the number of shares (if any) that persons have agreed for a commission to subscribe for absolutely in any circular or notice issued by the company inviting subscriptions for the shares.

subsection.content: A vendor to, promoter of, or other person who receives payment in money or shares from, a company may apply any part of the money or shares so received in payment of any commission the payment of which directly by the company would be permitted by this section.
If a company contravenes the condition referred to in subsection (2)(c)(i), the company, and every responsible person of the company, commit an offence, and each is liable to a fine at level 4.

section.name: s149
section.heading: Capital may be applied in writing off certain expenses and commission
section.leadIn: A company may apply its share capital in writing off—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the preliminary expenses of the company;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any commission paid under section 148 or under section 46 of the predecessor Ordinance; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: any other expenses of any issue of shares in the company.

section.name: s150
section.heading: Requirement for instrument of transfer

subsection.content: A company must not register a transfer of shares in the company unless a proper instrument of transfer has been delivered to the company.
Subsection (1) does not affect any power of a company to register as a member a person to whom the right to shares has been transmitted by operation of law.

section.name: s151
section.heading: Registration of transfer or refusal of registration

subsection.content: The transferee or transferor of shares in a company may lodge the transfer with the company.

subsection.leadIn: Within 2 months after the transfer is lodged, the company must either—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: register the transfer; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: send the transferee and the transferor notice of refusal to register the transfer.

subsection.content: If a company refuses registration, the transferee or transferor may request a statement of the reasons for the refusal.

subsection.leadIn: If a request is made under subsection (3), the company must, within 28 days after receiving the request—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: send the person who made the request a statement of the reasons; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: register the transfer.

subsection.content: If a company contravenes subsection (2) or (4), the company, and every responsible person of the company, commit an offence, and each is liable to a fine at level 4 and, in the case of a continuing offence, to a further fine of $700 for each day during which the offence continues.

section.name: s152
section.heading: Order of Court for registration

subsection.content: If a company refuses to register a transfer, the transferee or the transferor may apply to the Court for an order under this section.
On an application under subsection (1), the Court may order the company to register the transfer, if the Court is satisfied that the application is well-founded.

section.name: s153
section.heading: Transfer by personal representative
section.content: A transfer of a share or other interest of a deceased member of a company by his or her personal representative is as valid as if the personal representative had been the registered holder of that share or interest at the time of execution of the instrument of transfer.

section.name: s154
section.heading: Certification of transfer

subsection.leadIn: The certification by a company of an instrument of transfer of shares in the company—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is a representation by the company to any person acting on the faith of the certification that documents have been produced to the company that evidence title to the shares in the transferor named in the instrument; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: is not a representation that the transferor has any title to the shares.

subsection.content: If a person acts on the faith of a false certification by a company made negligently, the company is under the same liability to the person as if the certification had been made fraudulently.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of this section, an instrument of transfer is certified by a company if it bears—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the words “certificate lodged”, or words to the same effect, in English or Chinese; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: under or adjacent to those words, the signature or initials of a person having the actual or apparent authority to certify transfers on behalf of the company.

subsection.leadIn: Unless the contrary is proved, a signature or initials appearing on an instrument of transfer as referred to in subsection (3)(b) must be regarded—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: as the signature or initials of the person whose signature or initials they purport to be; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: as having been placed on the instrument by that person or by another person who has the actual or apparent authority to use the signature or initials for the purpose of certifying transfers on behalf of the company.

section.name: s155
section.heading: Issue of share certificate on transfer

subsection.content: Within the period specified in subsection (2), a company must complete the certificates for any of its shares that are transferred and have the certificates ready for delivery.

subsection.leadIn: The period is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: for a private company, 2 months after the day on which the transfer is lodged with the company;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: for any other company, 10 business days after the day on which the transfer is lodged with the company.

subsection.leadIn: Subsection (1) does not apply to a transfer if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the conditions of issue of the shares provide otherwise;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: stamp duty has not been paid in respect of the transfer;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the transfer is invalid; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the company, being entitled to do so, refuses to register the transfer.

subsection.content: If a company contravenes this section, the company, and every responsible person of the company, commit an offence, and each is liable to a fine at level 4 and, in the case of a continuing offence, to a further fine of $700 for each day during which the offence continues.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: business day (營業日) means a day on which a recognized stock market is open for the business of dealing in securities.

section.name: s156
section.heading: Order of Court for delivery of share certificate

subsection.content: If a company contravenes section 155 in relation to a transfer of shares, a person entitled to the certificates for the shares may serve a notice on the company requiring it to deliver the certificates to the person within 10 days.

If a company on which a notice has been served under subsection (1) does not deliver the certificates within 10 days after service of the notice, the person may apply to the Court for an order under subsection (3).

On an application under subsection (2), the Court may make an order directing the company and any officer of the company to deliver the certificates to the person within the period specified in the order.
The order may provide that all costs of and incidental to the application are to be borne by the company or by an officer of the company responsible for the contravention.

section.name: s157
section.heading: Compensation regarding forged share transfers

subsection.leadIn: A company may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: pay compensation to a person for loss arising from a transfer of shares in the company under a forged transfer or a transfer under a forged power of attorney;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: provide, by insurance, reservation of capital or accumulation of income, a fund to meet claims for compensation;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: borrow on the security of its property for the purpose of paying compensation; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: impose any reasonable restrictions on the transfer of its shares or with respect to powers of attorney for the transfer of its shares that the company considers necessary to guard against losses arising from forgery.

subsection.content: A company that pays compensation to a person under this section has the same rights and remedies against the person liable for the loss as the person compensated would have had.

If the shares in a company have, by amalgamation or otherwise, become shares in another company, the other company has the same powers under this section as the first company would have had if it had continued.

subdivision.name: SD2
subdivision.heading: Transmission of Shares by Operation of Law

section.name: s158
section.heading: Registration or refusal of registration

subsection.content: This section applies if the right to shares is transmitted to a person by operation of law and the person notifies the company in writing that the person wishes to be registered as a member of the company in respect of the shares.

subsection.leadIn: Within 2 months after receiving the notification, the company must either—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: register the person as a member of the company in respect of the shares; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: send the person notice of refusal of registration.

subsection.content: If a company refuses registration, the person may request a statement of the reasons for the refusal.

subsection.leadIn: If a person makes a request under subsection (3), the company must, within 28 days after receiving the request—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: send the person a statement of the reasons; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: register the person as a member of the company in respect of the shares.

subsection.content: If a company contravenes subsection (2) or (4), the company, and every responsible person of the company, commit an offence, and each is liable to a fine at level 4 and, in the case of a continuing offence, to a further fine of $700 for each day during which the offence continues.

section.name: s159
section.heading: Order of Court for registration

subsection.content: If a company refuses registration under section 158, the person to whom the right to the shares was transmitted may apply to the Court for an order under this section.

On an application under subsection (1), the Court may order the company to register the person as a member of the company in respect of the shares, if the Court is satisfied that the application is well-founded.

section.name: s160
section.heading: Pre-emption rights in relation to transmission by law

subsection.content: This section applies if a company’s articles give a member or class of members of the company a right of pre-emption or right to purchase shares in the company on the occurrence of an event that constitutes a transmission of the right to the shares by operation of law.

If this section applies, the registration as a member of the company of the person to whom the right to the shares is transmitted is subject to the right of pre-emption or right to purchase shares contained in the articles and that right may be enforced against the person.

section.name: s161
section.heading: Evidence of grant of probate etc.
section.content: For the purposes of a transfer of shares or transmission of the right to shares, a company must accept as sufficient evidence of the grant of probate of the will or letters of administration of a deceased person the production to the company of a document that is by law sufficient evidence of that grant.

division.name: D5
division.heading: Replacement of Listed Companies’ Lost Share Certificates

section.name: s162
section.heading: Interpretation
section.leadIn: In this Division—

def.name: EligiblePerson
def.leadIn: eligible person (合資格人士), in relation to shares in a listed company, means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a registered holder of the shares; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a person who claims to be entitled to have the person’s name entered in the register of members of the company in respect of the shares;

def.name: GenuinePurchaser
def.leadIn: genuine purchaser (真正購買者), in relation to shares, means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a person (other than a person to whom a new certificate for the shares is issued under this Division) who purchases the shares in good faith for value and without notice of any defect in the title of the seller; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a person who becomes entitled to the shares at any time after the purchase of them by a person referred to in paragraph (a);

section.def: new certificate (新股份證明書) means a share certificate that replaces a share certificate that has been lost;
original certificate (原有股份證明書) means a share certificate that has been lost;

website (網站), in relation to a company (other than a recognized exchange company), means the website on which the company is required, by the listing rules applicable to the recognized stock market concerned, to publish announcements, notices or other documents.

section.name: s163
section.heading: Application for new certificate

subsection.content: If a share certificate for shares in a listed company has been lost, an eligible person may apply to the company for a new certificate.

subsection.leadIn: The application—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: must be in the specified form; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: must be accompanied by a statutory declaration by the eligible person stating the following—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: that the original certificate has been lost;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: when the original certificate was last in the person’s possession and how the person ceased to have possession of it;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: whether the person has executed any transfer in respect of the shares, in blank or otherwise;

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: that no other person is entitled to have their name entered in the register of members of the company in respect of the shares; and

subparagraph.name: v
subparagraph.content: any other matters that are necessary to verify the grounds on which the application is made.

section.name: s164
section.heading: Publication requirements

subsection.content: A listed company that intends to issue a new certificate on an application under section 163 must publish a notice in the specified form in accordance with this section.

subsection.leadIn: The notice must be published—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on the company’s website; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: in the Gazette if—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the eligible person making the application is not the registered holder of the shares or does not have the registered holder’s consent to make the application; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the latest value of the shares exceeds $200,000.

subsection.content: The notice must be published in the Gazette under subsection (2)(b) within one month after it is first published on the company’s website under subsection (2)(a).

subsection.leadIn: Before publishing a notice under this section, the company must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: deliver a copy of the notice to the recognized exchange company that operates the stock market on which the shares concerned are listed; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: obtain a certificate from an authorized officer of that exchange company that the copy is being exhibited in accordance with subsection (5).

subsection.leadIn: A recognized exchange company must exhibit a copy of a notice received under subsection (4)(a) in a conspicuous place on the premises on which the stock market operates or make the notice available on its official website for a period of at least—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: one month, for a notice that is not required to be published under subsection (2)(b); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: 3 months, for a notice that is required to be published under subsection (2)(b).

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsection (5), a failure to make a copy of a notice available on an exchange company’s official website throughout a period mentioned in that subsection is to be disregarded if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the notice is made available on the website for part of that period; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the failure is wholly attributable to circumstances that it would not be reasonable to have expected that exchange company to prevent or avoid.

subsection.leadIn: If the application was made by an eligible person who is not the registered holder of the shares and does not have the registered holder’s consent to make the application, the listed company—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: must serve a copy of the notice under this section on the registered holder by sending it by registered post to the registered holder’s last address appearing in the register of members of the company; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: must not publish the notice under this section until at least 3 months after the day on which the copy was served.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: latest value (最新價值) of shares means the value of the shares calculated at the last recorded price paid for shares of the same class in the company at the recognized stock market prior to the making of the application for the new certificate.

section.name: s165
section.heading: Issue of new certificate

subsection.leadIn: A listed company may issue a new certificate on an application under section 163 if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: the company has published a notice under section 164 and—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: if the notice is published under section 164(2)(a), the notice has been made available on the company’s website throughout a period of at least one month; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: if the notice is published under section 164(2)(b), the notice has been made available on the company’s website throughout a period of at least 3 months and published in the Gazette in accordance with section 164(3);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the company has not received notice of any other claim in respect of the shares; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: in the case of an application by an eligible person who is not the registered holder of the shares—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: an instrument of transfer in respect of the shares has been delivered to the company under section 150; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: if the application was made without the registered holder’s consent, the company has caused an instrument of transfer to be executed on behalf of the registered holder by a person appointed by the company and executed by the applicant on the applicant’s own behalf.

subsection.content: An instrument of transfer referred to in subsection (1)(c)(ii) is to be regarded as an instrument of transfer duly delivered to the company under section 150.

subsection.leadIn: A listed company that issues a new certificate must without delay—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: cancel the original certificate; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: record the issue of the new certificate and cancellation of the original certificate in the register of its members.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsection (1)(a), a failure to make a notice available on a company’s website throughout a period mentioned in that subsection is to be disregarded if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the notice is made available on the website for part of that period; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the failure is wholly attributable to circumstances that it would not be reasonable to have expected the company to prevent or avoid.

section.name: s166
section.heading: Public notice of issue of new certificate

subsection.leadIn: A listed company that issues a new certificate must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: publish a notice in the specified form in accordance with this section; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: deliver a copy of the notice to the recognized exchange company that operates the stock market on which the shares concerned are listed within 14 days after the date of issue.

subsection.content: The notice must be published by making it available on the listed company’s website throughout a period of at least 7 days beginning on a date falling within 14 days after the date of issue.

If the listed company was required by section 164(2)(b) to publish a notice in the Gazette of its intention to issue the new certificate, the notice under this section must also be published in the Gazette within 14 days after the date of issue.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsection (2), a failure to make a notice available on a listed company’s website throughout a period mentioned in that subsection is to be disregarded if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the notice is made available on the website for part of that period; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the failure is wholly attributable to circumstances that it would not be reasonable to have expected the company to prevent or avoid.

subsection.content: If a listed company contravenes this section, the company, and every responsible person of the company, commit an offence, and each is liable to a fine at level 3 and, in the case of a continuing offence, to a further fine of $300 for each day during which the offence continues.

section.name: s167
section.heading: Orders of Court for rectification of the register

subsection.leadIn: Subject to this section, if a listed company issues a new certificate in respect of shares, nothing in this Division affects the power of the Court to make an order under section 633 in favour of a person claiming to be entitled to the shares as against—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the person to whom the new certificate is issued; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a person whose name is subsequently entered in the register of members of the company in respect of the shares.

subsection.content: The Court must not make an order under section 633 as against a person referred to in subsection (1)(b) if that person is a genuine purchaser of the shares.

subsection.leadIn: If the Court makes an order under section 633 as against the person to whom the new certificate is issued or a person whose name is subsequently entered in the register of members of the company in respect of the shares—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Court must not order the payment of damages by the company; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the company is not otherwise liable for any damage caused by the issue of the new certificate or cancellation of the original certificate in accordance with this Division.

subsection.statutoryNote:
Note—
Section 633 gives the Court power to make an order for rectification of the register of members of a company.

section.name: s168
section.heading: Liability if rectification cannot be ordered

subsection.content: This section applies if an order cannot be made under section 633 because of section 167(2).
The company is not liable for any damage suffered by the claimant because of the issue of the new certificate or cancellation of the original certificate, unless the company has acted deceitfully.

If the genuine purchaser purchased the shares from the person to whom the new certificate is issued, the person to whom the new certificate is issued is liable to the claimant for the value of the shares as at the date of purchase.

If the genuine purchaser purchased the shares from a person whose name was subsequently entered in the register of members of the company in respect of the shares, the person to whom the new certificate is issued and any person whose name was subsequently entered in the register in respect of the shares (other than a genuine purchaser) are jointly and severally liable to the claimant for the value of the shares as at the date the shares were purchased by the genuine purchaser.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: claimant (申索人) means the person in whose favour an order could have been made under section 633 but for section 167(2).

section.name: s169
section.heading: Applicant to pay expenses

subsection.content: An applicant for a new certificate must pay all expenses relating to the application.

A listed company may refuse to deal, or to deal further, with an application until it is satisfied that the applicant has made reasonable provision for payment of the expenses relating to the application.

section.name: s170
section.heading: Permitted alteration of share capital

subsection.content: A limited company may alter its share capital in any one or more of the ways set out in subsection (2).

subsection.leadIn: The company may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: increase its share capital by allotting and issuing new shares in accordance with this Part;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: increase its share capital without allotting and issuing new shares, if the funds or other assets for the increase are provided by the members of the company;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: capitalize its profits, with or without allotting and issuing new shares;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: allot and issue bonus shares with or without increasing its share capital;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: convert all or any of its shares into a larger or smaller number of shares;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.leadIn: cancel shares—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: that, at the date the resolution for cancellation is passed, have not been taken or agreed to be taken by any person; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: that have been forfeited.

subsection.content: A limited company may alter its share capital as referred to in subsection (2)(e) or (f) only by resolution of the company.
subsection.statutoryNote:
Note—
Sections 140 and 141 contain provisions requiring a resolution of the company for an allotment of shares. Those sections may be relevant to an alteration of share capital referred to in subsection (2)(a), (c) or (d).

subsection.leadIn: A resolution referred to in subsection (3) may authorize the company to exercise the power—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on more than one occasion;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: at a specified time or in specified circumstances.

subsection.content: Any amount remaining unpaid on shares being converted under subsection (2)(e) is to be divided equally among the replacement shares.
If shares are cancelled under subsection (2)(f), the company must reduce its share capital by the amount of the shares cancelled.
For the purposes of Part 5, a cancellation of shares under this section is not a reduction of share capital.
A limited company’s articles may exclude or restrict the exercise of a power conferred by this section.

section.name: s171
section.heading: Notice of alteration of share capital

subsection.content: Within one month after altering its share capital under section 170, a company must deliver a notice to the Registrar for registration in relation to the alteration of share capital.

subsection.leadIn: The notice—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: must be in the specified form;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the company’s issued share capital is increased by the alteration, must state the amount of the increase; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: must include a statement of capital, as at the time immediately after the alteration, that complies with section 201. (Amended 35 of 2018 s. 12)

subsection.content: A company is not required to deliver a notice under this section in relation to an alteration of share capital involving an allotment of shares.
subsection.statutoryNote:
Note—
For an allotment of shares, section 142 requires a company to deliver a return of the allotment to the Registrar for registration.

subsection.content: If a company contravenes subsection (1), the company, and every responsible person of the company, commit an offence, and each is liable to a fine at level 4 and, in the case of a continuing offence, to a further fine of $700 for each day during which the offence continues.

section.name: s172
section.heading: Redenomination of share capital

subsection.content: A limited company may, by resolution of the company, convert its share capital or any class of shares from one currency to another currency. This is known as a redenomination.

subsection.leadIn: A resolution under this section may authorize a limited company to redenominate its share capital—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on more than one occasion;

paragraph.name: b
