paragraph.content: at a specified time or in specified circumstances.

subsection.content: A redenomination does not affect any rights or obligations of members under the company’s articles, or any restrictions affecting members under the company’s articles.

In particular, it does not affect any entitlement to dividends (including entitlement to dividends in a particular currency), voting rights or liability in respect of amounts remaining unpaid on shares (including liability in a particular currency).
For the purposes of this section, the company’s articles include the terms on which any shares in the company are allotted or held.
A limited company’s articles may exclude or restrict the exercise of a power conferred by this section.

section.name: s173
section.heading: Notice of redenomination

subsection.content: Within one month after passing a resolution under section 172, a company must deliver a notice in the specified form to the Registrar for registration in relation to the redenomination.
The notice must include a statement of capital, as at the time immediately after the redenomination, that complies with section 201. (Amended 35 of 2018 s. 13)

If a company contravenes this section, the company, and every responsible person of the company, commit an offence, and each is liable to a fine at level 4 and, in the case of a continuing offence, to a further fine of $700 for each day during which the offence continues.

section.name: s174
section.heading: Reconversion of stock into shares

subsection.content: A company that has converted paid up shares into stock (before the repeal by this Ordinance of the power to do so) may, by resolution of the company, reconvert that stock into paid up shares.
subsection.statutoryNote:
Note—
Section 138 repeals the power of a company to convert its shares into stock.

subsection.leadIn: A resolution under this section may authorize a company to exercise the power to reconvert stock—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on more than one occasion;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: at a specified time or in specified circumstances.

section.name: s175
section.heading: Notice of reconversion

subsection.content: Within one month after passing a resolution under section 174, a company must deliver a notice in the specified form to the Registrar for registration in relation to the reconversion of stock.
The notice must include a statement of capital, as at the time immediately after the reconversion, that complies with section 201. (Amended 35 of 2018 s. 14)

If a company contravenes this section, the company, and every responsible person of the company, commit an offence, and each is liable to a fine at level 4 and, in the case of a continuing offence, to a further fine of $700 for each day during which the offence continues.

division.name: D7
division.heading: Classes of Shares and Class Rights

section.name: s176
section.heading: Application of Subdivision
section.content: This Subdivision applies to a company that has a share capital.

section.name: s177
section.heading: Rights attached to shares
section.content: In this Ordinance, a reference to the rights attached to a share in a class of shares in a company is a reference to the rights of the holder of that share as a member of the company.

section.name: s178
section.heading: Classes of shares

subsection.content: For the purposes of this Ordinance, shares are in one class if the rights attached to them are in all respects uniform.

The rights attached to shares are not to be regarded as different from those attached to other shares only because they do not carry the same rights to dividends in the 12 months immediately following their allotment.

section.name: s179
section.heading: Description of shares of different classes

subsection.leadIn: A share certificate issued by a company that has different classes of shares must contain in a prominent position a statement—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: stating that the company’s share capital is divided into different classes of shares; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: specifying the voting rights attached to shares in each class.

subsection.leadIn: If a company has a class of shares the holders of which are not entitled to vote at general meetings of the company—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the descriptive title of shares in the class must include the words “non voting” or the Chinese characters “無表決權”; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the company must ensure that those words appear legibly on any share certificate issued by the company.

subsection.content: Subsection (2) does not apply to shares that are described as preference shares or preferred shares.

If a company contravenes this section, the company, and every responsible person of the company, commit an offence, and each is liable to a fine at level 4 and, in the case of a continuing offence, to a further fine of $700 for each day during which the offence continues.

section.name: s180
section.heading: Varying class rights

subsection.leadIn: Rights attached to shares in a class of shares in a company may be varied only—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in accordance with provisions in the company’s articles for the variation of those rights; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if there are no such provisions, with the consent of holders of shares in that class given in accordance with this section.

subsection.content: Subsection (1) is without prejudice to any other restrictions on the variation of the rights.
subsection.statutoryNote:
Example—
A company could make an agreement with the holders of shares in a class that imposes restrictions on the variation of class rights.

subsection.leadIn: The consent required for the purposes of subsection (1)(b) is— (Amended 35 of 2018 s. 15)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: written consent of holders representing at least 75% of the total voting rights of holders of shares in the class; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a special resolution passed at a separate general meeting of holders of shares in the class sanctioning the variation.

subsection.leadIn: A variation takes effect—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if the consent for the variation is full consent—at the time specified in subsection (4B); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the consent for the variation is not full consent—at the time specified in subsection (4C). (Replaced 35 of 2018 s. 15)

subsection.name: 4A
subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsection (4), full consent for a variation is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: written consent of all holders representing the total voting rights of holders of shares in the class; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a resolution passed unanimously by all holders representing the total voting rights of holders of shares in the class at a separate general meeting of those holders. (Added 35 of 2018 s. 15)

subsection.name: 4B
subsection.leadIn: The time specified for the purposes of subsection (4)(a) is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the date of the full consent; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if a later date is specified for the purpose in the full consent—the later date. (Added 35 of 2018 s. 15)

subsection.name: 4C
subsection.leadIn: The time specified for the purposes of subsection (4)(b) is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if no application is made under section 182 for the variation to be disallowed—the end of the period within which applications may be made under that section; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: if an application is made under that section for the variation to be disallowed—

subparagraph.content: the time when the application is withdrawn or finally determined; or
(if there is more than one application) the time when the last of the applications is withdrawn or finally determined. (Added 35 of 2018 s. 15)

subsection.name: 4D
subsection.content: Subsection (4)(b) does not apply if the variation is disallowed. (Added 35 of 2018 s. 15)

Any amendment of a provision in a company’s articles for the variation of the rights attached to shares in a class, or the insertion of any such provision into the articles, is itself to be regarded as a variation of those rights.
Nothing in this section affects the Court’s powers under sections 673, 675 and 725.

section.name: s181
section.heading: Notifying class members of variation

subsection.content: If the rights attached to shares in any class of shares in a company are varied, the company must give written notice of the variation to each holder of shares in that class within 14 days after the date on which the variation is made.

If a company contravenes this section, the company, and every responsible person of the company, commit an offence, and each is liable to a fine at level 4 and, in the case of a continuing offence, to a further fine of $700 for each day during which the offence continues.

section.name: s182
section.heading: Disallowance or confirmation of variation by Court

subsection.content: If the rights attached to shares in any class of shares in a company are varied, holders representing at least 10% of the total voting rights of holders of shares in the class may apply to the Court to have the variation disallowed.

subsection.name: 1A
subsection.leadIn: However, the holders may not apply to the Court under subsection (1) to have the variation disallowed if the variation is made with—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: written consent of all holders representing the total voting rights of holders of shares in the class; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a resolution passed unanimously by all holders representing the total voting rights of holders of shares in the class at a separate general meeting of those holders. (Added 35 of 2018 s. 16)

subsection.content: An application must be made within 28 days after the date on which the variation is made.
An application may be made on behalf of the members entitled to apply by any one or more of them appointed in writing by all of them.

subsection.leadIn: The following persons are entitled to be heard on an application—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the applicant;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any other person who appears to the Court to be interested in the application.

subsection.content: The Court may, by order, disallow the variation if it is satisfied that the variation would unfairly prejudice the members represented by the applicant.
If the Court is not so satisfied, it must, by order, confirm the variation.

subsection.leadIn: Nothing in this section affects—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the right of a member to petition the Court under section 724; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the Court’s powers under section 725.

section.name: s183
section.heading: Delivery of order of Court to Registrar

subsection.content: If the Court makes an order under section 182 in relation to a company, the company must deliver an office copy of the order to the Registrar for registration within 15 days after it is made.

If a company contravenes this section, the company, and every responsible person of the company, commit an offence, and each is liable to a fine at level 4 and, in the case of a continuing offence, to a further fine of $700 for each day during which the offence continues.

section.name: s184
section.heading: Notifying Registrar of variation

subsection.leadIn: If the rights attached to shares in any class of shares in a company are varied, the company must deliver to the Registrar for registration, within one month after the date on which the variation takes effect—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a copy of the resolution or other document that authorized the variation; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a notice in the specified form including a statement of capital, as at the time immediately after the variation takes effect, that complies with section 201. (Amended 35 of 2018 s. 17)

subsection.content: Subsection (1)(a) does not apply if the company is required to deliver a copy of the resolution or other document to the Registrar under another provision of this Ordinance.

If a company contravenes this section, the company, and every responsible person of the company, commit an offence, and each is liable to a fine at level 4 and, in the case of a continuing offence, to a further fine of $700 for each day during which the offence continues.

section.name: s185
section.heading: Application of Subdivision
section.content: This subdivision applies to a company that does not have a share capital.

section.name: s186
section.heading: Rights of members
section.content: In this Ordinance, a reference to the rights of a class of members of a company that does not have a share capital is a reference to the rights of the members in that class in their capacity as members of the company.

section.name: s187
section.heading: Classes of members
section.content: For the purposes of this Ordinance, members of a company that does not have a share capital are in one class if the rights of the members are in all respects uniform.

section.name: s188
section.heading: Varying class rights

subsection.leadIn: Rights of a class of members of a company that does not have a share capital may be varied only—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in accordance with provisions in the company’s articles for the variation of those rights; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if there are no such provisions, with the consent of the members of that class given in accordance with this section.

subsection.content: Subsection (1) is without prejudice to any other restrictions on the variation of the rights.
subsection.statutoryNote:
Example—
A company could make an agreement with the members of a class that imposes restrictions on the variation of class rights.

subsection.leadIn: The consent required for the purposes of subsection (1)(b) is— (Amended 35 of 2018 s. 18)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: written consent of at least 75% of the members in the class; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a special resolution passed at a separate general meeting of the members in the class sanctioning the variation.

subsection.leadIn: A variation takes effect—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if the consent for the variation is full consent—at the time specified in subsection (4B); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the consent for the variation is not full consent—at the time specified in subsection (4C). (Replaced 35 of 2018 s. 18)

subsection.name: 4A
subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsection (4), full consent for a variation is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: written consent of all members in the class; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a resolution passed unanimously by all members in the class at a separate general meeting of those members. (Added 35 of 2018 s. 18)

subsection.name: 4B
subsection.leadIn: The time specified for the purposes of subsection (4)(a) is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the date of the full consent; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if a later date is specified for the purpose in the full consent—the later date. (Added 35 of 2018 s. 18)

subsection.name: 4C
subsection.leadIn: The time specified for the purposes of subsection (4)(b) is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if no application is made under section 190 for the variation to be disallowed—the end of the period within which applications may be made under that section; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: if an application is made under that section for the variation to be disallowed—

subparagraph.content: the time when the application is withdrawn or finally determined; or
(if there is more than one application) the time when the last of the applications is withdrawn or finally determined. (Added 35 of 2018 s. 18)

subsection.name: 4D
subsection.content: Subsection (4)(b) does not apply if the variation is disallowed. (Added 35 of 2018 s. 18)

Any amendment of a provision in a company’s articles for the variation of the rights of a class of members, or the insertion of any such provision into the articles, is itself to be regarded as a variation of those rights.
Nothing in this section affects the Court’s powers under sections 673, 675 and 725.

section.name: s189
section.heading: Notifying class members of variation

subsection.content: If the rights of any class of members of a company that does not have a share capital are varied, the company must give written notice of the variation to each member in that class within 14 days after the date on which the variation is made.

If a company contravenes this section, the company, and every responsible person of the company, commit an offence, and each is liable to a fine at level 4 and, in the case of a continuing offence, to a further fine of $700 for each day during which the offence continues.

section.name: s190
section.heading: Disallowance or confirmation of variation by Court

subsection.content: If the rights of any class of members of a company that does not have a share capital are varied, members representing at least 10% of the members in the class may apply to the Court to have the variation disallowed.

subsection.name: 1A
subsection.leadIn: However, the members may not apply to the Court under subsection (1) to have the variation disallowed if the variation is made with—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: written consent of all members in the class; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a resolution passed unanimously by all members in the class at a separate general meeting of those members. (Added 35 of 2018 s. 19)

subsection.content: An application must be made within 28 days after the date on which the variation is made.
An application may be made on behalf of the members entitled to apply by any one or more of them appointed in writing by all of them.

subsection.leadIn: The following persons are entitled to be heard on an application—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the applicant;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any other person who appears to the Court to be interested in the application.

subsection.content: The Court may, by order, disallow the variation if it is satisfied that the variation would unfairly prejudice the members represented by the applicant.
If the Court is not so satisfied, it must, by order, confirm the variation.

subsection.leadIn: Nothing in this section affects—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the right of a member to petition the Court under section 724; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the Court’s powers under section 725.

section.name: s191
section.heading: Delivery of order of Court to Registrar

subsection.content: If the Court makes an order under section 190 in relation to a company, the company must deliver an office copy of the order to the Registrar for registration within 15 days after it is made.

If a company contravenes this section, the company, and every responsible person of the company, commit an offence, and each is liable to a fine at level 4 and, in the case of a continuing offence, to a further fine of $700 for each day during which the offence continues.

section.name: s192
section.heading: Notifying Registrar of variation

subsection.leadIn: If the rights of any class of members of a company that does not have a share capital are varied, the company must deliver to the Registrar for registration, within one month after the date on which the variation takes effect—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a copy of the resolution or other document that authorized the variation; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a notice in the specified form.

subsection.content: Subsection (1)(a) does not apply if the company is required to deliver a copy of the resolution or other document to the Registrar under another provision of this Ordinance.

If a company contravenes this section, the company, and every responsible person of the company, commit an offence, and each is liable to a fine at level 4 and, in the case of a continuing offence, to a further fine of $700 for each day during which the offence continues.

section.name: s193
section.heading: Variation includes abrogation
section.content: In this Division and (unless the context otherwise requires) in any provision in a company’s articles for the variation of class rights, a reference to a variation of those rights includes an abrogation of those rights.

section.name: s194
section.heading: Interpretation

subsection.leadIn: In this Division—
subsection.def: arrangement (安排) means any agreement, scheme or arrangement;
company (公司), except in reference to an issuing company, includes any body corporate;

equity share capital (權益股本) means a company’s issued share capital excluding any part of that capital that, neither as respects dividends nor as respects capital, carries any right to participate beyond a specified amount in a distribution;
equity shares (權益股份) means shares comprised in a company’s equity share capital;
issuing company (發行公司) means a company that issues shares;
non-equity shares (非權益股份) means shares in a company other than equity shares;
transfer (轉讓) of shares includes transfer of a right to be included in the company’s register of members in respect of the shares.

subsection.leadIn: In this Division—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a reference to the acquisition by a company of shares includes the acquisition of shares by a nominee of the company;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a reference to the issue or transfer of shares to a company includes the issue or transfer of shares to a nominee of the company;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a reference to the transfer of shares by a company includes the transfer of shares by a nominee of the company.

section.name: s195
section.heading: Group reconstruction relief

subsection.leadIn: This section applies if an issuing company—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.def: is a wholly owned subsidiary of another company (the holding company); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: issues shares—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: to the holding company; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.text: to another wholly owned subsidiary of the holding company,

paragraph.continued: in consideration for the transfer to the issuing company of non-cash assets of a company (the transferor company) that is a member of the group of companies that comprises the holding company and all its wholly owned subsidiaries.

subsection.content: Any excess of the value of the assets transferred over their net base value may be disregarded when recording as share capital of the issuing company the amount of consideration for the issue by the issuing company of its shares. Consequently, the minimum amount of consideration required to be recorded as share capital of the issuing company in respect of the shares issued for the transfer is the net base value of the assets transferred.

The net base value of the assets transferred is the amount by which the base value of the assets transferred exceeds the base value of any liabilities of the transferor company assumed by the issuing company as consideration for the assets transferred.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of this section—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: the base value of assets transferred is the lesser of—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the cost of those assets to the transferor company;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the amount at which those assets are stated in the transferor company’s accounting records immediately before the transfer;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the base value of liabilities assumed is the amount at which they are stated in the transferor company’s accounting records immediately before the transfer.

section.name: s196
section.heading: Merger relief

subsection.leadIn: This section applies if an issuing company has secured at least a 90% equity holding in another company under an arrangement providing for the issue of equity shares in the issuing company on terms that the consideration for the shares issued is to be provided—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: by the issue or transfer to the issuing company of equity shares in the other company; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: by the cancellation of any equity shares in the other company not held by the issuing company.

subsection.content: Any excess of the value of the equity shares acquired or cancelled under the arrangement over the subscribed capital of the other company attributable to those shares may be disregarded when recording as share capital of the issuing company the amount of consideration for the issue by the issuing company of its shares. Consequently, the minimum amount of consideration required to be recorded as share capital of the issuing company in respect of the shares issued under the arrangement is the subscribed capital of the other company attributable to the equity shares acquired or cancelled.

subsection.leadIn: If the arrangement also provides for the issue of any shares in the issuing company on terms that the consideration for those shares is to be provided—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: by the issue or transfer to the issuing company of non-equity shares in the other company; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: by the cancellation of any non-equity shares in the other company not held by the issuing company,

subsection.continued: any excess of the value of the non-equity shares acquired or cancelled under the arrangement over the subscribed capital of the other company attributable to those shares may be disregarded when recording as share capital of the issuing company the amount of consideration for the issue by the issuing company of its shares.

subsection.content: This section does not apply in a case falling within section 195.

section.name: s197
section.heading: Merger relief: meaning of 90% equity holding

subsection.def: This section has effect in determining, for the purposes of section 196, whether a company (company A) has secured at least a 90% equity holding in another company (company B) under an arrangement mentioned in section 196(1).

subsection.content: Company A has secured at least a 90% equity holding in company B if, in consequence of an acquisition or cancellation of equity shares in company B under that arrangement, company A holds in aggregate 90% or more of the equity shares in company B (whether or not all or any of the equity shares in company B held by company A were acquired under that arrangement).

If the equity shares in company B are divided into different classes of shares, company A is not regarded as having secured at least a 90% equity holding in company B unless the requirements of subsection (2) are met in relation to each of those classes of shares taken separately.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of this section, the following shares are regarded as held by company A—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: shares held by a company that is company A’s holding company or subsidiary;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: shares held by a subsidiary of company A’s holding company; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: shares held by nominees of company A or of a company referred to in paragraph (a) or (b).

section.name: s198
section.heading: Relief may be reflected in company’s statement of financial position
section.content: An amount corresponding to the amount that, because of this Subdivision, is not required to be recorded as a company’s share capital may also be disregarded in determining the amount at which any shares or other consideration provided for the shares issued is to be included in the company’s statement of financial position.

section.name: s199
section.heading: Regulations

subsection.content: The Financial Secretary may make regulations for restricting or otherwise modifying the relief provided by this Subdivision.
Regulations made under this section are subject to the approval of the Legislative Council.

section.name: s200
section.heading: Provision for different amounts to be paid on shares
section.leadIn: If authorized by its articles to do so, a company may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: make arrangements on the issue of shares for a difference between the shareholders in the amounts and times of payment of calls on their shares;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: accept from any member the whole or part of the amount remaining unpaid on any shares held by the member, although no part of that amount has been called up; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: pay a dividend in proportion to the amount paid up on each share where a larger amount is paid up on some shares than on others.

section.name: s201
section.heading: Statement of capital

subsection.content: This section applies if a provision of this Part or Part 5 requires a statement of capital to be included in a return or notice delivered to the Registrar for registration.

subsection.leadIn: A statement of capital must state—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the total number of issued shares in the company;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the amount paid up or regarded as paid up and the amount (if any) remaining unpaid or regarded as remaining unpaid on the total number of issued shares in the company; and (Amended 35 of 2018 s. 20)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the total amount of the company’s issued share capital. (Amended 35 of 2018 s. 20)

subsection.name: 2A
subsection.leadIn: If the issued share capital is divided into different classes of shares, a statement of capital must also state, for each class of shares—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the particulars specified in subsection (3);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the total number of issued shares in the class;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the amount paid up or regarded as paid up, and the amount (if any) remaining unpaid or regarded as remaining unpaid, on the total number of issued shares in the class; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the total amount of issued share capital of the class. (Added 35 of 2018 s. 20)

subsection.leadIn: The particulars are—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: particulars of any voting rights attached to shares in the class, including rights that arise only in certain circumstances;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: particulars of any rights attached to shares in the class, as respects dividends, to participate in a distribution;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: particulars of any rights attached to shares in the class, as respects capital, to participate in a distribution (including on a winding up); and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: whether or not shares in the class are redeemable shares.

section.name: s202
section.heading: Notice of paid up capital

subsection.content: An official document of a company that states the company’s issued capital must also state no less prominently the company’s paid up capital.

If a company issues, circulates or distributes an official document in Hong Kong that does not comply with subsection (1), the company, and every responsible person of the company, commit an offence, and each is liable to a fine at level 3.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: official document (正式文件) of a company, means a notice, circular, advertisement or other official publication of the company.

part.name: P5
part.heading: Transactions in relation to Share Capital

section.name: s203
section.heading: Interpretation

subsection.leadIn: In this Part—

def.name: Commission
def.leadIn: Commission (監察機關) means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: subject to paragraphs (b) and (c), the Securities and Futures Commission referred to in section 3(1) of the Securities and Futures Ordinance (Cap. 571);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if any relevant transfer order made under section 25 of that Ordinance is in force, the recognized exchange company concerned or both the Securities and Futures Commission and the recognized exchange company concerned, in accordance with the provisions of that order; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: if any relevant transfer order made under section 68 of that Ordinance is in force, the recognized exchange controller concerned or both the Securities and Futures Commission and the recognized exchange controller concerned, in accordance with the provisions of that order;

def.name: ContingentBuybackContract
def.leadIn: contingent buy-back contract (待確定回購合約) means a contract entered into by a company relating to any of its shares—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: that is not a contract to buy back those shares; but

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: under which the company may (subject to any conditions) become entitled or obliged to buy back those shares;

subsection.def: distributable profits (可分派利潤), in relation to the making of a payment by a company, means those profits out of which the company could lawfully make a distribution equal in value to the payment;
recognized exchange controller (認可控制人) has the meaning given by section 1 of Part 1 of Schedule 1 to the Securities and Futures Ordinance (Cap. 571);
specified Chinese language newspaper (指明中文報章) means a Chinese language newspaper that is specified under subsection (2);
specified English language newspaper (指明英文報章) means an English language newspaper that is specified under subsection (2).

subsection.content: The Chief Secretary for Administration may specify Chinese language newspapers and English language newspapers for the purposes of this Part and must publish a list of the specified newspapers in the Gazette.

section.name: s204
section.heading: Application of Division
section.leadIn: This Division has effect for the following transactions—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a reduction of share capital by special resolution supported by a solvency statement under Subdivision 2 of Division 3;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a payment out of capital in respect of a share redemption or buy-back under Division 4;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the giving of financial assistance by a company under Subdivision 4 of Division 5.

section.name: s205
section.heading: Solvency test
section.leadIn: A company satisfies the solvency test in relation to a transaction if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: immediately after the transaction there will be no ground on which the company could be found to be unable to pay its debts; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: either—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: if it is intended to commence the winding up of the company within 12 months after the date of the transaction, the company will be able to pay its debts in full within 12 months after the commencement of the winding up; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: in any other case, the company will be able to pay its debts as they become due during the period of 12 months immediately following the date of the transaction.

section.name: s206
section.heading: Solvency statement

subsection.content: A solvency statement in relation to a transaction is a statement that each of the directors making it has formed the opinion that the company satisfies the solvency test in relation to the transaction.

subsection.leadIn: In forming an opinion for the purpose of making a solvency statement, a director must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: inquire into the company’s state of affairs and prospects; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: take into account all the liabilities of the company (including contingent and prospective liabilities).

subsection.leadIn: A solvency statement—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: must be in the specified form;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: must state—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the date on which it is made; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the name of each director making it; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: must be signed by each director making it.

subsection.content: Subsection (3)(a) does not apply to a solvency statement made for the purposes of the giving of financial assistance by a company under Subdivision 4 of Division 5.

section.name: s207
section.heading: Offences regarding solvency statement
section.leadIn: A director who makes a solvency statement without having reasonable grounds for the opinion expressed in it commits an offence and is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on conviction on indictment to a fine of $150,000 and to imprisonment for 2 years; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on summary conviction to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

section.name: s208
section.heading: Power to modify solvency test by regulation

subsection.leadIn: The Chief Executive in Council may make regulations—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: modifying the solvency test or its application to any transaction or class of transactions; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: modifying the matters that a director is required to take into account in forming an opinion for the purpose of making a solvency statement.

subsection.content: Regulations made under this section are subject to the approval of the Legislative Council.

section.name: s209
section.heading: Application of Division
section.leadIn: This Division applies to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a company limited by shares; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a company limited by guarantee having a share capital that was formed as, or became, such a company under a former Companies Ordinance before 13 February 2004.

section.name: s210
section.heading: Permitted reductions of share capital

subsection.content: A company may, in accordance with the procedure specified in section 211, reduce its share capital under this Division in any way.

paragraph.content: A company may extinguish or reduce the liability on any of its shares in respect of share capital not paid up.

paragraph.leadIn: A company may, either with or without extinguishing or reducing liability on any of its shares—

subparagraph.name: a
subparagraph.content: cancel any paid-up share capital that is lost or unrepresented by available assets; or

subparagraph.name: b
subparagraph.content: repay any paid-up share capital in excess of the company’s wants.

subsection.content: However, a company must not reduce its share capital if, as a result of the reduction, there would no longer be any member of the company holding shares other than redeemable shares.
This Division is subject to any provision of a company’s articles that prohibits or restricts the reduction of the company’s share capital.

section.name: s211
section.heading: Procedure for a company to reduce its share capital
section.leadIn: The procedure for a company to reduce its share capital under this Division is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: by special resolution supported by a solvency statement under Subdivision 2; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: by special resolution confirmed by the Court under Subdivision 3.

section.name: s212
section.heading: Offence if share capital is reduced in contravention of Division

subsection.leadIn: If a company reduces its share capital in contravention of this Division, the company, and every responsible person of the company, commit an offence and each is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on conviction on indictment to a fine of $1,250,000 and to imprisonment for 5 years; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on summary conviction to a fine of $150,000 and to imprisonment for 12 months.

subsection.content: An offence is not committed under this section in relation to a reduction of share capital by a company only because one or more directors of the company commit an offence under section 207 in making a solvency statement for the purposes of the reduction of share capital.

An offence is not committed under this section if the reduction of share capital occurs as a result of a share redemption or buy-back in accordance with Division 4 or as otherwise provided in this Ordinance.

section.name: s213
section.heading: Liability of members following reduction of share capital

subsection.leadIn: If a company’s share capital is reduced under this Division, a past or present member of the company is not liable in respect of a share to a call or contribution exceeding in amount the difference (if any) between—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the issue price of the share; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the aggregate of the amount paid up on the share (if any) and the amount reduced on the share.

subsection.content: Subsection (1) is subject to section 232.
Nothing in this section affects the rights of the contributories among themselves.

section.name: s214
section.heading: Reserves arising from reductions of share capital

subsection.content: If a company reduces its share capital in accordance with this Division, a reserve arising from the reduction is to be regarded for the purposes of Part 6 as realized profit.

subsection.leadIn: Subsection (1) is subject to anything to the contrary in—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an order of, or undertaking given to, the Court;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the resolution for, or any other resolution relevant to, the reduction of share capital; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the company’s articles.

subdivision.name: SD2
subdivision.heading: Reduction of Share Capital by Special Resolution Supported by Solvency Statement

section.name: s215
section.heading: Special resolution for reduction of share capital

subsection.content: A company may reduce its share capital by special resolution in accordance with this Subdivision.
The special resolution and the reduction of share capital take effect when the return under section 224 or 225 in relation to the reduction is registered by the Registrar.

section.name: s216
section.heading: Solvency statement for reduction of share capital

subsection.content: All directors of the company must make a solvency statement that complies with Division 2 in relation to the reduction of share capital.
The special resolution for reduction of share capital must be passed within 15 days after the date of the solvency statement.

If the special resolution is proposed as a written resolution, a copy of the solvency statement must be sent to every member of the company at or before the time when the proposed resolution is sent to them.
If the special resolution is proposed at a meeting, a copy of the solvency statement must be made available for inspection by members at the meeting.
The special resolution is not effective if subsection (3) or (4) (as applicable) is not complied with.

section.name: s217
section.heading: Special resolution: exercise of voting rights

subsection.content: If the special resolution for reduction of share capital is proposed as a written resolution, a member of the company holding shares to which the resolution relates is not an eligible member for the purposes of Subdivision 2 of Division 1 of Part 12 (written resolution) in respect of those shares.

subsection.leadIn: If the special resolution is proposed at a meeting, the resolution is not effective if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any member of the company holding shares to which the resolution relates exercises the voting rights carried by any of those shares; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the resolution would not have been passed if the member had not done so.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsection (2)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a member holding shares to which the resolution relates is to be regarded as exercising the voting rights carried by those shares not only if the member votes in respect of them on a poll on the question whether the resolution should be passed but also if the member votes on the resolution otherwise than on a poll;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any member of the company may demand a poll on that question; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a vote or a demand for a poll by a person as proxy for a member is the same as a vote or a demand by the member.

subsection.content: The special resolution is not effective if a demand for a poll referred to in subsection (3)(b) is refused.
This section does not apply in the case of a reduction of share capital that applies equally to all issued shares in the company.

section.name: s218
section.heading: Public notice of reduction of share capital

subsection.leadIn: If a special resolution for reduction of share capital is passed, the company must, on or before the date specified in subsection (2), publish a notice in the Gazette—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: stating that the company has approved a reduction of share capital;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: specifying the amount of share capital to be reduced and the date of the special resolution;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: stating where the special resolution and solvency statement are available for inspection; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: stating that a member of the company who did not consent to or vote in favour of the special resolution or a creditor of the company may, within 5 weeks after the date of the special resolution, apply to the Court under section 220 for cancellation of the special resolution.

subsection.leadIn: The date is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a date that falls on the last working day of the week after the week in which the special resolution is passed; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the period between the date in paragraph (a) and the date on which the special resolution is passed is less than 4 business days (both dates exclusive), a date that falls on the last working day of the week next following.

The special resolution is passed on 2 February of a year (Thursday). Apart from Saturdays and Sundays, all other dates in February of that year are business days. The date that falls on the last working day of the week after the week in which the special resolution is passed is 10 February (Friday) of that year. There are 5 business days between 2 February and 10 February. Therefore, the relevant notice must be published in the Gazette on or before 10 February (Friday) of that year.

The special resolution is passed on 30 March of a year (Friday). Both 4 April (Wednesday) and 6 April (Friday) of that year are general holidays. 2 April (Monday), 3 April (Tuesday), 5 April (Thursday) and 13 April (Friday) of that year are business days. The date that falls on the last working day of the week after the week in which the special resolution is passed is 5 April (Thursday). There are only 2 business days between 30 March and 5 April. Therefore, the relevant notice must be published in the Gazette on or before the last working day of the week next following, which is 13 April (Friday) of that year.

subsection.leadIn: Before the end of the week after the week in which the special resolution for reduction of share capital is passed, the company must also—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: publish a notice to the same effect as the notice under subsection (1) in at least one specified Chinese language newspaper and at least one specified English language newspaper; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: give written notice to that effect to each of its creditors.

subsection.content: If the company contravenes subsection (1) or (3), the company, and every responsible person of the company, commit an offence, and each is liable to a fine at level 3.

subsection.leadIn: The company must deliver to the Registrar for registration a copy of the solvency statement no later than the day on which the company—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: publishes the notice under subsection (1); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if earlier, first publishes the notice or gives notice to creditors under subsection (3).

subsection.content: If the company contravenes subsection (5), the company, and every responsible person of the company, commit an offence, and each is liable to a fine at level 5 and, in the case of a continuing offence, to a further fine of $1,000 for each day during which the offence continues.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsection (2)—

def.name: BusinessDay
def.leadIn: business day (辦公日) means a day that is not—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a general holiday;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a Saturday; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a black rainstorm warning day or gale warning day as defined by section 71(2) of the Interpretation and General Clauses Ordinance (Cap. 1);

def.name: WorkingDay
def.leadIn: working day (工作日) means a day that is not—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a general holiday; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a Saturday.

section.name: s219
section.heading: Inspection of special resolution and solvency statement

subsection.leadIn: The company must ensure that the special resolution for reduction of share capital and the solvency statement made in relation to it are kept at its registered office or at a place prescribed by regulations made under section 657 for the period—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: beginning on the day on which the company—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: publishes the notice under section 218(1); or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: if earlier, first publishes the notice or gives notice to creditors under section 218(3); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: ending 5 weeks after the date of the special resolution.

subsection.content: The company must permit a member or creditor of the company to inspect the special resolution and solvency statement without charge during business hours in that period.

If the company contravenes subsection (1) or (2), the company, and every responsible person of the company, commit an offence, and each is liable to a fine at level 5 and, in the case of a continuing offence, to a further fine of $1,000 for each day during which the offence continues.
If the company contravenes subsection (2), the Court may by order require the company to permit an immediate inspection.

section.name: s220
section.heading: Application to Court by members or creditors

subsection.content: Subject to subsection (2), a member or creditor of the company may apply to the Court, within 5 weeks after the date of the special resolution for reduction of share capital, for cancellation of the resolution.
A member who consented to or voted in favour of the special resolution is not entitled to apply.
An application may be made on behalf of the persons entitled to apply by any one or more of them appointed in writing by all of them.

subsection.leadIn: If an application is made under this section—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the applicant must, as soon as possible, serve the application on the company; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the company must give the Registrar notice in the specified form of the application within 7 days after the day on which the application is served on the company.

subsection.content: If the company contravenes subsection (4)(b), the company, and every responsible person of the company, commit an offence, and each is liable to a fine at level 3 and, in the case of a continuing offence, to a further fine of $300 for each day during which the offence continues.

section.name: s221
section.heading: Power of Court to adjourn proceedings

subsection.content: The Court may adjourn proceedings on an application under section 220 so that an arrangement may be made to its satisfaction for the protection of the interests of dissentient members or dissentient creditors.
The Court may give any directions and make any orders it thinks expedient for facilitating or carrying into effect any such arrangement.

section.name: s222
section.heading: Power of Court to confirm or cancel special resolution

subsection.content: On an application under section 220, the Court must make an order confirming or cancelling the special resolution for reduction of share capital, and may do so on any terms and conditions it thinks fit.

subsection.leadIn: If the Court confirms the special resolution, it may by order alter or extend any date or period of time specified—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the special resolution; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in any provision of this Division applying to the special resolution or the reduction of share capital.

subsection.leadIn: If the Court thinks fit, the order may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: provide for the company to buy back the shares of any of its members and for the reduction accordingly of the company’s share capital;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: provide for the protection of the interests of members or creditors of the company;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: make any alteration to the company’s articles that may be required as a consequence;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: require the company not to make any, or any specified, alteration to its articles.

subsection.content: If the order of the Court requires the company not to make any, or any specified, alteration to its articles, the company does not have power to make any such alteration without leave of the Court.
The powers of the Court under this section do not limit its powers under section 221.

section.name: s223
section.heading: Company to deliver copy of order of Court to Registrar

subsection.content: Within 15 days after the making of an order by the Court under section 222, or within any longer period ordered by the Court, the company must deliver an office copy of the order to the Registrar for registration.

If the company contravenes subsection (1), the company, and every responsible person of the company, commit an offence, and each is liable to a fine at level 3 and, in the case of a continuing offence, to a further fine of $300 for each day during which the offence continues.

section.name: s224
section.heading: Registration of return if no application to Court

subsection.leadIn: If—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: no application is made under section 220 in respect of the special resolution for reduction of share capital; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the company delivers a return that complies with subsection (2) to the Registrar no earlier than 5 weeks and no later than 7 weeks after the date of the special resolution,

subsection.continued: the Registrar must register the return.
subsection.statutoryNote:
Note—
Under section 215(2), the special resolution and the reduction of share capital take effect when the return is registered by the Registrar.

subsection.leadIn: The return—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: must be in the specified form;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: must contain particulars of the reduction of share capital; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: must include a statement of capital, as at the time immediately after the reduction of share capital, that complies with section 201.

section.name: s225
section.heading: Registration of return if application to Court

subsection.leadIn: If—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an application is made under section 220 in respect of the special resolution for reduction of share capital;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: either—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the Court makes an order under section 222 confirming the special resolution; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the proceedings on the application are ended without determination by the Court (for example, by the withdrawal of the application); and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: the company delivers to the Registrar a return that complies with subsection (2)—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: within 15 days after the making of the order, or within any longer period ordered by the Court; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: within 15 days after the proceedings are ended without determination by the Court or, if there are more than one such proceedings, the last of them are so ended,

subsection.continued: the Registrar must register the return.
subsection.statutoryNote:
Note—
Under section 215(2), the special resolution and the reduction of share capital take effect when the return is registered by the Registrar.

subsection.leadIn: The return—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: must be in the specified form;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: must contain particulars of the reduction of share capital; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: must include a statement of capital, as at the time immediately after the reduction of share capital, that complies with section 201.

subdivision.name: SD3
subdivision.heading: Reduction of Share Capital Confirmed by Court

section.name: s226
section.heading: Special resolution and application to Court for confirmation of reduction of share capital

subsection.content: A company may pass a special resolution for reduction of share capital under this Subdivision and apply by petition to the Court for an order confirming the reduction.

subsection.leadIn: Unless the Court directs otherwise, section 227 (creditors entitled to object to reduction of share capital) applies if the proposed reduction of share capital involves either—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the diminution of liability in respect of unpaid share capital; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the payment to a shareholder of any paid-up share capital.

subsection.content: The Court may direct that section 227 is not to apply to any class or classes of creditors if the Court thinks it proper to do so, having regard to any special circumstances of the case.
The Court may direct that section 227 is to apply in any other case.

section.name: s227
section.heading: Creditors entitled to object to reduction of share capital

subsection.content: If this section applies (see section 226(2) and (4)), a creditor of the company is entitled to object to the reduction of share capital if the creditor is entitled, at the date fixed by the Court, to any debt or claim that would be admissible in proof against the company if the company were to commence being wound up on that date.
The Court must settle a list of creditors entitled to object.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsection (2), the Court—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: must ascertain, as far as possible without requiring an application from any creditor, the names of those creditors and the nature and amount of their debts or claims; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: may publish a notice fixing a period within which, or a date by which, creditors not on the list are to claim to be entered on the list or are to be excluded from the right of objecting.

subsection.content: If a creditor on the list whose debt or claim is not discharged or has not determined does not consent to the reduction, the Court may, if it thinks fit, dispense with the consent of the creditor on the company securing payment of the debt or claim.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsection (4), the debt or claim must be secured by appropriating (as the Court directs) the following amount—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if the company admits the full amount of the debt or claim or, though not admitting it, is willing to provide for it, the full amount of the debt or claim; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the company does not admit, and is not willing to provide for, the full amount of the debt or claim, or if the amount is contingent or not ascertained, an amount fixed by the Court after an inquiry and adjudication as if the company were being wound up by the Court.

section.name: s228
section.heading: Offence in connection with creditors list

subsection.leadIn: An officer of a company—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: must not intentionally or recklessly—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: conceal the name of a creditor entitled to object to the reduction of share capital; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: misrepresent the nature or amount of the debt or claim of a creditor; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: must not be knowingly concerned in any such concealment or misrepresentation.

subsection.leadIn: A person who contravenes subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on conviction on indictment to a fine of $150,000 and to imprisonment for 2 years; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on summary conviction to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

section.name: s229
section.heading: Order of Court confirming reduction of share capital

subsection.content: On an application by petition under section 226, the Court may make an order confirming the reduction of share capital on any terms and conditions it thinks fit.

subsection.leadIn: The Court must not confirm the reduction of share capital unless it is satisfied, with respect to every creditor of the company who is entitled to object to the reduction of share capital under section 227, that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the creditor’s consent has been obtained; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the creditor’s debt or claim has been discharged, has determined or has been secured.

section.name: s230
section.heading: Registration of order, minute and return

subsection.leadIn: If—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Court makes an order under section 229 confirming the reduction of share capital; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: within 15 days after the making of the order, or within any longer period ordered by the Court, the company delivers to the Registrar—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: an office copy of the order;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: a minute that complies with subsection (2) and that is approved by the Court; and

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: a return that complies with subsection (3),

subsection.continued: the Registrar must register the order, minute and return.

subsection.leadIn: The minute must state, with respect to the company’s share capital as altered by the order—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the amount of the share capital;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the total number of issued shares in the company;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the amount of each share; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the amount paid up and the amount (if any) remaining unpaid on each share.

subsection.leadIn: The return—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: must be in the specified form;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: must contain particulars of the reduction of share capital (by reference to the order or minute, or otherwise); and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: must include a statement of capital, as at the time immediately after the reduction of share capital, that complies with section 201.

subsection.content: The special resolution, as confirmed by the order, takes effect on registration of the order, minute and return by the Registrar.
Notice of the registration must be published in the manner directed by the Court.

section.name: s231
section.heading: Certification of registration

subsection.content: The Registrar must certify the registration of an order, minute and return under section 230.
The certificate must be signed by the Registrar.

subsection.leadIn: The certificate is conclusive evidence—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: that the requirements of this Ordinance for the reduction of share capital have been complied with; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: that the company’s share capital is as stated in the minute.

section.name: s232
section.heading: Liability to creditors omitted from list of creditors

subsection.leadIn: This section applies to a reduction of share capital confirmed by the Court under section 229 if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: a creditor entitled to object to the reduction of share capital was not entered on the list of creditors because the creditor was not aware—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: of the proceedings for reduction of share capital; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: of their nature or effect with respect to the creditor’s debt or claim; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: after the reduction of share capital the company is unable to pay the debt or claim.

subsection.content: A person who was a member of the company on the date of registration of the order confirming the special resolution for the reduction is liable to contribute for the payment of the debt or claim an amount not exceeding the amount that the person would have been liable to contribute if the company had commenced to be wound up on the day before that date.

subsection.leadIn: If the company is wound up, the Court, on application by the creditor and proof of the creditor’s lack of awareness referred to in subsection (1)(a), may, if it thinks fit—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: settle a list of persons liable to contribute under this section; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: make and enforce calls and orders on them as if they were ordinary contributories in a winding up.

subsection.content: Nothing in this section affects the rights of the contributories among themselves.

section.name: s233
section.heading: Application of Division
section.leadIn: This Division applies to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a company limited by shares; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a company limited by guarantee having a share capital that was formed as, or became, such a company under a former Companies Ordinance before 13 February 2004.

section.name: s234
section.heading: Issue of redeemable shares

subsection.content: Subject to subsections (2) and (3), a company may issue redeemable shares.
A company’s articles may prohibit or restrict the issue of redeemable shares.
A company must not issue redeemable shares at a time when there are no issued shares in the company other than redeemable shares.

section.name: s235
section.heading: Terms, conditions and manner of redemption

subsection.leadIn: The directors of a company may determine the terms, conditions and manner of redemption of shares if they are authorized to do so—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: by the company’s articles; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: by resolution of the company.

subsection.content: A resolution under subsection (1)(b) may be an ordinary resolution even if it amends the company’s articles.

subsection.leadIn: If the directors are authorized under subsection (1) to determine the terms, conditions and manner of redemption of shares—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: they must do so before the shares are allotted; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any obligation of the company to state in a statement of capital the rights attached to the shares extends to the terms, conditions and manner of redemption.

subsection.content: If the directors are not authorized under subsection (1), the terms, conditions and manner of redemption of shares must be stated in the company’s articles.

section.name: s236
section.heading: General power of company to buy back its own shares

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsections (2) and (3) and Subdivision 6, a company may buy back its own shares in accordance with—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: for a listed company, Subdivision 4;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: for an unlisted company, Subdivision 5.

subsection.content: A company’s articles may prohibit or restrict a buy-back by the company of its own shares.
A company must not buy back its own shares if, as a result of the buy-back, there would no longer be any member of the company holding shares other than redeemable shares.
A buy-back that contravenes subsection (3) is void.

section.name: s237
section.heading: Retention and inspection of share buy-back contracts

subsection.leadIn: This section applies to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a listed company that enters into a contract for the buy-back of its own shares that is authorized under section 240; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: an unlisted company that—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: under an authorization under section 244, enters into a contract for the buy-back of its own shares;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: under an authorization under section 247, agrees to a variation of a contract for the buy-back of its own shares;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: under an authorization under section 251, agrees to release its rights under a contract for the buy-back of its own shares; or

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: under an authorization under section 254, agrees to a variation of an agreement to release its rights under a contract for the buy-back of its own shares.

subsection.leadIn: The company must keep at its registered office or at a place prescribed by regulations made under section 657—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a copy of the contract or agreement if it is in writing; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if not, a memorandum of its terms.

subsection.content: The copy or memorandum must be kept from the conclusion of the contract or agreement until the end of the period of 10 years beginning on the day on which the buy-back of all the shares under the contract is completed or the day on which the contract otherwise terminates.

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (5), the company must make the copy or memorandum available during business hours for inspection without charge by—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a member of the company; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any other person, in the case of a listed company.

subsection.content: The company may, by resolution, impose reasonable restrictions on the making available of the copy or memorandum for inspection, as long as not less than 2 hours per day are allowed for inspection.

If a company contravenes subsection (2) or (3), or if an inspection required under subsection (4) is refused, the company, and every responsible person of the company, commit an offence, and each is liable to a fine at level 5 and, in the case of a continuing offence, to a further fine of $1,000 for each day during which the offence continues.
In the case of a refusal of an inspection required under subsection (4), the Court may by order require the company to permit an immediate inspection.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: contract (合約) includes a contingent buy-back contract.

section.name: s238
section.heading: Share buy-back under general offer

subsection.content: A listed company may buy back its own shares under a general offer that is authorized in advance by resolution of the company.

subsection.leadIn: The company must include with the notice of the proposed resolution—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a copy of the document containing the proposed general offer; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a statement, signed by the directors of the company, containing information that would enable a reasonable person to form a valid and justifiable opinion as to the merits of the offer.

subsection.leadIn: If, under the proposed general offer, a member of the company may be compelled to dispose of the member’s shares under Division 5 of Part 13 (compulsory acquisition after general offer for share buy-back)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the company must appoint an independent investment adviser to advise members who may be affected by the compulsory disposal on the merits of the offer; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the resolution authorizing the offer must be a special resolution on which no non-tendering member votes.

subsection.leadIn: A person is eligible for appointment as an investment adviser under subsection (3)(a) only if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the person is a corporation licensed to carry on, or an authorized financial institution registered for carrying on, a business in advising on securities or advising on corporate finance under Part V of the Securities and Futures Ordinance (Cap. 571); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the person is neither—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: a member, officer, shadow director or employee of the company making the general offer or of an associated company of that company; nor

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: an associated company of the company making the general offer.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of a special resolution referred to in subsection (3)(b)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a non-tendering member is to be regarded as voting not only if the non-tendering member votes on a poll on the question whether the resolution should be passed but also if the non-tendering member votes on the resolution otherwise than on a poll;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any member of the company may demand a poll on that question; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a vote or a demand for a poll by a person as proxy for a member is the same as a vote or a demand by the member.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: general offer (公開要約) has the meaning given by section 707;
non-tendering member (不售股成員) has the meaning given by section 705.

section.name: s239
section.heading: Share buy-back on recognized stock market or approved stock exchange

subsection.content: A listed company may buy back its own shares on a recognized stock market or on an approved stock exchange if the buy-back is authorized in advance by resolution of the company.
The company must include a memorandum of the terms of the proposed buy-back with the notice of the proposed resolution.

A resolution authorizing a buy-back under this section is valid for the period expiring on the date of the next annual general meeting of the company, and that period may be extended by the company at that annual general meeting until the date of the following annual general meeting.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—

def.name: ApprovedStockExchange
def.leadIn: approved stock exchange (核准證券交易所) means a stock exchange approved for the purposes of this section by notice published in the Gazette by—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Commission; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the recognized exchange company that operates the recognized stock market on which the shares concerned are listed.

section.name: s240
section.heading: Share buy-back otherwise than under section 238 or 239

subsection.content: A listed company may buy back its own shares otherwise than under section 238 or 239 if the contract for buy-back of the shares is authorized in advance by special resolution.
A contract may take the form of a contingent buy-back contract.

subsection.leadIn: The company must include with the notice of the proposed special resolution—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a copy of the proposed contract or, if it is not in writing, a memorandum of its terms; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a statement, signed by the directors of the company, after having made due and diligent inquiry of the members of the company holding the shares to which the proposed contract relates, containing information that would enable a reasonable person to form a valid and justifiable opinion as to the merits of the contract.

subsection.leadIn: A special resolution under this section is not effective if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any member of the company holding shares to which the resolution relates exercises the voting rights carried by any of those shares; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the resolution would not have been passed if the member had not done so.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsection (4)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a member holding shares to which the resolution relates is to be regarded as exercising the voting rights carried by those shares not only if the member votes in respect of them on a poll on the question whether the resolution should be passed but also if the member votes on the resolution otherwise than on a poll;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any member of the company may demand a poll on that question; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a vote or a demand for a poll by a person as proxy for a member is the same as a vote or a demand by the member.

subsection.content: A special resolution under this section is not effective if a demand for a poll referred to in subsection (5)(b) is refused.

section.name: s241
section.heading: Exemptions

subsection.content: The Commission may exempt any listed company from any of the provisions of section 238, 239 or 240, subject to any conditions it thinks fit.

subsection.leadIn: The Commission may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: suspend or withdraw an exemption granted under subsection (1) on the ground that the conditions subject to which the exemption was granted have not been complied with or on any other ground the Commission thinks fit; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: vary any condition imposed under subsection (1).

section.name: s242
section.heading: No assignment of right to buy back own shares
section.leadIn: The following rights of a listed company are not capable of being assigned—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: rights under a general offer authorized under section 238;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: rights under a buy-back on a recognized stock market or on an approved stock exchange authorized under section 239;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: rights under a contract authorized under section 240.

section.name: s243
section.heading: Release of right to buy back own shares

subsection.content: An agreement by a listed company to release its rights under a contract authorized under section 240 or under a general offer authorized under section 238 is void unless the terms of the release agreement are authorized in advance by special resolution.
Section 240(3), (4), (5) and (6) applies to the authorization for a proposed release agreement as it applies to the authorization for a proposed contract under section 240.

section.name: s244
section.heading: Share buy-back under contract

subsection.content: An unlisted company may buy back its own shares under a contract that is authorized in advance by special resolution.
A contract may take the form of a contingent buy-back contract.
The authorization for a contract may be varied, revoked or from time to time renewed by special resolution.
A special resolution conferring, varying, revoking or renewing the authorization for a contract is subject to sections 245 and 246.

section.name: s245
section.heading: Resolution authorizing contract: disclosure of contract details

subsection.content: This section applies in relation to a special resolution to confer, vary, revoke or renew the authorization for a contract under section 244.

subsection.leadIn: A copy of the proposed contract (if it is in writing) or a memorandum setting out its terms (if it is not) must be made available to members—

paragraph.name: a
