paragraph.content: in the case of a written resolution, by being sent to every member of the company at or before the time when the proposed resolution is sent to them; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: in the case of a resolution proposed at a meeting, by being made available for inspection by members of the company—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: at the company’s registered office or at a place prescribed by regulations made under section 657, for a period of not less than 15 days ending on the date of the meeting; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: at the meeting.

subsection.content: A memorandum referred to in subsection (2) must include the names of members holding shares to which the proposed contract relates.
A copy of a proposed contract made available under subsection (2) must have annexed to it a memorandum specifying any of those names that do not appear in the proposed contract.
The special resolution is not effective if the requirements of this section are not complied with.

section.name: s246
section.heading: Resolution authorizing contract: exercise of voting rights

subsection.content: This section applies to a special resolution to confer, vary, revoke or renew the authorization for a contract under section 244.

If the special resolution is proposed as a written resolution, a member holding shares to which the resolution relates is not an eligible member for the purposes of Subdivision 2 of Division 1 of Part 12 (written resolution) in respect of those shares.

subsection.leadIn: If the special resolution is proposed at a meeting, the resolution is not effective if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any member of the company holding shares to which the resolution relates exercises the voting rights carried by any of those shares; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the resolution would not have been passed if the member had not done so.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsection (3)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a member holding shares to which the resolution relates is to be regarded as exercising the voting rights carried by those shares not only if the member votes in respect of them on a poll on the question whether the resolution should be passed but also if the member votes on the resolution otherwise than on a poll;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any member of the company may demand a poll on that question; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a vote or a demand for a poll by a person as proxy for a member is the same as a vote or a demand by the member.

subsection.content: The special resolution is not effective if a demand for a poll referred to in subsection (4)(b) is refused.

section.name: s247
section.heading: Variation of authorized contract

subsection.content: An unlisted company may agree to a variation of a contract authorized under section 244 if the variation agreement is authorized in advance by special resolution.
The authorization for a variation agreement may be varied, revoked or from time to time renewed by special resolution.
A special resolution conferring, varying, revoking or renewing the authorization for a variation agreement is subject to sections 248 and 249.

section.name: s248
section.heading: Resolution authorizing variation: disclosure of details of variation

subsection.content: This section applies in relation to a special resolution to confer, vary, revoke or renew the authorization for a variation agreement under section 247.

subsection.leadIn: A copy of the proposed variation agreement (if it is in writing) or a memorandum giving details of the proposed variation agreement (if it is not) must be made available to members—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the case of a written resolution, by being sent to every member of the company at or before the time when the proposed resolution is sent to them; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: in the case of a resolution proposed at a meeting, by being made available for inspection by members of the company—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: at the company’s registered office or at a place prescribed by regulations made under section 657, for a period of not less than 15 days ending on the date of the meeting; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: at the meeting.

subsection.content: There must also be made available to members in accordance with subsection (2) a copy of the original contract or memorandum, together with any variations previously made.
A memorandum referred to in subsection (2) must include the names of members holding shares to which the proposed variation agreement relates.
A copy of a proposed variation agreement made available under subsection (2) must have annexed to it a memorandum specifying any of those names that do not appear in the proposed variation agreement.
The special resolution is not effective if the requirements of this section are not complied with.

section.name: s249
section.heading: Resolution authorizing variation: exercise of voting rights

subsection.content: This section applies to a special resolution to confer, vary, revoke or renew the authorization for a variation agreement under section 247.

If the special resolution is proposed as a written resolution, a member holding shares to which the resolution relates is not an eligible member for the purposes of Subdivision 2 of Division 1 of Part 12 (written resolution) in respect of those shares.

subsection.leadIn: If the special resolution is proposed at a meeting, the resolution is not effective if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any member of the company holding shares to which the resolution relates exercises the voting rights carried by any of those shares; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the resolution would not have been passed if the member had not done so.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsection (3)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a member holding shares to which the resolution relates is to be regarded as exercising the voting rights carried by those shares not only if the member votes in respect of them on a poll on the question whether the resolution should be passed but also if the member votes on the resolution otherwise than on a poll;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any member of the company may demand a poll on that question; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a vote or a demand for a poll by a person as proxy for a member is the same as a vote or a demand by the member.

subsection.content: The special resolution is not effective if a demand for a poll referred to in subsection (4)(b) is refused.

section.name: s250
section.heading: No assignment of right to buy back own shares
section.content: The rights of an unlisted company under a contract authorized under section 244 (as varied from time to time under section 247) are not capable of being assigned.

section.name: s251
section.heading: Release of right to buy back own shares

subsection.content: An agreement by an unlisted company to release its rights under a contract authorized under section 244 (as varied from time to time under section 247) is void unless the terms of the release agreement are authorized in advance by special resolution.
The authorization for a release agreement may be varied, revoked or from time to time renewed by special resolution.
A special resolution conferring, varying, revoking or renewing the authorization for a release agreement is subject to sections 252 and 253.

section.name: s252
section.heading: Resolution authorizing release: disclosure of details of release

subsection.content: This section applies in relation to a special resolution to confer, vary, revoke or renew the authorization for a release agreement under section 251.

subsection.leadIn: A copy of the proposed release agreement (if it is in writing) or a memorandum giving details of the proposed release agreement (if it is not) must be made available to members—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the case of a written resolution, by being sent to every member of the company at or before the time when the proposed resolution is sent to them; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: in the case of a resolution proposed at a meeting, by being made available for inspection by members of the company—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: at the company’s registered office or at a place prescribed by regulations made under section 657, for a period of not less than 15 days ending on the date of the meeting; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: at the meeting.

subsection.content: There must also be made available to members in accordance with subsection (2) a copy of the original contract or memorandum, together with any variations previously made.
A memorandum referred to in subsection (2) must include the names of members holding shares to which the proposed release agreement relates.
A copy of a proposed release agreement made available under subsection (2) must have annexed to it a memorandum specifying any of those names that do not appear in the proposed release agreement.
The special resolution is not effective if the requirements of this section are not complied with.

section.name: s253
section.heading: Resolution authorizing release: exercise of voting rights

subsection.content: This section applies to a special resolution to confer, vary, revoke or renew the authorization for a release agreement under section 251.

If the special resolution is proposed as a written resolution, a member holding shares to which the resolution relates is not an eligible member for the purposes of Subdivision 2 of Division 1 of Part 12 (written resolution) in respect of those shares.

subsection.leadIn: If the special resolution is proposed at a meeting, the resolution is not effective if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any member of the company holding shares to which the resolution relates exercises the voting rights carried by any of those shares; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the resolution would not have been passed if the member had not done so.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsection (3)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a member holding shares to which the resolution relates is to be regarded as exercising the voting rights carried by those shares not only if the member votes in respect of them on a poll on the question whether the resolution should be passed but also if the member votes on the resolution otherwise than on a poll;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any member of the company may demand a poll on that question; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a vote or a demand for a poll by a person as proxy for a member is the same as a vote or a demand by the member.

subsection.content: The special resolution is not effective if a demand for a poll referred to in subsection (4)(b) is refused.

section.name: s254
section.heading: Variation of release of right to buy back own shares

subsection.content: An unlisted company may agree to a variation of a release agreement authorized under section 251 if the variation agreement is authorized in advance by special resolution.
The authorization for a variation agreement may be varied, revoked or from time to time renewed by special resolution.
A special resolution conferring, varying, revoking or renewing the authorization for a variation agreement is subject to sections 255 and 256.

section.name: s255
section.heading: Resolution authorizing variation of release: disclosure of details of variation

subsection.content: This section applies in relation to a special resolution to confer, vary, revoke or renew the authorization for a variation agreement under section 254.

subsection.leadIn: A copy of the proposed variation agreement (if it is in writing) or a memorandum giving details of the proposed variation agreement (if it is not) must be made available to members—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the case of a written resolution, by being sent to every member of the company at or before the time when the proposed resolution is sent to them; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: in the case of a resolution proposed at a meeting, by being made available for inspection by members of the company—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: at the company’s registered office or at a place prescribed by regulations made under section 657, for a period of not less than 15 days ending on the date of the meeting; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: at the meeting.

subsection.content: There must also be made available to members in accordance with subsection (2) a copy of the original release agreement or memorandum, together with any variations previously made.
A memorandum referred to in subsection (2) must include the names of members holding shares to which the proposed variation agreement relates.
A copy of a proposed variation agreement made available under subsection (2) must have annexed to it a memorandum specifying any of those names that do not appear in the proposed variation agreement.
The special resolution is not effective if the requirements of this section are not complied with.

section.name: s256
section.heading: Resolution authorizing variation of release: exercise of voting rights

subsection.content: This section applies to a special resolution to confer, vary, revoke or renew the authorization for a variation agreement under section 254.

If the special resolution is proposed as a written resolution, a member holding shares to which the resolution relates is not an eligible member for the purposes of Subdivision 2 of Division 1 of Part 12 (written resolution) in respect of those shares.

subsection.leadIn: If the special resolution is proposed at a meeting, the resolution is not effective if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any member of the company holding shares to which the resolution relates exercises the voting rights carried by any of those shares; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the resolution would not have been passed if the member had not done so.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsection (3)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a member holding shares to which the resolution relates is to be regarded as exercising the voting rights carried by those shares not only if the member votes in respect of them on a poll on the question whether the resolution should be passed but also if the member votes on the resolution otherwise than on a poll;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any member of the company may demand a poll on that question; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a vote or a demand for a poll by a person as proxy for a member is the same as a vote or a demand by the member.

subsection.content: The special resolution is not effective if a demand for a poll referred to in subsection (4)(b) is refused.

subdivision.name: SD6
subdivision.heading: Payment for Share Redemptions and Buy-backs

section.name: s257
section.heading: Payment for redemption or buy-back

subsection.content: If a company redeems or buys back its own shares, the shares must be paid for on redemption or buy-back.

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsections (3) and (4), a company may make a payment in respect of a redemption or buy-back of its own shares—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: out of the company’s distributable profits;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: out of the proceeds of a fresh issue of shares made for the purpose of the redemption or buy-back; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: out of capital in accordance with this Subdivision.

subsection.content: A listed company must not make a payment out of capital in respect of a buy-back of its own shares on a recognized stock market or on an approved stock exchange under section 239.

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (3), a payment referred to in subsection (5) may be made by a company only—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: out of the company’s distributable profits; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: out of capital in accordance with this Subdivision.

subsection.leadIn: Subsection (4) applies to a payment by a company in consideration of any of the following—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the company acquiring any right with respect to the buy-back of its own shares under Subdivision 4 or 5;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the variation of a contract authorized under Subdivision 5; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the release, or variation of the release, of any of the company’s obligations with respect to the buy-back of any of its own shares under Subdivision 4 or 5.

section.name: s258
section.heading: Special resolution for payment out of capital

subsection.content: Subject to section 257(3), a company may make a payment out of capital in respect of the redemption or buy-back of its own shares by special resolution in accordance with this Subdivision.
Subject to section 263, the payment out of capital and the redemption or buy-back must be made no earlier than 5 weeks and no later than 7 weeks after the date of the special resolution.

section.name: s259
section.heading: Solvency statement for payment out of capital

subsection.content: All directors of the company must make a solvency statement that complies with Division 2 in relation to the payment out of capital.
The special resolution for payment out of capital must be passed within 15 days after the date of the solvency statement.

If the special resolution is proposed as a written resolution, a copy of the solvency statement must be sent to every member of the company at or before the time when the proposed resolution is sent to them.
If the special resolution is proposed at a meeting, a copy of the solvency statement must be made available for inspection by members at the meeting.
The special resolution is not effective if subsection (3) or (4) (as applicable) is not complied with.

section.name: s260
section.heading: Special resolution: exercise of voting rights

subsection.content: If the special resolution for payment out of capital is proposed as a written resolution, a member of the company holding shares to which the resolution relates is not an eligible member for the purposes of Subdivision 2 of Division 1 of Part 12 (written resolution) in respect of those shares.

subsection.leadIn: If the special resolution for payment out of capital is proposed at a meeting, the resolution is not effective if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any member of the company holding shares to which the resolution relates exercises the voting rights carried by any of those shares; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the resolution would not have been passed if the member had not done so.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsection (2)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a member holding shares to which the resolution relates is to be regarded as exercising the voting rights carried by those shares not only if the member votes in respect of them on a poll on the question whether the resolution should be passed but also if the member votes on the resolution otherwise than on a poll;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any member of the company may demand a poll on that question; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a vote or a demand for a poll by a person as proxy for a member is the same as a vote or a demand by the member.

subsection.content: The special resolution is not effective if a demand for a poll referred to in subsection (3)(b) is refused.
This section does not apply to a buy-back by a listed company under a general offer in accordance with section 238.

section.name: s261
section.heading: Public notice of payment out of capital

subsection.leadIn: If a special resolution for payment out of capital is passed, the company must, on or before the date specified in subsection (2), publish a notice in the Gazette—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: stating that the company has approved a payment out of capital;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: specifying the amount of the payment out of capital and the date of the special resolution;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: stating where the special resolution and solvency statement are available for inspection; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: stating that a member of the company who did not consent to or vote in favour of the special resolution or a creditor of the company may, within 5 weeks after the date of the special resolution, apply to the Court under section 263 for cancellation of the special resolution.

subsection.leadIn: The date is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a date that falls on the last working day of the week after the week in which the special resolution is passed; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the period between the date in paragraph (a) and the date on which the special resolution is passed is less than 4 business days (both dates exclusive), a date that falls on the last working day of the week next following.

The special resolution is passed on 2 February of a year (Thursday). Apart from Saturdays and Sundays, all other dates in February of that year are business days. The date that falls on the last working day of the week after the week in which the special resolution is passed is 10 February (Friday) of that year. There are 5 business days between 2 February and 10 February. Therefore, the relevant notice must be published in the Gazette on or before 10 February (Friday) of that year.

The special resolution is passed on 30 March of a year (Friday). Both 4 April (Wednesday) and 6 April (Friday) of that year are general holidays. 2 April (Monday), 3 April (Tuesday), 5 April (Thursday) and 13 April (Friday) of that year are business days. The date that falls on the last working day of the week after the week in which the special resolution is passed is 5 April (Thursday). There are only 2 business days between 30 March and 5 April. Therefore, the relevant notice must be published in the Gazette on or before the last working day of the week next following, which is 13 April (Friday) of that year.

subsection.leadIn: Before the end of the week after the week in which the special resolution for payment out of capital is passed, the company must also—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: publish a notice to the same effect as the notice under subsection (1) in at least one specified Chinese language newspaper and at least one specified English language newspaper; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: give written notice to that effect to each of its creditors.

subsection.content: If the company contravenes subsection (1) or (3), the company, and every responsible person of the company, commit an offence, and each is liable to a fine at level 3.

subsection.leadIn: The company must deliver to the Registrar for registration a copy of the solvency statement no later than the day on which the company—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: publishes the notice under subsection (1); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if earlier, first publishes the notice or gives notice to creditors under subsection (3).

subsection.content: If the company contravenes subsection (5), the company, and every responsible person of the company, commit an offence, and each is liable to a fine at level 5 and, in the case of a continuing offence, to a further fine of $1,000 for each day during which the offence continues.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsection (2)—

def.name: BusinessDay
def.leadIn: business day (辦公日) means a day that is not—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a general holiday;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a Saturday; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a black rainstorm warning day or gale warning day as defined by section 71(2) of the Interpretation and General Clauses Ordinance (Cap. 1);

def.name: WorkingDay
def.leadIn: working day (工作日) means a day that is not—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a general holiday; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a Saturday.

section.name: s262
section.heading: Inspection of special resolution and solvency statement

subsection.leadIn: The company must ensure that the special resolution for payment out of capital and the solvency statement made in relation to it are kept at its registered office or at a place prescribed by regulations made under section 657 for the period—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: beginning on the day on which the company—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: publishes the notice under section 261(1); or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: if earlier, first publishes the notice or gives notice to creditors under section 261(3); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: ending 5 weeks after the date of the special resolution.

subsection.content: The company must permit a member or creditor of the company to inspect the special resolution and solvency statement without charge during business hours in that period.

If the company contravenes subsection (1) or (2), the company, and every responsible person of the company, commit an offence, and each is liable to a fine at level 5 and, in the case of a continuing offence, to a further fine of $1,000 for each day during which the offence continues.
If the company contravenes subsection (2), the Court may by order require the company to permit an immediate inspection.

section.name: s263
section.heading: Application to Court by members or creditors

subsection.content: Subject to subsection (2), a member or creditor of the company may apply to the Court, within 5 weeks after the date of the special resolution for payment out of capital, for cancellation of the resolution.
A member who consented to or voted in favour of the special resolution is not entitled to apply.
An application may be made on behalf of the persons entitled to apply by any one or more of them appointed in writing by all of them.

subsection.leadIn: If an application is made under this section—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the applicant must, as soon as possible, serve the application on the company; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the company must give the Registrar notice in the specified form of the application within 7 days after the day on which the application is served on the company.

subsection.content: If the company contravenes subsection (4)(b), the company, and every responsible person of the company, commit an offence, and each is liable to a fine at level 3 and, in the case of a continuing offence, to a further fine of $300 for each day during which the offence continues.

section.name: s264
section.heading: Power of Court to adjourn proceedings

subsection.content: The Court may adjourn proceedings on an application under section 263 so that an arrangement may be made to its satisfaction for the protection of the interests of dissentient members or dissentient creditors.
The Court may give any directions and make any orders it thinks expedient for facilitating or carrying into effect any such arrangement.

section.name: s265
section.heading: Power of Court to confirm or cancel special resolution

subsection.content: On an application under section 263, the Court must make an order confirming or cancelling the special resolution for payment out of capital, and may do so on any terms and conditions it thinks fit.

subsection.leadIn: If the Court confirms the special resolution, it may by order alter or extend any date or period of time specified—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the special resolution; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in any provision of this Division applying to the special resolution, the payment out of capital or the redemption or buy-back.

subsection.leadIn: If the Court thinks fit, the order may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: provide for the company to buy back the shares of any of its members and for the reduction accordingly of the company’s share capital;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: provide for the protection of the interests of members or creditors of the company;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: make any alteration to the company’s articles that may be required as a consequence;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: require the company not to make any, or any specified, alteration to its articles.

subsection.content: If the order of the Court requires the company not to make any, or any specified, alteration to its articles, the company does not have power to make any such alteration without leave of the Court.
The powers of the Court under this section do not limit its powers under section 264.

section.name: s266
section.heading: Company to deliver copy of order of Court to Registrar

subsection.content: Within 15 days after the making of an order by the Court under section 265, or within any longer period ordered by the Court, the company must deliver an office copy of the order to the Registrar for registration.

If the company contravenes subsection (1), the company, and every responsible person of the company, commit an offence, and each is liable to a fine at level 3 and, in the case of a continuing offence, to a further fine of $300 for each day during which the offence continues.

subdivision.name: SD7
subdivision.heading: General Provisions on Share Redemptions and Buy-backs

section.name: s267
section.heading: General prohibition on acquisition of own shares

subsection.content: Except as provided by this Ordinance, a company must not acquire its own shares, whether by redemption, buy-back, subscription or otherwise.

subsection.leadIn: If a company contravenes subsection (1), an offence is committed by—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the company;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: every responsible person of the company; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: every non-tendering member of the company (as defined by section 705) who knowingly permits the contravention.

subsection.leadIn: A person who commits an offence under subsection (2) is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on conviction on indictment to a fine of $1,250,000 and to imprisonment for 5 years; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on summary conviction to a fine of $150,000 and to imprisonment for 12 months.

subsection.content: Subject to section 236(4) and Division 2 of Part 14 (remedies for unfair prejudice to members’ interests), a redemption or buy-back of shares by a company under this Division is not void only because of a failure to comply with this Division.

section.name: s268
section.heading: No redemption or buy-back of unpaid or partly-paid shares
section.content: A company must not redeem or buy back its own shares unless they are fully paid.

section.name: s269
section.heading: Effect of redemption or buy-back

subsection.content: Subject to Subdivision 8, shares redeemed or bought back under this Division are to be regarded as cancelled on redemption or buy-back. (Amended 1 of 2025 s. 6)

subsection.leadIn: Whether or not Subdivision 8 applies, on redemption or buy-back of its own shares, a company must— (Amended 1 of 2025 s. 6)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: reduce the amount of its share capital if the shares were redeemed or bought back out of capital;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: reduce the amount of its profits if the shares were redeemed or bought back out of profits; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: reduce the amount of its share capital and profits proportionately if the shares were redeemed or bought back out of both capital and profits,

subsection.continued: by the total amount of the price paid by the company for the shares.

section.name: s270
section.heading: Return of share redemption or buy-back

subsection.content: A company that redeems or buys back any shares under this Division must, within 15 days after the date on which the shares are delivered to the company, deliver a return to the Registrar for registration.

subsection.leadIn: The return—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: must be in the specified form;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: must state, for the shares of each class redeemed or bought back—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the number of shares; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the date on which they were delivered to the company;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: must include a statement of capital, as at the time immediately after the redemption or buy-back, that complies with section 201;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.leadIn: in the case of a listed company, must also state, for the shares of each class redeemed or bought back—

subparagraph.name: i
ii
subparagraph.content: the aggregate amount paid by the company for the shares; and

subparagraph.leadIn: if applicable, the number of shares—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: bought back and held by the company under section 272B(1); or

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: regarded as having been bought back and held by the company under section 272I(1); and (Added 1 of 2025 s. 7)

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: in the case of a redemption or buy-back financed by a payment out of capital, must also state particulars of the payment including the date and amount of the payment.

subsection.content: Details of shares delivered to the company on different dates and under different contracts may be included in a single return. If this is done, the amount required to be stated under subsection (2)(d)(ii) is the aggregate amount paid by the company for all the shares to which the return relates.

If the company contravenes subsection (1), the company, and every responsible person of the company, commit an offence, and each is liable to a fine at level 6 and, in the case of a continuing offence, to a further fine of $2,000 for each day during which the offence continues.

section.name: s271
section.heading: Effect of company’s failure to redeem or buy back

subsection.leadIn: This section applies if, under this Division, a company—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: issues redeemable shares; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: agrees to buy back any of its own shares.

subsection.content: The company is not liable in damages for any failure on its part to redeem or buy back any of the shares.
Subsection (2) is without prejudice to any right of the holder of the shares other than the right to sue the company for damages for the failure.

A court must not grant an order for specific performance of the terms of the redemption or buy-back if the company shows that it is unable to make a payment in respect of the redemption or buy-back out of distributable profits.

section.name: s272
section.heading: Effect on winding up of company’s failure to redeem or buy back

subsection.leadIn: This section applies if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: a company—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: issues redeemable shares under this Division; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: agrees to buy back any of its own shares under this Division;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the company is wound up; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: at the commencement of the winding up any of those shares have not been redeemed or bought back.

subsection.content: The terms of the redemption or buy-back may be enforced against the company.

subsection.leadIn: Subsection (2) does not apply if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the terms of the redemption or buy-back provided for the redemption or buy-back to take place at a date later than that of the commencement of the winding up; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: during the period—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: beginning on the day on which the redemption or buy-back was to have taken place; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: ending on the commencement of the winding up,

paragraph.continued: the company could not at any time have lawfully made a payment in respect of the redemption or buy-back out of distributable profits.

subsection.content: Shares are to be regarded as cancelled when they are redeemed or bought back under subsection (2).

subsection.leadIn: The following must be paid in priority to any amount that the company is liable under subsection (2) to pay in respect of any shares—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: all other debts and liabilities of the company (other than any due to members in their capacity as such); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if other shares carry rights (whether as to capital or income) that are preferred to the rights as to capital attaching to those shares, any amount due in satisfaction of those preferred rights.

subsection.content: Subject to subsection (5), any amount payable under subsection (2) must be paid in priority to any amounts due to members in satisfaction of their rights (whether as to capital or income) as members.

If, under section 264A of the Companies (Winding Up and Miscellaneous Provisions) Ordinance (Cap. 32), a creditor of a company is entitled to payment of any interest only after payment of all other debts of the company, the company’s debts and liabilities for the purposes of subsection (5) include the liability to pay that interest.

section.name: s272A
section.heading: Interpretation
section.leadIn: In this Subdivision—

def.name: Nominee
def.leadIn: nominee (代名人) means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a recognized clearing house as defined by section 1 of Part 1 of Schedule 1 to the Securities and Futures Ordinance (Cap. 571); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a subsidiary of a recognized clearing house mentioned in paragraph (a).

section.name: s272B
section.heading: Listed companies, on buying back their own shares, may hold them as treasury shares

subsection.content: A listed company that buys back its own shares under this Division may hold the shares.
If a listed company holding treasury shares is delisted, all its treasury shares are to be regarded as cancelled on the company being delisted.

section.name: s272C
section.heading: Names of listed companies or nominees holding treasury shares must be entered in registers of members of companies

subsection.leadIn: A listed company holding treasury shares must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if the treasury shares are held in the name of the company—enter its name in the register of members of the company in accordance with section 627; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the treasury shares are held through a nominee—enter the nominee’s name in the register of members of the company in accordance with section 627.

subsection.leadIn: Despite subsection (1), the listed company or the nominee (as the case requires) is not to be regarded, in respect of the treasury shares, as—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a member of the company for the purposes of this Ordinance (except section 2 of Schedule 6); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a member, shareholder or contributory of the company for the purposes of the Companies (Winding Up and Miscellaneous Provisions) Ordinance (Cap. 32).

statutoryNote.content: Please also see section 2(1) of the Companies (Winding Up and Miscellaneous Provisions) Ordinance (Cap. 32) for the definitions of member and contributory.

section.name: s272D
section.heading: Cancellation, sale or transfer of treasury shares
section.leadIn: A listed company holding treasury shares—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: may at any time cancel any of its treasury shares; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: may at any time sell or transfer (whether or not for a consideration) any of its treasury shares to any person.

section.name: s272E
section.heading: Return of cancellation of treasury shares

subsection.leadIn: This section applies if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a listed company cancels any of its treasury shares under section 272D(a); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a listed company is delisted and the treasury shares held by it are regarded as cancelled under section 272B(2).

subsection.leadIn: The company must deliver a return of the cancellation to the Registrar for registration within 15 days after—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: for subsection (1)(a)—the date on which the shares are cancelled, whether or not the company is subsequently delisted; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: for subsection (1)(b)—the date on which the shares are regarded as cancelled.

subsection.leadIn: The return—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: must be in the specified form;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: must state, for the treasury shares of each class cancelled or regarded as cancelled—

subparagraph.content: the total number of the shares; and
the date on which the shares are cancelled or regarded as cancelled (as the case may be); and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: must include a statement of capital, as at the time immediately after the treasury shares are cancelled or regarded as cancelled (as the case may be), that complies with section 201.

subsection.content: The particulars of treasury shares cancelled, or regarded as cancelled, on different dates may be included in a single return.

subsection.leadIn: If a company contravenes subsection (2), the company, and every responsible person of the company, commit an offence, and each is liable on conviction—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to a fine at level 6; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: for a continuing offence—to a further fine of $2,000 for each day during which the offence continues.

section.name: s272F
section.heading: Return of sale or transfer of treasury shares

subsection.content: If a listed company sells or transfers any of its treasury shares under section 272D(b), the company (whether or not it is subsequently delisted) must deliver a return of the sale or transfer to the Registrar for registration within 15 days after the date of the sale or transfer.

subsection.leadIn: The return—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: must be in the specified form;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: must state, for the treasury shares of each class sold or transferred (whether or not for a consideration)—

subparagraph.content: the total number of the shares; and
the date of the sale or transfer;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: for treasury shares that are sold or transferred for a consideration (whether wholly or partly cash consideration or non-cash consideration)—

subparagraph.content: must state the amount paid, or for non-cash consideration, regarded as paid, to the company for each share; and

subparagraph.leadIn: if the consideration is wholly or partly non-cash, must state the particulars of—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: the contract for the sale and purchase in respect of which the shares are sold or transferred; or

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: the contract for the services or other non-cash consideration in respect of which the shares are sold or transferred; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: must include a statement of capital, as at the time immediately after the sale or transfer of the treasury shares, that complies with section 201.

subsection.content: The particulars of treasury shares sold or transferred on different dates may be included in a single return.

subsection.leadIn: If a company contravenes subsection (1), the company, and every responsible person of the company, commit an offence, and each is liable on conviction—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to a fine at level 6; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: for a continuing offence—to a further fine of $2,000 for each day during which the offence continues.

subsection.content: If a company fails to deliver a return within the period specified in subsection (1) (specified period), the Court may, on application by the company or a responsible person of the company, extend the specified period by a period determined by the Court.

subsection.leadIn: However, the Court may extend the specified period only if it is satisfied that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the failure to deliver the return was accidental or due to inadvertence; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: it is just and equitable to extend the period.

subsection.leadIn: If the Court extends the specified period—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any liability already incurred by the company or a responsible person of the company for an offence under subsection (4) is extinguished; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: subsection (1) has effect as if the reference to 15 days were a reference to the extended period.

section.name: s272G
section.heading: Sections 140, 141 and 170(2)(a) apply to sale or transfer of treasury shares
section.content: If a listed company sells or transfers any of its treasury shares under section 272D(b), sections 140, 141 and 170(2)(a) apply in relation to the sale or transfer of the treasury shares as if it were an allotment of shares in the company.

section.name: s272H
section.heading: Rights attached to treasury shares suspended

subsection.content: All rights attached to treasury shares are to be regarded as suspended, and any act done in purported exercise of the rights is void.

statutoryNote.leadIn: The rights to be regarded as suspended include—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: the right to receive any dividends purported to be paid for those shares; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the right to receive any distribution of the company’s assets in the form of cash or otherwise (including any distribution of assets to members on a winding up) in respect of those shares.

subsection.content: In particular, treasury shares are not to be counted towards the total voting rights in respect of shares or any class of shares of a listed company under this Ordinance or the Companies (Winding Up and Miscellaneous Provisions) Ordinance (Cap. 32).
Nothing in this section prevents an allotment of shares as fully paid bonus shares in respect of treasury shares.

section.name: s272I
section.heading: Bonus shares allotted in respect of treasury shares to be regarded as shares bought back under this Division

subsection.leadIn: If a listed company allots, in respect of its treasury shares, any shares in the company as fully paid bonus shares, those bonus shares—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: are to be regarded as being bought back under this Division by the company on their allotment; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: may be held by the company.

subsection.content: Bonus shares under subsection (1) that are not held by the company are to be regarded as cancelled on allotment and sections 269 and 270 apply in respect of the shares.

subdivision.name: SD9
subdivision.heading: Modification of this Division by Regulations

section.name: s273
section.heading: Power to modify by regulation

subsection.leadIn: The Chief Executive in Council may make regulations modifying any of the provisions of this Division with respect to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the authorization required for a company to buy back its own shares;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the authorization required for the release by a company of its rights under a contract for the buy-back of its own shares, including a contingent buy-back contract; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the information to be included in a return by a company to the Registrar in relation to a share redemption or buy-back.

subsection.content: Regulations made under this section are subject to the approval of the Legislative Council.

division.name: D5
division.heading: Financial Assistance for Acquisition of Own Shares

section.name: s274
section.heading: Interpretation

subsection.leadIn: In this Division—

def.name: FinancialAssistance
def.leadIn: financial assistance (資助) means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: financial assistance given by way of gift;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: financial assistance given—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: by way of guarantee, security or indemnity (other than an indemnity in respect of the indemnifier’s own neglect or default); or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: by way of release or waiver;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: financial assistance given—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: by way of a loan or any other agreement under which any of the obligations of the person giving the assistance are to be fulfilled at a time when in accordance with the agreement any obligation of another party to the agreement remains unfulfilled; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: by way of the novation of, or the assignment of rights arising under, a loan or other agreement referred to in subparagraph (i); or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.leadIn: any other financial assistance given by a company if—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the net assets of the company are reduced to a material extent by the giving of the assistance; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the company has no net assets;

def.name: Liabilities
def.leadIn: liabilities (負債) includes any amount retained as reasonably necessary for the purpose of providing for any liability or loss that is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: likely to be incurred; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: certain to be incurred but uncertain as to the amount or as to the date on which it will arise;

subsection.def: net assets (淨資產) of a company that gives any financial assistance under this Division, means the amount by which the aggregate of the company’s assets exceeds the aggregate of its liabilities (taking the amount of both assets and liabilities to be as stated in the company’s accounting records immediately before the financial assistance is given).

subsection.leadIn: In this Division—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a reference to a person incurring a liability includes the person changing their financial position by making an agreement or arrangement (whether enforceable or unenforceable, and whether made on the person’s own account or with any other person) or by any other means; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a reference to a company giving financial assistance for the purpose of reducing or discharging a liability incurred by a person for the purpose of the acquisition of shares includes the company giving financial assistance for the purpose of wholly or partly restoring the person’s financial position to what it was before the acquisition took place.

subdivision.name: SD2
subdivision.heading: General Prohibition on Financial Assistance for Acquisition of Own Shares

section.name: s275
section.heading: Prohibition on financial assistance for acquisition of shares or for reducing or discharging liability for acquisition

subsection.content: If a person is acquiring or proposing to acquire shares in a company, the company or any of its subsidiaries must not give financial assistance directly or indirectly for the purpose of the acquisition before or at the same time as the acquisition takes place, except as provided by this Division.

subsection.leadIn: If—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a person has acquired shares in a company; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any person has incurred a liability for the purpose of the acquisition,

subsection.continued: the company or any of its subsidiaries must not give financial assistance directly or indirectly for the purpose of reducing or discharging the liability, except as provided by this Division.

subsection.content: If a company contravenes subsection (1) or (2), the company, and every responsible person of the company, commit an offence, and each is liable to a fine of $150,000 and to imprisonment for 12 months.

section.name: s276
section.heading: Failure to comply with Division does not affect validity of financial assistance, etc.
section.content: If a company gives financial assistance in contravention of this Division, the validity of the financial assistance and of any contract or transaction connected with it is not affected only because of the contravention.

section.name: s277
section.heading: General exceptions
section.leadIn: This Division does not prohibit any of the following transactions—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: the distribution of a company’s assets—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: by way of dividend lawfully made; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: in the course of winding up the company;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the allotment of bonus shares (including a transfer of treasury shares as bonus shares); (Amended 1 of 2025 s. 10)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the reduction of a company’s share capital in accordance with Division 3;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the redemption or buy-back of a company’s own shares in accordance with Division 4;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: anything done in accordance with a court order under Division 2 of Part 13 (arrangements and compromises);

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: anything done under an arrangement made under section 237 of the Companies (Winding Up and Miscellaneous Provisions) Ordinance (Cap. 32) (power of liquidator to accept shares, etc., as consideration for sale of property of company);

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: anything done under an arrangement made between a company and its creditors that is binding on the creditors because of section 254 of the Companies (Winding Up and Miscellaneous Provisions) Ordinance (Cap. 32) (arrangement, when binding on creditors).

section.name: s278
section.heading: Principal purpose exception
section.leadIn: This Division does not prohibit a company from giving financial assistance for the purpose of the acquisition of a share in the company or its holding company or for the purpose of reducing or discharging a liability incurred for such an acquisition if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: either—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the company’s principal purpose in giving the assistance is not to give it for the purpose of the acquisition of a share in the company or its holding company or for the purpose of reducing or discharging a liability incurred for such an acquisition; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the giving of the assistance for the purpose of the acquisition of a share in the company or its holding company or for the purpose of reducing or discharging a liability incurred for such an acquisition is only an incidental part of some larger purpose of the company; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the assistance is given in good faith in the interests of the company.

section.name: s279
section.heading: Exception for money lending businesses
section.content: Subject to section 282, this Division does not prohibit the lending of money by a company in the ordinary course of business if the lending of money is part of the ordinary business of the company.

section.name: s280
section.heading: Exception for employee share schemes

subsection.leadIn: Subject to section 282, this Division does not prohibit—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the giving by a company, in good faith in the interests of the company, of financial assistance for the purposes of an employee share scheme; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the giving of financial assistance by a company for the purposes of, or in connection with, anything done by the company or another company in the same group of companies for the purposes of enabling or facilitating transactions in shares in the company or its holding company between, and involving the acquisition of beneficial ownership of those shares by—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: persons employed or formerly employed in good faith by that company or another company in the same group of companies; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: spouses, widows, widowers, or minor children of persons referred to in subparagraph (i).

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: children (子女) includes step-children, illegitimate children and children adopted in any manner recognized by the law of Hong Kong;

def.name: EmployeeShareScheme
def.leadIn: employee share scheme (僱員參股計劃) means a scheme for encouraging or facilitating the holding of shares in a company by or for the benefit of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: persons employed or formerly employed in good faith by that company or another company in the same group of companies; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: spouses, widows, widowers, or minor children of persons referred to in paragraph (a);

subsection.def: minor children (未成年子女) means children who are under 18 years of age.

section.name: s281
section.heading: Exception for loans to employees

subsection.content: Subject to section 282, this Division does not prohibit the making by a company of loans to its eligible employees for the purpose of enabling them to acquire fully paid shares in the company or its holding company to be held by them by way of beneficial ownership.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: child (子女) includes a step-child, an illegitimate child and a child adopted in any manner recognized by the law of Hong Kong;

def.name: EligibleEmployees
def.leadIn: eligible employees (合資格的僱員), in relation to a company, means persons employed in good faith by the company, other than—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a director of the company;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a director’s spouse;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a director’s child who is under 18 years of age;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.leadIn: a trustee of a trust (other than an employee share scheme as defined by section 280(2) or a pension scheme)—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the beneficiaries of which include a person referred to in paragraph (a), (b) or (c); or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the terms of which confer a power on the trustees that may be exercised for the benefit of a person referred to in paragraph (a), (b) or (c); or

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: a partner of a person referred to in paragraph (a), (b) or (c) or of a trustee referred to in paragraph (d).

section.name: s282
section.heading: Special restriction for listed companies
section.leadIn: Section 279, 280 or 281 applies to a listed company only if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the company has net assets that are not reduced by the giving of the financial assistance; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to the extent that those assets are reduced, the assistance is provided by a payment out of distributable profits.

section.name: s283
section.heading: Financial assistance not exceeding 5% of shareholders funds

subsection.leadIn: A company may give financial assistance for the purpose of the acquisition of a share in the company or its holding company or for the purpose of reducing or discharging a liability incurred for such an acquisition if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: the directors resolve, before the assistance is given, that—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the company should give the assistance;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: giving the assistance is in the best interests of the company; and

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: the terms and conditions under which the assistance is to be given are fair and reasonable to the company;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on the same day that the directors pass the resolution, the directors who vote in favour of it make a solvency statement that complies with Division 2 in relation to the giving of the assistance;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the aggregate amount of the assistance and any other financial assistance given under this section that has not been repaid does not exceed 5% of the paid up share capital and reserves of the company (as disclosed in the most recent audited financial statements of the company); and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the assistance is given not more than 12 months after the day on which the solvency statement is made under paragraph (b).

subsection.content: The resolution of the directors under subsection (1)(a) must set out in full the grounds for their conclusions as to the matters referred to in subsection (1)(a)(i), (ii) and (iii).

A reference in subsection (1)(c) to any other financial assistance given under this section that has not been repaid includes the amount of any financial assistance given in the form of a guarantee or security for which the company remains liable at the time the financial assistance in question is given.

subsection.leadIn: Within 15 days after giving financial assistance under this section, the company must send to each member of the company a copy of the solvency statement made under subsection (1)(b) and a notice containing the following information—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the class and number of shares in respect of which the assistance was given;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the consideration paid or payable for those shares;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the name of the person receiving the assistance and, if a different person, the name of the beneficial owner of those shares;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the nature, the terms and the amount of the assistance.

subsection.content: If the company contravenes subsection (4), the company, and every responsible person of the company, commit an offence, and each is liable to a fine at level 3 and, in the case of a continuing offence, to a further fine of $300 for each day during which the offence continues.

section.name: s284
section.heading: Financial assistance with approval of all members

subsection.leadIn: A company may give financial assistance for the purpose of the acquisition of a share in the company or its holding company or for the purpose of reducing or discharging a liability incurred for such an acquisition if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: the directors resolve, before the assistance is given, that—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the company should give the assistance;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: giving the assistance is in the best interests of the company; and

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: the terms and conditions under which the assistance is to be given are fair and reasonable to the company;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on the same day that the directors pass the resolution, the directors who vote in favour of it make a solvency statement that complies with Division 2 in relation to the giving of the assistance;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the giving of the assistance is approved by written resolution of all members of the company before the assistance is given; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the assistance is given not more than 12 months after the day on which the solvency statement is made under paragraph (b).

subsection.content: The resolution of the directors under subsection (1)(a) must set out in full the grounds for their conclusions as to the matters referred to in subsection (1)(a)(i), (ii) and (iii).

section.name: s285
section.heading: Financial assistance by ordinary resolution

subsection.leadIn: A company may give financial assistance for the purpose of the acquisition of a share in the company or its holding company or for the purpose of reducing or discharging a liability incurred for such an acquisition if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: the directors resolve, before the assistance is given, that—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the company should give the assistance;

subparagraph.name: ii
iii

paragraph.name: b
c
paragraph.leadIn: the company sends to each member of the company a copy of the solvency statement made under paragraph (b) and a notice containing the following information—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the nature and terms of the assistance and the name of the person to whom it will be given;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: if it will be given to a nominee for another person, the name of that other person;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: the text of the resolution of the directors;

subparagraph.name: iv

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the giving of the assistance is approved by resolution of the company before the assistance is given; and

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.leadIn: the assistance is given—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: not less than 28 days after the day on which the resolution is passed under paragraph (d); and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: not more than 12 months after the day on which the solvency statement is made under paragraph (b).

subsection.content: The notice and copy of the solvency statement must be sent to each member under subsection (1)(c) at least 14 days before the day on which the resolution under subsection (1)(d) is proposed and may accompany notice of the meeting at which the resolution will be proposed.

Despite subsection (1)(e)(i), if an application is made to the Court under section 286 in relation to the giving of financial assistance under this section, the financial assistance must not be given until the application is finally determined, unless the Court orders otherwise.
The resolution of the directors under subsection (1)(a) must set out in full the grounds for their conclusions as to the matters referred to in subsection (1)(a)(i), (ii) and (iii).

section.name: s286
section.heading: Application to Court for restraining order

subsection.leadIn: Within 28 days after the day on which a resolution for the giving of financial assistance is passed under section 285(1)(d), an application to the Court for an order restraining the giving of financial assistance may be made—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if the company is limited by shares, by members representing at least 5% of the total voting rights of holders of shares in the company; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in any other case, by members representing at least 5% of the members of the company.

subsection.content: Despite subsection (1), a member who consented to or voted in favour of the resolution is not entitled to apply.
An application may be made on behalf of the members entitled to apply by any one or more of them appointed in writing by all of them.

subsection.leadIn: An application under this section may be made only on the ground that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: the giving of the assistance is neither—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: in the best interests of the company; nor

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: of benefit to those members of the company not receiving the assistance; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the terms and conditions under which the assistance is to be given are not fair and reasonable to—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the company; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: those members not receiving the assistance.

subsection.leadIn: If an application is made under this section—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the applicant must, as soon as possible, serve the application on the company; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the company must give the Registrar notice in the specified form of the application within 7 days after the day on which the application is served on the company.

subsection.content: If the company contravenes subsection (5)(b), the company, and every responsible person of the company, commit an offence, and each is liable to a fine at level 3 and, in the case of a continuing offence, to a further fine of $300 for each day during which the offence continues.

section.name: s287
section.heading: Power of Court to adjourn application

subsection.content: The Court may adjourn proceedings on an application under section 286 so that an arrangement may be made to its satisfaction for the protection of the interests of dissentient members.
The Court may give any directions and make any orders it thinks expedient for facilitating or carrying into effect any such arrangement.

section.name: s288
section.heading: Power of Court to confirm or restrain giving of financial assistance

subsection.content: On an application under section 286, the Court must make an order confirming or restraining the giving of financial assistance, and may do so on any terms and conditions it thinks fit.

subsection.leadIn: If the Court confirms the giving of financial assistance, it may by order alter or extend any date or period of time specified—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the directors’ resolution under section 285(1)(a) or the resolution of the company under section 285(1)(d); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in any provision of this Division applying to the giving of financial assistance.

subsection.leadIn: If the Court thinks fit, the order may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: provide for the company to buy back the shares of any of its members and for the reduction accordingly of the company’s share capital;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: make any alteration to the company’s articles that may be required as a consequence;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: require the company not to make any, or any specified, alteration to its articles.

subsection.content: If the order of the Court requires the company not to make any, or any specified, alteration to its articles, the company does not have power to make any such alteration without leave of the Court.
The powers of the Court under this section do not limit its powers under section 287.

section.name: s289
section.heading: Company to deliver copy of order of Court to Registrar

subsection.content: Within 15 days after the making of an order by the Court under section 288, or within any longer period ordered by the Court, the company must deliver an office copy of the order to the Registrar for registration.

If the company contravenes subsection (1), the company, and every responsible person of the company, commit an offence, and each is liable to a fine at level 3 and, in the case of a continuing offence, to a further fine of $300 for each day during which the offence continues.

part.name: P6
part.heading: Distribution of Profits and Assets

section.name: s290
section.heading: Interpretation

subsection.leadIn: In this Part—

def.name: CalledUpShareCapital
def.leadIn: called up share capital (已催繳股本), in relation to a company, means so much of its share capital as equals the aggregate amount of the calls made on its shares (whether or not those calls have been paid), together with—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any share capital paid up without being called; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any share capital to be paid on a specified future date under the articles, the terms of allotment of the relevant shares, or any other arrangements for payment of those shares,

def.continued: and uncalled share capital (未催繳股本) is to be read accordingly;

def.name: Capitalization
def.leadIn: capitalization (資本化), in relation to a company’s profits, means any of the following operations (whenever carried out)—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: transferring the profits to share capital;

def.name: Distribution
def.leadIn: distribution (分派) means every description of distribution of a company’s assets to its members, whether in cash or otherwise, except distribution by way of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an issue of shares as fully or partly paid bonus shares;

paragraph.name: ab
b
c
d
paragraph.content: a distribution of assets to the members on the company’s winding up; or

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: financial assistance given by the company to a member under section 283, 284 or 285;

section.def: financial assistance (資助) has the meaning given by section 274(1);

def.name: FinancialItems
def.leadIn: financial items (財務項目) means all of the following—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: profits, losses, assets and liabilities;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: provisions;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: share capital and reserves (including undistributable reserves);

def.name: UndistributableReserves
def.leadIn: undistributable reserves (不可分派的儲備), in relation to a company, means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: subject to subsection (2), the amount by which the company’s accumulated, unrealized profits, so far as not previously utilized by capitalization, exceeds its accumulated, unrealized losses, so far as not previously written off in a reduction or reorganization of capital; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any other reserve that the company is prohibited from distributing by an Ordinance (other than this Part) or by its articles.

subsection.content: In paragraph (a) of the definition of undistributable reserves in subsection (1), a reference to capitalization excludes a transfer of profits of the company to its capital redemption reserve on or after 1 September 1991.

subsection.leadIn: In this Part—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a reference to profits of any particular description is a reference to profits of that description made at any time; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a reference to losses of any particular description is a reference to losses of that description made at any time.

subsection.content: For the purposes of this Part, any financial statements are referential financial statements if the distribution in question is made pursuant to determinations made by reference to financial items as stated in the financial statements under section 302.

section.name: s291
section.heading: Realized profits and losses

subsection.content: In this Part, a reference to realized profits or realized losses of a company is a reference to those profits or losses of the company that are regarded as realized profits or realized losses for the purpose of any financial statements prepared by the directors in accordance with principles generally accepted, at the time when the financial statements are prepared, with respect to the determination for accounting purposes of realized profits or realized losses.
Subsection (1) does not affect any specific provision (whether in an Ordinance or otherwise) under which profits or losses of any description are regarded as realized.

If, after making all reasonable enquiries, a company’s directors are unable to determine whether or not a particular profit or loss made before 1 September 1991 is realized, they may treat the profit as realized, and the loss as unrealized, for the purposes of this Part.

section.name: s292
section.heading: Certain amount to be regarded as realized profit or loss

subsection.content: For the purposes of this Part, a provision other than an amount specified in subsection (2) is to be regarded as a realized loss.

subsection.leadIn: The amount is one written off or retained by way of providing for a diminution in value of a fixed asset appearing on a revaluation of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: all of the company’s fixed assets; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: all of the company’s fixed assets other than goodwill.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsection (2), any consideration by the directors of the value at a particular time of a fixed asset is to be regarded as a revaluation of the asset if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the case of a listed company, the conditions specified in subsection (4)(a) and (b) are satisfied; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: in the case of any other company—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: where the referential financial statements are the financial statements specified in section 304, the conditions specified in subsection (4)(a) and (b) are satisfied; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: where the referential financial statements are the financial statements specified in section 305 or 306, the condition specified in subsection (4)(a) is satisfied.

subsection.leadIn: The conditions are—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: that the directors are satisfied that the aggregate value at that time of the company’s fixed assets is not less than the aggregate amount at which they are for the time being stated in the financial statements; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: that it is stated in a note to the referential financial statements that—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the directors have considered the value of the company’s fixed assets without actually revaluing them;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the directors are satisfied that the aggregate value at the time of consideration of those assets is or was not less than the aggregate amount at which they are or were for the time being stated in the financial statements; and

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: accordingly, by virtue of this subsection, amounts are stated in the referential financial statements on the basis that a revaluation of the company’s fixed assets is to be regarded as having taken place at that time.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of this Part, if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on the revaluation of a fixed asset, an unrealized profit is shown to have been made; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on or after the revaluation, a sum is written off or retained for depreciation of the fixed asset over a period,

subsection.continued: the amount by which the sum exceeds the projected sum in relation to the depreciation of that asset over the period is to be regarded as a realized profit made over the period.

subsection.leadIn: In determining whether a company has made a profit or loss on an asset for the purposes of subsection (5), the value given to the asset in the earliest available record of its value made on or after its acquisition by the company is to be regarded as the cost of the asset if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: there is no record of the original cost of the asset; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a record of the original cost of the asset cannot be obtained without unreasonable expense or delay.

subsection.leadIn: In subsection (5)—
subsection.def: projected sum (預計款項), in relation to a depreciation of a fixed asset, means a sum that would have been written off or retained for depreciation if the revaluation of the asset had not been made.

subsection.content: For the purposes of this section, an asset of a company is to be regarded as a fixed asset if it is intended for use in the company’s activities, or otherwise to be held for the purpose of the company’s activities, on a continuing basis.

section.name: s294
section.heading: Distribution in kind: certain amount to be regarded as realized profit
section.content: If a company makes a distribution consisting of or including a non-cash asset, and any part of the amount at which the asset is stated in the referential financial statements represents an unrealized profit, that part of that amount is to be regarded as a realized profit for the purpose of determining, before or after the distribution, the lawfulness of the distribution in accordance with this Part.

section.name: s295
section.heading: Application of Part
