subsection.content: This Part applies in relation to a distribution made on or after the commencement date# of this Part, except a distribution specified in subsection (2).

The excepted distribution is a distribution the amount of which would, had this Part applied in relation to the distribution, be determined under section 302 by reference to the financial items as stated in any financial statements for a financial year or period beginning before the commencement date# of this Part.

section.name: s296
section.heading: Saving for other restraints on distribution
section.content: This Part does not affect any Ordinance or rule of law, or any provision of a company’s articles, restricting the sums out of which, or the cases in which, a distribution may be made.

section.name: s297
section.heading: Prohibition on certain distributions

subsection.content: A company may only make a distribution out of profits available for distribution.

For the purposes of this section, a company’s profits available for distribution are its accumulated, realized profits, so far as not previously utilized by distribution or capitalization, less its accumulated, realized losses, so far as not previously written off in a reduction or reorganization of capital.

section.name: s298
section.heading: Listed company may only make certain distributions

subsection.leadIn: A listed company may only make a distribution—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if the amount of its net assets is not less than the aggregate of its called up share capital and undistributable reserves; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if, and to the extent that, the distribution does not reduce the amount of those assets to an amount less than that aggregate.

subsection.content: A listed company must not include any uncalled share capital as an asset for the purpose of determining the amount of its net assets under this section.

section.name: s299
section.heading: Restriction on application of unrealized profits
section.content: A company must not apply an unrealized profit in paying up debentures or in paying up any amount unpaid on its issued shares.

section.name: s300
section.heading: Financial Secretary may modify or exempt provisions in relation to investment company

subsection.leadIn: On application by an investment company, the Financial Secretary may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: modify, in relation to the company, any of the prohibitions or restrictions in section 297, 298 or 299; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: exempt the company from any of such prohibitions or restrictions.

subsection.content: The Financial Secretary may make a modification or exemption under subsection (1) subject to any terms and conditions that the Financial Secretary thinks fit.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—

def.name: InvestmentCompany
def.leadIn: investment company (投資公司) means a listed company whose principal business consists of investing its funds in securities, land or other assets with the aim of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: spreading investment risk; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: giving its members the benefit of the results of the management of the assets.

section.name: s301
section.heading: Consequences of unlawful distribution

subsection.leadIn: This section applies if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: a company makes a distribution, or part of a distribution, to one of its members in contravention of—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: section 297, 298 or 299; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: a prohibition or restriction in that section as modified under section 300; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: at the time of the distribution, the member knows or has reasonable grounds for believing that the distribution, or that part of the distribution (as the case may be) is made in contravention of that section or modified prohibition or restriction.

subsection.content: If the distribution is made in cash, the member is liable to repay the distribution, or that part of the distribution (as the case may be) to the company.

If the distribution is made otherwise than in cash, the member is liable to pay to the company a sum equal to the value of the distribution or that part of the distribution (as the case may be) at the time of the distribution.
This section does not affect any obligation otherwise imposed on a member of a company to repay a distribution unlawfully made to the member.

subsection.leadIn: This section does not apply in relation to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any payment made by a company in respect of the redemption or buy-back by the company of shares in itself; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any financial assistance given by a company in contravention of section 275.

section.name: s302
section.heading: Justification of distribution by reference to financial statements
section.content: The amount of a distribution that may be made without contravening section 297, 298 or 299, or a prohibition or restriction in that section as modified under section 300, is to be determined by reference to the financial items as stated in the financial statements specified in Division 4.

section.name: s303
section.heading: Successive distributions

subsection.leadIn: This section applies if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a company proposes to make a distribution pursuant to determinations made by reference to financial items as stated in any financial statements; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the company—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: has made one or more prior distributions pursuant to determinations made by reference to financial items as stated in the financial statements; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: since the financial statements were prepared, has given financial assistance specified in subsection (3) or has made a payment specified in subsection (4).

subsection.content: Section 302 applies for the purpose of determining the amount of the proposed distribution that may be made without contravening section 297, 298 or 299, or a prohibition or restriction in that section as modified under section 300, as if the amount of the proposed distribution were increased by the amount of the prior distributions, financial assistance and other payments.

subsection.leadIn: The financial assistance is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: financial assistance that is given by the company out of its distributable profits; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: financial assistance—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: that is given by the company in contravention of Division 5 of Part 5; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the giving of which reduces the company’s net assets or increases its net liabilities.

subsection.leadIn: The payment is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a payment made by the company in respect of the buy-back by the company of shares in itself (except a payment lawfully made otherwise than out of distributable profits); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a payment made by the company of any description specified in section 257(5) (except a payment lawfully made otherwise than out of distributable profits).

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: liabilities (負債) has the meaning given by section 274(1);

net assets (淨資產), in relation to a company that gives any financial assistance, means the amount by which the aggregate of the company’s assets exceeds the aggregate of its liabilities (taking the amount of both assets and liabilities to be as stated in the company’s accounting records immediately before the financial assistance is given);

net liabilities (淨負債), in relation to a company that gives any financial assistance, means the amount by which the aggregate of the company’s liabilities exceeds the aggregate of its assets (taking the amount of both assets and liabilities to be as stated in the company’s accounting records immediately before the financial assistance is given).

section.name: s304
section.heading: Last annual financial statements specified for purposes of section 302

subsection.content: Subject to sections 305 and 306, the financial statements specified for the purposes of section 302 are the financial statements prepared by the directors for the previous financial year, in relation to which subsections (2), (3), (4), (5) and (6) are complied with.

subsection.leadIn: The financial statements must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: have been laid before the company in general meeting under section 429(1); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: have been sent to every member under section 430(3).

subsection.leadIn: The financial statements must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: have been properly prepared in accordance with Subdivision 3 of Division 4 of Part 9; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: have been properly prepared in accordance with Subdivision 3 of Division 4 of Part 9, except only in relation to the matters that are not material for the purpose specified in subsection (8).

subsection.content: The company’s auditor must have prepared a report on the financial statements under section 405.

If, in the auditor’s report, the auditor has not given an unqualified opinion to the effect that the financial statements have been properly prepared in compliance with this Ordinance, the auditor must have given a written statement as to whether, in the auditor’s opinion, the matter in respect of which the report is qualified is material for the purpose specified in subsection (8).

subsection.leadIn: A written statement under subsection (5)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: may be made at the time of the report or subsequently; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: must be laid before the company in general meeting or sent to every member to whom the auditor’s report is sent under section 430(3).

subsection.content: A written statement under subsection (5) is sufficient for the purpose of a distribution to which it relates and that has been proposed. If such a written statement relates to distributions of any particular description, the statement is also sufficient for the purpose of a distribution included in those distributions, even though the distribution has not been proposed at the time of the statement.

The purpose specified for subsections (3) and (5) is the purpose of determining, by reference to the financial items as stated in the financial statements, whether the distribution would be made in contravention of section 297, 298 or 299, or a prohibition or restriction in that section as modified under section 300.

section.name: s305
section.heading: Interim financial statements specified for purposes of section 302

subsection.content: This section applies where the distribution would be made in contravention of section 297, 298 or 299, or a prohibition or restriction in that section as modified under section 300, if the amount of distribution that may be made were determined by reference to the financial items as stated in the financial statements specified in section 304.

subsection.leadIn: The financial statements specified for the purposes of section 302 are the company’s financial statements—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: in the case of a listed company—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: that is necessary to enable a reasonable judgement to be made as to the amounts of the financial items; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: in relation to which subsections (3), (5) and (6) are complied with; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the case of any other company, that is necessary to enable a reasonable judgement to be made as to the amounts of the financial items.

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (4), the financial statements must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: have been properly prepared in accordance with Subdivision 3 of Division 4 of Part 9; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: have been properly prepared in accordance with Subdivision 3 of Division 4 of Part 9, except only in relation to the matters that are not material for the purpose of determining, by reference to the financial items as stated in the financial statements, whether the distribution would be made in contravention of section 297, 298 or 299, or a prohibition or restriction in that section as modified under section 300.

subsection.content: The requirement under subsection (3) for any financial statements to be properly prepared in accordance with Subdivision 3 of Division 4 of Part 9 has effect subject to any modification that is necessary for applying that requirement to the financial statements prepared otherwise than for a financial year.

subsection.leadIn: A statement of financial position that forms part of the financial statements—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: must be approved by the directors;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: must be signed by 2 directors on the directors’ behalf; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: must state the name of the directors who signed the statement on the directors’ behalf.

subsection.content: A copy of the financial statements must have been delivered to the Registrar for registration.

section.name: s306
section.heading: Initial financial statements specified for purposes of section 302

subsection.leadIn: If the distribution is proposed to be declared before any financial statements are laid before the company in general meeting under section 429(1) or sent to every member under section 430(3), the financial statements specified for the purposes of section 302 are the company’s financial statements—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: in the case of a listed company—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: that are necessary to enable a reasonable judgement to be made as to the amounts of the financial items; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: in relation to which subsections (2), (4), (5), (6) and (7) are complied with; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the case of any other company, that are necessary to enable a reasonable judgement to be made as to the amounts of the financial items.

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (3), the financial statements must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: have been properly prepared in accordance with Subdivision 3 of Division 4 of Part 9; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: have been properly prepared in accordance with Subdivision 3 of Division 4 of Part 9, except only in relation to the matters that are not material for the purpose specified in subsection (8).

subsection.content: The requirement under subsection (2) for any financial statements to be properly prepared in accordance with Subdivision 3 of Division 4 of Part 9 has effect subject to any modification that is necessary for applying that requirement to any financial statements prepared otherwise than for a financial year.

subsection.leadIn: A statement of financial position that forms part of the financial statements—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: must be approved by the directors;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: must be signed by 2 directors on the directors’ behalf; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: must state the name of the directors who signed the statement on the directors’ behalf.

subsection.content: The company’s auditor must have prepared a report on the financial statements stating whether, in the auditor’s opinion, the financial statements satisfy subsection (2)(a).

If, in the auditor’s report, the auditor has not given an unqualified opinion to the effect that the financial statements satisfy subsection (2)(a), the auditor must have given a written statement as to whether, in the auditor’s opinion, the matter in respect of which the report is qualified is material for the purpose specified in subsection (8).
A copy of the financial statements, of the auditor’s report of the financial statements, and of any written statement under subsection (6), must have been delivered to the Registrar for registration.

The purpose specified for subsections (2) and (6) is the purpose of determining, by reference to the financial items as stated in the financial statements, whether the distribution would be made in contravention of section 297, 298 or 299, or a prohibition or restriction in that section as modified under section 300.

part.name: P7
part.heading: Debentures

section.name: s307
section.heading: Interpretation
section.leadIn: In this Part—
section.def: branch register (登記支冊) means a branch register kept under section 312;

def.name: Debenture
def.leadIn: debenture (債權證), in relation to a company—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: includes bonds and any other debt securities of the company, whether or not constituting a charge on the assets of the company; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: except in sections 308, 311(2)(a), 312 and 331(1)(a) and Divisions 3 and 4, includes debenture stock;

section.def: register of debenture holders (債權證持有人登記冊) means a register kept under section 308.

section.name: s308
section.heading: Register of debenture holders

subsection.content: If a company issues a series of debentures, or any debenture stock, that are not transferable by delivery, the company must keep in the English or Chinese language a register of the holders of the debentures or debenture stock.

subsection.leadIn: A company must enter in the register of debenture holders—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the name and address of each holder of debentures or debenture stock;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the amount of debentures or debenture stock held by each holder;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the date on which each person is entered in the register as a holder of debentures or debenture stock; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the date on which any person ceases to be a holder of debentures or debenture stock.

subsection.content: If a company contravenes subsection (1) or (2), the company, and every responsible person of the company, commit an offence, and each is liable to a fine at level 4 and, in the case of a continuing offence, to a further fine of $700 for each day during which the offence continues.

section.name: s309
section.heading: Place where register must be kept

subsection.leadIn: A company must keep its register of debenture holders at—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the company’s registered office; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a place prescribed by regulations made under section 657.

subsection.content: A company must notify the Registrar of the place at which the register of debenture holders is kept. The notice must be in the specified form and delivered to the Registrar for registration within 15 days after the register is first kept at that place.

A company must notify the Registrar of any change (other than a change of the address of the company’s registered office) in the place at which the register of debenture holders is kept. The notice must be in the specified form and delivered to the Registrar for registration within 15 days after the change.

subsection.leadIn: Subsection (2) does not require a company to notify the Registrar of the place at which the register of debenture holders is kept—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if, in the case of a register that came into existence on or after the commencement date# of this Division, it has at all times been kept at the company’s registered office; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: if—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: immediately before that commencement date#, the company kept a register for the purposes of section 74A of the predecessor Ordinance; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: on and after that commencement date#, that register is kept as a register of debenture holders for the purposes of section 308(1) at the place at which it was kept immediately before that commencement date#.

subsection.content: If a company contravenes subsection (1), (2) or (3), the company, and every responsible person of the company, commit an offence, and each is liable to a fine at level 4 and, in the case of a continuing offence, to a further fine of $700 for each day during which the offence continues.

section.name: s310
section.heading: Right to inspect and request copy

subsection.content: A member of a company is entitled, on request made in the prescribed manner and without charge, to inspect the register of debenture holders of the company in accordance with regulations made under section 657.

A person who is registered in the register as a debenture holder of the company is entitled, on request made in the prescribed manner and without charge, to inspect the register in accordance with regulations made under section 657.
Any other person is entitled, on request made in the prescribed manner and on payment of a prescribed fee, to inspect the register in accordance with regulations made under section 657.

A person is entitled, on request and on payment of a prescribed fee, to be provided with a copy of the register of debenture holders of a company, or any part of it, in accordance with regulations made under section 657.

A debenture holder of a company or the trustee for all debenture holders of a company is entitled, on request and on payment of a prescribed fee, to be provided with a copy of any trust deed or any other document securing the issue of the debentures in accordance with regulations made under section 657.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: prescribed (訂明) means prescribed by regulations made under section 657.

section.name: s311
section.heading: Power to close register of debenture holders

subsection.content: A company may, on giving notice in accordance with subsection (2), close its register of debenture holders, or any part of it, for any period or periods not exceeding in the whole 30 days in each year.

subsection.leadIn: A notice for the purposes of subsection (1)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: in the case of a company having any of the debentures or debenture stock mentioned in section 308(1) listed on a recognized stock market, must be given—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: in accordance with the listing rules applicable to the stock market; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: by advertisement in a newspaper circulating generally in Hong Kong; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the case of any other company, must be given by advertisement in a newspaper circulating generally in Hong Kong.

subsection.content: The period of 30 days mentioned in subsection (1) may be extended in respect of any year by a resolution passed in that year by a majority in value of the debenture holders present in person or, if proxies are permitted, by proxy at a meeting summoned for the purpose or otherwise in accordance with the trust deed or any other document securing the issue of the debentures.
The period of 30 days mentioned in subsection (1) must not be extended for a further period or periods exceeding 30 days in the whole in any year.

A company must, on demand, provide any person seeking to inspect a register or part of a register that is closed under this section with a certificate signed by the company secretary of the company stating the period for which, and by whose authority, it is closed.
If a company contravenes subsection (5), the company, and every responsible person of the company, commit an offence, and each is liable to a fine at level 3.

section.name: s312
section.heading: Branch register of debenture holders

subsection.content: If a company issues in a place outside Hong Kong a series of debentures, or any debenture stock, that are not transferable by delivery, the company may, if it is authorized to do so by its articles, cause to be kept there a branch register of the holders of the debentures or debenture stock who are resident there.

A company that begins to keep a branch register must deliver to the Registrar for registration a notice in the specified form within 15 days after doing so, stating the address where the branch register is kept.

A company that keeps a branch register must deliver to the Registrar for registration a notice in the specified form of any change in the address where the branch register is kept, within 15 days after the change.

If a company contravenes subsection (2) or (3), the company, and every responsible person of the company, commit an offence, and each is liable to a fine at level 4 and, in the case of a continuing offence, to a further fine of $700 for each day during which the offence continues.

section.name: s313
section.heading: Keeping of branch register

subsection.def: A branch register must be kept in the same manner in which the company’s register of debenture holders (the principal register) is by this Ordinance required to be kept.

subsection.content: A company that keeps a branch register may close it in the same manner in which the principal register may be closed under section 311 except that the advertisement mentioned in that section must be inserted in a newspaper circulating generally in the place in which the branch register is kept.

subsection.leadIn: A company that keeps a branch register—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: must cause a duplicate of it to be kept at the place at which the company’s principal register is kept; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: must, within 15 days after an entry is made in the branch register—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: transmit a copy of the entry to its registered office; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: update the duplicate of the branch register.

subsection.content: A duplicate of a branch register is to be regarded for all the purposes of this Ordinance as part of the principal register.
Subject to the provisions of this Ordinance, a company may by its articles make any provision that it thinks fit respecting the keeping of branch registers.

If a company contravenes subsection (3), the company, and every responsible person of the company, commit an offence, and each is liable to a fine at level 4 and, in the case of a continuing offence, to a further fine of $700 for each day during which the offence continues.

section.name: s314
section.heading: Transactions in debentures registered in branch register

subsection.content: The debentures registered in a branch register of a company must be distinguished from those registered in the company’s register of debenture holders.
No transaction with respect to any debentures registered in a branch register may, during the continuance of that registration, be registered in any other register.

section.name: s315
section.heading: Discontinuance of branch register

subsection.content: A company may discontinue a branch register.

subsection.leadIn: If a company discontinues a branch register, all the entries in that register must be transferred to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: some other branch register kept in the same place outside Hong Kong by the company; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the company’s register of debenture holders.

subsection.leadIn: If a company discontinues a branch register, it must, within 15 days after the discontinuance, deliver to the Registrar for registration a notice in the specified form informing the Registrar of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the discontinuance; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the register to which the entries have been transferred.

subsection.content: If a company contravenes subsection (3), the company, and every responsible person of the company, commit an offence, and each is liable to a fine at level 4 and, in the case of a continuing offence, to a further fine of $700 for each day during which the offence continues.

division.name: D3
division.heading: Allotment of Debentures or Debenture Stock

section.name: s316
section.heading: Return of allotment

subsection.content: Within one month after an allotment of debentures or debenture stock, a company must deliver to the Registrar for registration a return of the allotment that complies with subsection (2).

subsection.leadIn: A return—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: must be in the specified form; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: must state—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the amount of debentures or debenture stock allotted;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the name and address of each allottee;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: the date of allotment of debentures or debenture stock; and

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: the date of redemption of debentures or debenture stock.

subsection.name: 2A
subsection.content: Subsection (2)(b)(ii) does not apply if the debentures or debenture stock are transferable by delivery. (Added 35 of 2018 s. 28)

If a company contravenes subsection (1), the company, and every responsible person of the company, commit an offence, and each is liable to a fine at level 4 and, in the case of a continuing offence, to a further fine of $700 for each day during which the offence continues.

If a company fails to deliver a return that complies with subsection (2) within one month after an allotment of debentures or debenture stock, the Court may, on application by the company or a responsible person of the company, extend the period for delivery of the return by a period determined by the Court.

subsection.leadIn: The Court may extend a period under subsection (4) only if it is satisfied—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: that failure to deliver the return was accidental or due to inadvertence; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: that it is just and equitable to extend the period.

subsection.content: If the Court extends the period for delivery of a return, any liability already incurred by the company or a responsible person of the company for an offence under subsection (3) is extinguished and subsection (1) has effect as if the reference to one month were a reference to the extended period.

section.name: s317
section.heading: Registration of allotment

subsection.content: A company must register an allotment of debentures or debenture stock as soon as practicable and in any event within 2 months after the date of the allotment, by entering in its register of debenture holders the information mentioned in section 308(2).

If a company fails to register an allotment of debentures or debenture stock within 2 months after the date of the allotment, the company, and every responsible person of the company, commit an offence, and each is liable to a fine at level 4 and, in the case of a continuing offence, to a further fine of $700 for each day during which the offence continues.

section.name: s318
section.heading: Issue of debenture or certificate for debenture stock on allotment

subsection.leadIn: Within 2 months after an allotment of debentures or debenture stock, a company must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the case of an allotment of debentures, complete the debentures and have them ready for delivery; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the case of an allotment of debenture stock, complete the certificates for the debenture stock and have them ready for delivery.

subsection.content: Subsection (1) does not apply if the conditions of allotment of the debentures or debenture stock provide otherwise.

If a company contravenes subsection (1), the company, and every responsible person of the company, commit an offence, and each is liable to a fine at level 4 and, in the case of a continuing offence, to a further fine of $700 for each day during which the offence continues.

section.name: s319
section.heading: Court order for delivery of debenture or certificate for debenture stock

subsection.content: If a company contravenes section 318 in relation to an allotment of debentures or debenture stock, a person entitled to the debentures or certificates for the debenture stock may serve a notice on the company requiring it to deliver the debentures or certificates to the person within 10 days.

If a company on which a notice has been served under subsection (1) does not deliver the debentures or certificates within 10 days after service of the notice, the person may apply to the Court for an order under subsection (3).

On an application under subsection (2), the Court may make an order directing the company and any officer of the company to deliver the debentures or certificates to the person within the period specified in the order.
The order may provide that all costs of and incidental to the application are to be borne by the company or by an officer of the company responsible for the contravention.

division.name: D4
division.heading: Transfer of Debentures or Debenture Stock

section.name: s320
section.heading: Requirement for instrument of transfer

subsection.content: A company must not register a transfer of debentures or debenture stock of the company unless a proper instrument of transfer has been delivered to the company.
Subsection (1) does not affect any power of a company to register as a debenture holder a person to whom the right to debentures or debenture stock has been transmitted by operation of law.

section.name: s321
section.heading: Registration of transfer or refusal of registration

subsection.content: The transferee or transferor of debentures or debenture stock of a company may lodge the transfer with the company.

subsection.leadIn: Within 2 months after the transfer is lodged, the company must either—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: register the transfer; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: send the transferee and the transferor notice of refusal to register the transfer.

subsection.content: If a company contravenes subsection (2), the company, and every responsible person of the company, commit an offence, and each is liable to a fine at level 4 and, in the case of a continuing offence, to a further fine of $700 for each day during which the offence continues.

section.name: s322
section.heading: Certification of transfer

subsection.leadIn: The certification by a company of an instrument of transfer of any debentures or debenture stock of the company—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is a representation by the company to any person acting on the faith of the certification that documents have been produced to the company that evidence title to the debentures or debenture stock in the transferor named in the instrument; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: is not a representation that the transferor has any title to the debentures or debenture stock.

subsection.content: If a person acts on the faith of a false certification by a company made negligently, the company is under the same liability to the person as if the certification had been made fraudulently.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of this section, an instrument of transfer is certified by a company if it bears—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the words “certificate lodged”, or words to the same effect, in English or Chinese; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: under or adjacent to those words, the signature or initials of a person having the actual or apparent authority to certify transfers on behalf of the company.

subsection.leadIn: Unless the contrary is proved, a signature or initials appearing on an instrument of transfer as mentioned in subsection (3)(b) must be regarded—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: as the signature or initials of the person whose signature or initials they purport to be; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: as having been placed on the instrument by that person or by another person who has the actual or apparent authority to use the signature or initials for the purpose of certifying transfers on behalf of the company.

section.name: s323
section.heading: Issue of debenture or certificate for debenture stock on transfer

subsection.leadIn: Within the period specified in subsection (2), a company must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the case of a transfer of debentures, complete the debentures and have them ready for delivery; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the case of a transfer of debenture stock, complete the certificates for the debenture stock and have them ready for delivery.

subsection.leadIn: The period is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: for a private company, 2 months after the day on which the transfer is lodged with the company;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: for any other company, 10 business days after the day on which the transfer is lodged with the company.

subsection.leadIn: Subsection (1) does not apply to a transfer if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the conditions of issue of the debentures or debenture stock provide otherwise;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: stamp duty has not been paid in respect of the transfer;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the transfer is invalid; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the company, being entitled to do so, refuses to register the transfer.

subsection.content: If a company contravenes subsection (1), the company, and every responsible person of the company, commit an offence, and each is liable to a fine at level 4 and, in the case of a continuing offence, to a further fine of $700 for each day during which the offence continues.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: business day (營業日) means a day on which a recognized stock market is open for the business of dealing in securities.

section.name: s324
section.heading: Court order for delivery of debenture or certificate for debenture stock

subsection.content: If a company contravenes section 323 in relation to a transfer of debentures or debenture stock, a person entitled to the debentures or certificates for the debenture stock may serve a notice on the company requiring it to deliver the debentures or certificates to the person within 10 days.

If a company on which a notice has been served under subsection (1) does not deliver the debentures or certificates within 10 days after service of the notice, the person may apply to the Court for an order under subsection (3).

On an application under subsection (2), the Court may make an order directing the company and any officer of the company to deliver the debentures or certificates to the person within the period specified in the order.
The order may provide that all costs of and incidental to the application are to be borne by the company or by an officer of the company responsible for the contravention.

section.name: s325
section.heading: Evidence of grant of probate etc.
section.content: For the purposes of a transfer of debentures or transmission of the right to debentures, a company must accept as sufficient evidence of the grant of probate of the will or letters of administration of a deceased person the production to the company of a document that is by law sufficient evidence of that grant.

section.name: s326
section.heading: Form of register of holders of debentures kept under instrument made by company

subsection.content: This section applies to a register of holders of debentures that is required to be kept under an instrument made by a company.

subsection.leadIn: If a provision of the instrument requires the register to be kept in a legible form, the provision is to be construed as requiring the register to be kept either—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in a legible form; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in a non-legible form capable of being reproduced in a legible form.

section.name: s327
section.heading: Perpetual debentures

subsection.leadIn: Despite any rule of equity to the contrary, a condition contained in any debentures, or in a deed securing the issue of any debentures, is not invalid only because the debentures are, by the condition, made—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: irredeemable;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: redeemable only on the happening of a contingency (however remote); or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: redeemable only on the expiration of a period of time (however long).

subsection.content: Subsection (1) applies to debentures whenever issued and to deeds whenever executed.

section.name: s328
section.heading: Power to reissue redeemed debentures

subsection.content: This section applies if a company has, whether before, on or after the commencement date# of this section, redeemed any debentures previously issued.

subsection.leadIn: A company has, and is to be regarded as always having had, the power to reissue redeemed debentures, either by reissuing the same debentures or by issuing new debentures in their place, unless—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a provision to the contrary (express or implied) is contained in the company’s articles or any contract made by the company; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the company has, by passing a resolution to that effect or by any other act, manifested its intention that the debentures are to be cancelled.

subsection.content: On a reissue of any redeemed debentures, a person entitled to the debentures has, and is to be regarded as always having had, the same priorities as if the debentures had never been redeemed.

subsection.leadIn: A reissue of redeemed debentures, whether before, on or after the commencement date# of this section—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is to be regarded as an issue of new debentures for the purposes of stamp duty; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: is not to be regarded as an issue of new debentures for the purposes of any provision limiting the amount or number of debentures to be issued.

subsection.content: A person lending money on the security of any debentures reissued under this section that appear to be stamped may give the debentures in evidence in any proceedings for enforcing the person’s security.

If a person gives the debentures in evidence in any proceedings for enforcing the person’s security under subsection (5), the stamp duty and penalty payable under the Stamp Duty Ordinance (Cap. 117) in respect of the reissue of the debentures are to be paid by the company.
Subsections (5) and (6) do not apply if the person had notice or, but for the person’s negligence, might have discovered that the debentures were not stamped.

If any debentures redeemed before 1 July 1933 are reissued on or after that date, the reissue does not prejudice, and is to be regarded as never having prejudiced, any right or priority that a person would have had under or by virtue of any mortgage or charge created before that date.

section.name: s329
section.heading: Deposit of debentures to secure advances
section.content: If a company has, whether before, on or after the commencement date# of this section, deposited any of its debentures to secure advances from time to time on current account or otherwise, the debentures are not to be regarded as having been redeemed only because the account of the company has ceased to be in debit while the debentures remained so deposited.

section.name: s330
section.heading: Specific performance of contracts to subscribe for debentures
section.content: A contract with a company to take up and pay for any debentures of the company may be enforced by an order for specific performance.

section.name: s331
section.heading: Court may order meeting of debenture holders

subsection.leadIn: This section applies to any person who holds—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any debentures that form part of a series issued by a company and rank equally with the other debentures of that series; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any debenture stock of a company.

subsection.content: If a person to whom this section applies, either alone or jointly with any other such person, holds at least the specified percentage of the value of the company’s debentures, the person may apply to the Court for a meeting of the company’s debenture holders to be held to give directions to the trustee for the debenture holders.
Subsection (2) may be excluded by the debentures, or the trust deeds or other documents securing the issue of the debentures.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—

def.name: SpecifiedPercentage
def.leadIn: specified percentage (指明百分比) means—

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the higher percentage that may be provided for in the debentures, or the trust deeds or other documents securing the issue of the debentures.

section.name: s332
section.heading: Liability of trustees for debenture holders

subsection.leadIn: A provision contained in—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a trust deed securing an issue of debentures; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a contract with the holders of debentures secured by a trust deed,

subsection.continued: is void to the extent that it would exempt a trustee of the trust deed from, or indemnify the trustee against, liability for breach of trust for the trustee’s failure to show the degree of care and diligence required of the trustee as a trustee, having regard to the provisions of the trust deed conferring on the trustee any powers, authorities or discretions.

subsection.leadIn: Subsection (1) does not—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: invalidate a release otherwise validly given in respect of anything done, or omitted to be done, by a trustee before the giving of the release;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: invalidate any provision enabling such a release to be given—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: on being agreed to by a majority of at least 75% in value of the debenture holders present and voting in person or, if proxies are permitted, by proxy at a meeting summoned for the purpose; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: either with respect to specific acts or omissions or on the trustee dying or ceasing to act;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: invalidate any provision in force on 31 August 1984 so long as any person who is then entitled to the benefit of the provision, or who is afterwards given the benefit of the provision under subsection (3), remains a trustee of the trust deed; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: deprive any person of any exemption or right to be indemnified in respect of anything done, or omitted to be done, by the person while any provision mentioned in paragraph (c) was in force.

subsection.leadIn: While a trustee of a trust deed remains entitled to the benefit of a provision saved by subsection (2)(c) or (d), the benefit may be given, in accordance with subsection (4), to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: all present and future trustees of the trust deed; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any named trustees or proposed trustees of the trust deed.

subsection.leadIn: The benefit is to be given by a resolution passed by a majority of at least 75% in value of the debenture holders present in person or, if proxies are permitted, by proxy at a meeting summoned for the purpose—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in accordance with the provisions of the trust deed; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the trust deed makes no provision for summoning meetings, in a manner approved by the Court.

part.name: P8
part.heading: Registration of Charges

section.name: s333
section.heading: Interpretation

subsection.leadIn: In this Part—
subsection.def: charge (押記) includes mortgage;

manager (經理人) excludes a special manager of the estate or business of a company or registered non-Hong Kong company appointed under section 216 of the Companies (Winding Up and Miscellaneous Provisions) Ordinance (Cap. 32).

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of this Part—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if a ship or aircraft of a registered non-Hong Kong company is registered in Hong Kong, it is to be regarded as property in Hong Kong of the company even though it is physically located outside Hong Kong; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if a ship or aircraft of a registered non-Hong Kong company is registered in a place outside Hong Kong, it is to be regarded as property outside Hong Kong of the company even though it is physically located in Hong Kong.

subsection.content: In Divisions 2 and 4, a reference to a person interested in a charge excludes the company or registered non-Hong Kong company creating the charge.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of Divisions 2 and 3, a copy of an instrument in relation to a charge delivered for registration is a certified copy if it is certified as a true copy—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: by—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: a director or company secretary of the company or registered non-Hong Kong company delivering the copy for registration; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: a person authorized by that company or registered non-Hong Kong company for the purpose; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: by—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: any other person interested in the charge; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.leadIn: in the case of—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: an interested person who is a natural person, a person authorized by the interested person for the purpose; or

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: an interested person that is a body corporate, a person authorized by the interested person for the purpose, or a director or company secretary of the interested person.

subsection.leadIn: In Division 6, a reference to the charged property of a registered non-Hong Kong company is a reference to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the property in Hong Kong of the company and subject to a charge created by the company, except property that was not in Hong Kong when the charge was created; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the property in Hong Kong of the company and subject to a charge that subsisted when the property was acquired by the company, except property that was not in Hong Kong when it was so acquired.

division.name: D2
division.heading: Obligation to Register Specified Charges after Creation

section.name: s334
section.heading: Specified charge

subsection.leadIn: In this Division, a reference to a specified charge is a reference to any of the following charges created on or after the material date— (Amended 14 of 2025 s. 16)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a charge on uncalled share capital of the company;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a charge created or evidenced by an instrument that, if executed by a natural person, would require registration as a bill of sale;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a charge on land (wherever situate) or any interest in land, except a charge for any rent or other periodical sum issuing out of land;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: a charge on book debts of the company;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: a charge on calls made but not paid;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: a charge on instalments due, but not paid, on the issue price of shares;

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: a charge on a ship or any share in a ship;

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.content: a charge on an aircraft or any share in an aircraft;

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.leadIn: a charge on—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: goodwill;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: a patent or a licence under a patent;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: a trademark; or

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: a copyright or a licence under a copyright;

paragraph.name: j
paragraph.content: a floating charge on the company’s undertaking or property.

subsection.content: For the purposes of subsection (1)(c), the holding of debentures entitling the holder to a charge on land is not to be regarded as an interest in the land.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsection (1)(d)—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: if a company maintains a deposit of money with another person (whether the money is deposited by the company or by any other person for the company’s benefit), a charge on the company’s right to repayment of the money is not to be regarded as a charge on book debts of the company.

subsection.content: For the purposes of subsection (1)(d) and (j), if a company charters a ship from a shipowner, the shipowner’s lien on the subfreights for amounts due under the charter is not to be regarded as a charge on book debts of the company or as a floating charge on the company’s undertaking or property.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—

def.name: MaterialDate
def.leadIn: material date (關鍵日期)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: for a company that is not a re-domiciled company—means 3 March 2014; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: for a re-domiciled company—means the re-domiciliation date. (Added 14 of 2025 s. 16)

section.name: s335
section.heading: Company must register specified charge created by it

subsection.content: A company must deliver a statement of the particulars of every specified charge created by the company, together with a certified copy of the instrument (if any) creating or evidencing the charge, to the Registrar for registration within the registration period specified in subsection (5)(a).

subsection.leadIn: Where—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: a specified charge created by a company—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: is given in a debenture forming part of a series by reference to any other instrument containing the charge (whether or not also contained in the debenture); or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: is contained in a debenture forming part of a series (but not given in the debenture by reference to any other instrument); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: every holder of the debentures of the series is entitled equally to the benefit of the charge,

subsection.continued: the company is to be regarded as having complied with subsection (1) in relation to the specified charge if the company delivers a statement of the particulars of the charge, together with a certified copy of an instrument specified in subsection (4), to the Registrar for registration within the registration period specified in subsection (5)(b).

subsection.leadIn: A person interested in a specified charge—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: may deliver a statement of the particulars of the charge, together with a certified copy of the instrument (if any) creating or evidencing the charge, to the Registrar for registration within the registration period specified in subsection (5)(a); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: may, in the case of subsection (2), deliver a statement of the particulars of the charge, together with a certified copy of an instrument specified in subsection (4), to the Registrar for registration within the registration period specified in subsection (5)(b).

subsection.leadIn: The instrument is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: for the purposes of subsection (2)(a)(i), the instrument by reference to which the specified charge is given; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: for the purposes of subsection (2)(a)(ii), any one debenture of the series.

subsection.leadIn: The registration period is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: for the purposes of subsection (1) or (3)(a)—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: one month after the date on which the specified charge is created; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: where the specified charge is created outside Hong Kong and comprising property situate outside Hong Kong, one month after the date on which a certified copy of the instrument creating or evidencing that charge could, if despatched with due diligence, have been received in Hong Kong in due course of post; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: for the purposes of subsection (2) or (3)(b)—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: one month after the execution of the instrument by reference to which the specified charge is given or if there is no such instrument, one month after the execution of the first debenture of the series; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: where the specified charge is created outside Hong Kong and comprising property situate outside Hong Kong, one month after the date on which a certified copy of the specified instrument could, if despatched with due diligence, have been received in Hong Kong in due course of post.

subsection.leadIn: A statement of the particulars of a specified charge—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: must be in the specified form; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: must be accompanied by the prescribed fee.

subsection.content: If a person interested in a specified charge pays to the Registrar any prescribed fee for the registration of a statement of the particulars of the charge, the fee is recoverable from the company creating the charge.

If a specified charge is created in Hong Kong and comprises property situate outside Hong Kong, a certified copy of the instrument creating or purporting to create the charge may be delivered to the Registrar for registration under subsection (1), (2) or (3) even though further proceedings may be necessary to make that charge valid or effectual according to the law of the place in which the property is situate.

section.name: s336
section.heading: Registered non-Hong Kong company must register specified charge created by it

subsection.content: A registered non-Hong Kong company must deliver a statement of the particulars of every specified charge created by the company on property in Hong Kong of the company, together with a certified copy of the instrument (if any) creating or evidencing the charge, to the Registrar for registration within the registration period specified in subsection (6)(a).

subsection.leadIn: Where—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: a specified charge created by a registered non-Hong Kong company on property in Hong Kong of the company—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: is given in a debenture forming part of a series by reference to any other instrument containing the charge (whether or not also contained in the debenture); or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: is contained in a debenture forming part of a series (but not given in the debenture by reference to any other instrument); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: every holder of the debentures of the series is entitled equally to the benefit of the charge,

subsection.continued: the company is to be regarded as having complied with subsection (1) in relation to the specified charge if the company delivers a statement of the particulars of the charge, together with a certified copy of an instrument specified in subsection (4), to the Registrar for registration within the registration period specified in subsection (6)(b).

subsection.leadIn: A person interested in a specified charge—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: may deliver a statement of the particulars of the charge, together with a certified copy of the instrument (if any) creating or evidencing the charge, to the Registrar for registration within the registration period specified in subsection (6)(a); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: may, in the case of subsection (2), deliver a statement of the particulars of the charge, together with a certified copy of an instrument specified in subsection (4), to the Registrar for registration within the registration period specified in subsection (6)(b).

subsection.leadIn: The instrument is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: for the purposes of subsection (2)(a)(i), the instrument by reference to which the specified charge is given; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: for the purposes of subsection (2)(a)(ii), any one debenture of the series.

subsection.content: Subsections (1) and (2) do not apply to a charge on property if the property was not in Hong Kong when the charge was created by the registered non-Hong Kong company.

subsection.leadIn: The registration period is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: for the purposes of subsection (1) or (3)(a), one month after the date on which the specified charge is created; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: for the purposes of subsection (2) or (3)(b)—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: one month after the execution of the instrument by reference to which the specified charge is given; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: if there is no such instrument, one month after the execution of the first debenture of the series.

subsection.leadIn: A statement of the particulars of a specified charge—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: must be in the specified form; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: must be accompanied by the prescribed fee.

subsection.content: If a person interested in a specified charge pays to the Registrar any prescribed fee for the registration of a statement of the particulars of the charge, the fee is recoverable from the registered non-Hong Kong company creating the charge.

section.name: s336A
section.heading: Supplementary provisions for section 336—where company incorporated outside Hong Kong ceases to be registered non-Hong Kong company because of registration under section 820C

subsection.leadIn: This section applies if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a company incorporated outside Hong Kong becomes a re-domiciled company (re-domiciliation); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: immediately before the re-domiciliation, the company is required, but has yet, to comply with the requirement under section 336(1) (requirement) in relation to a charge.

subsection.leadIn: Despite the re-domiciliation—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the company is required to comply with the requirement in relation to the charge; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: section 336(2), (3) and (8) applies in relation to the charge,

subsection.continued: as if the re-domiciliation had not taken place and the company were still a registered non-Hong Kong company.

section.name: s337
section.heading: Consequences of contravention of section 335 or 336

subsection.leadIn: This section applies if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a company contravenes section 335(1) in relation to a charge, and a person interested in the charge has not registered the charge under section 335(3); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a registered non-Hong Kong company, or a company to which section 336A applies, contravenes section 336(1) in relation to a charge, and a person interested in the charge has not registered the charge under section 336(3).

subsection.content: Subject to section 346, the company, and every responsible person of the company, commit an offence.

A person who commits an offence under subsection (2) is liable to a fine at level 5 and, in the case of a continuing offence, to a further fine of $1,000 for each day during which the offence continues.
Subject to section 346, the charge is void against any liquidator and creditor of the company so far as any security on its undertaking or property is conferred by the charge.
Subsection (4) does not prejudice any contract or obligation for repayment of the money secured by the charge.
At the lender’s option, the money secured by a charge becomes immediately payable when the charge becomes void under subsection (4).

section.name: s338
section.heading: Company must register charge existing on property acquired

subsection.leadIn: This section applies if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a company acquires property subject to a charge; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the charge is of a kind that a statement of its particulars would have been required by section 335(1) to be delivered for registration had it been created by the company after the acquisition.

subsection.content: The company must deliver a statement of the particulars of the charge, together with a certified copy of the instrument (if any) creating or evidencing the charge, to the Registrar for registration within the registration period specified in subsection (3).

subsection.leadIn: The registration period is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: one month after the date on which the acquisition is completed; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: where the property is situate, and the charge was created, outside Hong Kong, one month after the date on which a certified copy of the instrument creating or evidencing the charge could, if despatched with due diligence, have been received in Hong Kong in due course of post.

subsection.leadIn: A statement of the particulars of a charge—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: must be in the specified form; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: must be accompanied by the prescribed fee.

subsection.content: Subject to section 346, if a company contravenes subsection (2), the company, and every responsible person of the company, commit an offence.

A person who commits an offence under subsection (5) is liable to a fine at level 5 and, in the case of a continuing offence, to a further fine of $1,000 for each day during which the offence continues.

section.name: s338A
section.heading: Re-domiciled company must register charge created by company before re-domiciliation date and charge existing on property acquired before re-domiciliation date

subsection.leadIn: This section applies if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a company incorporated outside Hong Kong has created a charge before it becomes a re-domiciled company;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the charge subsists on the re-domiciliation date; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the charge is of a kind that a statement of its particulars would have been required by section 335 to be delivered for registration had the charge been created by the re-domiciled company on or after that date.

subsection.leadIn: This section also applies if—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: the charge subsists on the re-domiciliation date; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the charge is of a kind that a statement of its particulars would have been required by section 338 to be delivered for registration had the property been acquired by the re-domiciled company on or after that date.

subsection.content: Despite subsections (1) and (2), this section does not apply if the re-domiciled company has complied with section 336, 339 or 340 in relation to the charge.
The re-domiciled company must deliver a statement of the particulars of the charge to the Registrar for registration within 1 month after the re-domiciliation date.

If there is a specified instrument in relation to the charge, the re-domiciled company must deliver the statement under subsection (4) together with a certified copy of the specified instrument or, if there is more than one specified instrument in relation to the charge, a certified copy of any of those specified instruments.

subsection.leadIn: A statement of the particulars of a charge—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: must be in the specified form; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: must be accompanied by the prescribed fee.

subsection.content: Subject to section 346, if a re-domiciled company contravenes subsection (4) or (5) in relation to a charge, the company, and every responsible person of the company, commit an offence.

A person who commits an offence under subsection (7) is liable on conviction to a fine at level 5 and, in the case of a continuing offence, to a further fine of $1,000 for each day during which the offence continues.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: specified instrument (指明文書)—see section 338B.

section.name: s338B
section.heading: Meaning of specified instrument—for section 338A

subsection.content: This section explains the meaning of specified instrument for the purposes of section 338A.

subsection.leadIn: If—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a charge of a re-domiciled company is given in a debenture forming part of a series by reference to any other instrument containing the charge (whether or not also contained in the debenture); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: every holder of the debentures of the series is entitled equally to the benefit of the charge,

subsection.continued: the instrument by reference to which the charge is given is the specified instrument in relation to the charge.

subsection.leadIn: If—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a charge of a re-domiciled company is contained in a debenture forming part of a series (but not given in the debenture by reference to any other instrument); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: every holder of the debentures of the series is entitled equally to the benefit of the charge,

subsection.continued: any one debenture of the series is a specified instrument in relation to the charge.

subsection.content: In relation to any other charge, an instrument creating or evidencing the charge is a specified instrument in relation to the charge.

section.name: s339
section.heading: Registered non-Hong Kong company must register charge existing on property acquired

subsection.leadIn: This section applies if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a registered non-Hong Kong company acquires property in Hong Kong subject to a charge; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the charge is of a kind that a statement of its particulars would have been required by section 336(1) to be delivered for registration had it been created by the registered non-Hong Kong company after the acquisition.

subsection.content: Subsection (1)(a) does not apply to a charge on property if the property was not in Hong Kong when the property was acquired by the registered non-Hong Kong company.

The registered non-Hong Kong company must deliver a statement of the particulars of the charge, together with a certified copy of the instrument (if any) creating or evidencing the charge, to the Registrar for registration within the registration period specified in subsection (4).
The registration period is one month after the date on which the acquisition is completed.

subsection.leadIn: A statement of the particulars of a charge—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: must be in the specified form; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: must be accompanied by the prescribed fee.

subsection.content: Subject to section 346, if a registered non-Hong Kong company contravenes subsection (3), the company, and every responsible person of the company, commit an offence.

A person who commits an offence under subsection (6) is liable to a fine at level 5 and, in the case of a continuing offence, to a further fine of $1,000 for each day during which the offence continues.

section.name: s339A
section.heading: Supplementary provisions for section 339—where company incorporated outside Hong Kong ceases to be registered non-Hong Kong company because of registration under section 820C

subsection.leadIn: This section applies if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a company incorporated outside Hong Kong becomes a re-domiciled company (re-domiciliation); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: immediately before the re-domiciliation, the company is required, but has yet, to comply with the requirement under section 339(3) (requirement) in relation to a charge.

subsection.leadIn: Despite the re-domiciliation—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the company is required to comply with the requirement in relation to the charge; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: section 339(6) and (7) applies in relation to the charge,

subsection.continued: as if the re-domiciliation had not taken place and the company were still a registered non-Hong Kong company.

section.name: s340
section.heading: Registered non-Hong Kong company must register charge existing on property on date of company’s registration under Part 16

subsection.leadIn: This section applies if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: a registered non-Hong Kong company has, on the date of its registration under Part 16, property in Hong Kong subject to—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: a charge created by the company; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: a charge that subsisted when the property was acquired; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the charge is of a kind that a statement of its particulars would have been required by section 336(1) or 339(3) to be delivered for registration had the charge been created by the company, or had the property been acquired by the company, after the company has been registered under Part 16.

subsection.content: The registered non-Hong Kong company must deliver a statement of the particulars of the charge, together with a certified copy of the instrument (if any) creating or evidencing the charge, to the Registrar for registration within the registration period specified in subsection (5).

subsection.leadIn: If, in the case of subsection (1)(a)(i)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: the charge—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: is given in a debenture forming part of a series by reference to any other instrument containing the charge (whether or not also contained in the debenture); or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: is contained in a debenture forming part of a series (but not given in the debenture by reference to any other instrument); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: every holder of the debentures of the series is entitled equally to the benefit of the charge,

subsection.continued: the registered non-Hong Kong company is to be regarded as having complied with subsection (2) in relation to the charge if that company delivers a statement of the particulars of the charge, together with a certified copy of an instrument specified in subsection (4), to the Registrar for registration within the registration period specified in subsection (5).

subsection.leadIn: The instrument is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: for the purposes of subsection (3)(a)(i), the instrument by reference to which the charge is given; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: for the purposes of subsection (3)(a)(ii), any one debenture of the series.

subsection.content: The registration period is one month after the date on which the registered non-Hong Kong company is registered under Part 16.

subsection.leadIn: A statement of the particulars of a charge—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: must be in the specified form; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: must be accompanied by the prescribed fee.

subsection.content: Subject to section 346, if a registered non-Hong Kong company contravenes subsection (2), the company, and every responsible person of the company, commit an offence.

A person who commits an offence under subsection (7) is liable to a fine at level 5 and, in the case of a continuing offence, to a further fine of $1,000 for each day during which the offence continues.

section.name: s340A
section.heading: Supplementary provisions for section 340—where company incorporated outside Hong Kong ceases to be registered non-Hong Kong company because of registration under section 820C

subsection.leadIn: This section applies if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a company incorporated outside Hong Kong becomes a re-domiciled company (re-domiciliation); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: immediately before the re-domiciliation, the company is required, but has yet, to comply with the requirement under section 340(2) (requirement) in relation to a charge.

subsection.leadIn: Despite the re-domiciliation—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the company is required to comply with the requirement in relation to the charge; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: section 340(3), (7) and (8) applies in relation to the charge,

subsection.continued: as if the re-domiciliation had not taken place and the company were still a registered non-Hong Kong company.

division.name: D4
division.heading: Obligation to Register Other Particulars of Debentures

section.name: s341
section.heading: Company or registered non-Hong Kong company must register particulars of issue of debentures

subsection.leadIn: This section applies if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: a debenture forming part of a series—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: contains a charge created by a company or registered non-Hong Kong company; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: gives a charge created by a company or registered non-Hong Kong company, by reference to any other instrument containing the charge;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: every holder of the debentures of the series is entitled equally to the benefit of the charge; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a statement of the particulars of the charge is required to be delivered for registration under section 335(2), 336(2), 338A(4) or 340(3). (Amended 14 of 2025 s. 22)

subsection.content: The company or registered non-Hong Kong company must deliver a statement of the particulars of every issue of the debentures of the series to the Registrar for registration within the registration period specified in subsection (4).
A person interested in the charge may deliver a statement of the particulars of an issue of debentures to the Registrar for registration within the registration period specified in subsection (4).

subsection.leadIn: The registration period is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: if a statement of the particulars of the charge is delivered for registration under section 335(2) or 336(2)—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: in the case of an issue of debentures made at the time of the creation of the charge, the registration period specified in relation to the registration of the charge in section 335(5)(b) or 336(6)(b); or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: in the case of any subsequent issue of debentures, one month after the date of the issue; (Amended 14 of 2025 s. 22)

paragraph.name: ab
paragraph.leadIn: if a statement of the particulars of the charge is delivered for registration under section 338A(4)—

subparagraph.content: in the case of an issue of debentures made on or before the re-domiciliation date, 1 month after that date; or
in the case of any subsequent issue of debentures, 1 month after the date of the issue; or (Added 14 of 2025 s. 22)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: if a statement of the particulars of the charge is delivered for registration under section 340(3)—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: in the case of an issue of debentures made on or before the registration under Part 16, the registration period specified in relation to the registration of the charge in section 340(5); or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: in the case of any subsequent issue of debentures, one month after the date of the issue.

subsection.content: A statement of the particulars of an issue of debentures must be in the specified form.
Without limiting section 23, a statement of the particulars of an issue of debentures must contain the date and the amount of the issue.
