Subject to section 346, if subsection (2) is contravened, and a person interested in the charge has not delivered a statement of the particulars of the issue of debentures for registration under subsection (3), the company or registered non-Hong Kong company, and every responsible person of the company or registered non-Hong Kong company, commit an offence.

A person who commits an offence under subsection (7) is liable to a fine at level 5 and, in the case of a continuing offence, to a further fine of $1,000 for each day during which the offence continues.
A contravention of subsection (2) does not affect the validity of the debentures issued.

subsection.leadIn: In this section, a reference to the time of the creation of a charge is a reference to the time of execution of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the instrument by reference to which the charge is given; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if there is no such instrument, the first debenture of the series.

section.name: s342
section.heading: Company or registered non-Hong Kong company must register particulars of commission etc. in relation to debentures

subsection.leadIn: This section applies if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: any commission, allowance or discount has been paid or made, directly or indirectly, by a company or registered non-Hong Kong company to any person in consideration of the person—

subparagraph.name: i
ii

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the debenture—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: creates or evidences a charge; or

subparagraph.name: ii

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the charge is created by the company or registered non-Hong Kong company; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.leadIn: a statement of the particulars of the charge is required to be delivered for registration under—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: section 335(1);

subparagraph.name: ii
2a
subparagraph.content: section 338A(4); or (Added 14 of 2025 s. 23)

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: section 340(2).

subsection.content: The company or registered non-Hong Kong company must deliver a statement of the particulars of the commission, allowance or discount to the Registrar for registration within the registration period specified in subsection (6)(a).

subsection.leadIn: Where—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the case of subsection (1)(d)(i), a statement of the particulars of the charge is delivered for registration under section 335(2); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the case of subsection (1)(d)(ii), a statement of the particulars of the charge is delivered for registration under section 336(2),

subsection.continued: the company or registered non-Hong Kong company is to be regarded as having complied with subsection (2) if it delivers a statement of the particulars of the commission, allowance or discount to the Registrar for registration within the registration period specified in subsection (6)(b).

subsection.name: 3A
subsection.content: Where, in the case of subsection (1)(d)(iia), a statement of the particulars of the charge is delivered for registration under section 338A(4), the company is to be regarded as having complied with subsection (2) if it delivers a statement of the particulars of the commission, allowance or discount to the Registrar for registration within the registration period specified in subsection (6)(ba). (Added 14 of 2025 s. 23)

Where, in the case of subsection (1)(d)(iii), a statement of the particulars of the charge is delivered for registration under section 340(3), the registered non-Hong Kong company is to be regarded as having complied with subsection (2) if it delivers a statement of the particulars of the commission, allowance or discount to the Registrar for registration within the registration period specified in subsection (6)(c).

subsection.leadIn: A person interested in the charge—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: may deliver a statement of the particulars of the commission, allowance or discount to the Registrar for registration within the registration period specified in subsection (6)(a); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: may, in the case of subsection (3), deliver a statement of the particulars of the commission, allowance or discount to the Registrar for registration within the registration period specified in subsection (6)(b).

subsection.leadIn: The registration period is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: for the purposes of subsection (2) or (5)(a)—

subparagraph.name: i
ii
subparagraph.content: in the case of subsection (1)(d)(ii), the registration period specified in relation to the registration of the charge in section 336(6)(a); (Amended 14 of 2025 s. 23)

subparagraph.name: 2a
subparagraph.content: in the case of subsection (1)(d)(iia), 1 month after the re-domiciliation date; or (Added 14 of 2025 s. 23)

subparagraph.name: iii

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: for the purposes of subsection (3) or (5)(b)—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: in the case of an issue of debentures made at the time of the creation of the charge, the registration period specified in relation to the registration of that charge in section 335(5)(b) or 336(6)(b); or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: in the case of any subsequent issue of debentures, one month after the date of the issue; (Amended 14 of 2025 s. 23)

paragraph.name: ba
paragraph.leadIn: for the purposes of subsection (3A)—

subparagraph.content: in the case of an issue of debentures made on or before the re-domiciliation date, 1 month after that date; or
in the case of any subsequent issue of debentures, 1 month after the date of the issue; or (Added 14 of 2025 s. 23)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: for the purposes of subsection (4)—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: in the case of an issue of debentures made on or before the registration under Part 16, the registration period specified in relation to the registration of that charge in section 340(5); or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: in the case of any subsequent issue of debentures, one month after the date of the issue.

subsection.content: A statement of the particulars of any commission, allowance or discount must be in the specified form.
For the purposes of this section, the deposit of any debenture as security for any debt of a company or registered non-Hong Kong company is not to be regarded as an issue of debentures at a discount.

subsection.leadIn: In this section, a reference to the time of the creation of a charge is a reference to the time of execution of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the instrument by reference to which the charge is given; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if there is no such instrument, the first debenture of the series.

section.name: s343
section.heading: Consequences of contravention of section 342

subsection.content: Subject to section 346, if section 342(2) is contravened, and a person interested in the charge has not delivered a statement of the particulars of the commission, allowance or discount (as the case may be) for registration under section 342(5), the company or registered non-Hong Kong company, and every responsible person of the company or registered non-Hong Kong company, commit an offence.

A person who commits an offence under subsection (1) is liable to a fine at level 5 and, in the case of a continuing offence, to a further fine of $1,000 for each day during which the offence continues.
A contravention of section 342(2) does not affect the validity of the debentures issued.

section.name: s344
section.heading: Certificate of registration

subsection.content: This section applies if a statement of the particulars of a charge, and the requisite accompanying instrument, are delivered by a company or registered non-Hong Kong company, or by a person interested in the charge, to the Registrar for registration under Division 2 or 3.

After registering the statement and the requisite accompanying instrument, the Registrar must issue a certificate to the company or registered non-Hong Kong company, or to the interested person, certifying registration of the charge under Division 2 or 3.
A certificate of registration must be signed by the Registrar.
A certificate of registration is conclusive evidence that the requirements of this Part as to registration have been satisfied.

section.name: s345
section.heading: Notification to Registrar of payment of debt, release, etc.

subsection.leadIn: This section applies if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the debt secured by a registered charge has been paid or satisfied in whole or in part; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the whole or any part of the property or undertaking subject to a registered charge—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: has been released from the charge; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: has ceased to form part of the company’s or registered non-Hong Kong company’s property or undertaking.

subsection.content: The company or registered non-Hong Kong company, or the mortgagee or person entitled to the charge, may notify the Registrar of the payment, satisfaction, release or cessation.

subsection.leadIn: A notification—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: must be in the specified form;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: must be accompanied by the prescribed fee; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: must be accompanied by a certified copy of any instrument required by the Registrar for the purpose of evidencing the payment, satisfaction, release or cessation.

subsection.content: If the Registrar is satisfied from the instrument accompanying a notification that the payment, satisfaction, release or cessation did take place, the Registrar must process the notification, and the accompanying instrument, in the same way as if they were delivered to the Registrar for registration.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of this section, a copy of an instrument is a certified copy if it is certified as a true copy by—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the mortgagee or the person entitled to the charge; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: in the case of—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: a mortgagee or entitled person who is a natural person, a person authorized by the mortgagee or entitled person for the purpose; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.leadIn: a mortgagee or entitled person that is a body corporate—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: a person authorized by the mortgagee or entitled person for the purpose; or

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: a director or company secretary of the mortgagee or entitled person.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of this section, a charge is a registered charge—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: if—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: a statement of the particulars of the charge, and the requisite accompanying instrument, have been delivered to the Registrar for registration under Division 2 or 3; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the Registrar has recorded the information contained in the statement, and in that instrument, for the purposes of section 27(1); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: if—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: immediately before the commencement date# of this Division, the charge was registered under Part III of the predecessor Ordinance; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: on or after the commencement date# of this Division, the charge has been registered under Part III of the predecessor Ordinance having a continuing effect under Schedule 11.

section.name: s346
section.heading: Extension of time for registration

subsection.leadIn: The Court may, on application by the company or registered non-Hong Kong company or by a person interested in the charge, order that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the registration period specified in section 335(5), 336(6), 338(3), 338A(4), 339(4), 340(5), 341(4) or 342(6) be extended; (Amended 14 of 2025 s. 24)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the time required for registration by section 80 or 82 of the predecessor Ordinance, or that section as extended by section 91 of that Ordinance, having a continuing effect under Schedule 11 be extended; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the time required for registration by section 91(5) of the predecessor Ordinance having a continuing effect under Schedule 11 be extended.

subsection.content: The Court may make an order under subsection (1) on any terms and conditions that the Court thinks just and expedient.

subsection.leadIn: The Court must not make an order unless the Court is satisfied that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: the failure specified in subsection (5)—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: was accidental;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: was due to inadvertence or to some other sufficient cause; or

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: is not of a nature to prejudice the position of creditors or members of the company or registered non-Hong Kong company; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: it is just and equitable to grant the relief on other grounds.

subsection.leadIn: If—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Court makes an order under subsection (1) in relation to a charge or debenture; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the failure specified in subsection (5) is rectified within the extended period or time,

subsection.continued: any liability already incurred for an offence under the offence provision specified in subsection (6) in relation to the registration of the charge or debenture is extinguished.

subsection.leadIn: The failure is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the case of subsection (1)(a), a failure to deliver a statement as required under Division 2, 3 or 4, or any accompanying instrument, within that registration period;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: in the case of subsection (1)(b), a failure to deliver—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the particulars as required under section 80 or 82 of the predecessor Ordinance having a continuing effect under section 63(2), 64(2), 65(2) or 66(2) of Schedule 11 within that time; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: a statement as required under section 80 or 82 of the predecessor Ordinance having a continuing effect under section 63(4)(a), 64(4)(a), 65(4) or 66(4) of Schedule 11, or any accompanying instrument, within that time; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: in the case of subsection (1)(c), a failure to deliver—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the particulars as required under section 91(5) of the predecessor Ordinance having a continuing effect under section 67(2) of Schedule 11 within that time; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: a statement as required under section 91(5) of the predecessor Ordinance having a continuing effect under section 67(4) of Schedule 11, or any accompanying instrument, within that time.

subsection.leadIn: The offence provision is—

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the case of subsection (1)(b), section 81 or 82 of the predecessor Ordinance having a continuing effect under Schedule 11; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: in the case of subsection (1)(c), section 91(6) of the predecessor Ordinance having a continuing effect under Schedule 11.

section.name: s347
section.heading: Rectification of registered particulars

subsection.leadIn: The Court may, on application by the company or registered non-Hong Kong company or by a person interested in the charge, order that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: an omission or misstatement of any particular in any of the following be rectified—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.leadIn: a statement of the particulars of a charge, or any accompanying instrument, delivered for registration under—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: Division 2 or 3;

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: section 80 or 82 of the predecessor Ordinance, or that section by virtue of section 91 of that Ordinance, having a continuing effect under section 63(4)(a), 64(4)(a), 65(4) or 66(4) of Schedule 11; or

subparagraph.name: C
subparagraph.content: section 91(5) of the predecessor Ordinance having a continuing effect under section 67(4) of Schedule 11;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.leadIn: a statement of the particulars of an issue of debentures, or a statement of the particulars of commission, allowance or discount, delivered for registration under—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: Division 4;

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: section 80 or 82 of the predecessor Ordinance, or that section by virtue of section 91 of that Ordinance, having a continuing effect under section 63(4)(a), 64(4)(a), 65(4) or 66(4) of Schedule 11; or

subparagraph.name: C
subparagraph.content: section 91(5) of the predecessor Ordinance having a continuing effect under section 67(4) of Schedule 11;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: a notification, or any accompanying instrument, under section 345;

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: a memorandum under section 85 of the predecessor Ordinance; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: an omission or misstatement of any of the following be rectified—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: any particular with respect to a charge delivered for registration before the commencement date# of this section under section 80, 82 or 91(5) of the predecessor Ordinance;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: any particular with respect to a charge delivered for registration under section 80, 82 or 91(5) of the predecessor Ordinance having a continuing effect under section 63(2), 64(2), 65(2), 66(2) or 67(2) of Schedule 11.

subsection.content: The Court may make an order under subsection (1) on any terms and conditions that the Court thinks just and expedient.

subsection.leadIn: The Court must not make an order unless the Court is satisfied that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: the omission or misstatement—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: was accidental;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: was due to inadvertence or to some other sufficient cause; or

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: is not of a nature to prejudice the position of creditors or members of the company or registered non-Hong Kong company; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: it is just and equitable to grant the relief on other grounds.

subsection.content: The Court may make an order to rectify an omission or misstatement of any particular in any accompanying instrument mentioned in subsection (1)(a)(i) or (iii) to the extent as permitted by common law rules and equitable principles.

division.name: D6
division.heading: Notice to Registrar of Enforcement of Security

section.name: s348
section.heading: Notice of appointment of receiver or manager

subsection.content: If a person obtains an order for the appointment of a receiver or manager of the property of a company or the charged property of a registered non-Hong Kong company, or appoints such a receiver or manager under the powers contained in an instrument, the person must, within 7 days after the date of the order or of the appointment under those powers, deliver a statement of that fact to the Registrar for registration.

subsection.leadIn: A statement under subsection (1) must include—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the name and address of the person appointed as receiver or manager; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the number of that person’s identity card, or if that person does not have an identity card, the number and issuing country of any passport held by that person.

subsection.leadIn: A statement under subsection (1)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: must be in the specified form; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: must be accompanied by the prescribed fee.

subsection.content: If a person contravenes subsection (1), the person commits an offence and is liable to a fine at level 3 and, in the case of a continuing offence, to a further fine of $300 for each day during which the offence continues.

section.name: s349
section.heading: Notice of mortgagee entering into possession of property

subsection.content: If a person enters into possession of the property of a company, or the charged property of a registered non-Hong Kong company, as mortgagee, the person must, within 7 days after the date of entering into possession, deliver a statement of that fact to the Registrar for registration.

subsection.leadIn: A statement under subsection (1) must include—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: if the person is a natural person—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the person’s name and address; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the number of the person’s identity card, or if the person does not have an identity card, the number and issuing country of any passport held by the person; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the person is a body corporate, its name and the address of its registered or principal office.

subsection.leadIn: A statement under subsection (1)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: must be in the specified form; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: must be accompanied by the prescribed fee.

subsection.content: If a person contravenes subsection (1), the person commits an offence and is liable to a fine at level 3 and, in the case of a continuing offence, to a further fine of $300 for each day during which the offence continues.

section.name: s350
section.heading: Notice of cessation of appointment of receiver or manager or mortgagee going out of possession of property, etc.

subsection.leadIn: This section applies to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: a person—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: whose particulars are required to be included in a statement delivered to the Registrar under section 348(1); or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: whose particulars were, before the commencement date# of section 348, required to be included in a notice delivered to the Registrar under section 87(1) of the predecessor Ordinance; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: a person—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: whose particulars are required to be included in a statement delivered to the Registrar under section 349(1); or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: whose particulars were, before the commencement date# of section 349, required to be included in a notice delivered to the Registrar under section 87(2) of the predecessor Ordinance.

subsection.content: If the person mentioned in subsection (1)(a) ceases to act as receiver or manager, the person must, within 7 days after the date of the cessation, deliver a statement of the cessation to the Registrar for registration.

If the person mentioned in subsection (1)(b) goes out of possession of the property or charged property, the person must, within 7 days after going out of possession, deliver a statement of that fact to the Registrar for registration.

If there is any change to the particulars of the person included in the statement or notice, the person must, within 15 days after the date of the change, deliver a statement of that change to the Registrar for registration.

subsection.leadIn: Subsection (4) does not apply if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: in the case of a person mentioned in subsection (1)(a)—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the person has ceased to act as receiver or manager; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the person has delivered a statement of the cessation to the Registrar under subsection (2) or has, before the commencement date# of section 348, given notice of the cessation under section 87(4) of the predecessor Ordinance; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: in the case of a person mentioned in subsection (1)(b)—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the person has gone out of possession of the property or charged property; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the person has delivered a statement of that fact to the Registrar under subsection (3) or has, before the commencement date# of section 349, given notice of that fact under section 87(4) of the predecessor Ordinance.

subsection.content: A statement under subsection (2), (3) or (4) must be in the specified form.

If a person contravenes subsection (2), (3) or (4), the person commits an offence and is liable to a fine at level 3 and, in the case of a continuing offence, to a further fine of $300 for each day during which the offence continues.

division.name: D7
division.heading: Company’s and Registered Non-Hong Kong Company’s Records and Register of Charges

section.name: s351
section.heading: Obligation to keep copies of instruments creating charges

subsection.leadIn: A company must keep at its registered office, or at a place prescribed by regulations made under section 657—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a copy of every instrument creating a charge required to be registered by the company under this Part; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a copy of every instrument creating a charge required to be registered by the company under Part III of the predecessor Ordinance.

subsection.leadIn: A registered non-Hong Kong company must keep at its principal place of business in Hong Kong, or at a place prescribed by regulations made under section 356—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a copy of every instrument creating a charge required to be registered by the company under this Part; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a copy of every instrument creating a charge required to be registered by the company under Part III of the predecessor Ordinance.

subsection.leadIn: Where—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a series of debentures is issued by a company or registered non-Hong Kong company;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the debentures contain a charge required to be registered by the company or registered non-Hong Kong company under this Part or under Part III of the predecessor Ordinance; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the terms of the debentures are the same,

subsection.continued: the company or registered non-Hong Kong company is to be regarded as having complied with subsection (1) or (2) in relation to the debentures if it keeps a copy of one of the debentures in accordance with that subsection.

subsection.leadIn: A company or registered non-Hong Kong company—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: must, within 15 days after a copy of an instrument mentioned in subsection (1) or (2) is first kept at a place, notify the Registrar of the place; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: must, within 15 days after there is a change in the place where a copy of such an instrument is kept, notify the Registrar of the change.

subsection.name: 4A
subsection.leadIn: Subsection (4)(b) does not apply to a change of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the address of the company’s registered office; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the address of the registered non-Hong Kong company’s principal place of business in Hong Kong. (Added 35 of 2018 s. 30)

subsection.content: A notification under subsection (4)(a) or (b) must be in the specified form.

subsection.leadIn: Subsection (4)(a) does not require a company or registered non-Hong Kong company to notify the Registrar of the place at which a copy of an instrument is kept—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if, in the case of a copy that came into existence on or after the commencement date# of this section, it has at all times been kept at the company’s registered office, or the registered non-Hong Kong company’s principal place of business in Hong Kong; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: if—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: immediately before that commencement date#, the company or registered non-Hong Kong company kept a copy of the instrument for the purposes of section 88 of the predecessor Ordinance; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: on and after that commencement date#, that copy is kept for the purposes of subsection (1) or (2) at the place at which it was kept immediately before that commencement date#.

subsection.content: If subsection (1), (2) or (4) is contravened, the company or registered non-Hong Kong company, and every responsible person of the company or registered non-Hong Kong company, commit an offence, and each is liable to a fine at level 4 and, in the case of a continuing offence, to a further fine of $700 for each day during which the offence continues.

section.name: s352
section.heading: Obligation of company to keep register of charges

subsection.leadIn: A company must keep a register of charges—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: at the company’s registered office; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: at a place prescribed by regulations made under section 657.

subsection.leadIn: A company—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: must enter in its register of charges—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: every charge specifically affecting property of the company; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: every floating charge on the whole or part of the company’s property or undertaking; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: must enter in its register of charges the following particulars in respect of every charge specified in paragraph (a)(i) and (ii)—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the amount secured by the charge;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: a description of the property charged;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: except in the case of securities to bearer, the names of the persons entitled to the charge.

subsection.content: If a company contravenes subsection (1) or (2), the company, and every responsible person of the company, commit an offence, and each is liable to a fine at level 4 and, in the case of a continuing offence, to a further fine of $700 for each day during which the offence continues.

If an officer of the company knowingly and wilfully authorizes or permits the omission of an entry required to be made under subsection (2), the officer commits an offence and is liable to a fine at level 5.

section.name: s353
section.heading: Obligation of registered non-Hong Kong company to keep register of charges

subsection.leadIn: A registered non-Hong Kong company must keep a register of charges—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: at the company’s principal place of business in Hong Kong; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: at a place prescribed by regulations made under section 356.

subsection.leadIn: A registered non-Hong Kong company—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: must enter in its register of charges—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: every charge created by the company on property in Hong Kong of the company; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: every charge on property in Hong Kong that is acquired by the company; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: must enter in its register of charges the following particulars in respect of every charge specified in paragraph (a)(i) and (ii)—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the amount secured by the charge;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: a description of the property charged;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: except in the case of securities to bearer, the names of the persons entitled to the charge.

subsection.content: Subsection (2) does not apply to a charge on property if the property was not in Hong Kong when the charge was created by, or the property was acquired by, the registered non-Hong Kong company.

If a registered non-Hong Kong company contravenes subsection (1) or (2), the company, and every responsible person of the company, commit an offence, and each is liable to a fine at level 4 and, in the case of a continuing offence, to a further fine of $700 for each day during which the offence continues.

If an officer of the registered non-Hong Kong company knowingly and wilfully authorizes or permits the omission of an entry required to be made under subsection (2), the officer commits an offence and is liable to a fine at level 5.

section.name: s354
section.heading: Notification of place where register of charges is kept

subsection.content: A company or registered non-Hong Kong company must notify the Registrar of the place at which the register of charges is kept. The notice must be in the specified form and delivered to the Registrar for registration within 15 days after the register is first kept at that place.

A company or registered non-Hong Kong company must notify the Registrar of any change (other than a change of the address of the company’s registered office or registered non-Hong Kong company’s principal place of business in Hong Kong) in the place at which the register of charges is kept. The notice must be in the specified form and delivered to the Registrar for registration within 15 days after the change.

subsection.leadIn: Subsection (1) does not require a company or registered non-Hong Kong company to notify the Registrar of the place at which the register of charges is kept—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: if, in the case of a register that came into existence on or after the commencement date# of this section, it has at all times been kept at—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the company’s registered office; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the registered non-Hong Kong company’s principal place of business in Hong Kong; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: if—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: immediately before that commencement date#, the company or registered non-Hong Kong company kept a register for the purposes of section 89 of the predecessor Ordinance; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: on and after that commencement date#, that register is kept as a register of charges for the purposes of section 352(1) or 353(1) at the place at which it was kept immediately before that commencement date#.

subsection.content: If subsection (1) or (2) is contravened, the company or registered non-Hong Kong company, and every responsible person of the company or registered non-Hong Kong company, commit an offence, and each is liable to a fine at level 4 and, in the case of a continuing offence, to a further fine of $700 for each day during which the offence continues.

section.name: s355
section.heading: Right to inspect

subsection.leadIn: A member or creditor of a company is entitled, on request made in the prescribed manner and without charge, to inspect, in accordance with regulations made under section 657—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the copies kept by the company under section 351(1); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the register of charges kept by the company under section 352(1).

subsection.leadIn: A member or creditor of a registered non-Hong Kong company is entitled, on request made in the prescribed manner and without charge, to inspect, in accordance with regulations made under section 356—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the copies kept by the company under section 351(2); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the register of charges kept by the company under section 353(1).

subsection.leadIn: Any other person is entitled, on request made in the prescribed manner and on payment of a prescribed fee, to inspect, in accordance with regulations made under section 356 or 657—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the copies kept by a company or registered non-Hong Kong company under section 351(1)(a) or (2)(a); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the register of charges kept by a company or registered non-Hong Kong company under section 352(1) or 353(1).

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: prescribed (訂明) means prescribed by regulations made under section 356 or 657.

section.name: s356
section.heading: Financial Secretary may make regulations for purposes of this Division

subsection.leadIn: The Financial Secretary may make regulations—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: prescribing a place at which—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: copies of instruments creating charges are to be kept by a registered non-Hong Kong company under section 351; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: a register of charges is to be kept by a registered non-Hong Kong company under section 353;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: providing for the obligations of a registered non-Hong Kong company to make the copies and the register available for inspection under section 355;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: prescribing the fees for the purposes of section 355(3); and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: prescribing any other thing that is required or permitted to be prescribed under this Division in respect of those copies and that register.

subsection.leadIn: Regulations made under subsection (1)(a) may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: prescribe a place other than the registered non-Hong Kong company’s principal place of business in Hong Kong;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: prescribe a place—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: by reference to the place at which the registered non-Hong Kong company keeps any other records; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: in any other way;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: provide that section 351 or 353 is not complied with by keeping the copies, or the register of charges, at a place prescribed in the regulations unless conditions prescribed in the regulations are met; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: prescribe more than one place for the purpose specified in subsection (1)(a)(i) or (ii).

subsection.leadIn: Regulations made under subsection (1)(b) may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: make provision as to the time, duration and manner of inspection;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: prescribe the manner in which a request for inspection is to be made; and (Amended 35 of 2018 s. 31)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: define what may be required of the registered non-Hong Kong company as regards the nature, extent and manner of extracting or presenting any information for the purposes of inspection.

subsection.leadIn: Regulations made under subsection (1) may provide that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: if a registered non-Hong Kong company contravenes any of the regulations, an offence is committed by—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the company; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: every responsible person of the company;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a person who commits an offence mentioned in paragraph (a) is liable to a fine not exceeding level 5 and, in the case of a continuing offence, to a further fine not exceeding $1,000 for each day during which the offence continues;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: the Court may, in prescribed circumstances—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: by order compel an immediate inspection of the copies and the register of charges; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: make any order as to the time, duration and manner of inspection; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: if the copies, or the register of charges, are kept at the office of a person other than the registered non-Hong Kong company concerned, an order mentioned in paragraph (c) may be made against that other person and that other person’s officers and other employees.

subsection.leadIn: Nothing in any provision of this Ordinance or in the regulations made under this section is to be construed as preventing a registered non-Hong Kong company—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: from providing more extensive facilities than are required by the regulations; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if a fee may be charged, from charging a lesser fee than that prescribed or none at all.

part.name: P9
part.heading: Accounts and Audit

section.name: s357
section.heading: Interpretation

subsection.leadIn: In this Part—
subsection.def: accounting standards (會計準則) means statements of standard accounting practice issued or specified by a body prescribed by the Regulation; (Added 35 of 2018 s. 32)
annual consolidated financial statements (周年綜合財務報表) means the consolidated statements required to be prepared under section 379(2) or (3A)(a)(ii); (Amended 35 of 2018 s. 32)
annual financial statements (周年財務報表) means the statements required to be prepared under section 379(1), (3A)(a)(i) or (b); (Amended 35 of 2018 s. 32)
auditor’s report (核數師報告) means the report required to be prepared under section 405;

def.name: DirectorsReport
def.leadIn: directors’ report (董事報告) means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the report required to be prepared under section 388(1); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the consolidated report required to be prepared under section 388(2);

subsection.def: financial statements (財務報表) means annual financial statements or annual consolidated financial statements;

non-Hong Kong body corporate (非香港法人團體)— (Amended 14 of 2025 s. 25)(a)means a body corporate incorporated outside Hong Kong; but(b)does not include a re-domiciled company; (Added 35 of 2018 s. 32. Amended 14 of 2025 s. 25)
Regulation (《規例》) means the regulations made under sections 451 and 452;
summary financial report (財務摘要報告) means a financial report prepared under section 439.

subsection.leadIn: In this Part, a reference to the reporting documents for a financial year is a reference to all of the following—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the financial statements for the financial year;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the directors’ report for the financial year;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the auditor’s report on those financial statements.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of this Part, a body corporate is a wholly owned subsidiary of another body corporate if it has only the following as members—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: that other body corporate;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a wholly owned subsidiary of that other body corporate;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a nominee of that other body corporate or such a wholly owned subsidiary.

subsection.leadIn: In this Part—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a reference to accounting standards applicable to any financial statements of a company is a reference to accounting standards as are, in accordance with their terms, relevant to the company’s circumstances and to the financial statements;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a reference to a holding company includes a parent undertaking that is a company, and a reference to a group of companies is to be construed accordingly; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a reference to a parent undertaking or subsidiary undertaking is to be construed in accordance with Schedule 1. (Added 35 of 2018 s. 32)

section.name: s358
section.heading: Application in relation to financial year beginning on or after commencement date of relevant provision etc.

subsection.leadIn: Each of the following sections applies in relation to a financial year beginning on or after the commencement date# of that section—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: section 359;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: section 379;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: section 388;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: section 389;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: section 429;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: section 430;

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: section 439.

subsection.leadIn: Each of the following sections applies in relation to accounting records for a financial year beginning on or after the commencement date# of that section—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: section 373;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: section 374;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: section 376;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: section 377.

subsection.leadIn: Each of the following sections applies in relation to financial statements for a financial year beginning on or after the commencement date# of that section—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: section 380;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: section 381;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: section 382;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: section 383;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: section 436;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: section 449.

subsection.content: Section 387 applies in relation to a statement of financial position for a financial year beginning on or after the commencement date# of that section.

subsection.leadIn: Each of the following sections applies in relation to a directors’ report for a financial year beginning on or after the commencement date# of that section—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: section 390;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: section 391.

subsection.leadIn: Each of the following sections applies in relation to an appointment of an auditor for a financial year beginning on or after the commencement date# of that section—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: section 394;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: section 395;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: section 396;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: section 398;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: section 399.

subsection.leadIn: Each of the following sections applies in relation to a person appointed as auditor for a financial year beginning on or after the commencement date# of that section—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: section 402;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: section 403;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: section 404.

subsection.content: Section 411 applies in relation to a general meeting of which notice is given on or after the commencement date# of that section.

subsection.leadIn: Each of the following sections applies in relation to a person who is appointed, or is deemed to be reappointed, as auditor for a financial year beginning on or after the commencement date# of that section—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: section 412;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: section 416;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: section 417;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: section 418;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: section 419.

subsection.content: Section 415 applies to a provision made on or after the commencement date# of that section.

subsection.leadIn: Section 435 applies in relation to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any financial statements and directors’ report for a financial year beginning on or after the commencement date# of that section; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any auditor’s report on those financial statements.

subsection.content: Section 440 applies in relation to a summary financial report for a financial year beginning on or after the commencement date# of that section.
Schedule 4 applies in relation to financial statements for a financial year beginning on or after the commencement date# of that Schedule.

section.name: s359
section.heading: Company falling within reporting exemption

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of this Part, a company falls within the reporting exemption for a financial year—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: if—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: it is qualified as a small private company or small guarantee company for the financial year; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: it is not a company specified in subsection (4) at any time during the financial year;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: if—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: it is a private company at all times, and is not a company specified in subsection (4) at any time, during the financial year;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: it does not have any subsidiary and is not a subsidiary of another company; and

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: all members of the company agree in writing that the company is to fall within the reporting exemption for the financial year only; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: if—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: it is a private company at all times, and is not a company specified in subsection (4) at any time, during the financial year;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: it is qualified as an eligible private company for the financial year; and

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: the conditions specified in section 360(1) are satisfied.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of this Part, a company also falls within the reporting exemption for a financial year if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: it is a private company at all times, and is not a company specified in subsection (4) at any time, during the financial year;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: it is the holding company of a group of companies, of which, at any time during the financial year, no member is—

subparagraph.content: a company specified in subsection (4); or
a non-Hong Kong body corporate specified in subsection (5); and (Replaced 35 of 2018 s. 33)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: the group of companies—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: is qualified as a group of small private companies for the financial year; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: is qualified as a group of eligible private companies for the financial year and the conditions specified in section 360(2) are satisfied.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of this Part, a company also falls within the reporting exemption for a financial year if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: it is a company limited by guarantee at all times, and is not a company specified in subsection (4) at any time, during the financial year;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: it is the holding company of a group of companies, of which, at any time during the financial year, no member is—

subparagraph.content: a company specified in subsection (4); or
a non-Hong Kong body corporate specified in subsection (5); and (Replaced 35 of 2018 s. 33)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the group of companies is qualified as a group of small guarantee companies for the financial year.

subsection.name: 3A
subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of this Part, a company also falls within the reporting exemption for a financial year if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: it is a private company or a company limited by guarantee at all times, and is not a company specified in subsection (4) at any time, during the financial year;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: it is the holding company of a group of companies, of which, at any time during the financial year, no member is—

subparagraph.content: a company specified in subsection (4); or
a non-Hong Kong body corporate specified in subsection (5);

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the group of companies is qualified as a mixed group for the financial year; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: (where any member of the group of companies is qualified as an eligible private company, but is not qualified as a small private company, for the financial year) the conditions specified in section 360(2) are satisfied. (Added 35 of 2018 s. 33)

subsection.leadIn: The company specified for the purposes of subsections (1), (2), (3) and (3A) is— (Amended 35 of 2018 s. 33)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: one that carries on any banking business and holds a valid banking licence granted under the Banking Ordinance (Cap. 155);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: one that is a corporation licensed under Part V of the Securities and Futures Ordinance (Cap. 571) to carry on a business in any regulated activity within the meaning of that Ordinance; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: one that—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: carries on any insurance business otherwise than solely as an agent; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: accepts, by way of trade or business (other than banking business), loans of money at interest or repayable at a premium, otherwise than on terms involving the issue of debentures or other securities.

subsection.leadIn: The non-Hong Kong body corporate specified for the purposes of subsections (2), (3) and (3A) is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a non-Hong Kong body corporate that carries on any business that, had it been carried on in Hong Kong, would be required to be carried on under a valid banking licence granted under the Banking Ordinance (Cap. 155), or under a licence under Part V of the Securities and Futures Ordinance (Cap. 571) to carry on a business in any regulated activity within the meaning of that Ordinance;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: a non-Hong Kong body corporate that—

subparagraph.content: carries on any insurance business otherwise than solely as an agent; or

accepts, by way of trade or business (other than banking business), loans of money at interest or repayable at a premium, otherwise than on terms involving the issue of debentures or other securities; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a non-Hong Kong body corporate that would have fallen within the meaning of public company in section 12 had it been incorporated under this Ordinance. (Added 35 of 2018 s. 33)

subsection.content: Despite section 358, the amendments made to subsections (2)(b) and (3)(b) by the Companies (Amendment) (No. 2) Ordinance 2018 (35 of 2018), and subsections (3A)(b)(ii) and (5), apply only in relation to a financial year beginning on or after the commencement date* of section 33 of that Ordinance. (Added 35 of 2018 s. 33)

section.name: s360
section.heading: Conditions specified for section 359(1)(c)(iii), (2)(c)(ii) and (3A)(d)

subsection.leadIn: The conditions specified for the purposes of section 359(1)(c)(iii) are—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: subject to subsection (3), a resolution is passed at a general meeting by the members holding at least 75% of the voting rights in the company to the effect that the company is to fall within the reporting exemption for the financial year; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the members holding the remaining voting rights do not vote against the resolution.

subsection.leadIn: The conditions specified for the purposes of section 359(2)(c)(ii) and (3A)(d) are—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: subject to subsection (3), a resolution is passed at a general meeting by the members holding at least 75% of the voting rights in the holding company to the effect that the holding company is to fall within the reporting exemption for the financial year; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the members holding the remaining voting rights do not vote against the resolution. (Replaced 35 of 2018 s. 34)

subsection.leadIn: If—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a resolution is passed for the purposes of subsection (1)(a) or (2)(a) to the effect that a company is to fall within the reporting exemption for a financial year;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: by notice in writing to the company, a member holding voting rights in the company objects to the company falling within the reporting exemption for the financial year; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the notice is given at least 6 months before the end of the financial year to which the objection relates,

subsection.continued: the resolution is regarded as not being passed in relation to the financial year to which the objection relates. (Amended 35 of 2018 s. 34)

subsection.content: Within 14 days after receiving a notice under subsection (3)(b), a company must notify its members of the objection.
Special notice is required for a resolution mentioned in subsection (1)(a) or (2)(a). (Amended 35 of 2018 s. 34)
subsection.statutoryNote:
Note—
See also section 578 which sets out the requirements regarding special notice.

section.name: s361
section.heading: Small private company

subsection.content: For the purposes of this Part, if a company is a private company formed and registered under this Ordinance or is a private company that is a re-domiciled company, and any 2 of the conditions specified in section 1(1) of Schedule 3 are satisfied in its first financial year, the company is qualified as a small private company for that first financial year, and every subsequent financial year, until it is disqualified under subsection (4). (Amended 14 of 2025 s. 26)

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of this Part, if a company is an existing private company, and any 2 of the conditions specified in section 1(1) of Schedule 3 are satisfied—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in its first financial year after the coming into operation of this section; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the financial year of the company for the purposes of the predecessor Ordinance that immediately precedes that first financial year,

subsection.continued: the company is qualified as a small private company for that first financial year, and every subsequent financial year, until it is disqualified under subsection (4).

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of this Part, if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a company is a private company; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: after its first financial year after the coming into operation of this section, any 2 of the conditions specified in section 1(1) of Schedule 3 are satisfied for 2 consecutive financial years,

subsection.continued: the company is also qualified as a small private company for the financial year immediately following those 2 financial years, and every subsequent financial year, until it is disqualified under subsection (4).

subsection.content: For the purposes of this Part, if, after a company is qualified as a small private company under subsection (1), (2) or (3), any 2 of the conditions specified in section 1(2) of Schedule 3 are not satisfied for 2 consecutive financial years, the company is disqualified as a small private company for the financial year immediately following those 2 financial years, and every subsequent financial year, until it is qualified again under subsection (3).

section.name: s362
section.heading: Eligible private company

subsection.content: For the purposes of this Part, if a company is a private company formed and registered under this Ordinance or is a private company that is a re-domiciled company, and any 2 of the conditions specified in section 1(3) of Schedule 3 are satisfied in its first financial year, the company is qualified as an eligible private company for that first financial year, and every subsequent financial year, until it is disqualified under subsection (4). (Amended 14 of 2025 s. 27)

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of this Part, if a company is an existing private company, and any 2 of the conditions specified in section 1(3) of Schedule 3 are satisfied—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in its first financial year after the coming into operation of this section; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the financial year of the company for the purposes of the predecessor Ordinance that immediately precedes that first financial year,

subsection.continued: the company is qualified as an eligible private company for that first financial year, and every subsequent financial year, until it is disqualified under subsection (4).

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of this Part, if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a company is a private company; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: after its first financial year after the coming into operation of this section, any 2 of the conditions specified in section 1(3) of Schedule 3 are satisfied for 2 consecutive financial years,

subsection.continued: the company is also qualified as an eligible private company for the financial year immediately following those 2 financial years, and every subsequent financial year, until it is disqualified under subsection (4).

subsection.content: For the purposes of this Part, if, after a company is qualified as an eligible private company under subsection (1), (2) or (3), any 2 of the conditions specified in section 1(4) of Schedule 3 are not satisfied for 2 consecutive financial years, the company is disqualified as an eligible private company for the financial year immediately following those 2 financial years, and every subsequent financial year, until it is qualified again under subsection (3).

section.name: s363
section.heading: Small guarantee company

subsection.content: For the purposes of this Part, if a company is a company limited by guarantee formed and registered under this Ordinance, and the condition specified in section 1(5) of Schedule 3 is satisfied in its first financial year, the company is qualified as a small guarantee company for that first financial year, and every subsequent financial year, until it is disqualified under subsection (4).

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of this Part, if a company is an existing company limited by guarantee, and the condition specified in section 1(5) of Schedule 3 is satisfied—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in its first financial year after the coming into operation of this section; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the financial year of the company for the purposes of the predecessor Ordinance that immediately precedes that first financial year,

subsection.continued: the company is qualified as a small guarantee company for that first financial year, and every subsequent financial year, until it is disqualified under subsection (4).

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of this Part, if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a company is a company limited by guarantee; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: after its first financial year after the coming into operation of this section, the condition specified in section 1(5) of Schedule 3 is satisfied for 2 consecutive financial years,

subsection.continued: the company is also qualified as a small guarantee company for the financial year immediately following those 2 financial years, and every subsequent financial year, until it is disqualified under subsection (4).

subsection.content: For the purposes of this Part, if, after a company is qualified as a small guarantee company under subsection (1), (2) or (3), the condition specified in section 1(6) of Schedule 3 is not satisfied for 2 consecutive financial years, the company is disqualified as a small guarantee company for the financial year immediately following those 2 financial years, and every subsequent financial year, until it is qualified again under subsection (3).

section.name: s364
section.heading: Group of small private companies

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of this Part, if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the holding company of a group of companies is formed and registered under this Ordinance or is a re-domiciled company; and (Amended 14 of 2025 s. 28)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the conditions specified in section 1(7) of Schedule 3, and any 2 of the conditions specified in section 1(8) of that Schedule, are satisfied in the holding company’s first financial year,

subsection.continued: the group is qualified as a group of small private companies for that first financial year, and every subsequent financial year, until it is disqualified under subsection (4) or (5).

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of this Part, if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the holding company of a group of companies is an existing company; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the conditions specified in section 1(7) of Schedule 3, and any 2 of the conditions specified in section 1(8) of that Schedule, are satisfied— (Amended 35 of 2018 s. 35)

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: in the holding company’s first financial year after the coming into operation of this section; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: in the holding company’s financial year for the purposes of the predecessor Ordinance that immediately precedes that first financial year,

subsection.continued: the group is qualified as a group of small private companies for that first financial year, and every subsequent financial year, until it is disqualified under subsection (4) or (5).

subsection.content: For the purposes of this Part, if, after the first financial year of the holding company of a group of companies after the coming into operation of this section, the conditions specified in section 1(7) of Schedule 3, and any 2 of the conditions specified in section 1(8) of that Schedule, are satisfied for 2 consecutive financial years of the holding company, the group is also qualified as a group of small private companies for the financial year immediately following those 2 financial years, and every subsequent financial year, until it is disqualified under subsection (4) or (5).

For the purposes of this Part, if, after a group of companies is qualified as a group of small private companies under subsection (1), (2) or (3), another company or non-Hong Kong body corporate becomes a new member of the group in a financial year of the holding company such that either a condition specified in section 1(7) of Schedule 3 is not satisfied, or any 2 of the conditions specified in section 1(9) of that Schedule are not satisfied, for the financial year, the group is disqualified as a group of small private companies for the financial year, and every subsequent financial year, until it is qualified again under subsection (3).

For the purposes of this Part, if, after a group of companies is qualified as a group of small private companies under subsection (1), (2) or (3), either a condition specified in section 1(7) of Schedule 3 is not satisfied, or any 2 of the conditions specified in section 1(9) of that Schedule are not satisfied, for 2 consecutive financial years of the holding company, the group is also disqualified as a group of small private companies for the financial year immediately following those 2 financial years, and every subsequent financial year, until it is qualified again under subsection (3).

section.name: s365
section.heading: Group of eligible private companies

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of this Part, if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the holding company of a group of companies is formed and registered under this Ordinance or is a re-domiciled company; and (Amended 14 of 2025 s. 29)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the conditions specified in section 1(10) of Schedule 3, and any 2 of the conditions specified in section 1(11) of that Schedule, are satisfied in the holding company’s first financial year,

subsection.continued: the group is qualified as a group of eligible private companies for that first financial year, and every subsequent financial year, until it is disqualified under subsection (4) or (5).

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of this Part, if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the holding company of a group of companies is an existing company; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the conditions specified in section 1(10) of Schedule 3, and any 2 of the conditions specified in section 1(11) of that Schedule, are satisfied— (Amended 35 of 2018 s. 36)

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: in the holding company’s first financial year after the coming into operation of this section; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: in the holding company’s financial year for the purposes of the predecessor Ordinance that immediately precedes that first financial year,

subsection.continued: the group is qualified as a group of eligible private companies for that first financial year, and every subsequent financial year, until it is disqualified under subsection (4) or (5).

subsection.content: For the purposes of this Part, if, after the first financial year of the holding company of a group of companies after the coming into operation of this section, the conditions specified in section 1(10) of Schedule 3, and any 2 of the conditions specified in section 1(11) of that Schedule, are satisfied for 2 consecutive financial years of the holding company, the group is also qualified as a group of eligible private companies for the financial year immediately following those 2 financial years, and every subsequent financial year, until it is disqualified under subsection (4) or (5).

For the purposes of this Part, if, after a group of companies is qualified as a group of eligible private companies under subsection (1), (2) or (3), another company or non-Hong Kong body corporate becomes a new member of the group in a financial year of the holding company such that either a condition specified in section 1(10) of Schedule 3 is not satisfied, or any 2 of the conditions specified in section 1(12) of that Schedule are not satisfied, for the financial year, the group is disqualified as a group of eligible private companies for the financial year, and every subsequent financial year, until it is qualified again under subsection (3).

For the purposes of this Part, if, after a group of companies is qualified as a group of eligible private companies under subsection (1), (2) or (3), either a condition specified in section 1(10) of Schedule 3 is not satisfied, or any 2 of the conditions specified in section 1(12) of that Schedule are not satisfied, for 2 consecutive financial years of the holding company, the group is also disqualified as a group of eligible private companies for the financial year immediately following those 2 financial years, and every subsequent financial year, until it is qualified again under subsection (3).

section.name: s366
section.heading: Group of small guarantee companies

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of this Part, if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the holding company of a group of companies is formed and registered under this Ordinance; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the conditions specified in section 1(12A) and (13) of Schedule 3 are satisfied in the holding company’s first financial year,

subsection.continued: the group is qualified as a group of small guarantee companies for that first financial year, and every subsequent financial year, until it is disqualified under subsection (4) or (5).

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of this Part, if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the holding company of a group of companies is an existing company; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the conditions specified in section 1(12A) and (13) of Schedule 3 are satisfied— (Amended 35 of 2018 s. 37)

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: in the holding company’s first financial year after the coming into operation of this section; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: in the holding company’s financial year for the purposes of the predecessor Ordinance that immediately precedes that first financial year,

subsection.continued: the group is qualified as a group of small guarantee companies for that first financial year, and every subsequent financial year, until it is disqualified under subsection (4) or (5).

subsection.content: For the purposes of this Part, if, after the first financial year of the holding company of a group of companies after the coming into operation of this section, the conditions specified in section 1(12A) and (13) of Schedule 3 are satisfied for 2 consecutive financial years of the holding company, the group is also qualified as a group of small guarantee companies for the financial year immediately following those 2 financial years, and every subsequent financial year, until it is disqualified under subsection (4) or (5).

For the purposes of this Part, if, after a group of companies is qualified as a group of small guarantee companies under subsection (1), (2) or (3), another company or non-Hong Kong body corporate becomes a new member of the group in a financial year of the holding company such that a condition specified in section 1(12A) of Schedule 3 is not satisfied, or the condition specified in section 1(14) of that Schedule is not satisfied, for the financial year, the group is disqualified as a group of small guarantee companies for the financial year, and every subsequent financial year, until it is qualified again under subsection (3).

For the purposes of this Part, if, after a group of companies is qualified as a group of small guarantee companies under subsection (1), (2) or (3), a condition specified in section 1(12A) of Schedule 3 is not satisfied, or the condition specified in section 1(14) of that Schedule is not satisfied, for 2 consecutive financial years of the holding company, the group is also disqualified as a group of small guarantee companies for the financial year immediately following those 2 financial years, and every subsequent financial year, until it is qualified again under subsection (3).

section.name: s366A
section.heading: Mixed group

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of this Part, if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the holding company of a group of companies is a company;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the group only consists of—

subparagraph.content: one or more bodies corporate specified in subsection (2); and
one or more bodies corporate specified in subsection (3); and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: the specified conditions are satisfied—

subparagraph.content: in the first financial year of the holding company after the coming into operation of this section; or
in the financial year of the holding company that immediately precedes that first financial year,

subsection.continued: the group is qualified as a mixed group for that first financial year, and every subsequent financial year, until it is disqualified under subsection (6) or (7).

subsection.leadIn: A body corporate specified for the purposes of subsection (1)(b)(i) is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a small private company;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a non-Hong Kong body corporate that would have been qualified as a small private company had it been incorporated under this Ordinance;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: an eligible private company; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: a non-Hong Kong body corporate that would have been qualified as an eligible private company had it been incorporated under this Ordinance.

subsection.leadIn: A body corporate specified for the purposes of subsection (1)(b)(ii) is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a small guarantee company; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a non-Hong Kong body corporate that would have been qualified as a small guarantee company had it been incorporated under this Ordinance.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsection (1)(c), a reference to specified conditions is a reference to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if the holding company is a small private company—any 2 of the conditions specified in section 1(8) of Schedule 3;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the holding company is an eligible private company—any 2 of the conditions specified in section 1(11) of that Schedule;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: if the holding company is a small guarantee company—the condition specified in section 1(13) of that Schedule.

subsection.content: For the purposes of this Part, if, after the first financial year of the holding company of a group of companies after the coming into operation of this section, the condition under subsection (1)(b), and the conditions specified in subsection (4)(a), (b) or (c), are satisfied for 2 consecutive financial years of the holding company, the group is also qualified as a mixed group for the financial year immediately following those 2 financial years, and every subsequent financial year, until it is disqualified under subsection (6) or (7).

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of this Part, if, after a group of companies is qualified as a mixed group under subsection (1) or (5), another company or non-Hong Kong body corporate becomes a new member of the group in a financial year of the holding company and, for the financial year—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: either—

subparagraph.content: that other company is not a small private company, an eligible private company or a small guarantee company; or
that other body corporate would not have been qualified as a small private company, an eligible private company or a small guarantee company had it been incorporated under this Ordinance; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the specified conditions are not satisfied,

subsection.continued: the group is disqualified as a mixed group for the financial year, and every subsequent financial year, until it is qualified again under subsection (5).

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of this Part, if, after a group of companies is qualified as a mixed group under subsection (1) or (5), for 2 consecutive financial years of the holding company, either—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the condition under subsection (1)(b) is not satisfied; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the specified conditions are not satisfied,

subsection.continued: the group is also disqualified as a mixed group for the financial year immediately following those 2 financial years, and every subsequent financial year, until it is qualified again under subsection (5).

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsections (6)(b) and (7)(b), a reference to specified conditions is a reference to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if the holding company is a small private company—any 2 of the conditions specified in section 1(9) of Schedule 3;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the holding company is an eligible private company—any 2 of the conditions specified in section 1(12) of that Schedule;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: if the holding company is a small guarantee company—the condition specified in section 1(14) of that Schedule.

section.name: s367
section.heading: Financial year

subsection.leadIn: A company’s first financial year after the coming into operation of this section begins on the first day of its first accounting reference period and ends on— (Amended 35 of 2018 s. 39)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: subject to paragraph (b), the last day of that period; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: another date, within 7 days before, or after, the end of that period, as specified by the directors. (Amended 35 of 2018 s. 39)

subsection.leadIn: Every subsequent financial year of a company begins on the date immediately following the end of the previous financial year and ends on— (Amended 35 of 2018 s. 39)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: subject to paragraph (b), the last day of the accounting reference period immediately following the one by reference to which the previous financial year is determined; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: another date, within 7 days before, or after, the end of that period, as specified by the directors. (Amended 35 of 2018 s. 39)

subsection.content: If an undertaking is not a company, a reference in this Ordinance to its financial year is a reference to a period in respect of which a profit and loss account of the undertaking is required, by its constitution or by the law under which it is established, to be made up, whether or not the period is a year.
