paragraph.content: reasonably believes that the information is relevant to the performance of that other person’s duties as auditor of the company.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: work-related information (工作資料), in relation to a person who is or has been an auditor of a company, means information of which the person became aware in the capacity of auditor.

section.name: s415
section.heading: Avoidance of provisions protecting auditor from liability

subsection.content: This section applies to a provision contained in a company’s articles, or in a contract entered into by a company, or otherwise.

If a provision purports to exempt an auditor of the company from any liability that would otherwise attach to the auditor in connection with any negligence, default, breach of duty or breach of trust occurring in the course of performance of the duties as auditor in relation to the company, the provision is void.

If, by a provision, the company directly or indirectly provides an indemnity for an auditor of the company, or an auditor of an associated company of the company, against any liability attaching to the auditor in connection with any negligence, default, breach of duty or breach of trust occurring in the course of performance of the duties as auditor in relation to the company or associated company (as the case may be), the provision is void.

subsection.leadIn: Subsection (3) does not prevent a company from taking out and keeping in force insurance for an auditor of the company, or an auditor of an associated company of the company, against—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any liability to any person attaching to the auditor in connection with any negligence, default, breach of duty or breach of trust (except for fraud) occurring in the course of performance of the duties of auditor in relation to the company or associated company (as the case may be); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any liability incurred by the auditor in defending any proceedings (whether civil or criminal) taken against the auditor for any negligence, default, breach of duty or breach of trust (including fraud) occurring in the course of performance of the duties of auditor in relation to the company or associated company (as the case may be).

subsection.leadIn: Subsection (3) does not prevent a company from indemnifying an auditor of the company against any liability incurred by the auditor—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in defending any proceedings (whether civil or criminal) in which judgment is given in the auditor’s favour or the auditor is acquitted; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in connection with an application under section 903 or 904 in which relief is granted to the auditor by the Court.

subsection.leadIn: In this section, a reference to performance of the duties of auditor includes—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: making a cessation statement, giving the statement to the company, and requesting the company to comply with the requirement specified in section 422(5) in relation to the statement; (Amended 35 of 2018 s. 50)

paragraph.name: ab
paragraph.content: requiring the company to send a copy of a cessation statement to every member under section 423(2)(b); and (Added 35 of 2018 s. 50)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: making a statement of circumstances, and giving the statement to the company.

section.name: s416
section.heading: When appointment is terminated

subsection.leadIn: A person’s appointment as auditor of a company is terminated if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the term of office expires;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the person resigns from office under section 417(1);

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the person ceases to be auditor under section 418;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the person is removed from office under section 419(1); or

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: a winding up order is made in respect of the company.

subsection.leadIn: Where a firm is appointed, by the firm name, as auditor of a company, the appointment is also terminated if every person who is regarded as being appointed as auditor by virtue of section 399—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: ceases to be a partner in the firm before the term of office expires; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: ceases to be eligible, or becomes disqualified, for appointment as auditor of the company under Subdivision 2 before the term of office expires.

subsection.content: Where a body corporate is appointed as auditor of a company, the appointment is also terminated if the body corporate is dissolved.
If 2 or more persons are appointed as auditor of a company, and the appointment of any of the persons is terminated, the termination does not affect the appointment of the other person.

section.name: s417
section.heading: Resignation of auditor

subsection.content: A person may resign from the office of auditor by giving the company a notice in writing that is accompanied by a statement required to be given under section 424.

subsection.leadIn: Such a person’s term of office expires—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: at the end of the day on which notice is given to the company under subsection (1); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the notice specifies a time on a later day for the purpose, at that time.

subsection.content: Within 15 days beginning on the date on which a company receives a notice of resignation, the company must deliver a notification in the specified form of that fact to the Registrar for registration.

If a company contravenes subsection (3), the company, and every responsible person of the company, commit an offence, and each is liable to a fine at level 5 and to imprisonment for 6 months and, in the case of a continuing offence, to a further fine of $1,000 for each day during which the offence continues.

section.name: s418
section.heading: Cessation of office

subsection.leadIn: If, while holding office as auditor of a company, a person ceases to be eligible, or becomes disqualified, for appointment as auditor of the company under Subdivision 2, the person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: immediately ceases to be auditor of the company; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: must notify the company of the cessation in writing within 14 days from the date of the cessation.

subsection.content: A person who contravenes subsection (1)(b) commits an offence and is liable to a fine at level 4.

If a person is charged with an offence under subsection (2), it is a defence to establish that the person did not know, and had no reason to believe, that the person had ceased to be eligible, or had become disqualified, for appointment as auditor of the company under Subdivision 2.

section.name: s419
section.heading: Company may remove auditor

subsection.leadIn: A company may by an ordinary resolution passed at a general meeting remove a person from the office of auditor despite—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any agreement between the person and the company; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: anything in the company’s articles.

subsection.content: Special notice is required for an ordinary resolution proposed for the purposes of subsection (1).
subsection.statutoryNote:
Note—
See also section 578 which sets out the requirements regarding special notice.

subsection.content: On receipt of a special notice, the company must send a copy of it to the person proposed to be removed.

If an ordinary resolution for the removal is passed, the company must deliver a notice in the specified form of that fact to the Registrar for registration within 15 days beginning on the date on which it is passed.

If a company contravenes subsection (4), the company, and every responsible person of the company, commit an offence, and each is liable to a fine at level 3 and, in the case of a continuing offence, to a further fine of $300 for each day during which the offence continues.

section.name: s420
section.heading: Removed auditor not deprived of compensation, damages, etc.
section.leadIn: Section 419 does not deprive a person of compensation or damages payable to the person in respect of the person ceasing—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to hold office as auditor of a company; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to hold any appointment that is terminated with the termination of the person’s appointment as auditor.

subdivision.name: SD7
subdivision.heading: Outgoing Auditor’s Right to Requisition Meeting of Company and Make Representation

section.name: s421
section.heading: Resigning auditor may requisition meeting

subsection.content: If a person gives under section 417(1) a notice of resignation that is accompanied by a statement of circumstances given under section 424(a), the person may, by another notice given to the company with the notice of resignation, require the directors to convene a general meeting of the company for receiving and considering the explanation of the circumstances connected with the resignation that the person places before the meeting.

Within 21 days beginning on the date on which the company receives that other notice, the directors must convene a general meeting for a date falling within 28 days after the date on which the notice convening the meeting is given.

subsection.leadIn: If the directors of a company contravene subsection (2), every director who failed to take all reasonable steps to secure that a general meeting was convened as required by that subsection commits an offence and is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on conviction on indictment to a fine of $150,000 and to imprisonment for 2 years; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on summary conviction to a fine at level 5 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

section.name: s422
section.heading: Cessation statement in relation to, and attendance at, general meeting

subsection.leadIn: If a general meeting is convened under section 421(2), the person who resigns from the office of auditor—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: may give the company a statement by the person that sets out in reasonable length the circumstances surrounding the resignation;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: may request the company to comply with the requirement specified in subsection (5) in relation to the statement; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: is entitled—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: to be given every notice of, and every other item of communication, relating to the general meeting, that a member of the company is entitled to be given;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: to attend the general meeting; and

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: to be heard at the general meeting on any part of the business of the meeting that concerns the person as auditor or former auditor of the company.

subsection.leadIn: If special notice is given under section 400(1)(a) for a resolution for appointing a person as auditor in place of another person, that other person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: may give the company a statement by that other person that sets out in reasonable length the circumstances surrounding the termination of the appointment as auditor;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: may request the company to comply with the requirement specified in subsection (5) in relation to the statement; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: is entitled—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: to be given every notice of, and every other item of communication, relating to the general meeting, that a member of the company is entitled to be given;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: to attend the general meeting; and

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: to be heard at the general meeting on any part of the business of the meeting that concerns the person as auditor or former auditor of the company.

subsection.leadIn: If special notice is given under section 419(2) for an ordinary resolution for removing a person from the office of auditor, the person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: may give the company a statement by the person that sets out in reasonable length the circumstances surrounding the proposed removal; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: may request the company to comply with the requirement specified in subsection (5) in relation to the statement.

subsection.content: A person’s entitlement under subsection (1)(c)(ii) or (iii) or (2)(c)(ii) or (iii) is, if the person is a firm or body corporate, exercisable by a natural person authorized by the person to act as the person’s representative at the meeting.

subsection.leadIn: The requirement specified for the purposes of subsection (1)(b), (2)(b) or (3)(b) is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: if the company receives the statement on a date that is more than 2 days before the last day on which notice may be given under section 571(1) to call the general meeting, the requirement—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: to state, in every notice of the meeting given to the members, that the statement has been made; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: to send a copy of the statement to every member to whom a notice of the meeting is or has been given; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the company has not sent a copy of the statement to every member to whom a notice of the meeting is or has been given, the requirement to ensure that the statement is read out at the meeting.

subsection.content: Unless exempted by an order under subsection (7), the company must comply with a request made under subsection (1)(b), (2)(b) or (3)(b).

subsection.leadIn: On application by the company or by anyone who claims to be aggrieved, the Court may order that the company is exempted from complying with the request, if it is satisfied that the person who has given a statement and made a request under subsection (1)(a) and (b), (2)(a) and (b) or (3)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: has abused the right to do so; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: has used such a right to secure needless publicity for defamatory matter.

subsection.content: If a company contravenes subsection (6), the company, and every responsible person of the company, commit an offence, and each is liable to a fine at level 5.

section.name: s423
section.heading: Cessation statement in relation to written resolution

subsection.content: This section applies if a company sends a copy of a written resolution to a person under section 401(3)(b)(i).

subsection.leadIn: The person may, within 14 days after receiving a copy of the written resolution from the company—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: give the company a statement by the person that sets out in reasonable length the circumstances surrounding the termination of the appointment as auditor; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: require the company to send a copy of the statement to every member at the same time when the written resolution is circulated under section 550 or 552.

subsection.content: Section 553 applies to the circulation of the written resolution as if the reference to 21 days in section 553(3) were replaced by a reference to 28 days.
Unless exempted by an order under subsection (5), the company must comply with a requirement made under subsection (2)(b).

subsection.leadIn: On application by the company or by anyone who claims to be aggrieved, the Court may order that the company is exempted from complying with the requirement, if it is satisfied that the person who has given a statement and made a requirement under subsection (2)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: has abused the right to do so; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: has used such a right to secure needless publicity for defamatory matter.

subsection.content: If a company contravenes subsection (4), the written resolution is ineffective.

section.name: s424
section.heading: Duty of resigning auditor to give statement
section.leadIn: A person who resigns from office under section 417(1) must, on the resignation, give the company—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if the person considers that there are circumstances connected with the resignation that should be brought to the attention of the company’s members or creditors, a statement of those circumstances; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the person considers that there are no such circumstances, a statement to that effect.

section.name: s425
section.heading: Duty of auditor who retires or is removed to give statement

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (3), a person whose appointment as auditor is terminated under section 416(1)(a) or (d) must, on the termination, give the company—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if the person considers that there are circumstances connected with the termination that should be brought to the attention of the company’s members or creditors, a statement of those circumstances; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the person considers that there are no such circumstances, a statement to that effect.

subsection.leadIn: Such a person must send a statement mentioned in subsection (1) to the company so that it will be received by the company—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: where the person’s term of office expires because the person is not deemed to be reappointed as auditor under section 403(2)(d), at least 14 days before the end of the appointment period in relation to the next financial year; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in any other case, within 14 days beginning on the date of termination.

subsection.leadIn: Subsection (1) does not apply if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the person’s appointment is terminated under section 416(1)(a); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the person—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: is appointed as auditor of the company for a term immediately following the term of office that expires; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: is deemed by section 403 to be reappointed as auditor of the company for the next financial year.

subsection.content: A person who contravenes subsection (1) or (2) commits an offence and is liable to a fine at level 3 and, in the case of a continuing offence, to a further fine of $300 for each day during which the offence continues.

If a person is charged with an offence under subsection (4), it is a defence to establish that the person took all reasonable steps to secure compliance with subsection (1) or (2) (as the case may be).

section.name: s426
section.heading: Company’s and aggrieved person’s responses to statement of circumstances

subsection.leadIn: If a company is given a statement of circumstances, the company must, within 14 days beginning on the date on which it receives the statement—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: send a copy of the statement to every member of the company; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: apply to the Court for an order directing that copies of the statement are not to be sent under paragraph (a).

subsection.content: If a company makes an application under subsection (1)(b), it must give notice of the application to the person who has given the statement of circumstances to the company.

A person who claims to be aggrieved by a statement of circumstances may, within 14 days beginning on the date on which the company receives the statement, apply to the Court for an order directing that copies of the statement are not to be sent under subsection (1)(a).

subsection.leadIn: If a person makes an application under subsection (3), the person must give notice of the application to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the company; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the person who has given the statement of circumstances to the company.

subsection.leadIn: If—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a person gives a company a statement of circumstances; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: within 21 days beginning on the date on which the company receives the statement, the person has not received notice of an application under subsection (2) or (4),

subsection.continued: the person must within the next 7 days deliver a copy of the statement to the Registrar for registration.

subsection.leadIn: If a company contravenes subsection (1), the company, and every responsible person of the company, commit an offence, and each is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on conviction on indictment to a fine of $150,000 and to imprisonment for 2 years; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on summary conviction to a fine at level 5 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

subsection.content: If a person contravenes subsection (5), the person commits an offence and is liable to a fine at level 3 and, in the case of a continuing offence, to a further fine of $300 for each day during which the offence continues.
If a person is charged with an offence under subsection (7), it is a defence to establish that the person took all reasonable steps to secure compliance with subsection (5).

section.name: s427
section.heading: Court may order statement of circumstances not to be sent

subsection.content: This section applies if an application has been made under section 426(1)(b) or (3) in relation to a statement of circumstances given by a person to a company.

subsection.leadIn: If the Court is satisfied that the person has abused the use of the statement of circumstances or is using the statement to secure needless publicity for defamatory matter, the Court—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: must direct that copies of the statement are not to be sent under section 426(1)(a); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: may order the person, though not a party to the application, to pay the applicant’s costs on the application in whole or in part.

subsection.leadIn: If the Court gives directions under subsection (2)(a), the company must, within 15 days beginning on the date on which the directions are given—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: send a notice setting out the effect of the directions to—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: every member of the company; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: unless already named as a party to the proceedings, the person who has given the statement of circumstances to the company; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: deliver a copy of the notice to the Registrar for registration.

subsection.leadIn: If the Court decides not to grant the application, the company must, within 15 days beginning on the date on which the decision is made or on which the proceedings are discontinued for any reason—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: give notice of the decision to the person who has given the statement of circumstances to the company; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: send a copy of the statement of circumstances to every member of the company and to that person.

subsection.content: Within 7 days beginning on the date on which a person receives a notice under subsection (4)(a), the person must deliver a copy of the statement of circumstances to the Registrar for registration.

section.name: s428
section.heading: Offences relating to section 427

subsection.leadIn: If a company contravenes section 427(3) or (4), the company, and every responsible person of the company, commit an offence, and each is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on conviction on indictment to a fine of $150,000 and to imprisonment for 2 years; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on summary conviction to a fine at level 5 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

subsection.content: A person who contravenes section 427(5) commits an offence and is liable to a fine at level 3 and, in the case of a continuing offence, to a further fine of $300 for each day during which the offence continues.

If a person is charged with an offence under subsection (2) for contravening section 427(5), it is a defence to establish that the person took all reasonable steps to secure compliance with that section.

division.name: D6
division.heading: Laying and Publication of Financial Statements and Reports

section.name: s429
section.heading: Directors must lay financial statements etc. before company in general meeting

subsection.content: A company’s directors must, in respect of each financial year, lay before the company in annual general meeting, or in any other general meeting directed by the Court, a copy of the reporting documents for the financial year within the period specified in section 431.
Subsection (1) does not apply in relation to a financial year in respect of which an annual general meeting is not required to be held under section 612.
A director of a company who fails to take all reasonable steps to secure compliance with subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable to a fine of $300,000.

A director of a company who wilfully fails to take all reasonable steps to secure compliance with subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable to a fine of $300,000 and to imprisonment for 12 months.

subsection.leadIn: If a person is charged with an offence under subsection (3)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: it is a defence to establish that the person had reasonable grounds to believe, and did believe, that a competent and reliable person—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: was charged with the duty of ensuring that subsection (1) was complied with; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: was in a position to discharge that duty; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: it is not a defence to establish that the financial statements or report was not in fact prepared as required by this Ordinance.

section.name: s430
section.heading: Company must send copies of financial statements etc. to members before general meeting

subsection.content: If a company is required to hold an annual general meeting in accordance with section 610 in respect of a financial year, the company must send a copy of the reporting documents for the financial year to every member at least 21 days before the date of the meeting at which the copy is required by section 429 to be laid.

For the purposes of subsection (1), even though a copy of the reporting documents for the financial year is sent to a member less than 21 days before the date of the meeting at which the copy is required by section 429 to be laid, the copy is to be regarded as having been sent to the member at least 21 days before that date if so agreed by all members entitled to attend and vote at that meeting.

If, by virtue of section 612(2), a company is not required to hold an annual general meeting in accordance with section 610 in respect of a financial year, the company must send a copy of the reporting documents for the financial year to every member within the period specified in section 431.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of section 833(3)(c), a notification is to be sent—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the case of subsection (1), at least 21 days before the date of the general meeting at which a copy of the reporting documents is required by section 429 to be laid; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the case of subsection (3), at least 21 days before the date on which a copy of the reporting documents is sent to every member under that subsection.

subsection.leadIn: The period specified for the purposes of section 833(3)(d)(i) is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the case of subsection (1), the period beginning at least 21 days before the date of the general meeting at which a copy of the reporting documents is required by section 429 to be laid and ending on the date of that meeting; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the case of subsection (3), the period of 21 days after the date on which a notification under section 833(3)(c) is sent.

subsection.content: If a copy or copies of the reporting documents are sent under this section over a period of days, the copy or copies are to be regarded as having been sent on the last day of the period for the purpose of a reference in this Ordinance to the day on which the copy or copies are sent under this section.

section.name: s431
section.heading: Period for laying and sending financial statements etc.

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (2), the period specified for the purposes of sections 429(1) and 430(3) is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: where the company is a private company described in subsection (3), or a company limited by guarantee, at the end of the accounting reference period by reference to which the financial year is determined—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: subject to subparagraph (ii), the period of 9 months, or any longer period directed by the Court, after the end of that accounting reference period; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: if that accounting reference period is the company’s first accounting reference period and is longer than 12 months, whichever of the periods set out in subsection (4)(a) and (b) expires last; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: where the company is neither a private company described in subsection (3), nor a company limited by guarantee, at the end of that accounting reference period—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: subject to subparagraph (ii), the period of 6 months, or any longer period directed by the Court, after the end of that accounting reference period; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: if that accounting reference period is the company’s first accounting reference period and is longer than 12 months, whichever of the periods set out in subsection (5)(a) and (b) expires last.

subsection.leadIn: If, after a new accounting reference date is specified under section 371(1), the accounting reference period by reference to which the financial year is determined is shortened, the period specified for the purposes of section 429(1) and 430(3) is whichever of the following expires last—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the period specified in subsection (1);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the period of 3 months after the date of the directors’ resolution.

subsection.content: For the purposes of subsection (1)(a) or (b), the private company is one that is not a subsidiary of a public company at any time during the financial year.

subsection.leadIn: The periods set out for the purposes of subsection (1)(a)(ii) are—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the period of 9 months, or any longer period directed by the Court, after the first anniversary of the specified event; and (Amended 14 of 2025 s. 34)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the period of 3 months after the end of the accounting reference period by reference to which the financial year is determined.

subsection.leadIn: The periods set out for the purposes of subsection (1)(b)(ii) are—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the period of 6 months, or any longer period directed by the Court, after the first anniversary of the specified event; and (Amended 14 of 2025 s. 34)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the period of 3 months after the end of the accounting reference period by reference to which the financial year is determined.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—

def.name: SpecifiedEvent
def.leadIn: specified event (指明事件)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in relation to a company other than a re-domiciled company—means the incorporation of the company; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in relation to a re-domiciled company—means the registration of the company under section 820C(1). (Added 14 of 2025 s. 34)

section.name: s432
section.heading: Exception to section 430

subsection.content: Section 430 does not require a company to send a copy of any document to a member whose address is unknown to the company.

subsection.leadIn: Section 430 does not require a company to send a copy of any document—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the case of joint holders of shares none of whom is entitled to receive notices of the company’s general meeting, to more than one of the holders; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the case of joint holders of shares some of whom are so entitled and some not, to those who are not entitled.

subsection.content: Section 430 does not require a company to send a copy of any document to a member if the company has sent the member a copy of the summary financial report for the financial year under section 441, or in compliance with a request under section 444.

If a company does not have a share capital, section 430 does not require the company to send a copy of any document to a member who is not entitled to receive notice of general meeting of the company.

section.name: s433
section.heading: Offences relating to section 430

subsection.content: If a company contravenes section 430(1), the company, and every responsible person of the company, commit an offence, and each is liable to a fine at level 5.
If a company contravenes section 430(3), the company, and every responsible person of the company, commit an offence, and each is liable to a fine of $300,000.

If a company wilfully contravenes section 430(3), the company, and every responsible person of the company, commit an offence, and each is liable to a fine of $300,000 and to imprisonment for 12 months.
If a person is charged with an offence under subsection (1) or (2), it is not a defence to establish that the financial statements or report was not in fact prepared as required by this Ordinance.

section.name: s434
section.heading: Company must send to non-voting members other documents

subsection.leadIn: A company must, at the same time when it sends a copy of the reporting documents under section 430, send to every member who is not entitled to vote at a general meeting of the company—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a copy of any document issued by the company and circulated by the company with a copy of the reporting documents under section 430; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a copy of any other document intended for the purpose of providing information about the company’s affairs that is so circulated.

subsection.content: If a company contravenes subsection (1), the company, and every responsible person of the company, commit an offence, and each is liable to a fine at level 5.

section.name: s435
section.heading: Company must send copies of financial statements etc. to members and others on demand

subsection.leadIn: Within 7 days after a demand is made by a member or a member’s personal representative, a company must send to the member or personal representative—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: one copy of the latest financial statements;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: one copy of the latest directors’ report; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: one copy of the auditor’s report on those latest financial statements.

subsection.content: A copy of a document that a person is entitled to be sent under subsection (1) is in addition to any copy of the document that the person is entitled to be sent under section 430.

If a company contravenes subsection (1), the company, and every responsible person of the company, commit an offence, and each is liable to a fine at level 5 and, in the case of a continuing offence, to a further fine of $1,000 for each day during which the offence continues.

If a person is charged with an offence under subsection (3), it is a defence to establish that the member or member’s personal representative (as the case may be) had previously made another demand for the document concerned and had been provided with a copy of the document.

section.name: s436
section.heading: Requirement in connection with publication of financial statements etc.

subsection.leadIn: This section applies if a company—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: circulates, publishes or issues—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: any specified financial statements in relation to the company; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: any non-statutory accounts in relation to the company; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: otherwise makes such financial statements or accounts available for public inspection in a manner calculated to invite members of the public generally, or any class of them, to read the financial statements or accounts.

subsection.content: The specified financial statements must be accompanied by the auditor’s report on those statements.

subsection.leadIn: The non-statutory accounts must be accompanied by a statement indicating—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: that those accounts are not specified financial statements in relation to the company;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: whether the specified financial statements for the financial year with which those accounts purport to deal have been delivered to the Registrar;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: whether an auditor’s report has been prepared on the specified financial statements for the financial year; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.leadIn: whether the auditor’s report—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: was qualified or otherwise modified;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: referred to any matter to which the auditor drew attention by way of emphasis without qualifying the report; or

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: contained a statement under section 406(2) or 407(2) or (3).

subsection.content: The non-statutory accounts must not be accompanied by any auditor’s report on the specified financial statements.
If subsection (2), (3) or (4) is contravened, the company, and every responsible person of the company, commit an offence, and each is liable to a fine of $150,000.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—

def.name: NonstatutoryAccounts
def.leadIn: non-statutory accounts (非法定帳目), in relation to a company—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: means—

subparagraph.content: any statement of financial position or statement of comprehensive income, otherwise than as part of any financial statements prepared by the directors, relating to, or purporting to deal with, a financial year of the company; or

accounts in any form, otherwise than as part of any financial statements prepared by the directors, purporting to be a statement of financial position or statement of comprehensive income for a group of companies consisting of the company and its subsidiary undertakings relating to, or purporting to deal with, a financial year of the company; but

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: excludes any summary financial report; (Replaced 35 of 2018 s. 52)

def.name: SpecifiedFinancialStatements
def.leadIn: specified financial statements (指明財務報表), in relation to a company, means any financial statements prepared by the directors—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a copy of which is required by section 429(1) to be laid before the company in general meeting; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a copy of which is required by section 430(3) to be sent to every member or is otherwise circulated, published or issued by the company.

section.name: s437
section.heading: Interpretation
section.leadIn: In this Division—
section.def: potential member (潛在成員), in relation to a company, means a person who is entitled, whether conditionally or unconditionally, to become a member of the company.

section.name: s438
section.heading: Application of Division
section.content: This Division applies to a company in relation to a financial year if the company does not fall within the reporting exemption for the financial year.

section.name: s439
section.heading: Directors may prepare financial report in summary form

subsection.content: The directors of a company may prepare for a financial year a financial report, in summary form, derived from the reporting documents for the financial year, a copy of which is required to be sent to every member of the company under section 430.

subsection.leadIn: A financial report prepared under subsection (1)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: must contain the information prescribed by the Regulation; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: must comply with other requirements prescribed by the Regulation.

subsection.leadIn: If subsection (2) is contravened—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a director who failed to take all reasonable steps to secure compliance with that subsection commits an offence and is liable to a fine of $300,000; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a director who wilfully failed to take all reasonable steps to secure compliance with that subsection commits an offence and is liable to a fine of $300,000 and to imprisonment for 12 months.

subsection.leadIn: If a person is charged with an offence under subsection (3)(a), it is a defence to establish that the person had reasonable grounds to believe, and did believe, that a competent and reliable person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: was charged with the duty of ensuring that subsection (2) was complied with; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: was in a position to discharge that duty.

section.name: s440
section.heading: Summary financial report to be approved and signed

subsection.leadIn: A summary financial report—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: must be approved by the directors; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: must be signed on the directors’ behalf by a director.

subsection.content: Every copy of a summary financial report sent to a member under this Division or otherwise circulated, published or issued by the company must state the name of the director who signed the report on the directors’ behalf.

If, as respect any summary financial report a copy of which is circulated, published or issued by the company, subsection (1) is contravened, the company, and every responsible person of the company, commit an offence, and each is liable to a fine at level 4.
If subsection (2) is contravened, the company, and every responsible person of the company, commit an offence, and each is liable to a fine at level 4.

section.name: s441
section.heading: Company may send copy of summary financial report to member

subsection.content: If a company is required to send a copy of the reporting documents for a financial year to a member under section 430, the company may send a copy of the summary financial report for the financial year (if any) to the member instead.

If a company sends a copy of the summary financial report for a financial year to a member under subsection (1), the copy must be sent during the period within which a copy of the reporting documents for the financial year would be required to be sent to the member by the company under section 430.

section.name: s442
section.heading: Company may seek member’s intent on receiving summary financial report

subsection.content: A company may notify every member or potential member to give the company a notice of intent under subsection (3).

subsection.leadIn: A notification to a member or potential member—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: must be given in writing; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: must be given in relation to a financial year.

subsection.leadIn: In response to a notification, a member or potential member may give the company a notice of intent to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: request—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: either a copy of the reporting documents or a copy of the summary financial report; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: none of those copies; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the case of paragraph (a)(i), request the copy to be sent by the company in hard copy form, in electronic form, or by making it available on a website.

subsection.content: A member or potential member may only make a request under subsection (3)(b) in response to a notification for a copy of the reporting documents or a copy of the summary financial report to be sent in electronic form or by making it available on a website if the company has given, in the notification, the member or potential member an option to request the copy to be so sent.

If a notice of intent is received by the company at least 28 days before the first date on which a copy of the reporting documents for the financial year is sent to a member under section 430, the notice of intent has effect in relation to that financial year, and every subsequent financial year, until it ceases to have effect by virtue of subsection (7).

subsection.leadIn: If a notice of intent is received by the company less than 28 days before the first date on which a copy of the reporting documents for the financial year is sent to a member under section 430—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the notice of intent has effect in relation to every financial year subsequent to that financial year until it ceases to have effect by virtue of subsection (7); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the member or potential member is to be regarded as—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: having requested a copy of the summary financial report for the financial year; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: having requested the summary financial report to be sent by the company in hard copy form.

subsection.leadIn: A notice of intent ceases to have effect if the person who gave the notice—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is no longer a member of the company; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: revokes the notice by giving the company a written notice of revocation.

subsection.leadIn: If a member or potential member does not give the company a notice of intent in response to a notification before the first date on which a copy of the reporting documents for the financial year is sent to a member under section 430, the member or potential member is to be regarded as—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: having requested a copy of the summary financial report for the financial year and every subsequent financial year; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: having requested the summary financial report to be sent by the company in hard copy form.

subsection.leadIn: Subsection (8) ceases to have effect in relation to a person if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the person is no longer a member of the company; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the person gives the company a written notice of cessation of statutory election.

section.name: s443
section.heading: Notice of revocation and notice of cessation of statutory election

subsection.leadIn: A notice of revocation given by a person for the purposes of section 442(7)(b)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: must state the financial year to which it relates;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: must state that the notice of intent previously given by the person is revoked;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: must state that the person requests—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: either a copy of the reporting documents or a copy of the summary financial report; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: none of those copies; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: in the case of paragraph (c)(i), must state that the person requests the copy to be sent by the company in hard copy form, in electronic form, or by making it available on a website.

subsection.content: The request stated in a notice of revocation under subsection (1)(c) must be different from the request stated in the notice of intent revoked by the notice of revocation.

subsection.leadIn: A notice of cessation of statutory election given by a person for the purposes of section 442(9)(b)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: must state the financial year to which it relates;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: must state that the person is no longer regarded as having made the requests mentioned in section 442(8);

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: must state that the person requests—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: either a copy of the reporting documents or a copy of the summary financial report; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: none of those copies; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: in the case of paragraph (c)(i), must state that the person requests the copy to be sent by the company in hard copy form, in electronic form, or by making it available on a website.

subsection.content: A person may only state in a notice of revocation under subsection (1)(d), or a notice of cessation of statutory election under subsection (3)(d), that the person requests for a copy of the reporting documents or a copy of the summary financial report to be sent in electronic form or by making it available on a website if the company has given, in the notification under section 442(1) to which the notice relates, the person an option to request the copy to be so sent.

If a notice of revocation, or a notice of cessation of statutory election, is received by the company at least 28 days before the first date on which a copy of the reporting documents for the financial year to which the notice relates is sent to a member under section 430, the notice has effect in relation to that financial year, and every subsequent financial year.

If a notice of revocation, or a notice of cessation of statutory election, is received by the company less than 28 days before the first date on which a copy of the reporting documents for the financial year to which the notice relates is sent to a member under section 430, the notice has effect in relation to every financial year subsequent to that financial year.

section.name: s444
section.heading: Company must comply with member’s request in notice of intent etc.

subsection.content: If a person requests a copy of the reporting documents, or a copy of the summary financial report, in a relevant notice, the company must comply with the request unless it is prohibited from doing so by section 446.

The request must be complied with during the period within which a copy of the reporting documents for the relevant financial year would be required to be sent to the person by the company under section 430.

Subsection (1) does not require a company to comply with a potential member’s request unless the potential member becomes a member of the company at least 28 days before the first date on which a copy of the reporting documents for the financial year is sent to a member under section 430(1) or (3).

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: relevant financial year (有關財政年度) means the financial year in relation to which the relevant notice has effect under section 442 or 443;

def.name: RelevantNotice
def.leadIn: relevant notice (有關通知) means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a notice of intent given under section 442(3);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a notice of revocation given for the purposes of section 442(7)(b); or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a notice of cessation of statutory election given for the purposes of section 442(9)(b).

section.name: s445
section.heading: Additional copy of reports etc. to be sent by company

subsection.content: If a company has sent a copy of the summary financial report for a financial year to a person under section 441, or in compliance with a request under section 444, the company must, at the person’s request, send a copy of the reporting documents for the financial year to the person at the time specified in subsection (3).

If a company has sent a copy of the reporting documents for a financial year to a person under section 430, the company must, at the person’s request, send a copy of the summary financial report for the financial year to the person at the time specified in subsection (3) unless it is prohibited from doing so by section 446.

subsection.leadIn: The time specified for subsection (1) or (2) is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: where a copy of the reporting documents for the financial year is to be laid before the company in general meeting under section 429(1), and the company receives the person’s request more than 14 days before the date of that meeting, any time falling at least 7 days before the date of that meeting; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in any other case, any time within 14 days after the date on which the company receives the person’s request.

subsection.leadIn: Subsection (1) or (2) does not require a company to send a copy of the summary financial report or reporting documents for a financial year to a person if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: where a copy of the reporting documents for the financial year is laid before the company in general meeting under section 429(1), the person’s request is made after the expiry of a period of 6 months after the date of that meeting; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: where a copy of the reporting documents for the financial year is sent to every member under section 430(3), the person’s request is made after the expiry of a period of 6 months after the date on which the copy is sent.

subsection.leadIn: Subsection (2) does not require a company to send a copy of the summary financial report for a financial year to a person unless—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the company has prepared the summary financial report for the financial year; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: when the company sent a copy of the reporting documents for the financial year to the person, the company gave the person a right to request a copy of the summary financial report for the financial year.

subsection.content: If a company contravenes subsection (1) or (2), the company, and every responsible person of the company, commit an offence, and each is liable to a fine at level 5 and, in the case of a continuing offence, to a further fine of $1,000 for each day during which the offence continues.
If a company is charged with an offence under subsection (6), it is a defence to establish that it took all reasonable steps to secure compliance with subsection (1) or (2) (as the case may be).

section.name: s446
section.heading: Company must not send summary financial report under some circumstances

subsection.leadIn: A company must not send a copy of the summary financial report for the purposes of section 441(1) for a financial year to a member if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the company’s articles require that a copy of the reporting documents for the financial year must be sent to each member; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the company’s articles prohibit the company from sending a copy of the summary financial report for the purposes of section 441(1) for the financial year to a member.

subsection.leadIn: A company must not send a copy of the summary financial report for a financial year to a member if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an auditor’s report has not been prepared on the financial statements for the financial year;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the summary financial report has not been approved by the directors;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the summary financial report has not been signed on the directors’ behalf; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the summary financial report does not comply with section 439(2).

subsection.content: If a company contravenes subsection (1) or (2), the company, and every responsible person of the company, commit an offence, and each is liable to a fine at level 5.

section.name: s447
section.heading: Exemption applicable to dormant company

subsection.leadIn: The following provisions do not apply to a company that is a dormant company under section 5(1)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: section 367(4);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: Subdivisions 3 and 4 of Division 4;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: Subdivisions 2 and 3 of Division 5;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: sections 411 and 412;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: Subdivisions 6, 7 and 8 of Division 5;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: Divisions 6 and 7.

subsection.leadIn: If such a company enters into an accounting transaction—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: subsection (1) ceases to have effect on and after the date of the accounting transaction; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a member of the company who knew or ought to have known about the accounting transaction, and every director of the company, are personally liable for any debt or liability of the company arising out of the accounting transaction.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: director (董事) includes a shadow director.

section.name: s448
section.heading: Liability for untrue or misleading statement in reports

subsection.leadIn: This section applies to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a directors’ report; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a summary financial report so far as it is derived from a directors’ report.

subsection.leadIn: A director of a company is liable to compensate the company for any loss suffered by the company as a result of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any untrue or misleading statement in the report; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the omission from the report of anything required to be included in it.

subsection.leadIn: A director is not liable unless—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the case of subsection (2)(a), the director knew the statement to be untrue or misleading or was reckless as to whether it was untrue or misleading; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the case of subsection (2)(b), the director knew the omission to be a dishonest concealment of a material fact.

subsection.content: A person is not subject to any liability to another person other than the company resulting from reliance, by that other person or any other person, on information contained in the report.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsection (4), a person is also subject to a liability to another person if that other person is entitled against the person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to be granted any civil remedy; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to rescind or repudiate an agreement.

subsection.content: This section does not affect liability for criminal offence.

section.name: s449
section.heading: Voluntary revision of financial statements etc.

subsection.leadIn: If—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a copy of any financial statements prepared by the directors of a company has been sent under section 430 to a member; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: it subsequently appears to the directors of the company that the financial statements did not comply with this Ordinance,

subsection.continued: the directors may cause the financial statements to be revised and make necessary consequential revisions to the summary financial report or directors’ report concerned.

subsection.leadIn: Such revision of the financial statements is to be confined to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: those aspects of the financial statements that did not comply with this Ordinance; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: other necessary consequential revisions.

subsection.leadIn: If—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the directors of a company decide to cause any financial statements to be revised under subsection (1); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a copy of the financial statements has been delivered to the Registrar in compliance with section 664(3)(b),

subsection.continued: the company must, within 7 days after the decision, deliver to the Registrar for registration a warning statement, in the specified form, that the financial statements will be so revised.

subsection.content: If a company contravenes subsection (3), the company, and every responsible person of the company, commit an offence, and each is liable to a fine at level 5 and, in the case of a continuing offence, to a further fine of $1,000 for each day during which the offence continues.

section.name: s450
section.heading: Financial Secretary may make regulation regarding revision of financial statements etc.

subsection.leadIn: The Financial Secretary may make regulations—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: providing for the application of this Ordinance in relation to the financial statements, summary financial report or directors’ report that has been revised under section 449; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: providing for requirements in relation to revised financial statements, summary financial report or directors’ report.

subsection.leadIn: The regulations may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: make different provisions according to whether the financial statements, summary financial report or directors’ report has been revised by—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: supplementing the financial statements or report with another document that shows the revisions; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: replacing the financial statements or report;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: provide for the functions of the persons who prepare the auditor’s report in relation to the financial statements, summary financial report or directors’ report that has been revised;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: where—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the financial statements or directors’ report, or a copy of the statements or report, has, before the revision, been laid before the company in general meeting under section 429, been sent to members under section 430, or been delivered to the Registrar in compliance with section 664(3)(b); or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: a copy of a summary financial report has, before the revision, been sent to a member under section 441, or in compliance with a request under section 444 or 445(2),

paragraph.continued: require the company or the directors of the company to take the steps specified in the regulations in relation to the financial statements or report that has been revised; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: provide for the application of this Ordinance to the financial statements, summary financial report or directors’ report that has been revised, subject to such additions, exceptions and modifications as may be specified in the regulations.

subsection.leadIn: The regulations may provide that any of the following is an offence—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: a failure to take all reasonable steps to secure compliance with, as respects the financial statements, summary financial report or directors’ report that has been revised—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: a specified provision of the regulations; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: a specified provision of this Ordinance as having effect under the regulations;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: a contravention of—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: a specified provision of the regulations; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: a specified provision of this Ordinance as having effect under the regulations.

subsection.content: The maximum fine that may be prescribed for an offence committed wilfully is $300,000 and the maximum imprisonment is 12 months. The maximum fine that may be prescribed for an offence not committed wilfully is $300,000. In addition, in the case of a continuing offence, a further fine not exceeding $2,000 for each day during which the offence continues may be prescribed.

subsection.name: 4A
subsection.leadIn: The regulations may also provide that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a contravention of a provision in relation to revised financial statements is an offence; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the maximum penalty that may be prescribed—

subparagraph.content: for such an offence of which a person is convicted on indictment, is a fine of $150,000 and imprisonment for 2 years; and
for such an offence of which a person is summarily convicted, is a fine at level 5 and imprisonment for 6 months. (Added 35 of 2018 s. 53)

subsection.content: The regulations may provide for defences to any such offence.

section.name: s451
section.heading: Financial Secretary may make regulation regarding disclosures of certain information
section.content: The Financial Secretary may make regulations prescribing, for the purposes of section 383(3), a requirement that the financial statements for the financial year are to contain a statement showing the information about the matter mentioned in section 383(1)(d).

section.name: s452
section.heading: Financial Secretary may make other regulations

subsection.content: The Financial Secretary may make regulations prescribing a body for the purposes of the definition of accounting standards in section 357(1). (Amended 35 of 2018 s. 54)

subsection.leadIn: The Financial Secretary may make regulations—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: prescribing information that is required to be contained in the notes to any financial statements under section 383(1); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: prescribing other requirements for notes to any financial statements.

subsection.leadIn: The Financial Secretary may make regulations—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: prescribing information that is required to be contained in a directors’ report under section 388(1) and (2); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: prescribing other requirements for a directors’ report.

subsection.leadIn: The Financial Secretary may make regulations—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: prescribing information that is required to be contained in a summary financial report under section 439(2); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: prescribing other requirements for a summary financial report.

subsection.leadIn: The Financial Secretary may make regulations—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: providing for the form and contents of—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: a notification under section 442(2);

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: a notice of intent under section 442(3); or

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: any document attached to such a notification or notice; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: providing that any such document is to be postage prepaid.

part.name: P10
part.heading: Directors and Company Secretaries

division.name: D1
division.heading: Appointment, Removal and Resignation of Directors

section.name: s453
section.heading: Public company and company limited by guarantee required to have at least 2 directors

subsection.leadIn: This section applies to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a public company; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a company limited by guarantee.

subsection.content: The company must have at least 2 directors.

For a company formed and registered under this Ordinance, with effect from the date of incorporation, the first directors of the company are the persons named as the directors in the incorporation form delivered to the Registrar under section 67(1). (Amended 14 of 2025 s. 35)

subsection.name: 3A
subsection.content: For a re-domiciled company that is a public company, with effect from the re-domiciliation date, the first directors of the company are the persons named in the re-domiciliation form delivered to the Registrar under section 820B(2) as the first directors of the company after it is registered under section 820C(1). (Added 14 of 2025 s. 35)

A person who is deemed to be a director of the company under section 153(2) of the pre-amended predecessor Ordinance immediately before the commencement date# of this section continues to be deemed to be a director of the company as if section 19(1) of Schedule 2 to the Companies (Amendment) Ordinance 2004 (30 of 2004) had not been enacted, until a notice of appointment of a director is delivered to the Registrar in accordance with section 645(1).

If a power specified in subsection (6) is exercisable by a director under the company’s articles where the number of directors is reduced below the number fixed as the necessary quorum of directors, the power is exercisable also where the number of directors is reduced below the number required by subsection (2).

subsection.leadIn: The power specified for the purposes of subsection (5) is a power to act for the purpose of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: increasing the number of directors; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: calling a general meeting of the company,

subsection.continued: but not for any other purpose.

subsection.leadIn: In subsection (4)—
subsection.def: pre-amended predecessor Ordinance (修訂前的《前身條例》) means the predecessor Ordinance that was in force immediately before it was amended by section 19(1) of Schedule 2 to the Companies (Amendment) Ordinance 2004 (30 of 2004).

section.name: s454
section.heading: Private company required to have at least one director

subsection.content: A private company must have at least one director.

For a private company formed and registered under this Ordinance, with effect from the date of incorporation, the first directors of the company are the persons named as the directors in the incorporation form delivered to the Registrar under section 67(1). (Amended 14 of 2025 s. 36)

subsection.name: 2A
subsection.content: For a re-domiciled company that is a private company, with effect from the re-domiciliation date, the first directors of the company are the persons named in the re-domiciliation form delivered to the Registrar under section 820B(2) as the first directors of the company after it is registered under section 820C(1). (Added 14 of 2025 s. 36)

A person who is deemed to be a director of a private company under section 153A(2) of the pre-amended predecessor Ordinance immediately before the commencement date# of this section continues to be deemed to be a director of the company as if section 20(1) of Schedule 2 to the Companies (Amendment) Ordinance 2004 (30 of 2004) had not been enacted, until a notice of appointment of a director is delivered to the Registrar in accordance with section 645(1).

subsection.leadIn: In subsection (3)—
subsection.def: pre-amended predecessor Ordinance (修訂前的《前身條例》) means the predecessor Ordinance that was in force immediately before it was amended by section 20(1) of Schedule 2 to the Companies (Amendment) Ordinance 2004 (30 of 2004).

section.name: s455
section.heading: Nomination of reserve director of private company

subsection.content: If a private company has only one member and that member is the sole director of the company, the company may by a resolution passed at a general meeting, despite anything in its articles, nominate a person (other than a body corporate) who has attained the age of 18 years as a reserve director of the company to act in the place of the sole director in the event of the sole director’s death.

subsection.leadIn: The nomination of a person as a reserve director of a private company ceases to have effect if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: before the death of the director in respect of whom the person was nominated—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the person resigns as reserve director in accordance with section 464; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the company at a general meeting revokes the nomination; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the director in respect of whom the person was nominated ceases to be the sole member and sole director of the company for any reason other than the death of that director.

subsection.content: If the nomination of a person as a reserve director of a private company ceases to have effect under subsection (2), the company must deliver a notice to the Registrar in accordance with section 645(4).

subsection.leadIn: Subject to compliance with the conditions specified in subsection (5), in the event of the death of the director in respect of whom the reserve director is nominated, the reserve director is to be regarded as a director of the company for all purposes until—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a person is appointed as a director of the company in accordance with its articles; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the reserve director resigns from the office of director in accordance with section 464,

subsection.continued: whichever is the earlier.

subsection.leadIn: The conditions specified for the purposes of subsection (4) are—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: that the nomination of the reserve director has not ceased to have effect under subsection (2); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: that the reserve director is not prohibited by law nor disqualified from acting as a director of the company.

section.name: s456
section.heading: Restriction on body corporate being director

subsection.leadIn: This section applies to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a public company;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a private company that is a member of a group of companies of which a listed company is a member; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a company limited by guarantee.

subsection.content: A body corporate must not be appointed a director of the company.
An appointment made in contravention of subsection (2) is void.

subsection.leadIn: Nothing in this section affects any liability of a body corporate under any provision of this Ordinance or the Companies (Winding Up and Miscellaneous Provisions) Ordinance (Cap. 32) if it—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: purports to act as a director; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: acts as a shadow director,

subsection.continued: although it could not, by virtue of this section, be appointed as a director.

section.name: s457
section.heading: Requirement to have at least one director who is natural person

subsection.content: This section applies to a private company other than a private company that is a member of a group of companies of which a listed company is a member.
The company must have at least one director who is a natural person.

section.name: s458
section.heading: Direction requiring company to appoint director

subsection.content: If it appears to the Registrar that a company is in contravention of section 453(2), 454(1) or 457(2), the Registrar may direct the company to appoint a director or directors in compliance with that section.

subsection.leadIn: The direction must specify—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the statutory requirement of which the company appears to be in contravention;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: subject to subsection (3), the period within which the company must comply with the direction; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: that a failure to comply with the direction is an offence under subsection (6).

subsection.content: The period must not be less than one month or more than 3 months after the date on which the direction is given.
The Registrar may, before the end of the period specified in the direction, by notice in writing extend the period.

The company must comply with the direction by making the necessary appointment or appointments before the end of the period specified in the direction, or, if the period is extended by the Registrar under subsection (4), the extended period.

If a company fails to comply with a direction under this section, the company, and every responsible person of the company, commit an offence, and each is liable to a fine at level 6 and, in the case of a continuing offence, to a further fine of $2,000 for each day during which the offence continues.

section.name: s459
section.heading: Minimum age for appointment as director

subsection.content: A person must not be appointed a director of a company unless at the time of appointment the person has attained the age of 18 years.
An appointment made in contravention of subsection (1) is void.

subsection.leadIn: Nothing in this section affects any liability of a person under any provision of this Ordinance or the Companies (Winding Up and Miscellaneous Provisions) Ordinance (Cap. 32) if the person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: purports to act as a director; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: acts as a shadow director,

subsection.continued: although the person could not, by virtue of this section, be appointed as a director.

section.name: s460
section.heading: Appointment of directors to be voted on individually

subsection.leadIn: This section applies to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a public company; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a company limited by guarantee.

subsection.content: At a general meeting of the company, a motion for the appointment of 2 or more persons as directors of the company by a single resolution must not be made, unless a resolution that it may be so made has first been passed at the meeting without any vote against it.
A resolution moved in contravention of subsection (2) is void, whether or not its being so moved was objected to at the time.

Despite the fact that the resolution is void, no provision (whether contained in a company’s articles or in any contract with the company or otherwise) for the automatic reappointment of retiring directors in default of another appointment applies.
For the purposes of this section, a motion for approving a person’s appointment, or for nominating a person for appointment, is to be regarded as a motion for the appointment of the person.

section.name: s461
section.heading: Validity of acts of director

subsection.leadIn: The acts of a person acting as a director are valid despite the fact that it is afterwards discovered—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: that there was a defect in the appointment of the person as a director;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: that the person was not qualified to hold office as a director or was disqualified from holding office as a director;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: that the person had ceased to hold office as a director; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: that the person was not entitled to vote on the matter in question.

subsection.leadIn: Subsection (1) applies even if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the appointment of the person as a director is void under section 456(3) or 459(2); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the resolution for the appointment of the person as a director is void under section 460(3).

section.name: s462
section.heading: Resolution to remove director

subsection.content: A company may by an ordinary resolution passed at a general meeting remove a director before the end of the director’s term of office, despite anything in its articles or in any agreement between it and the director.
Subsection (1) does not, if the company is a private company, authorize the removal of a director who has held office for life since 31 August 1984.
Subsections (4), (5), (6), (7) and (8) apply in relation to a removal of a director by resolution, irrespective of whether the removal by resolution is under subsection (1) or otherwise.

subsection.leadIn: Special notice is required of a resolution—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to remove a director; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to appoint somebody in place of a director so removed at the meeting at which the director is removed.

subsection.statutoryNote:
Note—
See also section 578 which sets out the requirements regarding special notice.
