subsection.content: A vacancy created by the removal of a director, if not filled at the meeting at which the director is removed, may be filled as a casual vacancy.

A person appointed director in place of a removed director is to be regarded, for the purpose of determining the time at which that person or any other director is to retire, as if that person had become director on the day on which the person removed was last appointed a director.

In relation to a resolution to remove a director before the end of the director’s term of office, no share may, on a poll, carry a greater number of votes than it would carry in relation to the generality of matters to be voted on at a general meeting of the company.

If a share carries special voting rights (that is to say, rights different from those carried by other shares) in relation to some matters but not others, the reference in subsection (7) to the generality of matters to be voted on at a general meeting of the company is to be construed as a reference to the matters in relation to which the share carries no special voting rights.

subsection.leadIn: This section is not to be regarded as depriving a person of compensation or damages payable to the person in respect of the termination of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the person’s appointment as director; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any appointment terminating with that as director.

section.name: s463
section.heading: Director’s right to protest against removal

subsection.content: On receipt of notice of a resolution under section 462(4) to remove a director, the company must forthwith send a copy of the notice to the director concerned.
The director (whether or not a member of the company) is entitled to be heard on the resolution at the meeting at which the resolution is voted on.

subsection.leadIn: If notice is given of a resolution under section 462(4) to remove a director, the director—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: may make with respect to the resolution representations in writing to the company (not exceeding a reasonable length); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: may request the company to comply with the requirement specified in subsection (4) in relation to the representations.

subsection.leadIn: The requirement specified for the purposes of subsection (3)(b) is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: if the company receives the representations on a date that is more than 2 days before the last day on which notice may be given under section 571(1) to call the meeting, the requirement—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: to state, in every notice of the meeting given to the members, that the representations have been made; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: to send a copy of the representations to every member to whom a notice of the meeting is or has been given; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the company has not sent a copy of the representations to every member to whom a notice of the meeting is or has been given, the requirement to ensure that the representations are read out at the meeting.

subsection.content: Unless exempted by an order under subsection (6), the company must comply with a request made under subsection (3)(b).

subsection.leadIn: On application by the company or by anyone who claims to be aggrieved, the Court may order that the company is exempted from complying with the request, if it is satisfied that the person who has made representations and made a requirement under subsection (3)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: has abused the right to do so; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: has used such a right to secure needless publicity for defamatory matter.

subsection.content: If the company contravenes subsection (5), the resolution passed under section 462(1) is void even though section 562(1) is complied with.

section.name: s464
section.heading: Resignation of director

subsection.content: A director of a company may, unless it is otherwise provided in the articles of the company or by any agreement with the company, resign as director at any time.
If a director of a company resigns, the company must deliver a notice of the resignation to the Registrar in the manner required by section 645(4).

Despite subsection (2), if the director resigning has reasonable grounds for believing that the company will not deliver the notice, the director resigning must deliver to the Registrar for registration a notice of the resignation in the specified form.

subsection.leadIn: The notice required to be delivered under subsection (3) must state—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: whether the director resigning is required by the articles of the company or by any agreement with the company to give notice of resignation to the company; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if notice is so required, whether the notice has been given in accordance with the requirement.

subsection.leadIn: If notice of the resignation of a director of a company is required to be given by the articles of the company or by any agreement with the company, the resignation does not have effect unless the director gives notice in writing of the resignation—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in accordance with the requirement;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: by leaving it at the registered office of the company; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: by sending it to the company in hard copy form or in electronic form.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: director (董事) includes a reserve director and a person regarded as a director under section 455(4).

division.name: D2
division.heading: Directors’ Duty of Care, Skill and Diligence

section.name: s465
section.heading: Duty to exercise reasonable care, skill and diligence

subsection.content: A director of a company must exercise reasonable care, skill and diligence.

subsection.leadIn: Reasonable care, skill and diligence mean the care, skill and diligence that would be exercised by a reasonably diligent person with—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the general knowledge, skill and experience that may reasonably be expected of a person carrying out the functions carried out by the director in relation to the company; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the general knowledge, skill and experience that the director has.

subsection.content: The duty specified in subsection (1) is owed by a director of a company to the company.

The duty specified in subsection (1) has effect in place of the common law rules and equitable principles as regards the duty to exercise reasonable care, skill and diligence, owed by a director of a company to the company.
This section applies to a shadow director as it applies to a director.

For the purposes of subsection (5), a body corporate is not to be regarded as a shadow director of any of its subsidiaries by reason only that the directors, or a majority of the directors, of the subsidiary are accustomed to act in accordance with its direction or instructions.

section.name: s466
section.heading: Civil consequences of breach of duty to exercise reasonable care, skill and diligence
section.content: Without affecting other provisions of this Ordinance or the Companies (Winding Up and Miscellaneous Provisions) Ordinance (Cap. 32), the consequences of breach (or threatened breach) of the duty specified in section 465(1) are the same as would apply if the common law rules or equitable principles that section 465(1) replaces applied.

section.name: s467
section.heading: Interpretation and application

subsection.leadIn: In this Division—

def.name: PermittedIndemnityProvision
def.leadIn: permitted indemnity provision (獲准許的彌償條文), in relation to a company, means a provision that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: provides for indemnity against liability incurred by a director of the company to a third party; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: meets the requirements specified in section 469(2);

subsection.def: third party (第三者), in relation to a company, means a person other than the company or an associated company.

subsection.content: Sections 468, 469 and 470 apply to any provision made on or after the commencement date# of those sections.
Sections 471 and 472 apply to a permitted indemnity provision made on or after the commencement date# of those sections.
Section 473 applies to conduct by a director on or after the commencement date# of that section.

section.name: s468
section.heading: Avoidance of provisions protecting director from liability

subsection.content: This section applies to a provision contained in a company’s articles, or in a contract entered into by a company, or otherwise.

If a provision purports to exempt a director of the company from any liability that would otherwise attach to the director in connection with any negligence, default, breach of duty or breach of trust in relation to the company, the provision is void.

If, by a provision, the company directly or indirectly provides an indemnity for a director of the company, or a director of an associated company of the company, against any liability attaching to the director in connection with any negligence, default, breach of duty or breach of trust in relation to the company or associated company (as the case may be), the provision is void.

subsection.leadIn: Subsection (3) does not prevent a company from taking out and keeping in force insurance for a director of the company, or a director of an associated company of the company, against—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any liability to any person attaching to the director in connection with any negligence, default, breach of duty or breach of trust (except for fraud) in relation to the company or associated company (as the case may be); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any liability incurred by the director in defending any proceedings (whether civil or criminal) taken against the director for any negligence, default, breach of duty or breach of trust (including fraud) in relation to the company or associated company (as the case may be).

section.name: s469
section.heading: Permitted indemnity provision

subsection.content: Section 468(3) does not apply to a provision for indemnity against liability incurred by the director to a third party if the requirements specified in subsection (2) are met in relation to the provision.

subsection.leadIn: The provision must not provide any indemnity against—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: any liability of the director to pay—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: a fine imposed in criminal proceedings; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: a sum payable by way of a penalty in respect of non-compliance with any requirement of a regulatory nature; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: any liability incurred by the director—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: in defending criminal proceedings in which the director is convicted;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: in defending civil proceedings brought by the company, or an associated company of the company, in which judgment is given against the director;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: in defending civil proceedings brought on behalf of the company by a member of the company or of an associated company of the company, in which judgment is given against the director;

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: in defending civil proceedings brought on behalf of an associated company of the company by a member of the associated company or by a member of an associated company of the associated company, in which judgment is given against the director; or

subparagraph.name: v
subparagraph.content: in connection with an application for relief under section 358 of the predecessor Ordinance or section 903 or 904 in which the Court refuses to grant the director relief.

subsection.content: A reference in subsection (2)(b) to a conviction, judgment or refusal of relief is to the final decision in the proceedings.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsection (3), a conviction, judgment or refusal of relief—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if not appealed against, becomes final at the end of the period for bringing an appeal; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if appealed against, becomes final when the appeal, or any further appeal, is disposed of.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsection (4)(b), an appeal is disposed of if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: it is determined, and the period for bringing any further appeal has ended; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: it is abandoned or otherwise ceases to have effect.

section.name: s470
section.heading: Permitted indemnity provision to be disclosed in directors’ report

subsection.content: If, when a directors’ report prepared by the directors of a company is approved in accordance with section 391, a permitted indemnity provision (whether made by the company or otherwise) is in force for the benefit of one or more directors of the company, the report must state that the provision is in force.

If, at any time during the financial year to which a directors’ report prepared by the directors of a company relates, a permitted indemnity provision (whether made by the company or otherwise) was in force for the benefit of one or more persons who were then directors of the company, the report must state that the provision was in force.

If, when a directors’ report prepared by the directors of a company is approved in accordance with section 391, a permitted indemnity provision made by the company is in force for the benefit of one or more directors of an associated company of the company, the report must state that the provision is in force.

If, at any time during the financial year to which a directors’ report prepared by the directors of a company relates, a permitted indemnity provision made by the company was in force for the benefit of one or more persons who were then directors of an associated company of the company, the report must state that the provision was in force.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—

def.name: DirectorsReport
def.leadIn: directors’ report (董事報告) means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the report required to be prepared under section 388(1); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the consolidated report required to be prepared under section 388(2).

section.name: s471
section.heading: Place where copy of permitted indemnity provision must be kept

subsection.leadIn: This section has effect if a permitted indemnity provision is made for a director of a company, and applies—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to that company (whether the provision is made by that company or an associated company of that company); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the provision is made by an associated company, to that associated company.

subsection.leadIn: A company to which this section applies must keep the following at its registered office or at a place prescribed by regulations made under section 657—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a copy of the permitted indemnity provision;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the provision is not in writing, a written memorandum setting out the terms of the provision.

subsection.leadIn: The company—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: must retain the copy or memorandum for at least one year after the date of termination or expiry of the provision; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: must keep the copy or memorandum available for inspection during that time.

subsection.content: If the copy or memorandum is kept at a place other than the company’s registered office, the company must notify the Registrar of the place, or any change in the place, at which the copy or memorandum is kept. The notice must be in the specified form and delivered to the Registrar for registration within 15 days after the copy or memorandum is first kept at that place or within 15 days after the change (as the case may be).
If a company contravenes subsection (2) or (3), the company, and every responsible person of the company, commit an offence, and each is liable to a fine at level 3.

If a company contravenes subsection (4), the company, and every responsible person of the company, commit an offence, and each is liable to a fine at level 3 and, in the case of a continuing offence, to a further fine of $300 for each day during which the offence continues.
In this section, a reference to a permitted indemnity provision includes a variation of the provision.

section.name: s472
section.heading: Right of member to inspect and request copy

subsection.content: A member of a company is entitled, on request made in the prescribed manner and without charge, to inspect, in accordance with regulations made under section 657, a copy of a permitted indemnity provision or a written memorandum kept by the company under section 471.
A member of the company is entitled, on request and on payment of a prescribed fee, to be provided with a copy of the provision or memorandum in accordance with regulations made under section 657.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: prescribed (訂明) means prescribed by regulations made under section 657.

subsection.content: In this section, a reference to a permitted indemnity provision includes a variation of the provision.

section.name: s473
section.heading: Ratification of conduct by director involving negligence, etc.

subsection.content: This section applies to the ratification by a company of conduct by a director involving negligence, default, breach of duty or breach of trust in relation to the company.
A decision of the company to ratify the conduct may only be made by resolution of the members of the company.

subsection.leadIn: If such a resolution is proposed at a meeting, every vote in favour of the resolution by a member who—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is a director in respect of whose conduct the ratification is sought;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: is an entity connected with that director; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: holds any shares in the company in trust for that director or entity,

subsection.continued: is to be disregarded.

subsection.content: Subsection (3) does not prevent a member specified in that subsection from attending, being counted towards the quorum for, or taking part in the proceedings at, any meeting at which the decision is considered.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of this section—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.def: conduct (行為) includes acts and omissions;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.def: director (董事) includes a former director;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a shadow director is to be regarded as a director; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: a reference to an entity connected with a director has the meaning given by section 486.

subsection.leadIn: Nothing in this section affects—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the validity of a decision taken by unanimous consent of the members of the company; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any power of the directors to agree not to sue, or to settle or release a claim made by them on behalf of the company.

subsection.leadIn: This section does not affect—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any other Ordinance or rule of law imposing additional requirements for valid ratification; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any rule of law as to acts that are incapable of being ratified by the company.

division.name: D4
division.heading: Appointment and Resignation of Company Secretaries

section.name: s474
section.heading: Company required to have company secretary

subsection.content: A company must have a company secretary.

For a company formed and registered under this Ordinance, with effect from the date of incorporation, the first company secretary of the company is the person named as the company secretary in the incorporation form delivered to the Registrar under section 67(1). (Amended 14 of 2025 s. 37)

subsection.name: 2A
subsection.content: For a re-domiciled company, with effect from the re-domiciliation date, the first company secretary of the company is the person named in the re-domiciliation form delivered to the Registrar under section 820B(2) as the first company secretary of the company after it is registered under section 820C(1). (Added 14 of 2025 s. 37)

If, in relation to a company mentioned in subsection (2), the name of a firm is specified in the incorporation form under section 5(1)(c) of Schedule 2, all partners of the firm as at the date of the incorporation form are the first joint company secretaries of the company. (Amended 14 of 2025 s. 37)

subsection.name: 3A
subsection.content: If, in relation to a re-domiciled company, the name of a firm is specified in the re-domiciliation form under section 6(2)(c) of Schedule 6B, all partners of the firm as at the re-domiciliation date are the first joint company secretaries of the re-domiciled company. (Added 14 of 2025 s. 37)

subsection.leadIn: A company secretary of a company must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if a natural person, ordinarily reside in Hong Kong; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if a body corporate, have its registered office or a place of business in Hong Kong.

subsection.leadIn: Anything required or authorized to be done by or to the company secretary may be done—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: if there is no assistant or deputy company secretary capable of acting, by or to any officer of the company authorized generally or specially in that behalf by the directors.

section.name: s475
section.heading: Circumstances under which director may not be company secretary

subsection.content: Subject to subsections (2) and (3), a director of a company may be a company secretary of the company.
The director of a private company having only one director must not also be a company secretary of the company.
No private company having only one director may have as company secretary of the company a body corporate the sole director of which is the sole director of the private company.

section.name: s476
section.heading: Direction requiring company to appoint company secretary

subsection.content: If it appears to the Registrar that a company is in contravention of section 474(1) or (4) or 475(2) or (3), the Registrar may direct the company to appoint a company secretary in compliance with that section.

subsection.leadIn: The direction must specify—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the statutory requirement of which the company appears to be in contravention;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: subject to subsection (3), the period within which the company must comply with the direction; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: that a failure to comply with the direction is an offence under subsection (6).

subsection.content: The period must not be less than one month or more than 3 months after the date on which the direction is given.
The Registrar may, before the end of the period specified in the direction, by notice in writing extend the period.

The company must comply with the direction by making the necessary appointment before the end of the period specified in the direction, or, if the period is extended by the Registrar under subsection (4), the extended period.

If a company fails to comply with a direction under this section, the company, and every responsible person of the company, commit an offence, and each is liable to a fine at level 6 and, in the case of a continuing offence, to a further fine of $2,000 for each day during which the offence continues.

section.name: s477
section.heading: Resignation of company secretary

subsection.content: A company secretary of a company may, unless it is otherwise provided in the articles of the company or by any agreement with the company, resign as company secretary at any time.
If a company secretary of a company resigns, the company must deliver a notice of the resignation to the Registrar in the manner required by section 652(2).

Despite subsection (2), if the company secretary resigning has reasonable grounds for believing that the company will not deliver the notice, the company secretary resigning must deliver to the Registrar for registration a notice of the resignation in the specified form.

subsection.leadIn: The notice required to be delivered under subsection (3) must state—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: whether the company secretary resigning is required by the articles of the company or by any agreement with the company to give notice of resignation to the company; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if notice is so required, whether the notice has been given in accordance with the requirement.

subsection.leadIn: If notice of the resignation of a company secretary of a company is required to be given by the articles of the company or by any agreement with the company, the resignation does not have effect unless the company secretary gives notice in writing of the resignation—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in accordance with the requirement;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: by leaving it at the registered office of the company; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: by sending it to the company in hard copy form or in electronic form.

division.name: D5
division.heading: Miscellaneous Provisions Relating to Directors and Company Secretaries

section.name: s478
section.heading: Director vicariously liable for acts of alternate etc.

subsection.leadIn: If the articles of a company authorize a director to appoint an alternate director to act in place of the director, then, unless the articles contain any provision to the contrary, whether express or implied—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an alternate director so appointed is deemed to be the agent of the director who appoints the alternate director; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a director who appoints an alternate director is vicariously liable for any tort committed by the alternate director while acting in the capacity of alternate director.

subsection.content: Nothing in subsection (1)(b) affects the personal liability of an alternate director for any act or omission.

section.name: s479
section.heading: Avoidance of acts done by person in dual capacity as director and company secretary

subsection.leadIn: A provision requiring or authorizing a thing to be done by or to a director and a company secretary of a company is not satisfied by its being done by or to the same person acting—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: both as director and company secretary; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: both as director and in place of the company secretary.

subsection.leadIn: This section applies to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any provision of this Ordinance or the Companies (Winding Up and Miscellaneous Provisions) Ordinance (Cap. 32); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any provision in a company’s articles.

section.name: s480
section.heading: Provisions as to undischarged bankrupt acting as director

subsection.content: A person who is an undischarged bankrupt must not act as director of, or directly or indirectly take part or be concerned in the management of, a company, except with the leave of the Court by which the person was adjudged bankrupt.

subsection.leadIn: A person who contravenes subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on conviction on indictment to a fine of $700,000 and to imprisonment for 2 years; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on summary conviction to a fine of $150,000 and to imprisonment for 12 months.

subsection.content: The Court must not give leave for the purposes of this section unless notice of intention to apply for it has been served on the Official Receiver.

If the Official Receiver is of opinion that it is contrary to the public interest that an application under subsection (3) should be granted, the Official Receiver must attend the hearing of, and oppose the granting of, the application.

subsection.leadIn: In subsection (1)—
subsection.def: company (公司) has the meaning given by section 168C(1) of the Companies (Winding Up and Miscellaneous Provisions) Ordinance (Cap. 32).

section.name: s481
section.heading: Minutes of directors’ meetings and directors’ resolutions

subsection.leadIn: A company must cause the following to be recorded—(Amended 35 of 2018 s. 55)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: minutes of all proceedings at meetings of its directors; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: all resolutions passed by its directors without a meeting.

subsection.leadIn: A company must keep the records under subsection (1) for at least 10 years from— (Amended 35 of 2018 s. 55)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the date of the meeting; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the date of the passing of the resolution without a meeting.

subsection.content: If a company contravenes subsection (1) or (2), the company, and every responsible person of the company, commit an offence, and each is liable to a fine at level 5 and, in the case of a continuing offence, to a further fine of $1,000 for each day during which the offence continues.

This section does not apply to a resolution passed without a meeting before the commencement date* of section 55 of the Companies (Amendment) (No. 2) Ordinance 2018 (35 of 2018). (Added 35 of 2018 s. 55)

section.name: s482
section.heading: Minutes as evidence

subsection.content: Minutes recorded in accordance with section 481, if purporting to be signed by the chairperson of the meeting or by the chairperson of the next directors’ meeting, are evidence of the proceedings at the meeting.

subsection.leadIn: If the proceedings at a meeting of directors are evidenced by minutes under subsection (1), then, until the contrary is proved— (Amended 35 of 2018 s. 56)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the meeting is to be regarded as having been duly held and convened;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: all proceedings at the meeting are to be regarded as having duly taken place; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: all appointments at the meeting are to be regarded as valid.

subsection.content: Subsection (2)(c) is subject to sections 456(3) and 459(2).

section.name: s483
section.heading: Written record of decision of sole director of private company

subsection.leadIn: If a private company has only one director and the director takes any decision that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: may be taken in a meeting of directors; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: has effect as if agreed in a meeting of directors,

subsection.continued: the director must (unless that decision is taken by way of a resolution in writing) provide the company with a written record of that decision within 7 days after the decision is made.

subsection.content: If the director provides the company with a written record of a decision in accordance with subsection (1), that record is sufficient evidence of the decision having been taken by the director.
A company must keep a written record provided to the company in accordance with subsection (1) for at least 10 years from the date of the decision.
A director who contravenes subsection (1) commits an offence.
If a company contravenes subsection (3), the company, and every responsible person of the company, commit an offence.
A person who commits an offence under subsection (4) is liable to a fine at level 3.

A person who commits an offence under subsection (5) is liable to a fine at level 5 and, in the case of a continuing offence, to a further fine of $1,000 for each day during which the offence continues.
A contravention of subsection (1) by a director does not affect the validity of any decision mentioned in that subsection.

part.name: P11
part.heading: Fair Dealing by Directors

section.name: s484
section.heading: Interpretation

subsection.leadIn: In this Division—
subsection.def: child (子女) includes a step-child, an illegitimate child and a child adopted in any manner recognized by the law of Hong Kong;
cohabitation relationship (同居關係) means a relationship between 2 persons (whether of the same sex or of the opposite sex) who live together as a couple in an intimate relationship;
director (董事) includes a shadow director.

subsection.content: In this Division, a reference to a minor child is a reference to a child who is under 18 years of age.

section.name: s485
section.heading: Circumstances constituting contravention
section.content: In this Part, a reference to circumstances constituting a contravention includes, in the case of a transaction or arrangement that, but for any fact or circumstances, would not be prohibited because of Subdivision 3 of Division 2, the fact or circumstances.

section.name: s486
section.heading: Connected entity

subsection.leadIn: In this Part, a reference to an entity connected with a director or former director of a company is a reference to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a member of the director’s or former director’s family;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a person who is in a cohabitation relationship with the director or former director;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: a minor child of a person falling within paragraph (b) who—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: is not a child of the director or former director; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: lives with the director or former director;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: a body corporate with which the director or former director is associated;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: a person acting in the capacity as trustee of a specified trust, other than a trust for the purpose of an employee share scheme or a pension scheme; or

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.leadIn: a person acting in the capacity as partner of—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the director or former director;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the spouse of the director or former director;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: a minor child of the director or former director; or

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: another person who, by virtue of paragraph (e), is an entity connected with the director or former director.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsection (1)(e), a trust is a specified trust—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: if the beneficiaries of the trust include—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the director or former director;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the spouse of the director or former director; or

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: a minor child of the director or former director; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: if—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.leadIn: the terms of the trust give a power to the trustees that may be exercised for the benefit of—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: the director or former director;

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: the spouse of the director or former director; or

subparagraph.name: C
subparagraph.content: a minor child of the director or former director; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the director or former director knows that the director or former director, or the spouse or child, is an object of the power.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—

def.name: EmployeeShareScheme
def.leadIn: employee share scheme (僱員參股計劃) means a scheme for encouraging or facilitating the holding of shares in a company by or for the benefit of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: persons employed or formerly employed in good faith by that company or another company in the same group of companies; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the spouses, widows, widowers or minor children of persons referred to in paragraph (a);

subsection.def: partner (合夥人), in relation to another person, means a person who is a partner of that other person in a partnership within the meaning of the Partnership Ordinance (Cap. 38).

section.name: s487
section.heading: Family member of director or former director
section.leadIn: In this Part, a reference to a member of a director’s or former director’s family is a reference to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the spouse of the director or former director;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a child of the director or former director; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a parent of the director or former director.

section.name: s488
section.heading: Director or former director associated with body corporate

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of this Part, a director or former director is associated with a body corporate if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the director or former director, or any one or more of the entities specified in subsection (3), or the director or former director together with any one or more of those specified entities, are entitled to exercise, or control the exercise of, more than 30% of the voting power at any general meeting of that body corporate; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the directors, or a majority of the directors, of that body corporate are accustomed to act in accordance with the directions or instructions of—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the director or former director; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: an entity connected with the director or former director.

subsection.content: In this section, a reference to voting power the exercise of which is controlled by a director or former director, or by an entity specified in subsection (3), includes voting power the exercise of which is controlled by another body corporate if the director or former director, or any one or more of the specified entities, or the director or former director together with any one or more of the specified entities, are entitled to exercise, or control the exercise of, more than 50% of the voting power at any general meeting of that other body corporate.

subsection.leadIn: The entity specified for the purposes of subsections (1) and (2) is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the spouse of the director or former director;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a minor child of the director or former director; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a person who, by virtue of section 486(1)(e), is an entity connected with the director or former director.

section.name: s489
section.heading: Company subject to more than one prohibition

subsection.content: If a company is prohibited by more than one provision of this Part from doing something without the approval of the members of the company, or of the members of a holding company of the company, specified in each provision, the company is prohibited from doing the thing without all those approvals.
Subsection (1) does not require a separate resolution for the purposes of each of the provisions.

section.name: s490
section.heading: Application to transaction or arrangement despite its governing law
section.content: For the purposes of this Part, it is immaterial whether or not the law (apart from this Ordinance) that governs a transaction or arrangement is the law of Hong Kong.

section.name: s491
section.heading: Interpretation

subsection.leadIn: In this Division—
subsection.def: director (董事) includes a shadow director;
guarantee (擔保) includes indemnity;
land (土地) includes any estate or interest in land, buildings, messuages and tenements of any nature or kind;
services (服務) means anything other than goods or land;

def.name: SpecifiedCompany
def.leadIn: specified company (指明公司) means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a public company; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a private company or company limited by guarantee that is a subsidiary of a public company.

subsection.content: For the purposes of this Division, a body corporate is not to be regarded as a shadow director of any of its subsidiaries by reason only that the directors, or a majority of the directors, of the subsidiary are accustomed to act in accordance with its directions or instructions.

section.name: s492
section.heading: Body corporate controlled by director

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of this Division, a body corporate is controlled by a director if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the director is entitled to exercise, or control the exercise of, more than 50% of the voting power at any general meeting of that body corporate; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the directors, or a majority of the directors, of that body corporate are accustomed to act in accordance with the directions or instructions of the director.

subsection.content: In subsection (1), a reference to voting power the exercise of which is controlled by a director includes voting power the exercise of which is controlled by another body corporate if the director is entitled to exercise, or control the exercise of, more than 50% of the voting power at any general meeting of that other body corporate.

section.name: s493
section.heading: Quasi-loan

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of this Division, a person makes a quasi-loan to a director or an entity connected with a director if the person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: agrees to pay, or pays otherwise than pursuant to an agreement, a sum for the director or connected entity—

subparagraph.name: i
ii
subparagraph.content: in circumstances giving rise to a liability on the director or connected entity to reimburse the person; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: agrees to reimburse, or reimburses otherwise than pursuant to an agreement, expenditure incurred by another person for the director or connected entity—

subparagraph.name: i
ii
subparagraph.content: in circumstances giving rise to a liability on the director or connected entity to reimburse the person.

subsection.content: For the purposes of this Division, if a person makes a quasi-loan to a director or an entity connected with a director, the director’s or connected entity’s liabilities under the quasi-loan include the liabilities of any other person who has agreed to reimburse the person on the director’s or connected entity’s behalf.

section.name: s494
section.heading: Credit transaction

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of this Division, a person enters into a credit transaction as creditor for a director or an entity connected with a director if the person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: supplies goods to the director or connected entity under a hire-purchase agreement;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: sells goods or land to the director or connected entity under a conditional sale agreement;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: leases or hires goods or leases land to the director or connected entity in return for periodical payments; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: otherwise supplies goods or services or disposes of land to the director or connected entity on the understanding that payment (whether in a lump sum or instalments or by way of periodical payments or otherwise) is to be deferred.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—

def.name: ConditionalSaleAgreement
def.leadIn: conditional sale agreement (有條件售賣協議) means an agreement for the sale of goods or land under which—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the purchase price or part of it is payable by instalments;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the property in the goods or land is to remain in the seller until the conditions regarding the payment of instalments, or other conditions, specified in the agreement are fulfilled; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: despite such reservation of property, the buyer is to be in possession of the goods or land before the fulfilment of those conditions;

subsection.def: hire-purchase agreement (租購協議) means an agreement for the bailment of goods under which the bailee may buy the goods, or under which the property in the goods will or may pass to the bailee.

section.name: s495
section.heading: Person for whom transaction or arrangement entered into

subsection.leadIn: In this Division, a reference to a director, a body corporate controlled by a director, or an entity connected with a director, for whom a transaction is entered into is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the case of a loan or quasi-loan, or a guarantee or security in connection with a loan or quasi-loan, a reference to the director, controlled body corporate or connected entity to whom the loan or quasi-loan is made; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the case of a credit transaction, or a guarantee or security in connection with a credit transaction, a reference to the director or connected entity to whom goods, land or services are supplied, sold, leased, hired or otherwise disposed of under the credit transaction.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of this Division, an arrangement is entered into for a director, a body corporate controlled by a director, or an entity connected with a director if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the case of an arrangement mentioned in section 504(1)(a) or (2)(a), a company takes part in the arrangement under which another person enters into a transaction with the director, controlled body corporate or connected entity; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the case of an arrangement mentioned in section 504(1)(b) or (2)(b), a company enters into the arrangement in relation to any rights, obligations or liabilities under a transaction entered into by another person with the director, controlled body corporate or connected entity.

section.name: s496
section.heading: Prescribed approval of members

subsection.leadIn: In this Division, a reference to the prescribed approval of the members of a company that enters into a transaction or arrangement, or the members of a holding company of the company, is a reference to an approval obtained by a resolution of those members—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: that is passed before the transaction or arrangement is entered into; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in respect of which the requirements specified in subsection (2) are met.

subsection.leadIn: The requirements specified for the purposes of subsection (1)(b) are—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: that, in the case of a written resolution, a memorandum setting out the matters specified in subsection (4) is sent to every member at or before the time at which the proposed resolution is sent to the member; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: that, in the case of a resolution passed at a general meeting—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: a memorandum setting out the matters specified in subsection (4) is sent to every member together with the notice convening the meeting; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: if the company is a specified company, the resolution is passed after disregarding every vote in favour of the resolution by a member specified in subsection (5).

subsection.content: Subject to any provision of the company’s articles, any accidental omission to send the memorandum to a member is to be disregarded for the purpose of determining whether the requirement specified in subsection (2)(a) or (b)(i) has been met.

subsection.leadIn: The matters specified for the purposes of subsection (2)(a) and (b)(i) are—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: in the case of a resolution for the purposes of section 500, 501 or 502—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the nature of the transaction to be approved by the resolution;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the amount of the loan or quasi-loan;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: the purpose for which the loan or quasi-loan is required; and

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: the extent of the company’s liability under any transaction connected with the loan or quasi-loan;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: in the case of a resolution for the purposes of section 503—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the nature of the transaction to be approved by the resolution;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the amount and value of the credit transaction;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: the purpose for which the goods, land or services supplied, sold, leased, hired or otherwise disposed of under the credit transaction are required; and

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: the extent of the company’s liability under any transaction connected with the credit transaction; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: in the case of a resolution for the purposes of section 504—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the matters that would have to be disclosed if the company were seeking approval of the transaction to which the arrangement relates;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the nature of the arrangement to be approved by the resolution; and

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: the extent of the company’s liability under the arrangement.

subsection.leadIn: The member specified for the purposes of subsection (2)(b)(ii) is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: in the case of a resolution for the purposes of section 500 or 501—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: one who is the controlled body corporate to whom the loan is proposed to be made or was made;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.leadIn: one who is the director—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: who controls that body corporate; or

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: to whom the loan or quasi-loan is proposed to be made or was made; or

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: one who holds any shares in the company in trust for that controlled body corporate or director;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: in the case of a resolution for the purposes of section 502—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: one who is the connected entity to whom the loan or quasi-loan is proposed to be made or was made;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: one who is the director with whom that entity is connected; or

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: one who holds any shares in the company in trust for that connected entity or director;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: in the case of a resolution for the purposes of section 503—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: one who is the director or connected entity for whom the credit transaction is proposed to be entered into or was entered into;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: one who is the director with whom that entity is connected; or

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: one who holds any shares in the company in trust for the director specified in subparagraph (i) or (ii) or that connected entity; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.leadIn: in the case of a resolution for the purposes of section 504—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: one who is the controlled body corporate, or connected entity, for whom the arrangement is proposed to be entered into or was entered into;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.leadIn: one who is the director—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: who controls that body corporate;

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: with whom that entity is connected; or

subparagraph.name: C
subparagraph.content: for whom the arrangement is proposed to be entered into or was entered into; or

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: one who holds any shares in the company in trust for that controlled body corporate, connected entity or director.

subsection.content: Subsection (2)(b)(ii) does not prevent a member specified in subsection (5) from attending, being counted towards the quorum for, or taking part in the proceedings at, any meeting at which the decision is considered.

subsection.leadIn: In this section, a reference to a transaction to which an arrangement relates is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the case of an arrangement mentioned in section 504(1)(a) or (2)(a), a reference to the transaction entered into with a director, a body corporate controlled by a director, or an entity connected with a director under the arrangement; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the case of an arrangement mentioned in section 504(1)(b) or (2)(b) in relation to any rights, obligations or liabilities under a transaction, a reference to the transaction.

subsection.content: For the purposes of subsection (1)(a), it is irrelevant whether the resolution is passed before, on or after the commencement date# of this Division.

section.name: s497
section.heading: Value of transaction or arrangement etc.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of this Division—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the value of a transaction is to be determined in accordance with subsection (2); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the value of any other relevant transaction or arrangement is the value of the transaction or arrangement determined in accordance with subsection (2) or (3), reduced by any amount by which the liabilities of the director, the body corporate controlled by a director, or the entity connected with a director, for whom the transaction or arrangement was entered into have been reduced.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsection (1)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the value of a loan is the amount of its principal;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the value of a quasi-loan is the amount, or maximum amount, that the person to whom the quasi-loan is made is liable to reimburse the person making the quasi-loan;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the value of a credit transaction is the price that it is reasonable to expect could be obtained for goods, land or services to which the transaction relates if they had been supplied (at the time the transaction is entered into) in the ordinary course of business and on the same terms (apart from the price) as they have been supplied, or are to be supplied, under the transaction; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the value of a guarantee or security is the amount guaranteed or secured.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsection (1)(b)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the value of an arrangement mentioned in section 504(1)(a) or (2)(a) is the value of the transaction entered into with a director, a body corporate controlled by a director, or an entity connected with a director under the arrangement; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the value of an arrangement mentioned in section 504(1)(b) or (2)(b) in relation to any rights, obligations or liabilities under a transaction is the value of the transaction.

section.name: s498
section.heading: Total exposure amount

subsection.leadIn: In sections 509 and 510—

def.name: TotalExposureAmount
def.leadIn: total exposure amount (風險承擔總額) means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in relation to a company that is not a specified company, the aggregate of the amounts specified in subsection (2); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in relation to a specified company, the aggregate of the amounts specified in subsection (3).

subsection.leadIn: The amounts specified for the purposes of paragraph (a) of the definition of total exposure amount in subsection (1) are—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the amount of the transaction in question;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the aggregate of the amounts outstanding at the time that transaction is entered into, in respect of the principal and interest or otherwise, on every loan made by the company to a director of the company or of a holding company of the company, or to a body corporate controlled by such a director (excluding the transaction in question, and any loan made with the prescribed approval mentioned in section 500 or by virtue of section 499, 505, 506, 507, 508, 511 or 512);

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the aggregate of the amounts representing the maximum liability of the company at that time under every guarantee given by the company, and in respect of every security provided by the company, in connection with any loan made by any person to a director of the company or of a holding company of the company, or to a body corporate controlled by such a director (excluding the transaction in question, and any guarantee or security given or provided with the prescribed approval mentioned in section 500 or by virtue of section 499, 505, 506, 507, 508, 511 or 512); and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the aggregate of the net amounts incurred or to be incurred by the company at that time under every arrangement specified in subsection (4) that is entered into by the company (excluding any arrangement entered into with the prescribed approval mentioned in section 504 or by virtue of section 499).

subsection.leadIn: The amounts specified for the purposes of paragraph (b) of the definition of total exposure amount in subsection (1) are—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the amount of the transaction in question;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the aggregate of the amounts outstanding at the time that transaction is entered into, in respect of the principal and interest or otherwise, on every loan and quasi-loan made by the company to, and every credit transaction entered into by the company as creditor for, a director of the company or of a holding company of the company, or a body corporate controlled by such a director, or an entity connected with such a director (excluding the transaction in question, and any loan, quasi-loan or credit transaction made or entered into with the prescribed approval mentioned in section 500, 501, 502 or 503 or by virtue of section 499, 505, 506, 507, 508, 511 or 512);

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the aggregate of the amounts representing the maximum liability of the company at that time under every guarantee given by the company, and in respect of every security provided by the company, in connection with any loan or quasi-loan made by any person to, or any credit transaction entered into by any person as creditor for, a director of the company or of a holding company of the company, or a body corporate controlled by such a director, or an entity connected with such a director (excluding the transaction in question, and any guarantee or security given or provided with the prescribed approval mentioned in section 500, 501, 502 or 503 or by virtue of section 499, 505, 506, 507, 508, 511 or 512); and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the aggregate of the net amounts incurred or to be incurred by the company at that time under every arrangement specified in subsection (5) that is entered into by the company (excluding any arrangement entered into with the prescribed approval mentioned in section 504 or by virtue of section 499).

subsection.leadIn: An arrangement specified for the purposes of subsection (2)(d) is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: an arrangement under which—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.leadIn: another person makes a questionable loan to—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: a director of the company or of a holding company of the company; or

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: a body corporate controlled by such a director; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: that other person, pursuant to the arrangement, has obtained or is to obtain any benefit from the company or an associated company of the company; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: an arrangement for an assignment to the company, or assumption by the company, of any rights, obligations or liabilities under a questionable loan made by another person to—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: a director of the company or of a holding company of the company; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: a body corporate controlled by such a director.

subsection.leadIn: An arrangement specified for the purposes of subsection (3)(d) is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: an arrangement under which—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.leadIn: another person makes a questionable loan or quasi-loan to, or enters into a questionable credit transaction as creditor for—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: a director of the company or of a holding company of the company;

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: a body corporate controlled by such a director; or

subparagraph.name: C
subparagraph.content: an entity connected with such a director; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: that other person, pursuant to the arrangement, has obtained or is to obtain any benefit from the company or an associated company of the company; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: an arrangement for an assignment to the company, or assumption by the company, of any rights, obligations or liabilities under—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.leadIn: a questionable loan or quasi-loan made by another person to—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: a director of the company or of a holding company of the company;

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: a body corporate controlled by such a director; or

subparagraph.name: C
subparagraph.content: an entity connected with such a director; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.leadIn: a questionable credit transaction entered into by another person as creditor for—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: a director of the company or of a holding company of the company; or

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: an entity connected with such a director.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a reference to a questionable loan or quasi-loan made by a person to a director of the company, a body corporate controlled by such a director, or an entity connected with such a director, under an arrangement is a reference to a loan or quasi-loan (as the case may be) that, if it had been made by the company on the date of the arrangement, would have been prohibited by section 500(1), 501(1) or 502(1) or would have been so prohibited in the absence of sections 509 and 510;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a reference to a questionable credit transaction entered into by a person as creditor for a director of the company, or an entity connected with such a director, under an arrangement is a reference to a credit transaction that, if it had been entered into by the company on the date of the arrangement, would have been prohibited by section 503(1) or would have been so prohibited in the absence of sections 509 and 510;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a reference to a questionable loan or quasi-loan made by a person to a director of a holding company of the company, a body corporate controlled by such a director, or an entity connected with such a director, under an arrangement is a reference to a loan or quasi-loan (as the case may be) that, if it had been made by the company on the date of the arrangement, would have been prohibited by section 500(2), 501(2) or 502(2) or would have been so prohibited in the absence of sections 509 and 510; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: a reference to a questionable credit transaction entered into by a person as creditor for a director of a holding company of the company, or an entity connected with such a director, under an arrangement is a reference to a credit transaction that, if it had been entered into by the company on the date of the arrangement, would have been prohibited by section 503(2) or would have been so prohibited in the absence of sections 509 and 510.

section.name: s499
section.heading: Preservation of effect of members’ unanimous consent

subsection.content: If, under a provision of this Division, a transaction or arrangement must not be entered into without the prescribed approval of a company’s members, the provision does not prohibit the transaction or arrangement from being entered into with the unanimous consent of those members given before it is entered into.

If, under a provision of this Division, a transaction or arrangement may be entered into with only the prescribed approval of a company’s members, the provision does not preclude the transaction or arrangement from being entered into with the unanimous consent of those members given before it is entered into.
For the purposes of subsection (1) or (2), it is irrelevant whether the unanimous consent is given before, on or after the commencement date# of this Division.

section.name: s500
section.heading: Company must not make loan etc. to director or body corporate controlled by director

subsection.leadIn: Without the prescribed approval of its members, a company must not—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: make a loan to—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: a director of the company; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: a body corporate controlled by such a director; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: give a guarantee or provide security in connection with a loan made by any person to—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: a director of the company; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: a body corporate controlled by such a director.

subsection.leadIn: Without the prescribed approval of its members and the prescribed approval of the holding company’s members, a company must not—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: make a loan to—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: a director of a holding company of the company; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: a body corporate controlled by such a director; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: give a guarantee or provide security in connection with a loan made by any person to—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: a director of a holding company of the company; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: a body corporate controlled by such a director.

subsection.leadIn: Despite subsection (2)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: a company may enter into the transaction with only the prescribed approval of its members if the holding company— (Amended 14 of 2025 s. 38)

subparagraph.content: is incorporated outside Hong Kong; and
is not a re-domiciled company; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: a company may enter into the transaction with only the prescribed approval of the holding company’s members if it is a wholly owned subsidiary of the holding company, and the holding company— (Amended 14 of 2025 s. 38)

subparagraph.content: is incorporated in Hong Kong; or
is a re-domiciled company. (Amended 14 of 2025 s. 38)

section.name: s501
section.heading: Specified company must not make quasi-loan etc. to director

subsection.leadIn: Without the prescribed approval of its members, a specified company must not—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: make a quasi-loan to a director of the company; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: give a guarantee or provide security in connection with a quasi-loan made by any person to such a director.

subsection.leadIn: Without the prescribed approval of its members and the prescribed approval of the holding company’s members, a specified company must not—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: make a quasi-loan to a director of a holding company of the company; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: give a guarantee or provide security in connection with a quasi-loan made by any person to such a director.

subsection.leadIn: Despite subsection (2)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: a specified company may enter into the transaction with only the prescribed approval of its members if the holding company— (Amended 14 of 2025 s. 39)

subparagraph.content: is incorporated outside Hong Kong; and
is not a re-domiciled company; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: a specified company may enter into the transaction with only the prescribed approval of the holding company’s members if it is a wholly owned subsidiary of the holding company, and the holding company— (Amended 14 of 2025 s. 39)

subparagraph.content: is incorporated in Hong Kong; or
is a re-domiciled company. (Amended 14 of 2025 s. 39)

section.name: s502
section.heading: Specified company must not make loan or quasi-loan etc. to connected entity

subsection.leadIn: Without the prescribed approval of its members, a specified company must not—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: make a loan or quasi-loan to an entity connected with a director of the company; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: give a guarantee or provide security in connection with a loan or quasi-loan made by any person to an entity connected with such a director.

subsection.leadIn: Without the prescribed approval of its members and the prescribed approval of the holding company’s members, a specified company must not—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: make a loan or quasi-loan to an entity connected with a director of a holding company of the company; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: give a guarantee or provide security in connection with a loan or quasi-loan made by any person to an entity connected with such a director.

subsection.leadIn: Despite subsection (2)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: a specified company may enter into the transaction with only the prescribed approval of its members if the holding company— (Amended 14 of 2025 s. 40)

subparagraph.content: is incorporated outside Hong Kong; and
is not a re-domiciled company; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: a specified company may enter into the transaction with only the prescribed approval of the holding company’s members if it is a wholly owned subsidiary of the holding company, and the holding company— (Amended 14 of 2025 s. 40)

subparagraph.content: is incorporated in Hong Kong; or
is a re-domiciled company. (Amended 14 of 2025 s. 40)

section.name: s503
section.heading: Specified company must not enter into credit transaction etc. as creditor for director or connected entity

subsection.leadIn: Without the prescribed approval of its members, a specified company must not—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: enter into a credit transaction as creditor for—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: a director of the company; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: an entity connected with such a director; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: give a guarantee or provide security in connection with a credit transaction entered into by any person as creditor for such a director or an entity connected with such a director.

subsection.leadIn: Without the prescribed approval of its members and the prescribed approval of the holding company’s members, a specified company must not—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: enter into a credit transaction as creditor for—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: a director of a holding company of the company; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: an entity connected with such a director; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: give a guarantee or provide security in connection with a credit transaction entered into by any person as creditor for such a director or an entity connected with such a director.

subsection.leadIn: Despite subsection (2)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: a specified company may enter into the transaction with only the prescribed approval of its members if the holding company— (Amended 14 of 2025 s. 41)

subparagraph.content: is incorporated outside Hong Kong; and
is not a re-domiciled company; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: a specified company may enter into the transaction with only the prescribed approval of the holding company’s members if it is a wholly owned subsidiary of the holding company, and the holding company— (Amended 14 of 2025 s. 41)

subparagraph.content: is incorporated in Hong Kong; or
is a re-domiciled company. (Amended 14 of 2025 s. 41)

section.name: s504
section.heading: Company must not take part in arrangement purporting to circumvent sections 500 to 503

subsection.leadIn: Without the prescribed approval of its members, a company must not—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: take part in an arrangement under which—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: another person enters into a questionable transaction with a director of the company, a body corporate controlled by such a director, or an entity connected with such a director; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: that other person, pursuant to the arrangement, has obtained or is to obtain any benefit from the company or an associated company of the company; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: arrange for an assignment to the company, or assumption by the company, of any rights, obligations or liabilities under a questionable transaction entered into by another person with—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: a director of the company;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: a body corporate controlled by such a director; or

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: an entity connected with such a director.

subsection.leadIn: Without the prescribed approval of its members and the prescribed approval of the holding company’s members, a company must not—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: take part in an arrangement under which—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: another person enters into a questionable transaction with a director of a holding company of the company, a body corporate controlled by such a director, or an entity connected with such a director; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: that other person, pursuant to the arrangement, has obtained or is to obtain any benefit from the company or an associated company of the company; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: arrange for an assignment to the company, or assumption by the company, of any rights, obligations or liabilities under a questionable transaction entered into by another person with—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: a director of a holding company of the company;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: a body corporate controlled by such a director; or

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: an entity connected with such a director.

subsection.leadIn: Despite subsection (2)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: a company may enter into the arrangement with only the prescribed approval of its members if the holding company— (Amended 14 of 2025 s. 42)

subparagraph.content: is incorporated outside Hong Kong; and
is not a re-domiciled company; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: a company may enter into the arrangement with only the prescribed approval of the holding company’s members if it is a wholly owned subsidiary of the holding company, and the holding company— (Amended 14 of 2025 s. 42)

subparagraph.content: is incorporated in Hong Kong; or
is a re-domiciled company. (Amended 14 of 2025 s. 42)

subsection.leadIn: In this section—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a reference to a questionable transaction entered into by a person with a director of the company, a body corporate controlled by such a director, or an entity connected with such a director, under an arrangement is a reference to a transaction that, if it had been entered into by the company on the date of the arrangement, would have been prohibited by section 500(1), 501(1), 502(1) or 503(1) or would have been so prohibited in the absence of Subdivision 3; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a reference to a questionable transaction entered into by a person with a director of a holding company of the company, a body corporate controlled by such a director, or an entity connected with such a director, under an arrangement is a reference to a transaction that, if it had been entered into by the company on the date of the arrangement, would have been prohibited by section 500(2), 501(2), 502(2) or 503(2) or would have been so prohibited in the absence of Subdivision 3.

section.name: s505
section.heading: Exception for loan, quasi-loan and credit transaction of value not exceeding 5% of net assets or called-up share capital

subsection.leadIn: A company is not prohibited by section 500, 501, 502 or 503 from making a loan or quasi-loan, entering into a credit transaction or giving a guarantee or providing security in connection with a loan, quasi-loan or credit transaction, if the aggregate of the value of the transaction in question, and the value of any other relevant transaction or arrangement, does not exceed 5% of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the value of the company’s net assets as determined by reference to the relevant financial statements of the company; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if no such relevant financial statements have been prepared, the amount of the company’s called-up share capital.

subsection.leadIn: In this section, a reference to the relevant financial statements of a company is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a reference to the company’s annual financial statements or annual consolidated financial statements prepared under Part 9 that were most recently sent to its members under section 430; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if no such annual financial statements or annual consolidated financial statements have been sent since the commencement date# of section 430, a reference to the company’s accounts prepared under section 122 of the predecessor Ordinance that were most recently sent to its members under section 129G of that Ordinance.

subsection.leadIn: A transaction or arrangement is a relevant transaction or arrangement for the purposes of subsection (1)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if it is entered into before, or at the same time as, the transaction in question; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: if—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: where the transaction in question is entered into for a director of the company, a body corporate controlled by such a director, or an entity connected with such a director, it is entered into for the director, controlled body corporate or connected entity by the company or a subsidiary of the company as permitted by subsection (1); or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: where the transaction in question is entered into for a director of a holding company of the company, a body corporate controlled by such a director, or an entity connected with such a director, it is entered into for the director, controlled body corporate or connected entity by the holding company or a subsidiary of the holding company as permitted by subsection (1).

subsection.leadIn: Despite subsection (3), a transaction or arrangement is not a relevant transaction or arrangement for the purposes of subsection (1) if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: it was entered into by a body corporate that, at the time it was entered into—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: was a subsidiary of the company entering into the transaction in question; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: was a subsidiary of a holding company of that company; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: at the time the question arises as to whether the transaction in question falls within subsection (1), the body corporate is no longer such a subsidiary.

section.name: s506
section.heading: Exception for expenditure on company business
