subsection.leadIn: A company is not prohibited by section 500, 501, 502 or 503 from entering into any transaction to provide—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a director of the company or of a holding company of the company;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a body corporate controlled by such a director; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: an entity connected with such a director,

subsection.continued: with funds to meet expenditure specified in subsection (2) or to avoid incurring such expenditure.

subsection.leadIn: The expenditure is one incurred or to be incurred by the director, controlled body corporate or connected entity (as the case may be)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: for the purposes of the company; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: for the purpose of enabling the director, controlled body corporate or connected entity (as the case may be) to properly perform duties as an officer of the company.

section.name: s507
section.heading: Exception for expenditure on defending proceedings etc.

subsection.leadIn: If the condition specified in subsection (2) is satisfied, a company is not prohibited by section 500, 501, 502 or 503 from entering into any transaction—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: to provide a director of the company or of a holding company of the company with funds to meet expenditure incurred or to be incurred by the director—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: in defending any criminal or civil proceedings in connection with any alleged negligence, default, breach of duty or breach of trust by the director in relation to the company or an associated company of the company; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: in connection with an application for relief under section 358 of the predecessor Ordinance or section 903 or 904; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to enable such a director to avoid incurring such expenditure.

subsection.leadIn: The condition is that the transaction in question is entered into on the terms—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: that the funds are to be repaid, or any liability of the company incurred in relation to that transaction is to be discharged, if—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the director is convicted in the proceedings;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: judgment is given against the director in the proceedings; or

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: the court refuses to grant the director relief on the application; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: that the funds are to be so repaid, or such liability is to be so discharged, not later than the date when the conviction, judgment or refusal of relief becomes final.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsection (2), a conviction, judgment or refusal of relief—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if not appealed against, becomes final at the end of the period for bringing an appeal; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if appealed against, becomes final when the appeal, or any further appeal, is disposed of.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsection (3)(b), an appeal is disposed of if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: it is determined, and the period for bringing any further appeal has ended; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: it is abandoned or otherwise ceases to have effect.

section.name: s508
section.heading: Exception for expenditure in connection with investigation or regulatory action

subsection.leadIn: If the condition specified in subsection (2) is satisfied, a company is not prohibited by section 500, 501, 502 or 503 from entering into any transaction—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to provide a director of the company or of a holding company of the company with funds to meet expenditure incurred or to be incurred by the director in putting up a defence in an investigation, or against any action taken or proposed to be taken, by a regulatory authority in connection with any alleged misconduct by the director in relation to the company or an associated company of the company; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to enable such a director to avoid incurring such expenditure.

subsection.leadIn: The condition is that the transaction in question is entered into on the terms—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: that the funds are to be repaid, or any liability of the company incurred in relation to that transaction is to be discharged, if the director is found in the investigation or action to have committed the misconduct; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: that the funds are to be so repaid, or such liability is to be so discharged, not later than the date when the finding becomes final.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsection (2)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: a finding subject to review—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: if no application for review has been made, becomes final at the end of the period for making an application for review; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: if an application for review has been made, becomes final when the review, or any further review, is disposed of;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: a finding subject to appeal—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: if not appealed against, becomes final at the end of the period for bringing an appeal; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: if appealed against, becomes final when the appeal, or any further appeal, is disposed of; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a finding not subject to review or appeal becomes final when it is made.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsection (3)(a)(ii) or (b)(ii), a review or appeal is disposed of if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: it is determined, and the period for bringing any further review or appeal has ended; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: it is abandoned or otherwise ceases to have effect.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: misconduct (不當行為) means negligence, default, breach of duty or breach of trust.

section.name: s509
section.heading: Exception for home loan

subsection.leadIn: If the conditions specified in subsection (2) are satisfied, a company is not prohibited by section 500, 501, 502 or 503 from entering into any transaction—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: for the purpose of facilitating the purchase of any residential premises for use as the only or main residence of—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: a director of the company;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: an employee of the company who is a director of a holding company of the company; or

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: an employee of the company who is an entity connected with a director of the company or of a holding company of the company;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: for the purpose of improving any residential premises so used; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: in substitution for any transaction entered into by any other person for a purpose specified in paragraph (a) or (b).

subsection.leadIn: The conditions are—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: that, at the time the transaction in question is entered into, the total exposure amount does not exceed 10% of—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the value of the company’s net assets as determined by reference to the relevant financial statements of the company; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: if no such relevant financial statements have been prepared, the amount of the company’s called-up share capital;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: that the company ordinarily enters into transactions for a purpose specified in subsection (3) on terms no less favourable than those on which the transaction in question is entered into;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: that a valuation report on the residential premises is made and signed by a professionally qualified valuation surveyor, who is subject to the discipline of a professional body, within 3 months before the date on which the transaction in question is entered into; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: that the transaction in question is secured by a legal mortgage on the land comprising the residential premises.

subsection.leadIn: The purpose specified for the purposes of subsection (2)(b) is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to facilitate the purchase of any residential premises for use as the only or main residence of an employee of the company;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to improve any residential premises so used; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: to substitute for any transaction entered into by any other person for a purpose specified in paragraph (a) or (b).

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: residential premises (住用處所) means any residential premises together with any land to be occupied or enjoyed with the premises.

subsection.leadIn: In this section, a reference to the relevant financial statements of a company is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a reference to the company’s annual financial statements or annual consolidated financial statements prepared under Part 9 that were most recently sent to its members under section 430; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if no such annual financial statements or annual consolidated financial statements have been sent since the commencement date# of section 430, a reference to the company’s accounts prepared under section 122 of the predecessor Ordinance that were most recently sent to its members under section 129G of that Ordinance.

section.name: s510
section.heading: Exception for leasing goods and land etc.

subsection.leadIn: If the conditions specified in subsection (2) are satisfied, a company is not prohibited by section 500, 501, 502 or 503 from leasing or hiring goods or leasing land to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a director of the company or of a holding company of the company;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a body corporate controlled by such a director; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: an entity connected with such a director.

subsection.leadIn: The conditions are—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: that, at the time the transaction in question is entered into, the total exposure amount does not exceed 10% of—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the value of the company’s net assets as determined by reference to the relevant financial statements of the company; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: if no such relevant financial statements have been prepared, the amount of the company’s called-up share capital; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: that the terms of the transaction in question are not more favourable than what is reasonable to expect the company to have offered, if the goods had been leased or hired, or the land had been leased, on the open market, to a person unconnected with the company.

subsection.leadIn: In this section, a reference to the relevant financial statements of a company is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a reference to the company’s annual financial statements or annual consolidated financial statements prepared under Part 9 that were most recently sent to its members under section 430; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if no such annual financial statements or annual consolidated financial statements have been sent since the commencement date# of section 430, a reference to the company’s accounts prepared under section 122 of the predecessor Ordinance that were most recently sent to its members under section 129G of that Ordinance.

section.name: s511
section.heading: Exception for transaction entered into in ordinary course of business

subsection.leadIn: A company is not prohibited by section 500, 501 or 502 from making a loan or quasi-loan, or giving a guarantee or providing security in connection with a loan or quasi-loan, if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the company’s ordinary business includes the making of loans or quasi-loans, or the giving of guarantees or provision of securities in connection with loans or quasi-loans (as the case may be);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the loan, quasi-loan, guarantee or security is made, given or provided by the company in the ordinary course of its business; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the amount of the loan or quasi-loan, guarantee or security is not greater, and the terms of it are not more favourable, than what is reasonable to expect the company to have offered to a person of the same financial standing but unconnected with the company.

subsection.leadIn: A company is not prohibited by section 503 from entering into a credit transaction, or giving a guarantee or providing security in connection with a credit transaction, if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the company’s ordinary business includes the entering into of credit transactions, or the giving of guarantees or provision of securities in connection with credit transactions (as the case may be);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the credit transaction, guarantee or security is entered into, given or provided by the company in the ordinary course of its business; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the amount of the credit transaction, guarantee or security is not greater, and the terms of it are not more favourable, than what is reasonable to expect the company to have offered to a person of the same financial standing but unconnected with the company.

section.name: s512
section.heading: Exception for intra-group transaction
section.leadIn: If a company is a member of a group of companies, the company is not prohibited by section 500, 501, 502 or 503 from—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: making a loan or quasi-loan to, or entering into a credit transaction as creditor for, a body corporate that is a member of the group; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: giving a guarantee or providing security in connection with—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: a loan or quasi-loan made by any person to such a body corporate; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: a credit transaction entered into by any person as creditor for such a body corporate.

section.name: s513
section.heading: Civil consequences of contravention

subsection.leadIn: If a company enters into a transaction in contravention of section 500, 501, 502 or 503, or enters into an arrangement in contravention of section 504, the transaction or arrangement is voidable at the company’s instance unless—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: restitution of any money or other asset that was the subject matter of the transaction or arrangement is no longer possible;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the company has been indemnified for any loss or damage resulting from the transaction or arrangement; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a person other than the director, controlled body corporate, or connected entity, for whom the transaction or arrangement was entered into acquired rights in good faith, for value, and without actual notice of the contravention, and those rights would be affected by the avoidance.

subsection.leadIn: Whether or not the transaction or arrangement has been avoided, each of the persons specified in subsection (3) is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to account to the company for any gain that the person has made, directly or indirectly, by the transaction or arrangement; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: jointly and severally with any other person so liable under this section, to indemnify the company for any loss or damage resulting from the transaction or arrangement.

subsection.leadIn: The persons are—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a director of the company, or of a holding company of the company, for whom the company entered into the transaction or arrangement;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a body corporate controlled by such a director, or an entity connected with such a director, for whom the company entered into the transaction or arrangement;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the director of the company who controls such a body corporate or with whom such an entity is connected;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the director of a holding company of the company who controls such a body corporate or with whom such an entity is connected; and

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: any other director of the company who authorized the transaction or arrangement.

subsection.leadIn: Despite subsection (2)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the controlled body corporate or connected entity specified in subsection (3)(b) is not liable if the controlled body corporate or connected entity establishes that, at the time the transaction or arrangement was entered into, it was not aware of the circumstances constituting the contravention;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the director specified in subsection (3)(c) or (d) is not liable if the director establishes that the director took all reasonable steps to secure the company’s compliance with section 500, 502, 503 or 504 (as the case may be); and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a director specified in subsection (3)(e) is not liable if the director establishes that, at the time the transaction or arrangement was entered into, the director was not aware of the circumstances constituting the contravention.

subsection.content: This section does not exclude the operation of any other Ordinance or rule of law by virtue of which the transaction or arrangement may be called into question or any liability to the company may arise.

section.name: s514
section.heading: Affirmation of contravening transaction or arrangement

subsection.content: Despite section 513, a transaction or arrangement may no longer be avoided under that section if, within a reasonable period after it is entered into, the transaction or arrangement is affirmed.

If a transaction or arrangement contravenes Subdivision 2 because it was entered into without the prescribed approval of the company’s members, the affirmation of the transaction or arrangement must be obtained by a resolution of the company’s members.

If a transaction or arrangement contravenes Subdivision 2 because it was entered into without the prescribed approval of the holding company’s members, the affirmation of the transaction or arrangement must be obtained by a resolution of the holding company’s members.

subsection.leadIn: If a transaction or arrangement contravenes Subdivision 2 because it was entered into without the prescribed approval of the company’s members and the prescribed approval of the holding company’s members, the affirmation of the transaction or arrangement must be obtained—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: by a resolution of the company’s members; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: by a resolution of the holding company’s members.

subsection.content: Subsections (2), (3) and (4) do not affect the validity of a company’s or holding company’s decision to affirm a transaction or arrangement if it is taken by unanimous consent of the company’s or holding company’s members.

section.name: s515
section.heading: Provisions supplementary to section 514

subsection.leadIn: The following requirements must be met in relation to a resolution of the members of any company under section 514—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the case of a written resolution, a memorandum setting out the matters specified in subsection (3) is sent to every member at or before the time at which the proposed resolution is sent to the member; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: in the case of a resolution passed at a general meeting—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: a memorandum setting out the matters specified in subsection (3) is sent to every member together with the notice convening the meeting; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: if the company is a specified company, the resolution is passed after disregarding every vote in favour of the resolution by a member specified in subsection (4).

subsection.content: Subject to any provision of the company’s articles, any accidental omission to send the memorandum to a member is to be disregarded for the purpose of determining whether the requirement specified in subsection (1)(a) or (b)(i) has been met.

subsection.leadIn: The matters specified for the purposes of subsection (1)(a) and (b)(i) are—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: in the case of a resolution for the purpose of a contravention of section 500, 501 or 502—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the nature of the transaction to be affirmed by the resolution;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the amount of the loan or quasi-loan;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: the purpose for which the loan or quasi-loan is required; and

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: the extent of the company’s liability under any transaction connected with the loan or quasi-loan;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: in the case of a resolution for the purpose of a contravention of section 503—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the nature of the transaction to be affirmed by the resolution;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the amount and value of the credit transaction;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: the purpose for which the goods, land or services supplied, sold, leased, hired or otherwise disposed of under the credit transaction are required; and

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: the extent of the company’s liability under any transaction connected with the credit transaction; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: in the case of a resolution for the purpose of a contravention of section 504—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the matters that would have to be disclosed if the company were seeking affirmation of the transaction to which the arrangement relates;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the nature of the arrangement to be affirmed by the resolution; and

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: the extent of the company’s liability under the arrangement.

subsection.leadIn: The member specified for the purposes of subsection (1)(b)(ii) is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: in the case of a resolution for the purpose of a contravention of section 500 or 501—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: one who is the controlled body corporate to whom the loan is proposed to be made or was made;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.leadIn: one who is the director—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: who controls that body corporate; or

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: to whom the loan or quasi-loan is proposed to be made or was made;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: one who is any other director of the company who authorized the loan or quasi-loan; or

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: one who holds any shares in the company in trust for the director specified in subparagraph (ii) or (iii) or that controlled body corporate;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: in the case of a resolution for the purpose of a contravention of section 502—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: one who is the connected entity to whom the loan or quasi-loan is proposed to be made or was made;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: one who is the director with whom that entity is connected;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: one who is any other director of the company who authorized the loan or quasi-loan; or

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: one who holds any shares in the company in trust for the director specified in subparagraph (ii) or (iii) or that connected entity;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: in the case of a resolution for the purpose of a contravention of section 503—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: one who is the director or connected entity for whom the credit transaction is proposed to be entered into or was entered into;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: one who is the director with whom that entity is connected;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: one who is any other director of the company who authorized the credit transaction; or

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: one who holds any shares in the company in trust for the director specified in subparagraph (i), (ii) or (iii) or that connected entity; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.leadIn: in the case of a resolution for the purpose of a contravention of section 504—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: one who is the controlled body corporate, or connected entity, for whom the arrangement is proposed to be entered into or was entered into;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.leadIn: one who is the director—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: who controls that body corporate;

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: with whom that entity is connected; or

subparagraph.name: C
subparagraph.content: for whom the arrangement is proposed to be entered into or was entered into;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: one who is any other director of the company who authorized the arrangement; or

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: one who holds any shares in the company in trust for the director specified in subparagraph (ii) or (iii) or that controlled body corporate or connected entity.

subsection.content: Subsection (1)(b)(ii) does not prevent a member specified in subsection (4) from attending, being counted towards the quorum for, or taking part in the proceedings at, any meeting at which the decision is considered.

subsection.leadIn: In this section, a reference to a transaction to which an arrangement relates is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the case of an arrangement mentioned in section 504(1)(a) or (2)(a), a reference to the transaction entered into with a director, a body corporate controlled by a director, or an entity connected with a director under the arrangement; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the case of an arrangement mentioned in section 504(1)(b) or (2)(b) in relation to any rights, obligations or liabilities under a transaction, a reference to the transaction.

section.name: s516
section.heading: Interpretation

subsection.leadIn: In this Division—

def.name: AffectedMember
def.leadIn: affected member (受影響成員) means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a holder of the shares to which the takeover offer relates; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a holder of shares of the same class as any of the shares to which the takeover offer relates;

subsection.def: director (董事) includes a shadow director;
takeover offer (收購要約) means a takeover offer as defined by section 689.

subsection.leadIn: In this Division—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a reference to payment, compensation or consideration includes benefits otherwise than in cash; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a reference to loss of office as a director excludes loss of a person’s status as a shadow director.

subsection.leadIn: In section 517 and Subdivisions 2 and 3, a reference to a payment to a director or former director includes—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a payment to an entity connected with the director or former director; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: a payment to a person made at the direction of, or for the benefit of—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the director or former director; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: an entity connected with the director or former director.

subsection.content: In section 517 and Subdivisions 2 and 3, a reference to a payment by a person includes a payment by another person made at the direction of, or on behalf of, the person.

For the purposes of this Division, a body corporate is not to be regarded as a shadow director of any of its subsidiaries by reason only that the directors, or a majority of the directors, of the subsidiary are accustomed to act in accordance with its directions or instructions.

section.name: s517
section.heading: Payment for loss of office

subsection.leadIn: In this Division, a reference to a payment for loss of office made to a director or former director of a company is a reference to a payment made to the director or former director—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: by way of compensation for loss of office as director of the company;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: by way of compensation for loss, while director of the company or in connection with ceasing to be director of it, of—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: any other office or employment in connection with the management of the affairs of the company; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: any office (as director or otherwise) or employment in connection with the management of the affairs of any subsidiary undertaking of the company;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: as consideration for or in connection with the retirement from the office as director of the company; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.leadIn: as consideration for or in connection with the retirement, while director of the company or in connection with ceasing to be director of it, from—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: any other office or employment in connection with the management of the affairs of the company; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: any office (as director or otherwise) or employment in connection with the management of the affairs of any subsidiary undertaking of the company.

subsection.leadIn: If, in connection with a transfer mentioned in section 522 or 523—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the price to be paid to a director or former director of the company specified in subsection (3) for any shares in the company exceeds the price that could at the time have been obtained by other holders of like shares; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any valuable consideration is given to a director or former director of the company specified in subsection (3) by a person other than the company,

subsection.continued: the excess, or (as the case may be) the money value of the consideration, is to be regarded as a payment for loss of office for the purposes of sections 522 and 523.

subsection.leadIn: The director or former director of the company is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: one who is or was to cease to hold office in connection with the transfer; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: one who is or was to cease to be the holder of either of the following offices in connection with the transfer—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: any other office or employment in connection with the management of the affairs of the company;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: any office (as director or otherwise) or employment in connection with the management of the affairs of any subsidiary undertaking of the company.

subsection.content: Subsection (1)(a) and (b) applies to a loss of office occurring on or after the commencement date# of this Division.
Subsection (1)(c) and (d) applies to a retirement occurring on or after the commencement date# of this Division.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsections (4) and (5), a loss of office or retirement occurs—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the case of a directorship, when the person ceases to be a director;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the case of any other office, when the person ceases to hold the office; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: in the case of an employment, when the employment comes to an end.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: subsidiary undertaking (附屬企業) has the same meaning as in Part 9. (Added 35 of 2018 s. 57)

section.name: s518
section.heading: Prescribed approval of members or affected members

subsection.leadIn: In this Division, a reference to the prescribed approval of the members or affected members of a company is a reference to an approval obtained by a resolution of those members or affected members—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: that is passed before the payment for loss of office is made; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in respect of which the requirements specified in subsection (2) are met.

subsection.leadIn: The requirements specified for the purposes of subsection (1)(b) are—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: that, in the case of a written resolution, a memorandum setting out the particulars of the payment is sent to every member or affected member (as the case may be) at or before the time at which the proposed resolution is sent to the member or affected member; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: that, in the case of a resolution passed at a general meeting—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: a memorandum setting out the particulars of the payment is sent to every member or affected member (as the case may be) together with the notice convening the meeting; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: if the company is a public company, the resolution is passed after disregarding every vote in favour of the resolution by a member or affected member (as the case may be) specified in subsection (4) or (5).

subsection.content: Subject to any provision of the company’s articles, any accidental omission to send the memorandum to a member or affected member (as the case may be) is to be disregarded for the purpose of determining whether the requirement specified in subsection (2)(a) or (b)(i) has been met.

subsection.leadIn: In the case of a resolution for the purposes of section 521 or 522, the member specified for the purposes of subsection (2)(b)(ii) is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: one who is the director or former director to whom the payment for loss of office is proposed to be made;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: one who is the proposed recipient of the payment for loss of office and who is not the director or former director specified in paragraph (a); or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: one who holds any shares in the company in trust for that director, former director or recipient.

subsection.leadIn: In the case of a resolution for the purposes of section 523, the affected member specified for the purposes of subsection (2)(b)(ii) is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: one who is the director or former director to whom the payment for loss of office is proposed to be made;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: one who is the proposed recipient of the payment for loss of office and who is not the director or former director specified in paragraph (a);

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: one who makes the takeover offer;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: one who is an associate of the person making the takeover offer; or

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.leadIn: one who holds any shares in the company in trust for—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: that director, former director or recipient;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the maker of the takeover offer specified in paragraph (c); or

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: the associate.

subsection.content: Subsection (2)(b)(ii) does not prevent a member or affected member (as the case may be) specified in subsection (4) or (5) from attending, being counted towards the quorum for, or taking part in the proceedings at, any meeting at which the decision is considered.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: associate (有聯繫者), in relation to a person making a takeover offer, means an associate of the person as defined by section 667.

subsection.content: For the purposes of subsection (1)(a), it is irrelevant whether the resolution is passed before, on or after the commencement date# of this Division.

section.name: s519
section.heading: Preservation of effect of members’ or affected members’ unanimous consent

subsection.content: If, under a provision of this Division, a transaction must not be entered into without the prescribed approval of a company’s members or affected members, the provision does not prohibit the transaction from being entered into with the unanimous consent of those members or affected members given before it is entered into.

If, under a provision of this Division, a transaction may be entered into with only the prescribed approval of a company’s members or affected members, the provision does not preclude the transaction from being entered into with the unanimous consent of those members or affected members given before it is entered into.
For the purposes of subsection (1) or (2), it is irrelevant whether the unanimous consent is given before, on or after the commencement date# of this Division.

section.name: s520
section.heading: This Division does not affect operation of other Ordinance or law
section.leadIn: This Division does not affect the operation of any other Ordinance or rule of law requiring disclosure to be made with respect to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any payment for loss of office mentioned in section 521, 522 or 523; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any other like payment made or to be made to a director or former director of a company.

section.name: s521
section.heading: Company must not make payment for loss of office to director or former director

subsection.content: Without the prescribed approval of its members, a company must not make a payment for loss of office to a director or former director of the company.

Without the prescribed approval of its members and the prescribed approval of the holding company’s members, a company must not make a payment for loss of office to a director or former director of a holding company of the company.

subsection.leadIn: Despite subsection (2)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: a company may enter into the transaction with only the prescribed approval of its members if the holding company— (Amended 14 of 2025 s. 43)

subparagraph.content: is incorporated outside Hong Kong; and
is not a re-domiciled company; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: a company may enter into the transaction with only the prescribed approval of the holding company’s members if it is a wholly owned subsidiary of the holding company, and the holding company— (Amended 14 of 2025 s. 43)

subparagraph.content: is incorporated in Hong Kong; or
is a re-domiciled company. (Amended 14 of 2025 s. 43)

section.name: s522
section.heading: Person must not make payment for loss of office to director or former director in connection with transfer of company’s undertaking or property

subsection.content: Without the prescribed approval of the company’s members, a person must not make a payment for loss of office to a director or former director of a company in connection with a transfer of the whole or any part of the undertaking or property of the company.

Without the prescribed approval of the company’s members and the prescribed approval of the subsidiary’s members, a person must not make a payment for loss of office to a director or former director of a company in connection with a transfer of the whole or any part of the undertaking or property of a subsidiary of the company.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of this section, a payment is presumed, except in so far as the contrary is shown, to be made in connection with a transfer of any undertaking or property of a company if it is made pursuant to an arrangement—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: entered into as part of the agreement for the transfer, or within one year before or 2 years after that agreement is entered into; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to which the company, or any person to whom the transfer is made, is privy.

subsection.leadIn: Despite subsection (2), a person may enter into the transaction with only the prescribed approval of the company’s members if the subsidiary— (Amended 14 of 2025 s. 44)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is incorporated outside Hong Kong and is not a re-domiciled company; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: is a wholly owned subsidiary of the company. (Amended 14 of 2025 s. 44)

section.name: s523
section.heading: Person must not make payment for loss of office to director or former director in connection with transfer of shares resulting from takeover offer

subsection.content: Without the prescribed approval of the affected members, a person must not make a payment for loss of office to a director or former director of a company in connection with a transfer of shares in the company, or in a subsidiary of the company, resulting from a takeover offer.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of this section, a payment is presumed, except in so far as the contrary is shown, to be made in connection with a transfer of any shares in a company if it is made pursuant to an arrangement—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: entered into as part of the agreement for the transfer, or within one year before or 2 years after that agreement is entered into; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to which the company, or any person to whom the transfer is made, is privy.

subsection.content: Despite subsection (1), a person may enter into the transaction without the prescribed approval of a body corporate’s affected members if the body corporate is incorporated outside Hong Kong and is not a re-domiciled company. (Amended 14 of 2025 s. 45)

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of this section, the prescribed approval of the affected members of a payment is to be regarded as being obtained if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a quorum is not present at a general meeting to consider the resolution in respect of which the requirement specified in section 518(2)(b)(i) is met;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the meeting is adjourned to a later date; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a quorum is not present at the adjourned meeting.

section.name: s524
section.heading: Exception for payments in discharge of legal obligation etc.

subsection.leadIn: A person is not prohibited by Subdivision 2 from making a payment in good faith—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in discharge of an existing legal obligation;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: by way of damages for breach of an existing legal obligation;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: by way of settlement or compromise of any claim arising in connection with the termination of a person’s office or employment; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: by way of pension in respect of past services.

subsection.content: For the purposes of subsection (1), if part of a payment falls within that subsection and part of it does not, the payment is to be regarded as if those parts were separate payments.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—

def.name: ExistingLegalObligation
def.leadIn: existing legal obligation (現存法律義務)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in relation to a payment falling within section 521 and made by a company, means an obligation of the company, or an associated company of it, that was not entered into in connection with, or in consequence of, the event giving rise to the payment for loss of office; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in relation to a payment falling within section 522 or 523 and made by a person in connection with a transfer of any undertaking, property or shares, means an obligation of the person that was not entered into for the purpose of, in connection with, or in consequence of, the transfer;

subsection.def: pension (退休金) includes any superannuation allowance, superannuation gratuity or similar payment.

subsection.content: For the purposes of the definition of existing legal obligation in subsection (3), if a payment falls within both sections 521 and 522 or within both sections 521 and 523, it is to be regarded as falling within section 521 but not within section 522 or 523.

section.name: s525
section.heading: Exception for small payment

subsection.content: A company is not prohibited by section 521 from making a payment to a director or former director if the aggregate of the amount or value of the payment, and the amount or value of any other payment for loss of office made by the company or a subsidiary of the company to the director or former director in connection with the same event, does not exceed $100,000.

A company is not prohibited by section 522 or 523 from making a payment to a director or former director in connection with a transfer of any undertaking or property of, or shares in, the company or a subsidiary of the company if the aggregate of the amount or value of the payment, and the amount or value of any other payment for loss of office made by the company or a subsidiary of the company to the director or former director in connection with the transfer, does not exceed $100,000.

A subsidiary of a company (excepted subsidiary) is not prohibited by section 522 or 523 from making a payment to a director or former director in connection with a transfer of any undertaking or property of, or shares in, the company or a subsidiary of the company if the aggregate of the amount or value of the payment, and the amount or value of any other payment for loss of office made by the excepted subsidiary or a subsidiary of the excepted subsidiary to the director or former director in connection with the transfer, does not exceed $100,000. (Amended 35 of 2018 s. 58)

Subsection (3) applies in relation to a loss of office that occurs on or after the commencement date* of section 58 of the Companies (Amendment) (No. 2) Ordinance 2018 (35 of 2018). (Added 35 of 2018 s. 58)

Subsection (3), as in force immediately before the commencement date* of section 58 of the Companies (Amendment) (No. 2) Ordinance 2018 (35 of 2018), continues to apply in relation to a loss of office specified in that subsection that occurred before that commencement date*. (Added 35 of 2018 s. 58)

section.name: s526
section.heading: Interpretation
section.leadIn: For the purposes of this Division—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: unless the court directs otherwise, a payment is to be regarded as being made in contravention of section 522 if it is made in contravention of both sections 521 and 522; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: unless the court directs otherwise, a payment is to be regarded as being made in contravention of section 523 if it is made in contravention of both sections 521 and 523.

section.name: s527
section.heading: Civil consequences of contravention of section 521
section.leadIn: If a payment is made by a company in contravention of section 521—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the payment is held by the recipient in trust for the company; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any director of the company who authorized the payment is jointly and severally liable to indemnify the company for any loss resulting from the payment.

section.name: s528
section.heading: Civil consequences of contravention of section 522

subsection.content: This section applies if a payment is made in connection with a transfer of any undertaking or property of a company, or a subsidiary of a company, in contravention of section 522.
The payment is held by the recipient in trust for the company or subsidiary.

If the payment is made by or on behalf of the company, any director of the company who authorized the payment is jointly and severally liable to indemnify the company for any loss resulting from the payment.

If the payment is made by or on behalf of the subsidiary, any director of the subsidiary who authorized the payment is jointly and severally liable to indemnify the subsidiary for any loss resulting from the payment.

section.name: s529
section.heading: Civil consequences of contravention of section 523

subsection.content: This section applies if a payment is made in connection with a transfer of shares in a company, or a subsidiary of a company, resulting from a takeover offer in contravention of section 523.
The payment is held by the recipient in trust for those who have sold their shares as a result of the offer made.
The recipient must bear the expenses in distributing that sum amongst those who have sold their shares.

If the payment is made by or on behalf of the company, any director of the company who authorized the payment is jointly and severally liable to indemnify the company for any loss resulting from the payment.

If the payment is made by or on behalf of the subsidiary, any director of the subsidiary who authorized the payment is jointly and severally liable to indemnify the subsidiary for any loss resulting from the payment.

section.name: s530
section.heading: Interpretation

subsection.leadIn: In this Division—
subsection.def: director (董事) includes a shadow director.

subsection.content: For the purposes of this Division, a body corporate is not to be regarded as a shadow director of any of its subsidiaries by reason only that the directors, or a majority of the directors, of the subsidiary are accustomed to act in accordance with its directions or instructions.

section.name: s531
section.heading: Service contract

subsection.leadIn: In this Division, a reference to a service contract of a director of a company—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: is a reference to a contract under which—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the director undertakes personally to perform services, as director or otherwise, for the company or for a subsidiary of the company; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: services that the director undertakes personally to perform, as director or otherwise, are to be made available by a third party to the company or to a subsidiary of the company; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: includes the terms of a person’s appointment as director of the company.

subsection.content: In this Division, a reference to a service contract of a director of a company is not restricted to a contract for the performance of services outside the scope of a director’s ordinary duties as director.

section.name: s532
section.heading: Prescribed approval of members

subsection.leadIn: In this Division, a reference to the prescribed approval of the members of a company is a reference to an approval obtained by a resolution of those members—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: that is passed before the company agrees to the provision; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in respect of which the requirements specified in subsection (2) are met.

subsection.leadIn: The requirements specified for the purposes of subsection (1)(b) are—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: that, in the case of a written resolution, a memorandum setting out the proposed service contract (incorporating the provision in question) is sent to every member at or before the time at which the proposed resolution is sent to the member; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: that, in the case of a resolution passed at a general meeting—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: a memorandum setting out the proposed service contract (incorporating the provision in question) is sent to every member together with the notice convening the meeting; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: if the company is a public company, the resolution is passed after disregarding every vote in favour of the resolution by a member specified in subsection (4).

subsection.content: Subject to any provision of the company’s articles, any accidental omission to send the memorandum to a member is to be disregarded for the purpose of determining whether the requirement specified in subsection (2)(a) or (b)(i) has been met.

subsection.leadIn: The member specified for the purposes of subsection (2)(b)(ii) is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: one who is the director with whom the service contract is proposed to be entered into; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: one who holds any shares in the company in trust for that director.

subsection.content: Subsection (2)(b)(ii) does not prevent a member specified in subsection (4) from attending, being counted towards the quorum for, or taking part in the proceedings at, any meeting at which the decision is considered.
For the purposes of subsection (1)(a), it is irrelevant whether the resolution is passed before, on or after the commencement date# of this Division.

section.name: s533
section.heading: Preservation of effect of members’ unanimous consent

subsection.content: If, under section 534(1), any provision must not be agreed to without the prescribed approval of a company’s members, that section does not prohibit the provision from being agreed to with the unanimous consent of those members given before it is agreed to.
For the purposes of subsection (1), it is irrelevant whether the unanimous consent is given before, on or after the commencement date# of this Division.

section.name: s534
section.heading: Company must not agree to director’s long-term employment

subsection.content: Without the prescribed approval of its members, a company must not agree to any provision under which the guaranteed term of the employment of a director of the company with the company exceeds or may exceed 3 years.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: employment (僱用) means any employment under a director’s service contract.

subsection.leadIn: In this section, a reference to the guaranteed term of a director’s employment is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: a reference to the period (if any) during which the employment—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: is to continue, or may be continued, otherwise than at the instance of the company (whether under the original contract or under a new contract entered into pursuant to it); and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: cannot be terminated by the company by notice, or can be so terminated only in specified circumstances;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the case of employment terminable by the company by notice, a reference to the period of notice required to be given; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: in the case of employment having a period within paragraph (a) and a period within paragraph (b), a reference to the aggregate of those periods.

subsection.content: For the purposes of this section, if, more than 6 months before the end of the guaranteed term of a director’s employment, the company enters into a further service contract otherwise than pursuant to a right given, by or under the original contract, to the other party to it, the guaranteed term of the employment under the further contract is to be regarded as including the unexpired period of the guaranteed term of the employment under the original contract.
For the purposes of subsection (4), it is irrelevant whether the original contract is entered into before, on or after the commencement date# of this Division.

section.name: s535
section.heading: Civil consequences of contravention of section 534
section.leadIn: If a company agrees to a provision in contravention of section 534—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the provision is void to the extent of the contravention; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the contract is to be regarded as containing a term entitling the company to terminate it at any time by giving reasonable notice.

division.name: D5
division.heading: Material Interests in Transaction, Arrangement or Contract

section.name: s536
section.heading: Director must declare material interests

subsection.content: If a director of a company is in any way, directly or indirectly, interested in a transaction, arrangement or contract, or a proposed transaction, arrangement or contract, with the company that is significant in relation to the company’s business, and the director’s interest is material, the director must declare the nature and extent of the director’s interest to the other directors in accordance with sections 537, 538 and 539.

If an entity connected with a director of a public company is in any way, directly or indirectly, interested in a transaction, arrangement or contract, or a proposed transaction, arrangement or contract, with the company that is significant in relation to the company’s business, and the connected entity’s interest is material, the director must declare the nature and extent of the connected entity’s interest to the other directors in accordance with sections 537, 538 and 539.
If a declaration made under subsection (1) or (2) proves to be, or becomes, inaccurate or incomplete, the director must make a further declaration in accordance with sections 537, 538 and 539.

subsection.leadIn: This section does not require a director to declare an interest—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if the director is not aware of the interest or the transaction, arrangement or contract in question; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: if, or to the extent that, the interest concerns the terms of the director’s service contract that have been or are to be considered by—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: a meeting of the directors; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: a committee of the directors appointed for the purpose under the company’s articles.

subsection.content: For the purposes of subsection (4)(a), a director is to be regarded as being aware of matters of which the director ought reasonably to be aware.

This section does not affect the operation of any other Ordinance or rule of law restricting a director of a company from having any interest in a transaction, arrangement or contract with the company.

section.name: s537
section.heading: Declaration to directors: timing

subsection.content: A declaration of interest under section 536 in a transaction, arrangement or contract that has been entered into must be made as soon as reasonably practicable.
A declaration of interest under section 536 in a proposed transaction, arrangement or contract must be made before the company enters into the transaction, arrangement or contract.
Failure to comply with subsection (1) or (2) does not affect the underlying duty to make the declaration.

section.name: s538
section.heading: Declaration to directors: procedures

subsection.leadIn: A declaration to directors under section 536 must be—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: made at a directors’ meeting;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: made by notice in writing and sent by the director to the other directors; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: made by general notice by the director.

subsection.leadIn: A notice for the purposes of subsection (1)(b)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: must be sent—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: in hard copy form; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: if the recipient has agreed to receive it in electronic form, in the electronic form so agreed; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: must be sent—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: by hand or by post; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: if the recipient has agreed to receive it by electronic means, by the electronic means so agreed.

subsection.leadIn: If a declaration to directors under section 536 is made by notice in writing—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the making of the declaration is to be regarded as forming part of the proceedings at the next directors’ meeting after the notice is given; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: section 481 applies as if the declaration had been made at that meeting.

subsection.leadIn: A general notice by a director for the purposes of subsection (1)(c) is a notice to the effect that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: the director—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: has an interest (as member, officer, employee or otherwise) in a body corporate or firm specified in the notice; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: is to be regarded as interested in any transaction, arrangement or contract that may, after the effective date of the notice, be entered into with the specified body corporate or firm; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the director—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: is connected with a person specified in the notice (other than a body corporate or firm); and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: is to be regarded as interested in any transaction, arrangement or contract that may, after the effective date of the notice, be entered into with the specified person.

subsection.leadIn: A general notice must state—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the nature and extent of the director’s interest in the specified body corporate or firm; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the nature of the director’s connection with the specified person.

subsection.leadIn: A general notice must be given—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: at a directors’ meeting; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in writing and sent to the company.

subsection.statutoryNote:
Note—
See also section 541 which requires a company receiving a general notice to send the general notice to other directors.

subsection.content: A general notice given under subsection (6)(a) takes effect on the date of the directors’ meeting.
A general notice given under subsection (6)(b) takes effect on the twenty-first day after the day on which it is sent to the company.

section.name: s539
section.heading: Declaration to directors in case of company with sole director

subsection.leadIn: If a declaration to directors under section 536 is required of a sole director of a company that is required to have more than one director—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the declaration must be recorded in writing;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the making of the declaration is to be regarded as forming part of the proceedings at the next directors’ meeting after the notice is given; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: section 481 applies as if the declaration had been made at that meeting.

subsection.content: This section does not affect the operation of section 545.

section.name: s540
section.heading: Application of Division to shadow director

subsection.content: Subject to subsections (2), (3) and (4), the provisions of this Division relating to the duty of a director to declare an interest under section 536 apply to a shadow director in the same manner as they apply to a director.
Section 538(1)(a) and (6) does not apply to a shadow director.
A general notice by a shadow director for the purposes of section 538(1)(c) is not effective unless it is given by notice in writing and sent by the shadow director to the other directors.

subsection.leadIn: A notice for the purposes of subsection (3)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: must be sent—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: in hard copy form; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: if the recipient has agreed to receive it in electronic form, in the electronic form so agreed; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: must be sent—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: by hand or by post; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: if the recipient has agreed to receive it by electronic means, by the electronic means so agreed.

section.name: s541
section.heading: Companies must send general notices to other directors

subsection.content: If a company receives a notice under section 538(6)(b) from a director, it must, within 15 days after the day on which it receives the notice, send a copy of the notice to other directors of the company.
If a company contravenes subsection (1), the company, and every responsible person of the company, commit an offence, and each is liable to a fine at level 6.

section.name: s542
section.heading: Offence

subsection.content: A director or shadow director who contravenes section 536(1), (2) or (3) commits an offence and is liable to a fine at level 6.

If a person is charged with an offence under subsection (1) for contravening section 536(2), it is a defence to establish that the person took all reasonable steps to secure compliance with that section.

section.name: s543
section.heading: Disclosure of management contract

subsection.leadIn: This section applies if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a company enters into a contract by which a person undertakes the management and administration of the whole or any substantial part of any business of the company; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the contract is not a contract of service with any director of the company or any person engaged in the full-time employment of the company.

subsection.leadIn: The directors’ report for any year in which the contract is in force must include—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a statement of the existence and duration of the contract; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the name of every director and shadow director interested in the contract, and the nature and extent of the interest.

subsection.leadIn: The company must keep the following at its registered office or at a place prescribed by regulations made under section 657—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a copy of the contract;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if such a contract is not in writing, a written memorandum setting out the terms of the contract.

subsection.leadIn: The company—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: must retain the copy or memorandum for at least one year after the date of termination or expiry of the contract; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: must keep the copy or memorandum available for inspection during that time.

subsection.content: If the copy or memorandum is kept at a place other than the company’s registered office, the company must deliver to the Registrar for registration a notice, in the specified form, of the place, or any change in the place, at which the copy or memorandum is kept. The notice must be delivered to the Registrar within 15 days after the copy or memorandum is first kept at that place or within 15 days after the change (as the case may be).
If subsection (3) or (4) is contravened, the company, and every responsible person of the company, commit an offence, and each is liable to a fine at level 3.

If subsection (5) is contravened, the company, and every responsible person of the company, commit an offence, and each is liable to a fine at level 3 and, in the case of a continuing offence, to a further fine of $300 for each day during which the offence continues.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—

def.name: 董事報告
def.leadIn: directors’ report (董事報告) means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the report required to be prepared under section 388(1); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the consolidated report required to be prepared under section 388(2).

section.name: s544
section.heading: Right of member to inspect and request copy

subsection.content: A member of a company is entitled, on request made in the prescribed manner and without charge, to inspect, in accordance with regulations made under section 657, a copy of a contract or a written memorandum kept by the company under section 543.
A member of the company is entitled, on request and on payment of a prescribed fee, to be provided with a copy of the contract or memorandum in accordance with regulations made under section 657.
In this section, a reference to a contract includes a variation of the contract.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: prescribed (訂明) means prescribed by regulations made under section 657.

section.name: s545
section.heading: Contract with sole member who is also director

subsection.leadIn: This section applies if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a company having only one member enters into a contract with the member;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the member is also a director of the company; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the contract is not entered into in the ordinary course of the company’s business.

subsection.leadIn: Unless the contract is in writing, the company must ensure that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the terms of the contract are set out in a written memorandum within 15 days from the entering into of the contract; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the memorandum is kept at the place at which the books containing the minutes of the directors’ meetings are kept.

subsection.content: If a company contravenes subsection (2), the company, and every responsible person of the company, commit an offence, and each is liable to a fine at level 3.
A contravention of subsection (2) in relation to a contract does not affect the validity of the contract.
This section does not exclude the operation of any other Ordinance or rule of law applying to contracts between a company and a director of the company.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: director (董事) includes a shadow director.

subsection.content: For the purposes of this section, a body corporate is not to be regarded as a shadow director of any of its subsidiaries by reason only that the directors, or a majority of the directors, of the subsidiary are accustomed to act in accordance with its directions or instructions.

section.name: s546
section.heading: Financial Secretary may amend certain sums or percentage figures

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (2), the Financial Secretary may, by notice published in the Gazette, amend any provision of Division 2 or 3—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: by substituting for any sum of money specified in the provision a sum specified in the notice; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: by substituting for any percentage figure specified in the provision a percentage figure specified in the notice.

subsection.content: A notice under this section may not be made to amend the amount of a fine.
A notice under this section does not have effect in relation to anything done or not done before the notice comes into operation.
Proceedings in respect of any liability incurred before a notice under this section comes into operation may be continued or instituted as if the notice had not been made.

part.name: P12
part.heading: Company Administration and Procedure

section.name: s547
section.heading: Interpretation

subsection.leadIn: In this Division—

def.name: CirculationDate
def.leadIn: circulation date (傳閱日期), in relation to a written resolution or a proposed written resolution, means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the date on which copies of the resolution are sent to eligible members in accordance with section 553; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if copies are sent to eligible members on different days, the first of those days;

subsection.def: electronic address (電子地址) means any sequence or combination of letters, characters, numbers or symbols of any language or, any number, used for the purposes of sending or receiving a document or information by electronic means; (Amended 2 of 2023 s. 3)
virtual meeting technology (虛擬會議科技) means a technology that allows a person to listen, speak and vote at a meeting without being physically present at the meeting. (Added 2 of 2023 s. 3)

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of this Division—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in relation to a proposed written resolution, the eligible members are the members who would have been entitled to vote on the resolution on the circulation date of the resolution; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the persons entitled to vote on the resolution change during the course of the day that is the circulation date of the resolution, the eligible members are the persons entitled to vote on the resolution at the time that the first copy of the resolution is sent to a member for agreement.

subsection.leadIn: Nothing in this Division affects the operation of any other Ordinance or rule of law as to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: things done otherwise than by passing a resolution;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: circumstances in which a resolution is or is not to be regarded as having been passed; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: cases in which a person is precluded from alleging that a resolution has not been duly passed.

section.name: s548
section.heading: Written resolution

subsection.content: Anything that may be done by a resolution passed at a general meeting of a company may be done, without a meeting and without any previous notice being required, by a written resolution of the members of the company.

Anything that may be done by a resolution passed at a meeting of a class of members of a company may be done, without a meeting and without any previous notice being required, by a written resolution of that class of members of the company.

If a resolution is required by any Ordinance to be passed as an ordinary resolution or a special resolution, the resolution may be passed as a written resolution; and a reference in any Ordinance to an ordinary resolution or a special resolution includes a written resolution.

A reference in any Ordinance to the date of passing of a resolution or the date of a meeting is, in relation to a written resolution, the date on which the written resolution is passed under section 556.

subsection.leadIn: A written resolution of a company has effect as if passed by—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the company at a general meeting; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a meeting of the relevant class of members of the company,

subsection.continued: as the case may be, and a reference in any Ordinance to a meeting at which a resolution is passed or to members voting in favour of a resolution is to be construed accordingly.

subsection.leadIn: This section does not apply to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a resolution removing an auditor before the end of the auditor’s term of office; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a resolution removing a director before the end of the director’s term of office.

section.name: s549
section.heading: Power to propose written resolution
section.leadIn: A resolution may be proposed as a written resolution by—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the directors of a company; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a member of a company.

section.name: s550
section.heading: Company’s duty to circulate written resolution proposed by directors
section.content: If the directors of a company have proposed a resolution as a written resolution under section 549(a), the company must circulate the resolution.

section.name: s551
section.heading: Members’ power to request circulation of written resolution

subsection.leadIn: A member of a company may request the company to circulate a resolution that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: may properly be moved; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: is proposed as a written resolution under section 549(b).

subsection.content: If a member requests a company to circulate a resolution, the member may request the company to circulate with the resolution a statement of not more than 1 000 words on the subject matter of the resolution.
However, each member may only request the company to circulate one such statement with respect to the resolution.

section.name: s552
section.heading: Company’s duty to circulate written resolution proposed by members

subsection.content: A company must circulate a resolution proposed as a written resolution under section 549(b) and any statement mentioned in section 551(2) if it has received requests that it do so from the members of the company representing not less than the requisite percentage of the total voting rights of all the members entitled to vote on the resolution.
The requisite percentage mentioned in subsection (1) is 5% or a lower percentage specified for this purpose in the company’s articles.

subsection.leadIn: A request—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: may be sent to the company in hard copy form or in electronic form;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: must identify the resolution and any statement mentioned in section 551(2); and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: must be authenticated by the person or persons making it.

section.name: s553
section.heading: Circulation of written resolution

subsection.leadIn: If a company is required under section 550 or 552 to circulate a resolution proposed as a written resolution, the company must send at its own expense to every eligible member and every other member (if any) who is not an eligible member—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a copy of the resolution; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if so required under section 551(2), a copy of a statement mentioned in that section.

subsection.leadIn: The company may comply with subsection (1)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: by sending copies at the same time (so far as reasonably practicable) to all members in hard copy form or in electronic form or by making the copies available on a website;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if it is possible to do so without undue delay, by sending the same copy to each member in turn (or different copies to each of a number of members in turn); or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: by sending copies to some members in accordance with paragraph (a) and sending a copy or copies to other members in accordance with paragraph (b).

subsection.content: The company must send the copies (or if copies are sent to members on different days, the first of those copies) not more than 21 days after it becomes subject to the requirement under subsection (1) to send the copies.

subsection.leadIn: If the company sends a copy of a proposed written resolution or statement by making it available on a website, the copy is not validly sent for the purposes of this Subdivision unless the copy is available on the website throughout the period—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: beginning on the circulation date; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: ending on the date on which the resolution lapses under section 558.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsection (4), a failure to make a copy of a proposed written resolution or statement available on a website throughout the period mentioned in that subsection is to be disregarded if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the copy is made available on the website for part of that period; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the failure is wholly attributable to circumstances that it would not be reasonable to have expected the company to prevent or avoid.

subsection.leadIn: The company must ensure that the copy of the proposed written resolution sent to an eligible member is accompanied by guidance as to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: how to signify agreement to the resolution under section 556; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the date by which the resolution must be passed if it is not to lapse under section 558.

subsection.content: If a company contravenes subsection (1), (3) or (6), the company, and every responsible person of the company, commit an offence, and each is liable to a fine at level 5.
The validity of the resolution, if passed, is not affected by a contravention of subsection (1), (3) or (6).

section.name: s554
section.heading: Application not to circulate accompanying statement
