If a company contravenes subsection (2), the company, and every responsible person of the company, commit an offence, and each is liable to a fine at level 3 and, in the case of a continuing offence, to a further fine of $300 for each day during which the offence continues.
If a company contravenes subsection (3) or (5), the company, and every responsible person of the company, commit an offence, and each is liable to a fine at level 3.
For the purposes of subsections (7) and (8), a liquidator or provisional liquidator of the company is to be regarded as an officer of the company.

section.name: s623
section.heading: Application to class meetings of companies with share capital

subsection.content: Subject to subsections (2) and (3), this Division (except Subdivision 10) applies, with necessary modifications, in relation to a meeting of holders of shares in a class of a company’s shares as it applies in relation to a general meeting.
Sections 566, 567, 568, 570 and 575 do not apply in relation to a meeting of holders of shares in a class of a company’s shares.

subsection.def: In addition to those sections mentioned in subsection (2), sections 585 and 591 do not apply in relation to a meeting in connection with the variation of the rights attached to shares in a class (variation of class rights meeting).

subsection.leadIn: The quorum for a variation of class rights meeting is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the case of a meeting other than an adjourned meeting, 2 persons present in person or by proxy together holding at least one-third of the total voting rights of holders of shares in the class; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the case of an adjourned meeting, one person present in person or by proxy holding any shares in the class.

subsection.content: For the purposes of subsection (4), if a person is present by proxy, that person is to be regarded as holding only the shares in respect of which the proxy is authorized to exercise voting rights.
At a variation of class rights meeting, any holder of shares in the class who is present in person or by proxy may demand a poll.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of this section—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any amendment of a provision in a company’s articles for the variation of the rights attached to shares in a class, or the insertion of such a provision into the articles, is itself to be regarded as a variation of those rights; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a reference to the variation of the rights attached to shares in a class includes the abrogation of those rights.

section.name: s624
section.heading: Application to class meetings of companies without share capital

subsection.content: Subject to subsections (2) and (3), this Division (except Subdivision 10) applies, with necessary modifications, in relation to a meeting of a class of members of a company without a share capital as it applies in relation to a general meeting.
Sections 566, 567, 568, 570 and 575 do not apply in relation to a meeting of a class of members.

subsection.def: In addition to those sections mentioned in subsection (2), sections 585 and 591 do not apply in relation to a meeting in connection with the variation of the rights of a class of members (variation of class rights meeting).

subsection.leadIn: The quorum for a variation of class rights meeting is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the case of a meeting other than an adjourned meeting, 2 members of the class present in person or by proxy together representing at least one-third of the total voting rights of members of the class; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the case of an adjourned meeting, one member of the class present (in person or by proxy).

subsection.content: At a variation of class rights meeting, any member present in person or by proxy may demand a poll.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of this section—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any amendment of a provision in a company’s articles for the variation of the rights of a class of members, or the insertion of such a provision into the articles, is itself to be regarded as a variation of those rights; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a reference to the variation of the rights of a class of members includes the abrogation of those rights.

division.name: D2
division.heading: Registers (other than Register of Significant Controllers)

section.name: s625
section.heading: Interpretation
section.leadIn: In this Division—
section.def: prescribed (訂明) means prescribed by regulations made under section 657.

section.name: s626
section.heading: Interpretation
section.leadIn: In this Subdivision—
section.def: branch register (登記支冊) means, except in section 640, a branch register of members kept under section 636.

section.name: s627
section.heading: Register of members

subsection.content: A company must keep in the English or Chinese language a register of members.

subsection.leadIn: A company must enter in the register of members—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the names and addresses of its members;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the date on which each person is entered in the register as a member; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the date on which any person ceases to be a member.

subsection.leadIn: In the case of a company having a share capital, the company must enter in the register of members, with the names and addresses of the members, a statement of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the shares held by each member, distinguishing each share by its number so long as the share has a number; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the amount paid or agreed to be considered as paid on the shares of each member.

subsection.content: A company must enter in the register of members the particulars required under subsections (2) and (3) within 2 months after the company has received notice of the particulars concerned.

In the case of a person mentioned in subsection (2)(c), all entries in the register relating to that person on the date on which the person ceased to be a member may be destroyed after the end of a period of 10 years from that date.

A company must retain a copy of any details that were included in the register of members immediately before the commencement date# of subsection (5) until 10 years after the member concerned ceased to be a member.

If a company contravenes subsection (1), (4) or (6), the company, and every responsible person of the company, commit an offence, and each is liable to a fine at level 4 and, in the case of a continuing offence, to a further fine of $700 for each day during which the offence continues.

section.name: s628
section.heading: Place where register must be kept

subsection.leadIn: A company must keep its register of members at—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the company’s registered office; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a prescribed place.

subsection.content: A company must notify the Registrar of the place at which the register of members is kept. The notice must be in the specified form and delivered to the Registrar for registration within 15 days after the register is first kept at that place.

A company must notify the Registrar of any change (other than a change of the address of the company’s registered office) in the place at which the register of members is kept. The notice must be in the specified form and delivered to the Registrar for registration within 15 days after the change.

subsection.leadIn: Subsection (2) does not require a company to notify the Registrar of the place at which the register of members is kept—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if, in the case of a register that came into existence on or after the commencement date# of this section, it has at all times been kept at the company’s registered office; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: if—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: immediately before that commencement date#, the company kept a register for the purposes of section 95 of the predecessor Ordinance; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: on and after that commencement date#, that register is kept as a register of members for the purposes of section 627 at the place at which it was kept immediately before that commencement date#.

subsection.content: If a company contravenes subsection (1), (2) or (3), the company, and every responsible person of the company, commit an offence, and each is liable to a fine at level 4 and, in the case of a continuing offence, to a further fine of $700 for each day during which the offence continues.

section.name: s629
section.heading: Statement that company has only one member

subsection.leadIn: If, after a person ceases to be a member of a company, the number of members of the company falls to one, the company must, within 15 days after the date on which the cessation is entered in its register of members under section 627(2)(c), enter in the register—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a statement that it has only one member; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the date on which it became a company having only one member.

subsection.leadIn: If the membership of a company increases from one to 2 or more members, the company must, within 15 days after the date on which the particulars of the new member are entered in its register of members under section 627(2), enter in the register—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a statement that it has ceased to have only one member; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the date on which that event occurred.

subsection.content: If a company contravenes subsection (1) or (2), the company, and every responsible person of the company, commit an offence, and each is liable to a fine at level 4 and, in the case of a continuing offence, to a further fine of $700 for each day during which the offence continues.

section.name: s630
section.heading: Index of members

subsection.content: A company having more than 50 members must keep an index of the names of the members of the company, unless its register of members is in a form that constitutes in itself an index.
The company must make any necessary alteration in the index within 15 days after the date on which any alteration is made in its register of members.
The company must ensure that the index contains, in respect of each member, a sufficient indication to enable the account of that member in the register to be readily found.
The company must keep the index at the same place as its register of members at all times.

If a company contravenes subsection (1), (2), (3) or (4), the company, and every responsible person of the company, commit an offence, and each is liable to a fine at level 4 and, in the case of a continuing offence, to a further fine of $700 for each day during which the offence continues.

section.name: s631
section.heading: Right to inspect and request copy

subsection.content: A member of a company is entitled, on request made in the prescribed manner and without charge, to inspect the register of members of the company, and the index of members’ names, in accordance with regulations made under section 657.
Any other person is entitled, on request made in the prescribed manner and on payment of a prescribed fee, to inspect the register and index in accordance with regulations made under section 657.
A person is entitled, on request and on payment of a prescribed fee, to be provided with a copy of the register or index, or any part of it, in accordance with regulations made under section 657.

section.name: s632
section.heading: Power to close register of members

subsection.content: A company may, on giving notice in accordance with subsection (2), close its register of members, or the part of it relating to members holding shares of any class, for any period or periods not exceeding in the whole 30 days in each year.

subsection.leadIn: A notice for the purposes of subsection (1)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: if the company is a listed company, must be given—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: in accordance with the listing rules applicable to the stock market; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: by advertisement in a newspaper circulating generally in Hong Kong; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the case of any other company, must be given by advertisement in a newspaper circulating generally in Hong Kong.

subsection.content: The period of 30 days mentioned in subsection (1) may be extended in respect of any year by a resolution of the company’s members passed in that year.
The period of 30 days mentioned in subsection (1) must not be extended for a further period or periods exceeding 30 days in the whole in any year.

A company must, on demand, provide any person seeking to inspect a register or part of a register that is closed under this section with a certificate signed by the company secretary of the company stating the period for which, and by whose authority, it is closed.
If a company contravenes subsection (5), the company, and every responsible person of the company, commit an offence, and each is liable to a fine at level 3.

section.name: s633
section.heading: Power of Court to rectify register

subsection.leadIn: If—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the name of any person is, without sufficient cause, entered in or omitted from the register of members of a company; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: default is made or unnecessary delay takes place in entering in the register the fact of any person having ceased to be a member,

subsection.continued: a person aggrieved, or any member of the company, or the company, may apply to the Court for rectification of the register.

subsection.leadIn: If an application is made under subsection (1), the Court may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: refuse the application; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: subject to section 167, order rectification of the register and payment by the company of any damages sustained by any party aggrieved.

subsection.leadIn: Subject to section 167, on an application under subsection (1), the Court—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: may decide any question relating to the title of any person who is a party to the application to have the person’s name entered in or omitted from the register, whether the question arises—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: between members or alleged members; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: between members or alleged members on the one hand and the company on the other hand; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: generally may decide any question necessary or expedient to be decided for rectification of the register.

subsection.content: In the case of a company required by this Ordinance to deliver particulars relating to its members to the Registrar for registration, the Court, when making an order for rectification of the register, must by its order direct notice of the rectification to be given to the Registrar.

section.name: s634
section.heading: Trusts not to be entered in register
section.leadIn: No notice of any trust (whether expressed, implied or constructive) may be—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: entered in the register of members of a company; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: receivable by the Registrar.

section.name: s635
section.heading: Register to be proof in the absence of contrary evidence
section.content: In the absence of evidence to the contrary, the register of members is proof of any matters that are by this Ordinance required or authorized to be inserted in it.

section.name: s636
section.heading: Branch register of members

subsection.content: A company having a share capital may keep in a place outside Hong Kong a branch register of its members resident there if it is authorized to do so by its articles.

A company that begins to keep a branch register must deliver to the Registrar for registration a notice in the specified form within 15 days after doing so, stating the address where the branch register is kept.

A company that keeps a branch register must deliver to the Registrar for registration a notice in the specified form of any change in the address where the branch register is kept, within 15 days after the change.

If a company contravenes subsection (2) or (3), the company, and every responsible person of the company, commit an offence, and each is liable to a fine at level 4 and, in the case of a continuing offence, to a further fine of $700 for each day during which the offence continues.

section.name: s637
section.heading: Keeping of branch register

subsection.content: A branch register must be kept in the same manner in which the company’s register of members (the principal register) is by this Ordinance required to be kept.

A company that keeps a branch register may close it in the same manner in which the principal register may be closed under section 632 except that the advertisement mentioned in that section must be inserted in a newspaper circulating generally in the place in which the branch register is kept.

subsection.leadIn: A company that keeps a branch register—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: must cause a duplicate of it to be kept at the place at which the company’s principal register is kept; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: must, within 15 days after an entry is made in the branch register—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: transmit a copy of the entry to its registered office; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: update the duplicate of the branch register.

subsection.content: A duplicate of a branch register is to be regarded for all the purposes of this Ordinance as part of the principal register.
Subject to the provisions of this Ordinance, a company may by its articles make any provision that it thinks fit respecting the keeping of branch registers.

If a company contravenes subsection (3), the company, and every responsible person of the company, commit an offence, and each is liable to a fine at level 4 and, in the case of a continuing offence, to a further fine of $700 for each day during which the offence continues.

section.name: s638
section.heading: Transactions in shares registered in branch register

subsection.content: The shares registered in a branch register of a company must be distinguished from those registered in the company’s register of members.
No transaction with respect to any shares registered in a branch register may, during the continuance of that registration, be registered in any other register.

section.name: s639
section.heading: Discontinuance of branch register

subsection.content: A company may discontinue a branch register.

subsection.leadIn: If a company discontinues a branch register, all the entries in that register must be transferred to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: some other branch register kept in the same place outside Hong Kong by the company; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the company’s register of members.

subsection.leadIn: If a company discontinues a branch register, it must within 15 days after the discontinuance deliver to the Registrar for registration a notice in the specified form informing the Registrar of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the discontinuance; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the register to which all the entries have been transferred.

subsection.content: If a company contravenes subsection (3), the company, and every responsible person of the company, commit an offence, and each is liable to a fine at level 4 and, in the case of a continuing offence, to a further fine of $700 for each day during which the offence continues.

section.name: s640
section.heading: Provisions as to branch registers of non-Hong Kong companies kept in Hong Kong
section.leadIn: If under the law in force in any place outside Hong Kong, companies incorporated under that law have power to keep in Hong Kong branch registers of their members resident in Hong Kong, the Financial Secretary may by order direct that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: those branch registers must be kept at a place in Hong Kong as specified in the order;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: sections 631 and 633, subject to any modifications and adaptations specified in the order, apply to and in relation to those branch registers kept in Hong Kong as they apply to and in relation to the registers of members.

section.name: s641
section.heading: Register of directors

subsection.content: A company must keep in the English or Chinese language a register of directors.

Subject to section 56(5), (6)(a) and (7)(a), a company must enter in the register of directors the required particulars specified in section 643 of each person who is a director or reserve director (if any) of the company.

subsection.leadIn: A company must keep the register of directors at—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the company’s registered office; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a prescribed place.

subsection.content: A company must notify the Registrar of the place at which the register of directors is kept. The notice must be in the specified form and delivered to the Registrar for registration within 15 days after the register is first kept at that place.

A company must notify the Registrar of any change (other than a change of the address of the company’s registered office) in the place at which the register of directors is kept. The notice must be in the specified form and delivered to the Registrar for registration within 15 days after the change.

subsection.leadIn: Subsection (4) does not require a company to notify the Registrar of the place at which the register of directors is kept—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if, in the case of a register that came into existence on or after the commencement date# of this section, it has at all times been kept at the company’s registered office; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: if—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: immediately before that commencement date#, the company kept a register for the purposes of section 158 of the predecessor Ordinance; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: on and after that commencement date#, that register, in so far as it relates to the directors or reserve directors of the company, is kept as a register of directors for the purposes of subsection (1) at the place at which it was kept immediately before that commencement date#.

subsection.content: If a company contravenes subsection (1), (2), (3), (4) or (5), the company, and every responsible person of the company, commit an offence, and each is liable to a fine at level 4 and, in the case of a continuing offence, to a further fine of $700 for each day during which the offence continues.

section.name: s642
section.heading: Right to inspect and request copy

subsection.content: A member of a company is entitled, on request made in the prescribed manner and without charge, to inspect the register of directors of the company in accordance with regulations made under section 657.
Any other person is entitled, on request made in the prescribed manner and on payment of the prescribed fee, to inspect the register in accordance with regulations made under section 657.
A person is entitled, on request and on payment of a prescribed fee, to be provided with a copy of the register, or any part of it, in accordance with regulations made under section 657.

section.name: s643
section.heading: Particulars of directors to be registered

subsection.leadIn: If a company is a private company (other than one that is a member of a group of companies of which a listed company is a member), its register of directors must contain the following particulars with respect to each director—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: if the director is a natural person—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the present forename and surname, former forename or surname (if any), and aliases (if any);

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the usual residential address and a correspondence address; and

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: the number of the identity card or, if the director does not have an identity card, the number and issuing country of any passport held by the director; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the director is a body corporate, the corporate name and the address of its registered or principal office.

subsection.leadIn: If a company is a public company, a company limited by guarantee, or a private company that is a member of a group of companies of which a listed company is a member, its register of directors must contain the following particulars with respect to each director—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the present forename and surname, former forename or surname (if any), and aliases (if any);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the usual residential address and a correspondence address; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the number of the identity card or, if the director does not have an identity card, the number and issuing country of any passport held by the director.

subsection.leadIn: If a company is a private company having only one member and that member is the sole director of the company, its register of directors must contain the following particulars with respect to the reserve director of the company (if any)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the present forename and surname, former forename or surname (if any), and aliases (if any);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the usual residential address and a correspondence address; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the number of the identity card or, if the director does not have an identity card, the number and issuing country of any passport held by the director.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: forename (名字) includes a Christian or given name;

def.name: ResidentialAddress
def.leadIn: residential address (住址)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: does not include an address at a hotel unless the person to whom it relates is stated, for the purposes of this section, to have no other permanent address; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: does not include a post office box number;

subsection.def: surname (姓氏), for a person usually known by a title different from the person’s surname, means that title.

subsection.content: For the purposes of subsections (1)(a)(ii), (2)(b) and (3)(b), a correspondence address must not be a post office box number.

subsection.leadIn: In this section, a reference to a former forename or surname does not include—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: in relation to a person—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: a forename or surname that was changed or ceased to be used before the person attained the age of 18 years; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: a forename or surname that has been changed or ceased to be used for a period of at least 20 years;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in relation to a person usually known by a title different from the person’s surname, the name by which the person was known before the adoption of or succession to the title; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: in relation to a married woman, a name or surname by which she was known before her marriage.

subsection.content: The Financial Secretary may, by notice published in the Gazette, amend subsection (1), (2), (3), (4), (5) or (6).

section.name: s644
section.heading: Protection of certain particulars from inspection

subsection.leadIn: Despite section 642(1), (2) and (3), a company may withhold the following particulars contained in its register of directors from a person who inspects the register or requests for a copy of it or any part of it—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an address contained in the register as the usual residential address of a director or reserve director; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the number of the identity card or passport of a director or reserve director.

subsection.content: A company may only exercise the power under subsection (1) in the prescribed manner and to the prescribed extent.

section.name: s645
section.heading: Duty to notify Registrar of appointment and change

subsection.leadIn: If a person is appointed as director of a company otherwise than under section 453(3), (3A) or (4) or 454(2), (2A) or (3), the company must, within 15 days after the appointment, deliver to the Registrar for registration a notice in the specified form containing— (Amended 14 of 2025 s. 49)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the director’s particulars specified in its register of directors;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a statement that the person has accepted the appointment; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: if the person is a natural person, a statement that he or she has attained the age of 18 years.

subsection.content: The company must, within 15 days after the nomination of a person as a reserve director of the company, deliver to the Registrar for registration a notice in the specified form containing all the particulars with respect to that person that are required to be contained in its register of directors.

If a person is nominated as a reserve director of a private company, the company must, within 15 days after the nomination, deliver to the Registrar for registration a statement in the specified form that the person has accepted the nomination and has attained the age of 18 years.

subsection.leadIn: If a person ceases to be a director or reserve director of a company or there is any change in the particulars contained in the register of directors of a company, the company must, within 15 days after the cessation or change, deliver to the Registrar for registration a notice in the specified form containing—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the particulars of cessation or change and the date on which it occurred; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: other matters that are specified in the form.

subsection.content: If the company is not allowed under section 56(7)(b) to state in a notice under subsection (4) that a director’s correspondence address is changed to an address other than the address specified in subparagraph (i) or (ii) of that section, subsection (4) does not apply in relation to that change.

If a company contravenes subsection (1), (2), (3) or (4), the company, and every responsible person of the company, commit an offence, and each is liable to a fine at level 4 and, in the case of a continuing offence, to a further fine of $700 for each day during which the offence continues.

section.name: s646
section.heading: Duty of director to make disclosure

subsection.content: A director of a company must give notice to the company of matters relating to the director that are required for the purposes of sections 643 and 645.
A reserve director of a company must give notice to the company of matters relating to the reserve director that are required for the purposes of sections 643 and 645.
A person who contravenes subsection (1) or (2) commits an offence and is liable to a fine at level 4.

section.name: s647
section.heading: Registrar to keep an index of directors

subsection.content: The Registrar must keep an index of every person who is a director of a company or a reserve director of a private company.

subsection.leadIn: The particulars contained in the index must, in respect of each director or reserve director, include—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the name and address of the director or reserve director;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the latest particulars sent to the Registrar in respect of the director or reserve director; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the name of each company of which the director or reserve director can be identified as a director or reserve director.

subsection.content: The index kept under this section must be open for inspection by any person on payment of a prescribed fee.

subsection.leadIn: Despite subsection (3), the following particulars contained in the index must not be open for inspection under that subsection—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the usual residential address of the director or reserve director; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the full number of the identity card or passport of the director or reserve director.

subsection.content: Subsection (4) does not affect the inclusion in the index of a correspondence address of the director or reserve director, nor does it affect the inspection of the correspondence address under subsection (3), even if the correspondence address is the same as the usual residential address of the director or reserve director.

section.name: s648
section.heading: Register of company secretaries

subsection.content: A company must keep in the English or Chinese language a register of company secretaries.

A company must enter in the register of company secretaries the required particulars specified in section 650 of a person who is, or persons who are the company secretary or joint company secretaries of the company.

subsection.leadIn: A company must keep the register of company secretaries at—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the company’s registered office; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a prescribed place.

subsection.content: A company must notify the Registrar of the place at which the register of company secretaries is kept. The notice must be in the specified form and delivered to the Registrar for registration within 15 days after the register is first kept at that place.

A company must notify the Registrar of any change (other than a change of the address of the company’s registered office) in the place at which the register of company secretaries is kept. The notice must be in the specified form and delivered to the Registrar for registration within 15 days after the change.

subsection.leadIn: Subsection (4) does not require a company to notify the Registrar of the place at which the register of company secretaries is kept—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if, in the case of a register that came into existence on or after the commencement date# of this section, it has at all times been kept at the company’s registered office; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: if—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: immediately before that commencement date#, the company kept a register for the purposes of section 158 of the predecessor Ordinance; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: on and after that commencement date#, that register, in so far as it relates to the company secretary or joint company secretaries of the company, is kept as a register of company secretaries for the purposes of subsection (1) at the place at which it was kept immediately before that commencement date#.

subsection.content: If a company contravenes subsection (1), (2), (3), (4) or (5), the company, and every responsible person of the company, commit an offence, and each is liable to a fine at level 4 and, in the case of a continuing offence, to a further fine of $700 for each day during which the offence continues.

section.name: s649
section.heading: Right to inspect and request copy

subsection.content: A member of a company is entitled, on request made in the prescribed manner and without charge, to inspect the register of company secretaries of the company in accordance with regulations made under section 657.
Any other person is entitled, on request made in the prescribed manner and on payment of the prescribed fee, to inspect the register in accordance with regulations made under section 657.
A person is entitled, on request and on payment of a prescribed fee, to be provided with a copy of the register, or any part of it, in accordance with regulations made under section 657.

section.name: s650
section.heading: Particulars of company secretaries to be registered

subsection.leadIn: The register of company secretaries of a company must contain the following particulars with respect to the company secretary or, if there are joint company secretaries, with respect to each of them—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: if the company secretary is a natural person—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the present forename and surname, former forename or surname (if any), and aliases (if any);

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the correspondence address; and

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: the number of the identity card or, if the company secretary does not have an identity card, the number and issuing country of any passport held by the company secretary; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the company secretary is a body corporate, the corporate name and the address of its registered or principal office.

subsection.content: If all the partners in a firm are joint company secretaries of a company, the name and principal office of the firm may be stated instead of the particulars mentioned in subsection (1)(a) or (b).

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: forename (名字) includes a Christian or given name;
surname (姓氏), for a person usually known by a title different from the person’s surname, means that title.

subsection.content: For the purposes of subsection (1)(a)(ii), a correspondence address must be a place in Hong Kong and must not be a post office box number.

subsection.leadIn: In this section, a reference to a former forename or surname does not include—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: in relation to a person—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: a forename or surname that was changed or ceased to be used before the person attained the age of 18 years; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: a forename or surname that has been changed or ceased to be used for a period of at least 20 years;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in relation to a person usually known by a title different from the person’s surname, the name by which the person was known before the adoption of or succession to the title; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: in relation to a married woman, a name or surname by which she was known before her marriage.

subsection.content: The Financial Secretary may, by notice published in the Gazette, amend subsection (1), (2), (3), (4) or (5).

section.name: s651
section.heading: Protection of identification number from inspection

subsection.content: Despite section 649(1), (2) and (3), a company may withhold the number of the identity card or passport of a company secretary contained in its register of company secretaries from a person who inspects the register or requests for a copy of it or any part of it.
A company may only exercise the power under subsection (1) in the prescribed manner and to the prescribed extent.

section.name: s652
section.heading: Duty to notify Registrar of appointment and change

subsection.content: If a person or persons are appointed as company secretary or joint company secretaries of a company otherwise than under section 474(2), (2A), (3) or (3A), the company must, within 15 days after the appointment, deliver to the Registrar for registration a notice in the specified form containing the company secretary’s or joint company secretaries’ particulars specified in its register of company secretaries. (Amended 14 of 2025 s. 50)

subsection.leadIn: If a person ceases to be a company secretary of the company or there is any change in the particulars contained in the register of company secretaries of a company, the company must, within 15 days after the cessation or change, deliver to the Registrar for registration a notice in the specified form containing—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the particulars of the cessation or change and the date on which it occurred; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any other particulars that are specified in the form.

subsection.content: If a company contravenes subsection (1) or (2), the company, and every responsible person of the company, commit an offence, and each is liable to a fine at level 4 and, in the case of a continuing offence, to a further fine of $700 for each day during which the offence continues.

section.name: s653
section.heading: Duty of company secretary to make disclosure

subsection.content: A company secretary of a company must give notice to the company of matters relating to the company secretary that are required for the purposes of sections 650 and 652.
A person who contravenes subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable to a fine at level 4.

section.name: s653A
section.heading: Interpretation
section.leadIn: In this Division—
section.def: applicable company (適用公司) means a company other than—(a)a listed company; or(b)a company that falls within a type of company, or class of companies, exempted by regulations made under section 653ZG(1)(a);
commencement date (生效日期) means the date of commencement of this Division;
existing company (原有公司) means a company that came into existence before the commencement date;
function (職能) includes a power and a duty;
law enforcement officer (執法人員)—see section 653B;
legal entity (法律實體)—(a)means a body of persons, corporate or unincorporate, that is a legal person under the law that governs it; but(b)does not include a specified entity;
prescribed (訂明) means prescribed by regulations made under section 657;
registrable change (須登記更改)—see section 653F;
registrable legal entity (須登記法律實體)—see section 653D;
registrable person (須登記人士)—see section 653C;
related person (有關連人士)—see section 653G;
required particulars (所需詳情) means the particulars prescribed in Schedule 5B;
significant control (重大控制權)—see section 653E;
significant controller (重要控制人) means—(a)a registrable person of an applicable company; or(b)a registrable legal entity of an applicable company;

specified function (指明職能), in relation to a law enforcement officer, means a function of the officer under the law of Hong Kong that is a function relating to the prevention, detection or investigation of money laundering, or terrorist financing, as defined by section 1 of Part 1 of Schedule 1 to the Anti-Money Laundering and Counter-Terrorist Financing Ordinance (Cap. 615).

section.name: s653B
section.heading: Law enforcement officer

subsection.leadIn: Each of the following is a law enforcement officer for the purposes of this Division—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an officer of the Companies Registry;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an officer of the Customs and Excise Department;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: an officer of the Hong Kong Monetary Authority;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: an officer of the Hong Kong Police Force;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: an officer of the Immigration Department;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: an officer of the Inland Revenue Department;

paragraph.name: g
h

paragraph.content: an officer of the Securities and Futures Commission referred to in section 3(1) of the Securities and Futures Ordinance (Cap. 571);

paragraph.name: j
paragraph.content: an officer of any department or agency of the Government, or of any statutory body, that is specified by the Financial Secretary by regulations made under section 653ZG(1)(b) for the purposes of this paragraph.

subsection.leadIn: In subsection (1)—
subsection.def: statutory body (法定團體) means a body established or constituted by or under the authority of an Ordinance.

section.name: s653C
section.heading: Registrable person

subsection.content: If a natural person or specified entity has significant control over an applicable company, the person or entity is a registrable person of the company.

Despite subsection (1), a natural person or specified entity that has significant control over an applicable company is not a registrable person of the company if the condition specified in subsection (3) is satisfied.

subsection.leadIn: The condition is that the natural person or specified entity has significant control over the company only because—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the person or entity holds or has rights or shares in the company through a registrable legal entity of the company (entity A), and entity A has any of its shares listed on a recognized stock market; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the person or entity holds or has rights or shares in the company through a chain of legal entities with the last one in the chain being a registrable legal entity of the company (entity B), and entity B has any of its shares listed on a recognized stock market.

statutoryNote.heading: Note—
statutoryNote.content: See also section 653E and Schedule 5A which provide for the criteria for determining whether a person has significant control over an applicable company.

section.name: s653D
section.heading: Registrable legal entity
section.leadIn: A legal entity is a registrable legal entity of an applicable company if the entity—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is a member of the company; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: has significant control over the company.

statutoryNote.heading: Note—
statutoryNote.content: See also section 653E and Schedule 5A which provide for the criteria for determining whether a person has significant control over an applicable company.

section.name: s653E
section.heading: How to determine whether person has significant control over applicable company
section.content: A person has significant control over an applicable company if the person meets one or more of the conditions specified in Part 1 of Schedule 5A in relation to the company.

section.name: s653F
section.heading: Registrable change
section.leadIn: There is a registrable change with respect to a person if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the person ceases to be a significant controller of an applicable company; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any other change results in any particulars entered in the company’s significant controllers register for the person being incorrect or incomplete.

section.name: s653G
section.heading: Related person

subsection.leadIn: This section applies if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a provision of this Division provides that if a requirement of a notice given to a legal entity is not complied with (failure), a related person of the entity commits an offence; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a provision in the regulations made under section 653ZG provides that a related person of a legal entity commits an offence if a provision is contravened (contravention).

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of the provision, a person is a related person of a legal entity that is a body corporate (entity A) if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the person is an officer or shadow director of entity A; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the person authorizes or permits, or participates in, the failure or contravention.

subsection.leadIn: A person is also a related person of entity A if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the person is an officer or shadow director of another body corporate that is an officer or shadow director of entity A;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the other body corporate authorizes or permits, or participates in, the failure or contravention; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the person authorizes or permits, or participates in, the failure or contravention.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of the provision, a person is a related person of a legal entity other than a body corporate (entity B) if—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: the person authorizes or permits, or participates in, the failure or contravention.

subsection.leadIn: A person is also a related person of entity B if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the person is an officer or shadow director of a body corporate;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the body corporate is a similar officer of entity B and authorizes or permits, or participates in, the failure or contravention; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the person authorizes or permits, or participates in, the failure or contravention.

section.name: s653H
section.heading: Keeping of register

subsection.content: Each applicable company must keep a register of its significant controllers.
Subsection (1) applies to an applicable company even if the company does not have a significant controller.

subsection.leadIn: The significant controllers register of an applicable company must be kept in the English or Chinese language.

subsection.content: If subsection (1) or (3) is contravened, the company, and every responsible person of the company, commit an offence, and each is liable to a fine at level 4 and, in the case of a continuing offence, to a further fine of $700 for each day during which the offence continues.

section.name: s653I
section.heading: Contents of register

subsection.leadIn: The significant controllers register of an applicable company must contain the following particulars of each person that the company knows to be a significant controller of the company—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the particulars prescribed in Schedule 5B that are applicable to the person; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: for a registrable change with respect to the person—

subparagraph.content: details of the change; and
the date on which the change occurs.

subsection.leadIn: The register must also contain—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the name and contact details of at least one person designated by the company under section 653ZC; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: all the additional matters required to be noted in the register under Schedule 5C in relation to the company.

subsection.content: If subsection (1)(a) or (b) or (2)(a) or (b) is contravened, the company, and every responsible person of the company, commit an offence, and each is liable to a fine at level 4 and, in the case of a continuing offence, to a further fine of $700 for each day during which the offence continues.
To avoid doubt, section 634 does not affect what may be contained or entered in the significant controllers register of an applicable company.

section.name: s653J
section.heading: Entering of particulars in register—registrable person

subsection.leadIn: The particulars required under section 653I(1)(a) to be contained in the significant controllers register of an applicable company for a natural person or specified entity—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: must not be entered in the register unless they are all confirmed by the person or entity; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: must be entered in the register within 7 days after they have all been so confirmed.

subsection.leadIn: The particulars required under section 653I(1)(b) to be contained in the significant controllers register of an applicable company for a registrable change with respect to a natural person or specified entity—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: must not be entered in the register unless they are all confirmed by the person or entity; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: must be entered in the register within 7 days after they have all been so confirmed.

subsection.content: If subsection (1)(a) or (b) or (2)(a) or (b) is contravened, the company, and every responsible person of the company, commit an offence, and each is liable to a fine at level 4 and, in the case of a continuing offence, to a further fine of $700 for each day during which the offence continues.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of this section, a particular of a natural person or specified entity is or has been confirmed by that person or entity only if the particular is or has been—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: provided or confirmed by that person or entity; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: provided or confirmed by another person with that natural person’s or specified entity’s knowledge.

section.name: s653K
section.heading: Entering of particulars in register—registrable legal entity

subsection.content: A particular required under section 653I(1) to be contained in the significant controllers register of an applicable company for a legal entity must be entered in the register within 7 days after the particular comes to the notice of the company.

If subsection (1) is contravened, the company, and every responsible person of the company, commit an offence, and each is liable to a fine at level 4 and, in the case of a continuing offence, to a further fine of $700 for each day during which the offence continues.

section.name: s653L
section.heading: When may entries in register be destroyed
section.leadIn: If a person ceases to be a significant controller of an applicable company, all the entries in the company’s significant controllers register relating to the person may be destroyed—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: for a natural person or specified entity—after the end of a period of 6 years from the date on which the person or entity ceased to be the company’s registrable person; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: for a legal entity—after the end of a period of 6 years from the date on which the entity ceased to be the company’s registrable legal entity.

section.name: s653M
section.heading: Place at which register must be kept

subsection.leadIn: An applicable company must keep its significant controllers register at—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the company’s registered office; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a prescribed place.

subsection.content: The company must notify the Registrar in accordance with subsection (3) of the place at which its significant controllers register is kept.

subsection.leadIn: The notice—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: must be in the specified form; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: must be delivered to the Registrar for registration within 15 days after the register is first kept at that place.

subsection.content: An applicable company is not required to comply with subsection (2) if, since its significant controllers register came into existence, the register has at all times been kept at the company’s registered office.

subsection.leadIn: Without affecting subsection (4), an existing company is not required to comply with subsection (2) if—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: since the company’s significant controllers register came into existence, the register has also at all times been kept at that place; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: immediately before the commencement date, the company has delivered to the Registrar every notice that is required under section 628 in respect of its register of members.

subsection.content: If subsection (1) or (2) is contravened, the company, and every responsible person of the company, commit an offence, and each is liable to a fine at level 4 and, in the case of a continuing offence, to a further fine of $700 for each day during which the offence continues.

section.name: s653N
section.heading: Change in place at which register is kept

subsection.content: An applicable company must notify the Registrar in accordance with subsection (2) of a change in the place at which its significant controllers register is kept.

subsection.leadIn: The notice—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: must be in the specified form; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: must be delivered to the Registrar for registration within 15 days after the change.

subsection.leadIn: An applicable company is not required to comply with subsection (1) in relation to a change mentioned in that subsection if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: its significant controllers register is kept at the company’s registered office; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the change is due to a change of the registered office’s address.

subsection.content: If subsection (1) is contravened, the company, and every responsible person of the company, commit an offence, and each is liable to a fine at level 4 and, in the case of a continuing offence, to a further fine of $700 for each day during which the offence continues.

subdivision.name: SD3
subdivision.heading: Investigation and Obtaining Information by Applicable Company

section.name: s653O
section.heading: Interpretation

subsection.leadIn: In this Subdivision—
subsection.def: specified particulars (指明詳情), in relation to a person—(a)means the particulars of the person falling within a description of the particulars prescribed in Schedule 5B; but(b)if the person is a natural person, does not include—(i)the number of an identity card of the person; and(ii)the number and issuing country of a passport held by the person.

subsection.content: In sections 653P, 653Q and 653R, a reference to knowing the identity of a person includes knowing any information from which the person can be identified.

section.name: s653P
section.heading: Company’s duty to investigate and obtain information

subsection.leadIn: An applicable company must take reasonable steps—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to ascertain whether there is any significant controller of the company; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if any, to identify each of them.

subsection.leadIn: Without limiting subsection (1), if the company knows, or has reasonable cause to believe, that a person is a significant controller of the company, the company must give a notice, in accordance with section 653Q, to the person within 7 days after the first of the following to happen—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the company first knows that the person is a significant controller of the company;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the company first has reasonable cause to believe that the person is such a controller.

subsection.leadIn: Without limiting subsection (1), if the company knows, or has reasonable cause to believe, that a particular person knows the identity of another person who is a significant controller of the company, the company must give a notice, in accordance with section 653R, to the particular person within 7 days after the first of the following to happen—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the company first knows that the particular person knows the identity of another person who is a significant controller of the company;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the company first has reasonable cause to believe that the particular person knows the identity of another person who is such a controller.

subsection.content: If subsection (1), (2) or (3) is contravened, the company, and every responsible person of the company, commit an offence, and each is liable to a fine at level 4.

statutoryNote.heading: Note—
statutoryNote.content: See also section 653S which provides for the circumstances under which an applicable company is not required to comply with this section.

section.name: s653Q
section.heading: Notice under section 653P(2)

subsection.leadIn: A notice given under section 653P(2) by an applicable company must be in writing and must require the addressee of the notice to confirm, as the case requires—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: whether or not the addressee is a registrable person of the company; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: whether or not the addressee is a registrable legal entity of the company.

subsection.leadIn: The notice must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: state that if the addressee confirms that the addressee is a registrable person or registrable legal entity of the company, the addressee is required to—

subparagraph.content: confirm or correct the required particulars of the addressee that are included in the notice; and
provide any required particulars of the addressee that are missing from the notice; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: require the addressee to—

subparagraph.content: state whether or not the addressee knows the identity of another person who is a significant controller of the company; and

subparagraph.leadIn: if the addressee knows the identity of such a person—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: provide to the company all the specified particulars of that person that are known to the addressee; and

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: state whether or not the particulars are provided with that person’s knowledge.

subsection.content: The notice must also state that the addressee must comply with the requirements made under this section within 1 month from the date of the notice.

section.name: s653R
section.heading: Notice under section 653P(3)

subsection.leadIn: A notice given under section 653P(3) by an applicable company must be in writing and must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: require the addressee of the notice to confirm whether or not the addressee knows the identity of another person who is a significant controller of the company; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: state that if the addressee confirms that the addressee knows the identity of such a person, the addressee is required to—

subparagraph.content: provide to the company all the specified particulars of that person that are known to the addressee; and
state whether or not the particulars are provided with that person’s knowledge.

subsection.content: The notice must also state that the addressee must comply with the requirements made under this section within 1 month from the date of the notice.

section.name: s653S
section.heading: Circumstances where notice under section 653P not required
section.leadIn: An applicable company is not required to comply with section 653P with respect to a significant controller of the company if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: for a registrable person of the company—

subparagraph.content: the company has already been informed of the person’s status as such; and
all the required particulars of the person have been provided to the company by the person or with the person’s knowledge; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: for a registrable legal entity of the company—

subparagraph.content: the company has already been informed of the entity’s status as such; and
all the required particulars of the entity have been provided to the company.

subdivision.name: SD4
subdivision.heading: Applicable Company to Keep Information Up-to-date

section.name: s653T
section.heading: Company’s duty to keep information up-to-date

subsection.content: This section applies to an applicable company if the company knows, or has reasonable cause to believe, that there is a registrable change with respect to a person, the details of which are required to be contained in the significant controllers register of the company.

subsection.leadIn: The company must give a notice, in accordance with section 653U, to the person to whom the registrable change relates within 7 days after the first of the following to happen—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the registrable change first comes to the notice of the company;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the company first has reasonable cause to believe that the change has occurred.

subsection.content: If subsection (2) is contravened, the company, and every responsible person of the company, commit an offence, and each is liable to a fine at level 4.

statutoryNote.heading: Note—
statutoryNote.content: See also section 653V which provides for the circumstances under which an applicable company is not required to comply with this section.

section.name: s653U
section.heading: Notice under section 653T

subsection.leadIn: A notice given under section 653T by an applicable company must be in writing and must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: require the addressee of the notice to confirm whether or not there is a registrable change with respect to the addressee; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: state that if the addressee confirms that there is such a change, the addressee is required to—

subparagraph.content: inform the company of the date on which the change occurs;

subparagraph.leadIn: confirm or correct any particulars—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: that are required to be contained in the significant controllers register of the company for the addressee; and

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: that are included in the notice; and

subparagraph.leadIn: provide any particulars—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: that are required to be contained in the register for the addressee; and

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: that are missing from the notice.

subsection.content: The notice must also state that the addressee must comply with the requirements made under this section within 1 month from the date of the notice.

section.name: s653V
section.heading: Circumstances where notice under section 653T not required

subsection.leadIn: An applicable company is not required to comply with section 653T in relation to a registrable change with respect to a natural person or specified entity if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the company has already been informed of the change; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the information has been provided to the company by the person or entity, or with the person’s or entity’s knowledge.

subsection.content: An applicable company is not required to comply with section 653T in relation to a registrable change with respect to a legal entity if the company has already been informed of the change.

section.name: s653W
section.heading: Right to inspect and request copy of register

subsection.content: A person whose name is entered in the significant controllers register of an applicable company as a significant controller of the company is entitled, on request made in the prescribed manner and without charge, to inspect the register in accordance with regulations made under section 657.

A person mentioned in subsection (1) is entitled, on request and on payment of a prescribed fee, to be provided with a copy of the register, or a part of it, in accordance with regulations made under section 657.

statutoryNote.heading: Note—
statutoryNote.content: For the duties of a company regarding the inspection and provision of copies of its company records, and the power of the Court to make an order relating to the inspection and provision of copies of such records—see regulations made under section 657.

section.name: s653X
section.heading: Register be available for inspection etc. by law enforcement officer

subsection.leadIn: An applicable company must, on demand made by an officer of the Companies Registry for the purpose of ascertaining whether this Division is or has been complied with, or on demand made by any other law enforcement officer for the purpose of the officer’s performance under the law of Hong Kong of a specified function, act as follows—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: permit the officer to make a copy of the register, or a part of it, in the course of inspection.

subsection.content: If subsection (1)(a) or (b) is contravened, the company, and every responsible person of the company, commit an offence, and each is liable to a fine at level 4.

section.name: s653Y
section.heading: Court order relating to inspection of register

subsection.leadIn: This section applies if section 653X(1)(a) is contravened in relation to a demand made by a law enforcement officer under section 653X(1).

subsection.content: The Court may, on application by the law enforcement officer, order the applicable company concerned to permit the officer to inspect the company’s significant controllers register.

subsection.leadIn: An order made under subsection (2) may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: direct the company to permit the officer to inspect the register—

subparagraph.content: immediately after the order is made; or
from the time specified in the order; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: specify the duration and manner of the inspection.

subsection.leadIn: Subsection (5) applies if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the register is kept at the office of a person other than the company; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: section 653X(1)(a) is contravened because of a default of the person.

subsection.content: The power of the Court under subsection (2) extends to the making of an order against the person mentioned in subsection (4) and the person’s officers and employees.

section.name: s653Z
section.heading: Court order relating to making copy of register

subsection.content: This section applies if section 653X(1)(b) is contravened in relation to a demand made by a law enforcement officer under section 653X(1).

The Court may, on application by the law enforcement officer, order the applicable company concerned to permit the officer to make a copy of the company’s significant controllers register, or a part of it, in the course of inspection.

An order made under subsection (2) may also specify the time, duration and manner of inspection, including the circumstances in which and the extent to which the copying of information is permitted in the course of inspection.

subsection.leadIn: Subsection (5) applies if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the register is kept at the office of a person other than the company; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: section 653X(1)(b) is contravened because of a default of the person.

subsection.content: The power of the Court under subsection (2) extends to the making of an order against the person mentioned in subsection (4) and the person’s officers and employees.

section.name: s653ZA
section.heading: Addressee of notice to comply with requirements made under section 653Q, 653R or 653U

subsection.content: If a requirement made under section 653Q, 653R or 653U is not complied with within 1 month from the date of the notice concerned, the addressee of the notice, and (if the addressee is a legal entity) every related person of the entity, commit an offence, and each is liable to a fine at level 4.
If a person is charged with an offence under subsection (1), it is a defence for the person to prove that the requirement was frivolous or vexatious.

section.name: s653ZB
section.heading: Legal professional privilege
section.content: In complying with a notice given under this Division by an applicable company, a person is not required to provide any information to the company that the person would on grounds of legal professional privilege be entitled to refuse to give or provide in legal proceedings.

section.name: s653ZC
section.heading: Designated representative

subsection.leadIn: An applicable company must designate at least one person as its representative to provide the following assistance relating to the significant controllers register of the company—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: assistance to an officer of the Companies Registry to facilitate ascertaining whether this Division is or has been complied with;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: assistance to any other law enforcement officer to facilitate the officer’s performance under the law of Hong Kong of a specified function.

subsection.leadIn: The company must not designate a person under subsection (1) unless—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: the person—

subparagraph.content: is a natural person resident in Hong Kong; and
is a director, employee or member of the company; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the person is an accounting professional, a legal professional, or a TCSP licensee, as defined by section 1 of Part 2 of Schedule 1 to the Anti-Money Laundering and Counter-Terrorist Financing Ordinance (Cap. 615).

section.name: s653ZD
section.heading: Power of Court to order rectification of register

subsection.leadIn: An interested party may apply to the Court to rectify the significant controllers register of an applicable company if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the name of a person is, without sufficient cause, entered in or omitted from the register; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a default is made or an unnecessary delay takes place in entering in the register the fact that a person has ceased to be a significant controller of the company.

subsection.leadIn: If an application is made under subsection (1), the Court may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: refuse the application; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: order that the register be rectified.

subsection.content: A rectification order may include an order for the company to pay any damages sustained by an aggrieved party.

subsection.leadIn: On an application made under subsection (1), the Court—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: may decide whether the name of a person who is a party to the application should be entered in or omitted from the register; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: generally may decide any question considered necessary or expedient to rectify the register.

subsection.leadIn: In subsection (1)—
subsection.def: interested party (有利害關係的一方), in relation to a matter mentioned in subsection (1), means—(a)a person aggrieved by the matter;(b)a significant controller of the company; or(c)the company.

section.name: s653ZE
section.heading: Offence for false information

subsection.content: A person commits an offence if the person, in purported compliance with a notice given under this Division, knowingly or recklessly makes a statement or provides any information that is misleading, false or deceptive in a material particular.

subsection.leadIn: A person who commits an offence under subsection (1) is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on conviction on indictment to a fine of $300,000 and to imprisonment for 2 years; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on summary conviction to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

section.name: s653ZF
section.heading: Applicable company not to be affected with notice of certain rights or put on enquiry as to certain rights
section.leadIn: An applicable company—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: is not, because of anything done under this Division, affected with notice of—

subparagraph.content: the rights of a person in relation to any shares in the company; or
other rights of a person in or with respect to the company; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: is not, because of anything done under this Division, put on enquiry as to those rights of a person.

section.name: s653ZG
section.heading: Financial Secretary may make regulations

subsection.leadIn: Without affecting section 657, the Financial Secretary may make regulations—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to exempt a type of company, or class of companies, from this Division or a provision of this Division;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to specify any department or agency of the Government, and any statutory body, for the purposes of section 653B(1)(j);

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: to provide for matters relating to a notice given under this Division by an applicable company, including providing for—

subparagraph.content: the form and content of the notice; and
the way in which it is to be given; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: to provide for incidental or supplementary matters relating to keeping a significant controllers register of an applicable company.

subsection.leadIn: Regulations made under subsection (1) may provide that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: if a company contravenes any of the regulations made under that subsection, an offence is committed by—

subparagraph.content: the company; and
every responsible person of the company;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: if a legal entity contravenes any of the regulations made under that subsection, an offence is committed by—

subparagraph.content: the entity; and
every related person of the entity; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a person who commits an offence mentioned in paragraph (a) or (b) is liable to a fine not exceeding level 5 and, in the case of a continuing offence, to a further fine not exceeding $1,000 for each day during which the offence continues.

statutoryNote.heading: Note—
statutoryNote.content: See also section 910 which provides for supplementary provisions for regulations made under this Ordinance.

section.name: s653ZH
section.heading: Transitional provision for section 653J
section.content: For the purposes of section 653J(1), in relation to an existing company, a particular is confirmed only if the particular is confirmed on or after the commencement date.

section.name: s653ZI
section.heading: Transitional provision for section 653K
section.content: For the purposes of section 653K, in determining the time at which a particular comes to the notice of an existing company, any knowledge of the particular that the company had before the commencement date is not to be taken into account.

section.name: s653ZJ
section.heading: Transitional provisions for section 653P

subsection.content: For the purposes of section 653P(2), if, on the commencement date, an existing company knows, or has reasonable cause to believe, that a person is a significant controller of the company, the company must give the notice required under that section within 7 days after the commencement date.

For the purposes of section 653P(3), if, on the commencement date, an existing company knows, or has reasonable cause to believe, that a person knows the identity of another person who is a significant controller of the company, the company must give the notice required under that section within 7 days after the commencement date.

section.name: s653ZK
section.heading: Transitional provision for section 653S
section.content: For the purposes of section 653S, in relation to an existing company, a particular has been provided only if the particular has been provided on or after the commencement date.

section.name: s654
section.heading: Meaning of company records
section.leadIn: In this Division—
section.def: company records (公司紀錄) means any register, index, agreement, memorandum, minutes or other document required by this Ordinance to be kept by a company, but does not include accounting records.

section.name: s655
section.heading: Form of company records

subsection.content: A company must adequately record for future reference the information required to be contained in any company records.

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (1), company records may be—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: kept in hard copy form or in electronic form; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: arranged in the manner that the directors of the company think fit.

subsection.content: If the records are kept in electronic form, the company must ensure that they are capable of being reproduced in hard copy form.

subsection.leadIn: If any company records required by this Ordinance to be kept by a company are kept by the company by recording the information in question in electronic form, any duty imposed on the company under this Ordinance to allow inspection of the company records is to be regarded as a duty to allow inspection of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a reproduction of the recording, or the relevant part of the recording, in hard copy form; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if requested by the person inspecting the recording, the recording, or the relevant part of the recording, by electronic means.
