subsection.content: If a company contravenes subsection (1), the company, and every responsible person of the company, commit an offence, and each is liable to a fine at level 3 and, in the case of a continuing offence, to a further fine of $300 for each day during which the offence continues.
If a company contravenes subsection (3), the company, and every responsible person of the company, commit an offence, and each is liable to a fine at level 3.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: in electronic form (電子形式) means in the form of an electronic record;
in hard copy form (印本形式) means in a paper form or similar form capable of being read.

section.name: s656
section.heading: Duty to take precautions against falsification

subsection.leadIn: If company records are kept otherwise than by making entries in a bound book, a company—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: must take adequate precautions to guard against falsification; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: must take adequate steps to facilitate the discovery of the falsification.

subsection.content: If a company contravenes subsection (1), the company, and every responsible person of the company, commit an offence, and each is liable to a fine at level 3.

section.name: s657
section.heading: Regulations about keeping and inspection of company records and provision of copies

subsection.leadIn: The Financial Secretary may make regulations to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: provide for the obligations of a company that is required by any provision of this Ordinance—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: to keep any company records;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: to make available for inspection any company records; or

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: to provide copies of any company records or trust deeds;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: prescribe the fees payable in respect of company records or trust deeds; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: prescribe any other thing that is required or permitted to be prescribed under this Ordinance in respect of company records or trust deeds.

subsection.leadIn: The regulations may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: prescribe places other than a company’s registered office at which company records are required to be kept;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: prescribe the manner in which a request for inspection is to be made;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: require a company to inform a person of the most recent date on which alterations were made to a register or an index;

paragraph.name: d
e
f
paragraph.content: make provision as to the time within which a copy of company records, or a copy of a trust deed, must be provided; and

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: prescribe the manner in which and the extent to which a company may exercise the power under section 644 or 651.

subsection.leadIn: Regulations made under subsection (2)(a) may, in relation to a provision of this Ordinance requiring a company to keep any company records—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: prescribe a place—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: by reference to the company’s principal place of business or the place at which the company keeps any other records; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: in any other way;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: provide that that provision is not complied with by keeping company records at a place prescribed in the regulations unless conditions prescribed in the regulations are met; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: prescribe more than one place in relation to that provision.

subsection.leadIn: Regulations made under subsection (1), (2) or (3) may provide that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: if a company contravenes any of the regulations made under subsection (1), (2) or (3), an offence is committed by—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the company; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: every responsible person of the company;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a person who commits an offence mentioned in paragraph (a) is liable to a fine not exceeding level 5 and, in the case of a continuing offence, to a further fine not exceeding $1,000 for each day during which the offence continues;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: the Court may—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: by order compel an immediate inspection of company records;

subparagraph.name: ii
iii
subparagraph.content: make any order as to the time, duration and manner of inspection, including the circumstances in which and the extent to which the copying of information is permitted in the course of inspection; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: if company records or a trust deed is kept at the office of a person other than the company concerned, an order mentioned in paragraph (c) may be made against that other person and that other person’s officers and other employees (if any).

subsection.leadIn: Nothing in any provision of this Ordinance or in the regulations made under this section is to be construed as preventing a company—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: from providing more extensive facilities than are required by the regulations; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if a fee may be charged, from charging a lesser fee than that prescribed or none at all.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: trust deed (信託契據) means a trust deed or any other document securing the issue of debentures.

division.name: D4
division.heading: Registered Office and Publication of Company Names

section.name: s658
section.heading: Registered office of company

subsection.content: A company must have a registered office in Hong Kong to which all communications and notices may be addressed.

For a company formed and registered under this Ordinance, the intended address of the registered office stated in the incorporation form registered in respect of the company is to be regarded as the address of its registered office with effect from the date of its incorporation until a notice of change in respect of the address is delivered to the Registrar under subsection (3). (Amended 14 of 2025 s. 51)

subsection.name: 2A
subsection.content: For a re-domiciled company, the intended address of the registered office stated in the re-domiciliation form registered under section 820C(5) is to be regarded as its registered office with effect from the re-domiciliation date until a notice of change in respect of the address is delivered to the Registrar under subsection (3). (Added 14 of 2025 s. 51)
If the address of a company’s registered office is changed, the company must deliver to the Registrar for registration a notice of the change in the specified form within 15 days after the change.
The inclusion in the annual return of a company of a statement as to the address of its registered office does not satisfy the obligation imposed by subsection (3).

If a company contravenes subsection (1) or (3), the company, and every responsible person of the company, commit an offence, and each is liable to a fine at level 5 and, in the case of a continuing offence, to a further fine of $1,000 for each day during which the offence continues.

section.name: s659
section.heading: Requirement to disclose company name, etc.

subsection.leadIn: The Financial Secretary may make regulations to require companies—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to display prescribed information in prescribed locations;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to state prescribed information in common seals, and in prescribed descriptions of documents or communications; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: to provide prescribed information on request to those they deal with in the course of their business.

subsection.leadIn: The regulations—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: may in prescribed circumstances require disclosure of the name of the company;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: may make provision as to the manner in which any prescribed information is to be displayed, stated or provided; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: may exempt a company from any requirement of the regulations made under subsection (1).

subsection.content: The regulations may provide that, for the purposes of any requirement to disclose a company’s name, any variation between a word or words required to be part of the name and a permitted abbreviation of that word or those words (or vice versa) is to be disregarded.

section.name: s660
section.heading: Criminal consequences of failure to make required disclosures
section.leadIn: Regulations made under section 659 may provide that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: if a company contravenes any of the regulations made under that section, an offence is committed by—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the company; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: every responsible person of the company;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if any person who is acting on behalf of the company contravenes any of the regulations made under that section, an offence is committed by that person; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a person who commits an offence mentioned in paragraph (a) or (b) is liable to a fine not exceeding level 3.

section.name: s661
section.heading: Civil consequence of failure to make required disclosures
section.content: If an officer of a company or a person on its behalf signs or authorizes to be signed on behalf of the company, any bill of exchange, promissory note, endorsement, cheque or order for money or goods in which the company’s name is not mentioned in the manner as required by regulations made under section 659, that officer or person is personally liable to the holder of the bill of exchange, promissory note, cheque or order for money or goods for the amount of it (unless it is duly paid by the company).

section.name: s662
section.heading: Requirement to deliver annual return

subsection.content: A private company that is not a re-domiciled company must, in respect of every year (except the year of its incorporation), deliver to the Registrar for registration an annual return specified in subsection (5) within 42 days after the company’s return date. (Amended 14 of 2025 s. 52)
The company’s return date mentioned in subsection (1) is, in respect of a particular year, the anniversary of the date of the company’s incorporation in that year.

subsection.name: 2A
subsection.content: A private company that is a re-domiciled company must, in respect of every year (other than the year in which the certificate of re-domiciliation is issued), deliver to the Registrar for registration an annual return specified in subsection (5) within 42 days after the company’s return date. (Added 14 of 2025 s. 52)

subsection.name: 2B
subsection.content: For the purposes of subsection (2A), the company’s return date in respect of a particular year is the anniversary of the company’s re-domiciliation date in that particular year. (Added 14 of 2025 s. 52)

A public company or a company limited by guarantee must in respect of every financial year deliver to the Registrar for registration an annual return specified in subsection (5) within 42 days after the company’s return date.

subsection.leadIn: The company’s return date mentioned in subsection (3) is, in respect of a particular financial year—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if the company is a public company, the date that is 6 months after the end of its accounting reference period; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the company is a company limited by guarantee, the date that is 9 months after the end of its accounting reference period.

subsection.content: An annual return under this section must comply with the requirements under section 664.

If a company contravenes subsection (1), (2A) or (3), the company, and every responsible person of the company, commit an offence, and each is liable to a fine at level 5 and, in the case of a continuing offence, to a further fine of $1,000 for each day during which the offence continues. (Amended 14 of 2025 s. 52)

If a person is convicted of an offence under subsection (6), the magistrate may, in addition to any penalty that may be imposed, order that the person must, within a time specified in the order, do the act that the person has failed to do.

A person who contravenes an order under subsection (7) commits an offence and is liable to a fine at level 5 and, in the case of a continuing offence, to a further fine of $1,000 for each day during which the offence continues.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: accounting reference period (會計參照期) has the meaning given by section 368.

section.name: s663
section.heading: Exemption of dormant company from requirement to deliver annual return

subsection.content: Section 662 does not apply to a company that is a dormant company under section 5(1).
If such a company enters into an accounting transaction, subsection (1) ceases to have effect on and after the date of the accounting transaction.

section.name: s664
section.heading: Contents of annual return

subsection.leadIn: A company’s annual return under section 662 must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: be in the specified form; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: contain, with respect to the company, the particulars specified in the form.

subsection.content: Without limiting section 23, the Registrar may, for the purposes of this section, specify different forms or particulars in relation to different types of companies.

subsection.leadIn: Without limiting subsection (1), an annual return under section 662 must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: contain the information specified in Schedule 6; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: be accompanied by the documents specified in that Schedule.

subsection.leadIn: Despite subsection (3), if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an annual return is required to be delivered by a private company under section 662(1) in respect of a year; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: at any time during the year—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the company registers any transfer of shares in the company in contravention of the restriction imposed by the company’s articles;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the membership of the company exceeds the number specified in section 11(1)(a)(ii); or

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: the company makes an invitation to the public to subscribe for any shares or debentures of the company,

subsection.continued: the annual return must contain the information, and be accompanied by the documents, specified in subsection (5) instead.

subsection.leadIn: The information and documents are—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: information and documents specified for the purposes of a public company in Schedule 6; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: information and documents that relate to the financial year of the company ending on a date within the year in respect of which the annual return is required to be delivered.

subsection.content: The Court may, on the application of the company or a person interested in the matter, order that subsection (4) does not apply to the company.
The Court may make the order on any terms and conditions that the Court thinks just and expedient.

subsection.leadIn: The Court must not make the order unless the Court is satisfied that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the occurrence of the event mentioned in subsection (4)(b)(i), (ii) or (iii) was accidental;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: it was due to inadvertence or to some other sufficient cause that the event occurred; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: it is just and equitable to grant the relief on other grounds.

section.name: s665
section.heading: Construction of reference to annual return
section.content: A reference in this Ordinance to a company’s last annual return, or to an annual return delivered in accordance with section 662, is to be construed as including (so far as necessary to ensure the continuity of the law) a return made up to a date before the commencement date# of that section, or forwarded to the Registrar in accordance with the predecessor Ordinance.

part.name: P13
part.heading: Arrangements, Amalgamation, and Compulsory Share Acquisition in Takeover and Share Buy-back

section.name: s666
section.heading: Interpretation
section.leadIn: In this Part—
section.def: child (子女) includes a step-child, an illegitimate child and a child adopted in any manner recognized by the law of Hong Kong;
cohabitation relationship (同居關係) means a relationship between 2 persons (whether of the same sex or of the opposite sex) who live together as a couple in an intimate relationship;
offer period (要約期), in relation to an offer, means the period within which the offer can be accepted;
repurchasing company (回購公司), in relation to a general offer, means the listed company that makes the offer.

section.name: s667
section.heading: Associate

subsection.leadIn: In this Part, a reference to an associate of an offeror or member, is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: if the offeror or member is a natural person, a reference to—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the offeror’s or member’s spouse;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: a person who is in a cohabitation relationship with the offeror or member;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: a child of the offeror or member;

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.leadIn: a child of a person falling within subparagraph (ii) who—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: is not a child of the offeror or member;

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: lives with the offeror or member; and

subparagraph.name: C
subparagraph.content: has not attained the age of 18;

subparagraph.name: v
subparagraph.content: a parent of the offeror or member;

subparagraph.name: vi
subparagraph.content: a body corporate in which the offeror or member is substantially interested; or

subparagraph.name: vii
subparagraph.content: a person who is a party, or a nominee of a party, to an acquisition agreement with the offeror or member; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: if the offeror or member is a body corporate, a reference to—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: a body corporate in the same group of companies as the offeror or member;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: a body corporate in which the offeror or member is substantially interested; or

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: a person who is a party, or a nominee of a party, to an acquisition agreement with the offeror or member.

subsection.leadIn: In this Part, a reference to an associate of a repurchasing company is a reference to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a body corporate in the same group of companies as the repurchasing company;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a body corporate in which the repurchasing company is substantially interested; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a person who is a party, or a nominee of a party, to an acquisition agreement with the repurchasing company.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsections (1) and (2), an offeror, member or repurchasing company is substantially interested in a body corporate if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the body corporate, or its directors or a majority of its directors, are accustomed to act in accordance with the directions or instructions of the offeror, member or repurchasing company; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the offeror, member or repurchasing company is entitled to exercise, or control the exercise of, more than 30% of the voting power at any general meeting of the body corporate.

subsection.content: In subsection (3), a reference to voting power the exercise of which is controlled by an offeror, member or repurchasing company includes voting power the exercise of which is controlled by another body corporate if the offeror, member or repurchasing company is entitled to exercise, or control the exercise of, more than 50% of the voting power at any general meeting of that other body corporate.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsections (1) and (2), an agreement is an acquisition agreement if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: it is an agreement for the acquisition of—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: any of the shares to which the takeover offer or general offer relates; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: an interest in those shares; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: it includes provisions imposing obligations or restrictions on any of the parties to it with respect to the use, retention or disposal of the party’s interests in the shares acquired pursuant to the agreement.

section.name: s668
section.heading: Interpretation

subsection.leadIn: In this Division—
subsection.def: arrangement (安排) includes a reorganization of the company’s share capital by the consolidation of shares of different classes, or by the division of shares into different classes, or both;
company (公司), except in section 675, means a company liable to be wound up under the Companies (Winding Up and Miscellaneous Provisions) Ordinance (Cap. 32).

subsection.content: In this Division, a reference to a company’s articles, in the case of a company not having articles, is to be read as the instrument constituting or defining the constitution of the company.

section.name: s669
section.heading: Application of Division
section.leadIn: This Division applies if an arrangement or compromise is proposed to be entered into by a company with either or both of the following—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the creditors, or any class of the creditors, of the company;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the members, or any class of the members, of the company.

section.name: s670
section.heading: Court may order meeting of creditors or members to be summoned

subsection.leadIn: The Court may, on application made for the purposes of this subsection—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: order a meeting specified in subsection (2)(a), or a meeting specified in subsection (2)(b), or both (as the case may be) to be summoned in any manner that the Court directs; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: for the purposes of section 674(4), declare a person to be a person specified under that section.

subsection.leadIn: The meeting is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: if the arrangement or compromise is proposed to be entered into—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: with the creditors of the company, a meeting of those creditors; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: with a class of the creditors of the company, a meeting of that class of creditors; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: if the arrangement or compromise is proposed to be entered into—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: with the members of the company, a meeting of those members; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: with a class of the members of the company, a meeting of that class of members.

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (4), an application for the purposes of subsection (1) may be made only by—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the case of a meeting of creditors, the company or any of the creditors;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the case of a meeting of a class of creditors, the company or any creditor of that class;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: in the case of a meeting of members, the company or any of the members; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: in the case of a meeting of a class of members, the company or any member of that class.

subsection.content: If the company is being wound up, an application for the purposes of subsection (1) may be made only by the liquidator or provisional liquidator.
An application for the purposes of subsection (1) must be made in a summary way.

section.name: s671
section.heading: Explanatory statements to be issued or made available to creditors or members

subsection.leadIn: If a meeting is summoned under section 670—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: every notice summoning the meeting that is sent to a creditor or member must be accompanied by an explanatory statement complying with subsections (3) and (4); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: every notice summoning the meeting that is given by advertisement—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: must include an explanatory statement complying with subsections (3) and (4); or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: must state where and how a creditor or member entitled to attend the meeting may obtain a copy of the explanatory statement.

subsection.content: If a notice given by advertisement states that a creditor or member entitled to attend the meeting may obtain a copy of an explanatory statement, the company must provide a copy of the statement, free of charge, to a creditor or member applying in the manner specified in the notice.

subsection.leadIn: An explanatory statement—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: must explain the effect of the arrangement or compromise; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: must state—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: any material interests of the company’s directors, whether as directors or as members or as creditors of the company or otherwise, under the arrangement or compromise; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the effect of the arrangement or compromise on those interests, in so far as the effect is different from the effect on the like interests of other persons.

subsection.content: If the arrangement or compromise affects the rights of the company’s debenture holders, an explanatory statement must give the like explanation as respects the trustees of any deed for securing the issue of the debentures as it is required to give as respects the directors.

subsection.leadIn: If subsection (1) or (2) is contravened, all of the following commit an offence—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the company;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: every responsible person of the company;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a liquidator or provisional liquidator of the company who authorizes or permits, participates in, or fails to take all reasonable steps to prevent, the contravention;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: a trustee of a deed for securing the issue of the company’s debentures who authorizes or permits, participates in, or fails to take all reasonable steps to prevent, the contravention.

subsection.content: A person who commits an offence under subsection (5) is liable to a fine at level 5.

If a person is charged with an offence under subsection (5) for a contravention of subsection (1), it is a defence to establish that the contravention was due to the refusal of another person, who was a director of the company or a trustee for debenture holders of the company, to supply the necessary particulars of that other person’s interests.

section.name: s672
section.heading: Directors and trustees must notify company of interests under arrangement or compromise etc.

subsection.content: If a meeting is summoned under section 670, a director of the company, or a trustee for its debenture holders, must give notice to the company of any matter relating to the director or trustee that may be necessary for the purposes of section 671.
A person who contravenes subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable to a fine at level 5.

section.name: s673
section.heading: Court may sanction arrangement or compromise

subsection.content: This section applies if the creditors or the class of creditors, or the members or the class of members, or both, with whom the arrangement or compromise is proposed to be entered into, agree or agrees to the arrangement or compromise.
The Court may, on application made for the purposes of this subsection, sanction the arrangement or compromise.

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (4), an application for the purposes of subsection (2) may be made only by—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the case of an arrangement or compromise proposed to be entered into with the creditors of a company, the company or any of the creditors;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the case of an arrangement or compromise proposed to be entered into with a class of creditors of a company, the company or any creditor of that class;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: in the case of an arrangement or compromise proposed to be entered into with the members of a company, the company or any of the members; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: in the case of an arrangement or compromise proposed to be entered into with a class of members of a company, the company or any member of that class.

subsection.content: If the company is being wound up, an application for the purposes of subsection (2) may be made only by the liquidator or provisional liquidator.

subsection.leadIn: An arrangement or compromise sanctioned by the Court under subsection (2) is binding—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on the company or, if the company is being wound up, on the liquidator or provisional liquidator and contributories of the company; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on the creditors or the class of creditors, or the members or the class of members, or both, with whom the arrangement or compromise is proposed to be entered into.

subsection.content: An order made by the Court under subsection (2) has no effect until an office copy of the order is registered by the Registrar under Part 2.

If the order of the Court amends the company’s articles, or any resolution or agreement to which section 622 applies, the office copy of that order delivered to the Registrar for registration for the purposes of subsection (6) must be accompanied by a copy of those articles, or the resolution or agreement, as amended.
If subsection (7) is contravened, the company, and every responsible person of the company, commit an offence, and each is liable to a fine at level 3.

section.name: s674
section.heading: Provision supplementary to section 673(1): agreement to arrangement or compromise

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of section 673(1)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the creditors agree to the arrangement or compromise if, at a meeting of the creditors summoned under section 670, a majority in number representing at least 75% in value of the creditors present and voting, in person or by proxy, agree to the arrangement or compromise;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a class of creditors agrees to the arrangement or compromise if, at a meeting of the class of creditors summoned under section 670, a majority in number representing at least 75% in value of the class of creditors present and voting, in person or by proxy, agree to the arrangement or compromise;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: subject to subsection (2)(a), the members agree to the arrangement or compromise if, at a meeting of the members summoned under section 670—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: members representing at least 75% of the voting rights of the members present and voting, in person or by proxy, agree to the arrangement or compromise; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: unless the Court orders otherwise, a majority in number of the members present and voting, in person or by proxy, agree to the arrangement or compromise; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.leadIn: subject to subsection (2)(b), a class of members agrees to the arrangement or compromise if, at a meeting of the class of members summoned under section 670—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: members representing at least 75% of the voting rights of the class of members present and voting, in person or by proxy, agree to the arrangement or compromise; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: unless the Court orders otherwise, a majority in number of the class of members present and voting, in person or by proxy, agree to the arrangement or compromise.

subsection.leadIn: However, where the arrangement involves a general offer within the meaning of section 707 or a takeover offer—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: the members agree to the arrangement if—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: at a meeting of the members summoned under section 670, members representing at least 75% of the voting rights of the members present and voting, in person or by proxy, agree to the arrangement; and

subparagraph.name: ii

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: a class of members agrees to the arrangement if—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: at a meeting of the class of members summoned under section 670, members representing at least 75% of the voting rights of the class of members present and voting, in person or by proxy, agree to the arrangement; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the votes cast against the arrangement at the meeting do not exceed 10% of the total voting rights attached to all disinterested shares of the class in the company.

subsection.leadIn: In subsection (2)—

def.name: DisinterestedShares
def.leadIn: disinterested shares (無利害關係股份) means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: in the case of a takeover offer, shares in the company other than those held—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: by the offeror, or by a nominee on behalf of the offeror;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: by an associate of the offeror (except a person who falls within section 667(1)(a)(vii) or (b)(iii) or a person specified in subsection (4)); or

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: by a person who is a party to an acquisition agreement within the meaning of section 667(5) with the offeror (except a person specified in subsection (4)), or by a nominee on behalf of the person under the acquisition agreement;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: in the case of a general offer, shares in the company other than those held—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: by a non-tendering member as defined by section 705(1), or by a nominee on behalf of the member;

subparagraph.name: ii
iii
subparagraph.content: by a nominee on behalf of the repurchasing company;

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: by an associate of such a repurchasing company (except a person who falls within section 667(2)(c) or a person specified in subsection (4)); or

subparagraph.name: v
subparagraph.content: by a person who is a party to such an acquisition agreement with such a non-tendering member or repurchasing company (except a person specified in subsection (4)), or by a nominee on behalf of the person under the acquisition agreement.

subsection.content: The person specified for the purposes of paragraph (a)(ii) and (iii) and (b)(ii), (iv) and (v) of the definition of disinterested shares in subsection (3) is a person declared under section 670(1)(b) to be a person specified under this section.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsections (2) and (3)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: an offer to acquire shares in a company is a takeover offer if—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: it is an offer to acquire all the shares, or all the shares of any class, in the company, except those that, at the date of the offer, are held by the offeror; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.leadIn: the terms of the offer are the same—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: where the offer does not relate to shares of different classes, in relation to all the shares to which the offer relates; or

subparagraph.name: B

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: an offer under which consideration is provided for the cancellation of shares in a company is also a takeover offer if—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.leadIn: it is an offer under which consideration is provided for the cancellation of all the shares, or all the shares of any class, in the company, except—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: those that, at the date of the offer, are held by the offeror;

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: those that are specified in the offer document as shares that are not to be cancelled under the offer; and

subparagraph.name: C
ii
subparagraph.leadIn: the terms of the offer are the same—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: where the offer does not relate to shares of different classes, in relation to all the shares to which the offer relates; or

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: where the offer relates to shares of different classes, in relation to all the shares of each class to which the offer relates.

subsection.leadIn: In subsection (5)—
subsection.def: shares (股份) means shares, other than specified treasury shares, that have been allotted on the date of the offer. (Amended 1 of 2025 s. 12)

subsection.leadIn: In subsection (5)(a)(i) and (b)(i), a reference to shares that are held by an offeror—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: includes shares that the offeror has contracted, unconditionally or subject to conditions being satisfied, to acquire; but

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: excludes shares that are the subject of a contract—

subparagraph.name: i
ii
subparagraph.content: entered into for no consideration and by deed, for consideration of negligible value, or for consideration consisting of a promise by the offeror to make the offer.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsection (5)(a)(ii) and (b)(ii), even though, in relation to all the shares, or all the shares of a class of shares, to which an offer relates, there is a difference in the value of consideration offered for the shares allotted earlier as against the value of consideration offered for those allotted later, the terms of the offer are to be regarded as the same in relation to all the shares concerned if—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: the difference in value of consideration merely reflects that difference in entitlement to dividend; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: but for the difference in the value of consideration, the terms of the offer would be the same in relation to all the shares concerned.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsection (5)(a)(ii) and (b)(ii), even though, in relation to all the shares, or all the shares of a class of shares, to which an offer relates, there is a difference in the form of consideration offered, the terms of the offer are to be regarded as the same in relation to all the shares concerned if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the law of a place outside Hong Kong precludes an offer of consideration in the form specified in the terms of the offer, or precludes it except after compliance by the offeror with conditions with which the offeror is unable to comply or that the offeror regards as unduly onerous;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: consideration in another form is offered to a person to whom an offer of consideration in the specified form is so precluded;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the person is able to receive consideration in that other form that is of substantially equivalent value; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: but for the difference in the form of consideration, the terms of the offer would be the same in relation to all the shares concerned.

subsection.leadIn: Despite subsection (5), a takeover offer may include, among the shares to which it relates— (Amended 1 of 2025 s. 12)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: shares that will be allotted after the date of the offer but before a date specified in the offer; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: all or any specified treasury shares that are sold or transferred under section 272D(b) before a date specified in the offer. (Amended 1 of 2025 s. 12)

subsection.leadIn: In subsections (2), (3), (4), (5), (6), (7), (8), (9) and (10), a reference to shares in a company includes—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: debentures that are convertible into shares in the company; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: securities of the company that are convertible into, or entitle the holder to subscribe for, shares in the company.

subsection.continued: Those subsections apply to those debentures or securities as if they were shares of a separate class of the company, and a reference to a member or a holder of shares in those subsections is to be read accordingly.

subsection.leadIn: In subsections (6) and (10)—

def.name: SpecifiedTreasuryShares
def.leadIn: specified treasury shares (指明庫存股份) means shares—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: that are treasury shares held by the company on the date of the offer; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: that become treasury shares held by the company after the date of the offer but before a date specified in the offer. (Added 1 of 2025 s. 12)

section.name: s675
section.heading: Court’s additional powers to facilitate reconstruction or amalgamation

subsection.leadIn: This section applies if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an application is made for the purposes of section 673(2) to sanction the arrangement or compromise; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: it is shown to the Court that—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the arrangement or compromise is proposed for the purpose of, or in connection with, a scheme for the reconstruction of one or more companies, or for the amalgamation of 2 or more companies; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: under the scheme, the property or undertaking of any company concerned in the scheme, or any part of that property or undertaking, is to be transferred to another company.

subsection.leadIn: If the Court sanctions the arrangement or compromise, it may, by the order or a subsequent order, make provision for any or all of the following—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the transfer of the transferor’s property, undertaking or liabilities, or any part of it or them, to the transferee;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the allotting or appropriation by the transferee of any shares, debentures, policies, or other like interests in the transferee which, under the arrangement or compromise, are to be allotted or appropriated by the transferee to or for any person;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the continuation by or against the transferee of any legal proceedings pending by or against the transferor;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the dissolution, without winding up, of the transferor;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: the provision to be made for any person, who within the time, and in the manner, that the Court directs, dissents from the arrangement or compromise;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: the transfer or allotting of any interest in property to any person concerned in the arrangement or compromise;

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: any incidental, consequential and supplemental matters that are necessary to ensure that the reconstruction or amalgamation is fully and effectively carried out.

subsection.leadIn: If an order provides for the transfer of property under subsection (2)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the property is, by virtue of the order, transferred to, and vests in, the transferee; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: where the order so directs, the property vests freed from any charge that is to cease to have effect by virtue of the arrangement or compromise.

subsection.content: If an order provides for the transfer of liabilities under subsection (2), the liabilities are, by virtue of the order, transferred to, and become liabilities of, the transferee.

If the Court, by an order, makes provision for any matter under subsection (2), the order has no effect to the extent to which it purports to make the provision until an office copy of the order is registered by the Registrar under Part 2.

If the order of the Court amends the company’s articles, or any resolution or agreement to which section 622 applies, the office copy of that order delivered to the Registrar for registration for the purposes of subsection (5) must be accompanied by a copy of those articles, or the resolution or agreement, as amended.
If subsection (6) is contravened, the company, and every responsible person of the company, commit an offence, and each is liable to a fine at level 3.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—

def.name: Liabilities
def.leadIn: liabilities (法律責任) includes—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: duties of a personal character and incapable of being assigned or performed vicariously under the law; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: duties of any other description;

def.name: Property
def.leadIn: property (財產) includes—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: rights and powers of a personal character and incapable of being assigned or performed vicariously under the law; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: rights and powers of any other description;

subsection.def: transferee (受讓人), in relation to an arrangement or compromise proposed for the purpose of a scheme of reconstruction or amalgamation, means the company to which another company’s property, undertaking or liabilities, or any part of it or them, is to be transferred under the scheme;

transferor (出讓人), in relation to an arrangement or compromise proposed for the purpose of a scheme of reconstruction or amalgamation, means the company whose property, undertaking or liabilities, or any part of it or them, is to be transferred to another company under the scheme.

section.name: s676
section.heading: Court may order costs

subsection.content: This section applies in relation to an application made for the purposes of section 673(2) for an order of the Court sanctioning an arrangement that falls within section 674(2).
The Court may make any order that it thinks fit about the costs incurred or to be incurred by a member who dissents from the arrangement in opposing the application.
An order may require the company or any other party to the application to indemnify the member against the costs incurred or to be incurred by the member.

The Court may only make an order about costs (including the requirement as to indemnification) under this section in favour of the member if it is satisfied that the member was acting in good faith in, and had reasonable grounds for, opposing the application.
The Court may only make an order about costs under this section against the member if the member’s opposition to the application is frivolous or vexatious.

section.name: s677
section.heading: Company’s articles to be accompanied by order of Court

subsection.content: Every copy of the company’s articles issued by the company after an order is made for the purposes of section 673 or 675 must be accompanied by a copy of the order, unless the effect of the order, and the effect of the arrangement or compromise to which the order relates, has been incorporated into the articles by alteration to those articles.
If subsection (1) is contravened, the company, and every responsible person of the company, commit an offence, and each is liable to a fine at level 3.

section.name: s678
section.heading: Interpretation

subsection.leadIn: In this Division, a company is a wholly owned subsidiary of another body corporate if it has no members except— (Amended 35 of 2018 s. 69)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: that other body corporate;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a nominee of that other body corporate;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a wholly owned subsidiary of that other body corporate; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: a nominee of that subsidiary. (Amended 35 of 2018 s. 69)

subsection.content: A cancellation of shares under this Division is not a reduction of share capital for the purposes of Part 5.
For the purposes of this Division, a resolution approving an amalgamation mentioned in section 680(1) or 681(1) is an amalgamation proposal that has been approved.

section.name: s679
section.heading: Solvency statement

subsection.leadIn: In this Division, a reference to a solvency statement made by the directors of an amalgamating company is a reference to a statement made before the time specified in subsection (2) that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: in the directors’ opinion—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: as at the date of the statement, there is no ground on which the amalgamating company could be found to be unable to pay its debts; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the amalgamated company will be able to pay its debts as they fall due during the period of 12 months immediately after the date on which the amalgamation is to become effective; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: as at the date of the statement—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.leadIn: none of the following exists—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: any floating charge created by the amalgamating company;

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: any other security created by the amalgamating company over a class of assets, to any of which the security interest has not attached; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: there exists such a floating charge or other security, and each person entitled to the charge or security has consented in writing to the amalgamation proposal.

subsection.leadIn: The time specified for the purposes of subsection (1) is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if the amalgamation is to be approved by a resolution passed on a poll at a general meeting, the date of the meeting; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the amalgamation is to be approved by a written resolution, the circulation date of the resolution.

subsection.content: In forming an opinion for the purposes of subsection (1)(a)(ii), the directors must take into account all the liabilities of the amalgamated company (including contingent and prospective liabilities).

subsection.leadIn: In subsection (2)(b)—
subsection.def: circulation date (傳閱日期) has the meaning given by section 547(1).

section.name: s680
section.heading: Vertical amalgamation

def.name: AmalgamatingHoldingCompany
def.leadIn: A company (amalgamating holding company), and one or more of its wholly owned subsidiaries, may amalgamate, and continue, as one company if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the members of the amalgamating holding company approve the amalgamation on the terms specified in subsection (2); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the members of each of the amalgamating subsidiaries approve the amalgamation on the terms specified in subsection (2).

subsection.leadIn: The terms are—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: that the shares of each of the amalgamating subsidiaries will be cancelled without payment or other consideration;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: that the articles of the amalgamated company will be the same as the articles of the amalgamating holding company;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: that the directors of each amalgamating company—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: are satisfied that, as at the date of the solvency statement made by them, there is no ground on which the amalgamating company could be found to be unable to pay its debts; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: after taking into account all the liabilities of the amalgamated company (including contingent and prospective liabilities), are satisfied that the amalgamated company will be able to pay its debts as they fall due during the period of 12 months immediately after the date on which the amalgamation is to become effective;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.leadIn: that the directors of each amalgamating company have confirmed that as at the date of the solvency statement made by them—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.leadIn: none of the following exists—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: any floating charge created by the amalgamating company;

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: any other security created by the amalgamating company over a class of assets, to any of which the security interest has not attached; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: there exists such a floating charge or other security, and each person entitled to the charge or security has consented in writing to the amalgamation proposal;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: that the person or persons named in the resolution will be the director or directors of the amalgamated company.

subsection.content: An approval for the purposes of subsection (1)(a) must be obtained by a special resolution of the company passed on a poll at a general meeting but not by a written resolution.
An approval for the purposes of subsection (1)(b) must be obtained by a special resolution of the company passed on a poll at a general meeting or by a written resolution.
This section does not apply unless each amalgamating company is a company limited by shares.

section.name: s681
section.heading: Horizontal amalgamation

subsection.content: Two or more of the wholly owned subsidiaries of a body corporate may amalgamate, and continue, as one company if the members of each amalgamating company approve the amalgamation on the terms specified in subsection (2). (Amended 35 of 2018 s. 70)

subsection.leadIn: The terms are—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: that the shares of all but one of the amalgamating companies will be cancelled without payment or other consideration;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: that the articles of the amalgamated company will be the same as the articles of the amalgamating company whose shares are not cancelled;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: that the directors of each amalgamating company—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: are satisfied that, as at the date of the solvency statement made by them, there is no ground on which the amalgamating company could be found to be unable to pay its debts; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: after taking into account all the liabilities of the amalgamated company (including contingent and prospective liabilities), are satisfied that the amalgamated company will be able to pay its debts as they fall due during the period of 12 months immediately after the date on which the amalgamation is to become effective;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.leadIn: that the directors of each amalgamating company have confirmed that as at the date of the solvency statement made by them—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.leadIn: none of the following exists—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: any floating charge created by the amalgamating company;

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: any other security created by the amalgamating company over a class of assets, to any of which the security interest has not attached; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: there exists such a floating charge or other security, and each person entitled to the charge or security has consented in writing to the amalgamation proposal;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: that the person or persons named in the resolution will be the director or directors of the amalgamated company.

subsection.content: An approval for the purposes of subsection (1) must be obtained by a special resolution of the amalgamating company passed on a poll at a general meeting or by a written resolution.
This section does not apply unless each amalgamating company is a company limited by shares.

section.name: s682
section.heading: Directors of amalgamating company must notify secured creditors of proposed amalgamation

subsection.leadIn: The directors of each amalgamating company under section 680 or 681 must comply with subsection (2)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if the amalgamation is to be approved by a resolution passed on a poll at a general meeting, at least 21 days before the date of the meeting; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the amalgamation is to be approved by a written resolution, on or before the circulation date of the resolution.

subsection.leadIn: Those directors—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: must give written notice of the proposed amalgamation to every secured creditor of the amalgamating company; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: must publish notice of the proposed amalgamation in an English language newspaper, and a Chinese language newspaper, circulating generally in Hong Kong.

subsection.content: If the directors of an amalgamating company contravene subsection (1), each of them commits an offence and is liable to a fine at level 3.

subsection.leadIn: In subsection (1)(b)—
subsection.def: circulation date (傳閱日期) has the meaning given by section 547(1).

section.name: s683
section.heading: Director of amalgamating company must issue certificate on solvency statement

subsection.leadIn: Every director of the amalgamating company who votes in favour of making a solvency statement must issue a certificate—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: stating—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: that, in the director’s opinion, the conditions specified in section 679(1)(a)(i) and (ii) are satisfied; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the grounds for that opinion; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: stating that the condition specified in section 679(1)(b) is satisfied.

subsection.content: A person who contravenes subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable to a fine at level 4.

A director of the amalgamating company commits an offence if the director votes in favour of making a solvency statement, or otherwise causes a solvency statement to be made, without having reasonable grounds for the opinion and fact expressed in the statement.

subsection.leadIn: A person who commits an offence under subsection (3) is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on conviction on indictment to a fine of $150,000 and to imprisonment for 2 years; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on summary conviction to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

section.name: s684
section.heading: Registration of amalgamation

subsection.leadIn: For the purpose of effecting an amalgamation, the following documents must be delivered to the Registrar for registration within 15 days after the approval of the amalgamation proposal—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the amalgamation proposal that has been approved;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: every certificate required by section 683(1);

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: a certificate issued by the directors of each amalgamating company stating that the amalgamation has been approved in accordance with—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: this Division; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the articles of the amalgamating company;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: a notice of appointment of the directors of the amalgamated company;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: a certificate issued by the directors, or the proposed directors, of the amalgamated company stating that where the proportion of the claims of the amalgamated company’s creditors in relation to the value of that company’s assets is greater than the proportion of the claims of an amalgamating company’s creditors in relation to the value of that company’s assets, no creditor will be prejudiced by that fact.

subsection.content: A document mentioned in subsection (1)(a), (b), (c), (d) or (e) must be in the specified form.
As soon as practicable after the documents mentioned in subsection (1) are registered, the Registrar must issue a certificate of amalgamation.
A certificate of amalgamation may be issued in any form that the Registrar thinks fit.

section.name: s685
section.heading: Effective date of amalgamation

subsection.content: A certificate of amalgamation issued under section 684(3) must specify a date as the effective date of the amalgamation.

If an amalgamation proposal specifies a date on which the amalgamation is intended to become effective, and that date is the same as or later than the date on which the Registrar registers the documents mentioned in section 684(1), that date must be specified in the certificate of amalgamation as the effective date of the amalgamation.

subsection.leadIn: On the effective date of an amalgamation—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the amalgamation takes effect;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: each amalgamating company ceases to exist as an entity separate from the amalgamated company; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the amalgamated company succeeds to all the property, rights and privileges, and all the liabilities and obligations, of each amalgamating company.

subsection.leadIn: On and after the effective date of an amalgamation—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any proceedings pending by or against an amalgamating company may be continued by or against the amalgamated company;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any conviction, ruling, order or judgment in favour of or against an amalgamating company may be enforced by or against the amalgamated company; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: any agreement entered into by an amalgamating company may be enforced by or against the amalgamated company unless otherwise provided in the agreement.

subsection.content: As soon as practicable after the effective date of an amalgamation, the Registrar must make a note of the amalgamation in the Companies Register in relation to each amalgamating company.

section.name: s686
section.heading: Court may intervene in amalgamation proposal in certain cases

subsection.content: If the Court is satisfied that giving effect to an amalgamation proposal would unfairly prejudice a member or creditor of an amalgamating company or a person to whom an amalgamating company is under an obligation, it may, on application by the member, creditor or person made before the date on which the amalgamation becomes effective, make any order it thinks fit in relation to the amalgamation proposal.

subsection.leadIn: Without limiting subsection (1), the Court may make an order—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: directing that effect must not be given to the amalgamation proposal;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: modifying the amalgamation proposal in the manner specified in the order; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: directing the amalgamating company or its directors to reconsider the amalgamation proposal or any part of that proposal.

subsection.content: Without limiting subsection (1), the Court may also make an order directing the amalgamated company, or any other party to the proceedings, to purchase shares of a member of an amalgamating company who would be unfairly prejudiced by the amalgamation proposal.
On making an application for the purposes of subsection (1), the applicant must deliver to the Registrar for registration a notice of the application in the specified form.

If the Registrar receives a notice under subsection (4), he or she must withhold registration of the documents mentioned in section 684(1) unless the Court otherwise directs or the application is dismissed by the Court or is withdrawn.

If an order is made under this section, every company in relation to which the order is made must deliver an office copy of the order to the Registrar for registration within 7 days after the order is made.

If a company contravenes subsection (6), the company, and every responsible person of the company, commit an offence, and each is liable to a fine at level 3 and, in the case of a continuing offence, to a further fine of $300 for each day during which the offence continues.

section.name: s687
section.heading: Interpretation
section.leadIn: In this Division—
section.def: nominee (代名人), in relation to a company that is a member of a group of companies, includes a nominee on behalf of another company that is a member of the group.

section.name: s688
section.heading: Application of Division to convertible securities and debentures

subsection.content: This Division applies in relation to debentures of a company that are convertible into shares in the company, or to securities of a company that are convertible into, or entitle the holder to subscribe for, shares in the company, as if those debentures or securities were shares of a separate class of the company. A reference to a holder of shares, and to shares being allotted, is to be read accordingly.

subsection.leadIn: In this Division, a reference to 90% in number of the shares of any class is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the case of securities mentioned in subsection (1), a reference to 90% of the number of those securities; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the case of debentures mentioned in subsection (1), a reference to 90% of the total amount payable on those debentures.

section.name: s689
section.heading: Takeover offer

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of this Division, an offer to acquire shares in a company is a takeover offer if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: it is an offer to acquire all the shares, or all the shares of any class, in the company, except those that, at the date of the offer, are held by the offeror; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the terms of the offer are the same—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: where the offer does not relate to shares of different classes, in relation to all the shares to which the offer relates; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: where the offer relates to shares of different classes, in relation to all the shares of each class to which the offer relates.

subsection.leadIn: In subsection (1)—
subsection.def: shares (股份) means shares, other than specified treasury shares, that have been allotted on the date of the offer. (Amended 1 of 2025 s. 13)

subsection.leadIn: In subsection (1)(a), a reference to shares that are held by an offeror—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: includes shares that the offeror has contracted, unconditionally or subject to conditions being satisfied, to acquire; but

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: excludes shares that are the subject of a contract—

subparagraph.name: i
ii
subparagraph.content: entered into for no consideration and by deed, for consideration of negligible value, or for consideration consisting of a promise by the offeror to make the offer.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsection (1)(b), even though, in relation to all the shares, or all the shares of a class of shares, to which an offer relates, there is a difference in the value of consideration offered for the shares allotted earlier as against the value of consideration offered for those allotted later, the terms of the offer are to be regarded as the same in relation to all the shares concerned if—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: the difference in value of consideration merely reflects that difference in entitlement to dividend; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: but for the difference in the value of consideration, the terms of the offer would be the same in relation to all the shares concerned.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsection (1)(b), even though, in relation to all the shares, or all the shares of a class of shares, to which an offer relates, there is a difference in the form of consideration offered, the terms of the offer are to be regarded as the same in relation to all the shares concerned if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the law of a place outside Hong Kong precludes an offer of consideration in the form specified in the terms of the offer, or precludes it except after compliance by the offeror with conditions with which the offeror is unable to comply or that the offeror regards as unduly onerous;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: consideration in another form is offered to a person to whom an offer of consideration in the specified form is so precluded;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the person is able to receive consideration in that other form that is of substantially equivalent value; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: but for the difference in the form of consideration, the terms of the offer would be the same in relation to all the shares concerned.

subsection.leadIn: Despite subsection (1), a takeover offer may include, among the shares to which it relates— (Amended 1 of 2025 s. 13)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: shares that will be allotted after the date of the offer but before a date specified in the offer; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: all or any specified treasury shares that are sold or transferred under section 272D(b) before a date specified in the offer. (Amended 1 of 2025 s. 13)

subsection.leadIn: In subsections (2) and (6)—

def.name: SpecifiedTreasuryShares
def.leadIn: specified treasury shares (指明庫存股份) means shares—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: that are treasury shares held by the company on the date of the offer; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: that become treasury shares held by the company after the date of the offer but before a date specified in the offer. (Added 1 of 2025 s. 13)

section.name: s690
section.heading: Non-communication etc. does not prevent offer from being takeover offer

subsection.leadIn: Even though an offer to acquire shares is not communicated to a holder of shares, that does not prevent the offer from being a takeover offer for the purposes of this Division if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: no Hong Kong address for the holder is registered in the company’s register of members;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the offer was not communicated to the holder in order not to contravene the law of a place outside Hong Kong; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: either—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the offer is published in the Gazette; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the offer can be inspected, or a copy of it obtained, at a place in Hong Kong or on a website, and a notice is published in the Gazette specifying the address of that place or website.

subsection.content: It is not to be inferred from subsection (1) that an offer that is not communicated to a holder of shares cannot be a takeover offer for the purposes of this Division unless the conditions specified in paragraphs (a), (b) and (c) of that subsection are satisfied.

Even though it is impossible or more difficult for a person, by reason of the law of a place outside Hong Kong, to accept an offer to acquire shares, that does not prevent the offer from being a takeover offer for the purposes of this Division.

It is not to be inferred from subsection (3) that an offer that is impossible, or more difficult, for certain persons to accept cannot be a takeover offer for the purposes of this Division unless the reason for the impossibility or difficulty is the one mentioned in that subsection.

section.name: s691
section.heading: Shares to which takeover offer relates

subsection.content: For the purposes of this Division, if, after a takeover offer is made but before the end of the offer period, the offeror acquires, or contracts unconditionally to acquire, any of the shares to which the offer relates but does not do so by virtue of acceptances of the offer, those shares are not to be regarded as shares to which the offer relates. This subsection has effect subject to subsection (2).

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of this Division, those shares are to be regarded as shares to which the takeover offer relates, and the offeror is to be regarded as having acquired or contracted to acquire them by virtue of acceptances of that offer, if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the value of the consideration for which the shares are acquired, or contracted to be acquired, at the time of the acquisition or contract, does not exceed the value of the consideration specified in the terms of that offer; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: those terms are subsequently revised so that when the revision is announced, the value of the consideration for which the shares are acquired, or contracted to be acquired, at the time of the acquisition or contract, no longer exceeds the value of the consideration specified in those terms.

subsection.content: For the purposes of this Division, shares that an associate of the offeror, or a nominee on the offeror’s behalf, holds, or has contracted, unconditionally or subject to conditions being satisfied, to acquire, whether at the date of the takeover offer or subsequently, are not to be regarded as shares to which that offer relates, even if that offer extends to those shares. This subsection has effect subject to subsection (4).

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of this Division, where, after a takeover offer is made but before the end of the offer period, an associate of the offeror, or a nominee on the offeror’s behalf, acquires, or contracts unconditionally to acquire, any of the shares to which the offer relates, the shares are to be regarded as shares to which the offer relates if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the value of the consideration for which the shares are acquired, or contracted to be acquired, at the time of the acquisition or contract, does not exceed the value of the consideration specified in the terms of the offer; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: those terms are subsequently revised so that when the revision is announced, the value of the consideration for which the shares are acquired, or contracted to be acquired, at the time of the acquisition or contract, no longer exceeds the value of the consideration specified in those terms.

section.name: s692
section.heading: Revised offer not to be regarded as fresh offer
section.leadIn: For the purposes of this Division, a revision of the terms of an offer to acquire shares is not to be regarded as the making of a fresh offer if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: the terms of the offer make provision for—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: their revision; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: acceptances on the previous terms to be treated as acceptances on the revised terms; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the revision is made in accordance with that provision.

section.name: s693
section.heading: Offeror may give notice to buy out minority shareholders

subsection.content: If, in the case of a takeover offer that does not relate to shares of different classes, the offeror has, by virtue of acceptances of the offer, acquired, or contracted unconditionally to acquire, at least 90% in number of the shares to which the offer relates, the offeror may give notice to the holder of any other shares to which the offer relates that the offeror desires to acquire those shares.

If, in the case of a takeover offer that relates to shares of different classes, the offeror has, by virtue of acceptances of the offer, acquired, or contracted unconditionally to acquire, at least 90% in number of the shares of any class to which the offer relates, the offeror may give notice to the holder of any other shares of that class to which the offer relates that the offeror desires to acquire those shares.

If, in the case of a takeover offer that does not relate to shares of different classes, the offeror has, by virtue of acceptances of the offer, acquired, or contracted unconditionally to acquire, less than 90% in number of the shares to which the offer relates, the offeror may apply to the Court for an order authorizing the offeror to give notice to the holder of any other shares to which the offer relates that the offeror desires to acquire those shares.

If, in the case of a takeover offer that relates to shares of different classes, the offeror has, by virtue of acceptances of the offer, acquired, or contracted unconditionally to acquire, less than 90% in number of the shares of any class to which the offer relates, the offeror may apply to the Court for an order authorizing the offeror to give notice to the holder of any other shares of that class to which the offer relates that the offeror desires to acquire those shares.

subsection.leadIn: The Court may, on application under subsection (3) or (4), make the order if it is satisfied that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: after reasonable enquiry, the offeror has been unable to trace one or more of the persons holding shares to which the takeover offer relates;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: had the person, or all those persons, accepted the takeover offer, the offeror would have, by virtue of acceptances of that offer, acquired, or contracted unconditionally to acquire, at least 90% in number of the shares, or the shares of any class, to which that offer relates; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the consideration offered is fair and reasonable.

subsection.content: The Court must not make the order unless it is satisfied that it is just and equitable to do so having regard to all the circumstances and, in particular, to the number of holders of shares who have been traced but who have not accepted the takeover offer.
If the Court makes an order authorizing the offeror to give notice to the holder of any shares, the offeror may give notice to that holder.

section.name: s694
section.heading: Notice to minority shareholders

subsection.leadIn: A notice to a holder of shares under section 693—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: must be given in the specified form; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: must be given to the holder before whichever is the earlier of the following—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the end of the period of 3 months beginning on the day after the end of the offer period of the takeover offer;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the end of the period of 6 months beginning on the date of the takeover offer.

subsection.leadIn: The notice must be given to the holder of shares—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: by delivering it personally to that holder in Hong Kong;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: by sending it by registered post to that holder to—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: an address of that holder in Hong Kong registered in the books of the company; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: if there is no such address, an address in Hong Kong supplied by that holder to the company for the giving of notice to that holder; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: in the manner directed by the Registrar on an application made under subsection (3).

subsection.leadIn: An offeror may apply to the Registrar for directions regarding the manner in which the notice is to be given to a holder of shares if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: there is no address of the holder in Hong Kong registered in the books of the company; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the holder has not supplied to the company an address in Hong Kong for the giving of notice to the holder.

subsection.leadIn: If the takeover offer gives the holder of shares a choice of consideration, the notice—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: must give particulars of the choices;

paragraph.name: b
