subsection.leadIn: Despite subsection (2), the authorized person, or the applicant to whom the information was disclosed, may disclose such information to another person if the disclosure is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: required with a view to the institution of, or otherwise for the purpose of, any criminal proceedings;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: permitted in accordance with an order made under section 740(1) or (4); or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: permitted in accordance with law or a requirement made under law.

subsection.content: If the Court makes an order under section 740(1) authorizing a person to inspect a record or document, the person, or the applicant to whom the information was disclosed, must not, unless the Court otherwise orders, use any information obtained as a result of the inspection for any purpose other than the purpose for which the inspection is applied for.

subsection.leadIn: A person who contravenes subsection (2) or (4) commits an offence and is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on conviction on indictment to a fine of $150,000 and to imprisonment for 2 years; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on summary conviction to a fine at level 5 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

section.name: s742
section.heading: Legal professional privilege
section.content: Section 740, or an order made under it, does not authorize a person to inspect any record or document containing information that is subject to legal professional privilege.

section.name: s743
section.heading: Protection of personal data
section.content: To avoid doubt, sections 740 and 741, or an order made under section 740, do not authorize the collection, retention or use of personal data in contravention of the Personal Data (Privacy) Ordinance (Cap. 486).

part.name: P15
part.heading: Dissolution by Striking off or Deregistration

subdivision.name: SD1
subdivision.heading: Registrar’s Power to Strike off Name of Company not in Operation or Carrying on Business

section.name: s744
section.heading: Registrar may send inquiry letter to company

subsection.content: If the Registrar has reasonable cause to believe that a company is not in operation or carrying on business, the Registrar may send to the company by post a letter inquiring whether the company is in operation or carrying on business.

subsection.leadIn: A letter must be addressed—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to the company at its registered office;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if notice of the company’s registered office has not been given to the Registrar, to the care of an officer of the company; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: if there is no officer of the company whose name and address are known to the Registrar—

subparagraph.content: for a company other than a re-domiciled company—to each founder member whose name and address are known to the Registrar; and
for a re-domiciled company—to each member of the company whose name and address are known to the Registrar. (Replaced 14 of 2025 s. 53)

subsection.content: If the Registrar is of the opinion that the address of the company’s registered office cannot be ascertained or that a letter under subsection (1) is unlikely to be received by the company, the Registrar may, instead of sending a letter under that subsection, publish in the Gazette a notice that, unless cause is shown to the contrary, the company’s name will be struck off the Companies Register, and the company dissolved, at the end of 3 months after the date of the notice.

section.name: s745
section.heading: Registrar must follow up under certain circumstances

subsection.leadIn: This section applies if, within one month after sending a letter under section 744(1)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Registrar does not receive a reply to the letter; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the Registrar receives a reply to the letter to the effect that the company is not in operation or carrying on business.

subsection.leadIn: The Registrar must, within 30 days after the end of that one month—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: subject to subsection (4), send to the company by registered post another letter—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: referring to the letter sent under section 744(1); and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.leadIn: stating that—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: no reply to it has been received; or

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: the Registrar has received a reply to it to the effect that the company is not in operation or carrying on business; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: publish in the Gazette a notice that, unless cause is shown to the contrary, the company’s name will be struck off the Companies Register, and the company dissolved, at the end of 3 months after the date of the notice.

subsection.leadIn: A letter must be addressed—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to the company at its registered office;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if notice of the company’s registered office has not been given to the Registrar, to the care of an officer of the company; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: if there is no officer of the company whose name and address are known to the Registrar—

subparagraph.content: for a company other than a re-domiciled company—to each founder member whose name and address are known to the Registrar; and
for a re-domiciled company—to each member of the company whose name and address are known to the Registrar. (Replaced 14 of 2025 s. 54)

subsection.content: The Registrar is not required to send a letter to the company under subsection (2)(a) if the Registrar is of the opinion that the address of the company’s registered office cannot be ascertained or that the letter is unlikely to be received by the company.

section.name: s746
section.heading: Registrar may strike off company’s name

subsection.content: After publishing a notice under section 744(3) or 745(2)(b), the Registrar may, unless cause is shown to the contrary, strike the company’s name off the Companies Register at the end of 3 months after the date of the notice.
The Registrar must publish in the Gazette a notice indicating that the company’s name has been struck off the Companies Register.
On publication of the notice under subsection (2), the company is dissolved.

section.name: s747
section.heading: Registrar’s duty to act in case of company being wound up

subsection.leadIn: Subsection (2) applies if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a company is being wound up;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the Registrar has reasonable cause to believe that—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: no liquidator or provisional liquidator is acting; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the company’s affairs are fully wound up; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the returns required to be made by the liquidator or provisional liquidator have not been made for 6 consecutive months.

subsection.content: Subject to subsection (5), the Registrar must publish in the Gazette, and send to the company or the liquidator or provisional liquidator (if any), a notice that, unless cause is shown to the contrary, the company’s name will be struck off the Companies Register, and the company dissolved, at the end of 3 months after the date of the notice.

subsection.leadIn: A notice to be sent to a company must be addressed—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to the company at its registered office;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if notice of the company’s registered office has not been given to the Registrar, to the care of an officer of the company; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: if there is no officer of the company whose name and address are known to the Registrar—

subparagraph.content: for a company other than a re-domiciled company—to each founder member whose name and address are known to the Registrar; and
for a re-domiciled company—to each member of the company whose name and address are known to the Registrar. (Replaced 14 of 2025 s. 55)

subsection.content: A notice to be sent to a liquidator or provisional liquidator must be addressed to the liquidator or provisional liquidator at the addressee’s last known address.

subsection.leadIn: The Registrar is not required to send a notice to the company or the liquidator or provisional liquidator under subsection (2) if the Registrar is of the opinion that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the address of the company’s registered office, or the name and address of the liquidator or provisional liquidator (as the case may be) cannot be ascertained; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the notice is unlikely to be received by the company or the liquidator or provisional liquidator (as the case may be).

subsection.content: After publishing a notice under subsection (2), the Registrar may, unless cause is shown to the contrary, strike the company’s name off the Companies Register at the end of 3 months after the date of the notice.
The Registrar must publish in the Gazette a notice indicating that the company’s name has been struck off the Companies Register.
On publication of the notice under subsection (7), the company is dissolved.

section.name: s748
section.heading: Court may strike off name of company not appropriate to be wound up

subsection.content: If, on application by the Registrar, it appears to the Court that a company should be dissolved but, having regard to the company’s assets or for other reasons, it would not be appropriate to wind up the company, the Court may order that the company’s name be struck off the Companies Register and the company dissolved.
If an order is made, the company is dissolved on the date of the order.

section.name: s749
section.heading: Interpretation

subsection.leadIn: In this Division—

def.name: Company
def.leadIn: company (公司) excludes—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a public company; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a company specified in subsection (2).

subsection.leadIn: The company is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an authorized institution as defined by section 2(1) of the Banking Ordinance (Cap. 155);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an insurer as defined by section 2(1) and (2) of the Insurance Ordinance (Cap. 41); (Amended 12 of 2015 s. 167)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a corporation licensed under Part V of the Securities and Futures Ordinance (Cap. 571) to carry on a business in any regulated activity as defined by section 1 of Part 1 of Schedule 1 to that Ordinance;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: an associated entity, within the meaning of Part VI of the Securities and Futures Ordinance (Cap. 571), of a corporation mentioned in paragraph (c);

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: an approved trustee as defined by section 2(1) of the Mandatory Provident Fund Schemes Ordinance (Cap. 485);

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: a company registered as a trust company under Part VIII of the Trustee Ordinance (Cap. 29);

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: a company having a subsidiary that falls within paragraph (a), (b), (c), (d), (e) or (f); or

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.content: a company that fell within paragraph (a), (b), (c), (d), (e), (f) or (g) at any time during the 5 years immediately before the application under section 750 is made.

subsection.content: The Financial Secretary may, by notice published in the Gazette, amend subsection (2).

section.name: s750
section.heading: Application for deregistration

subsection.content: A company, or a director or member of a company, may apply to the Registrar for deregistration of the company.

subsection.leadIn: An application must not be made unless, at the time of the application—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: all the members agree to the deregistration;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the company has not commenced operation or business, or has not been in operation or carried on business during the 3 months immediately before the application;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the company has no outstanding liabilities;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the company is not a party to any legal proceedings;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: the company’s assets do not consist of any immovable property situate in Hong Kong; and

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: if the company is a holding company, none of its subsidiary’s assets consist of any immovable property situate in Hong Kong.

subsection.leadIn: An application—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: must be in the specified form;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: must be accompanied by the prescribed fee; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: must be accompanied by a written notice from the Commissioner of Inland Revenue stating that the Commissioner has no objection to the company being deregistered.

subsection.content: If the applicant is a company, it must nominate in the application a natural person to be given notice of the deregistration.
The applicant must give the Registrar any further information that the Registrar may request in connection with an application.

subsection.leadIn: A person who, in connection with an application, knowingly or recklessly gives any information to the Registrar that is false or misleading in a material particular commits an offence and is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on conviction on indictment to a fine of $300,000 and to imprisonment for 2 years; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on summary conviction to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

subsection.statutoryNote:
Note—
Please also see section 873 which empowers the Registrar to require the production of records or documents, and the provision of information or explanation in respect of the records or documents, for the purpose of enquiring into whether any act that would constitute an offence under subsection (6) has been done.

section.name: s751
section.heading: Registrar may deregister company

subsection.content: On receiving an application under section 750, the Registrar must publish in the Gazette a notice of the proposed deregistration unless the Registrar is aware of a failure to comply with subsection (2), (3), (4) or (5) of that section.
The notice must state that unless an objection to the deregistration is received within 3 months after the date of publication of the notice, the Registrar may deregister the company.

If, at the end of those 3 months, the Registrar has not received any objection to the deregistration, the Registrar may deregister the company by publishing in the Gazette another notice declaring it to be deregistered on the date of publication of that other notice.
A company is deregistered on the date of publication of the notice under subsection (3).
On the deregistration of a company, the Registrar must give notice of the deregistration to the applicant, or to the person nominated in the application to be given the notice.
A company is dissolved on deregistration.

division.name: D3
division.heading: Property of Dissolved Company and Other Miscellaneous Matters

section.name: s752
section.heading: Dissolved company’s property vested in Government

subsection.content: If a company is dissolved under this Part or section 226A, 227, 239 or 248 of the Companies (Winding Up and Miscellaneous Provisions) Ordinance (Cap. 32), every property and right vested in or held on trust for the company immediately before the dissolution is vested in the Government as bona vacantia.

subsection.leadIn: Subsection (1) has effect subject to the possible restoration of the company to the Companies Register under—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: Division 4; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: section 290 of the Companies (Winding Up and Miscellaneous Provisions) Ordinance (Cap. 32).

subsection.content: If any property or right is vested in the Government under subsection (1), the property or right remains subject to the liabilities imposed on the property or right by law and does not have the benefit of any exemption that it might otherwise have as a property or right vested in the Government.
Despite subsection (3), the Government is only required to satisfy those liabilities out of the property or right to the extent that it is properly available to satisfy those liabilities.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a reference to a property or right vested in or held on trust for a company includes a leasehold property but excludes a property or right held by the company on trust for any other person; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: a reference to a liability imposed on a property or right by law includes a liability that—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: is a charge or claim on the property or right; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: arises under an Ordinance that imposes rates, taxes or other charges.

section.name: s753
section.heading: Disclaimer of dissolved company’s property

subsection.content: If any property or right, other than immovable property situate in Hong Kong, is vested in the Government under section 752(1), the Registrar may, on his or her own initiative or on written application by a person interested in the property or right, disclaim the Government’s title to the property or right by a notice of disclaimer.

If the Registrar disclaims the Government’s title to any property or right on his or her own initiative, the Registrar must do so within 3 years after the date on which the fact that the property or right is vested in the Government under section 752(1) first came to the Registrar’s notice.
If the Registrar disclaims the Government’s title to any property or right on application by a person, the Registrar must do so within 3 months after the Registrar’s receipt of the application.
A notice of disclaimer is of no effect if it is signed after the end of the period within which the Government’s title to the property or right must be disclaimed under subsection (2) or (3).

subsection.leadIn: If a notice of disclaimer contains a statement that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the fact that the property or right is vested in the Government under section 752(1) first came to the Registrar’s notice on a date specified in the statement; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: no application for a disclaimer with respect to the property or right was received by the Registrar before a date specified in the statement,

subsection.continued: the statement is sufficient evidence of the matter stated in it unless the contrary is proved.

subsection.leadIn: The Registrar—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: must register a notice of disclaimer;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: must publish in the Gazette a copy of the notice; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: must send a copy of the notice to the person who made the application for the purposes of subsection (1).

subsection.content: The right to disclaim under this section may be waived by or on behalf of the Government either expressly, or by taking possession or other act showing an intention to waive the right.

section.name: s754
section.heading: Effect of disclaimer

subsection.content: If the Registrar disclaims the Government’s title to any property or right under section 753, the property or right is to be regarded as not having been vested in the Government under section 752(1).

subsection.leadIn: A disclaimer—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: terminates, with effect from the date of the disclaimer, the company’s rights, interests and liabilities in or in respect of the property or right disclaimed; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: except so far as is necessary for the purpose of releasing the company from any liability, does not affect any other person’s rights or liabilities.

section.name: s755
section.heading: Court may make vesting order

subsection.leadIn: On application by a person who—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: claims an interest in any property or right disclaimed under section 753; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: is subject to a liability in respect of such property or right that is not discharged by the disclaimer,

subsection.continued: the Court may make an order for the vesting of the property or right in, or its delivery to, a person entitled to it, or a person subject to the liability mentioned in paragraph (b), or a trustee for a person so entitled or subject.

subsection.content: An order may be made on the terms that the Court thinks fit.

An order for the vesting of a property or right in, or its delivery to, a person subject to a liability mentioned in subsection (1)(b), or a trustee for the person, may only be made if it appears to the Court that it would be just to do so for the purpose of compensating the person in respect of the disclaimer.
On the making of an order for the vesting of a property or right in, or its delivery to, a person, the property or right is vested in the person without conveyance, assignment or transfer.

section.name: s756
section.heading: Liabilities of directors etc. of dissolved company continue
section.content: Even though a company is dissolved under this Part, the liability (if any) of every director, manager and member of the company continues and may be enforced as if the company had not been dissolved.

section.name: s757
section.heading: Registrar may act as dissolved company’s or liquidator’s representative

subsection.leadIn: This section applies if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: a company has been dissolved under—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: this Part;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: section 226A, 227, 239 or 248 of the Companies (Winding Up and Miscellaneous Provisions) Ordinance (Cap. 32); or

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: section 291, 291A or 291AA of the predecessor Ordinance; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: it is proved to the Registrar’s satisfaction that—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the company, if still existing, would be legally or equitably bound to carry out, complete or give effect to a dealing, transaction or matter; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: in order to carry out, complete or give effect to the dealing, transaction or matter, a purely administrative act, that is not discretionary, should have been done by or on behalf of the company, or should be done by or on behalf of the company if still existing.

subsection.content: The Registrar may do the act, or cause the act to be done, as the company’s or the liquidator’s or provisional liquidator’s representative.

The Registrar may execute or sign any relevant instrument or document, adding a memorandum stating that the Registrar has done so as the company’s or the liquidator’s or provisional liquidator’s representative.
An instrument or document executed or signed by the Registrar under subsection (3) has the same effect as if the company, if still existing, had executed the instrument or document.

section.name: s758
section.heading: Former director must keep dissolved company’s books and papers for 6 years

subsection.content: If a company is dissolved under this Part or section 226A, 227, 239 or 248 of the Companies (Winding Up and Miscellaneous Provisions) Ordinance (Cap. 32), every person who was a director of the company immediately before the dissolution must ensure that the company’s books and papers are kept for at least 6 years after the date of the dissolution.
Subsection (1) does not apply to the books and papers that are otherwise required to be kept by another person under this Ordinance or any other Ordinance.
A person who contravenes subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable to a fine at level 3.

subsection.leadIn: If a person is charged with an offence under subsection (3), it is a defence to establish that the person had reasonable grounds to believe, and did believe, that a competent and reliable person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: was charged with the duty of ensuring that subsection (1) was complied with; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: was in a position to discharge that duty.

section.name: s759
section.heading: Court’s power to wind up dissolved companies
section.leadIn: The Court’s powers under the Companies (Winding Up and Miscellaneous Provisions) Ordinance (Cap. 32) to wind up a company are not affected by the fact that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the company’s name has been struck off the Companies Register under section 746 or 747 and the company is dissolved under that section; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the company has been deregistered, and is dissolved, under section 751.

section.name: s760
section.heading: Application to Registrar for restoration of company

subsection.leadIn: This section applies to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: a company whose name—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: has been struck off the Companies Register under section 746 or 747; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: has been struck off the register under section 291 of the predecessor Ordinance; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the company is dissolved under that section.

subsection.content: A person who was a director or member of the company may apply to the Registrar for the restoration of the company to the Companies Register.
An application must be made within 20 years after the date of the dissolution. For this purpose, an application is made when it is received by the Registrar.

subsection.leadIn: An application must be accompanied by a statement—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: that the applicant was a director or member of the company; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: that the conditions specified in section 761(2) are met.

subsection.content: The Registrar may accept the statement as sufficient evidence of the matters mentioned in subsection (4)(a) and (b).

section.name: s761
section.heading: Conditions for granting application

subsection.content: The Registrar must not grant an application made under section 760 unless all the conditions specified in subsection (2), and any other conditions that the Registrar thinks fit, are met.

subsection.leadIn: The conditions are—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: that the company was, at the time its name was struck off the Companies Register, in operation or carrying on business;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: that, if any immovable property situate in Hong Kong previously vested in or held on trust for the company has been vested in the Government under section 752(1), the Government has no objection to the restoration; (Amended 35 of 2018 s. 72)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: that the applicant has delivered to the Registrar the documents relating to the company that are necessary to bring up to date the records kept by the Registrar; and (Amended 35 of 2018 s. 72)

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: that the Government’s costs, expenses and liabilities in dealing with the property or right during the period of dissolution, or in connection with the proceedings on the application, have been paid or reimbursed by the applicant. (Added 35 of 2018 s. 72)

section.name: s762
section.heading: Registrar’s decision on application

subsection.content: The Registrar must notify the applicant of the decision on an application made under section 760.

If the Registrar grants the application, the company is restored to the Companies Register on the date on which notification is given under subsection (1), and the Registrar must register the notification and publish in the Gazette a notice of the restoration.

section.name: s763
section.heading: Registrar may restore company deregistered by mistake

subsection.content: The Registrar may, on his or her own initiative, restore a company to the Companies Register if satisfied that it has been deregistered, and is dissolved, under section 291AA of the predecessor Ordinance or section 751 as a result of a mistake of the Registrar.

In subsection (1), a reference to a mistake of the Registrar excludes a mistake that is made on the basis of wrong or false information given by the applicant in connection with the application for deregistration.

The Registrar may restore a company to the Companies Register by publishing in the Gazette a notice declaring the restoration, and the restoration takes effect on the date of publication of the notice.

section.name: s764
section.heading: Effect of restoration

subsection.content: If a company is restored to the Companies Register under this Subdivision, it is to be regarded as having continued in existence as if it had not been dissolved.

On application by any person, the Court may give directions, and make orders, as seem just for placing the company and all other persons in the same position as nearly as may be as if the company had not been dissolved.
An application for the purposes of subsection (2) must be made within 3 years after the date of the restoration.

section.name: s765
section.heading: Application to Court for restoration

subsection.leadIn: Where a company’s name or a company has been struck off the register under section 291 or 291A of the predecessor Ordinance, and the company is dissolved under that section, an application to the Court for the restoration of the company to the Companies Register may be made by a person who—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: was a director or member or creditor of the company; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: feels aggrieved by the striking off.

subsection.content: Where a company has been deregistered, and is dissolved, under section 291AA of the predecessor Ordinance, an application to the Court for the restoration of the company to the Companies Register may be made by a person who feels aggrieved by the deregistration.

subsection.leadIn: Subsection (4) applies if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a company’s name has been struck off the Companies Register under section 746, 747 or 748, and the company is dissolved under that section; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a company has been deregistered, and is dissolved, under section 751.

subsection.leadIn: An application to the Court for the restoration of the company to the Companies Register may be made—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: by a person who was a director or member or creditor of the company; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: by any other person, including the Government, who appears to the Court to have an interest in the matter.

section.name: s766
section.heading: When application must be made

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsections (2) and (4)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an application under section 765(1) must be made within 20 years after the date on which the notice was published in the Gazette under section 291(6), or on which the order was made under section 291A(1), of the predecessor Ordinance;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an application under section 765(2) must be made within 20 years of the deregistration; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: an application under section 765(4) must be made within 20 years after the date of the dissolution.

subsection.content: An application under section 765 may be made at any time if the purpose of the application is to enable a person to bring proceedings against the company for damages for personal injury.

subsection.leadIn: Subsection (4) applies if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a company’s name has been struck off the Companies Register under section 746 or 747, and the company is dissolved under that section;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an application has been made under section 760 for the restoration of the company to the Companies Register; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the Registrar has refused the application.

subsection.leadIn: An application under section 765(4) must be made—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: within 20 years after the date of the dissolution or any further time that the Court allows on application by the applicant; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the period of 20 years has ended, within 28 days after the Registrar gives notification of the refusal under section 762(1).

subsection.leadIn: In this section—

def.name: DamagesForPersonalInjury
def.leadIn: damages for personal injury (人身傷害損害賠償) includes—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any sum and damages claimed by virtue of section 20(2)(b)(i) of the Law Amendment and Reform (Consolidation) Ordinance (Cap. 23);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: damages under the Fatal Accidents Ordinance (Cap. 22); and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: any compensation for death or incapacity under section 5, 6 or 32 of the Employees’ Compensation Ordinance (Cap. 282);

subsection.def: personal injury (人身傷害) includes any disease and any impairment of a person’s physical or mental condition.

section.name: s767
section.heading: Court’s decision on application

subsection.leadIn: The Court may grant an application made under section 765(1) if satisfied that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the company was, at the time the company’s name or the company was struck off, in operation or carrying on business; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: it is otherwise just that the company be restored to the Companies Register.

subsection.content: The Court may grant an application made under section 765(2) if satisfied that it is just that the company be restored to the Companies Register.

subsection.leadIn: The Court may grant an application made under section 765(4) if satisfied that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: in the case of a company whose name has been struck off the Companies Register—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the company was, at the time its name was struck off, in operation or carrying on business; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: it is otherwise just that the company be restored to the Companies Register; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: in the case of a company that has been deregistered—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: any of the requirements specified in section 750(2)(a), (b), (c), (d) or (e) was not met; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: it is otherwise just that the company be restored to the Companies Register.

subsection.content: The Court must not grant an application made pursuant to section 766(2) if it appears to the Court that the proceedings would fail by reason of an Ordinance limiting the time within which proceedings may be brought.

In making a decision under subsection (4) not to grant an application, the Court must have regard to its power under section 768(2) to direct that the period between the dissolution of the company and the making of the Court’s order does not count for the purposes of the Ordinance.

If the Court grants an application made under section 765, the applicant must deliver to the Registrar for registration an office copy of the Court’s order, and the restoration takes effect on the registration.
After a company is restored to the Companies Register under subsection (6), the Registrar must publish in the Gazette a notice of the restoration.

section.name: s768
section.heading: Effect of restoration

subsection.content: If a company is restored to the Companies Register under section 767, it is to be regarded as having continued in existence as if it had not been dissolved.
The Court may give directions, and make orders, as seem just for placing the company and all other persons in the same position as nearly as may be as if the company had not been dissolved.

subsection.leadIn: The Court may also give directions as to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the delivery to the Registrar of the documents relating to the company that are necessary to bring up to date the records kept by the Registrar;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the payment of the Registrar’s costs in connection with the proceedings for the restoration of the company to the Companies Register; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: if any property or right previously vested in or held on trust for the company has been vested in the Government under section 752(1), the payment of the Government’s costs, expenses and liabilities in dealing with the property or right during the period of dissolution, or in connection with the proceedings on the application.

section.name: s769
section.heading: Company’s name on restoration
section.content: If a company is restored to the Companies Register under this Division, it is restored under its former name.

section.name: s770
section.heading: Company must change prohibited name

subsection.content: Subsection (2) applies if, had the company applied on the date of the restoration to be registered by the former name, section 100 would have prohibited the company from being registered by that name.

subsection.leadIn: Within 28 days after the restoration, the company—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: must by a special resolution change its name; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: must give notice in the specified form of the change to the Registrar.

subsection.leadIn: If a company gives notice of a change of name under subsection (2)(b), the Registrar must, unless the company is prohibited by section 100 from being registered by the new name—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: enter the new name on the Companies Register in place of the former name; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: issue a certificate of change of name.

subsection.content: The change of name has effect from the date on which the certificate of change of name is issued.

A change of name under this section does not affect any rights or obligations of the company or render defective any legal proceedings by or against it. Any legal proceedings that could have been commenced or continued by or against it by its former name may be commenced or continued by or against it by its new name.

If the company contravenes subsection (2) the company, and every responsible person of the company, commit an offence, and each is liable to a fine at level 3 and, in the case of a continuing offence, to a further fine of $300 for each day during which the offence continues.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: former name (前有名稱), in relation to a company restored to the Companies Register under this Division, means the name that the company had immediately before it was dissolved.

section.name: s771
section.heading: Registrar may direct company to change same or similar name etc.

subsection.leadIn: The Registrar may by notice in writing direct a company to change, within the period specified in the notice, a name under which the company is restored to the Companies Register under this Division if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the name is, as at the time of the restoration, the same as or in the Registrar’s opinion too like a name that appeared or should have appeared in the index of names kept under section 22C of the predecessor Ordinance or in the Index of Company Names; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the name is, as at the time of the restoration, the same as or in the Registrar’s opinion too like a name of a body corporate incorporated or established under an Ordinance.

subsection.content: A direction may only be given within 12 months after the restoration.
The Registrar may, before the end of the period specified in a notice given under subsection (1), by notice in writing extend the period.

If a company fails to comply with a direction within the period specified in the notice or extended under subsection (3), the company, and every responsible person of the company, commit an offence, and each is liable to a fine at level 6 and, in the case of a continuing offence, to a further fine of $2,000 for each day during which the offence continues.

section.name: s772
section.heading: Registrar may change company name in case of failure to comply with direction

subsection.leadIn: This section applies if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a company contravenes section 770(2) in relation to a name; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the Registrar directs a company to change a name under section 771(1), and the company fails to comply with the direction within the period specified in the notice or, if the period is extended under section 771(3), within the extended period. (Amended 14 of 2025 s. 56)

subsection.leadIn: Without limiting section 770(6) or 771(4), the Registrar may change the name to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the case of an English name, a name that consists of the words “Company Registration Number” as its prefix, followed by the registration number of the company as stated in the certificate of incorporation or the certificate of re-domiciliation;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the case of a Chinese name, a name that consists of the Chinese characters “公司註冊編號” as its prefix, followed by the registration number of the company as stated in the certificate of incorporation or the certificate of re-domiciliation; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: in the case of a name consisting of both an English name and a Chinese name—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: a new English name that consists of the words “Company Registration Number” as its prefix, followed by the registration number of the company as stated in the certificate of incorporation or the certificate of re-domiciliation; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: a new Chinese name that consists of the Chinese characters “公司註冊編號” as its prefix, followed by the registration number of the company as stated in the certificate of incorporation or the certificate of re-domiciliation. (Amended 14 of 2025 s. 56)

subsection.content: The Registrar must enter the new name in the Companies Register in place of the former name.
The change of name has effect from the date on which the new name is entered in the Companies Register.

subsection.leadIn: Within 30 days after the date of entering the new name in the Companies Register, the Registrar—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: must notify the company in writing of—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the fact that the name of the company has been changed;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the new name; and

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: the date on which the change takes effect under subsection (3); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: must publish a notice of that fact, the new name and that date in the Gazette.

subsection.content: A change of name under this section does not affect any rights or obligations of the company or render defective any legal proceedings by or against it. Any legal proceedings that could have been commenced or continued by or against it by its former name may be commenced or continued by or against it by its new name.

section.name: s773
section.heading: Effect of restoration on bona vacantia property or right

subsection.content: The Government may dispose of or otherwise deal with any property or right vested in it under section 292 of the predecessor Ordinance or section 752(1), or an interest in the property or right, in the same manner as it may dispose of or otherwise deal with any other property or right vested in it as bona vacantia, even though the company may be restored to the Companies Register under this Division or section 290 of the Companies (Winding Up and Miscellaneous Provisions) Ordinance (Cap. 32). (Amended 35 of 2018 s. 73)
Subsections (3), (4), (5) and (6) apply if the company is restored to the Companies Register.
The restoration does not affect the disposition or dealing.
Subsection (3) does not limit the effect of the restoration in relation to any other property or right previously vested in or held on trust for the company.

If any property, right or interest is still vested in the Government at the time of the restoration, it revests in the company subject to any liability, interest or claim that was attached to the property, right or interest immediately before the revest.

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (7), the Government must pay to the company—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: if the Government received any consideration for the property, right or interest disposed of or otherwise dealt with, an amount equal to—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the amount of the consideration; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the value of the consideration as at the date of the disposition or dealing; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if no consideration was received, an amount equal to the value of the property, right or interest disposed of or otherwise dealt with as at the date of the disposition or dealing.

subsection.content: There may be deducted from the amount payable under subsection (6) the Government’s reasonable costs in connection with the disposition or dealing to the extent that the costs have not been paid to the Government as a condition of a restoration under section 762 or pursuant to a direction under section 768.

part.name: P16
part.heading: Non-Hong Kong Companies

section.name: s774
section.heading: Interpretation

subsection.leadIn: In this Part—

def.name: ApprovedName
def.leadIn: approved name (經批准名稱), in relation to a registered non-Hong Kong company, means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the name entered in the Companies Register under section 782(5)(a) or 785(5)(a); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the name by which the company was registered by virtue of section 337B(3) of the predecessor Ordinance;

def.name: AuthorizedRepresentative
def.leadIn: authorized representative (獲授權代表), in relation to a registered non-Hong Kong company, means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a natural person resident in Hong Kong;

paragraph.name: b
c
paragraph.content: a corporate practice as defined by section 2(1) of the Accounting and Financial Reporting Council Ordinance (Cap. 588); (Amended L.N. 66 of 2022)

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: a firm of solicitors; or (Amended L.N. 66 of 2022)

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: a CPA firm as defined by section 2(1) of the Accounting and Financial Reporting Council Ordinance (Cap. 588), (Added L.N. 66 of 2022)

def.continued: that is authorized to accept on the company’s behalf service of any process or notice required to be served on the company;

subsection.def: domestic name (本土名稱), in relation to a non-Hong Kong company, means the name or names by which the company is registered in its place of incorporation;
place of business (營業地點) includes a share transfer office and a share registration office but excludes an office specified in subsection (3);
procedural regulations (《程序規例》) means regulations made under section 805;

def.name: RequiredDetails
def.leadIn: required details (所需細節), in relation to an authorized representative, means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the name and address in Hong Kong of the representative; (Amended 35 of 2018 s. 74)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the date on which the representative was authorized; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: in the case of a natural person—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the number of the representative’s identity card; or

subparagraph.name: ii

subsection.def: solicitor (律師) means a person who is qualified to act as a solicitor under the Legal Practitioners Ordinance (Cap. 159).

subsection.name: 1A
subsection.content: Subject to subsection (1B), the jurisdiction outside Hong Kong in which a non-Hong Kong company is incorporated and under the law of which it is registered as a company is the place of incorporation of the non-Hong Kong company. (Added 14 of 2025 s. 57)

subsection.name: 1B
subsection.leadIn: If, at any time after the incorporation of a non-Hong Kong company, the non-Hong Kong company—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: has transferred its domicile to a jurisdiction outside Hong Kong; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: is registered as a company under the law of that jurisdiction,

subsection.continued: the jurisdiction under the law of which the non-Hong Kong company is currently so registered is the place of incorporation of the non-Hong Kong company. (Added 14 of 2025 s. 57)

subsection.content: In this Part, a reference to a certified translation, in English or Chinese, of a domestic name is a reference to an English or Chinese translation of that name as shown in a certified translation, in English or Chinese (as the case may be), of the certificate of incorporation (or its equivalent) of the non-Hong Kong company.

The office specified for the purposes of the definition of place of business in subsection (1) is a local representative office established, or maintained, with the Monetary Authority’s approval, under section 46 of the Banking Ordinance (Cap. 155) by a bank as defined by subsection (9) of that section.
The Financial Secretary may, by notice published in the Gazette, amend subsection (3).

section.name: s775
section.heading: Certified copy

subsection.content: For the purposes of this Part, a copy of a document is a certified copy if it is certified as a true copy of the document by a person specified in subsection (2).

subsection.leadIn: The person is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: if the copy is certified in the non-Hong Kong company’s place of incorporation—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: an official of the government of that place to whose custody the original of the document is committed;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: a notary public practising in that place;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: a lawyer practising in that place;

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: a professional accountant practising in that place;

subparagraph.name: v
subparagraph.content: an officer of a court of law duly authorized by the law of that place to certify documents for any judicial or other legal purpose; or

subparagraph.name: vi
subparagraph.content: a professional company secretary practising in that place;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: if the copy is certified in Hong Kong—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: a notary public practising in Hong Kong;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: a solicitor practising in Hong Kong;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: a certified public accountant (practising);

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: an officer of the court in Hong Kong who is authorized by law to certify documents for any judicial or other legal purpose;

subparagraph.name: v
subparagraph.content: a consular officer of the non-Hong Kong company’s place of incorporation; or

subparagraph.name: vi
subparagraph.content: a professional company secretary practising in Hong Kong;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: an officer of the non-Hong Kong company; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: an authorized representative of the registered non-Hong Kong company.

subsection.content: The Secretary may, by notice published in the Gazette, amend subsection (2).

section.name: s776
section.heading: Certain non-Hong Kong companies must apply for registration

subsection.leadIn: This section applies to—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.leadIn: a non-Hong Kong company that—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: at that commencement date, has a place of business in Hong Kong established before the commencement date; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: had not complied with section 333 of the predecessor Ordinance as in force immediately before that commencement date; and (Amended 14 of 2025 s. 58)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a non-Hong Kong company whose registration is revoked under section 820F. (Added 14 of 2025 s. 58)

subsection.content: A non-Hong Kong company falling within subsection (1)(a) must, within one month after the establishment of the place of business, apply to the Registrar for registration as a registered non-Hong Kong company.

A non-Hong Kong company falling within subsection (1)(b) must, within one month after the commencement date of this Part, apply to the Registrar for registration as a registered non-Hong Kong company.

subsection.name: 3A
subsection.content: A non-Hong Kong company falling within the description in subsection (1)(c) must, within one month after the revocation order made under section 820F takes effect, apply to the Registrar for registration as a registered non-Hong Kong company. (Added 14 of 2025 s. 58)

subsection.leadIn: An application under subsection (2), (3) or (3A)— (Amended 14 of 2025 s. 58)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: must be in the specified form;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: must contain the particulars prescribed by procedural regulations;

paragraph.name: c
d
paragraph.content: must be accompanied by the documents prescribed by procedural regulations; and

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: must be delivered to the Registrar.

subsection.leadIn: If none of the non-Hong Kong company’s domestic names is in characters of the Latin alphabet or in Chinese, an application under subsection (2), (3) or (3A) must also contain— (Amended 35 of 2018 s. 75; 14 of 2025 s. 58)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: where the company has one domestic name, a certified translation of that name in English or Chinese, or both; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: where the company has more than one domestic name, a certified translation of one of those names in English or Chinese, or both.

subsection.content: If a non-Hong Kong company contravenes subsection (2), (3) or (3A), the company, every responsible person of the company, and every agent of the company who authorizes or permits the contravention, commit an offence, and each is liable to a fine at level 5 and, in the case of a continuing offence, to a further fine of $1,000 for each day during which the offence continues. (Amended 14 of 2025 s. 58)

section.name: s777
section.heading: Registration of non-Hong Kong company

subsection.content: On receiving an application under section 776(2) or (3), the Registrar must register the non-Hong Kong company as a registered non-Hong Kong company.

subsection.leadIn: If the application is not required by section 776(5) to contain a certified translation of a domestic name, the Registrar must enter in the Companies Register, as a corporate name—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the non-Hong Kong company’s domestic name in characters of the Latin alphabet, or that company’s domestic name in Chinese, or both; and (Amended 35 of 2018 s. 76)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the certified translation, in English or Chinese, of a domestic name (if any) contained in the application pursuant to procedural regulations.

subsection.content: If the application contains a certified translation of a domestic name for the purposes of section 776(5), the Registrar must enter that translation in the Companies Register as a corporate name.

subsection.leadIn: On registering a non-Hong Kong company under subsection (1), the Registrar—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: must issue to the company a certificate of registration, with the Registrar’s signature, certifying the registration; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: must register the application and accompanying documents.

division.name: D3
division.heading: Addition, Change or Cessation of Corporate Name

section.name: s778
section.heading: Company must notify Registrar of addition, change or cessation of name or translation of name

subsection.content: If, as a result of an addition of domestic name, a registered non-Hong Kong company has a new domestic name in characters of the Latin alphabet or in Chinese, the company must, within one month after the date of the addition, deliver to the Registrar for registration a return containing the particulars of the addition. (Amended 35 of 2018 s. 77)

If, as a result of a change to a domestic name, a registered non-Hong Kong company has a new domestic name, the company must, within one month after the date of the change, deliver to the Registrar for registration a return containing the particulars of the change.

subsection.leadIn: If a name of a registered non-Hong Kong company ceases to be a domestic name, the company must, within one month after the date of the cessation, deliver to the Registrar for registration a return—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: containing the particulars of the cessation; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: where, after the cessation, the company no longer has a name entered in the Companies Register as a corporate name, also containing the following particulars—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: at least one new domestic name in characters of the Latin alphabet or in Chinese; or (Amended 35 of 2018 s. 77)

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the certified translation, in English or Chinese, of at least one domestic name.

subsection.content: Subsection (2) or (3) does not apply unless the registered non-Hong Kong company is registered in the Companies Register by the domestic name or a translation of it.

subsection.leadIn: If—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a registered non-Hong Kong company does not have a corporate name in characters of the Latin alphabet, and the company adopts a certified translation, in English, of a domestic name, under which it is to carry on business in Hong Kong; or (Amended 35 of 2018 s. 77)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a registered non-Hong Kong company does not have a corporate name in Chinese, and the company adopts a certified translation, in Chinese, of a domestic name, under which it is to carry on business in Hong Kong,

subsection.continued: the company must, within one month after the date of the adoption, deliver to the Registrar for registration a return containing the particulars of the adoption and the certified translation of the domestic name.

subsection.content: If a translation of a domestic name of a registered non-Hong Kong company is entered in the Companies Register as a corporate name, and the company replaces the translation with another translation of the domestic name, under which it is to carry on business in Hong Kong, the company must, within one month after the date of the replacement, deliver to the Registrar for registration a return containing the particulars of the replacement and the certified translation of the domestic name.

subsection.leadIn: If a translation of a domestic name of a registered non-Hong Kong company is entered in the Companies Register as a corporate name, and the translation ceases to be a name under which it is to carry on business in Hong Kong, the company must, within one month after the date of the cessation, deliver to the Registrar for registration a return—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: containing the particulars of the cessation; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: where, after the cessation, the company no longer has a name entered in the Companies Register as a corporate name, also containing the following particulars—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: at least one new domestic name in characters of the Latin alphabet or Chinese; or (Amended 35 of 2018 s. 77)

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the certified translation, in English or Chinese, of at least one domestic name.

subsection.leadIn: A return under subsection (1), (2), (3), (5), (6) or (7)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: must be in the specified form; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: must be accompanied by the documents specified by the Registrar.

subsection.content: A return under subsection (2) must also contain a certified translation of the new domestic name in English or Chinese, or both, if the new domestic name is neither in characters of the Latin alphabet nor in Chinese. (Amended 35 of 2018 s. 77)

If a registered non-Hong Kong company contravenes subsection (1), (2), (3), (5), (6) or (7), the company, every responsible person of the company, and every agent of the company who authorizes or permits the contravention, commit an offence, and each is liable to a fine at level 3 and, in the case of a continuing offence, to a further fine of $300 for each day during which the offence continues.

section.name: s778A
section.heading: Supplementary provisions for section 778—where company incorporated outside Hong Kong ceases to be registered non-Hong Kong company because of registration under section 820C

subsection.leadIn: This section applies if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a company incorporated outside Hong Kong becomes a re-domiciled company (re-domiciliation); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: immediately before the re-domiciliation, the company is required, but has yet, to comply with a requirement under section 778 (requirement) to deliver a return to the Registrar for registration.

subsection.leadIn: Despite the re-domiciliation—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the company is required to comply with the requirement in relation to the return; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: section 778(10) applies to a non-compliance with the requirement by the company,

subsection.continued: as if the re-domiciliation had not taken place and the company were still a registered non-Hong Kong company.

section.name: s779
section.heading: Registration of corporate name

subsection.leadIn: If the Registrar receives a return under section 778(1), (2), (3), (5), (6) or (7), the Registrar—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: must make a note in the Companies Register to the effect that there is a change of corporate name;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: (if the return is delivered to the Registrar under that section not because of section 778A) must issue to the company concerned a fresh certificate of registration containing the current corporate name; and (Amended 14 of 2025 s. 60)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: must register the return and accompanying documents.

subsection.content: If the Registrar receives a return under section 778(1), the Registrar must also enter in the Companies Register, as a corporate name, the new domestic name to which the return relates. (Amended 14 of 2025 s. 60)

subsection.leadIn: If the Registrar receives a return under section 778(2), and the return is not required by section 778(9) to contain a certified translation of a new domestic name, the Registrar must also enter in the Companies Register, as a corporate name—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the new domestic name to which the return relates; and (Replaced 14 of 2025 s. 60)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the certified translation, in English or Chinese, of that domestic name (if any) contained in the return pursuant to procedural regulations.

subsection.content: If the Registrar receives a return under section 778(2), and the return contains a certified translation of a new domestic name for the purposes of section 778(9), the Registrar must also enter that translation in the Companies Register as a corporate name.

If the Registrar receives a return under section 778(3) or (7), and the return contains the particulars required by section 778(3)(b) or (7)(b), the Registrar must also enter in the Companies Register as a corporate name the new domestic name, or the certified translation of a domestic name, contained in the return.

If the Registrar receives a return under section 778(5) or (6), the Registrar must also enter in the Companies Register, as a corporate name, the certified translation of the domestic name contained in the return.

On a note being made under subsection (1)(a), a name entered in the Companies Register as an approved name in relation to the old corporate name is no longer an approved name, and the Registrar must make another note in the Companies Register to that effect.

On an entry being made under subsection (2) or (3), a translation of a domestic name of the company concerned that is entered in the Companies Register as a corporate name of the company is no longer a corporate name if it is in the same language as the new domestic name, and the Registrar must make a note in the Companies Register to that effect. (Amended 14 of 2025 s. 60)

division.name: D4
division.heading: Regulation of Names Used by Registered Non-Hong Kong Companies to Carry on Business in Hong Kong

section.name: s780
section.heading: Registrar may serve notice to regulate use of corporate names or approved names

subsection.leadIn: The Registrar may serve a notice on a registered non-Hong Kong company if satisfied that a corporate name or approved name of the company—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: is the same as or is too like—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: a name that appears, or should have appeared, in the index of names kept under section 22C of the predecessor Ordinance or in the Index of Company Names on the material date; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the name of a body corporate incorporated or established under an Ordinance before the material date; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: gives so misleading an indication of the nature of the company’s activities in Hong Kong as to be likely to cause harm to the public.

subsection.content: A notice must state the reasons for serving the notice.
A notice for the purposes of subsection (1)(a) must be served on a registered non-Hong Kong company within 6 months beginning on the material date.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—

def.name: MaterialDate
def.leadIn: material date (關鍵日期)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in relation to a domestic name, or a translation of a domestic name, of a registered non-Hong Kong company that is entered in the Companies Register under section 777 as a corporate name, means the date on which the certificate of registration was issued under that section;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in relation to a domestic name, or a translation of a domestic name, of a registered non-Hong Kong company that is entered in the Companies Register under section 779 as a corporate name, means the date on which the certificate of registration was issued under that section;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: in relation to a domestic name, or a translation of a domestic name, of a registered non-Hong Kong company that is entered in the Companies Register on a restoration of the company to the Companies Register, means the date of the restoration;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.leadIn: in relation to a domestic name, or a translation of a domestic name, of a registered non-Hong Kong company that has already been entered in the Companies Register as at the coming into operation of this Part, means—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the date on which the company complied with section 333 of the predecessor Ordinance; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: if the company has delivered a return for registration under section 335 of the predecessor Ordinance, the date on which the certificate of registration was issued under that section;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: in relation to a name that is entered in the Companies Register under section 782(5) or 785(5) as an approved name, means the date on which the certificate of registration was issued under that section; or

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: in relation to a name by which the registered non-Hong Kong company was registered by virtue of section 337B(3) of the predecessor Ordinance as an approved name, means the date of the registration.

section.name: s781
section.heading: Effect of notice

subsection.content: If a registered non-Hong Kong company is served with a notice under section 780(1) for a corporate name or approved name, the company must not, after the end of 2 months after the date of service, carry on business in Hong Kong under that name.

If a registered non-Hong Kong company contravenes subsection (1), the company, every responsible person of the company, and every agent of the company who authorizes or permits the contravention, commit an offence.

A person who commits an offence under subsection (2) is liable to a fine at level 6 and, in the case of a continuing offence, to a further fine of $2,000 for each day during which the offence continues.
This section does not invalidate any transaction entered into by the registered non-Hong Kong company.

section.name: s782
section.heading: Registration of approved name for carrying on business in Hong Kong

subsection.content: If a registered non-Hong Kong company is served with a notice under section 780(1) for a corporate name or for an approved name in relation to a corporate name, the company may apply, in writing, to the Registrar for approval of another name, in relation to the corporate name, under which the company is to carry on business in Hong Kong.
An application must be delivered to the Registrar.

subsection.leadIn: On receiving an application for approval of a name, the Registrar must approve the name unless satisfied that the name—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: is the same as or is too like—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: a name that appears, or should have appeared, in the Index of Company Names; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the name of a body corporate incorporated or established under an Ordinance; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: gives so misleading an indication of the nature of the registered non-Hong Kong company’s activities in Hong Kong as to be likely to cause harm to the public.

subsection.content: If the Registrar approves a name, the registered non-Hong Kong company may deliver to the Registrar for registration a return, in the specified form, specifying the name so approved.

subsection.leadIn: On receiving a return, the Registrar must, unless satisfied that the name specified in it is the same as a name that appears, or should have appeared, in the Index of Company Names—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: enter that specified name in the Companies Register as the name, in relation to the corporate name, under which the registered non-Hong Kong company is to carry on business in Hong Kong;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: issue to the company a fresh certificate of registration containing the corporate name and the name so entered; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: register the return.

subsection.content: On the issue of the fresh certificate of registration, the name entered in the Companies Register under subsection (5)(a) is, for all purposes of the law, the name under which the registered non-Hong Kong company is to carry on business in Hong Kong.
Subsection (6) does not affect any rights or obligations vested in the registered non-Hong Kong company under the name for which the notice is served on the company under section 780(1).

Subsection (6) does not render defective any legal proceedings by or against the registered non-Hong Kong company. If there are any legal proceedings that might have been commenced or continued by or against that company by the name for which the notice is served on that company under section 780(1), those proceedings may be commenced or continued by or against it by the name entered in the Companies Register under subsection (5)(a) as an approved name in relation to the corporate name.

section.name: s783
section.heading: Withdrawal of notice

subsection.content: After a registered non-Hong Kong company is served with a notice under section 780(1) for a corporate name or for an approved name in relation to a corporate name, the Registrar may, on written application by the company, withdraw the notice.
If the notice is withdrawn, section 781(1) ceases to apply to the registered non-Hong Kong company.

subsection.leadIn: If, after the notice is served, a name is entered in the Companies Register as an approved name in relation to the corporate name, the Registrar must, on withdrawing the notice—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: make a note in the Companies Register to the effect that the name is no longer an approved name; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: issue to the registered non-Hong Kong company a fresh certificate of registration containing the name for which the notice is served.

section.name: s784
section.heading: Appeal against decision to serve notice
section.content: Within 3 weeks after being served with a notice under section 780(1)(b) for a corporate name or for an approved name in relation to a corporate name, a registered non-Hong Kong company may appeal to the Administrative Appeals Board against the decision to serve the notice.

section.name: s785
section.heading: Change of approved name

subsection.content: A registered non-Hong Kong company may apply, in writing, to the Registrar for change of an approved name, in relation to a corporate name, under which the company is to carry on business in Hong Kong.
An application must be delivered to the Registrar.

subsection.leadIn: On receiving an application for change of an approved name, the Registrar must approve the new name unless satisfied that the new name—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: is the same as or is too like—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: a name that appears, or should have appeared, in the Index of Company Names; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the name of a body corporate incorporated or established under an Ordinance; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: gives so misleading an indication of the nature of the registered non-Hong Kong company’s activities in Hong Kong as to be likely to cause harm to the public.

subsection.content: If the Registrar approves a new name, the registered non-Hong Kong company may deliver to the Registrar for registration a return, in the specified form, specifying the new name so approved.

subsection.leadIn: On receiving a return, the Registrar must, unless satisfied that the new name specified in it is the same as a name that appears, or should have appeared, in the Index of Company Names—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: enter the new name in the Companies Register as the name, in relation to the corporate name, under which the registered non-Hong Kong company is to carry on business in Hong Kong;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: make a note in the Companies Register to the effect that there is a change of approved name;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: issue to the company a fresh certificate of registration containing the corporate name and the new approved name; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: register the return.

subsection.content: On the issue of the fresh certificate of registration, the new approved name is, for all purposes of the law, the name under which the registered non-Hong Kong company is to carry on business in Hong Kong.
Subsection (6) does not affect any rights or obligations vested in the registered non-Hong Kong company under the corporate name or the old approved name.

Subsection (6) does not render defective any legal proceedings by or against the registered non-Hong Kong company. If there are any legal proceedings that might have been commenced or continued by or against that company by the corporate name or the old approved name, those proceedings may be commenced or continued by or against it by the new approved name in relation to the corporate name.

division.name: D5
division.heading: Authorized Representatives of Registered Non-Hong Kong Companies

section.name: s786
section.heading: Company must keep authorized representative’s required details registered in Companies Register

subsection.leadIn: This section applies if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a person is registered in the Companies Register as an authorized representative of a registered non-Hong Kong company;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the person ceases to be an authorized representative of the non-Hong Kong company; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: after the cessation, no person is registered in the Companies Register as an authorized representative of the non-Hong Kong company.

subsection.content: For the purposes of subsection (1)(b), it is irrelevant, that at the time of the cessation, the company is no longer a registered non-Hong Kong company by virtue of section 794(3) or 798(3).

Within one month after the person ceases to be an authorized representative of the non-Hong Kong company, that company must deliver to the Registrar for registration under section 791(1) a return in respect of another person as an authorized representative of the company.

Subsection (3) does not apply to the non-Hong Kong company if, when the person ceases to be an authorized representative of that company, it has ceased to have a place of business in Hong Kong for at least 11 months.

If a non-Hong Kong company contravenes subsection (3), the company, every responsible person of the company, and every agent of the company who authorizes or permits the contravention, commit an offence, and each is liable to a fine at level 5 and, in the case of a continuing offence, to a further fine of $1,000 for each day during which the offence continues.

section.name: s787
section.heading: Termination of authorization

subsection.content: A person registered in the Companies Register as an authorized representative of a registered non-Hong Kong company may terminate the authorization by sending to the company’s registered office (or the equivalent) in its place of incorporation a written notice of termination stating the date of termination.

A registered non-Hong Kong company may terminate the authorization of a person registered in the Companies Register as an authorized representative of the company by sending to the person’s address shown in the Companies Register a written notice of termination stating the date of termination.
After sending a notice of termination under subsection (1) or (2), the sender must, within one month after the date of the notice, notify the Registrar, in writing, of the date of termination.
Subsection (3) does not apply to the sender if, at the time when the notice is sent, the registered non-Hong Kong company has ceased to have a place of business in Hong Kong for at least 11 months.

subsection.leadIn: A notification under subsection (3)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: must be in the specified form; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: must be accompanied by the documents prescribed by procedural regulations.

subsection.leadIn: A notification under subsection (3)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if given by a person registered as an authorized representative of a registered non-Hong Kong company, must contain a statement by the person that the company has been notified of the termination under subsection (1); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if given by a registered non-Hong Kong company, must contain a statement by the company that the person registered as an authorized representative of the company has been notified of the termination under subsection (2).

subsection.leadIn: If an authorization is terminated under subsection (1) or (2), the termination takes effect on whichever is the later of the following—
