paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the date of termination stated in the notice of termination;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the expiration of 21 days after subsection (3) is complied with.

subsection.content: In this section, a reference to a registered non-Hong Kong company includes a non-Hong Kong company that is no longer a registered non-Hong Kong company by virtue of section 794(3) or 798(3).

section.name: s787A
section.heading: Supplementary provisions for section 787—where company incorporated outside Hong Kong ceases to be registered non-Hong Kong company because of registration under section 820C

subsection.leadIn: Subsections (2) and (3) apply if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a company incorporated outside Hong Kong becomes a re-domiciled company (re-domiciliation);

paragraph.name: b
c
paragraph.content: immediately before the re-domiciliation, the sender of the notice is required, but has yet, to comply with the requirement under section 787(3) (requirement).

subsection.content: Despite the re-domiciliation, the sender of the notice is required to comply with the requirement, as if the re-domiciliation had not taken place and the company were still a registered non-Hong Kong company.

subsection.leadIn: If the sender is required to comply with the requirement because of subsection (2)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: section 787(7) does not apply; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the termination takes effect on the re-domiciliation date.

subsection.content: Subsection (5) applies in any other case where there is a re-domiciliation.

subsection.leadIn: A person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: who was registered in the Companies Register before the re-domiciliation as an authorized representative of the company concerned; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: who was an authorized representative of the company immediately before the re-domiciliation,

subsection.continued: is no longer such an authorized representative once the re-domiciliation takes place, and the authorization ceases to have effect on the re-domiciliation date.

division.name: D6
division.heading: Returns and Accounts of Registered Non-Hong Kong Companies

section.name: s788
section.heading: Company must deliver annual return for registration

subsection.content: Within 42 days after each anniversary of the date on which the certificate of registration was issued under section 777(4)(a) or the predecessor Ordinance, a registered non-Hong Kong company must deliver to the Registrar a return for registration.

subsection.leadIn: A return—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: must be in the specified form;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: must contain the particulars prescribed by procedural regulations; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: must be accompanied by the documents prescribed by procedural regulations.

subsection.content: If a registered non-Hong Kong company contravenes subsection (1), the company, every responsible person of the company, and every agent of the company who authorizes or permits the contravention, commit an offence, and each is liable to a fine at level 5 and, in the case of a continuing offence, to a further fine of $1,000 for each day during which the offence continues.

If a registered non-Hong Kong company, or an officer or agent of a registered non-Hong Kong company, is convicted of an offence under subsection (3), the magistrate may, in addition to any penalty that may be imposed, order the company, or the officer or agent, to deliver to the Registrar a return for registration within a time specified in the order.

If a registered non-Hong Kong company, or an officer or agent of a registered non-Hong Kong company, fails to comply with an order under subsection (4), the company, or the officer or agent, commits an offence and is liable to a fine at level 5 and, in the case of a continuing offence, to a further fine of $1,000 for each day during which the offence continues.

section.name: s788A
section.heading: Supplementary provisions for section 788—where company incorporated outside Hong Kong ceases to be registered non-Hong Kong company because of registration under section 820C

subsection.leadIn: This section applies if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a company incorporated outside Hong Kong becomes a re-domiciled company (re-domiciliation); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: immediately before the re-domiciliation, the company is required, but has yet, to comply with the requirement under section 788(1) (requirement) in relation to an anniversary mentioned in that section.

subsection.leadIn: Despite the re-domiciliation—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the company is required to comply with the requirement in relation to the anniversary;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: section 788(3) applies to the non-compliance with the requirement by the company;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: section 788(4) applies to the conviction of an offence for the non-compliance with the requirement; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: section 788(5) applies to a failure to comply with an order made under section 788(4) (as applied by paragraph (c)),

subsection.continued: as if the re-domiciliation had not taken place and the company were still a registered non-Hong Kong company.

section.name: s789
section.heading: Company must deliver accounts for registration

subsection.leadIn: This section applies if a registered non-Hong Kong company is required to publish its accounts, or to deliver copies of its accounts to any person in whose office the accounts may be inspected as of right by members of the public—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: by the law of its place of incorporation; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: by either of the following, but not by the law of its place of incorporation—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the law of any other jurisdiction where it is registered as a company;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the rules of any stock exchange or similar regulatory bodies in that jurisdiction.

subsection.leadIn: When the registered non-Hong Kong company delivers to the Registrar a return for registration under section 788, it must also deliver to the Registrar for registration—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the case of subsection (1)(a), a certified copy of its latest published accounts for a period of at least 12 months that comply with the law of its place of incorporation; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the case of subsection (1)(b), a certified copy of its latest published accounts for a period of at least 12 months that comply with any of the law or rules mentioned in subparagraphs (i) and (ii) of that subsection.

subsection.content: If a registered non-Hong Kong company contravenes subsection (2), the company, every responsible person of the company, and every agent of the company who authorizes or permits the contravention, commit an offence, and each is liable to a fine at level 5 and, in the case of a continuing offence, to a further fine of $1,000 for each day during which the offence continues.

If a registered non-Hong Kong company, or a responsible person or an agent of a registered non-Hong Kong company, is convicted of an offence under subsection (3), the magistrate may, in addition to any penalty that may be imposed, order the company, or the responsible person or agent, to deliver to the Registrar the certified copy of any accounts mentioned in subsection (2)(a) or (b) for registration within a time specified in the order. (Amended 35 of 2018 s. 78)

If a registered non-Hong Kong company, or a responsible person or an agent of a registered non-Hong Kong company, fails to comply with an order under subsection (4), the company, or the responsible person or agent, commits an offence and is liable to a fine at level 5 and, in the case of a continuing offence, to a further fine of $1,000 for each day during which the offence continues. (Amended 35 of 2018 s. 78)
In this section, a reference to a certified copy of any accounts is, if the accounts are not in English or Chinese, a reference to a certified translation of the accounts in English or Chinese.

section.name: s789A
section.heading: Supplementary provisions for section 789—where company incorporated outside Hong Kong ceases to be registered non-Hong Kong company because of registration under section 820C

subsection.leadIn: This section applies if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a company incorporated outside Hong Kong becomes a re-domiciled company (re-domiciliation);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: section 789(1) applied to the company before the re-domiciliation; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a return is required to be delivered for registration under section 788 because of section 788A.

subsection.content: The company is required to comply with the requirement under section 789(2) (requirement) in relation to the return.

subsection.leadIn: If there is a non-compliance with the requirement by the company in relation to the return—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: section 789(3) applies to the non-compliance with the requirement;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: section 789(4) applies to the conviction of an offence for the non-compliance; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: section 789(5) applies to a failure to comply with an order made under section 789(4) (as applied by paragraph (b)),

subsection.continued: as if the re-domiciliation had not taken place and the company were still a registered non-Hong Kong company.

section.name: s790
section.heading: Directors may revise accounts not complying with certain requirement

subsection.content: If a certified copy of any accounts has been delivered to the Registrar for registration under section 336 of the predecessor Ordinance or section 789, and it appears to the directors of the company that the accounts did not comply with the regulatory requirement specified in subsection (2), those directors may revise the accounts.

subsection.leadIn: The regulatory requirement is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in relation to the accounts of a company to which section 336(1) of the predecessor Ordinance or section 789(1)(a) applies, the law of its place of incorporation; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: in relation to the accounts of a company to which section 336(2) of the predecessor Ordinance or section 789(1)(b) applies— (Amended 14 of 2025 s. 65)

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the law of any other jurisdiction where it is registered as a company; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the rules of any stock exchange or similar regulatory bodies in that jurisdiction.

subsection.leadIn: A revision of the accounts must be confined to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: those aspects in which the accounts did not comply with the regulatory requirement specified in subsection (2); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: other necessary consequential revisions.

subsection.content: If the directors of the company decide to revise any accounts under subsection (1), the company must, within 15 days after the decision, deliver to the Registrar for registration a warning statement, in the specified form, that the accounts will be so revised.

If the company contravenes subsection (4), the company, every responsible person of the company, and every agent of the company who authorizes or permits the contravention, commit an offence, and each is liable to a fine at level 5 and, in the case of a continuing offence, to a further fine of $1,000 for each day during which the offence continues.

section.name: s791
section.heading: Company must deliver return for registration in case of change of certain particulars

subsection.content: If there is, in relation to a registered non-Hong Kong company, a change specified in subsection (2), the company must, within one month after the date of the change, deliver to the Registrar for registration a return containing the particulars of the change.

subsection.leadIn: The change is one made in—

paragraph.name: a
b
c
paragraph.content: the particulars of the directors, company secretary (or, where there are joint company secretaries, each of them) or authorized representatives of the company delivered to the Registrar under this Part;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the address of the company’s principal place of business in Hong Kong or of its registered office (or the equivalent), or its principal place of business, in its place of incorporation; or

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: the place of incorporation of the company. (Added 14 of 2025 s. 66)

subsection.leadIn: A return—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: must be in the specified form;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: must contain the particulars prescribed by procedural regulations; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: must be accompanied by the documents prescribed by procedural regulations.

subsection.content: If the registered non-Hong Kong company is not allowed under section 56(7)(b) to state in a return under this section that a director’s correspondence address is changed to an address other than the address specified in section 56(7)(b)(i) or (ii), this section does not apply in relation to that change.

If a registered non-Hong Kong company contravenes subsection (1) in respect of a change specified in subsection (2)(a), the company, every responsible person of the company, and every agent of the company who authorizes or permits the contravention, commit an offence, and each is liable on conviction to a fine at level 3 and, in the case of a continuing offence, to a further fine of $300 for each day during which the offence continues.

If a registered non-Hong Kong company contravenes subsection (1) in respect of a change specified in subsection (2)(b) or (c), the company, every responsible person of the company, and every agent of the company who authorizes or permits the contravention, commit an offence, and each is liable on conviction to a fine at level 4 and, in the case of a continuing offence, to a further fine of $700 for each day during which the offence continues.

If a registered non-Hong Kong company contravenes subsection (1) in respect of a change specified in subsection (2)(d), the company, every responsible person of the company, and every agent of the company who authorizes or permits the contravention, commit an offence, and each is liable on conviction to a fine at level 5 and, in the case of a continuing offence, to a further fine of $1,000 for each day during which the offence continues.

If a registered non-Hong Kong company contravenes subsection (1) in respect of a change specified in subsection (2)(e), the company, every responsible person of the company, and every agent of the company who authorizes or permits the contravention, commit an offence, and each is liable on conviction to a fine at level 5 and, in the case of a continuing offence, to a further fine of $1,000 for each day during which the offence continues. (Added 14 of 2025 s. 66)

section.name: s791A
section.heading: Supplementary provisions for section 791—where company incorporated outside Hong Kong ceases to be registered non-Hong Kong company because of registration under section 820C

subsection.leadIn: This section applies if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a company incorporated outside Hong Kong becomes a re-domiciled company (re-domiciliation); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: immediately before the re-domiciliation, the company is required, but has yet, to comply with the requirement under section 791(1) (requirement) in relation to a change specified in section 791(2).

subsection.leadIn: Despite the re-domiciliation—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the company is required to comply with the requirement in relation to the change; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: section 791(5), (6), (7) or (8) (as the case requires) applies to the non-compliance with the requirement,

subsection.continued: as if the re-domiciliation had not taken place and the company were still a registered non-Hong Kong company.

section.name: s793
section.heading: Registered non-Hong Kong company must notify Registrar of commencement of liquidation etc.

subsection.leadIn: Within 15 days after the later of the dates specified in subsection (2), a registered non-Hong Kong company must deliver to the Registrar for registration a notice, in the specified form, containing—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the particulars specified in subsection (3); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if a person is appointed as liquidator or provisional liquidator, the further particulars specified in subsection (4).

subsection.leadIn: The dates are—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the date of commencement of any proceedings for the liquidation of the registered non-Hong Kong company; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the date on which the notice of commencement of such proceedings was served on the company according to the law of the place in which those proceedings are commenced.

subsection.leadIn: The particulars are—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the date of commencement of the proceedings for the liquidation of the registered non-Hong Kong company;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the country where the proceedings are commenced; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: whether the liquidation is a voluntary or compulsory liquidation, or is in another mode of liquidation as specified in the notice under subsection (1).

subsection.leadIn: The further particulars are—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: whether the person is appointed as liquidator or provisional liquidator;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: whether the person is a sole liquidator, or one of the joint, or joint and several, liquidators;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the date of the appointment; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.leadIn: the following details of the person—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: in the case of a natural person, the present forename and surname, the address, and the number of the identity card or, if the person does not have an identity card, the number and issuing country of any passport held by the person; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: in any other case, the name and the address.

subsection.leadIn: Subsection (6) applies if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any change occurs in the particulars contained in a notice under subsection (1);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a liquidator or provisional liquidator is appointed after such a notice is delivered to the Registrar for registration; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the liquidator or provisional liquidator whose name is contained in such a notice has ceased to hold office as such.

subsection.content: Within 15 days after the change, appointment or cessation, the registered non-Hong Kong company must deliver to the Registrar for registration a notice, in the specified form, containing the particulars of the change, the further particulars specified in subsection (4) of the liquidator or provisional liquidator appointed, or the date of the cessation to hold office as liquidator or provisional liquidator.

If a registered non-Hong Kong company contravenes subsection (1) or (6), the company, every responsible person of the company, and every agent of the company who authorizes or permits the contravention, commit an offence, and each is liable to a fine at level 3 and, in the case of a continuing offence, to a further fine of $300 for each day during which the offence continues.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: forename (名字) includes a Christian or given name;
surname (姓氏), in the case of a person usually known by a title different from the person’s surname, means the title.

section.name: s794
section.heading: Registered non-Hong Kong company must notify Registrar of cessation of place of business in Hong Kong

subsection.content: If a registered non-Hong Kong company ceases to have a place of business in Hong Kong, the company must, within 7 days after the cessation, deliver to the Registrar a notice, in the specified form, of that fact.

subsection.leadIn: On receiving a notice, the Registrar—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: must register the notice in relation to the registered non-Hong Kong company; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: must enter in the Companies Register a statement that the company has ceased to have a place of business in Hong Kong.

subsection.content: On the entry of the statement in the Companies Register under subsection (2)(b), the company is no longer a registered non-Hong Kong company.

If a registered non-Hong Kong company contravenes subsection (1), the company, every responsible person of the company, and every agent of the company who authorizes or permits the contravention, commit an offence, and each is liable to a fine at level 3 and, in the case of a continuing offence, to a further fine of $300 for each day during which the offence continues.

section.name: s795
section.heading: Authorized representative of registered non-Hong Kong company must notify Registrar of dissolution

subsection.leadIn: If a registered non-Hong Kong company is dissolved, an authorized representative of the company must, within 15 days after the date of dissolution, deliver to the Registrar—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a notice, in the specified form, of that fact; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a certified copy of the instrument effecting the dissolution or, in the case of an instrument not in English or Chinese, a certified translation of the instrument in English or Chinese.

subsection.leadIn: On receiving a notice and document under subsection (1), the Registrar—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: must register the notice and document in relation to the registered non-Hong Kong company; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: must enter in the Companies Register a statement that the company has been dissolved.

subsection.content: On the entry of the statement in the Companies Register under subsection (2)(b), the company is no longer a registered non-Hong Kong company.

If an authorized representative of a registered non-Hong Kong company contravenes subsection (1), the authorized representative commits an offence and is liable to a fine at level 3 and, in the case of a continuing offence, to a further fine of $300 for each day during which the offence continues.

If a person is charged with an offence under subsection (4), it is a defence to establish that the person did not know, and had no reason to believe, that the registered non-Hong Kong company was dissolved.

section.name: s796
section.heading: Registrar may send inquiry letter to registered non-Hong Kong company

subsection.content: If the Registrar has reasonable cause to believe that a registered non-Hong Kong company has ceased to have a place of business in Hong Kong, the Registrar may send to the company by post a letter inquiring whether the company has ceased to have a place of business in Hong Kong.

subsection.leadIn: A letter must be addressed—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to an authorized representative of the registered non-Hong Kong company whose required details are shown in the Companies Register; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if no required details of authorized representatives of the company are shown in the Companies Register, to any place of business established by the company in Hong Kong.

subsection.content: If the Registrar is of the opinion that a letter under subsection (1) is unlikely to be received by the registered non-Hong Kong company, the Registrar may, instead of sending a letter under that subsection, publish in the Gazette a notice that, unless cause is shown to the contrary, the company’s name will be struck off the Companies Register, and the company will no longer be a registered non-Hong Kong company, at the end of 3 months after the date of the notice.

section.name: s797
section.heading: Registrar must follow up under certain circumstances

subsection.leadIn: This section applies if, within one month after sending a letter under section 796(1)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Registrar does not receive a reply to the letter; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the Registrar receives a reply to the letter to the effect that the registered non-Hong Kong company has ceased to have a place of business in Hong Kong.

subsection.leadIn: The Registrar must, within 30 days after the end of that one month—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: subject to subsection (4), send to the registered non-Hong Kong company by registered post another letter—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: referring to the letter sent under section 796(1); and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.leadIn: stating that—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: no reply to it has been received; or

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: the Registrar has received a reply to it to the effect that the company has ceased to have a place of business in Hong Kong; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: publish in the Gazette a notice that, unless cause is shown to the contrary, the company’s name will be struck off the Companies Register, and the company will no longer be a registered non-Hong Kong company, at the end of 3 months after the date of the notice.

subsection.leadIn: A letter must be addressed—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to an authorized representative of the registered non-Hong Kong company whose required details are shown in the Companies Register; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if no required details of authorized representatives of the company are shown in the Companies Register, to any place of business established by the company in Hong Kong.

subsection.content: The Registrar is not required to send a letter to the registered non-Hong Kong company under subsection (2)(a) if the Registrar is of the opinion that the letter is unlikely to be received by the company.

section.name: s798
section.heading: Registrar may strike off registered non-Hong Kong company’s name

subsection.content: After publishing a notice under section 796(3) or 797(2)(b), the Registrar may, unless cause is shown to the contrary, strike the registered non-Hong Kong company’s name off the Companies Register at the end of 3 months after the date of the notice.
The Registrar must publish in the Gazette a notice indicating that the non-Hong Kong company’s name has been struck off the Companies Register.
On publication of the notice under subsection (2), the non-Hong Kong company is no longer a registered non-Hong Kong company.
Subject to subsection (5), the non-Hong Kong company must not have a place of business in Hong Kong as long as it is not a registered non-Hong Kong company.

Subsection (4) does not prohibit the non-Hong Kong company from having a place of business in Hong Kong that is established after the publication of the notice under subsection (2) if it applies for registration under section 776(2) within one month after establishing that place of business.

If a non-Hong Kong company contravenes subsection (4), the company, every responsible person of the company, and every agent of the company who authorizes or permits the contravention, commit an offence, and each is liable to a fine at level 5 and, in the case of a continuing offence, to a further fine of $1,000 for each day during which the offence continues.

section.name: s799
section.heading: Application to Registrar for restoration of non-Hong Kong company

subsection.leadIn: This section applies if a non-Hong Kong company’s name—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: has been struck off the Companies Register under section 798; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: has been struck off the register of companies by virtue of section 339A(2) of the predecessor Ordinance.

subsection.content: A person who is a director or member of the non-Hong Kong company may apply to the Registrar for the restoration of the company to the Companies Register.
An application must be made within 6 years after the date of the striking off. For this purpose, an application is made when it is received by the Registrar.

subsection.leadIn: An application must be accompanied by a statement—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: that the applicant is a director or member of the non-Hong Kong company; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: that the conditions specified in section 800(2) are met.

subsection.content: The Registrar may accept the statement as sufficient evidence of the matters mentioned in subsection (4)(a) and (b).

section.name: s800
section.heading: Conditions for granting application

subsection.content: The Registrar must not grant an application made under section 799 unless all the conditions specified in subsection (2), and any other conditions that the Registrar thinks fit, are met.

subsection.leadIn: The conditions are—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: that the non-Hong Kong company had at the time of the application, and at any time within the period of 6 months before its name was struck off the Companies Register, a place of business in Hong Kong; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: that the applicant has delivered to the Registrar the documents relating to the non-Hong Kong company that are necessary to bring up to date the records kept by the Registrar.

section.name: s801
section.heading: Registrar’s decision on application

subsection.content: The Registrar must notify the applicant of the decision on an application made under section 799.

If the Registrar grants the application, the non-Hong Kong company is restored to the Companies Register on the date on which notification is given under subsection (1), and the Registrar must register the notification and publish in the Gazette a notice of the restoration.
On the restoration, the striking off is to be regarded as not having taken place.

section.name: s802
section.heading: Registrar to keep index of directors

subsection.content: The Registrar must keep an index of every person who is a director of a registered non-Hong Kong company.

subsection.leadIn: The particulars contained in the index must, in respect of each director, include—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the name and address of the director;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the latest particulars sent to the Registrar in respect of the director;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the name of each company or registered non-Hong Kong company of which the director can be identified as a director.

subsection.content: The index kept under this section must be open to the inspection of any person on payment of a prescribed fee.

subsection.leadIn: Despite subsection (3), the following particulars contained in the index must not be open for inspection under that subsection—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the usual residential address of the director;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the full number of the identity card or passport of the director.

subsection.content: Subsection (4) does not affect the inclusion in the index of a correspondence address of the director, nor does it affect the inspection of the correspondence address under subsection (3), even if the correspondence address is the same as the usual residential address of the director.

section.name: s803
section.heading: Service of process or notice

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsections (3) and (4), any process or notice required to be served on a registered non-Hong Kong company is sufficiently served if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: it is addressed to an authorized representative of the company whose required details are shown in the Companies Register; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: it is left at, or sent by post to, the representative’s last known address in Hong Kong. (Amended 35 of 2018 s. 80)

subsection.leadIn: Subsections (3) and (4) apply if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: no required details of authorized representatives of a registered non-Hong Kong company are shown in the Companies Register; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: every one of the company’s authorized representatives refuses to accept service on behalf of the company or the process or notice cannot be served on any of them.

subsection.content: Any process or notice required to be served on the registered non-Hong Kong company is sufficiently served if it is left at, or sent by post to, any place of business established by the company in Hong Kong.

subsection.leadIn: In the case of a registered non-Hong Kong company that no longer has a place of business in Hong Kong, any process or notice required to be served on the company is sufficiently served—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: if—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: it is sent by registered post to the company’s registered office (or the equivalent) in the company’s place of incorporation at the address as shown in the Companies Register; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: a copy of it is sent by registered post to the company’s principal place of business (if any) in the company’s place of incorporation at the address as shown in the Companies Register; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: where no such addresses are shown in the Companies Register, if it is left at, or sent by post to, any place in Hong Kong at which the company has had a place of business within the previous 12 months.

subsection.leadIn: Any process or notice required to be served on a non-Hong Kong company (other than a registered non-Hong Kong company) is sufficiently served—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the case of a company that has established a place of business in Hong Kong, if it is left at, or sent by post to, the place of business; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: in the case of a company that has established, but no longer has, a place of business in Hong Kong—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.leadIn: if—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: it is sent by registered post to the company’s registered office (or the equivalent) in the company’s place of incorporation; and

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: a copy of it is sent by registered post to the company’s principal place of business (if any) in the company’s place of incorporation; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: where the address of such registered office, or principal place of business, cannot be ascertained but the company has had a place of business in Hong Kong within the previous 12 months, if it is left at, or sent by post to, the place of business in Hong Kong.

section.name: s804
section.heading: Financial Secretary may make regulations

subsection.content: The Financial Secretary may make regulations providing for the application of this Ordinance in relation to the accounts that have been revised under section 790.

subsection.leadIn: The regulations may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: make different provisions according to whether the accounts have been revised by—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: supplementing the accounts with another document that shows the revisions; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: replacing the accounts;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: require a company incorporated outside Hong Kong to which section 790 applies to take the steps specified in the regulations in relation to the accounts that have been revised; and (Amended 14 of 2025 s. 68)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: apply this Ordinance to the accounts that have been revised subject to such additions, exceptions and modifications as are specified in the regulations.

subsection.leadIn: The regulations may provide that any of the following is an offence, punishable by a fine or imprisonment, or both—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: a failure to take all reasonable steps to secure compliance as respects the accounts that have been revised with—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: a specified provision of the regulations; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: a specified provision of this Ordinance as having effect under the regulations;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: a contravention of—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: a specified provision of the regulations; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: a specified provision of this Ordinance as having effect under the regulations.

subsection.content: The maximum fine that may be prescribed for an offence committed wilfully is $300,000 and the maximum imprisonment is 12 months. The maximum fine that may be prescribed for an offence not committed wilfully is $300,000. In addition, in the case of a continuing offence, a further fine not exceeding $2,000 for each day during which the offence continues may be prescribed.
The regulations may provide for defences to any such offence.

section.name: s805
section.heading: Financial Secretary may make regulations

subsection.leadIn: The Financial Secretary may make regulations prescribing—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the particulars to be contained in an application under section 776(2) or (3);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the documents to accompany an application under section 776(2) or (3);

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the documents to accompany a notification under section 787(3);

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the particulars to be contained in a return under section 788(1) or 791(1); and

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: the documents to accompany a return under section 788(1) or 791(1).

subsection.leadIn: The Financial Secretary may make regulations—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: providing that an application under section 776(2) or (3), or a return under section 778(2), may contain a certified translation of a domestic name of the non-Hong Kong company; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: providing for the procedures and requirements for the purpose.

subsection.content: Subsection (2) does not apply to an application or return that is required by section 776(5) or 778(9) to contain a certified translation of a domestic name.

section.name: s805A
section.heading: Requirement to disclose non-Hong Kong company’s name etc.

subsection.leadIn: The Financial Secretary may make regulations to require non-Hong Kong companies—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to display prescribed information in prescribed locations;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to state prescribed information in prescribed descriptions of documents or communications; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: to provide prescribed information on request to those they deal with in the course of their business.

subsection.leadIn: The regulations—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: may in prescribed circumstances require disclosure of the name of a non-Hong Kong company;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: may make provision as to the manner in which any prescribed information is to be displayed, stated or provided; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: may exempt a non-Hong Kong company from any requirement of the regulations made under subsection (1).

subsection.content: The regulations may provide that, for the purposes of any requirement to disclose a non-Hong Kong company’s name, any variation between a word or words required to be part of the name and a permitted abbreviation of that word or those words (or vice versa) is to be disregarded.

section.name: s805B
section.heading: Criminal consequences of failure to make required disclosures
section.leadIn: Regulations made under section 805A may provide that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: if a non-Hong Kong company contravenes any of the regulations made under that section, an offence is committed by—

subparagraph.content: the company; and
every responsible person of the company;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if a person who is acting on behalf of the company contravenes any of the regulations made under that section, an offence is committed by that person; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a person who commits an offence mentioned in paragraph (a) or (b) is liable to a fine not exceeding level 3.

part.name: P17
part.heading: Companies not Formed, but Registrable, under this Ordinance

section.name: s806
section.heading: Interpretation
section.leadIn: In this Part—

def.name: ConstitutionalDocument
def.leadIn: constitutional document (章程文件), in relation to an eligible company, means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an Ordinance constituting or regulating the company; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a non-statutory constitutional document of the company;

def.name: EligibleCompany
def.leadIn: eligible company (合資格公司) means a company—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: formed after 1 May 1865 in pursuance of an Ordinance other than this Ordinance or a former Companies Ordinance; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: otherwise constituted after that date according to law;

section.def: non-statutory constitutional document (不屬法定的章程文件), in relation to an eligible company, means any deed of settlement, or other instrument, constituting or regulating the company.

section.name: s807
section.heading: Registrar may register eligible company

subsection.leadIn: The Registrar may, on application by an eligible company, register the company as—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an unlimited company; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a company limited by guarantee.

subsection.content: An application for the purposes of subsection (1) must be in the specified form.

subsection.leadIn: An application for the purposes of subsection (1) must be accompanied by—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a copy of every constitutional document of the eligible company; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the case of an application for registration as a company limited by guarantee, a copy of the resolution that complies with section 810(2).

subsection.content: A registration under subsection (1) is not invalid by reason only of it having taken place with a view to the eligible company being wound up.

section.name: s808
section.heading: General restrictions on Registrar’s power to register

subsection.content: If the liability of the members of an eligible company is limited by an Ordinance or otherwise according to law, the Registrar must not register the company under this Part.

subsection.leadIn: The Registrar must not register an eligible company under this Part as a company limited by guarantee unless—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: if the company has an English name only—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the name by which the company is to be registered has “Limited” as the last word of that name; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: a Chinese equivalent of it that the company may use has “有限公司” as the last 4 Chinese characters of the equivalent;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: if the company has a Chinese name only—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the name by which the company is to be registered has “有限公司” as the last 4 Chinese characters of that name; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: an English equivalent of it that the company may use has “Limited” as the last word of the equivalent; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: if the company has both an English name and a Chinese name—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the English name by which the company is to be registered has “Limited” as the last word of that name; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the Chinese name by which the company is to be registered has “有限公司” as the last 4 Chinese characters of that name.

section.name: s809
section.heading: Registrar must not register without members’ assent

subsection.content: The Registrar must not register an eligible company under this Part as an unlimited company unless there is assent to the registration by a majority of the members present at a general meeting of the company convened for the purpose.

The Registrar must not register an eligible company under this Part as a company limited by guarantee unless there is assent to the registration by at least 75% of the members present at a general meeting of the company convened for the purpose.

For the purposes of this section, in computing a majority, or 75%, of the members where a poll is demanded, the number of votes to which each member is entitled according to the eligible company’s regulations must be taken into account.

subsection.leadIn: In this section, a reference to a member present at a general meeting is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a reference to a member present in person; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if proxies are allowed by the eligible company’s regulations, a reference to a member present by proxy.

section.name: s810
section.heading: Registrar must not register without resolution declaring amount of guarantee

subsection.content: The Registrar must not register an eligible company under this Part as a company limited by guarantee unless the members pass a resolution that complies with subsection (2).

subsection.leadIn: The resolution must declare that each person who is a member of the eligible company undertakes that if the company is wound up while the person is such a member, or within one year after the person ceases to be such a member, the person will contribute an amount required of the person, not exceeding a specified amount, to the company’s assets—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: for the payment of the company’s debts and liabilities contracted before the person ceases to be such a member;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: for the payment of the costs and expenses of winding up the company; and (Amended 35 of 2018 s. 82)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: for the adjustment, among the contributories, of their rights.

subsection.content: For the purposes of subsection (1), it is irrelevant whether the resolution is passed before, on or after the commencement date# of this Division.

section.name: s811
section.heading: Eligible company must pay registration fee
section.content: Before the Registrar registers an eligible company under this Part, the company must pay a prescribed fee to the Registrar for the registration.

section.name: s812
section.heading: Registrar must issue certificate of registration
section.content: On registering an eligible company under this Part, the Registrar must issue to it a certificate of registration, with the Registrar’s signature or printed signature.

section.name: s813
section.heading: Application of Division
section.content: This Division applies if an eligible company is registered under this Part as an unlimited company or a company limited by guarantee.

section.name: s814
section.heading: Status, property, rights and liabilities of eligible company

subsection.content: On being issued with a certificate of registration under section 812, the eligible company is to be regarded as having been incorporated under this Ordinance as an unlimited company or a company limited by guarantee, whichever is applicable.
Subsection (1) does not operate to create a new legal entity for the eligible company.
The registration does not affect the eligible company’s property.

subsection.leadIn: The registration does not affect the eligible company’s rights and liabilities in respect of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any debt or obligation incurred by or on behalf of, or owed to, the company before the registration; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any contract entered into by or on behalf of the company before the registration.

section.name: s815
section.heading: Continuation of existing proceedings

subsection.content: Subject to subsection (2), any action or other legal proceedings that are, at the time of registration, pending by or against the eligible company, or any of its officers or members, may be continued in the same manner as if the registration had not taken place.
Execution must not be issued against the effects of a member of the eligible company on any judgment, decree or order obtained in any such pending action or proceedings.
If the eligible company’s property and effects are insufficient to satisfy the judgment, decree or order, an order may be obtained for winding up the company.

section.name: s816
section.heading: Continuation of existing constitutional document

subsection.content: The provisions in a constitutional document of the eligible company are to be regarded as conditions and regulations of the company in the same manner and with the same incidents as if those provisions were, had the company been formed under this Ordinance, contained in the articles with which the company would have been formed.

In subsection (1), a reference to a constitutional document of an eligible company includes, in the case of an eligible company registered as a company limited by guarantee, the resolution that complies with section 810(2).

section.name: s817
section.heading: Eligible company may substitute articles for non-statutory constitutional document

subsection.content: The eligible company may alter the form of its constitution by substituting articles for a non-statutory constitutional document of the company.
An alteration must be made by special resolution.

Subject to subsections (5) and (6), so much of sections 89 and 91 as relate to the matters specified in subsection (4) applies to an alteration (so far as applicable) if the eligible company, had it been formed under this Ordinance, would have been a private company.

subsection.leadIn: The matters specified for the purposes of subsection (3) are—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: matters consequential on the passing of a resolution for an alteration under section 89; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an application to the Court for the cancellation of an alteration of a private company’s objects.

subsection.content: A reference in section 89(7) to a copy of the company’s articles as altered is to be read as a copy of the articles substituted for a non-statutory constitutional document of the eligible company under this section.

subsection.leadIn: On the delivery to the Registrar under section 89 of a copy of the company’s articles substituted for a non-statutory constitutional document of the eligible company or on the date when the alteration is no longer liable to be cancelled by order of the Court, whichever is the later—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the articles apply to the company in the same manner as if it were a private company registered under this Ordinance with the articles; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the non-statutory constitutional document ceases to apply to the company.

subsection.content: An alteration may be made under subsection (1) with or without an alteration of the eligible company’s objects under section 89.

section.name: s818
section.heading: This Ordinance applies to eligible company

subsection.content: Subject to section 819, this Ordinance applies to the eligible company and its officers, members, contributories and creditors in the same manner in all respects as if the company had been formed under this Ordinance.

Despite anything in a constitutional document of the eligible company, a provision of this Ordinance applies to the company if the provision relates to an unlimited company’s registration as a limited company.

section.name: s819
section.heading: Exceptions to section 818(1)

subsection.content: The eligible company may not adopt as its articles any or all of the provisions of the model articles prescribed under section 78, unless those provisions are adopted by special resolution.
Subject to section 820, the eligible company does not have any power to alter a provision in an Ordinance relating to the company.

section.name: s820
section.heading: Eligible company’s power to alter constitution
section.content: This Ordinance does not derogate from any power, vested in the eligible company, by virtue of a constitutional document of the company, of altering its constitution or regulations.

part.name: P17A
part.heading: Re-domiciled Companies

section.name: s820A
section.heading: Interpretation
section.leadIn: In this Part—
section.def: certificate of re-domiciliation (遷冊證明書) means a certificate issued under section 820C(5)(c);
information (資料) includes particulars;
intended RC (籌劃中公司), in relation to an application made under section 820B by a non-HK corporation, means the company that the corporation is intended to become by registering under section 820C(1);
non-HK corporation (非香港法團) means a body corporate that is a company incorporated outside Hong Kong;

def.name: PlaceOfIncorporation
def.leadIn: place of incorporation (成立地), in relation to a body corporate, means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the jurisdiction outside Hong Kong in which the body corporate is incorporated and under the law of which it is registered as at the application date; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the body corporate has, after its incorporation, transferred its domicile to a jurisdiction outside Hong Kong, and is registered as a company under the law of that jurisdiction as at the application date—that jurisdiction;

section.def: re-domiciliation form (遷冊表格), in relation to a body corporate, means the re-domiciliation form delivered by the corporation to the Registrar under section 820B(2)(a).

section.name: s820B
section.heading: Application requirements

subsection.leadIn: A non-HK corporation may apply to the Registrar for registration under section 820C(1) as—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a public company limited by shares;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a private company limited by shares;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a public unlimited company with a share capital; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: a private unlimited company with a share capital.

subsection.leadIn: The application must be made by the non-HK corporation (applicant) by delivering to the Registrar—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a re-domiciliation form in the specified form; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a copy of the proposed articles.

subsection.leadIn: The re-domiciliation form delivered to the Registrar under subsection (2)(a)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: must contain—

subparagraph.content: the information and statements specified in Schedule 6A; and

subparagraph.leadIn: a statement of compliance certifying—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: that all of the requirements in this section and Schedules 6A, 6B and 6C that are applicable to the application for registration of the applicant (applicable requirements) have been complied with; and

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: that the information and statements contained in the form are accurate and consistent with those in the proposed articles;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: must be signed by one of the directors of the applicant; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: must be accompanied by the documents specified in Schedule 6C.

subsection.content: The Registrar may accept a statement of compliance as sufficient evidence that all of the applicable requirements have been complied with.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: proposed articles (擬用章程細則) means the articles of association that the members of the applicant have resolved to be adopted as the articles of association of the intended RC with effect from the date on which it is registered under section 820C(1).

section.name: s820C
section.heading: Consideration of application and registration by Registrar

subsection.leadIn: On an application made under section 820B by a non-HK corporation (applicant), and on payment of the fee prescribed for the registration, the Registrar may register the applicant as—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a public company limited by shares;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a private company limited by shares;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a public unlimited company with a share capital; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: a private unlimited company with a share capital.

subsection.content: The Registrar must refuse to register an applicant under subsection (1) if any of the requirements mentioned in section 820B that are applicable to the application is not complied with.

The Registrar must refuse to register an applicant under subsection (1) if the Registrar is of the opinion that the intended RC is likely to be used for an unlawful purpose or for a purpose contrary to public interest.
The Registrar may require an applicant to provide any further documents or information that is, in the Registrar’s opinion, necessary for considering the application made under section 820B.

subsection.leadIn: On registering an applicant under subsection (1), the Registrar must also—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: register the re-domiciliation form;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: register the document delivered to the Registrar by the applicant under section 820B(2)(b); and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: issue a certificate to the applicant certifying that the applicant is registered under subsection (1) as a limited company or an unlimited company (as the case requires).

subsection.content: A registration under subsection (1) begins to have effect on the date of issue of the certificate of re-domiciliation.

On the date on which a certificate of re-domiciliation is issued to a body corporate registered as a company under subsection (1), the articles contained in the document registered under subsection (5)(b) becomes the articles of association of the registered company.
A certificate of re-domiciliation is conclusive evidence that the body corporate to which the certificate is issued is registered under subsection (1).

section.name: s820D
section.heading: Effect of registration under section 820C

subsection.leadIn: The fact that a body corporate is registered under section 820C(1)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: does not have the effect of creating a new legal entity;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: does not affect—

subparagraph.content: the identity or continuity of the body corporate as a body corporate registered in its place of incorporation;
any contract made, resolution passed or other thing done by or in relation to the body corporate; and
any function, property, right, privilege, obligation or liability acquired, accrued or incurred by or to the body corporate; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: does not render defective any legal proceedings commenced or continued by or against the body corporate.

subsection.content: To avoid doubt, on or after the re-domiciliation date, any legal proceedings that could have been commenced by or against the body corporate may be commenced or continued by or against the re-domiciled company.
To avoid doubt, with effect from the re-domiciliation date, all property of the body corporate is the property of the re-domiciled company.
For tax purposes, this section does not have the effect of transferring any assets of the body corporate or changing the beneficial ownership of any of those assets.
For a body corporate that was a registered non-Hong Kong company immediately before the re-domiciliation date, its registration under Part 16 ceases to have effect on that date.

section.name: s820E
section.heading: Deregistration in place of incorporation

subsection.content: This section applies to a body corporate to which a certificate of re-domiciliation is issued under section 820C(5)(c).
As soon as practicable after the re-domiciliation date, the body corporate must take all reasonable steps to procure its deregistration in its place of incorporation.

subsection.leadIn: Within 120 days after the re-domiciliation date (specified period), the body corporate—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: must be deregistered in its place of incorporation; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: must submit to the Registrar a document evidencing the deregistration to the satisfaction of the Registrar.

subsection.content: If the document mentioned in subsection (3)(b) is in a language other than the English language and the Chinese language, the document must be accompanied by a certified translation of the document in the English language or the Chinese language.
On an application made by the body corporate, the Registrar may extend the specified period subject to any conditions the Registrar considers appropriate.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: deregister (撤銷註冊), in relation to a body corporate, means to cease to have a registration under the law of its place of incorporation relating to the incorporation or domicile of the body corporate in that place.

section.name: s820F
section.heading: Revocation of registration under this Ordinance

subsection.leadIn: This section applies if the Registrar is satisfied that there is sufficient evidence to show that a re-domiciled company—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: has failed to comply with section 820E(2); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: has failed to comply with section 820E(3)(a) or (b) or (4) within the period specified in section 820E(3) or, if the specified period is extended under section 820E(5), the extended period.

subsection.content: Subject to subsections (3) and (5), after the expiry of the period specified under subsection (4), the Registrar may by order revoke the registration of the re-domiciled company under this Ordinance.

If the Registrar intends to make an order under subsection (2) (revocation order) in relation to a re-domiciled company, the Registrar must give the company a written notice informing the company of the Registrar’s intention to revoke the registration.
The notice must specify a period of not less than 30 days within which the company may make any written representation to the Registrar.
If the Registrar receives, within the period specified under subsection (4), any representation made by the company, the Registrar must consider the representation.

subsection.leadIn: If a revocation order is made under this section, the Registrar must, as soon as practicable after the order is made—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: cause a copy of the revocation order to be published in the Gazette; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: cause a copy of the order to be served on the body corporate concerned.

subsection.content: The revocation order takes effect on the date on which a copy of it is published under subsection (6)(a).
A decision of the Registrar under this section to revoke the registration of a re-domiciled company under this Ordinance is final.

The fact that the registration of a body corporate is revoked under this section does not affect any liability of an officer or a member of the body corporate and any such liability may be enforced as if the registration had not been revoked.

section.name: s820G
section.heading: Delivery of director’s written consent

subsection.content: A consent given for the purposes of section 4(1)(b)(ii) of Schedule 6B in relation to an application made under section 820B by a body corporate must be delivered in the specified form to the Registrar for registration within 15 days after the re-domiciliation date.

If subsection (1) is contravened, the re-domiciled company concerned, and every specified person, commit an offence and each is liable on conviction to a fine at level 4 and, in the case of a continuing offence, to a further fine of $700 for each day during which the offence continues.

In any proceedings against a director of the re-domiciled company under this section, it is a defence to establish that the director took all reasonable steps to secure compliance with subsection (1).

subsection.leadIn: In this section—

def.name: SpecifiedPerson
def.leadIn: specified person (指明人士), in relation to a re-domiciled company, means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: every director of the re-domiciled company who has signed the re-domiciliation form; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: every other person who is a responsible person of the company.

section.name: s820H
section.heading: Reporting duty of re-domiciled companies after registration under section 820C

subsection.content: This section applies to a body corporate that is registered under section 820C(1)(a), (b), (c) or (d).
Within 15 days after the re-domiciliation date, the re-domiciled company concerned must deliver to the Registrar for registration a return that complies with subsection (3).

subsection.leadIn: A return—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: must be in the specified form;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: must include a statement of share capital, as at the re-domiciliation date, that complies with section 201; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: must state the following particulars relating to the members of the re-domiciled company—

subparagraph.leadIn: if the company is not a listed company—

subparagraph.name: A
B
subparagraph.content: the name and address of each member; and

subparagraph.leadIn: if the company is a listed company—

subparagraph.name: A
B
C
subparagraph.content: the name and address of each specified member of the company.

subsection.content: In subsection (3)(c)(ii), a reference to a specified member of a re-domiciled company is, in relation to a class of shares, a reference to a member of the company who holds at least 5% of the issued shares in that class.

If a re-domiciled company contravenes subsection (2), the company, and every responsible person of the company, commit an offence, and each is liable on conviction to a fine at level 4 and, in the case of a continuing offence, to a further fine of $700 for each day during which the offence continues.

If a re-domiciled company fails to deliver a return that complies with subsection (3) within 15 days after the re-domiciliation date (failure), the Court may, on application of the company or a responsible person of the company, extend the period for delivery of the return by a period determined by the Court.

subsection.leadIn: The Court may not extend a period under subsection (6) unless it is satisfied that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the failure was accidental or due to inadvertence; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: it is just and equitable to extend the period.

subsection.leadIn: If the Court extends the period for delivery of a return—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any liability already incurred by the company or a responsible person of the company for an offence under subsection (5) is extinguished; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: subsection (2) has effect as if the reference to 15 days were a reference to the extended period.

part.name: P18
part.heading: Communications to and by Companies

section.name: s821
section.heading: Interpretation

subsection.leadIn: In this Part—
subsection.def: address (地址) includes a number, or any sequence or combination of letters, characters, numbers or symbols of any language, used for the purpose of sending or receiving a document or information by electronic means;

def.name: ApplicableProvision
def.leadIn: applicable provision (適用條文) —

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in Division 3, means a provision of this Ordinance or the Companies (Winding Up and Miscellaneous Provisions) Ordinance (Cap. 32) that authorizes or requires the document or information to be sent or supplied to a company; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in Division 4, means a provision of this Ordinance or the Companies (Winding Up and Miscellaneous Provisions) Ordinance (Cap. 32) that authorizes or requires the document or information to be sent or supplied by a company to another person;

def.name: BusinessDay
def.leadIn: business day (辦公日) means a day that is not—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a general holiday; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a black rainstorm warning day or gale warning day as defined by section 71(2) of the Interpretation and General Clauses Ordinance (Cap. 1);

subsection.def: document (文件), except in Division 2, excludes a document that is issued for the purpose of any legal proceedings.

subsection.leadIn: In this Part—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: a reference to sending a document, except in Division 2—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: includes supplying, delivering, forwarding or producing the document and, in the case of a notice, giving the document; but

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: excludes serving the document; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a reference to supplying information includes sending, delivering, forwarding or producing the information.

subsection.content: For the purposes of this Part, a person sends a document, or supplies information, by post if the person posts a prepaid envelope containing the document or information.

section.name: s822
section.heading: Minimum period specified for purposes of sections 828(3), 831(4), 833(6) and 833A(10)

subsection.content: This section specifies the minimum period of the notice of revocation, in relation to an agreement between a company and another person, for the purposes of sections 828(3), 831(4), 833(6) and 833A(10). (Amended 1 of 2025 s. 18)

subsection.leadIn: The minimum period is whichever is the longer of the following—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a period of 7 days;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the period set out in subsection (3) or (4).

subsection.leadIn: If that other person is not a company, the period set out for the purposes of subsection (2)(b) is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: where that other person is a member of the company, the period specified for the purpose in the company’s articles;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: where that other person is a debenture holder of the company, the period specified for the purpose in the instrument creating the debenture; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: where that other person is not such a member or holder, the period specified for the purpose in any agreement between the person and the company.

subsection.leadIn: If that other person is a company, the period set out for the purposes of subsection (2)(b) is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: where that other person is a member of the company, the period specified for the purpose in the company’s articles;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: where the company is a member of that other person, the period specified for the purpose in the person’s articles;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: where that other person is a debenture holder of the company or where the company is a debenture holder of that other person, the period specified for the purpose in the instrument creating the debenture; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: where neither that other person nor the company is such a member or holder, the period specified for the purpose in any agreement between the person and the company.

section.name: s823
section.heading: Period specified for purposes of sections 828(7)(a), 831(7)(a) and 833(12)(b)

subsection.leadIn: This section specifies—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the period, in relation to a document or information sent or supplied to a company by another person, for the purposes of section 828(7)(a); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the period, in relation to a document or information sent or supplied by a company to another person, for the purposes of sections 831(7)(a) and 833(12)(b).

subsection.content: The period is the period set out in subsection (3), (4) or (5).

subsection.leadIn: If that other person is not a company, the period set out for the purposes of subsection (2) is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: where that other person is a member of the company, the period specified for the purpose in the company’s articles;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: where that other person is a debenture holder of the company, the period specified for the purpose in the instrument creating the debenture; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: where that other person is not such a member or holder, the period specified for the purpose in any agreement between the person and the company.

subsection.leadIn: If that other person is a company, the period set out for the purposes of subsection (2) is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: where that other person is a member of the company, the period specified for the purpose in the company’s articles;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: where the company is a member of that other person, the period specified for the purpose in the person’s articles;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: where that other person is a debenture holder of the company or where the company is a debenture holder of that other person, the period specified for the purpose in the instrument creating the debenture; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: where neither that other person nor the company is such a member or holder, the period specified for the purpose in any agreement between the person and the company.

subsection.content: If the articles, instrument or agreement does not specify the period, the period set out for the purposes of subsection (2) is 48 hours.
In calculating a period of hours mentioned in subsection (5), any part of a day that is not a business day is to be disregarded.

section.name: s824
section.heading: Time specified for purposes of sections 828(7)(b), 829(5)(a), 831(7)(b) and 832(5)(a)

subsection.leadIn: This section specifies—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the time, in relation to a document or information sent or supplied to a company by another person, for the purposes of sections 828(7)(b) and 829(5)(a); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the time, in relation to a document or information sent or supplied by a company to another person, for the purposes of sections 831(7)(b) and 832(5)(a).

subsection.leadIn: The time is whichever is the later of the following—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the second business day after the day on which the document or information is sent or supplied;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the time set out in subsection (3) or (4).

subsection.leadIn: If that other person is not a company, the time set out for the purposes of subsection (2)(b) is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: where that other person is a member of the company, the time specified for the purpose in the company’s articles;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: where that other person is a debenture holder of the company, the time specified for the purpose in the instrument creating the debenture; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: where that other person is not such a member or holder, the time specified for the purpose in any agreement between the person and the company.

subsection.leadIn: If that other person is a company, the time set out for the purposes of subsection (2)(b) is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: where that other person is a member of the company, the time specified for the purpose in the company’s articles;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: where the company is a member of that other person, the time specified for the purpose in the person’s articles;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: where that other person is a debenture holder of the company or where the company is a debenture holder of that other person, the time specified for the purpose in the instrument creating the debenture; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: where neither that other person nor the company is such a member or holder, the time specified for the purpose in any agreement between the person and the company.

section.name: s825
section.heading: Address specified for purposes of sections 831(3)(b)(iii) and 832(2)(b)

subsection.content: This section specifies the address, in relation to a document or information sent or supplied by a company to another person, for the purposes of sections 831(3)(b)(iii) and 832(2)(b).

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsections (3) and (4), the address is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an address specified for the purpose by that other person generally or specifically; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an address to which a provision of this Ordinance authorizes or requires the document or information to be sent or supplied.

subsection.leadIn: If that other person (whether or not a company) is a member, debenture holder, director or company secretary of the company, the address is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the address specified in subsection (2); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the person’s address as shown in the company’s register of members, register of debenture holders, register of directors or register of company secretaries.

subsection.leadIn: If that other person is a company and is not a person covered by subsection (3), the address is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the address specified in subsection (2); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: its registered office.

subsection.content: If the company is unable to obtain an address specified in subsection (2), (3) or (4), the address is that other person’s address last known to the company.

section.name: s826
section.heading: Effect of this Part on sending documents etc. to Registrar
section.content: In its application in relation to documents or information to be sent or supplied to the Registrar, this Part has effect subject to Part 2.

section.name: s827
section.heading: Service of document
section.content: A document may be served on a company by leaving it at, or sending it by post to, the company’s registered office.

division.name: D3
division.heading: Other Communication to Company by Person who is not Company

section.name: s828
section.heading: Communication in electronic form

subsection.content: This section applies if a document or information is sent or supplied, in electronic form, to a company by a person who is not a company.

subsection.leadIn: The document or information is sent or supplied to the company for the purposes of an applicable provision if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: the company—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: has agreed, generally or specifically, that the document or information may be sent or supplied to it in electronic form and has not revoked the agreement; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: is to be regarded under a provision of this Ordinance as having so agreed;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the document or information is sent or supplied—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.leadIn: by electronic means to an address—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: specified for the purpose by the company generally or specifically; or

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: regarded under a provision of this Ordinance as having been so specified for the purpose; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: by hand or by post to an address specified in subsection (4); and
