paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: the document or information is sent or supplied in a form, and by a means, that, in the person’s reasonable opinion, will enable the recipient—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: to read the document or information, or, to the extent that it consists of images, to see the document or information, with the naked eye or with the eye with suitable corrective lens; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: to retain a copy of the document or information.

subsection.content: The company has not revoked the agreement for the purposes of subsection (2)(a)(i) unless it has given the person a notice of revocation of not less than the period specified in section 822.

subsection.leadIn: The address specified for the purposes of subsection (2)(b)(ii) is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an address specified for the purpose by the company generally or specifically;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the company’s registered office; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: an address to which a provision of this Ordinance authorizes or requires the document or information to be sent or supplied.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of an applicable provision that authorizes or requires the document or information to be authenticated, the document or information is sufficiently authenticated if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the person’s identity is confirmed in a manner specified by the company; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: where no manner has been specified, the communication contains or is accompanied by a statement of the person’s identity, and the company has no reason to doubt the truth of the statement.

subsection.content: If the document or information is sent or supplied by a person on behalf of another, subsection (5) does not affect any provision of the company’s articles under which the company may require reasonable evidence of the former’s authority to act on behalf of the latter.

subsection.leadIn: If the document or information is sent or supplied to a company for the purposes of an applicable provision, it is to be regarded as being received by the company—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: where the document or information is sent or supplied by electronic means, at the end of the period specified in section 823 after it is sent or supplied, unless the contrary is proved;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: where the document or information is sent or supplied by post, at the time specified in section 824, unless the contrary is proved; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: where the document or information is sent or supplied by hand, at the time when the document or information is delivered.

section.name: s829
section.heading: Communication in hard copy form

subsection.content: This section applies if a document or information is sent or supplied, in hard copy form, to a company by a person who is not a company.

subsection.leadIn: The document or information is sent or supplied to the company for the purposes of an applicable provision if the document or information is sent or supplied by hand or by post to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an address specified for the purpose by the company generally or specifically;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the company’s registered office; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: an address to which a provision of this Ordinance authorizes or requires the document or information to be sent or supplied.

subsection.content: For the purposes of an applicable provision that authorizes or requires the document or information to be authenticated, the document or information is sufficiently authenticated if it is signed by the person.

If the document or information is sent or supplied by a person on behalf of another, subsection (3) does not affect any provision of the company’s articles under which the company may require reasonable evidence of the former’s authority to act on behalf of the latter.

subsection.leadIn: If the document or information is sent or supplied to a company for the purposes of an applicable provision, it is to be regarded as being received by the company—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: where the document or information is sent or supplied by post, at the time specified in section 824, unless the contrary is proved; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: where the document or information is sent or supplied by hand, at the time when the document or information is delivered.

section.name: s830
section.heading: Communication in other forms

subsection.content: This section applies if a document or information is sent or supplied, otherwise than in electronic or hard copy form, to a company by a person who is not a company.

The document or information is sent or supplied to the company for the purposes of an applicable provision if the document or information is sent or supplied in a form or manner that has been agreed by the company

division.name: D4
division.heading: Other Communication by Company to Another Person

section.name: s831
section.heading: Communication in electronic form

subsection.content: Subject to subsection (2), this section applies if a document or information is sent or supplied, in electronic form, by a company to another person.
This section does not apply if the document or information is sent or supplied by the company to that other person by making it available on a website.

subsection.leadIn: The document or information is sent or supplied to that other person for the purposes of an applicable provision if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: that other person—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: where that other person is not a company, has agreed, generally or specifically, that the document or information may be sent or supplied to the person in electronic form and has not revoked the agreement; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: where that other person is a company, has so agreed and has not revoked the agreement, or is to be regarded under a provision of this Ordinance as having so agreed;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the document or information is sent or supplied—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.leadIn: by electronic means to an address—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: where that other person is not a company, specified for the purpose by that other person generally or specifically; or

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: where that other person is a company, so specified for the purpose, or regarded under a provision of this Ordinance as having been so specified for the purpose;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: by hand to that other person; or

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: by hand or by post to an address specified in section 825; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: the document or information is sent or supplied in a form, and by a means, that, in the company’s reasonable opinion, will enable the recipient—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: to read the document or information, or, to the extent that it consists of images, to see the document or information, with the naked eye or with the eye with suitable corrective lens; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: to retain a copy of the document or information.

subsection.content: That other person has not revoked the agreement for the purposes of subsection (3)(a) unless the person has given the company a notice of revocation of not less than the period specified in section 822.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of an applicable provision that authorizes or requires the document or information to be authenticated, the document or information is sufficiently authenticated if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the company’s identity is confirmed in a manner specified by that other person; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: where no manner has been specified, the communication contains or is accompanied by a statement of the company’s identity, and that other person has no reason to doubt the truth of the statement.

subsection.content: If the document or information is sent or supplied by a person on behalf of the company to another company, subsection (5) does not affect any provision of that other company’s articles under which that other company may require reasonable evidence of the person’s authority to act on behalf of the company for which the document or information is sent or supplied.

subsection.leadIn: If the document or information is sent or supplied to that other person for the purposes of an applicable provision, it is to be regarded as being received by that other person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: where the document or information is sent or supplied by electronic means, at the end of the period specified in section 823 after it is sent or supplied, unless the contrary is proved;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: where the document or information is sent or supplied by post, at the time specified in section 824, unless the contrary is proved; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: where the document or information is sent or supplied by hand, at the time when the document or information is delivered.

section.name: s832
section.heading: Communication in hard copy form

subsection.content: This section applies if a document or information is sent or supplied, in hard copy form, by a company to another person.

subsection.leadIn: The document or information is sent or supplied to that other person for the purposes of an applicable provision if the document or information is sent or supplied—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: by hand to that other person; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: by hand or by post to an address specified in section 825.

subsection.content: For the purposes of an applicable provision that authorizes or requires the document or information to be authenticated, the document or information is sufficiently authenticated if it is signed by a director or company secretary of the company or by an officer of the company authorized for the purpose.

If the document or information is sent or supplied by a person on behalf of the company to another company, subsection (3) does not affect any provision of that other company’s articles under which that other company may require reasonable evidence of the person’s authority to act on behalf of the company for which the document or information is sent or supplied.

subsection.leadIn: If the document or information is sent or supplied to that other person for the purposes of an applicable provision, it is to be regarded as being received by that other person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: where the document or information is sent or supplied by post, at the time specified in section 824, unless the contrary is proved; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: where the document or information is sent or supplied by hand, at the time when the document or information is delivered.

section.name: s833
section.heading: Communication by means of website

subsection.content: Subject to subsection (2), this section applies if a document or information is sent or supplied by a company to another person by making it available on a website.
This section does not apply if the document or information is sent or supplied by a member of a company to the company.

subsection.leadIn: The document or information is sent or supplied to that other person for the purposes of an applicable provision if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: that other person—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: has agreed, generally or specifically, that the document or information may be sent or supplied by the company to the person by making it available on a website, or is to be regarded under subsection (4) or (5) or section 833A(2) or (4) as having so agreed; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: has not revoked the agreement;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the document or information is sent or supplied in a form, and by a means, that, in the company’s reasonable opinion, will enable the recipient—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: to read the document or information, or, to the extent that it consists of images, to see the document or information, with the naked eye or with the eye with suitable corrective lens; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: to retain a copy of the document or information;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: subject to section 833B(1), the company has notified that other person of the matters specified in subsection (8); and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.leadIn: the company has made the document or information available on the website throughout—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the period specified by the applicable provision; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.leadIn: where no period is specified, the period of 28 days beginning on— (Amended 1 of 2025 s. 19)

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: the date on which the notification under paragraph (c) is sent to that other person; or

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: if paragraph (c) does not apply because of section 833B(1)—the date on which the document or information is first made available on the website. (Amended 1 of 2025 s. 19)

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsection (3)(a)(i), a person who is a member of the company is, subject to section 833B(2), to be regarded as having agreed that the document or information may be sent or supplied by the company to the person by making it available on a website if— (Amended 1 of 2025 s. 19)

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: subject to section 833B(1), the company has individually requested the person to agree that documents or information generally, or the document or information, may be so sent or supplied by the company to the person and has not received a response to the request within 28 days beginning on the date on which the request was sent; and (Amended 1 of 2025 s. 19)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: subject to section 833B(1), the request— (Amended 1 of 2025 s. 19)

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: stated clearly the effect of a failure to respond within those 28 days; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: was sent at least 12 months after any prior request made to the person for the purposes of paragraph (b) in respect of the same or a similar class of documents or information.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsection (3)(a)(i), a person who is a debenture holder of the company is, subject to section 833B(2), to be regarded as having agreed that the document or information may be sent or supplied by the company to the person by making it available on a website if— (Amended 1 of 2025 s. 19)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the instrument creating the debenture contains a provision to the effect, or the equivalent debenture holders have resolved in accordance with the provisions of that instrument, that documents or information generally may be so sent or supplied by the company to those holders;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: subject to section 833B(1), the company has individually requested the person to agree that documents or information generally, or the document or information, may be so sent or supplied by the company to the person and has not received a response to the request within 28 days beginning on the date on which the request was sent; and (Amended 1 of 2025 s. 19)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: subject to section 833B(1), the request— (Amended 1 of 2025 s. 19)

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: stated clearly the effect of a failure to respond within those 28 days; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: was sent at least 12 months after any prior request made to the person for the purposes of paragraph (b) in respect of the same or a similar class of documents or information.

subsection.content: That other person has not revoked the agreement for the purposes of subsection (3)(a)(ii) unless the person has given the company a notice of revocation of not less than the period specified in section 822.

For the purposes of subsection (3)(c), if the applicable provision specifies the time by which or the period within which the notification is to be sent, the notification must be sent by that time or within that period.

subsection.leadIn: The matters specified for the purposes of subsection (3)(c) are—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the presence of the document or information on the website;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the document or information is not available on the website on the date of the notification, the date on which it will be so available;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the address of the website;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the place on the website where the document or information may be accessed; and

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: how to access the document or information.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsection (3)(d), a failure to make a document or information available on a website throughout the period mentioned in that subsection is to be disregarded if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the document or information is made available on the website for part of that period; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the failure is wholly attributable to circumstances that it would not be reasonable to have expected the company to prevent or avoid.

subsection.leadIn: If the document or information is sent or supplied to that other person for the purposes of an applicable provision—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: it is to be regarded as being sent or supplied on whichever is the later of the following—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the date on which the document or information is first made available on the website;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the date on which a notification under subsection (3)(c) is sent; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: it is to be regarded as being received by that other person at the end of the period specified in section 823 after whichever is the later of the following—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the time when the document or information is first made available on the website;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the time when that other person receives a notification under subsection (3)(c).

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: equivalent debenture holders (相應債權證持有人), in relation to a person to whom a document or information is sent or supplied by a company, means the debenture holders of the company ranking equally for all purposes with the person.

section.name: s833A
section.heading: Communication by means of website regarded, on one-off notification, as having been agreed to

subsection.leadIn: Subsection (2)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: applies for the purposes of section 833(3)(a)(i); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: applies if the person referred to in section 833(3)(a)(i) is a member of the company referred to in that section.

subsection.leadIn: Subject to section 833B(2), the person is to be regarded as having agreed that the document or information (referred to in section 833(3)(a)(i)) may be sent or supplied by the company to the person by making it available on a website if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the articles of the company contain a provision to the effect that documents or information generally may be so sent or supplied by the company to its members; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: subject to section 833B(1), the company has individually sent to the person a one-off notification that complies with subsection (5) and (if applicable) subsection (6).

subsection.leadIn: Subsection (4)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: applies for the purposes of section 833(3)(a)(i); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: applies if the person referred to in section 833(3)(a)(i) is a debenture holder of the company referred to in that section.

subsection.leadIn: Subject to section 833B(2), the person is to be regarded as having agreed that the document or information (referred to in section 833(3)(a)(i)) may be sent or supplied by the company to the person by making it available on a website if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the instrument creating the debenture contains a provision to the effect, or the equivalent debenture holders (as defined by section 833(13)) have resolved in accordance with the provisions of that instrument, that documents or information generally may be so sent or supplied by the company to those holders; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: subject to section 833B(1), the company has individually sent to the person a one-off notification that complies with subsection (5) and (if applicable) subsection (6).

subsection.leadIn: The one-off notification specified for the purposes of subsections (2)(b) and (4)(b) must contain the following matters—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: the address of the website;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the place on the website where those documents or information may be accessed;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: how to access those documents or information;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.leadIn: a statement of—

subparagraph.content: the person’s right to request documents or information to be sent or supplied in electronic form under section 833C; and
the person’s right to request documents or information to be sent or supplied in hard copy form under section 837.

subsection.leadIn: Also, the one-off notification must contain an invitation specified in subsection (7) if the person—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: has agreed generally that any document or information may be sent or supplied in electronic form by the company to the person for the purposes of section 831(3)(a) but the agreement has been revoked under section 831(4); or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: has not specified an address to which any document or information may be sent or supplied by electronic means to the person for the purposes of section 831(3)(b)(i).

subsection.leadIn: The invitation specified for the purposes of subsection (6) is an invitation to the person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to agree generally that any document or information may be sent or supplied in electronic form by the company to the person for the purposes of section 831(3)(a); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to specify an address to which any document or information may be sent or supplied by electronic means to the person for the purposes of section 831(3)(b)(i).

subsection.content: Subsection (9) applies if an agreement is regarded under subsection (2) or (4) as having been given by the person.

subsection.leadIn: Section 833(3)(c) does not apply in relation to the person if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the company is a listed company; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: where the company is an unlisted company—

subparagraph.content: the person has agreed that the document or information may be sent or supplied by the company to the person by making it available on a website without any notification under section 833(3)(c); and
the person has not revoked the agreement.

subsection.content: The person has not revoked the agreement for the purposes of subsection (9)(b)(ii) unless the person has given the company a notice of revocation of not less than the period specified in section 822.

section.name: s833B
section.heading: Cases where notifications and requests not required, and communication by means of website not regarded as having been agreed to, for purposes of sections 833 and 833A

subsection.leadIn: Sections 833(3)(c), (4)(b) and (c) and (5)(b) and (c) and 833A(2)(b) and (4)(b) do not apply in relation to the person referred to in section 833(3)(a)(i) if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: the person—

subparagraph.leadIn: where the person is not a company—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: has not agreed that the document or information may be sent or supplied to the person in electronic form for the purposes of section 831(3)(a)(i); or

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: has not specified an address to which the document or information may be sent or supplied to the person for the purposes of section 831(3)(b)(i)(A); or

subparagraph.leadIn: where the person is a company—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: has not so agreed;

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: has not specified such an address; or

subparagraph.name: C

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any document or information has been sent or supplied, in hard copy form, by the company to the person by post to an address specified for the purposes of section 832(2)(b), and it has been returned by the post office as undeliverable at the address.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of sections 833(4) and (5) and 833A(2) and (4), the person is not to be regarded as having agreed that the document or information may be sent or supplied by the company to the person by making it available on a website if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the case of section 833(4), except where section 833(4)(b) does not apply because of subsection (1), it is proved that the person has not received the request under section 833(4)(b);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the case of section 833(5), except where section 833(5)(b) does not apply because of subsection (1), it is proved that the person has not received the request under section 833(5)(b);

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: in the case of section 833A(2), except where section 833A(2)(b) does not apply because of subsection (1), it is proved that the person has not received the one-off notification under section 833A(2)(b); and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: in the case of section 833A(4), except where section 833A(4)(b) does not apply because of subsection (1), it is proved that the person has not received the one-off notification under section 833A(4)(b).

section.name: s833C
section.heading: Communication by means of website: right to request document or information in electronic form

subsection.leadIn: This section applies if—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: the person is a member or debenture holder of the company.

subsection.content: The person may request the company to send or supply the document or information in electronic form to an address specified by the person in the request if the request is made within 28 days after the date the document or information is regarded under section 833(12)(b) as having been received by the person.

subsection.leadIn: The company must, in accordance with a request made under subsection (2), send or supply the document or information in electronic form to the person free of charge—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: within 21 days after the date of receiving the request; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the document or information requires an action to be taken by the person—within 7 days after the date of receiving the request.

subsection.content: Subsection (3) does not apply if the person has not specified an address in the request under subsection (2).
If a company contravenes subsection (3), the company, and every responsible person of the company, commit an offence, and each is liable on conviction to a fine at level 3.

section.name: s834
section.heading: Communication in other forms

subsection.content: This section applies if a document or information is sent or supplied by a company to another person otherwise than in electronic or hard copy form or by making it available on a website.

The document or information is sent or supplied to that other person for the purposes of an applicable provision if the document or information is sent or supplied in a form or manner that has been agreed by that other person.

section.name: s835
section.heading: Joint holders of shares or debentures

subsection.leadIn: This section applies if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a provision of this Ordinance authorizes or requires a document or information to be sent or supplied by a company to the holders of its shares or debentures; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a document or information is required to be sent to joint holders of the shares or debentures.

subsection.leadIn: Subject to anything in the company’s articles, the document or information is sent or supplied to the joint holders for the purposes of the provision if the document or information is sent or supplied to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: each of the joint holders; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the holder whose name appears first in the company’s register of members or register of debenture holders.

subsection.content: Subject to anything in the company’s articles, anything to be agreed or specified by the holders for the purposes of this Division must be agreed or specified by all the joint holders.

section.name: s836
section.heading: Death or bankruptcy of holder of shares

subsection.leadIn: This section applies if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a provision of this Ordinance authorizes or requires a document or information to be sent or supplied by a company to the holders of its shares; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a holder of the shares is dead or bankrupt.

subsection.leadIn: Subject to anything in the company’s articles, the document or information is sent or supplied to that holder for the purposes of the provision if the document or information—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is sent or supplied to the persons claiming to be entitled to the shares in consequence of the death or bankruptcy by name, or by the title of representatives of the deceased, or trustee of the bankrupt, or by any like description, at the address within Hong Kong supplied for the purpose by the persons so claiming; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: until such an address has been so supplied, is sent or supplied in any manner in which it might have been sent or supplied if the death or bankruptcy had not occurred.

section.name: s837
section.heading: Member or debenture holder may require hard copy

subsection.name: 1A
subsection.content: This section applies if a document or information is authorized or required to be sent or supplied by a company to a member or debenture holder under this Ordinance or the Companies (Winding Up and Miscellaneous Provisions) Ordinance (Cap. 32). (Added 35 of 2018 s. 83)

A member or debenture holder of a company may, within 28 days after the date of receiving from the company a document or information, otherwise than in hard copy form, request the company to send or supply to the member or holder the document or information in hard copy form.

subsection.leadIn: The company must send or supply to the member or holder the document or information in hard copy form, free of charge—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: within 21 days after the date of receiving the request; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the document or information requires an action to be taken by the member or holder, within 7 days after the date of receiving the request.

subsection.content: If a company contravenes subsection (2), the company, and every responsible person of the company, commit an offence, and each is liable to a fine at level 3.

part.name: P19
part.heading: Investigations and Enquiries

section.name: s838
section.heading: Interpretation

subsection.leadIn: In this Part—

def.name: Agent
def.leadIn: agent (代理人), in relation to a company, includes—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a banker or solicitor of the company; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a person, whether an officer of the company or not, who is engaged as an auditor of the company;

subsection.def: authorized institution (認可機構) has the meaning given by section 2(1) of the Banking Ordinance (Cap. 155);
books (簿冊) includes accounts and accounting information, however compiled or stored, and whether or not recorded in a legible form;

def.name: Delegate
def.leadIn: delegate (獲轉授人) —

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in relation to an inspector, means a person to whom the inspector has delegated any power under section 850(1);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in relation to the Financial Secretary, means a person to whom the Financial Secretary has delegated any power under section 870;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: in relation to the Registrar, means a public officer to whom the Registrar has delegated any power under section 874;

def.name: Document
def.leadIn: document (文件) means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any register, books or tape recording;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any input or output, in whatever form, into or from an information system; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: any other document or similar material (whether produced mechanically, electronically, magnetically, optically, manually or by any other means);

def.name: Information
def.leadIn: information (資料) includes—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: data, text, images, sound codes, computer programmes, software and databases; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any combination of the things mentioned in paragraph (a);

def.name: Inspector
def.leadIn: inspector (審查員) means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a person appointed under section 840 or 841 to investigate a company’s affairs; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a person appointed under section 853 to continue an investigation;

def.name: Record
def.leadIn: record (紀錄) means any record of information (however compiled or stored) and includes—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any books, deed, contract, agreement, voucher and receipt;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any document or other material used with or produced by an information system;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: any information that is recorded otherwise than in a legible form but is capable of being reproduced in a legible form;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: any document, disc, tape, sound track or other device in which sounds or other data (not being visual images) are embodied so as to be capable (with or without the aid of other equipment) of being reproduced; and

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: any film (including a microfilm), disc, tape or other device in which visual images are embodied so as to be capable (with or without the aid of other equipment) of being reproduced.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of this Part, a body corporate is an associated body corporate of a company if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the body corporate and the company are members of the same group of companies; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the body corporate and the company are substantially controlled by the same person.

division.name: D2
division.heading: Investigation of Company’s Affairs by Inspectors

section.name: s839
section.heading: Interpretation
section.leadIn: In this Division—

def.name: Company
def.leadIn: company (公司) —

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in section 840, includes a registered non-Hong Kong company;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in section 841, includes a non-Hong Kong company;

section.def: final report (最終報告) means the final report mentioned in section 856;
interim report (中期報告) means the interim report mentioned in section 855;
investigation (調查) means an investigation into a company’s affairs under section 840 or 841.

subdivision.name: SD2
subdivision.heading: Appointment by Financial Secretary of Inspectors to Investigate Company’s Affairs

section.name: s840
section.heading: Appointment of inspector on application by company or members

subsection.content: The Financial Secretary may, on application by a company, appoint a person to investigate the company’s affairs if the company has by special resolution declared that the company’s affairs ought to be so investigated.

subsection.leadIn: The Financial Secretary may also appoint a person to investigate a company’s affairs—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: for a company having a share capital, on application by—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: at least 100 members; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: members holding at least 10% of the shares issued (excluding treasury shares); or (Amended 1 of 2025 s. 21)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: for a company not having a share capital, on application by at least 10% in number of the persons on the company’s register of members.

subsection.content: An application for the purposes of subsection (1) or (2) must be supported by the evidence required by the Financial Secretary to show that the applicant has good reason for requesting the investigation.

The Financial Secretary must not appoint a person under subsection (1) or (2) to investigate a company’s affairs unless the Financial Secretary is satisfied that it is in the public interest to do so.

The Financial Secretary may, before making an appointment under subsection (1) or (2), require an applicant for an appointment under subsection (1) or (2) to give security for the payment of the expenses of the investigation, in an amount specified by the Financial Secretary.

section.name: s841
section.heading: Appointment of inspector on Court’s or Financial Secretary’s initiative

subsection.content: The Financial Secretary must appoint a person to investigate a company’s affairs if the Court by order declares that the company’s affairs ought to be so investigated.

subsection.leadIn: The Financial Secretary may appoint a person to investigate a company’s affairs if it appears to the Financial Secretary that there are circumstances suggesting that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the company was formed for a fraudulent or unlawful purpose;

paragraph.name: ab
paragraph.content: the company’s registration under section 820C(1) was sought or obtained for a fraudulent or unlawful purpose; (Added 14 of 2025 s. 70)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the company’s affairs are being or have been conducted—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: in a manner unfairly prejudicial to the interests of its members generally or of one or more members;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: with intent to defraud its creditors or the creditors of any other person; or

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: for any other fraudulent or unlawful purpose; (Amended 14 of 2025 s. 70)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the persons concerned with the formation of the company have, in relation to the formation, engaged in fraud, misfeasance or other misconduct towards it, its members or its creditors; (Replaced 14 of 2025 s. 70)

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: (if the company is a re-domiciled company) the persons involved in seeking or obtaining the registration under section 820C(1) for the company have, in relation to the registration, engaged in fraud, misfeasance or other misconduct towards it, its members or its creditors; or (Added 14 of 2025 s. 70)

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: the persons concerned with the management of the company’s affair have, in relation to the management, engaged in fraud, misfeasance or other misconduct towards it, its members or its creditors. (Added 14 of 2025 s. 70)

subsection.content: The Financial Secretary must not appoint a person under subsection (2) to investigate a company’s affairs unless the Financial Secretary is satisfied that it is in the public interest to do so.
The Financial Secretary may appoint a person under subsection (2) to investigate a company’s affairs even though the company is in the course of being wound up voluntarily.

section.name: s842
section.heading: Notice of appointment as inspector to be delivered to Registrar

subsection.content: A person who is appointed as an inspector under section 840 or 841 must deliver a notice of the appointment to the Registrar for registration.
The notice must be delivered to the Registrar within 15 days after the date of the appointment and must be in the specified form.

subdivision.name: SD3
subdivision.heading: Financial Secretary’s Powers to Give Directions to Inspectors

section.name: s843
section.heading: General power of Financial Secretary to give directions regarding investigation

subsection.content: The Financial Secretary may give directions to an inspector regarding an investigation.

subsection.leadIn: The Financial Secretary may give directions under this section—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on the Financial Secretary’s own initiative; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: at the request of the inspector.

subsection.content: The Financial Secretary may vary or revoke any directions given under this section.

section.name: s844
section.heading: Financial Secretary may give directions regarding subject matter of investigation etc.

subsection.leadIn: Without limiting section 843, the Financial Secretary may give directions to an inspector with respect to any or all of the following—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the terms or subject matter of the investigation (whether by reference to a specified area of a company’s operation, a specified transaction, a specified period of time or otherwise);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the matters the inspector must take into account or must not take into account in conducting the investigation;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the steps the inspector must take or must not take in conducting the investigation.

subsection.leadIn: Without limiting section 843, the Financial Secretary may also give directions to an inspector to require that the interim report or final report of the investigation—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is to include the inspector’s opinion with respect to a specified matter;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: is not to make reference to a specified matter;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: is to be made in a specified form or manner; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: is to be completed by a specified date.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: specified (指明) means specified in directions given under this section.

section.name: s845
section.heading: Financial Secretary may give directions to terminate or suspend investigation

subsection.leadIn: Without limiting section 843, the Financial Secretary may, at any time before the completion of an investigation, direct the inspector—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to terminate the investigation; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to suspend the investigation for a period as specified by the Financial Secretary.

subsection.leadIn: If the inspector is appointed under section 841(1), the Financial Secretary must not give directions under subsection (1)(a) unless—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: it appears to the Financial Secretary that—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: matters have come to light in the course of the investigation which suggest that a criminal offence under the laws of Hong Kong has been committed; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: those matters have been referred to a law enforcement agency; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the giving of the directions is approved by the Court.

section.name: s846
section.heading: Inspector may require production of records and documents etc.

subsection.leadIn: An inspector appointed to investigate a company’s affairs may, by notice in writing, require any of the persons specified in subsection (2) to do any or all of the following—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: produce, within the time and at the place specified in the notice, any record or document specified in the notice that—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: is or may be relevant to the investigation; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: is in the person’s custody or power;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: take all reasonable steps to preserve the record or document before it is produced to the inspector;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: attend before the inspector at the time and place specified in the notice, and answer any question, whether on oath or otherwise, relating to any matter under investigation that the inspector may raise with the person;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: answer any question relating to any matter under investigation that is specified in the notice;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: give the inspector all other assistance in connection with the investigation that the person is reasonably able to give.

subsection.leadIn: The persons are—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the company;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an officer or former officer of the company;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: an agent or former agent of the company;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.leadIn: a person whom the inspector has reasonable grounds to believe—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: to be in possession of any record or document that contains, or is likely to contain, information relevant to the investigation; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: otherwise to be in possession of that information.

subsection.leadIn: An inspector must not require an authorized institution to produce any record or document, or disclose any information, relating to the affairs of a customer of the institution under subsection (1) unless—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the inspector has reasonable grounds to believe that the customer may be able to provide information relevant to the investigation; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the inspector is satisfied that the production or disclosure is necessary for the purposes of the investigation and so certifies in writing.

subsection.leadIn: In subsection (1)(b), a reference to preserving a record or document includes preventing a person from—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: removing, disposing of or destroying the record or document;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: erasing, adding to or altering in any other manner an entry or other particulars contained in the record or document; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: interfering in any other manner with, or causing or permitting any other person to interfere with, the record or document.

subsection.content: An inspector may administer an oath to any person for the purposes of subsection (1)(c).

section.name: s847
section.heading: Inspector may require production of director’s accounts

subsection.content: If an inspector appointed to investigate a company’s affairs has reasonable grounds to believe that a director or former director of the company maintains or has maintained an account specified in subsection (2), the inspector may, by notice in writing, require the director or former director to produce to the inspector all documents relating to the account that are in the possession, or under the control, of the director or former director.

subsection.leadIn: The account is one of whatever description maintained by the director or former director (whether alone or jointly with any other person) with a bank, deposit-taking company or similar financial institution (whether in Hong Kong or elsewhere), into or out of which there has been paid—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any emolument, retirement benefit or compensation in respect of the directorship, particulars of which are not contained in the notes to the financial statements of the company for any financial year, contrary to section 383;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any loan or quasi-loan in favour of the director or former director, or any money that has resulted from or has been used in the financing of any dealing in favour of the director or former director, particulars of which are not contained in the notes to the financial statements of the company for any financial year, contrary to section 383; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: any money that has been in any way connected with any misconduct of the director or former director (whether fraudulent or not) towards the company or its members.

section.name: s848
section.heading: Provisions supplementary to sections 846 and 847: powers to require explanation etc.

subsection.leadIn: If a person produces a record or document in compliance with a requirement imposed under section 846 or 847, the inspector may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: make copies, or otherwise record the details, of the record or document; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: by notice in writing, require the person to provide any information or explanation in respect of the record or document.

subsection.content: If a person gives any answer or provides any information or explanation in compliance with a requirement imposed under subsection (1) or section 846, the inspector may, by notice in writing, further require the person to verify, within the time specified in that further requirement, the answer, information or explanation by a statutory declaration.

If a person does not give any answer or provide any information or explanation in compliance with a requirement imposed under subsection (1) or section 846 for the reason that the answer, information or explanation is not within the person’s knowledge or in the person’s possession, the inspector may, by notice in writing, further require the person to verify, within the time specified in that further requirement, that reason and fact by a statutory declaration.
A statutory declaration mentioned in subsection (2) or (3) may be taken by the inspector.

section.name: s849
section.heading: Inspector may exercise powers in relation to associated body corporate
section.content: If an inspector appointed to investigate a company’s affairs considers it necessary for the purposes of the investigation, the inspector may also exercise any or all of the powers under sections 846, 847 and 848 in relation to an associated body corporate of the company, as if the references to a company in those sections were references to an associated body corporate.

section.name: s850
section.heading: Delegation of powers by inspector

subsection.content: An inspector appointed to investigate a company’s affairs may delegate in writing any or all of the powers conferred under sections 846, 847 and 848 to another person.
An inspector may delegate powers under subsection (1) in relation to the company or an associated body corporate of the company.
If 2 or more inspectors are appointed to investigate a company’s affairs, the power under subsection (1) is exercisable by each of them.

subdivision.name: SD5
subdivision.heading: Resignation, Removal and Replacement of Inspectors

section.name: s851
section.heading: Resignation of inspector
section.content: An inspector may resign by notice in writing to the Financial Secretary.

section.name: s852
section.heading: Revocation of appointment of inspector by Financial Secretary
section.content: The Financial Secretary may revoke the appointment of an inspector by notice in writing to the inspector.

section.name: s853
section.heading: Appointment of replacement inspector

subsection.content: If an inspector dies or resigns, or an inspector’s appointment is revoked, the Financial Secretary may appoint another person to continue the investigation.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of this Division (except this section), a person appointed to continue an investigation under subsection (1)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is to be regarded as having been appointed under the provision of this Division under which the former inspector was appointed; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: is subject to any direction given to the former inspector under this Division that has not been revoked.

section.name: s854
section.heading: Former inspector must hand over documents etc.

subsection.leadIn: This section applies to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an inspector to whom the Financial Secretary has given a direction to terminate the investigation under section 845(1)(a); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: a person—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: who has resigned as an inspector; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: whose appointment as an inspector has been revoked.

subsection.leadIn: The inspector or person must produce any document that the inspector or person has obtained or generated during the course of the investigation to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Financial Secretary; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: if directed by the Financial Secretary—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: a person appointed to continue the investigation under section 853(1); or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: a person referred to in section 881(2)(a) or (b).

subsection.leadIn: The inspector or person must also, if directed by the Financial Secretary, inform—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Financial Secretary;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a person appointed to continue the investigation under section 853(1); or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a person referred to in section 881(2)(a) or (b),

subsection.continued: of any matter that came to the inspector’s or person’s knowledge as a result of the investigation.

subsection.content: A document mentioned in subsection (2) must be produced in a form as directed by the Financial Secretary.

section.name: s855
section.heading: Interim report to be made by inspector etc.

subsection.leadIn: An inspector—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: must, if directed by the Financial Secretary, prepare an interim report on the investigation; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: may at any time prepare an interim report on the investigation if the inspector considers it appropriate to do so.

subsection.content: If an inspector is directed under section 845(1)(a) to terminate an investigation, any direction previously given by the Financial Secretary referred to in subsection (1)(a) ceases to have effect.
An interim report must be delivered to the Financial Secretary within the time directed by the Financial Secretary or, in the absence of directions, within a reasonable time after it is prepared.
An inspector must, within a reasonable time after the delivery of an interim report to the Financial Secretary, deliver to the Registrar for registration a notice of that fact in the specified form.

subsection.leadIn: Irrespective of whether an interim report has been or will be prepared, an inspector—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: may, at any time in the course of the investigation, inform the Financial Secretary of any matter that comes to the inspector’s knowledge as a result of the investigation; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: must inform the Financial Secretary of any matter that comes to the inspector’s knowledge as a result of the investigation, if directed to do so by the Financial Secretary.

section.name: s856
section.heading: Final report to be made by inspector etc.

subsection.content: An inspector must, on the completion of the investigation, prepare a final report on the investigation.

subsection.leadIn: An inspector who is directed under section 845(1)(a) to terminate an investigation must still prepare a final report on the investigation if directed to do so—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: where the inspector is appointed under section 840(1) or (2) or 841(2), by the Financial Secretary; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: where the inspector is appointed under section 841(1), by the Court.

subsection.content: A final report must be delivered to the Financial Secretary within the time directed by the Financial Secretary or, in the absence of directions, within a reasonable time after it is prepared.
An inspector must, within a reasonable time after the delivery of a final report to the Financial Secretary, deliver to the Registrar for registration a notice of that fact in the specified form.

section.name: s857
section.heading: Interim report or final report may cover affairs of associated body corporate
section.content: If an inspector appointed to investigate a company’s affairs or a delegate of the inspector has exercised any of the powers under section 846, 847 or 848 in relation to an associated body corporate of the company, the inspector must also report on the affairs of that body corporate in the interim report or final report, so far as the inspector considers that the affairs of that body corporate are relevant to the investigation.

section.name: s858
section.heading: Inspector must send report to affected persons etc.

subsection.leadIn: If, in the opinion of an inspector appointed to investigate a company’s affairs, any person named in an interim report or final report on the investigation would in the event of a publication or other disclosure of the report, or any part of the report, be adversely affected by the publication or disclosure, the inspector must, before delivering the report to the Financial Secretary—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: send the draft report or that part of the draft report to the person; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: give the person a reasonable opportunity to be heard.

subsection.leadIn: Before an inspector sends a draft interim report or final report, or part of the draft report, to a person under subsection (1), the inspector may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: cause any passages in the draft report or that part of the draft report to be concealed from view or to be obliterated; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: require the person to keep the draft report or that part of the draft report confidential.

section.name: s859
section.heading: Financial Secretary to file copies of inspector’s report with Court

subsection.content: As soon as practicable after receiving an interim report or final report from an inspector appointed under section 841(1), the Financial Secretary must file a copy of the report with the Court.

The Financial Secretary may, before filing a copy of an interim report or final report with the Court under subsection (1), specify the period and manner in which access to the report is to be restricted.

section.name: s860
section.heading: Financial Secretary may send copies of inspector’s report to applicants of investigation etc.

subsection.leadIn: After receiving an interim report or final report from an inspector appointed to investigate a company’s affairs, the Financial Secretary may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: send a copy of the report to the company at its registered office; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: on request and on receipt of the prescribed fee, send a copy of the report to—

subparagraph.name: i
ii
subparagraph.content: the auditors of the company or body corporate;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: a person whose conduct is mentioned in the report;

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: the applicant for the investigation; or

subparagraph.name: v
subparagraph.content: any other person whose financial interest appears to the Financial Secretary to be affected by the matters dealt with in the report, whether as a creditor of the company or body corporate, or a possible investor or otherwise.

subsection.leadIn: Before sending a copy of an interim report or final report to any person under subsection (1), the Financial Secretary may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: cause any passage in the report to be concealed from view or to be obliterated; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: require the person to keep the copy of the report confidential.

section.name: s861
section.heading: Publication of inspector’s report

subsection.content: The Financial Secretary may publish, either in whole or in part, any interim report or final report delivered to the Financial Secretary under this Division.

The Financial Secretary must deliver to the Registrar for registration a copy of any interim report or final report, or any part of an interim report or final report, that is published under subsection (1) as soon as practicable after it is published.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: publish (發表) includes distribute, make available and disseminate.

section.name: s862
section.heading: Inspector’s report to be evidence
section.leadIn: In any civil proceedings before a court (including proceedings for the disqualification of a director)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a document purporting to be a copy of an interim report or final report prepared by an inspector, or a part of such a report, and purporting to be certified by the inspector or the Financial Secretary as a true copy of the report or part, is admissible in evidence on its production without further proof; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on being admitted in evidence under paragraph (a), the document is evidence of the facts stated in the report or that part of the report.

section.name: s863
section.heading: Offences for failing to comply with requirements under Subdivision 4 etc.

subsection.content: A person commits an offence if the person, without reasonable excuse, fails to comply with any requirement imposed on the person under Subdivision 4.
A person commits an offence if the person, with intent to defraud, fails to comply with any requirement imposed on the person under Subdivision 4.

An officer or employee of a company or body corporate on which a requirement is imposed under Subdivision 4 commits an offence if the officer or employee, with intent to defraud, causes or allows the company or body corporate to fail to comply with the requirement.

subsection.leadIn: A person commits an offence if the person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: in purported compliance with a requirement imposed on the person under Subdivision 4—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: produces any record or document that is false or misleading in a material particular;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: provides any information or explanation that is false or misleading in a material particular; or

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: says or states anything that is false or misleading in a material particular; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: knows that, or is reckless as to whether or not, the record or document, the information or explanation, or the thing said or stated, is false or misleading in a material particular.

subsection.leadIn: A person commits an offence if the person, with intent to defraud, in purported compliance with a requirement imposed on the person under Subdivision 4—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: produces any record or document that is false or misleading in a material particular;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: provides any information or explanation that is false or misleading in a material particular; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: says or states anything that is false or misleading in a material particular.

subsection.leadIn: An officer or employee of a company or body corporate on which a requirement is imposed under Subdivision 4 commits an offence if the officer or employee, with intent to defraud, causes or allows the company or body corporate to, in purported compliance with the requirement—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: produce any record or document that is false or misleading in a material particular;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: provide any information or explanation that is false or misleading in a material particular; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: say or state anything that is false or misleading in a material particular.

subsection.content: A person is not excused from complying with a requirement imposed on the person under Subdivision 4 only on the ground that to do so might tend to incriminate the person.

subsection.leadIn: Despite anything in this Ordinance, no criminal proceedings may be instituted against a person under subsection (1), (2), (3), (4), (5) or (6) in respect of any conduct if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: proceedings have previously been instituted against the person for the purposes of section 864(2)(b) in respect of the same conduct; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: those proceedings remain pending, or by reason of the previous institution of those proceedings, no proceedings may again be lawfully instituted against the person for the purposes of section 864(2)(b) in respect of the same conduct.

subsection.leadIn: A person who commits an offence under subsection (1) is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on conviction on indictment to a fine of $200,000 and to imprisonment for one year; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on summary conviction to a fine at level 5 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

subsection.leadIn: A person who commits an offence under subsection (2), (3), (5) or (6) is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on conviction on indictment to a fine of $1,000,000 and to imprisonment for 7 years; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on summary conviction to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

subsection.leadIn: A person who commits an offence under subsection (4) is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on conviction on indictment to a fine of $1,000,000 and to imprisonment for 2 years; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on summary conviction to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

section.name: s864
section.heading: Inspector may apply to Court to inquire into failure to comply with requirements under Subdivision 4

subsection.content: If a person fails to comply with a requirement imposed on the person under Subdivision 4, the inspector may, by originating summons, apply to the Court for an inquiry into the failure.

subsection.leadIn: The Court may, if it is satisfied that the person has without reasonable excuse failed to comply with the requirement, do any or all of the following—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: order the person to comply with the requirement within the period specified by the Court;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: punish the person, and any other person knowingly involved in the failure, in the same manner as if the person and, if applicable, that other person had been guilty of contempt of court.

subsection.leadIn: Despite anything in this Ordinance, no proceedings may be instituted against a person for the purposes of subsection (2)(b) in respect of any conduct if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: criminal proceedings have previously been instituted against the person under section 863(1), (2), (3), (4), (5) or (6) in respect of the same conduct; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: those criminal proceedings remain pending, or by reason of the previous institution of those criminal proceedings, no criminal proceedings may again be lawfully instituted against the person under section 863(1), (2), (3), (4), (5) or (6) in respect of the same conduct.

section.name: s865
section.heading: Use of incriminating evidence in proceedings

subsection.content: If an inspector or a delegate of an inspector requires a person, under Subdivision 4, to give an answer to any question or to provide any information or explanation in respect of any record or document produced, the inspector or delegate must ensure that the person has first been informed or reminded of the limitations imposed by subsection (2) on the admissibility in evidence of the inspector’s or delegate’s requirement and of the answer given, or information or explanation provided, by the person.

subsection.leadIn: Despite anything in this Ordinance, if the conditions specified in subsection (3) are satisfied, the inspector’s or delegate’s requirement and the answer given, or information or explanation provided, by the person are not admissible in evidence against the person in criminal proceedings, other than those in which the person is charged with an offence in respect of the answer, information or explanation—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: under section 863(4), (5) or (6);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: under Part V of the Crimes Ordinance (Cap. 200); or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: for perjury.

subsection.leadIn: The conditions are—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: that the answer, information or explanation might tend to incriminate the person; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: that the person so claims before giving the answer, or providing the information or explanation.

section.name: s866
section.heading: Expenses of investigation

subsection.content: The expenses of an investigation are to be defrayed in the first instance out of the general revenue but the persons mentioned in subsection (2) are liable to repay the expenses to the Government to the extent mentioned in that subsection.

subsection.leadIn: Those persons and the extent of their liability are as follows—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if, on a prosecution for an offence instituted as a result of the investigation, a person is convicted of the offence by the court, the person is liable to repay the expenses to the Government to the extent ordered by the court;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the inspector who conducted the investigation was appointed under section 840 or 841(1), any body corporate dealt with by the interim report or final report is liable to repay the expenses to the Government to the extent directed by the Financial Secretary;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: if the inspector who conducted the investigation was appointed under section 840 on application by a company or members of a company, the company or any of those members who made the application are liable to repay the expenses to the Government to the extent directed by the Financial Secretary.

subsection.content: When making an order or giving directions under a paragraph of subsection (2), the court or the Financial Secretary (as the case may be) may order or direct that 2 or more persons liable under that paragraph are to be jointly liable or jointly and severally liable for any of the expenses ordered or directed to be repaid to the Government.

On making an order on the extent of a person’s liability under paragraph (a) of subsection (2), the court may further order that the person is also liable to indemnify another person against any liability to which that other person may be subject under paragraph (b) or (c) of that subsection.

If the inspector who conducted the investigation was appointed under section 840 or 841(1), the interim report or final report of the investigation may, if the inspector thinks fit, include a recommendation as to the extent to which the expenses of the investigation should be repaid by a person referred to in paragraph (a), (b) or (c) of subsection (2).
An inspector must include a recommendation mentioned in subsection (5) in the interim report or final report of the investigation if so directed by the Financial Secretary.

subsection.leadIn: The recommendation of an inspector under subsection (5) or (6)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: in relation to a person referred to in paragraph (a) of subsection (2)—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: must not be disclosed to the court until after the person has been convicted; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: does not bind the court; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in relation to a person referred to in paragraph (b) or (c) of subsection (2), does not bind the Financial Secretary.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of this section, the expenses of an investigation include—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: reasonable expenses incidental to the investigation; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: such reasonable sums for general staff costs and overhead expenses of the Government, and for the cost of insurance for the inspector, as are determined by the Financial Secretary.

subsection.content: An amount that is repayable to the Government under subsection (2) is recoverable as a civil debt due to the Government.

division.name: D3
division.heading: Enquiry into Company’s Affairs by Financial Secretary

section.name: s867
section.heading: Interpretation
section.leadIn: company (公司) —

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in section 868(a), includes a registered non-Hong Kong company;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in section 868(b), includes a non-Hong Kong company.

section.name: s868
section.heading: Circumstances under which Financial Secretary may enquire into company’s affairs
section.leadIn: The Financial Secretary may enquire into a company’s affairs if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Financial Secretary considers that doing so would assist the Financial Secretary in deciding whether to appoint an inspector under section 840(2); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: it appears to the Financial Secretary that there is a good reason for doing so.

section.name: s869
section.heading: Financial Secretary may require production of records and documents etc.

subsection.leadIn: For the purpose of enquiring into a company’s affairs under section 868, if the Financial Secretary considers that a record or document is or may be relevant to the enquiry, the Financial Secretary may, by notice in writing, require—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the company; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any other person who appears to the Financial Secretary to be in possession of the record or document,

subsection.continued: to produce the record or document within the time and at the place specified in the notice.

subsection.leadIn: If a company or a person produces a record or document in compliance with a requirement imposed under subsection (1), the Financial Secretary may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: make copies, or otherwise record the details, of the record or document; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: by notice in writing, require an officer or former officer of the company or the person to provide any information or explanation in respect of the record or document.

subsection.leadIn: The Financial Secretary must not require an authorized institution to produce any record or document, or disclose any information, relating to the affairs of a customer of the institution under subsection (1) or (2) unless—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Financial Secretary has reasonable grounds to believe that the customer may be able to provide information relevant to the enquiry; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the Financial Secretary is satisfied that the production or disclosure is necessary for the purposes of the enquiry and so certifies in writing.

subsection.content: If an authorized institution produces a record or document relating to the affairs of its customer in compliance with a requirement imposed under subsection (1), the Financial Secretary may also require that customer to provide any information or explanation in respect of the record or document.

If a company or a person does not produce a record or document in compliance with a requirement imposed under subsection (1), the Financial Secretary may, by notice in writing, require the company or person to state, to the best of the company’s or person’s knowledge and belief, where the record or document is.

section.name: s870
section.heading: Financial Secretary may delegate powers under section 869
section.content: The Financial Secretary may delegate in writing any or all of the powers conferred under section 869 to another person.

section.name: s871
section.heading: Offences for failing to comply with requirements under section 869 etc.

subsection.content: A person commits an offence if the person, without reasonable excuse, fails to comply with any requirement imposed on the person under section 869.
A person commits an offence if the person, with intent to defraud, fails to comply with any requirement imposed on the person under section 869.

An officer or employee of a company on which a requirement is imposed under section 869 commits an offence if the officer or employee, with intent to defraud, causes or allows the company to fail to comply with the requirement.

subsection.leadIn: A person commits an offence if the person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: in purported compliance with a requirement imposed on the person under section 869—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: produces any record or document that is false or misleading in a material particular; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: provides any information or explanation that is false or misleading in a material particular; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: knows that, or is reckless as to whether or not, the record or document, or the information or explanation, is false or misleading in a material particular.

subsection.leadIn: A person commits an offence if the person, with intent to defraud, in purported compliance with a requirement imposed on the person under section 869—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: produces any record or document that is false or misleading in a material particular; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: provides any information or explanation that is false or misleading in a material particular.

subsection.leadIn: An officer or employee of a company on which a requirement is imposed under section 869 commits an offence if the officer or employee, with intent to defraud, causes or allows the company to, in purported compliance with the requirement—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: produce any record or document that is false or misleading in a material particular; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: provide any information or explanation that is false or misleading in a material particular.

subsection.content: A person is not excused from complying with a requirement imposed on the person under section 869 only on the ground that to do so might tend to incriminate the person.

subsection.leadIn: A person who commits an offence under subsection (1) is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on conviction on indictment to a fine of $200,000 and to imprisonment for one year; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on summary conviction to a fine at level 5 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

subsection.leadIn: A person who commits an offence under subsection (2), (3), (5) or (6) is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on conviction on indictment to a fine of $1,000,000 and to imprisonment for 7 years; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on summary conviction to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

subsection.leadIn: A person who commits an offence under subsection (4) is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on conviction on indictment to a fine of $1,000,000 and to imprisonment for 2 years; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on summary conviction to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

section.name: s872
section.heading: Use of incriminating evidence in proceedings
