subsection.content: If the Financial Secretary or a delegate of the Financial Secretary requires a person, under section 869, to provide any information or explanation in respect of any record or document produced, the Financial Secretary or delegate must ensure that the person has first been informed or reminded of the limitations imposed by subsection (2) on the admissibility in evidence of the Financial Secretary’s or delegate’s requirement and of the information or explanation provided by the person.

subsection.leadIn: Despite anything in this Ordinance, if the conditions specified in subsection (3) are satisfied, the Financial Secretary’s or delegate’s requirement, as well as the information or explanation provided by the person, are not admissible in evidence against the person in criminal proceedings other than those in which the person is charged with an offence in respect of the information or explanation—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: under section 871(4), (5) or (6);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: under Part V of the Crimes Ordinance (Cap. 200); or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: for perjury.

subsection.leadIn: The conditions specified for the purposes of subsection (2) are—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: that the information or explanation might tend to incriminate the person; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: that the person so claims before providing the information or explanation.

section.name: s873
section.heading: Registrar may require production of records and documents etc.

subsection.leadIn: For the purpose of enquiring into whether any specified act has been done, if each of the conditions specified in subsection (2) is satisfied, the Registrar may, by notice in writing, require a person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to produce, within the time and at the place specified in the notice, any record or document specified in the notice; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the record or document is produced, to provide any information or explanation in respect of the record or document.

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (3), the conditions are—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: that the Registrar has reason to believe that—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: a specified act has been done;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the record, document, information or explanation is relevant to the enquiry; and

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: the person is in possession of the record or document; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: that it is so certified in writing by the Registrar.

subsection.leadIn: Subsection (2)(a)(iii) does not apply if the person who is to be required to produce the record or document is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the body corporate to which the act relates; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an officer of that body corporate.

subsection.leadIn: The Registrar must not require an authorized institution to produce any record or document, or disclose any information, relating to the affairs of a customer of the institution under subsection (1) unless—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Registrar has reasonable grounds to believe that the customer may be able to provide information relevant to the enquiry; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the Registrar is satisfied that the production or disclosure is necessary for the purposes of the enquiry and so certifies in writing.

subsection.content: If an authorized institution produces a record or document relating to the affairs of its customer in compliance with a requirement imposed under subsection (1), the Registrar may also require that customer to provide any information or explanation in respect of the record or document.
If a person produces a record or document in compliance with a requirement imposed under subsection (1), the Registrar may make copies, or otherwise record the details, of the record or document.
The Financial Secretary may, by notice published in the Gazette, amend subsection (8).

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: specified act (指明作為) means an act that would constitute an offence under section 750(6) or 895(1).

section.name: s874
section.heading: Registrar may delegate powers under section 873
section.content: The Registrar may delegate in writing any or all of the powers conferred under section 873 to any public officer.

section.name: s875
section.heading: Offences for failing to comply with requirements under section 873 etc.

subsection.content: A person commits an offence if the person, without reasonable excuse, fails to comply with any requirement imposed on the person under section 873.
A person commits an offence if the person, with intent to defraud, fails to comply with any requirement imposed on the person under section 873.

An officer or employee of a body corporate on which a requirement is imposed under section 873 commits an offence if the officer or employee, with intent to defraud, causes or allows the body corporate to fail to comply with the requirement.

subsection.leadIn: A person commits an offence if the person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: in purported compliance with a requirement imposed on the person under section 873—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: produces any record or document that is false or misleading in a material particular; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: provides any information or explanation that is false or misleading in a material particular; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: knows that, or is reckless as to whether or not, the record or document, or the information or explanation, is false or misleading in a material particular.

subsection.leadIn: A person commits an offence if the person, with intent to defraud, in purported compliance with a requirement imposed on the person under section 873—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: produces any record or document that is false or misleading in a material particular; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: provides any information or explanation that is false or misleading in a material particular.

subsection.leadIn: An officer or employee of a body corporate on which a requirement is imposed under section 873 commits an offence if the officer or employee, with intent to defraud, causes or allows the body corporate to, in purported compliance with the requirement—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: produce any record or document that is false or misleading in a material particular; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: provide any information or explanation that is false or misleading in a material particular.

subsection.content: A person is not excused from complying with a requirement imposed on the person under section 873 only on the ground that to do so might tend to incriminate the person.

subsection.leadIn: A person who commits an offence under subsection (1) is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on conviction on indictment to a fine of $150,000 and to imprisonment for one year; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on summary conviction to a fine at level 5 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

subsection.leadIn: A person who commits an offence under subsection (2), (3), (5) or (6) is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on conviction on indictment to a fine of $1,000,000 and to imprisonment for 3 years; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on summary conviction to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

subsection.leadIn: A person who commits an offence under subsection (4) is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on conviction on indictment to a fine of $300,000 and to imprisonment for 2 years; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on summary conviction to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

section.name: s876
section.heading: Use of incriminating evidence in proceedings

subsection.content: If the Registrar or a delegate of the Registrar requires a person, under section 873, to provide any information or explanation in respect of any record or document produced, the Registrar or delegate must ensure that the person has first been informed or reminded of the limitations imposed by subsection (2) on the admissibility in evidence of the Registrar’s or delegate’s requirement and of the information or explanation provided by the person.

subsection.leadIn: Despite anything in this Ordinance, if the conditions specified in subsection (3) are satisfied, the Registrar’s or delegate’s requirement, as well as the information or explanation provided by the person, are not admissible in evidence against the person in criminal proceedings other than those in which the person is charged with an offence in respect of the information or explanation—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: under section 875(4), (5) or (6);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: under Part V of the Crimes Ordinance (Cap. 200); or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: for perjury.

subsection.leadIn: The conditions specified for the purposes of subsection (2) are—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: that the information or explanation might tend to incriminate the person; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: that the person so claims before providing the information or explanation.

subdivision.name: SD1
subdivision.heading: Supplementary Provisions Applicable to Divisions 2 and 3

section.name: s877
section.heading: Magistrate’s warrants

subsection.content: If a magistrate is satisfied on information on oath that there are reasonable grounds to suspect that there is, or is likely to be, on premises specified in the information any record or document that may be required to be produced under Division 2 or 3, the magistrate may issue a warrant in respect of the premises. (Amended 17 of 2018 s. 141)

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsection (1), the information—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: must set out—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the nature of the record or document that is, or is likely to be, on the premises; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the provision of Division 2 or 3 under which the record or document may be required to be produced; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: must be laid by—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: in relation to an investigation under Division 2, an inspector; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: in relation to an enquiry under Division 3, the Financial Secretary or a delegate of the Financial Secretary.

subsection.leadIn: A warrant issued under subsection (1) authorizes a person specified in it, and such other persons as may be necessary to assist in its execution, to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: enter the premises, if necessary by force, at any time within the period of 7 days beginning with the date of the warrant; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: search for, seize and remove, any record or document that the person so specified has reasonable grounds to believe may be required to be produced under Division 2 or 3 (as the case may be).

subsection.leadIn: If an authorized person has reasonable grounds to believe that another person on the premises is employed or engaged to provide a service in connection with a business that is or has been conducted on the premises, the authorized person may require that other person to produce for examination any record or document that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is in the possession of that other person; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the authorized person has reasonable grounds to believe may be required to be produced under Division 2 or 3 (as the case may be).

subsection.leadIn: An authorized person may, in relation to any record or document required to be produced under subsection (4)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: prohibit any person found on the premises from—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: removing the record or document from the premises;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: erasing anything from, adding anything to, or otherwise altering anything in, the record or document; or

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: otherwise interfering in any manner with, or causing or permitting any other person to interfere with, the record or document; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: take any other steps that appear to the authorized person to be necessary for—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: preserving the record or document; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: preventing interference with the record or document.

subsection.leadIn: Any record or document removed by an authorized person may be retained for—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a period not exceeding 6 months beginning with the day of its removal; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the record or document is or may be required for the purposes of any criminal proceedings, or any proceedings under this Ordinance or the Companies (Winding Up and Miscellaneous Provisions) Ordinance (Cap. 32), such longer period as may be necessary for the purposes of those proceedings.

subsection.leadIn: If an authorized person removes any record or document under this section, the person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: must as soon as practicable after the removal give a receipt for the record or document; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: may permit any other person who, but for the removal, would be entitled to inspect the record or document, at all reasonable times—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: to inspect it; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: to make copies or otherwise record details of it.

subsection.content: Section 102 of the Criminal Procedure Ordinance (Cap. 221) applies to any property that has, by virtue of this section, come into the possession of an inspector, the Financial Secretary or a delegate of the Financial Secretary, as it applies to property that has come into the possession of the police.

subsection.leadIn: A person commits an offence if the person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: without reasonable excuse, fails to comply with a requirement or prohibition under subsection (4) or (5); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: obstructs an authorized person in the exercise of a power conferred by subsection (3), (4) or (5).

subsection.leadIn: A person who commits an offence under subsection (9) is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on conviction on indictment to a fine of $1,000,000 and to imprisonment for 2 years; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on summary conviction to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: authorized person (獲授權人) means a person authorized by a warrant issued under subsection (1) to carry out the acts set out in paragraphs (a) and (b) of subsection (3).

section.name: s878
section.heading: Officers must give assistance in prosecution instituted as a result of investigation etc.

subsection.leadIn: If—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an investigation under Division 2 or an enquiry under Division 3 has been carried out; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a prosecution for an offence is instituted as a result of the investigation or enquiry,

subsection.continued: every officer or former officer, employee or former employee, or agent or former agent of any body corporate the affairs of which have been investigated or enquired into in that investigation or enquiry must give the Secretary for Justice all assistance in connection with the prosecution that the officer, employee or agent is reasonably able to give.

subsection.content: Subsection (1) does not require a person to give any assistance in connection with the prosecution if the person is a defendant in the proceedings.

section.name: s879
section.heading: Proceedings on specified materials

subsection.content: If it appears to the Financial Secretary from any specified materials that it is expedient in the public interest that a body corporate which may be wound up under the Companies (Winding Up and Miscellaneous Provisions) Ordinance (Cap. 32) should be wound up, the Financial Secretary may present a petition for it to be wound up.
On a petition by the Financial Secretary under subsection (1), the Court may make a winding up order if the Court thinks it just and equitable for the body corporate to be wound up.

subsection.leadIn: If it appears to the Financial Secretary from any specified materials that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a company’s or non-Hong Kong company’s affairs are being or have been conducted in a manner unfairly prejudicial to the interests of the members generally or of one or more members; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an actual or proposed act or omission of a company or non-Hong Kong company (including one done or made on its behalf) is or would be so prejudicial,

subsection.continued: the Financial Secretary may, whether or not a petition has been presented under subsection (1), present to the Court a petition for an order to be made under section 725(1)(b) or (2).

subsection.leadIn: If it appears to the Financial Secretary from any specified materials that, in relation to a company or non-Hong Kong company, a person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: has engaged, is engaging or is proposing to engage in any conduct specified in section 728(1)(a); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: before the commencement date# of section 728, had engaged, was engaging or was proposing to engage in any conduct specified in section 728(2)(a), and the engagement or proposal still subsists,

subsection.continued: the Financial Secretary may apply to the Court for the remedies under section 729(2).

subsection.leadIn: If it appears to the Financial Secretary from any specified materials that, in relation to a company or non-Hong Kong company, a person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: has refused or failed, is refusing or failing, or is proposing to refuse or fail, to do an act or thing specified in section 728(1)(b); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: before the commencement date# of section 728, had refused or failed, was refusing or failing, or was proposing to refuse or fail, to do an act or thing that the person was required by the predecessor Ordinance and is required by this Ordinance to do, and the refusal, failure or proposal still subsists,

subsection.continued: the Financial Secretary may apply to the Court for the remedies under section 729(2).

subsection.leadIn: If it appears to the Financial Secretary from any specified materials that it is expedient in the public interest that a disqualification order be made under section 168J(1) of the Companies (Winding Up and Miscellaneous Provisions) Ordinance (Cap. 32) against any person who is or has been a director or shadow director of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a company as defined by section 2(1);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: an unregistered company as defined by section 326(1) of the Companies (Winding Up and Miscellaneous Provisions) Ordinance (Cap. 32) (other than a partnership, whether limited or not, or an association), wherever incorporated, that—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: is carrying on business in Hong Kong, or has carried on business in Hong Kong; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: may be wound up under the Companies (Winding Up and Miscellaneous Provisions) Ordinance (Cap. 32); or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a registered non-Hong Kong company,

subsection.continued: the Financial Secretary may apply to the Court for such an order to be made against that person.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—

def.name: SpecifiedMaterials
def.leadIn: specified materials (指明材料) means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any report made on, or any record, document or information obtained in, an investigation under Division 2 by an inspector or a delegate of an inspector; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any record, document or information obtained in an enquiry under Division 3 by the Financial Secretary or a delegate of the Financial Secretary.

section.name: s880
section.heading: Preservation of secrecy

subsection.leadIn: Except in the performance of any function under this Ordinance or the Companies (Winding Up and Miscellaneous Provisions) Ordinance (Cap. 32), or for carrying into effect the provisions of this Ordinance or that Ordinance, a person specified in subsection (3)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: must not permit any person to have access to any matter relating to the affairs of any person that comes to the specified person’s knowledge in an investigation under Division 2 or an enquiry under Division 3, or otherwise in connection with the investigation or enquiry; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: must not communicate any such matter to any person other than the person to whom the matter relates.

subsection.content: Subsection (1) has effect subject to section 881(1) and (2).

subsection.leadIn: The persons specified for the purposes of subsection (1) are—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a public officer;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an inspector or a delegate of an inspector or of the Financial Secretary, or an employee, agent, consultant or adviser of the inspector or delegate;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: an employee, agent, consultant or adviser who is employed or appointed for the purposes of an investigation under Division 2 or an enquiry under Division 3;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: a person who performs or has performed any function in an investigation under Division 2 or an enquiry under Division 3;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: a person who has assisted any other person in the performance of any function in an investigation under Division 2 or an enquiry under Division 3; and

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.leadIn: a person who, under section 858 or 860—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: has been sent a draft report or a part of the draft report, or a report, on an investigation; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: has been required to keep the draft report or that part of the draft report, or the report, confidential.

section.name: s881
section.heading: Permitted disclosure and restrictions

subsection.leadIn: A person specified in section 880(3) may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: disclose information that has already been made available to the public;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: disclose information for the purpose of any criminal proceedings in Hong Kong or any investigation conducted by a law enforcement agency with a view to bringing any such proceedings;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: disclose information for the purpose of seeking advice from or giving advice by counsel, a solicitor or other professional adviser, acting or proposing to act in a professional capacity in connection with any matter arising under this Ordinance or the Companies (Winding Up and Miscellaneous Provisions) Ordinance (Cap. 32);

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: disclose information in connection with any judicial or other proceedings to which the specified person is a party; and

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: disclose information in accordance with an order of a court or tribunal, or in accordance with a law or a requirement made under a law.

subsection.leadIn: The Financial Secretary may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: subject to subsection (3), disclose information to—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the Chief Executive;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the Secretary for Justice;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: the Secretary for Financial Services and the Treasury;

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: the Commissioner of Police of Hong Kong;

subparagraph.name: v
subparagraph.content: the Commissioner of the Independent Commission Against Corruption;

subparagraph.name: vi
subparagraph.content: the Commissioner of Inland Revenue;

subparagraph.name: vii
subparagraph.content: the Registrar;

subparagraph.name: viii
ix
subparagraph.content: the Monetary Authority;

subparagraph.name: x
subparagraph.content: the Securities and Futures Commission;

subparagraph.name: xi
subparagraph.content: the Accounting and Financial Reporting Council; (Amended L.N. 66 of 2022)

subparagraph.name: xii
subparagraph.content: the Market Misconduct Tribunal;

subparagraph.name: xiii
subparagraph.content: the Insurance Authority;

subparagraph.name: xiv
subparagraph.content: the Mandatory Provident Fund Schemes Authority;

subparagraph.name: xv
subparagraph.content: an inspector;

subparagraph.name: xvi
subparagraph.content: a delegate of the Financial Secretary;

subparagraph.name: xvii
subparagraph.content: a company recognized as an exchange company under section 19(2) of the Securities and Futures Ordinance (Cap. 571);

subparagraph.name: xviii
subparagraph.content: the Privacy Commissioner for Personal Data;

subparagraph.name: xix
subparagraph.content: the Ombudsman; or

subparagraph.name: xx
subparagraph.content: a public officer authorized by the Financial Secretary under subsection (7);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: subject to subsection (3), disclose information in respect of a company whose affairs are or have been investigated under section 840 or 841, or enquired into under section 869, to—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the Official Receiver in the capacity of a liquidator or provisional liquidator of the company appointed under, or holding such office by virtue of, the Companies (Winding Up and Miscellaneous Provisions) Ordinance (Cap. 32); or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.leadIn: any other person who—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: is a liquidator or provisional liquidator of the company appointed under that Ordinance; or

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: acts in a similar capacity in relation to the company under any law of a place outside Hong Kong;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: disclose information with the consent of—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the person from whom the information was obtained or received; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: if the information does not relate to such person, the person to whom it relates; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: disclose information in summary form that is so framed as to prevent particulars relating to any person from being ascertained from it.

subsection.leadIn: The Financial Secretary must not disclose information under subsection (2)(a) or (b) unless the Financial Secretary is of the opinion that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the disclosure will enable or assist the recipient of the information to perform the recipient’s functions; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: it is not contrary to the public interest that the information be so disclosed.

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (5), if information is disclosed under subsection (1) or (2) (other than subsection (1)(a) or (2)(d)) or section 880(1)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the person to whom the information is so disclosed; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any other person who obtains or receives the information from that person,

subsection.continued: must not disclose the information to any other person.

subsection.leadIn: Subsection (4) does not prohibit a person mentioned in paragraph (a) or (b) of that subsection from disclosing the information to any other person if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Financial Secretary consents to the disclosure;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the information has already been made available to the public;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the disclosure is for the purpose of seeking advice from or giving advice by counsel, a solicitor or other professional adviser, acting or proposing to act in a professional capacity in connection with any matter arising under this Ordinance or the Companies (Winding Up and Miscellaneous Provisions) Ordinance (Cap. 32);

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the disclosure is in connection with any judicial or other proceedings to which the person so referred to is a party; or

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: the disclosure is in accordance with an order of a court or tribunal, or in accordance with a law or a requirement made under a law.

subsection.leadIn: The Financial Secretary may attach such conditions as the Financial Secretary considers appropriate to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a disclosure of information made under subsection (2); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a consent granted under subsection (5)(a).

subsection.content: The Financial Secretary may authorize any public officer as a person to whom information may be disclosed under subsection (2)(a)(xx).

section.name: s882
section.heading: Offences on breach of secrecy

subsection.content: A person who contravenes section 880(1) commits an offence.

subsection.leadIn: A person commits an offence if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the person discloses any information in contravention of section 881(4); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: at the time of the disclosure—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the person knew, or ought to have known, that the information was previously disclosed to, or obtained or received by, the person as described in section 881(4)(a) or (b); and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the person had no reasonable grounds to believe that the person was not prohibited from disclosing the information by virtue of section 881(5).

subsection.leadIn: A person who commits an offence under subsection (1) or (2) is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on conviction on indictment to a fine of $1,000,000 and to imprisonment for 2 years; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on summary conviction to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

subdivision.name: SD2
subdivision.heading: Supplementary Provisions Applicable to Divisions 2, 3 and 4

section.name: s883
section.heading: Interpretation
section.leadIn: In this Subdivision—

def.name: SpecifiedOfficer
def.leadIn: specified officer (指明人員) —

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in relation to an investigation under Division 2, means an inspector or a delegate of an inspector;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in relation to an enquiry under Division 3, means the Financial Secretary or a delegate of the Financial Secretary; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: in relation to an enquiry under Division 4, means the Registrar or a delegate of the Registrar.

section.name: s884
section.heading: Protection in relation to certain disclosures

subsection.leadIn: If—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a person makes a disclosure to a specified officer otherwise than in compliance with a requirement made by the officer under Division 2, 3 or 4 (as the case may be); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the disclosure satisfies each of the conditions specified in subsection (2),

subsection.continued: the person is not liable in any proceedings relating to a breach of duty of confidentiality by reason only of the disclosure.

subsection.leadIn: The conditions are—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: that the disclosure is of a kind that the person could be required to make under Division 2, 3 or 4 (as the case may be);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: that the person makes the disclosure in good faith and in the reasonable belief that the disclosure is capable of assisting the specified officer in the investigation under Division 2 or enquiry under Division 3 or 4;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: that the information disclosed is not more than is reasonably necessary for the purpose of assisting the specified officer in the investigation under Division 2 or enquiry under Division 3 or 4;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: that the disclosure is not prohibited by virtue of any enactment.

subsection.content: Subsection (1) does not apply to a disclosure made by a person in the capacity as a banker or lawyer in respect of information to which the person owes a duty of confidentiality in that capacity.

section.name: s885
section.heading: Protection of informers etc.

subsection.content: Any information concerning the identity of a protected person is not admissible in evidence in any proceedings before a court or tribunal.

subsection.leadIn: In such proceedings, a witness is not obliged—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to disclose the name or address of a protected person who is not a witness in those proceedings; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to state any matter that would lead, or would tend to lead, to discovery of the name or address of a protected person who is not a witness in those proceedings.

subsection.leadIn: If a book, document or paper that is in evidence, or liable to inspection, in such proceedings contains an entry—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in which a protected person is named or described; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: that might lead to discovery of a protected person,

subsection.continued: the court or tribunal (as the case may be) must cause all such entries to be concealed from view, or to be obliterated, so far as may be necessary to protect the identity of the protected person from discovery.

subsection.leadIn: In such proceedings, the court or tribunal may, despite subsection (1), (2) or (3), permit inquiry, and require full disclosure, concerning a protected person if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: it is of the opinion that justice cannot be fully done between the parties to the proceedings without disclosure of the name of the protected person; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: it is satisfied that the protected person made a material statement that the person—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: knew or believed to be false; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: did not believe to be true.

subsection.content: This section has effect despite the preparation or publication of any interim report or final report of an investigation under Division 2.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—

def.name: ProtectedPerson
def.leadIn: protected person (受保障人士) means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an informer who has given information to a specified officer with respect to an investigation under Division 2 or an enquiry under Division 3 or 4; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a person who has assisted a specified officer with respect to such an investigation or enquiry.

section.name: s886
section.heading: Legal professional privilege

subsection.content: Subject to subsection (2), this Part does not affect any claims, rights or entitlements that would, apart from this Part, arise on the ground of legal professional privilege.

Subsection (1) does not affect any requirement under Division 2, 3 or 4 to disclose the name and address of a client of a legal practitioner (whether or not the legal practitioner is qualified in Hong Kong to practise as counsel or to act as a solicitor).

section.name: s887
section.heading: Immunity

subsection.content: A person who complies with a requirement imposed by a specified officer under Subdivision 4 of Division 2 or section 869 or 873 does not incur any civil liability by reason only of that compliance.

A person does not incur any civil liability in respect of anything done, or omitted to be done, by the person in good faith in the performance, or purported performance, of any function under this Part.

section.name: s888
section.heading: Production of information in information systems etc.

subsection.leadIn: If—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a specified officer requires any record or document to be produced under Subdivision 4 of Division 2 or section 869 or 873; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any information or matter contained in the record or document is recorded otherwise than in a legible form but is capable of being reproduced in a legible form,

subsection.continued: the officer may require the production of a reproduction of the recording of the information or matter, or the relevant part of the recording, in a legible form.

subsection.leadIn: If—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a specified officer requires any record or document to be produced under Subdivision 4 of Division 2 or section 869 or 873; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any information or matter contained in the record or document is recorded in an information system,

subsection.continued: the officer may require the production of a reproduction of the recording of the information or matter, or the relevant part of the recording, in a form that enables the information or matter to be reproduced in a legible form.

section.name: s889
section.heading: Lien claimed on records or documents
section.leadIn: If a person claims a lien on any record or document in the person’s possession that is required to be produced under Subdivision 4 of Division 2 or section 869 or 873—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the lien does not affect the requirement to produce the record or document;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: no fee is payable for or in respect of the production; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the production does not affect the lien.

section.name: s890
section.heading: Destruction of documents

subsection.leadIn: A person commits an offence if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the person destroys, falsifies, conceals or otherwise disposes of, or causes or permits the destruction, falsification, concealment or disposal of, any record or document that is required to be produced under Subdivision 4 of Division 2 or section 869 or 873; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the person does so with intent to conceal, from the specified officer by whom the requirement was imposed, facts or matters capable of being disclosed by the record or document.

subsection.leadIn: A person who commits an offence under subsection (1) is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on conviction on indictment to a fine of $1,000,000 and to imprisonment for 2 years; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on summary conviction to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

section.name: s891
section.heading: Inspection of records or documents seized etc.

subsection.content: This section applies if a specified officer has taken possession of any record or document under this Part.

subsection.leadIn: The specified officer must, subject to any reasonable conditions the officer may impose as to security or otherwise, permit any person who would be entitled to inspect the record or document had the officer not taken possession of it, at all reasonable times—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to inspect it; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to make copies or otherwise record details of it.

division.name: D6
division.heading: Investigation of Company’s Affairs by Persons Appointed by Company

section.name: s892
section.heading: Appointment of person by company to investigate its affairs

subsection.content: A company may, by special resolution, appoint a person to investigate its affairs.

subsection.leadIn: For the purpose of investigating the company’s affairs, the appointed person may, by notice in writing, require any officer or agent of the company to do any or all of the following—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: produce to the appointed person any record or document relating to any matter under investigation that is in the officer’s or agent’s custody or power;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: attend before the appointed person at the time and place specified in the notice, and answer any question, whether on oath or otherwise, relating to any matter under investigation that the appointed person may raise with the officer or agent;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: answer any question relating to any matter under investigation that is specified in the notice.

subsection.content: The appointed person may administer an oath to any person for the purposes of subsection (2)(b).

section.name: s893
section.heading: Court may inquire into failure of officer or agent to attend before appointed person etc.

subsection.content: If an officer or agent of a company fails to comply with a requirement imposed on the officer or agent under section 892(2), the appointed person may apply to the Court for an inquiry into the failure.

The Court may, if it is satisfied that the officer or agent has without any reasonable excuse failed to comply with the requirement, punish the officer or agent (as the case may be) in the same manner as if the officer or agent had been guilty of contempt of court.

section.name: s894
section.heading: Report by appointed person

subsection.content: A person appointed to investigate a company’s affairs under section 892(1) must, on the conclusion of the investigation, report on the investigation in any manner as that company in general meeting may direct.

subsection.leadIn: In any proceedings before a court—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a document purporting to be a copy of the report, and purporting to be signed by the appointed person and the company, is admissible in evidence on its production without further proof; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on being admitted in evidence under paragraph (a), the document is proof of any opinion of the appointed person expressed in the report.

part.name: P20
part.heading: Miscellaneous

section.name: s895
section.heading: Offence for false statement

subsection.content: A person commits an offence if, in any return, report, financial statements, certificate or other document, required by or for the purposes of any provision of this Ordinance, the person knowingly or recklessly makes a statement that is misleading, false or deceptive in any material particular.
subsection.statutoryNote:
Note—
Please also see section 873 which empowers the Registrar to require the production of records or documents, and the provision of information or explanation in respect of the records or documents, for the purpose of enquiring into whether any act that would constitute an offence under this subsection has been done.

subsection.leadIn: A person who commits an offence under subsection (1) is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on conviction on indictment to a fine of $300,000 and to imprisonment for 2 years; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on summary conviction to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

subsection.leadIn: This section does not affect the operation of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: Part V of the Crimes Ordinance (Cap. 200); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: section 19, 20 or 21 of the Theft Ordinance (Cap. 210).

section.name: s896
section.heading: Offence for improper use of “Limited” or “有限公司” etc.

subsection.leadIn: A person commits an offence if the person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is not incorporated with limited liability; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: uses, trades or carries on business under a name or title of which—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the word “Limited”, or a contraction or imitation of that word, is the last word;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the Chinese version of the word “Limited”, or of a contraction or imitation of that word, is the last word; or

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: the Chinese characters “有限公司” form part.

subsection.leadIn: A person commits an offence if the person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is not incorporated; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: uses, trades or carries on business under a name or title of which—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the word “Corporation” or “Incorporated”, or a contraction or imitation of that word, is the last word;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the Chinese version of the word “Corporation” or “Incorporated”, or of a contraction or imitation of that word, is the last word; or

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: the Chinese characters “註冊公司” or “法人團體” form part.

subsection.content: A person who commits an offence under subsection (1) or (2) is liable to a fine at level 3 and, in the case of a continuing offence, to a further fine of $300 for each day during which the offence continues.

division.name: D2
division.heading: Miscellaneous Provisions relating to Investigation or Enforcement Measures

section.name: s897
section.heading: Court may order inspection or production of records or documents if offence suspected

subsection.leadIn: The Court may, on application by the Secretary for Justice, make an order under subsection (2) or (3) if it is satisfied that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: there is reasonable cause to believe that any person has, while an officer of a company, committed an offence in connection with the management of the company’s affairs; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: evidence of the commission of the offence is to be found in—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: any record or document of, or under the control of, the company; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: any record or document of a person carrying on a banking business, which relate to the company’s affairs.

subsection.leadIn: The Court may, in the case of a record or document mentioned in subsection (1)(b)(i), make an order—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: authorizing a person named in the order to inspect the record or document for the purpose of investigating and obtaining evidence of the offence; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: requiring the company secretary of the company, or any other officer of the company named in the order, to produce the record or document to a person, and at a place, named in the order.

subsection.content: The Court may, in the case of a record or document mentioned in subsection (1)(b)(ii), make an order authorizing a person named in the order to inspect the record or document for the purpose of investigating and obtaining evidence of the offence.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: document (文件) has the meaning given by section 838(1);
record (紀錄) has the meaning given by section 838(1).

section.name: s898
section.heading: Enforcement of requirements by order of Court

subsection.leadIn: This section applies if a company or an officer of a company contravenes a requirement of this Ordinance—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to send, deliver, supply, forward or produce a document to the Registrar; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to give notice to the Registrar of any matter.

subsection.content: The Registrar, or a member or creditor of the company, may serve a notice on the company or officer requiring the company or officer to comply with the requirement.

subsection.leadIn: If the company or officer fails to make good the contravention within 14 days after service of the notice, the Court may, on application by the Registrar, or by a member or creditor of the company, make an order—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the case of a contravention by the company, directing the company and any officer of the company to make good the contravention within the time specified in the order; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the case of a contravention by the officer, directing the officer to make good the contravention within the time specified in the order.

subsection.leadIn: An order may provide that all costs of and incidental to the application are to be borne—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the case of a contravention by the company, by the company or by any officer of the company responsible for the contravention; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the case of a contravention by the officer, by that officer.

subsection.content: This section does not affect the operation of any Ordinance imposing penalties on a company or any officer of a company in respect of the contravention.

section.name: s899
section.heading: Registrar may give notice to suspected offender about not instituting proceedings under certain conditions

subsection.leadIn: If the Registrar has reason to believe that a person has committed an offence specified in Schedule 7, the Registrar may give the person a notice in writing that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: alleges that the person has committed an offence specified in the Schedule, and contains the particulars of the offence;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: contains—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: in the case of an offence mentioned in subsection (5), the terms of the notice by reference to that subsection; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: in the case of an offence mentioned in subsection (6), the terms of the notice by reference to that subsection;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: specifies the period and amount for the purposes of that subsection; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: contains any other information that the Registrar thinks fit.

subsection.content: A notice may be given only before the proceedings on the offence commence.
The Registrar may, by a further notice in writing, extend the period specified under subsection (1)(c). This power is exercisable within, or after the end of, that period.
A notice under subsection (1) may not be withdrawn within the period specified in the notice or that period as extended under subsection (3).

subsection.leadIn: Where the offence is an offence constituted by a failure to do an act or thing—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: no proceedings will be instituted against the person in respect of that offence if, within the period specified in a notice under subsection (1) or that period as extended under subsection (3), the person pays to the Registrar the amount specified in the notice and does the act or thing; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: proceedings may be instituted against the person in respect of that offence if, within the period specified in a notice under subsection (1) or that period as extended under subsection (3), the person has not paid to the Registrar the amount specified in the notice or has not done the act or thing.

subsection.leadIn: Where the offence is not an offence constituted by a failure to do an act or thing—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: no proceedings will be instituted against the person in respect of that offence if, within the period specified in a notice under subsection (1) or that period as extended under subsection (3), the person pays to the Registrar the amount specified in the notice; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: proceedings may be instituted against the person in respect of that offence if, within the period specified in a notice under subsection (1) or that period as extended under subsection (3), the person has not paid to the Registrar the amount specified in the notice.

subsection.content: The payment of an amount specified in a notice given to a person under subsection (1) is not to be regarded as an admission by the person of any liability for the offence alleged in the notice to have been committed by the person.

section.name: s900
section.heading: Limitation on commencement of proceedings

subsection.leadIn: Despite section 26 of the Magistrates Ordinance (Cap. 227), an information or complaint relating to an offence under this Ordinance may be tried if it is laid before or made to a magistrate—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: within 3 years after the commission of the offence; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: within 12 months after the date on which the supporting evidence came to the Secretary for Justice’s knowledge.

subsection.content: For the purposes of this section, a certificate of the Secretary for Justice as to the date on which the supporting evidence came to the Secretary for Justice’s knowledge is conclusive evidence of that date.

subsection.leadIn: This section does not apply to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an indictable offence; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an offence triable either on indictment or summarily.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: supporting evidence (助控證據) means evidence sufficient, in the Secretary for Justice’s opinion, to justify the proceedings.

section.name: s901
section.heading: Application of fines

subsection.content: When imposing a fine under this Ordinance, the court may direct that the whole or any part of the fine is to be applied in or towards payment of the costs of the proceedings.
Subject to a direction under subsection (1), a fine under this Ordinance must be paid into the general revenue.
Subsection (2) has effect despite anything in any other Ordinance.

division.name: D3
division.heading: Miscellaneous Provisions relating to Misconduct by Officer or Auditor of Company

section.name: s902
section.heading: Interpretation
section.leadIn: In this Division—
section.def: misconduct (不當行為) means negligence, default, breach of duty or breach of trust;

def.name: SpecifiedPerson
def.leadIn: specified person (指明人士) means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an officer of a company; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a person employed by a company as an auditor.

section.name: s903
section.heading: Court may grant company officer etc. relief in proceedings for misconduct

subsection.leadIn: This section applies if, in any proceedings for any misconduct against a specified person, it appears to the Court that the person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is or may be liable for the misconduct;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: has acted honestly and reasonably; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: ought fairly to be excused for the misconduct, having regard to all the circumstances of the case (including those connected with the person’s appointment).

subsection.content: The Court may relieve the specified person, either wholly or partly, from the liability on any terms that the Court thinks fit.

subsection.leadIn: If the case is tried by a judge with a jury, the judge may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: withdraw the case in whole or in part from the jury; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: direct judgment to be entered for the specified person on the terms as to costs or otherwise that the judge thinks fit.

section.name: s904
section.heading: Court may grant company officer etc. relief for misconduct on officer’s application

subsection.content: A specified person may apply to the Court for relief if the person has reason to apprehend that a claim will or might be made against the person for any misconduct.

subsection.leadIn: On an application, the Court may relieve the specified person, either wholly or partly, from the liability on any terms that the Court thinks fit if it appears to the Court that the person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is or may be liable for the misconduct;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: has acted honestly and reasonably; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: ought fairly to be excused for the misconduct, having regard to all the circumstances of the case (including those connected with the person’s appointment).

section.name: s905
section.heading: Costs in action by company etc.

subsection.leadIn: This section applies where—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a company is a plaintiff in an action or other legal proceedings; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: it appears, by credible testimony, to the court having jurisdiction in the matter that there is reason to believe the company will be unable to pay the defendant’s costs if the defendant succeeds in the defence.

subsection.leadIn: Without limiting the powers of the court under any other Ordinance, the court may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: require sufficient security to be given for those costs; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: stay all proceedings until the security is given.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—

def.name: Company
def.leadIn: company (公司) means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a limited company; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a company incorporated outside Hong Kong that is not a re-domiciled company. (Replaced 14 of 2025 s. 71)

section.name: s906
section.heading: Saving as to private prosecution
section.content: Nothing in this Ordinance relating to the institution of criminal proceedings by the Secretary for Justice precludes any person from instituting or carrying on any such proceedings.

section.name: s907
section.heading: Saving for privileged communication
section.content: If proceedings are instituted under this Ordinance against any person by the Secretary for Justice, nothing in this Ordinance is to be regarded as requiring any person to disclose any information that the person is entitled to refuse to disclose on grounds of legal professional privilege.

section.name: s908
section.heading: Paperless holding and transfer of shares and debentures
section.text: Schedule 8, which contains amendments relating to paperless holding and transfer of shares and debentures, has effect.

section.name: s909
section.heading: Power to make regulations

subsection.content: The Financial Secretary may make regulations for any matter required or permitted to be prescribed under this Ordinance.
Subsection (1) does not apply if the Chief Executive in Council or the Financial Secretary is empowered under another Part to make regulations for the matter.

section.name: s910
section.heading: Supplementary provisions for regulations made under this Ordinance
section.leadIn: Subsidiary legislation made by the Chief Executive in Council or the Financial Secretary under this Ordinance may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: make different provision for different cases or classes of cases; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: contain any consequential, transitional, saving, incidental or supplementary provisions, that the Chief Executive in Council or the Financial Secretary (as the case may be) thinks fit.

section.name: s911
section.heading: Financial Secretary and Registrar may amend Schedules

subsection.content: The Financial Secretary may, by notice published in the Gazette, amend Schedule 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 5A, 5B, 5C, 6A, 6B, 6C or 7. (Amended 3 of 2018 s. 5; 14 of 2025 s. 72)
The Registrar may, by notice published in the Gazette, amend Schedule 6.

part.name: P21
part.heading: Consequential Amendments, and Transitional and Saving Provisions

section.name: s912
section.heading: Amendments to enactments

subsection.content: The enactments specified in Schedules 9 and 10 are amended as set out in those Schedules.

subsection.leadIn: The Financial Secretary may, by notice published in the Gazette—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: amend Schedule 9 or 10 to make such consequential or related amendments to any enactment as are necessary on account of the coming into operation of any provision of this Ordinance; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: repeal any provision in Schedule 9 or 10 that is no longer necessary on account of the coming into operation of any provision of this Ordinance.

section.name: s913
section.heading: Transitional and saving provisions

subsection.content: The transitional and saving provisions as set out in Schedule 11 have effect.
The Financial Secretary may, by notice published in the Gazette, amend Schedule 11.

section.name: s914
section.heading: Extended effect of saving provision

subsection.content: This section applies if a provision of the predecessor Ordinance is repealed by section 912 but has a continuing effect under Schedule 11, or by virtue of section 23 of the Interpretation and General Clauses Ordinance (Cap. 1), or both, after the repeal.

subsection.leadIn: The saving as mentioned in subsection (1) for the effect of a provision of the predecessor Ordinance extends to any other provision of the predecessor Ordinance—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: that defines an expression used in the provision; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in accordance with which the provision is to be construed.

subsection.content: The saving as mentioned in subsection (1) for the effect of a provision of the predecessor Ordinance that creates an offence extends to the entry relating to that provision in the Twelfth Schedule to the predecessor Ordinance.

Section 304(1) and (2) of, and the Eighth Schedule to, the predecessor Ordinance, as in force immediately before their repeal, continue to apply in respect of a matter that is required or authorized by or under a provision of the predecessor Ordinance having a continuing effect as mentioned in subsection (1) if, immediately before that provision was repealed by section 912, a fee specified in that Schedule was payable to the Registrar in respect of that matter.

Subject to subsections (7) and (9), the saving as mentioned in subsection (1) for the effect of a provision of the predecessor Ordinance that refers to a prescribed or specified form, or refers to a prescribed manner, extends to the form or manner and to the power under which it is prescribed or specified.

subsection.leadIn: If the provision of the predecessor Ordinance refers to a specified form, the Registrar may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: specify another form for the purpose; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: determine a date in relation to that other form for the purposes of subsection (7)(b).

subsection.leadIn: If the Registrar exercises the powers under subsection (6), the effect of the provision of the predecessor Ordinance is to be construed as—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: also referring to the form specified under subsection (6)(a) before the date determined under subsection (6)(b); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: only referring to that form on or after that date.

subsection.leadIn: If the provision of the predecessor Ordinance requires a person, in relation to a particular purpose of that Ordinance, to state or furnish any matter, particulars or information to the Registrar, but does not require the matter, particulars or information to be stated or furnished in a specified form, the Registrar may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: specify a form for the purpose; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: determine a date in relation to the form for the purposes of subsection (9).

subsection.content: If the Registrar exercises the powers under subsection (8), the effect of the provision of the predecessor Ordinance is to be construed as requiring the matter, particulars or information to be stated or furnished in the form specified under subsection (8)(a) on or after the date determined under subsection (8)(b).

section.name: s915
section.heading: Offence for false statement

subsection.leadIn: This section applies if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a provision of the predecessor Ordinance is repealed by section 912 but has a continuing effect under Schedule 11, or by virtue of section 23 of the Interpretation and General Clauses Ordinance (Cap. 1), or both, after the repeal; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: after the repeal, any return, report, certificate, balance sheet or other document, is required by or for the purposes of the provision.

subsection.content: A person commits an offence if, in the return, report, certificate, balance sheet or document, the person wilfully makes a statement false in any material particular knowing it to be false.
A person who commits an offence under subsection (2) is liable to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

subsection.leadIn: This section does not affect the operation of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: Part V of the Crimes Ordinance (Cap. 200); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: section 19, 20 or 21 of the Theft Ordinance (Cap. 210).

section.name: s916
section.heading: Limitation on commencement of proceedings

subsection.leadIn: This section applies if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a provision of the predecessor Ordinance is repealed by section 912 but has a continuing effect under Schedule 11, or by virtue of section 23 of the Interpretation and General Clauses Ordinance (Cap. 1), or both, after the repeal; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: after the repeal, an offence is committed under the provision.

subsection.leadIn: Despite section 26 of the Magistrates Ordinance (Cap. 227), an information or complaint relating to the offence may be tried if it is laid or made—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: within 3 years after the commission of the offence; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: within 12 months after the date on which the supporting evidence came to the Secretary for Justice’s knowledge.

subsection.content: For the purposes of this section, a certificate of the Secretary for Justice as to the date on which the supporting evidence came to the Secretary for Justice’s knowledge is conclusive evidence of that date.
This section does not apply to an offence committed before 1 March 1973.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: supporting evidence (助控證據) means evidence sufficient, in the Secretary for Justice’s opinion, to justify the proceedings.

section.name: s917
section.heading: Application of fines

subsection.leadIn: This section applies if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a provision of the predecessor Ordinance is repealed by section 912 but has a continuing effect under Schedule 11, or by virtue of section 23 of the Interpretation and General Clauses Ordinance (Cap. 1), or both, after the repeal; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: after the repeal, a fine is imposed under the provision.

subsection.leadIn: When imposing the fine, the Court or magistrate may direct that the whole or any part of the fine is to be applied—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in or towards payment of the costs of the proceedings; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in or towards rewarding the person on whose information, or at whose suit, the fine is recovered.

subsection.content: Subject to a direction under subsection (2), the fine must be paid into the general revenue.
Subsection (3) has effect despite anything in any other Ordinance.

section.name: s918
section.heading: Saving as to private prosecution

subsection.leadIn: This section applies if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a provision of the predecessor Ordinance is repealed by section 912 but has a continuing effect under Schedule 11, or by virtue of section 23 of the Interpretation and General Clauses Ordinance (Cap. 1), or both, after the repeal; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the provision relates to the institution of criminal proceedings by the Secretary for Justice.

subsection.content: Nothing in the provision precludes any person from instituting or carrying on any criminal proceedings.

section.name: s919
section.heading: Saving for privileged communication

subsection.leadIn: This section applies if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a provision of the predecessor Ordinance is repealed by section 912 but has a continuing effect under Schedule 11, or by virtue of section 23 of the Interpretation and General Clauses Ordinance (Cap. 1), or both, after the repeal; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: after the repeal, proceedings are instituted under the provision against any person by the Secretary for Justice.

subsection.content: Nothing in the provision is to be regarded as requiring any person who has acted as solicitor for the defendant to disclose any privileged communication made to the person in that capacity.

section.name: s920
section.heading: This Part etc. not to derogate from section 23 of Cap. 1
section.content: This Part, and Schedules 9, 10 and 11, are in addition to and not in derogation of section 23 of the Interpretation and General Clauses Ordinance (Cap. 1), except as otherwise provided in this Part or those Schedules.

section.name: s921
section.heading: Continuity of law

subsection.content: This section applies if a provision of this Ordinance re-enacts (with or without modification) a provision of another Ordinance repealed by this Ordinance.
The repeal and re-enactment does not affect the continuity of the law.

Anything done (including subsidiary legislation made), or having effect as if done, under or for the purposes of the repealed provision that could have been done under or for the purposes of the corresponding provision of this Ordinance, if in force or effective immediately before the commencement date of that corresponding provision, has effect after that commencement date as if done under or for the purposes of that corresponding provision.

A reference (express or implied) in an Ordinance, instrument or document to a provision of this Ordinance is to be construed (so far as the context permits) as including, as respects times, circumstances and purposes in relation to which the corresponding repealed provision had effect, a reference to that corresponding provision.

A reference (express or implied) in an Ordinance, instrument or document to a repealed provision is to be construed (so far as the context permits), as respects times, circumstances and purposes in relation to which the corresponding provision of this Ordinance has effect, as being or (according to the context) including a reference to the corresponding provision of this Ordinance.
This section has effect subject to any specific transitional or saving provision contained in this Ordinance.

section.name: s1
section.heading: Interpretation

subsection.leadIn: In this Schedule— (Amended 35 of 2018 s. 85)
subsection.def: accounting standards (會計準則) has the same meaning as in Part 9; (Added 35 of 2018 s. 85)

def.name: shares
def.leadIn: shares (股份)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in relation to an undertaking having a share capital, means the allotted shares;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in relation to an undertaking having capital in a form other than share capital, means the right to share in the capital of the undertaking; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: in relation to an undertaking not having any capital, means—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the interest giving a right to share in the profits, or giving rise to a liability to contribute to the losses, of the undertaking; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the interest giving rise to an obligation to contribute to the debts or expenses of the undertaking in the event of its being wound up;

def.name: undertaking
def.leadIn: undertaking (企業) means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a body corporate;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a partnership; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: an unincorporated association carrying on a trade or business, whether for profit or not.

subsection.content: In this Schedule, a reference to accounting standards applicable to any financial statements of a parent undertaking is a reference to accounting standards as are, in accordance with their terms, relevant to the parent undertaking’s circumstances and to the financial statements. (Added 35 of 2018 s. 85)

section.name: s2
section.heading: Parent undertaking

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of this Schedule and Part 9, an undertaking is a parent undertaking of another undertaking if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: it has control over that other undertaking; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: it is a parent of that other undertaking for the purposes of the accounting standards applicable to its financial statements.

subsection.content: For the purposes of subsection (1)(a), an undertaking has control over another undertaking if it has the power to govern the financial and operating policies of that other undertaking so as to obtain benefits from that other undertaking’s activities.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsection (1)(a), an undertaking is presumed, unless the contrary is proved, to have control over another undertaking if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: it holds a majority of the voting rights in that other undertaking;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: it has the power to exercise a majority of the voting rights in that other undertaking by reason of an agreement with other members of that other undertaking;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: it has the right to appoint or remove a majority of the board of directors, or an equivalent governing body, of that other undertaking; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: it has the power to cast a majority of votes at meetings of the board of directors, or an equivalent governing body, of that other undertaking.

subsection.content: Subsection (3) does not limit subsection (2).

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsection (3), a reference to the voting rights in an undertaking is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the case of an undertaking having a share capital, a reference to the rights given to the members in respect of their shares to vote at general meetings of the undertaking on all, or substantially all, matters; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: in the case of an undertaking not having a share capital—

subparagraph.content: if the undertaking is required to hold general meetings at which matters are decided by the exercise of voting rights—a reference to the rights given to the members to vote at the general meetings on all, or substantially all, matters; or

if the undertaking is not required to hold such general meetings—a reference to the rights under the undertaking’s constitution to direct the undertaking’s overall policy or to alter the terms of that constitution.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsection (3)(c), a reference to the right to appoint or remove a majority of a board of directors or an equivalent governing body is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a reference to the right to appoint or remove directors holding a majority of the voting rights at meetings of the board on all, or substantially all, matters; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a reference to the right to appoint or remove members of the body holding a majority of the voting rights at meetings of the body on all, or substantially all, matters.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsection (6)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in determining whether an undertaking has the right to appoint or remove a director or a member of the equivalent governing body, a right that is exercisable only with another person’s consent is to be disregarded unless no other person has the right; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: an undertaking has the right to appoint a director or a member of the equivalent governing body if—

subparagraph.content: a person’s appointment as a director or a member follows necessarily from that person’s appointment as a director or a member in relation to the undertaking; or
the directorship or membership is held by the undertaking itself.

section.name: s3
section.heading: Provisions supplementary to section 2 of this Schedule

subsection.content: For the purposes of this Schedule, a right held by a subsidiary undertaking of another undertaking is to be regarded as being held by that other undertaking.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of this Schedule—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: without limiting paragraph (b), a right that is exercisable only in certain circumstances is taken into account—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: only when the circumstances have arisen and for so long as they continue to exist; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: only when the circumstances are within the control of the person having the right; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a right that is normally exercisable but is temporarily incapable of being exercised continues to be taken into account.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of this Schedule—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a right held by a person in a fiduciary capacity is to be regarded as not being held by the person; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a right held by a person as nominee for another is to be regarded as being held by that other.

subsection.content: For the purposes of this Schedule, a right is to be regarded as being held by a person as nominee for another if it is exercisable only on the instructions, or with the consent, of that other.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of this Schedule, a right attached to shares held by way of security is to be regarded as being held by the person providing the security—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if, except where the right is exercised for the purpose of preserving the value of the security or of realizing the security, it is exercisable only in accordance with that person’s instructions; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: if—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the shares are held in connection with the granting of loans as part of normal business activities; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: except where the right is exercised for the purpose of preserving the value of the security or of realizing the security, it is exercisable only in that person’s interests.

subsection.content: Subsections (3) and (5) do not require a right held by a parent undertaking to be regarded as being held by any of its subsidiary undertakings.

For the purposes of subsection (5), a right is to be regarded as being exercisable in accordance with the instructions, or in the interests, of an undertaking if it is exercisable in accordance with the instructions, or in the interests (as the case may be) of any group undertaking of the undertaking.

subsection.leadIn: In this section, an undertaking is a group undertaking of another undertaking if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: it is a parent or subsidiary undertaking of that other undertaking; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: it is a subsidiary undertaking of any parent undertaking of that other undertaking.

section.name: s4
section.heading: Subsidiary undertaking

subsection.content: For the purposes of this Schedule and Part 9, an undertaking is a subsidiary undertaking of another undertaking if that other undertaking is a parent undertaking of it.

For the purposes of this Schedule and Part 9, an undertaking is also a subsidiary undertaking of another undertaking if a parent undertaking of it is a subsidiary undertaking of that other undertaking.

part.name: P1
part.heading: Particulars and Statements of Company

section.name: s1
section.heading: Particulars and statements relating to company
section.leadIn: The particulars and statements specified for the purposes of section 68(1)(a) are—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the proposed name of the company;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the proposed address of the company’s registered office in Hong Kong;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a statement as to whether the company is to be a company limited by shares or by guarantee, or an unlimited company;

paragraph.name: d
e
