paragraph.content: if the company is to be a company limited by guarantee, the number of members with which it proposes to register.

part.name: P2
part.heading: Particulars of Founder member

section.name: s2
section.heading: Particulars of founder member
section.content: The particulars specified for the purposes of section 68(1)(b) are the name and address of the founder member.

part.name: P3
part.heading: Particulars and Statement of Proposed Officers

section.name: s3
section.heading: Particulars of director

subsection.leadIn: The particulars specified for the purposes of section 68(1)(c)(i) are—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: if the person is a natural person—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the present forename and surname, former forename or surname (if any), and aliases (if any);

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the usual residential address;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: the correspondence address; and

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: the number of the identity card or, if the person does not have an identity card, the number and issuing country of any passport held by the person; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the person is a body corporate, the corporate name and the address of its registered or principal office.

subsection.content: For the purposes of subsection (1)(a)(iii), a correspondence address must not be a post office box number.

section.name: s4
section.heading: Statement relating to director
section.leadIn: The statement specified for the purposes of section 68(1)(c)(ii) is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: if the person is the signatory to the incorporation form, a statement by the person—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: that the person has consented to be a director of the company; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: if the person is a natural person, that he or she has attained the age of 18 years; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: if the person is not the signatory to the incorporation form—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: a statement by the person that the person has consented to be a director of the company and, if the person is a natural person, that he or she has attained the age of 18 years; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: a statement by the signatory that the person has consented to be a director of the company and, if the person is a natural person, that he or she has attained the age of 18 years.

section.name: s5
section.heading: Particulars of company secretary

subsection.leadIn: The particulars specified for the purposes of section 68(1)(d) are—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: if the person is a natural person and is not a person covered by paragraph (c)—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the present forename and surname, former forename or surname (if any), and aliases (if any);

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the correspondence address; and

subparagraph.name: iii

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the person is a body corporate and is not a person covered by paragraph (c), the corporate name and the address of its registered or principal office; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: if the person is a partner of a firm all partners of which are to be the joint company secretaries of the company, the firm’s name and the address of the firm’s principal office.

subsection.content: For the purposes of subsection (1)(a)(ii), a correspondence address must be a place in Hong Kong and must not be a post office box number.

section.name: s6
section.heading: Definitions

subsection.leadIn: In this Part—
subsection.def: forename (名字) includes a Christian or given name;residential address (住址)—(a)does not include an address at a hotel unless the person to whom it relates is stated, for the purposes of this Part, to have no other permanent address; and(b)does not include a post office box number;
signatory (簽署人), in relation to an incorporation form, means the founder member who signs the form for the purposes of section 69;
surname (姓氏), for a person usually known by a title different from the person’s surname, means that title.

subsection.leadIn: In this Part, a reference to a former forename or surname does not include—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: in relation to a person—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: a forename or surname that was changed or ceased to be used before the person attained the age of 18 years; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: a forename or surname that has been changed or ceased to be used for a period of at least 20 years;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in relation to a person usually known by a title different from his or her surname, the name by which the person was known before the adoption of or succession to the title; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: in relation to a married woman, a name or surname by which she was known before her marriage.

part.name: P4
part.heading: Statements relating to Articles

section.name: s7
section.heading: Statements relating to articles
section.leadIn: The statements specified for the purposes of section 68(1)(e) are—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a statement that the company’s articles have been signed for the purposes of section 67(1)(a) by every person proposing to become a member of the company on the company’s formation; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a statement that the contents of the copy of the company’s articles delivered under section 67(1)(b)(ii), with or without the part showing the signature and the date of signing as they appear on the original document, are the same as those of the articles.

part.name: P5
part.heading: Statement of Capital and Initial Shareholdings

section.name: s8
section.heading: Statement of capital and initial shareholdings

subsection.leadIn: The statement specified for the purposes of section 68(2) is a statement that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: states the total number of shares that the company proposes to issue on the company’s formation;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: states the total amount of share capital to be subscribed by the company’s founder members on that formation;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: states the amount to be paid up or to be regarded as paid up, and the amount to remain unpaid or to be regarded as remaining unpaid, on the total number of shares that the company proposes to issue on that formation;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.leadIn: if the share capital is to be divided into different classes of shares on that formation, also states the classes and, for each class—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the total number of shares in that class that the company proposes to issue on that formation;

subparagraph.name: ii
iii
subparagraph.content: the amount to be paid up or to be regarded as paid up, and the amount to remain unpaid or to be regarded as remaining unpaid, on the total number of shares in that class that the company proposes to issue on that formation;

subparagraph.name: iv
v
subparagraph.content: the particulars of any rights attached to shares in that class, as respects dividends, to participate in a distribution;

subparagraph.name: vi
subparagraph.content: the particulars of any rights attached to shares in that class, as respects capital, to participate in a distribution (including on a winding up); and

subparagraph.name: vii
subparagraph.content: whether or not shares in that class are redeemable shares; and

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: in respect of each founder member, states the number of shares that the company proposes to issue to the member and the total amount of share capital to be subscribed by the member on that formation.

subsection.content: If the shares proposed to be issued to a founder member on the formation belong to 2 or more classes, the information required under subsection (1)(e) must be stated in respect of each class.

schedule.name: sch3
schedule.heading: Specified Qualifying Conditions for Sections 361 to 366A

section.name: s1A
section.heading: Interpretation
section.leadIn: In this Schedule—

def.name: NonHongKongBodyCorporate
def.leadIn: non-Hong Kong body corporate (非香港法人團體)— (Amended 14 of 2025 s. 74)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: means a body corporate incorporated outside Hong Kong; but

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: does not include a re-domiciled company. (Amended 14 of 2025 s. 74)

section.name: s1
section.heading: Qualifying conditions

subsection.leadIn: The conditions specified for the purposes of section 361(1), (2) and (3) are—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: that the amount of the company’s total revenue for the financial year, as would be reflected in the company’s annual financial statements for the financial year if the company were qualified as a small private company for the financial year, does not exceed $100 million;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: that the amount of the company’s total assets at the date of the statement of financial position for the financial year, as would be reflected in the company’s annual financial statements for the financial year if the company were qualified as a small private company for the financial year, does not exceed $100 million; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: that the average number of the company’s employees during the financial year does not exceed 100.

subsection.leadIn: The conditions specified for the purposes of section 361(4) are—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: that the amount of the company’s total assets at the date of the statement of financial position for the financial year, as reflected in the company’s annual financial statements for the financial year, does not exceed $100 million; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: that the average number of the company’s employees during the financial year does not exceed 100.

subsection.leadIn: The conditions specified for the purposes of section 362(1), (2) and (3) are—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: that the amount of the company’s total revenue for the financial year, as would be reflected in the company’s annual financial statements for the financial year if the company were qualified as an eligible private company for the financial year, does not exceed $200 million;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: that the amount of the company’s total assets at the date of the statement of financial position for the financial year, as would be reflected in the company’s annual financial statements for the financial year if the company were qualified as an eligible private company for the financial year, does not exceed $200 million; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: that the average number of the company’s employees during the financial year does not exceed 100.

subsection.leadIn: The conditions specified for the purposes of section 362(4) are—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: that the amount of the company’s total assets at the date of the statement of financial position for the financial year, as reflected in the company’s annual financial statements for the financial year, does not exceed $200 million; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: that the average number of the company’s employees during the financial year does not exceed 100.

subsection.content: The condition specified for the purposes of section 363(1), (2) and (3) is that the amount of the company’s total revenue for the financial year, as would be reflected in the company’s annual financial statements for the financial year if the company were qualified as a small guarantee company for the financial year, does not exceed $25 million.

The condition specified for the purposes of section 363(4) is that the amount of the company’s total revenue for the financial year, as reflected in the company’s annual financial statements for the financial year, does not exceed $25 million.

subsection.leadIn: The conditions specified for the purposes of section 364(1), (2), (3), (4) and (5) are—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: that each company in the group is qualified as a small private company for the financial year; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: that each non-Hong Kong body corporate in the group would have been qualified as a small private company for the financial year had it been incorporated under this Ordinance. (Replaced 35 of 2018 s. 86)

subsection.leadIn: The conditions specified for the purposes of section 364(1), (2) and (3) and section 366A(4)(a) are— (Amended 35 of 2018 s. 86)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: that the aggregate amount of the group’s total revenue for the financial year does not exceed $100 million;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: that the aggregate amount of the group’s total assets at the date of the statement of financial position for the financial year does not exceed $100 million; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: that the aggregate number of employees of the group during the financial year does not exceed 100.

subsection.leadIn: The conditions specified for the purposes of section 364(4) and (5) and section 366A(8)(a) are— (Amended 35 of 2018 s. 86)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: that the aggregate amount of the group’s total revenue for the financial year does not exceed $100 million;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: that the aggregate amount of the group’s total assets at the date of the statement of financial position for the financial year does not exceed $100 million; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: that the aggregate number of employees of the group during the financial year does not exceed 100.

subsection.leadIn: The conditions specified for the purposes of section 365(1), (2), (3), (4) and (5) are—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: that each company in the group is qualified as an eligible private company for the financial year; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: that each non-Hong Kong body corporate in the group would have been qualified as an eligible private company for the financial year had it been incorporated under this Ordinance. (Replaced 35 of 2018 s. 86)

subsection.leadIn: The conditions specified for the purposes of section 365(1), (2) and (3) and section 366A(4)(b) are— (Amended 35 of 2018 s. 86)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: that the aggregate amount of the group’s total revenue for the financial year does not exceed $200 million;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: that the aggregate amount of the group’s total assets at the date of the statement of financial position for the financial year does not exceed $200 million; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: that the aggregate number of employees of the group during the financial year does not exceed 100.

subsection.leadIn: The conditions specified for the purposes of section 365(4) and (5) and section 366A(8)(b) are— (Amended 35 of 2018 s. 86)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: that the aggregate amount of the group’s total revenue for the financial year does not exceed $200 million;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: that the aggregate amount of the group’s total assets at the date of the statement of financial position for the financial year does not exceed $200 million; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: that the aggregate number of employees of the group during the financial year does not exceed 100.

subsection.name: 12A
subsection.leadIn: The conditions specified for the purposes of section 366(1), (2), (3), (4) and (5) are—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: that each company in the group is qualified as a small guarantee company for the financial year; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: that each non-Hong Kong body corporate in the group would have been qualified as a small guarantee company for the financial year had it been incorporated under this Ordinance. (Added 35 of 2018 s. 86)

subsection.content: The condition specified for the purposes of section 366(1), (2) and (3) and section 366A(4)(c) is that the aggregate amount of the group’s total revenue for the financial year does not exceed $25 million. (Replaced 35 of 2018 s. 86)

The condition specified for the purposes of section 366(4) and (5) and section 366A(8)(c) is that the aggregate amount of the group’s total revenue for the financial year does not exceed $25 million. (Replaced 35 of 2018 s. 86)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a reference to a financial year of a company for the purposes of section 361(2), 362(2), 363(2), 364(2), 365(2) or 366(2) includes a financial year of the company for the purposes of the predecessor Ordinance that immediately precedes the company’s first financial year after the coming into operation of this section; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a reference to a company’s annual financial statements is, in the case of a financial year of the company for the purposes of the predecessor Ordinance, a reference to the company’s accounts for the financial year.

section.name: s2
section.heading: Provisions supplementary to section 1 of this Schedule

subsection.content: For the purposes of section 1(1)(a), (2)(a), (3)(a), (4)(a), (5), (6), (8)(a), (9)(a), (11)(a), (12)(a), (13) and (14) of this Schedule, the amount of total revenue for a financial year that is shorter or longer than 12 months is to be calculated on a pro-rata basis as if the length of the financial year were 12 months.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of section 1(8), (11) and (13) of this Schedule, the aggregate amount of the group’s total revenue or assets— (Amended 35 of 2018 s. 86)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is to be calculated by aggregating the total revenue or assets (as the case may be) of each member in the group, as would be reflected in the member’s annual financial statements or annual consolidated financial statements for the financial year if the group were qualified as a group of small private companies, eligible private companies or small guarantee companies, or a mixed group (as the case may be); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: is to be calculated on the basis that the set-offs and other adjustments for transactions between members in the group have been made.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of section 1(9), (12) and (14) of this Schedule, the aggregate amount of the group’s total revenue or assets— (Amended 35 of 2018 s. 86)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is to be calculated by aggregating the total revenue or assets (as the case may be) of each member in the group, as reflected in the member’s annual financial statements or annual consolidated financial statements for the financial year; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: is to be calculated on the basis that the set-offs and other adjustments for transactions between members in the group have been made.

subsection.content: For the purposes of section 1(8)(c), (9)(c), (11)(c) and (12)(c) of this Schedule, the aggregate number of employees of the group during a financial year is to be calculated by aggregating the average number of employees of each member in the group during the financial year.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsection (4) and of section 1(1)(c), (2)(c), (3)(c) and (4)(c) of this Schedule, the average number of the employees of a company or a member in a group during a financial year is to be calculated by using the following formula— (Amended 35 of 2018 s. 86)
where—

tr.td: represents the aggregate of the number of the employees of the company or the member in the group as at the end of each month during the financial year;
represents the number of months in the financial year.

subsection.content: In subsections (2)(a) and (3)(a), a reference to a company’s annual financial statements or annual consolidated financial statements is, in the case of a financial year of the company for the purposes of the predecessor Ordinance mentioned in section 1(15)(a) of this Schedule, a reference to the company’s accounts or group accounts for the financial year.

part.name: P1
part.heading:
Disclosures for Companies whether or not Falling
within Reporting Exemption

section.name: s1
section.heading: Aggregate amount of authorized loans
section.content: The financial statements for a financial year must contain, under separate headings, the aggregate amount of any outstanding loans made under the authority of sections 280 and 281 during the financial year.

section.name: s2
section.heading: Statement of financial position to be contained in notes to annual consolidated financial statements

subsection.leadIn: The annual consolidated financial statements for a financial year—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: must contain, in the notes to the statements, the holding company’s statement of financial position for the financial year; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: must include a note disclosing the movement in the holding company’s reserves.

subsection.content: Despite section 380(4), the holding company’s statement of financial position to be contained in the notes to the annual consolidated financial statements for a financial year is not required to contain any notes.

That statement of financial position must be in the format in which that statement would have been prepared if the holding company had not been required to prepare any annual consolidated financial statements for the financial year.

section.name: s3
section.heading: Subsidiary’s financial statements must contain particulars of ultimate parent undertaking

subsection.content: This section applies if, at the end of a financial year, a company is the subsidiary of another undertaking.

subsection.leadIn: The company’s financial statements for the financial year must contain, in the notes to the statements—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the name of the undertaking regarded by the directors as being the company’s ultimate parent undertaking; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the following information relating to that undertaking as known to the directors—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: if that undertaking is a body corporate, the country in which it is incorporated;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: if that undertaking is not a body corporate, the address of its principal place of business.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: parent undertaking (母企業) has the same meaning as in Part 9. (Added 35 of 2018 s. 87)

section.name: s4
section.heading: Compliance with applicable accounting standards
section.leadIn: The financial statements for a financial year must state—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: whether they have been prepared in accordance with the applicable accounting standards as defined by section 357(1); and (Amended 35 of 2018 s. 87)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if they have not been so prepared, the particulars of, and the reasons for, any material departure from those standards.

part.name: P2
part.heading:
Disclosures for Companies not Falling within
Reporting Exemption

section.name: s1
section.heading: Remuneration of auditor

subsection.content: A company’s financial statements for a financial year must state, under a separate heading, the amount of the remuneration of the auditor.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: remuneration (酬金), in relation to an auditor of a company, includes any sum paid by the company in respect of the auditor’s expenses.

schedule.name: sch5
schedule.heading: Contents of Directors’ Report: Business Review

section.name: s1
section.leadIn: A directors’ report for a financial year must contain a business review that consists of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a fair review of the company’s business;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a description of the principal risks and uncertainties facing the company;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: particulars of important events affecting the company that have occurred since the end of the financial year; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: an indication of likely future development in the company’s business.

section.name: s2
section.leadIn: To the extent necessary for an understanding of the development, performance or position of the company’s business, a business review must include—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an analysis using financial key performance indicators;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: a discussion on—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the company’s environmental policies and performance; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the company’s compliance with the relevant laws and regulations that have a significant impact on the company; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: an account of the company’s key relationships with its employees, customers and suppliers and others that have a significant impact on the company and on which the company’s success depends.

section.name: s3
section.content: This Schedule does not require the disclosure of any information about impending developments or matters in the course of negotiation if the disclosure would, in the directors’ opinion, be seriously prejudicial to the company’s interests.

section.name: s4
section.leadIn: This Schedule has effect in relation to a directors’ report required to be prepared under section 388(2) as if a reference to the company were a reference to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the company; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the subsidiary undertakings included in the annual consolidated financial statements for the financial year.

section.name: s5
section.leadIn: In this Schedule—
section.def: key performance indicators (關鍵表現指標) means factors by reference to which the development, performance or position of the company’s business can be measured effectively; (Amended 35 of 2018 s. 88)
subsidiary undertaking (附屬企業) has the same meaning as in Part 9. (Added 35 of 2018 s. 88)

part.name: P1
part.heading: Who has Significant Control over Applicable Company

section.name: s1
section.heading: Significant control over applicable company
section.leadIn: A person has significant control over an applicable company as defined by section 653A if one or more of the following conditions are met—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: the person holds, directly or indirectly—

subparagraph.content: if the company has a share capital—more than 25% of the issued shares in the company; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the person holds, directly or indirectly, more than 25% of the voting rights in the company;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the person holds, directly or indirectly, the right to appoint or remove a majority of the board of directors of the company;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the person has the right to exercise, or actually exercises, significant influence or control over the company;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.leadIn: the person has the right to exercise, or actually exercises, significant influence or control over the activities of a trust or firm—

subparagraph.content: that, under the law governing the trust or firm, is not a legal person; and
whose trustees or members meet one or more of the conditions (in their capacity as such) specified in paragraphs (a), (b), (c) and (d).

statutoryNote.heading: Note—
statutoryNote.content: In relation to paragraphs (d) and (e), when determining whether a person has the right to exercise, or actually exercises, significant influence or control over an applicable company or the activities of a trust or firm, regard may be had to any guidelines issued under section 24.

part.name: P2
part.heading: Interpretative Provisions

section.name: s2
section.heading: Purpose of this Part
section.content: This Part sets out the provisions for the interpretation of this Schedule.

section.name: s3
section.heading: Interpretation

subsection.leadIn: In this Part—
subsection.def: legal entity (法律實體) has the meaning given by section 653A.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of this Part, an arrangement—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: includes—

subparagraph.content: a scheme, agreement or understanding, whether or not it is legally enforceable; and
a convention, custom or practice of any kind; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: refers only to an arrangement with some degree of stability, whether by its nature or terms, the time it has been in existence or otherwise.

section.name: s4
section.heading: Joint interest—share
section.content: If a person holds a share jointly with another person, each of them is regarded as holding the share.

section.name: s5
section.heading: Joint arrangement—share

subsection.content: If shares held by a person and those held by another person are the subject of a joint arrangement between the person and the other person, each of them is regarded as holding the combined shares of both of them.

For the purposes of subsection (1), a joint arrangement is an arrangement between the holders of shares to exercise all, or substantially all, the rights conferred by their respective shares jointly in a way pre-determined by the arrangement.

section.name: s6
section.heading: Share held by nominee
section.content: A share held by a nominee for another person is regarded as being held by that other person.

section.name: s7
section.heading: Share held indirectly

subsection.leadIn: A person holds a share indirectly if the person has a majority stake in a legal entity (entity A) and—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: entity A holds the share; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: entity A is part but not the last of a chain of legal entities and—

subparagraph.content: each of those legal entities (other than the last one in the chain) has a majority stake in the entity immediately below it in the chain; and
the last one in the chain holds the share.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsection (1), a person has a majority stake in a legal entity if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the person holds a majority of the voting rights in that entity;

paragraph.name: b
c
paragraph.content: the person is a member of that entity and, under an agreement with another member of that entity, controls alone a majority of the voting rights in that entity; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the person has the right to exercise, or actually exercises, dominant influence or control over that entity.

section.name: s8
section.heading: Who is regarded as holding right

subsection.content: If a person controls a right, the person is regarded as holding the right, whether or not the person in fact holds the right.
Although a person in fact holds a right, the person is not regarded as holding the right unless the person also controls the right.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of this section, a person controls a right if, under an arrangement between the person and another person, a right is exercisable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: only by the person;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: only in accordance with the person’s directions or instructions; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: only with the person’s consent or concurrence.

section.name: s9
section.heading: Joint interest—right
section.content: If a person holds a right jointly with another person, each of them is regarded as holding the right.

section.name: s10
section.heading: Joint arrangement—right

subsection.content: If rights held by a person and those held by another person are the subject of a joint arrangement between the person and the other person, each of them is regarded as holding the combined rights of both of them.

For the purposes of subsection (1), a joint arrangement is an arrangement between the holders of rights to exercise all, or substantially all, the rights conferred by their respective rights jointly in a way pre-determined by the arrangement.

section.name: s11
section.heading: Voting rights in legal entity

subsection.leadIn: A reference to the voting rights in a legal entity is a reference to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if the entity has a share capital—the rights given to its members in respect of their shares to vote at general meetings of the entity on all matters or on substantially all matters; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the entity does not have a share capital—the rights given to its members to vote at general meetings of the entity on all matters or on substantially all matters.

subsection.leadIn: For a legal entity that does not have general meetings at which matters are decided by exercising such rights—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: a reference to the voting rights in the entity is a reference to—

subparagraph.content: if the entity has a share capital—the rights equivalent to those mentioned in subsection (1)(a); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a reference to 25% of the voting rights in the entity is a reference to the right under the entity’s constitution to block changes to the overall policy of the entity or to the terms of its constitution.

section.name: s12
section.heading: Appointment or removal of majority of board of directors
section.leadIn: A reference to a right to appoint or remove a majority of the board of directors of a legal entity—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is a reference to the right to appoint or remove directors holding a majority of the voting rights at meetings of the board on all matters or on substantially all matters; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in relation to a legal entity that does not have a board of directors, is a reference to the right to appoint or remove members of an equivalent governing body holding a majority of the voting rights at meetings of the body on all matters or on substantially all matters.

section.name: s13
section.heading: Right held indirectly

subsection.leadIn: A person holds a right indirectly if the person has a majority stake in a legal entity (entity A) and—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: entity A holds the right; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: entity A is part but not the last of a chain of legal entities and—

subparagraph.content: each of those legal entities (other than the last one in the chain) has a majority stake in the entity immediately below it in the chain; and
the last one in the chain holds the right.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsection (1), a person has a majority stake in a legal entity if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the person holds a majority of the voting rights in that entity;

paragraph.name: b
c
paragraph.content: the person is a member of that entity and, under an agreement with another member of that entity, controls alone a majority of the voting rights in that entity; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the person has the right to exercise, or actually exercises, dominant influence or control over that entity.

section.name: s14
section.heading: Circumstances under which legal entity would be regarded as having right to appoint director of another legal entity

subsection.leadIn: A legal entity (entity B) is regarded as having a right to appoint a director of another legal entity (entity C) if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a person’s appointment as a director of entity C follows necessarily from that person’s appointment as a director of entity B; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the directorship of entity C is held by entity B itself.

subsection.content: For the purposes of subsection (1), if entity B does not have a board of directors, a reference to a director of entity B in subsection (1)(a) is a reference to a member of an equivalent governing body of entity B.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsection (1), if entity C does not have a board of directors—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a reference to a director of entity C in subsection (1)(a) is a reference to a member of an equivalent governing body of entity C; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a reference to the directorship of entity C in subsection (1)(b) is a reference to the membership of an equivalent governing body of entity C.

section.name: s15
section.heading: Right attached to shares held by way of security

subsection.leadIn: A right attached to shares held by way of security is regarded as being held by the person providing the security—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if, except for the situation specified in subsection (2), the right is exercisable only in accordance with that person’s instructions; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: if—

subparagraph.content: the shares are held in connection with the granting of loans as part of normal business activities; and
except for the situation specified in subsection (2), the right is exercisable only in that person’s interests.

subsection.leadIn: The situation is that the right—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is exercised for the purpose of preserving the value of the security; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: is exercised for the purpose of realizing the security.

section.name: s16
section.heading: Right exercisable only in certain circumstances

subsection.leadIn: A right that is exercisable only in certain circumstances is taken into account only if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the circumstances have arisen; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the circumstances are within the control of the person having the right.

subsection.content: A right exercisable under subsection (1)(a) is exercisable for so long as the circumstances exist.
A right that is normally exercisable but is temporarily incapable of being exercised continues to be taken into account.

A reference in this section to a right that is exercisable does not include a right that is exercisable by a provisional liquidator, liquidator or creditor under the Companies (Winding Up and Miscellaneous Provisions) Ordinance (Cap. 32).

part.name: P1
part.heading: Preliminary

section.name: s1
section.heading: Interpretation
section.leadIn: In this Schedule—
section.def: applicable company (適用公司) has the meaning given by section 653A;
registrable person (須登記人士) has the meaning given by section 653C;
significant controllers register (重要控制人登記冊) has the meaning given by section 653A.

part.name: P2
part.heading: Natural Person

section.name: s2
section.heading: Particulars of natural person

subsection.content: This section applies if a registrable person of an applicable company is a natural person.

subsection.leadIn: The following are the particulars required under section 653I(1)(a) to be contained in the significant controllers register of the company for the person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the person’s present forename and surname, former forename or surname (if any), and aliases (if any);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the person’s correspondence address, which must not be a post office box number;

paragraph.name: c
d
paragraph.content: the date on which the person became a registrable person of the company;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: the nature of the person’s control over the company.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: forename (名字) includes a Christian or given name;
surname (姓氏), in relation to a person usually known by a title that is different from the person’s surname, means that title.

subsection.leadIn: In this section, a reference to a person’s former forename or surname does not include—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a forename or surname of the person that was changed or ceased to be used before the person attained the age of 18 years;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a forename or surname of the person that has been changed or ceased to be used for a period of at least 20 years;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: if the person is usually known by a title different from the person’s surname, the name by which the person was known before adopting or succeeding to that title; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: if the person is a married woman, a name or surname by which the person was known before the marriage.

part.name: P3
part.heading: Specified Entity

section.name: s3
section.heading: Particulars of specified entity

subsection.content: This section applies if a registrable person of an applicable company is a specified entity.

subsection.leadIn: The following are the particulars required under section 653I(1)(a) to be contained in the significant controllers register of the company for the entity—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the entity’s name;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the address of the entity’s principal office;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the entity’s legal form, and the law that governs it;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the date on which the entity became a registrable person of the company;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: the nature of the entity’s control over the company.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: specified entity (指明實體) has the meaning given by section 653A.

part.name: P4
part.heading: Legal Entity

section.name: s4
section.heading: Particulars of legal entity

subsection.content: This section applies to a registrable legal entity of an applicable company.

subsection.leadIn: The following are the particulars required under section 653I(1)(a) to be contained in the significant controllers register of the company for the entity—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the entity’s name;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: if the entity is a company as defined by section 2(1) but is not a re-domiciled company— (Amended 14 of 2025 s. 75)

subparagraph.content: the company’s registration number as stated in its certificate of incorporation; and
the address of its registered office;

paragraph.name: ba
paragraph.leadIn: if the entity is a re-domiciled company—

subparagraph.content: the company’s registration number as stated in its certificate of re-domiciliation; and
the address of its registered office; (Added 14 of 2025 s. 75)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: if the entity is not a company as defined by section 2(1)—

subparagraph.leadIn: if the entity has not transferred its domicile to any other jurisdiction after its incorporation or formation—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: the entity’s registration number (or the equivalent) as stated in its certificate of incorporation or formation (or the equivalent); and

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: the address of its registered or principal office; and

subparagraph.leadIn: if the entity has transferred its domicile to any other jurisdiction after its incorporation or formation—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: the entity’s registration number (or the equivalent) as stated in the certificate of registration (or the equivalent) issued in the latest domicile certifying that the entity is registered under the law of its latest place of domicile; and

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: the address of its registered or principal office; (Replaced 14 of 2025 s. 75)

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the entity’s legal form, and the law that governs it;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: the date on which the entity became a registrable legal entity of the company;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: the nature of the entity’s control over the company.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: registrable legal entity (須登記法律實體) has the meaning given by section 653D.

part.name: P1
part.heading: Preliminary

section.name: s1
section.heading: Interpretation
section.leadIn: In this Schedule—
section.def: applicable company (適用公司) has the meaning given by section 653A;
registrable person (須登記人士) has the meaning given by section 653C;
required particulars (所需詳情) has the meaning given by section 653A;
significant controller (重要控制人) has the meaning given by section 653A;
specified period (指明限期), in relation to a notice given under section 653P or 653T, means the period of 1 month from the date of the notice.

part.name: P2
part.heading: Inclusion of Additional Matters in Certain Cases

section.name: s2
section.heading: Case 1—where there is no significant controller

subsection.content: This section applies if an applicable company knows, or has reasonable cause to believe, that it has no significant controller.
The company must note in its significant controllers register that the company knows, or has reasonable cause to believe, that it has no significant controller.

section.name: s3
section.heading: Case 2—where there is unidentified registrable person

subsection.leadIn: This section applies if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an applicable company knows, or has reasonable cause to believe, that it has a registrable person; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the company has not been able to identify that person.

subsection.leadIn: The company must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: note in its significant controllers register that the company knows, or has reasonable cause to believe, that it has a registrable person but has not been able to identify that person; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: make a separate note in the register in respect of each person that the company has not been able to identify.

section.name: s4
section.heading: Case 3—where particulars of identified registrable person are not confirmed

subsection.leadIn: This section applies if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an applicable company has identified a registrable person of the company; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: not all the required particulars of that person have been confirmed under section 653J.

subsection.leadIn: The company must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: note in its significant controllers register that the company has identified a registrable person of the company but not all the required particulars of that person have been confirmed under section 653J; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: make a separate note in the register in respect of each registrable person whose required particulars have not been so confirmed.

section.name: s5
section.heading: Case 4—where company’s investigations are ongoing

subsection.leadIn: This section applies to an applicable company if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: none of the following provisions of this Schedule applies to the company—

subparagraph.content: section 2;
section 3;
section 4;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the company has not entered, and is not yet required to enter, the required particulars of a significant controller of the company in its significant controllers register; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the company has not completed taking reasonable steps to ascertain whether it has a significant controller.

subsection.content: The company must note in its significant controllers register that the company has not yet completed taking reasonable steps to ascertain whether it has a significant controller.

section.name: s6
section.heading: Case 5—where matters noted under section 2, 3, 4 or 5 of this Schedule has ceased to be true

subsection.content: This section applies to an applicable company if a matter noted in its significant controllers register under section 2, 3, 4 or 5 of this Schedule has ceased to be true.

subsection.leadIn: The company must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: note in its significant controllers register that the matter has ceased to be true; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: note also in the register the date on which the matter ceased to be true.

section.name: s7
section.heading: Case 6—where requirement made under section 653Q or 653R is not complied with within specified period

subsection.leadIn: This section applies if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an applicable company has given a notice under section 653P(2) or (3); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the addressee of the notice has failed to comply with a requirement of the notice made under section 653Q or 653R within the specified period.

subsection.leadIn: The company must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: note in its significant controllers register that the company has given a notice under section 653P(2) or (3) (as the case requires) in respect of which a requirement made under section 653Q or 653R (as the case requires) has not been complied with within the specified period; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: make a separate note in the register in respect of each such notice.

section.name: s8
section.heading: Case 7—where all requirements made under section 653Q or 653R are complied with after specified period

subsection.leadIn: This section applies if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an applicable company has given a notice under section 653P(2) or (3);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a note has been made in the company’s significant controllers register in respect of the notice under section 7 of this Schedule; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the addressee of the notice has complied with all of the requirements of the notice made under section 653Q or 653R after the specified period.

subsection.leadIn: The company must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: note in its significant controllers register that the company has given a notice under section 653P(2) or (3) (as the case requires) in respect of which all of the requirements made under section 653Q or 653R (as the case requires) have been complied with after the specified period; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: make a separate note in the register in respect of each such notice.

subsection.content: Each separate note must also state the date of the compliance.

section.name: s9
section.heading: Case 8—where requirement made under section 653U is not complied with within specified period

subsection.leadIn: This section applies if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an applicable company has given a notice under section 653T(2); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the addressee of the notice has failed to comply with a requirement of the notice made under section 653U within the specified period.

subsection.leadIn: The company must—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: note also in the register that the addressee has failed to comply with the requirement within the specified period.

section.name: s10
section.heading: Case 9—where all requirements made under section 653U are complied with after specified period

subsection.leadIn: This section applies if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an applicable company has given a notice under section 653T(2);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a note has been made in the company’s significant controllers register in respect of the notice under section 9 of this Schedule; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the addressee of the notice has complied with all of the requirements of the notice made under section 653U after the specified period.

subsection.leadIn: The company must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: note in the entry for the addressee in its significant controllers register that the addressee has complied with all of the requirements after the specified period; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: note also in the register the date of the compliance.

schedule.name: sch6
schedule.heading: Information to be Contained in Annual Return and Documents by which Annual Return must be Accompanied

part.name: P1
part.heading: Information to be Contained in Annual Return

section.name: s1
section.leadIn: An annual return under section 662(1) or (3) must contain the following information in respect of the company—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the company name, its registered number and business name (if any);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the type of company;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the address of the registered office of the company;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the date to which the company makes up the return;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.leadIn: particulars of the total amount of the indebtedness of the company in respect of all mortgages and charges that—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: are required to be registered with the Registrar under this Ordinance; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: would have been required to be so registered if created after 1 January 1912;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.leadIn: in the case of a company having a share capital—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: particulars relating to members and share capital of the company; and

subparagraph.name: ii

paragraph.name: g
h
i
paragraph.leadIn: particulars with respect to—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: any person who at the date of the return is a director or reserve director of the company; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: any person who at that date is a company secretary of the company,

paragraph.continued: that are by this Ordinance required to be contained with respect to them in the register of directors and register of company secretaries of a company.

section.name: s2
section.content: In the case of a listed company, the particulars relating to members as required under section 1(f)(i) of this Schedule are limited to those relating to members who held 5% or more of the issued shares in any class of the company’s shares as at the date of the return.

section.name: s3
section.leadIn: If a director or reserve director is a natural person, the particulars as required under section 1(i) of this Schedule do not include—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an address contained in the register of directors as the usual residential address of the director or reserve director; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the full number of the identity card or passport of the director or reserve director.

section.name: s4
section.content: If a company secretary is a natural person, the particulars as required under section 1(i) of this Schedule do not include the full number of the identity card or passport of the company secretary.

section.name: s5
section.content: In the case of a company that keeps a branch register of members in accordance with section 636(1), the particulars of the entries in that register need not be included in the annual return if copies of those entries have not been received at the registered office of the company. Those particulars must, so far as they relate to matters that are required to be contained in the annual return, be included in the next annual return after copies of those entries are received at the registered office of the company.

part.name: P2
part.heading:
Additional Information to be Contained in
Annual Return of Private Company

section.name: s6
section.leadIn: An annual return under section 662(1) must also contain the following information in respect of the private company—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: a statement that the company has not—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: since the date of the last return; or

subparagraph.leadIn: in the case of a first return—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: if the company is not a re-domiciled company—since the date of the incorporation of the company; and

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: if the company is a re-domiciled company—since the re-domiciliation date, (Replaced 14 of 2025 s. 76)

paragraph.continued: issued any invitation to the public to subscribe for any shares or debentures of the company; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the annual return discloses the fact that the number of members of the company exceeds 50, a statement that the excess consists wholly of persons who, under section 11(2), are excluded in the calculation of the number of members of the company.

part.name: P3
part.heading: Documents by which Annual Return of Public Company or Company Limited by Guarantee must be Accompanied

section.name: s7
section.leadIn: An annual return under section 662(3) must be accompanied by—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: copies of the documents required to be sent to every member of the company under section 430, certified by a director or company secretary of the company to be true copies; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if any of the documents mentioned in paragraph (a) is in a language other than English or Chinese, a certified translation (to be annexed to that document) in English or Chinese of the document.

schedule.name: sch6A
schedule.heading:
Information and Statements to be Contained in
Re-domiciliation Form

part.name: P1
part.heading: Preliminary

section.name: s1
section.heading: Interpretation
section.leadIn: In this Schedule—
section.def: applicant (申請人), in relation to an application made under section 820B, means the non-HK corporation that makes the application;
information (資料) has the meaning given by section 820A;
non-HK corporation (非香港法團) has the meaning given by section 820A;
place of incorporation (成立地) has the meaning given by section 820A.

part.name: P2
part.heading:
Information and Statements to be Contained in
Re-domiciliation Form

section.name: s2
section.heading: Re-domiciliation form to contain certain information and statements
section.leadIn: The re-domiciliation form to be delivered to the Registrar under section 820B(2) must contain the following in relation to the applicant—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the name of the applicant;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the place of incorporation of the applicant;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: information as to whether the applicant is a non-Hong Kong company registered under Part 16;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: if the applicant is a non-Hong Kong company registered under Part 16—the applicant’s business registration number;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: information as to whether the applicant is a listed company;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: the information specified in section 3 of this Schedule; and

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: the statements specified in section 4 of this Schedule.

section.name: s3
section.heading: Supplementary provisions for section 2(f) of this Schedule

subsection.leadIn: The information referred to in section 2(f) of this Schedule is as follows—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: the total amount of the issued share capital of the applicant as at the reference date;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the amount paid up or regarded as paid up on the total number of issued shares as at the reference date;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the amount remaining unpaid or regarded as remaining unpaid on the total number of issued shares as at the reference date;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.leadIn: if, in respect of the issued share capital of the applicant, there are different classes of shares as at the reference date—

subparagraph.content: a description of each of those classes (each class);
the total number of issued shares in each class as at the reference date;
the total amount of the issued share capital in respect of each class as at the reference date;
the amount paid up or regarded as paid up on the total number of issued shares in each class as at the reference date;
the particulars of any rights attached to the shares in each class, as respects capital, to participate in a distribution (including on a winding up); and
information as to whether or not the shares in each class are redeemable shares;

paragraph.name: f
g
paragraph.content: subject to subsections (2), (3) and (4), the amount of the issued share capital held by each member as at the reference date.

subsection.leadIn: If the applicant—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is not a listed company; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: as at the reference date, has issued more than one class of shares to a member,

subsection.continued: the information required under subsection (1)(f) and (g) must be stated in respect of each class of shares issued to the member.

subsection.leadIn: If the applicant is a listed company and, as at the reference date, has not issued more than one class of shares to any of its member—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the information required under subsection (1)(f) is the number of shares that the applicant has issued, as at the reference date, to each member who holds at least 5% of the issued shares as at that date; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the information required under subsection (1)(g) is the amount of the issued share capital that is held, as at the reference date, by each member who holds at least 5% of the issued shares as at that date.

subsection.leadIn: If the applicant is a listed company and, as at the reference date, has issued more than one class of shares to any of its members—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the information required under subsection (1)(f) is the number of shares in each class that the applicant has issued, as at the reference date, to each member who holds at least 5% of the issued shares in that class as at that date; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the information required under subsection (1)(g) is the amount of the issued share capital in respect of each class that is held, as at the reference date, by each member who holds at least 5% of the issued shares in that class as at that date.

subsection.content: For the purposes of subsection (1)(a), the latest practicable date referred to in that subsection must be a date not earlier than 15 days before the application date.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: latest practicable date (在切實可行的範圍內屬最近期的某日)—see subsection (5);
member (成員) means a member of the applicant;
reference date (參考日) means the date as at which the total number of issued shares is to be stated in the re-domiciliation form because of subsection (1)(a).

section.name: s4
section.heading: Supplementary provisions for section 2(g) of this Schedule

subsection.leadIn: The statements referred to in section 2(g) of this Schedule are—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: if the liability of the members of the applicant (members) is limited—a statement confirming that the way in which and the extent to which the liability is limited is defined in the constitutional document of the applicant;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: a statement confirming that—

subparagraph.content: there is, under the law of the applicant’s place of incorporation, a regime that allows the applicant to deregister in the place of incorporation for the purpose of its registration in another jurisdiction as a company (deregistration); and
neither the law of the place of incorporation nor the constitutional document of the applicant prohibits the applicant to become a re-domiciled company (re-domiciliation);

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: if, under the law of the place of incorporation or the constitutional document of the applicant, the applicant is required to obtain permission (however described) for the re-domiciliation—a statement confirming that the permission has been obtained;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: if, under the law of the place of incorporation or the constitutional document of the applicant, the applicant is required to obtain consent from its members for the re-domiciliation (relevant requirement)—a statement confirming that the relevant requirement has been complied with;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.leadIn: if there is no relevant requirement, a statement confirming—

subparagraph.content: that a resolution of members is duly passed for the re-domiciliation under the law of the place of incorporation and the constitutional document of the applicant; and
that the resolution is passed at a meeting, or (if it is passed without a meeting) is passed in writing, by a majority of at least 75%; and

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: a statement confirming that, if the applicant becomes a re-domiciled company, the applicant will, as soon as practicable after the re-domiciliation date, take all reasonable steps to procure the deregistration.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: deregister (撤銷註冊) has the meaning given by section 820E(6);

eligible member (合資格成員), in relation to the re-domiciliation, means a member who, under the law of the place of incorporation and the constitutional document of the applicant, is entitled to vote on a resolution for the re-domiciliation;

intended type (擬註冊類別) means the type of company that is specified in section 820C(1)(a), (b), (c) or (d) and that the applicant has indicated in the re-domiciliation form that the applicant intends to be registered as under section 820C(1).

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsection (1)(f), a resolution passed at a meeting is passed by a majority of at least 75% if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: it is passed by at least 75% of the total of the following—

subparagraph.content: the number of eligible members who vote in person on the resolution;
the number of persons who vote on the resolution as duly appointed proxies of eligible members; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: it is passed by members representing at least 75% of the total voting rights of all the eligible members who vote in person or by proxy on the resolution.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsection (1)(f), a resolution passed without a meeting is passed in writing by a majority of at least 75% if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: at least 75% of all eligible members have signified in writing their agreement to it; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: members representing at least 75% of the total voting rights of all eligible members have signified in writing their agreement to it.

part.name: P3
part.heading:
Information and Statements to be Contained in
Re-domiciliation Form in relation to Intended RC

section.name: s5
section.heading: Re-domiciliation form to contain certain information and statements in relation to intended RC

subsection.leadIn: The re-domiciliation form to be delivered to the Registrar under section 820B(2) must contain the following in relation to the intended RC—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the name of the intended RC;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the address that is proposed to be the registered office of the intended RC;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: a statement that states the intention of the applicant to become a re-domiciled company and its intention to be registered as—

subparagraph.content: a public company limited by shares;
a private company limited by shares;
a public unlimited company with a share capital; or
a private unlimited company with a share capital;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: for each person who is to be a director of the intended RC if it is registered under section 820C(1)—the particulars and statement specified in sections 3 and 4 of Schedule 6B;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: for each person who, as at the application date, is a director of the applicant and who, if the intended RC is registered, would not be a director of the re-domiciled company because of the registration—the particulars specified in section 5 of Schedule 6B;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: for each person who is to be the company secretary or one of the joint company secretaries of the intended RC if it is registered under section 820C(1)—the particulars specified in section 6 of Schedule 6B;

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: for each person who, as at the application date, is a company secretary or one of the joint company secretaries of the applicant and who, if the intended RC is registered, would not be a company secretary, or one of the joint company secretaries, (as the case requires) of the re-domiciled company because of the registration—the particulars specified in section 7 of Schedule 6B; and

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.leadIn: a statement—

subparagraph.leadIn: confirming that—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: the proposed articles contained in the copy delivered under section 820B(2)(b) have been signed by each person who is to be a member of the intended RC on its registration; and

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: members of the applicant have resolved under the constitutional document that the proposed articles should be adopted; or

subparagraph.leadIn: confirming that—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: the proposed articles contained in the copy delivered under section 820B(2)(b) have been signed by each person who is to be a director of the intended RC on its registration; and

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: members of the applicant have resolved under the constitutional document that the proposed articles should be adopted.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: proposed articles (擬用章程細則) has the meaning given by section 820B(5).

schedule.name: sch6B
schedule.heading: Directors and Company Secretary of Re-domiciled Company

part.name: P1
part.heading: Preliminary

section.name: s1
section.heading: Interpretation

subsection.leadIn: In this Schedule—
subsection.def: forename (名字) includes a Christian or given name;
non-HK corporation (非香港法團) has the meaning given by section 820A;
surname (姓氏), for a person usually known by a title different from the person’s surname, means that title.

subsection.leadIn: In this Schedule, a reference to a former forename or surname does not include—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: in relation to a person—

subparagraph.content: a forename or surname that was changed or ceased to be used before the person attained the age of 18 years; and
a forename or surname that has been changed or ceased to be used for a period of at least 20 years;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in relation to a person usually known by a title different from the person’s surname, the name by which the person was known before the adoption of or succession to the title; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: in relation to a married woman, a name or surname by which the woman was known before the woman’s marriage.

part.name: P2
part.heading: Directors of Re-domiciled Company

section.name: s2
section.heading: Application of sections 3 and 4 of this Schedule
section.content: Sections 3 and 4 of this Schedule apply for the purposes of section 5(1)(d) of Schedule 6A.

section.name: s3
section.heading: Particulars of person to be director of intended RC on registration

subsection.leadIn: The particulars required to be contained in the re-domiciliation form in respect of each person who is to be a director of the intended RC on its registration are—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: if the person is a natural person—

subparagraph.content: the present forename and surname, former forename or surname (if any), and aliases (if any);
the usual residential address;
the correspondence address;
the number of the identity card or, if the person does not have an identity card, the number and issuing country of any passport held by the person; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: if the person is a body corporate—

subparagraph.content: the name of the body corporate;
the address of its registered or principal office; and
if, as at the application date, the person is a director of the applicant—the date of appointment of the person as the director.

subsection.content: For the purposes of subsection (1)(a)(iii), a correspondence address must not be a post office box number.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—

def.name: ResidentialAddress
def.leadIn: residential address (住址)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: does not include an address at a hotel unless the person to whom it relates is stated, for the purposes of this Schedule, to have no other permanent address; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: does not include a post office box number.

section.name: s4
section.heading: Statement relating to person to be director of intended RC on registration

subsection.leadIn: The statement required to be contained in the re-domiciliation form in respect of each person who is to be a director of the intended RC on its registration is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: if the person is the signatory to the re-domiciliation form, a statement by the person—

subparagraph.content: that the person has consented to be a director of the intended RC on its registration; and
(if the person is a natural person) that the person has attained the age of 18 years; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: if the person is not the signatory to the re-domiciliation form—

subparagraph.leadIn: a statement by the person—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: that the person has consented to be a director of the intended RC on its registration; and

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: (if the person is a natural person) that the person has attained the age of 18 years; or

subparagraph.leadIn: a statement by the signatory—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: that the person has consented to be a director of the intended RC on its registration; and

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: (if the person is a natural person) that the person has attained the age of 18 years.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: signatory (簽署人), in relation to an application made under section 820B, means the person who signs the re-domiciliation form under section 820B(3)(b) for the application.

section.name: s5
section.heading: Particulars of person who would not be director of intended RC on registration

subsection.content: This section applies for the purposes of section 5(1)(e) of Schedule 6A.

subsection.leadIn: The particulars required to be contained in the re-domiciliation form in respect of each person to which section 5(1)(e) of Schedule 6A applies are—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: if the person is a natural person—

subparagraph.content: the present forename and surname, former forename or surname (if any), and aliases (if any); and
the number of the identity card or, if the person does not have an identity card, the number and issuing country of any passport held by the person; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the person is a body corporate—the name of the body corporate.

subsection.content: For the purposes of subsection (2)(a)(ii), the number of the identity card or passport is not required to be a full number.

part.name: P3
part.heading: Company Secretary of Re-domiciled Company

section.name: s6
section.heading: Particulars of person to be company secretary of intended RC on registration

subsection.content: This section applies for the purposes of section 5(1)(f) of Schedule 6A.

subsection.leadIn: The particulars required to be contained in the re-domiciliation form in respect of each person who is to be the company secretary, or one of the joint company secretaries, of the intended RC on its registration are—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: if the person is a natural person and is not a person covered by paragraph (c)—

subparagraph.content: the present forename and surname, former forename or surname (if any), and aliases (if any);
the correspondence address;
the number of the identity card or, if the person does not have an identity card, the number and issuing country of any passport held by the person; and

if, as at the application date, the person is a company secretary or one of the joint company secretaries of the applicant (specified secretary)—the date on which the person becomes the specified secretary;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: if the person is a body corporate and is not a person covered by paragraph (c)—

subparagraph.content: the name of the body corporate;
the address of its registered or principal office; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: if the person is a partner of a firm each partner of which is to be one of the joint company secretaries of the intended RC on its registration—

subparagraph.content: the firm’s name;
the address of the firm’s principal office; and
if, as at the application date, the person is one of the joint company secretaries of the applicant—the date on which the person becomes one of the joint company secretaries of the applicant.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsection (2)(a)(ii)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a correspondence address must be a place in Hong Kong; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: must not be a post office box number.

section.name: s7
section.heading: Particulars of person who would not be company secretary or one of the joint company secretaries of intended RC on registration

subsection.content: This section applies for the purposes of section 5(1)(g) of Schedule 6A.

subsection.leadIn: The particulars required to be contained in the re-domiciliation form in respect of each person to which section 5(1)(g) of Schedule 6A applies are—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: if the person is a natural person—

subparagraph.content: the present forename and surname, former forename or surname (if any), and aliases (if any); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the person is a body corporate—the name of the body corporate; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: if the person is a partner of a firm each partner of which is one of the joint company secretaries of the applicant—the name of the firm.

subsection.content: For the purposes of subsection (2)(a)(ii), the number of the identity card or passport is not required to be a full number.

section.name: s1
section.heading: Interpretation

subsection.leadIn: In this Schedule—
subsection.def: applicant (申請人), in relation to an application made under section 820B, means the non-HK corporation that makes the application;
certified copy (經核證副本)—see subsection (5);
constitutional document (章程文件) has the meaning given by section 1 of Schedule 6A;
deregister (撤銷註冊) has the meaning given by section 820E(6);
eligible member (合資格成員) has the meaning given by section 4(2) of Schedule 6A;
latest practicable date (在切實可行的範圍內屬最近期的某日)—see subsection (2);
non-HK corporation (非香港法團) has the meaning given by section 820A;
place of incorporation (成立地) has the meaning given by section 820A;
proposed articles (擬用章程細則) has the meaning given by section 820B(5).

subsection.content: For the purposes of section 2(1)(e) of this Schedule, the latest practicable date referred to in that section must be a date not earlier than 12 months before the application date.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of section 2(1)(f)(viii) of this Schedule, a resolution passed at a meeting is passed by a majority of at least 75% if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: it is passed by at least 75% of the total of the following—

subparagraph.content: the number of eligible members who vote in person on the resolution;
the number of persons who vote on the resolution as duly appointed proxies of eligible members; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: it is passed by members representing at least 75% of the total voting rights of all the eligible members who vote in person or by proxy on the resolution.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of section 2(1)(f)(viii) of this Schedule, a resolution passed without a meeting is passed in writing by a majority of at least 75% if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: at least 75% of all eligible members have signified in writing their agreement to it; or

paragraph.name: b
