paragraph.content: members representing at least 75% of the total voting rights of all eligible members have signified in writing their agreement to it.

subsection.content: For the purposes of this Schedule, a copy of a document is a certified copy if it is certified as a true copy of the document by a person specified in subsection (6).

subsection.leadIn: The person is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: if the copy is certified in the place of incorporation of the applicant that makes the application under section 820B—

subparagraph.content: an official of the government of that place to whose custody of the document is committed;
a notary public practising in that place;
a lawyer practising in that place;
a professional accountant practising in that place;
a professional company secretary practising in that place;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: if the copy is certified in Hong Kong—

subparagraph.content: a notary public practising in Hong Kong;
a solicitor practising in Hong Kong;
a certified public accountant (practising);
an officer of the court in Hong Kong who is authorized by law to certify documents for any judicial or other legal purpose;
a consular officer of the place of incorporation of the applicant; or
a professional company secretary practising in Hong Kong; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: an officer of the applicant.

section.name: s2
section.heading: Re-domiciliation form to be accompanied by certain documents

subsection.leadIn: A re-domiciliation form delivered by an applicant to the Registrar under section 820B(2) must be accompanied by the following documents—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: if the place of incorporation of the applicant is the place in which the applicant is incorporated—

subparagraph.content: a certified copy of the certificate of incorporation of the applicant, or a certified copy of any equivalent document, issued under the law of that place; and
a certified copy of each constitutional document of the applicant;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: if the place of incorporation of the applicant is any other place (particular place)—

subparagraph.content: a certified copy of the certificate of registration of the applicant as a company, or a certified copy of any equivalent document, issued under the law of the particular place; and
a certified copy of each constitutional document of the applicant;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a certificate specified in subsection (2);

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: if neither the law of the place of incorporation nor the constitutional document of the applicant requires consent from members of the applicant for the applicant to become a re-domiciled company (re-domiciliation)—a certified copy of the resolution referred to in section 4(1)(f) of Schedule 6A;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: the accounts of the applicant as at the latest practicable date before the application date or (if under the law of the place of incorporation of the applicant, or the rules of any stock exchange or similar regulatory bodies in that place, the applicant is also required to prepare audited accounts) the audited accounts of the applicant as at the latest practicable date before the application date;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.leadIn: a legal opinion, issued within 35 days before the application date by a legal practitioner who practises the law of the place of incorporation of the applicant—

subparagraph.content: that the applicant is duly registered and validly subsisting in the place of incorporation;
that the applicant is an entity the type of which is the same or substantially the same as that of the intended RC;

that each of the persons specified in the re-domiciliation form to be a director of the intended RC is not disqualified from being appointed as a director, under the law of the place of incorporation;

subparagraph.leadIn: if the proposed name of the intended RC is different from the name of the applicant—

subparagraph.name: A
B

subparagraph.leadIn: that—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: there is, under the law of the place of incorporation, a regime that allows the deregistration of the applicant for the purpose of its registration in another jurisdiction as a company; and

subparagraph.name: B

subparagraph.content: if, under the law of the place of incorporation or the constitutional document of the applicant, the applicant is required to obtain permission (however described) for the re-domiciliation—that the permission has been duly obtained;

if, under the law of the place of incorporation or the constitutional document of the applicant, the applicant is required to obtain consent from its members for the re-domiciliation (relevant requirement)—that the relevant requirement has been complied with;

subparagraph.leadIn: if there is no relevant requirement—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: that a resolution of members is duly passed for the re-domiciliation under the law of the place of incorporation and the constitutional document of the applicant; and

subparagraph.name: B

subparagraph.content: that there is no order to wind up or liquidate the applicant in the place of incorporation;

that the applicant is not operating or carrying on business under any scheme, order, compromise or other similar arrangement, relating to the insolvency of the applicant that is entered into or made by the applicant in its place of incorporation with any other person;
that the proposed articles have been approved by the members of the applicant and resolved by them to be adopted with effect from the re-domiciliation date; and

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: if a document mentioned in paragraph (a), (b), (c), (d), (e) or (f) is in a language other than the English language and the Chinese language—a certified translation of the document in the English language or the Chinese language.

subsection.leadIn: The certificate referred to in subsection (1)(c) is a certificate, signed and issued in compliance with the requirement in subsection (3), to the effect that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the applicant has only one place of incorporation, being the one specified in the certificate of incorporation (or the equivalent) or the certificate of registration (or the equivalent) under subsection (1)(b);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the applicant—

subparagraph.content: if the place of incorporation is the place in which the applicant is incorporated—has a registration relating to its incorporation under the law of that place; and

paragraph.name: c
d
paragraph.content: the applicant has not been notified of any order to wind up or liquidate the applicant in any other place;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: no resolution has been passed in any place to wind up or liquidate the applicant;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: the applicant has not been notified of the appointment of any receiver or liquidator (however described) with respect to the applicant or any property of the applicant (specified person) and no person is acting as a specified person in any place;

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: the applicant is not operating or carrying on business under any scheme, order, compromise or other similar arrangement relating to the insolvency of the applicant entered into or made by the applicant in any place with any other person;

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.content: the applicant has served on all its creditors notice of the applicant’s proposal to become a re-domiciled company;

paragraph.name: j
k
m
paragraph.content: the first financial year of the applicant at the place of incorporation ends on or before the application date;

paragraph.name: n
paragraph.content: the application is not intended to defraud existing creditors of the applicant and is made in good faith; and

paragraph.name: o
paragraph.leadIn: the board of directors of the applicant—

subparagraph.content: has made a full inquiry into the affairs of the applicant; and
has formed an opinion that the applicant will be able to pay its debts which fall due within the period of 12 months beginning on the application date.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsection (2), the certificate mentioned in that subsection—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: must be signed by a director of the applicant certifying that the director has been approved by resolution of the board of directors of the applicant to sign the certificate; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: must be issued by the board of directors of the applicant within 35 days before the application date.

schedule.name: sch8
schedule.heading: Amendments relating to Paperless Holding and Transfer of Shares and Debentures

section.name: s1
section.heading: This Ordinance amended
section.content: This Ordinance is amended as set out in sections 2 to 14 of this Schedule.

section.name: s2
section.heading: Section 2 amended (Interpretation)
section.content: Section 2(1)—

quotedStructure.def: “prescribed securities (訂明證券) has the meaning given by section 397(5) of the Securities and Futures Ordinance (Cap. 571);
Scripless Rules (《無紙化規則》) means rules made under section 397(1A) of the Securities and Futures Ordinance (Cap. 571);”.

section.name: s3
section.heading: Section 134 amended (Nature and transferability of shares)

amendingFormula.quotedText: “subject, for shares or other interests that are prescribed securities, to the Scripless Rules”.

section.name: s4
section.heading: Section 137 amended (Share certificate to be proof of title in the absence of contrary evidence)

subsection.content: Subsection (1) does not affect section 635.”.

section.name: s5
section.heading: Section 144 amended (Issue of share certificate on allotment)

subsection.leadIn: Subsection (1) does not apply if—

paragraph.content: the shares are prescribed securities that are allotted in accordance with the Scripless Rules; or
the shares are not prescribed securities and the conditions of issue of the shares provide otherwise.”.

section.name: s6
section.heading: Section 150 amended (Requirement for instrument of transfer)

subsection.content: Subsection (1) does not apply to a transfer, made in accordance with the Scripless Rules, of shares that are prescribed securities.”.

section.name: s7
section.heading: Section 153 amended (Transfer by personal representative)

section.name: s8
section.heading: Section 155 amended (Issue of share certificate on transfer)

paragraph.leadIn: either—

subparagraph.content: the shares are prescribed securities that are transferred in accordance with the Scripless Rules; or
the shares are not prescribed securities and the conditions of issue of the shares provide otherwise;”.

section.name: s9
section.heading: Section 318 amended (Issue of debenture or certificate for debenture stock on allotment)

subsection.leadIn: Subsection (1) does not apply if—

paragraph.content: the debentures or debenture stock are not prescribed securities and the conditions of issue of the debentures or debenture stock provide otherwise.”.

section.name: s10
section.heading: Section 320 amended (Requirement for instrument of transfer)

subsection.content: Subsection (1) does not apply to a transfer, made in accordance with the Scripless Rules, of debentures or debenture stock that are prescribed securities.”.

section.name: s11
section.heading: Section 323 amended (Issue of debenture or certificate for debenture stock on transfer)

paragraph.leadIn: either—

subparagraph.content: the debentures or debenture stock are not prescribed securities and the conditions of issue of the debentures or debenture stock provide otherwise;”.

section.name: s12
section.heading: Section 627A added
Additional register entries for prescribed securities

subsection.leadIn: If a company’s share capital is divided into different classes of shares and any of those shares are prescribed securities, the company must enter in the register of its members—

paragraph.content: a statement that its share capital is divided into different classes of shares;
the voting rights attached to the shares of each class;
in relation to a class of shares the holders of which are not entitled to vote at general meetings of the company, the words “non voting” or the Chinese characters “無表決權”; and
any other matters that are required by the Scripless Rules to be entered in the register.

subsection.content: Subsection (1)(c) does not apply to shares that are described as preference shares or preferred shares.

If a company contravenes subsection (1), the company, and every responsible person of the company, commit an offence, and each is liable to a fine at level 4 and, in the case of a continuing offence, to a further fine of $700 for each day during which the offence continues.”.

section.name: s13
section.heading: Section 635 amended (Register to be proof in the absence of contrary evidence)

subsection.content: Without limiting subsection (1), in the absence of evidence to the contrary, an entry in the register of members recording a person as holding any share is proof of the person’s title to the share.”.

section.name: s14
section.heading: Section 696 amended (Obligations of offeror with right to buy out minority shareholders)

subsection.leadIn: Subsection (3)(a)(ii) does not require the offeror to send to the company an instrument of transfer of—

paragraph.content: any shares for which a share warrant is for the time being outstanding; or
any shares that are prescribed securities, if the transfer of the shares is made in accordance with the Scripless Rules.”.

part.name: P1
part.heading: Preliminary

section.name: s1
section.heading: Interpretation
section.leadIn: In this Schedule—
section.def: repeal (廢除) means a repeal by section 912, and repealed is to be construed accordingly.

part.name: P2
part.heading: Transitional and Saving Arrangements for Part 2

section.name: s2
section.heading: Office of Registrar

subsection.content: A person holding or acting in the office of Registrar of Companies immediately before the commencement date# of section 21 continues to hold or act in that office (as the case may be) as if the person were appointed under section 21(1).
The last seals that were directed under section 303(4) of the predecessor Ordinance to be prepared are to be regarded as seals that have been directed under section 21(4) to be prepared.

The place directed or last directed by the Chief Executive under section 303(1) of the predecessor Ordinance before the commencement date# of section 21 is to be regarded as the place that has been designated under section 21(3).

section.name: s2A
section.heading: Correspondence address of directors etc. in Companies Register

subsection.leadIn: The Registrar must, for the purposes of section 27, record the following address as the correspondence address of a director or reserve director of a company—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if the company is an existing company, or a company formed and registered under this Ordinance before the specified date—the address shown, immediately before that date, on the Companies Register as the address of the company’s registered office; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the company is a non-Hong Kong company registered in the Companies Register as a registered non-Hong Kong company before the specified date—the address shown, immediately before that date, on the Companies Register as the address of the company’s principal place of business in Hong Kong.

subsection.leadIn: If an incorporation form under section 67(1)(b)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is delivered under that section in relation to a company before the specified date; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: is registered under section 71(1) on or after that date,

subsection.continued: the Registrar must, for the purposes of section 27, record the address contained, as the intended address of the company’s registered office, in the form as the correspondence address of a director or reserve director of the company.

subsection.content: If, on an application under section 776(2) that is delivered by a company under section 776(4)(e) before the specified date, the Registrar registers the company under section 777(1) on or after that date, the Registrar must, for the purposes of section 27, record the address contained, as the address of the company’s principal place of business in Hong Kong, in the application as the correspondence address of a director or reserve director of the company.

subsection.leadIn: After an address is recorded under subsection (1), (2) or (3) as the correspondence address of a director or reserve director of a company, the Registrar must update the entry of such correspondence address with—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the latest address of the company’s registered office contained in a notice of change of address of the company’s registered office that is delivered under section 658(3) and registered by the Registrar under Part 2; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the latest address of the company’s principal place of business in Hong Kong contained in a return in respect of the change of address of the company’s principal place of business in Hong Kong that is delivered under section 791(1) and registered by the Registrar under Part 2.

subsection.leadIn: Subsection (4) ceases to apply when, in relation to the director or reserve director—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a notice or return is delivered under section 645(4) or 791(1) in respect of a change of the director’s or reserve director’s correspondence address; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the notice or return is registered by the Registrar under Part 2.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: company (公司) has the meaning given by section 20(1);
^specified date (指明日期) means the date on which section 54(2) comes into operation.

part.name: P3
part.heading: Transitional and Saving Arrangements for Part 3

section.name: s3
section.heading: Application for company formation

subsection.leadIn: This section applies to a pending application—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: that was made before the commencement date# of Division 1 of Part 3 to the Registrar for the purposes of section 14A(1) of the predecessor Ordinance; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in respect of which section 15(1) of that Ordinance was complied with before that date.

subsection.content: Sections 4, 5, 6, 9, 10, 11, 12, 14, 14A, 15, 16, 18, 18A, 20, 23 and 24 of the predecessor Ordinance, Tables A, B, C, D and E in the First Schedule to that Ordinance, and the Companies (Specification of Names) Order (Cap. 32 sub. leg. E), as in force immediately before their repeal, continue to apply in relation to the pending application.

section.name: s4
section.heading: Application for Registrar’s licence to dispense with “Limited” etc.
section.content: Section 21(1), (2) and (3) of the predecessor Ordinance, as in force immediately before its repeal, continues to apply in relation to a pending application delivered to the Registrar before the commencement date# of Subdivision 2 of Division 3 of Part 3 for a licence under section 21(1) or (2) of the predecessor Ordinance.

section.name: s5
section.heading: Licence dispensing with “Limited” etc.
section.content: A licence that was granted under section 21(1) or (2) of the predecessor Ordinance and was in force immediately before the commencement date# of Subdivision 2 of Division 3 of Part 3 is to be regarded as a licence granted under section 103 for the purposes of this Ordinance.

section.name: s6
section.heading: Alteration of company’s objects

subsection.content: Section 8 of the predecessor Ordinance, as in force immediately before its repeal, continues to apply in relation to a special resolution passed before the commencement date# of Subdivision 4 of Division 2 of Part 3 for the purposes of section 8(1) of the predecessor Ordinance.

Item 1(a) of Schedule 1 to the Companies (Fees and Percentages) Order (Cap. 32 sub. leg. C), as in force immediately before its repeal, continues to apply in relation to a petition to confirm an alteration in a memorandum presented under section 8 of the predecessor Ordinance having a continuing effect under subsection (1).

section.name: s7
section.heading: Alteration of certain conditions of memorandum of association
section.content: Sections 8(2)(a), (3), (4), (7), (7A) and (8) and 25A of the predecessor Ordinance, as in force immediately before their repeal, continue to apply in relation to a special resolution passed before the commencement date# of Subdivision 4 of Division 2 of Part 3 for the purposes of section 25A(1) of the predecessor Ordinance.

section.name: s8
section.heading: Alteration of articles by special resolution
section.content: Section 13 of the predecessor Ordinance, as in force immediately before its repeal, continues to apply in relation to a special resolution passed before the commencement date# of Subdivision 4 of Division 2 of Part 3 for the purposes of section 13(1) of the predecessor Ordinance.

section.name: s9
section.heading: Savings for Table A in former Companies Ordinance
section.leadIn: This Ordinance does not affect—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: Table A in the First Schedule to the Companies Ordinance 1911 (58 of 1911), as in force from time to time, so far as it applies to any existing company; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: Table A in the First Schedule to the predecessor Ordinance, so far as it applies to any existing company.

section.name: s10
section.heading: Special resolution changing company name
section.content: Sections 20 and 22(1A), (1B), (7) and (8) of the predecessor Ordinance and the Companies (Specification of Names) Order (Cap. 32 sub. leg. E), as in force immediately before their repeal, continue to apply in relation to a special resolution passed before the commencement date# of Subdivision 3 of Division 3 of Part 3 for the purposes of section 22(1) of the predecessor Ordinance.

section.name: s11
section.heading: Registrar’s direction to change company name

subsection.content: Section 22(5) and (6) of the predecessor Ordinance, as in force immediately before its repeal, continues to apply in relation to a direction given by the Registrar before the commencement date# of Subdivision 3 of Division 3 of Part 3 under section 22(2), (3A), (3B) or (4) of the predecessor Ordinance.

Sections 22(7) and (8) and 22A(2), (3) and (4) of the predecessor Ordinance, as in force immediately before their repeal, continue to apply in relation to a direction given by the Registrar before the commencement date# of Subdivision 3 of Division 3 of Part 3 under section 22A(1) or (1A) of the predecessor Ordinance.

section.name: s12
section.heading: Re-registration of unlimited company as limited company

subsection.leadIn: This section applies to a special resolution—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: that was passed before the commencement date# of Subdivision 2 of Division 2 of Part 3 for the purposes of section 19(1) of the predecessor Ordinance by an existing company registered as an unlimited company on or after 31 August 1984; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in respect of which no certificate of incorporation was issued before that commencement date# under section 19(4) of that Ordinance.

subsection.content: Sections 19(1), (2), (3), (4) and (5) and 117 of the predecessor Ordinance, as in force immediately before their repeal, continue to apply in relation to the special resolution.

An unlimited company re-registered as a limited company on or after the commencement date# of Division 2 of Part 3 under the provisions having a continuing effect under subsection (2) is, for all purposes, to be regarded as a limited company registered under the predecessor Ordinance.

part.heading: Transitional and Saving Arrangements for Part 4

section.name: s13
section.heading: Conversion of shares into stock

subsection.content: Section 138 does not affect the conversion of shares into stock on or after the commencement date# of that section in accordance with a resolution passed before that commencement date#.
The reference in section 174 to the conversion of shares into stock before the repeal of the power to do so includes a conversion referred to in subsection (1).

subsection.leadIn: The following provisions of the predecessor Ordinance, as in force immediately before their repeal, continue to apply to a conversion of shares into stock that took place before the commencement date# of section 138 or a conversion referred to in subsection (1)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: section 54 (so far as it relates to a conversion of shares into stock);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: paragraph (i) of the proviso to section 95(1); and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: section 95(4) (so far as it relates to that paragraph).

subsection.content: If any amounts of stock have been entered in the register of members of the company in accordance with paragraph (i) of the proviso to section 95(1) of the predecessor Ordinance, those amounts are to be regarded as the details required by Subdivision 2 of Division 2 of Part 12 to be entered in the register instead of the details relating to shares.

section.name: s14
section.heading: Share warrants

subsection.content: This section applies if a company has issued a share warrant before the commencement date# of section 139 but has not complied with section 97(1) of the predecessor Ordinance before that commencement date#.
Section 97(1) of the predecessor Ordinance, as in force immediately before its repeal, continues to apply to the company in relation to the share warrant.

If the particulars of a share warrant have been entered in the register of members of the company in accordance with section 97(1) of the predecessor Ordinance, those particulars are to be regarded as the details required by Subdivision 2 of Division 2 of Part 12 to be entered in the register.

section.name: s15
section.heading: Exercise by directors of power to allot shares or grant rights
section.content: Section 140 does not apply to an allotment of shares by a company on or after the commencement date# of that section in accordance with an offer, agreement or option made or granted by the company before 31 August 1984.

section.name: s16
section.heading: Allotment of shares or grant of rights with company approval
section.content: An approval in force under section 57B of the predecessor Ordinance immediately before the commencement date# of section 141 has effect on and after that commencement date# as if given under section 141.

section.name: s17
section.heading: Return of allotments
section.content: Section 45 of the predecessor Ordinance, as in force immediately before its repeal, continues to apply to shares allotted before the commencement date# of section 142.

section.name: s18
section.heading: Registration of allotment
section.content: Section 143 applies to shares allotted on or after the commencement date# of that section.

section.name: s19
section.heading: Issue of share certificate on allotment
section.content: Section 70 of the predecessor Ordinance (so far as it relates to an allotment of shares), as in force immediately before its repeal, continues to apply to shares allotted before the commencement date# of section 144.

section.name: s20
section.heading: Validation by Court of issue or allotment
section.content: Section 57C of the predecessor Ordinance, as in force immediately before its repeal, continues to apply to shares purportedly issued or allotted before the commencement date# of section 146.

section.name: s21
section.heading: Permitted commissions
section.content: Section 46 of the predecessor Ordinance, as in force immediately before its repeal, continues to apply in relation to an agreement made in accordance with that section before the commencement date# of section 148 for a company to pay commission to a person in consideration of the person subscribing or agreeing to subscribe for shares in the company or procuring or agreeing to procure subscriptions.

section.name: s22
section.heading: Registration of transfer or refusal of registration
section.content: Section 69 of the predecessor Ordinance (so far as it relates to a transfer of shares), as in force immediately before its repeal, continues to apply to a transfer lodged before the commencement date# of section 151.

section.name: s23
section.heading: Issue of share certificate on transfer
section.content: Section 70 of the predecessor Ordinance (so far as it relates to a transfer of shares), as in force immediately before its repeal, continues to apply to a transfer lodged before the commencement date# of section 155.

section.name: s24
section.heading: Transmission of shares by operation of law
section.content: Section 69 of the predecessor Ordinance (so far as it relates to a transmission of shares by operation of law), as in force immediately before its repeal, continues to apply to shares transmitted before the commencement date# of Subdivision 2 of Division 4 of Part 4.

section.name: s25
section.heading: Replacement of listed companies’ lost share certificates

subsection.content: An application may be made under section 163 for a new share certificate whether the original certificate was lost before, on or after the commencement date# of that section, unless an application for a new certificate had already been made under section 71A of the predecessor Ordinance before that commencement date#.
Section 71A of the predecessor Ordinance, as in force immediately before its repeal, continues to apply to an application for a new certificate made before the commencement date# of section 163.

section.name: s26
section.heading: Notice of alteration of share capital

subsection.content: This section applies if a company, before the commencement date# of section 171, does anything referred to in section 54(1)(a) to (f) of the predecessor Ordinance.
Section 54 of the predecessor Ordinance, as in force immediately before its repeal, continues to apply to the company in relation to the thing done.

section.name: s27
section.heading: Notice of increase of share capital
section.content: Section 55 of the predecessor Ordinance, as in force immediately before its repeal, continues to apply to an increase in a company’s share capital if the resolution authorizing the increase was passed before the commencement date# of section 171.

section.name: s28
section.heading: Description of shares of different classes
section.content: Section 57A of the predecessor Ordinance, as in force immediately before its repeal, continues to apply to a share certificate, prospectus or directors’ report issued before the commencement date# of section 179.

section.name: s29
section.heading: Variation of class rights: companies having a share capital

subsection.content: Sections 63A and 64 of the predecessor Ordinance, as in force immediately before their repeal, continue to apply to a variation or abrogation of the rights attaching to a class of shares if the resolution or written consent for the variation or abrogation was passed or given before the commencement date# of section 180.

Item 2(a) of Schedule 1 to the Companies (Fees and Percentages) Order (Cap. 32 sub. leg. C), as in force immediately before its repeal, continues to apply in relation to an application made under section 64 of the predecessor Ordinance having a continuing effect under subsection (1).

section.name: s30
section.heading: Notifying Registrar of variation or attachment of rights to a class of shares
section.content: Section 64A of the predecessor Ordinance, as in force immediately before its repeal, continues to apply to an attachment of rights to a class of shares before the commencement date# of section 184.

section.name: s31
section.heading: Variation of class rights: companies without a share capital
section.content: Sections 188 to 192 apply in relation to a variation or abrogation of the rights of a class of members of a company on or after the commencement date# of those sections.

section.name: s32
section.heading: Repeal of provision about reserve share capital
section.content: The repeal of sections 52 and 56 of the predecessor Ordinance does not affect the validity of any resolution under those sections that was in force immediately before the repeal.

section.name: s33
section.heading: Payment of interest out of capital

subsection.content: Section 57 of the predecessor Ordinance, as in force immediately before its repeal, continues to apply to the payment of interest by a company if the special resolution under paragraph (a) of the proviso to that section authorizing the payment was passed before the repeal, regardless of when the sanction of the court for the payment is obtained.

subsection.leadIn: Without limiting subsection (1), the company may charge interest to capital in accordance with section 57 of the predecessor Ordinance if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: interest was paid by a company in accordance with that section before its repeal, but not charged to capital; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: interest is paid by a company after the repeal in accordance with a special resolution passed under paragraph (a) of the proviso to that section before the repeal, regardless of when the sanction of the court for the payment is obtained.

subsection.statutoryNote:
Note—
Paragraph (b) of the proviso to section 57 of the predecessor Ordinance requires the sanction of the court to be obtained before the payment is made.

section.name: s34
section.heading: Relief from share capital requirements

subsection.content: Subdivision 1 of Division 8 of Part 4 applies in relation to an issue of shares on or after the commencement date# of that Subdivision whether the arrangement for the issue or the transfer of non-cash assets was made before, on or after that commencement date#.

A reference in section 198 to an amount that, because of Subdivision 1 of Division 8 of Part 4, is not required to be recorded as a company’s share capital includes an amount that, immediately before the repeal of section 48E of the predecessor Ordinance, was not included in the company’s share premium account by virtue of section 48C or 48D of the predecessor Ordinance.

division.name: D2
division.heading: Transitional Provisions relating to Abolition of Nominal Value

section.name: s35
section.heading: Interpretation
section.leadIn: In this Division—
section.def: continuing provision (續用條文) means a provision of the predecessor Ordinance that has a continuing effect under this Schedule.

section.name: s36
section.heading: References to amount paid on shares issued before commencement date# of section 135
section.leadIn: For the purposes of the operation of this Ordinance on and after the commencement date# of section 135 in relation to a share issued before that commencement date#—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the amount paid on the share is the sum of all amounts paid to the company at any time for the share; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the amount remaining unpaid on the share is the difference between the issue price of the share and the amount paid on the share.

section.name: s37
section.heading: Treatment of share premium account and capital redemption reserve

subsection.content: At the beginning of the commencement date# of section 135, any amount standing to the credit of the company’s share premium account and capital redemption reserve becomes part of the company’s share capital.

Any amount that would be required by a continuing provision to be transferred to a company’s share premium account or capital redemption reserve on or after the commencement date# of section 135 becomes part of the company’s share capital.

section.name: s38
section.heading: Use of amount standing to credit of share premium account

subsection.leadIn: Despite section 37 of this Schedule, a company may, on or after the commencement date# of section 135, use the amount that was standing to the credit of its share premium account immediately before that commencement date# to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: pay up, in accordance with an agreement made before that commencement date#, shares that are to be issued on or after that commencement date# to members of the company as fully paid bonus shares;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: write off—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the preliminary expenses of the company incurred before that commencement date#; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the expenses incurred, commission paid, or discount allowed, before that commencement date#, in respect of any issue of shares in the company; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: provide for the premium payable on redemption of redeemable preference shares issued before 1 September 1991.

subsection.leadIn: Despite section 37 of this Schedule, if redeemable shares issued by a company on or after 1 September 1991 but before the commencement date# of section 135 are redeemed on or after the commencement date# of section 135, any premium payable on their redemption may be paid out of the proceeds of a fresh issue of shares made for the purpose of the redemption, up to an amount equal to the lesser of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the aggregate of the premiums received by the company on the issue of the shares redeemed;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the amount that was standing to the credit of the company’s share premium account immediately before the commencement date# of section 135 less any amounts already applied under subsection (1) or this subsection.

subsection.content: If an amount is paid under subsection (2), the remaining amount available for the purposes of subsection (1) or (2) must be reduced by a corresponding amount.

section.name: s39
section.heading: Calls on partly paid shares
section.content: The liability of a shareholder for calls in respect of money remaining unpaid on shares issued before the commencement date# of section 135 (whether on account of the nominal value of the shares or by way of premium) is not affected by the share ceasing to have a nominal value.

section.name: s40
section.heading: References in contracts and other documents to par or nominal value

subsection.leadIn: This section applies for the purpose of interpreting and applying on or after the commencement date# of section 135—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: a resolution of a company or of any of its members made before that commencement date#; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a trust deed or other document executed before that commencement date#.

subsection.leadIn: A reference to the par or nominal value of a share (whether made expressly or by implication) is a reference to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if the share was issued before the commencement date# of section 135, the nominal value of the share immediately before that commencement date#;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the share is issued on or after the commencement date# of section 135 but shares of the same class were on issue immediately before that commencement date#, the nominal value that the share would have had if it had been issued immediately before that commencement date#; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: if the share is issued on or after the commencement date# of section 135 and shares of the same class were not on issue immediately before that commencement date#, the nominal value determined by the directors.

subsection.content: A reference to share premium is a reference to any residual share capital in relation to the share.
A reference to a right to a return of capital on a share is a reference to a right to a return of capital of a value equal to the amount paid in respect of the nominal value of the share.

A reference to a distribution in a winding up in proportion to the capital paid up on a share is a reference to a distribution in a winding up in proportion to the amount paid in respect of the nominal value of the share.

subsection.leadIn: A reference to the aggregate par or nominal value of the company’s issued share capital is a reference to that aggregate as it existed immediately before the commencement date# of section 135 and—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: increased to take account of the nominal value of any shares issued on or after that commencement date#; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: reduced to take account of the nominal value of any shares cancelled on or after that commencement date#.

subsection.content: Despite subsection (2) or (6), if the nominal value of a share is altered on or after the commencement date# of section 135 under a continuing provision, a reference to the par or nominal value of the share is a reference to the nominal value as so altered.

section.name: s41
section.heading: References in continuing provisions of the predecessor Ordinance

subsection.content: A reference in a continuing provision to the nominal amount or nominal value of a share is, in relation to any period on or after the commencement date# of section 135, a reference to the nominal amount or nominal value of the share immediately before that commencement date#, and a reference to share premium is to be construed accordingly.

A reference in a continuing provision to a company’s share premium account or capital redemption reserve is, in relation to any period on or after the commencement date# of section 135, a reference to the company’s share premium account or capital redemption reserve immediately before that commencement date#.

Despite subsection (1), if the nominal amount or nominal value of a share is altered on or after the commencement date# of section 135 under a continuing provision, a reference in a continuing provision to the nominal amount or nominal value of the share is a reference to the nominal amount or nominal value as so altered.

part.name: P5
part.heading: Transitional and Saving Arrangements for Part 5

section.name: s42
section.heading: Reduction of share capital confirmed by Court

subsection.content: Section 58 (so far as it relates to a reduction of share capital) and sections 59 to 63 of the predecessor Ordinance and Order 102 of the Rules of the High Court (Cap. 4 sub. leg. A), as in force immediately before the commencement date# of Subdivision 3 of Division 3 of Part 5, continue to apply in relation to a resolution for reducing share capital that was passed under section 58(1) of the predecessor Ordinance immediately before that commencement date#.

subsection.leadIn: Sections 58 to 63 of the predecessor Ordinance and Order 102 of the Rules of the High Court (Cap. 4 sub. leg. A), as in force immediately before the commencement date# of Subdivision 3 of Division 3 of Part 5—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: continue to apply, by virtue of section 48B(1) of the predecessor Ordinance as so in force, in relation to a resolution for reducing share premium that was passed under section 58(1) of the predecessor Ordinance before that commencement date#; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: continue to apply, by virtue of section 49H(4) of the predecessor Ordinance as so in force, in relation to a resolution for reducing capital redemption reserve that was passed under section 58(1) of the predecessor Ordinance before that commencement date#.

subsection.leadIn: Item 1(b) of Schedule 1 to the Companies (Fees and Percentages) Order (Cap. 32 sub. leg. C), as in force immediately before its repeal—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: continues to apply, by virtue of section 48B(1) of the predecessor Ordinance as in force immediately before its repeal, to an application to confirm a reduction of share premium made under section 59 of the predecessor Ordinance having a continuing effect under subsection (2)(a); and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: continues to apply, by virtue of section 49H(4) of the predecessor Ordinance as in force immediately before its repeal, to an application to confirm a reduction of capital redemption reserve made under section 59 of the predecessor Ordinance having a continuing effect under subsection (2)(b).

subsection.content: Division 3 of Part 5 does not apply to a reduction of share capital referred to in subsection (1).

section.name: s43
section.heading: Share redemptions and buy-backs

subsection.content: Sections 49, 49A, 49B, 49BA, 49C, 49E, 49F, 49G, 49H, 49P, 49Q, 49R, 49S, 58 and 168B of, and the Thirteenth Schedule to, the predecessor Ordinance (so far as they relate to a redemption or purchase by a listed company of its own shares), as in force immediately before their repeal, continue to apply in relation to an authorization that was in force under section 49BA, 49E(2) or 49F(3) of the predecessor Ordinance immediately before the commencement date# of Division 4 of Part 5.

Sections 49 to 49S and 58 of the predecessor Ordinance (so far as they relate to a redemption or purchase by an unlisted company of its own shares), as in force immediately before their repeal, continue to apply in relation to an authorization or approval that was in force under section 49D, 49E(3) or 49F(2) of the predecessor Ordinance immediately before the commencement date# of Division 4 of Part 5.
Division 4 of Part 5 does not apply to a redemption or purchase by a company of its own shares under an authorization or approval referred to in subsection (1) or (2).

section.name: s44
section.heading: Redeemable shares issued before commencement date#
section.content: Any redeemable preference shares issued before 1 September 1991 and any redeemable shares issued on or after that date but before the commencement date# of section 234 may be redeemed in accordance with this Ordinance.

section.name: s45
section.heading: Effect of company’s failure to redeem or buy back
section.content: Sections 271 and 272 do not apply to any redeemable preference shares issued before 1 September 1991.

section.name: s46
section.heading: Financial assistance by unlisted company for acquisition of its own shares

subsection.content: Sections 47A to 48 of the predecessor Ordinance (so far as they relate to the giving of financial assistance by an unlisted company), as in force immediately before their repeal, continue to apply to the giving of financial assistance by an unlisted company if the directors’ statement under section 47E(6) of the predecessor Ordinance was made before the commencement date# of Division 5 of Part 5.
Division 5 of Part 5 does not apply to the giving of financial assistance referred to in subsection (1).

section.name: s47
section.heading: Specified newspapers
section.content: Until the Chief Secretary for Administration publishes a list of Chinese language newspapers and English language newspapers in the Gazette under section 203(2), a Chinese language newspaper or an English language newspaper specified in the list of newspapers last published under section 71A(3)(a) of the predecessor Ordinance is taken to be a specified Chinese language newspaper or a specified English language newspaper (as the case may be) for the purposes of Part 5.

part.name: P6
part.heading: Transitional and Saving Arrangements for Part 6

section.name: s48
section.heading: Saving of predecessor Ordinance for certain distribution

subsection.content: Subject to subsection (2), Part IIA of the predecessor Ordinance, as in force immediately before its repeal, continues to apply to a distribution specified in section 295(2), to which Part 6 does not apply.

subsection.leadIn: That Part IIA applies as if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in section 79A(1) of the predecessor Ordinance, in the definition of distribution, the following had been added after paragraph (b)—

the redemption or buy-back of any shares in the company out of capital (including the proceeds of any fresh issue of shares), or out of unrealized profits, in accordance with Division 4 of Part 5 of the Companies Ordinance (Cap. 622);
financial assistance given by the company to a member under section 283, 284 or 285 of the Companies Ordinance (Cap. 622);”;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in section 79J(2) of the predecessor Ordinance, the following had been added after paragraph (a)—

paragraph.leadIn: financial assistance—

subparagraph.content: that is given by the company in contravention of Division 5 of Part 5 of the Companies Ordinance (Cap. 622); and
the giving of which reduces the company’s net assets or increases its net liabilities;”; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: in section 79M(2) of the predecessor Ordinance—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: in paragraph (a), the word “or” had been deleted; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the following had been added after paragraph (a)—

paragraph.content: financial assistance given by a company in contravention of section 275 of the Companies Ordinance (Cap. 622);”.

section.name: s49
section.heading: Saving for certain older provisions in articles
section.content: If, immediately before 1 September 1991, a company was authorized by a provision of its articles to apply its unrealized profits in paying up, in full or in part, unissued shares to be allotted to the members as fully or partly paid bonus shares, that provision continues (subject to any alteration of the articles) as authority for those profits to be so applied after that date.

part.name: P7
part.heading: Transitional and Saving Arrangements for Part 7

section.name: s50
section.heading: Register of debenture holders
section.content: On and after the commencement date# of section 308, a register of holders of debentures kept under section 74A of the predecessor Ordinance is to be regarded as a register of debenture holders kept under section 308.

section.name: s51
section.heading: Notifying Registrar of place where register of debenture holders is kept
section.content: Section 74A(4) of the predecessor Ordinance, as in force immediately before its repeal, continues to apply in relation to an obligation to send notice to the Registrar that arose before the commencement date# of section 309 under section 74A(3) of the predecessor Ordinance.

section.name: s52
section.heading: Right to inspect register of debenture holders
section.content: Sections 75(1), (4), (5) and (6) and 348C(3) of the predecessor Ordinance, as in force immediately before their repeal, continue to apply in relation to a request received by the company before the commencement date# of section 310 for inspecting a register of debenture holders.

section.name: s53
section.heading: Right to obtain copy of register of debenture holders
section.content: Sections 75(2), (4) and (5) and 348C(3) of the predecessor Ordinance, as in force immediately before their repeal, continue to apply in relation to a request received by the company before the commencement date# of section 310 for a copy of a register of debenture holders (or any part of it).

section.name: s54
section.heading: Request for copy of trust deed or other document
section.content: Section 75(3), (4) and (5) of the predecessor Ordinance, as in force immediately before its repeal, continues to apply in relation to a request received by the company before the commencement date# of section 310 for a copy of any trust deed or any other document securing any issue of debentures.

section.name: s55
section.heading: Company to close register of debenture holders
section.content: Section 99 of the predecessor Ordinance, as in force immediately before its repeal, continues to apply in relation to a closure of a register of debenture holders if the notice for the purposes of section 99(1) of the predecessor Ordinance was given before the commencement date# of section 311.

section.name: s56
section.heading: Return of allotment
section.content: Section 316 applies to debentures or debenture stock allotted on or after the commencement date# of that section.

section.name: s57
section.heading: Registration of allotment
section.content: Section 317 applies to debentures or debenture stock allotted on or after the commencement date# of that section.

section.name: s58
section.heading: Issue of debenture or certificate for debenture stock on allotment
section.content: Section 70 of the predecessor Ordinance (so far as it relates to an allotment of debentures or debenture stock), as in force immediately before its repeal, continues to apply in relation to debentures or debenture stock allotted before the commencement date# of sections 318 and 319.

section.name: s59
section.heading: Registration of transfer or refusal of registration
section.content: Section 69 of the predecessor Ordinance (so far as it relates to a transfer of debentures or debenture stock), as in force immediately before its repeal, continues to apply in relation to a transfer of debentures or debenture stock lodged before the commencement date# of section 321.

section.name: s60
section.heading: Issue of debenture or certificate for debenture stock on transfer
section.content: Section 70 of the predecessor Ordinance (so far as it relates to a transfer of debentures or debenture stock), as in force immediately before its repeal, continues to apply in relation to a transfer of debentures or debenture stock lodged before the commencement date# of sections 323 and 324.

section.name: s61
section.heading: Meeting of debenture holders
section.content: Sections 75A, 113, 114B, 114C, 114D(2) and 114E of the predecessor Ordinance, as in force immediately before their repeal, continue to apply in relation to a requisition made before the commencement date# of section 331 for a meeting of debenture holders and to any relevant meeting of debenture holders.

part.name: P8
part.heading: Transitional and Saving Arrangements for Part 8

section.name: s62
section.heading: Interpretation

subsection.leadIn: In this Part, a copy of an instrument in relation to a charge delivered for registration is a certified copy if it is certified as a true copy—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: by—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: a director or company secretary of the company, or of the non-Hong Kong company registered under Part XI of the predecessor Ordinance, delivering the copy for registration; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: a person authorized by that company or non-Hong Kong company for the purpose; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: by—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: any other person interested in the charge; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: in the case of—

subparagraph.name: A
B
subparagraph.content: an interested person that is a body corporate, a person authorized by the interested person for the purpose, or a director or company secretary of the interested person.

subsection.leadIn: In this Part, a reference to the charged property of a non-Hong Kong company registered under Part XI of the predecessor Ordinance is a reference to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the property in Hong Kong of the company and subject to a charge created by the company, except property that was not in Hong Kong when the charge was created; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the property in Hong Kong of the company and subject to a charge that subsisted when the property was acquired by the company, except property that was not in Hong Kong when it was so acquired.

section.name: s63
section.heading: Charge created by company

subsection.leadIn: This section applies to a charge if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: before section 80 of the predecessor Ordinance was repealed, a company created the charge; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the charge was required by that section to be registered.

subsection.content: Subject to subsection (4), sections 80 and 81 of the predecessor Ordinance, as in force immediately before their repeal, continue to apply in relation to the charge.
Subject to section 68 of this Schedule, section 83(2) of the predecessor Ordinance, as in force immediately before its repeal, continues to apply in relation to the charge.

subsection.leadIn: On the expiry of the period of 8 weeks after the commencement date# of Division 2 of Part 8—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: that section 80 applies in relation to the charge as if—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: in subsection (1) of that section, the words “the particulars of the charge (which must include those specified in subsection (1A) and be in the specified form), together with the instrument, if any, by which the charge is created or evidenced” had been substituted by the words “a statement of the particulars of the charge (in the same form as that specified for the purposes of section 335(1) of the Companies Ordinance (Cap. 622)), together with a certified copy of the instrument (if any) creating or evidencing the charge”;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: subsection (1A) of that section had been deleted;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: in subsection (3) of that section, the words “the delivery to and the receipt by the Registrar of a copy verified in the prescribed manner of the instrument by which the charge is created or evidenced, shall have the same effect for the purposes of this section as the delivery and receipt of the instrument itself, and” had been deleted;

subparagraph.name: iv
v
vi
vii
subparagraph.content: in subsection (7) of that section, the words after “5 weeks after the execution of the” and before the proviso had been substituted by the words “instrument by reference to which the charge is given or, if there is no such instrument, after the execution of the first debenture of the series, a statement of the particulars of the charge (in the same form as that specified for the purposes of section 335(2) of the Companies Ordinance (Cap. 622)), together with a certified copy of the instrument by reference to which the charge is given or, if there is no such instrument, any one debenture of the series:”;

subparagraph.name: viii
subparagraph.content: in subsection (7) of that section, in the proviso, the words “particulars of the date and amount of each issue” had been substituted by the words “a statement of the particulars of every issue (in the same form as that specified for the purposes of section 341(2) of the Companies Ordinance (Cap. 622))”; and

subparagraph.name: ix
subparagraph.content: in subsection (8) of that section, the words “the particulars required to be sent for registration under this section shall include particulars as to the amount or rate per cent of the commission, discount, or allowance so paid or made” had been substituted by the words “a statement required to be sent for registration under this section must be accompanied by a statement of the particulars of the commission, allowance or discount (in the same form as that specified for the purposes of section 342(2) of the Companies Ordinance (Cap. 622))”; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: that section 81 applies in relation to the charge as if—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: in subsection (1) of that section, the words “the particulars of every charge created by the company and of the issues of debentures of a series, requiring registration under section 80” had been substituted by the words “the statement, or a certified copy of the instrument or debenture, or both, as required under section 80(1), (7) or (8)”;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: in subsection (1) of that section, the words “any such charge” had been substituted by the words “any such statement or certified copy (as the case may be)”; and

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: in subsection (3) of that section, the words “the particulars of any charge created by the company, or of the issues of debentures of a series, requiring registration as aforesaid” had been substituted by the words “the statement or certified copy that the company is required under subsection (1) to do so”.

section.name: s64
section.heading: Charge created by non-Hong Kong company

subsection.leadIn: This section applies to a charge if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: before section 80 of the predecessor Ordinance was repealed, a non-Hong Kong company registered under Part XI of the predecessor Ordinance created the charge; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the charge was required by that section, as extended by section 91 of the predecessor Ordinance, to be registered.

subsection.content: Subject to subsection (4), sections 80 and 81 of the predecessor Ordinance, as in force immediately before their repeal, continue to apply, by virtue of section 91 of the predecessor Ordinance as so in force, in relation to the charge.

Subject to section 68 of this Schedule, section 83(2) of the predecessor Ordinance, as in force immediately before its repeal, continues to apply, by virtue of section 91 of the predecessor Ordinance as so in force, in relation to the charge.

subsection.leadIn: On the expiry of the period of 8 weeks after the commencement date# of Division 2 of Part 8—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: that section 80 applies in relation to the charge as if—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: in subsection (1) of that section, the words “the particulars of the charge (which must include those specified in subsection (1A) and be in the specified form), together with the instrument, if any, by which the charge is created or evidenced” had been substituted by the words “a statement of the particulars of the charge (in the same form as that specified for the purposes of section 336(1) of the Companies Ordinance (Cap. 622)), together with a certified copy of the instrument (if any) creating or evidencing the charge”;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: subsection (1A) of that section had been deleted;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: in subsection (7) of that section, the words after “5 weeks after the execution of the” and before the proviso had been substituted by the words “instrument by reference to which the charge is given or, if there is no such instrument, after the execution of the first debenture of the series, a statement of the particulars of the charge (in the same form as that specified for the purposes of section 336(2) of the Companies Ordinance (Cap. 622)), together with a certified copy of the instrument by reference to which the charge is given or, if there is no such instrument, any one debenture of the series:”;

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: in subsection (7) of that section, in the proviso, the words “particulars of the date and amount of each issue” had been substituted by the words “a statement of the particulars of every issue (in the same form as that specified for the purposes of section 341(2) of the Companies Ordinance (Cap. 622))”; and

subparagraph.name: v
subparagraph.content: in subsection (8) of that section, the words “the particulars required to be sent for registration under this section shall include particulars as to the amount or rate per cent of the commission, discount, or allowance so paid or made” had been substituted by the words “a statement required to be sent for registration under this section must be accompanied by a statement of the particulars of the commission, allowance or discount (in the same form as that specified for the purposes of section 342(2) of the Companies Ordinance (Cap. 622))”; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: that section 81 applies in relation to the charge as if—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: in subsection (1) of that section, the words “the particulars of every charge created by the company and of the issues of debentures of a series, requiring registration under section 80” had been substituted by the words “the statement, or a certified copy of the instrument or debenture, or both, as required under section 80(1), (7) or (8)”;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: in subsection (1) of that section, the words “any such charge” had been substituted by the words “any such statement or certified copy (as the case may be)”; and

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: in subsection (3) of that section, the words “the particulars of any charge created by the company, or of the issues of debentures of a series, requiring registration as aforesaid” had been substituted by the words “the statement or certified copy that the non-Hong Kong company is required under subsection (1) to do so”.

section.name: s65
section.heading: Charge existing on property acquired by company

subsection.leadIn: This section applies to a charge if—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: the charge was required by that section to be registered.

subsection.content: Subject to subsection (4), section 82 of the predecessor Ordinance, as in force immediately before its repeal, continues to apply in relation to the charge.
Subject to section 68 of this Schedule, section 83(2) of the predecessor Ordinance, as in force immediately before its repeal, continues to apply in relation to the charge.

subsection.leadIn: On the expiry of the period of 8 weeks after the commencement date# of Division 3 of Part 8, that section 82 applies in relation to the charge as if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in subsection (1) of that section, the words “the particulars of the charge (which must include those specified in section 80(1A) and be in the specified form), together with a copy (certified in the prescribed manner to be a correct copy) of the instrument, if any, by which the charge was created or is evidenced” had been substituted by the words “a statement of the particulars of the charge (in the same form as that specified for the purposes of section 338(2) of the Companies Ordinance (Cap. 622)), together with a certified copy of the instrument (if any) creating or evidencing the charge”;

paragraph.name: b
c
paragraph.content: in subsection (1) of that section, in the proviso, the words “the particulars and the copy of the instrument” had been substituted by the words “the statement and certified copy”.

section.name: s66
section.heading: Charge existing on property acquired by non-Hong Kong company

subsection.leadIn: This section applies to a charge if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: before section 82 of the predecessor Ordinance was repealed, a non-Hong Kong company registered under Part XI of the predecessor Ordinance acquired any property subject to the charge; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the charge was required by that section, as extended by section 91 of the predecessor Ordinance, to be registered.

subsection.content: Subject to subsection (4), section 82 of the predecessor Ordinance, as in force immediately before its repeal, continues to apply, by virtue of section 91 of the predecessor Ordinance as so in force, in relation to the charge.

Subject to section 68 of this Schedule, section 83(2) of the predecessor Ordinance, as in force immediately before its repeal, continues to apply, by virtue of section 91 of the predecessor Ordinance as so in force, in relation to the charge.

On the expiry of the period of 8 weeks after the commencement date# of Division 3 of Part 8, that section 82 applies in relation to the charge as if in subsection (1) of that section, the words “the particulars of the charge (which must include those specified in section 80(1A) and be in the specified form), together with a copy (certified in the prescribed manner to be a correct copy) of the instrument, if any, by which the charge was created or is evidenced” had been substituted by the words “a statement of the particulars of the charge (in the same form as that specified for the purposes of section 339(3) of the Companies Ordinance (Cap. 622)), together with a certified copy of the instrument (if any) creating or evidencing the charge”.

section.name: s67
section.heading: Charge existing on property on date of non-Hong Kong company’s registration under Part XI of predecessor Ordinance

subsection.leadIn: This section applies to a charge if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: before section 91(5) of the predecessor Ordinance was repealed, a non-Hong Kong company had, on the date of its registration under Part XI of the predecessor Ordinance, property in Hong Kong subject to the charge; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the charge was required by that section to be registered.

subsection.content: Subject to subsection (4), section 91(5) and (6) of the predecessor Ordinance, as in force immediately before its repeal, continues to apply in relation to the charge.
Subject to section 68 of this Schedule, section 83(2) of the predecessor Ordinance, as in force immediately before its repeal, continues to apply in relation to the charge.

On the expiry of the period of 8 weeks after the commencement date# of Division 3 of Part 8, that section 91(5) applies in relation to the charge as if the words “for registration the particulars in the specified form (including any instrument or its copy by which the charge was created or is evidenced) that are mentioned in this Part as requiring registration in respect of a charge of that kind” had been substituted by the words—

paragraph.leadIn: either or both of the following—

subparagraph.content: a statement of the particulars of the charge (in the same form as that specified for the purposes of section 340(2) of the Companies Ordinance (Cap. 622)), together with a certified copy of the instrument (if any) creating or evidencing the charge;

a statement of the particulars of the charge (in the same form as that specified for the purposes of section 340(3) of the Companies Ordinance (Cap. 622)), together with a certified copy of the instrument by reference to which the charge is given or, if there is no such instrument, any one debenture of the series; and

paragraph.content: (if applicable) the statement as required under the proviso to section 80(7) or (8) having a continuing effect under section 64(4)(a)(iv) or (v) of Schedule 11 to the Companies Ordinance (Cap. 622)”.

section.name: s68
section.heading: Certificates on registration of charge
section.leadIn: Section 83(2) of the predecessor Ordinance, as in force immediately before its repeal—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: continues to apply, by virtue of section 91 of the predecessor Ordinance as so in force, in relation to a charge to which section 64, 66 or 67 of this Schedule applies,

section.continued: as if the words “this Part” (wherever appearing) had been substituted by the words “this Part having a continuing effect under Schedule 11 to the Companies Ordinance (Cap. 622)”.

section.name: s69
section.heading: Entries of satisfaction and release
section.leadIn: Section 85 of the predecessor Ordinance, as in force immediately before its repeal—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: continues to apply in relation to an application made by a company, the mortgagee, or the person entitled to the charge, before the commencement date# of Division 5 of Part 8 for the purposes of that section 85; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: continues to apply, by virtue of section 91 of the predecessor Ordinance as so in force, in relation to an application made by a non-Hong Kong company registered under Part XI of the predecessor Ordinance, the mortgagee, or the person entitled to the charge, before that commencement date# for the purposes of that section 85.

section.name: s70
section.heading: Extension of time for registration and rectification of register of charges
section.leadIn: Section 86 of the predecessor Ordinance, as in force immediately before its repeal—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: continues to apply in relation to an application made by a company, or any person interested, before the commencement date# of sections 346 and 347 for the purposes of that section 86; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: continues to apply, by virtue of section 91 of the predecessor Ordinance as so in force, in relation to an application made by a non-Hong Kong company registered under Part XI of the predecessor Ordinance, or any person interested, before that commencement date# for the purposes of that section 86.

heading.b: Notice to Registrar of appointment of receiver or manager etc.

subsection.leadIn: This section applies if, before section 87 of the predecessor Ordinance was repealed—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a person made an appointment of a receiver or manager of the property of a company, or the charged property of a non-Hong Kong company registered under Part XI of the predecessor Ordinance, to which subsection (1) of that section 87 applied;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a person obtained an order for the appointment of such a receiver or manager;

paragraph.name: c
d
paragraph.content: a person who was appointed as receiver or manager of the property of a company, or the charged property of a non-Hong Kong company registered under Part XI of the predecessor Ordinance, and in respect of whom notice was required to be given under subsection (1) of that section 87, ceased to act as receiver or manager;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: a person who is mentioned in paragraph (c), and in respect of whom notice was required to be given under subsection (2) of that section 87, went out of possession of the property; or

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: any change occurred in the particulars given in a notice under subsection (1) or (2) of that section 87.

subsection.leadIn: In the case of subsection (1)(a) or (b), section 87(1), (3), (6), (7) and (8) of the predecessor Ordinance, as in force immediately before its repeal—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: continues to apply in relation to an appointment for a property of a company; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: continues to apply, by virtue of section 91 of the predecessor Ordinance as so in force, in relation to an appointment for a charged property of a non-Hong Kong company registered under Part XI of the predecessor Ordinance.

subsection.leadIn: In the case of subsection (1)(c), section 87(2), (3), (6) and (7) of the predecessor Ordinance, as in force immediately before its repeal—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: continues to apply in relation to an entry into possession of a property of a company; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: continues to apply, by virtue of section 91 of the predecessor Ordinance as so in force, in relation to an entry into possession of a charged property of a non-Hong Kong company registered under Part XI of the predecessor Ordinance.

subsection.leadIn: In the case of subsection (1)(d), section 87(4), (6), (7) and (8) of the predecessor Ordinance, as in force immediately before its repeal—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: continues to apply in relation to the ceasing to act as receiver or manager of a property of a company; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: continues to apply, by virtue of section 91 of the predecessor Ordinance as so in force, in relation to the ceasing to act as receiver or manager of a charged property of a non-Hong Kong company registered under Part XI of the predecessor Ordinance.

subsection.leadIn: In the case of subsection (1)(e), section 87(4), (6) and (7) of the predecessor Ordinance, as in force immediately before its repeal—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: continues to apply in relation to the going out of possession of a property of a company; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: continues to apply, by virtue of section 91 of the predecessor Ordinance as so in force, in relation to the going out of possession of a charged property of a non-Hong Kong company registered under Part XI of the predecessor Ordinance.

subsection.leadIn: In the case of subsection (1)(f), section 87(5), (6), (7) and (8) of the predecessor Ordinance, as in force immediately before its repeal—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: continues to apply in relation to a change that occurred in the particulars given in connection with an appointment of a receiver or manager of, or an entry into possession as mortgagee of, a property of a company; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: continues to apply, by virtue of section 91 of the predecessor Ordinance as so in force, in relation to a change that occurred in the particulars given in connection with an appointment of a receiver or manager of, or an entry into possession as mortgagee of, a charged property of a non-Hong Kong company registered under Part XI of the predecessor Ordinance.

section.name: s72
section.heading: Register of charges
section.leadIn: On and after the commencement date# of section 352—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a register of charges kept under section 89 of the predecessor Ordinance is to be regarded as a register of charges kept under section 352(1); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a register of charges kept, by virtue of section 91 of the predecessor Ordinance, under section 89 of that Ordinance, is to be regarded as a register of charges kept under section 353(1).

section.name: s73
section.heading: Notifying Registrar of place where copies of instruments creating charges are kept
section.leadIn: Section 88(4) of the predecessor Ordinance, as in force immediately before its repeal—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: continues to apply in relation to an obligation of a company to send notice to the Registrar under section 88(3) of the predecessor Ordinance that arose before the commencement date# of section 351; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: continues to apply, by virtue of section 91 of the predecessor Ordinance as so in force, in relation to an obligation of a non-Hong Kong company registered under Part XI of the predecessor Ordinance to send notice to the Registrar under section 88(3) of the predecessor Ordinance that arose before that commencement date#.

section.name: s74
section.heading: Notifying Registrar of place where register of charges is kept
section.leadIn: Section 89(4) and (5) of the predecessor Ordinance, as in force immediately before its repeal—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: continues to apply in relation to an obligation of a company to send notice to the Registrar under section 89(3) of the predecessor Ordinance that arose before the commencement date# of section 354; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: continues to apply, by virtue of section 91 of the predecessor Ordinance as so in force, in relation to an obligation of a non-Hong Kong company registered under Part XI of the predecessor Ordinance to send notice to the Registrar under section 89(3) of the predecessor Ordinance that arose before that commencement date#.

section.name: s75
section.heading: Right to inspect copies of instruments creating charges and register of charges
section.leadIn: Sections 90 and 348C(3) of the predecessor Ordinance, as in force immediately before their repeal—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: continue to apply in relation to a request received by a company before the commencement date# of section 355 for inspecting a register of charges or copies of instruments creating a charge; and

paragraph.name: b
