paragraph.content: continue to apply, by virtue of section 91 of the predecessor Ordinance as so in force, in relation to a request received by a non-Hong Kong company registered under Part XI of the predecessor Ordinance before that commencement date# for inspecting a register of charges or copies of instruments creating a charge.

part.name: P9
part.heading: Transitional and Saving Arrangements for Part 9

section.name: s76
section.heading: Books of account
section.content: Sections 121 and 348C of the predecessor Ordinance, as in force immediately before their repeal, continue to apply in relation to books of account for a financial year beginning before the commencement date# of Subdivision 2 of Division 4 of Part 9 and ending on or after that commencement date#.

section.name: s77
section.heading: Financial year and related matters
section.content: Sections 127 and 141D of, and the Eleventh Schedule to, the predecessor Ordinance, as in force immediately before their repeal, continue to apply in relation to a financial year beginning before the commencement date# of Division 3 of Part 9 and ending on or after that commencement date#.

section.name: s78
section.heading: Accounts and directors’ report

subsection.content: Sections 122, 123, 124, 125, 126, 128, 129, 129A, 129B, 129C, 129D, 129G, 141C, 161, 161A, 161B, 161BA and 161BB of, and the Tenth Schedule to, the predecessor Ordinance, as in force immediately before their repeal, continue to apply in relation to accounts for a financial year beginning before the commencement date# of Subdivision 3 of Division 4 of Part 9 and ending on or after that commencement date#.

Despite subsection (1), section 122(1B) of the predecessor Ordinance, as in force immediately before its repeal, continues to apply in relation to accounts for a financial year beginning before the commencement date# of Subdivision 3 of Division 4 of Part 9 and ending on or after that commencement date# as if paragraph (b) of that section were omitted.

If the Court makes an order under section 122(1B) of the predecessor Ordinance having a continuing effect under subsection (2), the accounts to be laid at the meeting concerned must be made up to the company’s primary accounting reference date under section 369(1)(b).

Sections 129D, 129E, 129F and 141C of the predecessor Ordinance, as in force immediately before their repeal, continue to apply in relation to a directors’ report for a financial year beginning before the commencement date# of Subdivision 4 of Division 4 of Part 9 and ending on or after that commencement date#.

section.name: s79
section.heading: Appointment of auditor

subsection.content: Sections 131(1), (2), (3), (4) and (9), 132 and 140 of the predecessor Ordinance, as in force immediately before their repeal, continue to apply in relation to an appointment of auditor for a financial year beginning before the commencement date# of Subdivision 2 of Division 5 of Part 9 and ending on or after that commencement date#.

Section 131(8) of, and paragraph 15 of the Tenth Schedule to, the predecessor Ordinance, as in force immediately before their repeal, continue to apply in relation to a person appointed as auditor for a financial year beginning before the commencement date# of Subdivision 2 of Division 5 of Part 9 and ending on or after that commencement date#.

section.name: s80
section.heading: Auditor’s report

subsection.content: Sections 141(1), (2), (3), (4), (5) and (6), 161(8) and 161B(12) of the predecessor Ordinance, as in force immediately before their repeal, continue to apply in relation to a financial year beginning before the commencement date# of Subdivision 3 of Division 5 of Part 9 and ending on or after that commencement date#.

Section 141(7) and (8) of the predecessor Ordinance, as in force immediately before its repeal, continues to apply in relation to a general meeting of which notice is given before the commencement date# of Subdivision 4 of Division 5 of Part 9.

section.name: s81
section.heading: Removal and resignation of auditor

subsection.content: Sections 131(6), (7) and (10) and 132 of the predecessor Ordinance, as in force immediately before their repeal, continue to apply in relation to a removal of a person appointed as auditor for a financial year beginning before the commencement date# of Subdivision 6 of Division 5 of Part 9 and ending on or after that commencement date#.

Sections 140A and 140B of the predecessor Ordinance, as in force immediately before their repeal, continue to apply in relation to a resignation of a person appointed as auditor for a financial year beginning before the commencement date# of Subdivision 6 of Division 5 of Part 9 and ending on or after that commencement date#.

section.name: s82
section.heading: Indemnity provision
section.content: Section 165 of the predecessor Ordinance, as in force immediately before its repeal, continues to apply in relation to a provision made before the commencement date# of Subdivision 5 of Division 5 of Part 9.

section.name: s83
section.heading: Summary financial report
section.content: Sections 141CA, 141CB, 141CC, 141CD, 141CE and 141CF of the predecessor Ordinance, and the Companies (Summary Financial Reports of Listed Companies) Regulation (Cap. 32 sub. leg. M), as in force immediately before their repeal, continue to apply in relation to a summary financial report for a financial year beginning before the commencement date# of Division 7 of Part 9 and ending on or after that commencement date#.

section.name: s84
section.heading: Voluntary revision of accounts etc.
section.content: Section 141E of the predecessor Ordinance, and the Companies (Revision of Accounts and Reports) Regulation (Cap. 32 sub. leg. N), as in force immediately before their repeal, continue to apply in relation to accounts for a financial year beginning before the commencement date# of section 449 and ending on or after that commencement date#.

section.name: s85
section.heading: Register kept under section 161BB(2) of predecessor Ordinance
section.content: On and after the commencement date# of section 384, a register kept under section 161BB(2) of the predecessor Ordinance is to be regarded as a register kept under section 384.

section.name: s86
section.heading: Right to inspect register kept under section 161BB(2) of predecessor Ordinance
section.content: Sections 161BB(5), (7) and (8) and 348C(3) of the predecessor Ordinance, as in force immediately before their repeal, continue to apply in relation to a request received by the company before the commencement date# of section 386 for inspecting a register kept under section 161BB(2) of the predecessor Ordinance.

section.name: s87
section.heading: Right to obtain copy of register kept under section 161BB(2) of predecessor Ordinance
section.content: Sections 161BB(6), (7) and (8) and 348C(3) of the predecessor Ordinance, as in force immediately before their repeal, continue to apply in relation to a request received by the company before the commencement date# of section 386 for a copy of the register kept under section 161BB(2) of the predecessor Ordinance.

part.name: P10
part.heading: Transitional and Saving Arrangements for Part 10

section.name: s88
section.heading: First directors of companies
section.content: Section 153(2) or 153A(2) (as the case requires) of the predecessor Ordinance, as in force immediately before its repeal, applies in relation to a company formed and registered under a provision of the predecessor Ordinance having a continuing effect under this Schedule or by virtue of section 23 of the Interpretation and General Clauses Ordinance (Cap. 1).

section.name: s89
section.heading: Requirement to have at least one director who is natural person

subsection.leadIn: If, on the commencement date# of section 457—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a company has at least one director; but

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: that director is not a natural person and none of the company’s other directors (if any) are natural persons,

subsection.continued: section 457(2) does not apply to the company until after the end of 6 months after that commencement date#.

subsection.leadIn: If, on the date of incorporation of a company formed and registered under a provision of the predecessor Ordinance having a continuing effect under this Schedule or by virtue of section 23 of the Interpretation and General Clauses Ordinance (Cap. 1)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the company has at least one director; but

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: that director is not a natural person and none of the company’s other directors (if any) are natural persons,

subsection.continued: section 457(2) does not apply to the company until after the end of 6 months after the commencement date# of section 457.

subsection.content: If, on the commencement date# of section 457, a company is a company deemed to be a dormant company under section 344A of the predecessor Ordinance, section 457(2) does not apply in relation to the company.
If the company mentioned in subsection (3) enters into an accounting transaction, that subsection ceases to have effect on and after the date of the accounting transaction.

section.name: s90
section.heading: Validity of acts of director
section.content: Section 157 of the predecessor Ordinance, as in force immediately before its repeal, continues to apply in relation to acts done before the commencement date# of section 461.

section.name: s91
section.heading: Removal of director
section.content: Section 157B(4) of the predecessor Ordinance, as in force immediately before its repeal, continues to apply if the representations were received by the company before the commencement date# of section 463.

section.name: s92
section.heading: Directors’ liabilities
section.content: So far as it relates to directors, section 165 of the predecessor Ordinance, as in force immediately before its repeal, continues to apply in relation to any provision to which it applied immediately before the commencement date# of sections 468, 469 and 470.

section.name: s93
section.heading: First company secretaries
section.content: Section 154(1AA) of the predecessor Ordinance, as in force immediately before its repeal, applies in relation to a company formed and registered under a provision of the predecessor Ordinance having a continuing effect under this Schedule or by virtue of section 23 of the Interpretation and General Clauses Ordinance (Cap. 1).

section.name: s94
section.heading: Records of meetings of directors

subsection.content: Section 119 of the predecessor Ordinance, as in force immediately before its repeal, continues to apply to meetings of directors held before the commencement date# of sections 481 and 482.

Despite subsection (1), a company is not required to keep the minutes that have been entered in a book in accordance with section 119(1) of the predecessor Ordinance if they have been kept for at least 10 years from the date of the meeting.
Section 153C of the predecessor Ordinance, as in force immediately before its repeal, continues to apply to decisions taken before the commencement date# of section 483.

Despite subsection (3), a company is not required to keep a record that has been entered into a book in accordance with section 153C(3) of the predecessor Ordinance if the record has been kept for at least 10 years from the date of the decision.

part.name: P11
part.heading: Transitional and Saving Arrangements for Part 11

section.name: s95
section.heading: Loans etc. to directors or other persons

subsection.leadIn: This section applies if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: before the commencement date# of Division 2 of Part 11, a company entered into a transaction specified in section 157HA(3)(a) of the predecessor Ordinance;

paragraph.name: b
c
paragraph.content: that condition has not been satisfied before that commencement date#.

subsection.leadIn: If the company has dispensed with the holding of an annual general meeting in accordance with section 613, the specified condition continues to apply as if it provided—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: that the approval of the company is required on or before the last date on which the company would otherwise have been required to hold an annual general meeting; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: that any liability falling on any person in connection with the transaction must be discharged within 6 months after that date if that approval is not forthcoming.

section.name: s96
section.heading: Loss of office or retirement

subsection.content: Sections 163, 163A, 163B, 163C and 163D of the predecessor Ordinance, as in force immediately before their repeal, continue to apply in relation to a loss of office or retirement specified in those sections that occurred before the commencement date# of Division 3 of Part 11.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of this section, a loss of office or retirement occurred—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the case of a directorship, when the person ceased to be a director; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the case of any other office, when the person ceased to hold the office.

section.name: s97
section.heading: Contracts with sole member who is also director
section.content: Section 162B of the predecessor Ordinance, as in force immediately before its repeal, continues to apply in relation to a contract specified in that section and entered into before the commencement date# of section 545.

part.name: P12
part.heading: Transitional and Saving Arrangements for Part 12

section.name: s98
section.heading: Interpretation

subsection.content: For the purposes of sections 100, 101, 102, 104, 105, 106 and 111 of this Schedule, if notice of a meeting is given over more than one day, it is to be regarded as given on the first of those days.

For the purposes of sections 100, 101, 103 and 107 of this Schedule, if copies of a requisition are deposited on more than one day, the date on which the requisition is made is to be regarded as the first day on which the copies deposited are sufficient to require the company to act.

section.name: s99
section.heading: Written resolution

subsection.content: Sections 116B (except subsections (7), (8), (9) and (10)), 116BA and 116BB of the predecessor Ordinance, as in force immediately before their repeal, continue to apply in relation to resolutions sent or circulated to any relevant member before the commencement date# of Subdivision 2 of Division 1 of Part 12.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: relevant member (有關成員) means a member whose signature is required by section 116B(1) of the predecessor Ordinance.

section.name: s100
section.heading: Resolutions at meetings
section.leadIn: Section 116 of the predecessor Ordinance, as in force immediately before its repeal, continues to apply in relation to resolutions (other than written resolutions)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: of which notice was given before the commencement date# of Subdivision 3 of Division 1 of Part 12; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: that are proposed at a meeting—

subparagraph.name: i
ii
subparagraph.content: that is convened in accordance with a requisition made before that commencement date# under section 113 of the predecessor Ordinance.

section.name: s101
section.heading: Calling meetings

subsection.content: Section 113 of the predecessor Ordinance, as in force immediately before its repeal, continues to apply in relation to requisitions made before the commencement date# of sections 566, 567 and 568.

Section 114A(1)(b) of the predecessor Ordinance, as in force immediately before its repeal, continues to apply in relation to a meeting of which notice was given before the commencement date# of section 569.

section.name: s102
section.heading: Notice of meetings

subsection.content: Sections 111(1), 114, 114A, 116A, 141(7) and 155B of the predecessor Ordinance, as in force immediately before their repeal, continue to apply in relation to a meeting of which notice was given before the commencement date# of sections 571, 574, 576 and 577.

Section 116C of the predecessor Ordinance, as in force immediately before its repeal, continues to apply in relation to resolutions for which special notice is required if notice of the intention to move the resolution was given to the company before the commencement date# of section 578.

section.name: s103
section.heading: Members’ statements
section.content: In so far as it relates to the circulation of any statement in relation to an annual general meeting, section 115A of the predecessor Ordinance, as in force immediately before its repeal, continues to apply in relation to requisitions made to a company under section 115A(1)(b) of the predecessor Ordinance before the commencement date# of Subdivision 6 of Division 1 of Part 12.

section.name: s104
section.heading: Procedure at meetings
section.content: Sections 114A(1)(c) and (d), 114AA and 118 of the predecessor Ordinance, as in force immediately before their repeal, continue to apply to meetings of which notice was given before the commencement date# of Subdivision 7 of Division 1 of Part 12.

section.name: s105
section.heading: Voting at meetings
section.content: Sections 114A(1)(e), 114D, 114E and 116(2) of the predecessor Ordinance, as in force immediately before their repeal, continue to apply to meetings of which notice was given before the commencement date# of Subdivision 8 of Division 1 of Part 12.

section.name: s106
section.heading: Proxies and corporate representatives
section.content: Sections 114C and 115 of the predecessor Ordinance, as in force immediately before their repeal, continue to apply to meetings of which notice was given before the commencement date# of Subdivision 9 of Division 1 of Part 12.

section.name: s107
section.heading: Annual general meetings

subsection.content: The repeal of section 115A of the predecessor Ordinance does not affect its application in relation to a requisition under section 115A(1)(a) of the predecessor Ordinance made to a company before the repeal.

subsection.leadIn: If a company is required under section 78(1) of this Schedule to lay at its annual general meeting an account or a balance sheet in accordance with section 122 of the predecessor Ordinance—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: section 111(1), (5) and (6) of the predecessor Ordinance, as in force immediately before its repeal, continues to apply in relation to an annual general meeting at which the account or balance sheet is to be laid; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: section 610 applies in relation to subsequent annual general meetings.

subsection.content: For the purposes of subsection (2)(a), section 111(6)(a) of the predecessor Ordinance has effect as if for the words “a resolution or resolutions in accordance with section 116B”, there were substituted the words “a written resolution or written resolutions”.

The repeal of section 111(2), (3), (4) and (5) of the predecessor Ordinance does not affect its operation in relation to a company if an application under section 111(2) of the predecessor Ordinance was made before the commencement date# of section 610.

subsection.leadIn: If a company has contravened section 111(1) of the predecessor Ordinance and no member of the company has made an application under section 111(2) of that Ordinance, section 610(7), (8) and (9) has effect in relation to the company as if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: for the words “subsection (1), (2), (3) or (6)” in section 610(7) and (9), there were substituted the words “section 111(1) of the predecessor Ordinance”; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: for the words “the financial year in respect of which the company has failed to hold an annual general meeting in accordance with this section” in section 610(8), there were substituted the words “the year in respect of which the company has failed to hold an annual general meeting in accordance with section 111(1) of the predecessor Ordinance”.

subsection.content: In so far as it relates to giving notice of a resolution in relation to an annual general meeting, section 115A of the predecessor Ordinance, as in force immediately before its repeal, continues to apply in relation to requisitions made to a company under section 115A(1)(a) of the predecessor Ordinance before the commencement date# of sections 615 and 616.

section.name: s108
section.heading: Records of resolutions and meetings

subsection.content: Sections 116B(7), (8), (9) and (10), 116BC, 119, 119A and 120 of the predecessor Ordinance, as in force immediately before their repeal, continue to apply in relation to resolutions passed, meetings held or decisions taken before the commencement date# of sections 617 to 621.

Despite subsection (1), a company is not required to keep a record or the minutes that have been entered into a book in accordance with section 116B(7), 116BC(3) or 119(1) of the predecessor Ordinance if the record or the minutes have been kept for at least 10 years from the date of the resolution, meeting or decision, as the case may be.

Section 117(1), (5) and (7) of the predecessor Ordinance, as in force immediately before its repeal, continues to apply in relation to resolutions passed and agreements made, but not forwarded to the Registrar, before the commencement date# of section 622 (except subsections (3) and (5)).

Section 117(2), (6) and (7) of the predecessor Ordinance, as in force immediately before its repeal, continues to apply in relation to a company’s articles issued before the commencement date# of section 622(3).

Section 117(3), (6) and (7) of the predecessor Ordinance, as in force immediately before its repeal, continues to apply if the request was received by the company before the commencement date# of section 622(5).

section.name: s109
section.heading: Right to inspect records of resolutions and meetings
section.leadIn: Sections 120(1), (3) and (4) and 348C(3) of the predecessor Ordinance, as in force immediately before their repeal—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: continue to apply in relation to a request received by the company before the commencement date# of section 620 for inspecting the books containing the minutes of proceedings of any general meeting of the company;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: continue to apply, by virtue of section 116B(9) of the predecessor Ordinance as so in force, in relation to a request received by the company before the commencement date# of section 620 for inspecting the record made in accordance with section 116B(7) of that Ordinance; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: continue to apply, by virtue of section 116BC(4) of the predecessor Ordinance as so in force, in relation to a request received by the company before the commencement date# of section 620 for inspecting the record made in accordance with section 116BC(3) of that Ordinance.

section.name: s110
section.heading: Right to obtain copy of records of resolutions and meetings
section.leadIn: Sections 120(2), (3) and (4) and 348C(3) of the predecessor Ordinance, as in force immediately before their repeal—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: continue to apply in relation to a request received by the company before the commencement date# of section 620 for a copy of the books containing the minutes of proceedings of any general meeting of the company;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: continue to apply, by virtue of section 116B(9) of the predecessor Ordinance as so in force, in relation to a request received by the company before the commencement date# of section 620 for a copy of the record made in accordance with section 116B(7) of that Ordinance; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: continue to apply, by virtue of section 116BC(4) of the predecessor Ordinance as so in force, in relation to a request received by the company before the commencement date# of section 620 for a copy of the record made in accordance with section 116BC(3) of that Ordinance.

section.name: s111
section.heading: Application to class meetings
section.content: Section 63A(6) of the predecessor Ordinance, as in force immediately before its repeal, continues to apply in relation to meetings of which notice was given before the commencement date# of Subdivision 12 of Division 1 of Part 12.

section.name: s112
section.heading: Register of members

subsection.content: On and after the commencement date# of section 627, a register of members kept under section 95 of the predecessor Ordinance is to be regarded as a register of members kept under and for the purposes of section 627.

Sections 98(1), (3) and (4) and 348C(3) of the predecessor Ordinance, as in force immediately before their repeal, continue to apply in relation to a request received by the company before the commencement date# of section 631 for inspecting a register of members or index of members’ names.

Sections 98(2), (3) and (4) and 348C(3) of the predecessor Ordinance, as in force immediately before their repeal, continue to apply in relation to a request received by the company before the commencement date# of section 631 for a copy of a register of members (or any part of it).

Section 99 of the predecessor Ordinance, as in force immediately before its repeal, continues to apply in relation to a closure of a register of members if the notice for the purposes of section 99(1) of the predecessor Ordinance was given before the commencement date# of section 632.

Section 104 of the predecessor Ordinance, as in force immediately before its repeal, continues to apply in relation to a register of members kept under a licence issued under section 103 of that Ordinance.

section.name: s113
section.heading: Inspection of register of directors and secretaries
section.content: Sections 158(7), (8) and (9) and 348C(3) of the predecessor Ordinance, as in force immediately before their repeal, continue to apply in relation to a request received by the company before the commencement date# of sections 642 and 649 for inspecting a register of directors and secretaries.

section.name: s114
section.heading: Register of directors
section.content: On and after the commencement date# of section 641, a register of directors and secretaries kept by a company under section 158(1) of the predecessor Ordinance, in so far as it relates to the company’s directors or reserve directors, is to be regarded as a register of directors kept under and for the purposes of section 641.

section.name: s115A
section.heading: Correspondence address in company’s register of directors etc.

subsection.leadIn: This section applies in relation to the following company—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an existing company; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a company formed and registered under this Ordinance before the specified date.

subsection.content: The register of directors (register) of the company need not contain a specified director’s correspondence address for compliance with section 643(1)(a)(ii), (2)(b) or (3)(b) before the company’s specified annual return date.

subsection.leadIn: Despite subsection (2), the company’s register must contain a specified director’s correspondence address before the company’s specified annual return date if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the particulars of the specified director are first entered in the register on or after the specified date; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any change is made to the particulars of the specified director contained in the register on or after the specified date.

subsection.content: For the purposes of subsection (3)(a), the company’s register must contain the specified director’s correspondence address beginning on the date on which the particulars are first entered in the register.
For the purposes of subsection (3)(b), the company’s register must contain the specified director’s correspondence address beginning on the date on which the change is made.

subsection.leadIn: The address of the company’s registered office is, for all purposes relating to the company’s register, to be regarded as the correspondence address of a specified director of the company until whichever is the earlier of the following—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the date on which the company enters the specified director’s correspondence address in the register;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the company’s specified annual return date.

subsection.leadIn: The company need not, for compliance with section 645(4), deliver to the Registrar a notice—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: for entering in the company’s register a specified director’s correspondence address before the specified date;

paragraph.name: b
c
paragraph.content: because the address of the company’s registered office is regarded as a specified director’s correspondence address under subsection (6).

subsection.leadIn: Despite subsection (7), if, immediately before the specified date—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a specified director’s correspondence address was contained in the company’s register; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the address was not the address of the company’s registered office,

subsection.continued: the company must, for compliance with section 645(4), deliver to the Registrar a notice in relation to the specified director’s correspondence address as if there were, on that date, a change in the specified director’s correspondence address contained in the register to the address mentioned in paragraph (a).

subsection.content: An annual return of the company under section 662(1) or (3) made up to a date before the specified date need not contain a correspondence address of a person who at the date of the return is a specified director of the company.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—

def.name: SpecifiedAnnualReturnDate
def.leadIn: specified annual return date (指明周年申報表日期), in relation to a company, means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if the specified date falls on an annual return date of the company—the specified date; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if not—the first annual return date of the company after the specified date;

subsection.def: specified date (指明日期) means the date on which section 54(2) comes into operation;
specified director (指明董事) means a director or reserve director who is a natural person.

section.name: s116
section.heading: Supplementary provisions relating to particulars to be registered

subsection.content: On the commencement date of section 643, an existing company must remove from its register of directors any entry relating to a shadow director who is deemed to be a director of the company under section 158(10)(a) of the predecessor Ordinance.

If, in accordance with section 158 of the predecessor Ordinance, an existing company has sent to the Registrar a notification in relation to a shadow director of the company, section 645 applies as if the shadow director had ceased to be a director on the commencement date of section 643.

The removal by an existing company from its register of directors on or after the commencement date of section 643 of particulars required by the predecessor Ordinance but not required by this Ordinance does not give rise to any duty to deliver a notice to the Registrar under section 645.
Section 158 of the predecessor Ordinance, as in force immediately before its repeal, continues to apply in relation to a change occurring before the commencement date of section 643.

section.name: s117
section.heading: Register of company secretaries
section.content: On and after the commencement date# of section 648, a register of directors and secretaries kept by a company under section 158(1) of the predecessor Ordinance, in so far as it relates to the company secretary or joint company secretaries of the company, is to be regarded as a register of company secretaries kept under and for the purposes of section 648.

section.name: s118
section.heading: Particulars to be registered in register of company secretaries

subsection.leadIn: An existing company need not comply with any provision of this Ordinance requiring the company’s register of company secretaries to contain particulars additional to those required by the predecessor Ordinance until—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the date to which the company makes up its first annual return made up to a date on or after the commencement date# of section 650; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the company fails to do so, the last date to which the company should have made up that return.

subsection.content: Unless the existing company is a company formed and registered under a provision of the predecessor Ordinance having a continuing effect under this Schedule or by virtue of section 23 of the Interpretation and General Clauses Ordinance (Cap. 1), subsection (1) does not apply in relation to a company secretary of whom particulars are first registered on or after the commencement date# of section 650 (whether the company secretary was appointed before, on or after that date).

Subsection (1) ceases to apply in relation to a company secretary whose registered particulars fall to be altered on or after the commencement date# of section 650 (whether the change occurred before, on or after that date).
Subsections (1), (2) and (3) do not affect the particulars required to be included in the company’s annual return.

In the case of a company secretary of an existing company who is a natural person, the address of the company’s registered office is to be regarded, on and after the commencement date# of section 650, as the correspondence address of the company secretary.
The operation of subsection (5) does not give rise to any duty to deliver a notice to the Registrar under section 652.

section.name: s119
section.heading: Supplementary provisions relating to particulars to be registered

subsection.content: The removal by an existing company from its register of company secretaries on or after the commencement date# of section 650 of particulars required by the predecessor Ordinance but not required by this Ordinance does not give rise to any duty to deliver a notice to the Registrar under section 652.
Section 158 of the predecessor Ordinance, as in force immediately before its repeal, continues to apply in relation to a change occurring before the commencement date# of section 650.

section.name: s120
section.heading: Registered office of company
section.content: Section 92 of the predecessor Ordinance, as in force immediately before its repeal, continues to apply in relation to a change occurring before the commencement date# of section 658.

section.name: s121
section.heading: Annual return

subsection.leadIn: Except where the company is a private company having a share capital, if the financial year (as defined in section 2(1) of the predecessor Ordinance) of the company begins before the commencement date# of section 662 and ends on or after that date—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: sections 107 and 109 of the predecessor Ordinance, as in force immediately before their repeal, continue to apply in relation to the company for that financial year; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: section 662 applies in relation to the company for the first financial year that begins on or after that commencement date# and all subsequent financial years.

subsection.content: If the company is a private company having a share capital, sections 107 and 109 of the predecessor Ordinance, as in force immediately before their repeal, continue to apply in relation to the company’s annual returns made up to a date before the commencement date# of section 662.

part.name: P13
part.heading: Transitional and Saving Arrangements for Part 13

section.name: s122
section.heading: Saving of predecessor Ordinance etc. for sanctioning arrangement or compromise

subsection.content: Sections 166, 166A and 167 of the predecessor Ordinance and rule 117 of the Companies (Winding-up) Rules (Cap. 32 sub. leg. H), as in force immediately before the commencement date# of Division 2 of Part 13, continue to apply in relation to an arrangement or compromise if, before that commencement date#, an application was made to the Court for the purposes of section 166(1) of the predecessor Ordinance for a meeting to be summoned in relation to the arrangement or compromise.

Item 2(e) of Schedule 1 to the Companies (Fees and Percentages) Order (Cap. 32 sub. leg. C), as in force immediately before its repeal, continues to apply in relation to an application made under section 166 of the predecessor Ordinance having a continuing effect under subsection (1).

section.name: s123
section.heading: Acquisition offer
section.leadIn: Section 168(1), (2) and (3) of, and the Ninth Schedule to, the predecessor Ordinance, as in force immediately before their repeal, continue to apply in relation to an acquisition offer—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: that was made before the commencement date# of Division 4 of Part 13; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in relation to which those provisions applied immediately before the repeal.

part.name: P14
part.heading: Transitional and Saving Arrangements for Part 14

section.name: s124
section.heading: Petition in case of unfair prejudice

subsection.content: Section 168A of the predecessor Ordinance, as in force immediately before 15 July 2005, continues to apply in relation to a petition presented before 15 July 2005 for an order under that section 168A.

Section 168A of the predecessor Ordinance, as in force immediately before its repeal, continues to apply in relation to a petition presented on or after 15 July 2005, but before the commencement date# of Division 2 of Part 14, for an order under that section.

The Companies (Winding-up) Rules (Cap. 32 sub. leg. H), as in force immediately before the commencement date# of Division 2 of Part 14, continue to apply in relation to a petition presented on or after 15 July 2005, but before that commencement date#, for an order under section 168A of the predecessor Ordinance.

section.name: s125
section.heading: Application for injunction
section.content: Section 350B(1)(g) and (h) of the predecessor Ordinance, as in force immediately before its repeal, continues to apply in relation to an application made before the commencement date# of Division 3 of Part 14 for the purposes of that section.

section.name: s126
section.heading: Derivative action in case of misconduct against companies etc.

content.leadIn: Part IVAA of the predecessor Ordinance, as in force immediately before its repeal, continues to apply in relation to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an application made before the commencement date# of Division 4 of Part 14 for leave to bring or intervene in proceedings under section 168BC of the predecessor Ordinance, as in force immediately before its repeal; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if leave is granted to bring or intervene in proceedings, the proceedings so brought or intervened in.

section.name: s127
section.heading: Application for inspection of company’s records
section.leadIn: Sections 152FA, 152FB, 152FC, 152FD and 152FE of the predecessor Ordinance, as in force immediately before their repeal, continue to apply in relation to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an application made before the commencement date# of Division 5 of Part 14 for an order for inspection under section 152FA of the predecessor Ordinance, as in force immediately before its repeal; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if an order for inspection is made, the inspection.

part.name: P15
part.heading: Transitional and Saving Arrangements for Part 15

section.name: s128
section.heading: Disclaimer of property vested in Government under predecessor Ordinance
section.content: Sections 290C and 290D of the predecessor Ordinance, as in force immediately before their repeal, continue to apply in relation to a disclaimer of the Government’s title to any property or right (other than immovable property) vested in the Government before the commencement date# of Division 3 of Part 15 under section 292 of the predecessor Ordinance.

section.name: s129
section.heading: Striking off

subsection.content: Section 291(2), (3) and (6) of the predecessor Ordinance, as in force immediately before its repeal, continues to apply in relation to the striking off the register of the name of a company and to the dissolution of the company if, before the commencement date# of Subdivision 1 of Division 1 of Part 15, the Registrar has sent a letter to the company under section 291(1) of the predecessor Ordinance.

Section 291(6) of the predecessor Ordinance, as in force immediately before its repeal, continues to apply in relation to the striking off the register of the name of a company and to the dissolution of the company if, before the commencement date# of Subdivision 1 of Division 1 of Part 15, the Registrar has published in the Gazette a notice in relation to the company under section 291(5) of the predecessor Ordinance.

Section 291(6) of the predecessor Ordinance, as in force immediately before its repeal, continues to apply in relation to the striking off the register of the name of a company and to the dissolution of the company if, before the commencement date# of Subdivision 2 of Division 1 of Part 15, the Registrar has published in the Gazette a notice in relation to the company under section 291(4) of the predecessor Ordinance.

Section 291A of the predecessor Ordinance, as in force immediately before its repeal, continues to apply in relation to the striking off the register of the name of a company and to the dissolution of the company if, before the commencement date# of Subdivision 2 of Division 1 of Part 15, the Registrar has made an application for the purposes of section 291A(1) of the predecessor Ordinance.

Section 291AA of the predecessor Ordinance, as in force immediately before its repeal, continues to apply in relation to the deregistration of a company and to the dissolution of the company if, before the commencement date# of Division 2 of Part 15, an application has been made under section 291AA(1) of the predecessor Ordinance.

section.name: s130
section.heading: Restoration

subsection.content: Section 291(7) or 291A(2) of the predecessor Ordinance, as in force immediately before its repeal, continues to apply in relation to an application made before the commencement date# of Subdivision 2 of Division 4 of Part 15 for the purposes of that section.

Section 291AB(2), (3), (4) and (5) of the predecessor Ordinance, as in force immediately before its repeal, continues to apply in relation to an application made before the commencement date# of Subdivision 2 of Division 4 of Part 15 for the purposes of section 291AB(2) of the predecessor Ordinance as in force immediately before the repeal.

section.name: s131
section.heading: Bona vacantia
section.content: Section 292(2) of the predecessor Ordinance, as in force immediately before its repeal, continues to apply in relation to section 292(1) of the predecessor Ordinance as so in force and having a continuing effect by virtue of section 23 of the Interpretation and General Clauses Ordinance (Cap. 1).

part.name: P16
part.heading: Transitional and Saving Arrangements for Part 16

section.name: s132
section.heading: Application for registration

subsection.content: If, immediately before the commencement date# of Division 2 of Part 16, there was a pending application for registration under section 333(1) of the predecessor Ordinance, the application is to be regarded as an application for registration made under section 776(2).

Paragraph (a) of Part III of the Eighth Schedule to the predecessor Ordinance, as in force immediately before its repeal, continues to apply in relation to an application mentioned in subsection (1), as if the reference to section 333AA(2)(c) in that paragraph were a reference to section 777(4)(a).

Paragraph (aa) of Part III of the Eighth Schedule to the predecessor Ordinance, as in force immediately before its repeal, continues to apply in relation to an application mentioned in subsection (1), as if the reference to section 333 in that paragraph were a reference to section 776.

section.name: s133
section.heading: Registered particulars of authorized representative
section.content: Section 333A(2) of the predecessor Ordinance, as in force immediately before its repeal, continues to apply in relation to a non-Hong Kong company if, on or after the commencement date# of Division 5 of Part 16, the company delivers to the Registrar for registration a return in respect of another authorized representative for the purposes of section 335(1)(b) of the predecessor Ordinance having a continuing effect by virtue of section 23 of the Interpretation and General Clauses Ordinance (Cap. 1).

section.name: s134
section.heading: Registration of return

subsection.leadIn: If—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: before the commencement date# of Division 3 of Part 16, a return and other documents were delivered to the Registrar for registration under section 335(2) of the predecessor Ordinance; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: as at the beginning of that commencement date#, the Registrar has not registered the return and issued a fresh certificate of registration under section 335(3) of the predecessor Ordinance because the Registrar has not received all the documents mentioned in section 335(2)(b) of the predecessor Ordinance,

subsection.continued: the return is to be regarded as a return delivered to the Registrar for registration under section 778.

subsection.content: If, on or after the commencement date# of Division 3 of Part 16, a return and other documents are delivered to the Registrar for registration under section 335(2) of the predecessor Ordinance having a continuing effect by virtue of section 23 of the Interpretation and General Clauses Ordinance (Cap. 1), the return is to be regarded as a return delivered to the Registrar for registration under section 778.

Paragraph (a) of Part III of the Eighth Schedule to the predecessor Ordinance, as in force immediately before its repeal, continues to apply in relation to an application mentioned in subsection (1), as if the reference to section 335(3) in that paragraph were a reference to section 779(1)(b).

section.name: s135
section.heading: Notice to regulate use of corporate names
section.content: A notice that was served under section 337B of the predecessor Ordinance, as in force immediately before its repeal, and that was in force immediately before the commencement date# of Division 4 of Part 16, continues in force and has effect as if it were a notice served under section 780.

section.name: s136
section.heading: Notice of cessation of place of business in Hong Kong
section.content: If, on or after the commencement date# of Division 7 of Part 16, a non-Hong Kong company sends a notice to the Registrar under section 339(1) of the predecessor Ordinance having a continuing effect by virtue of section 23 of the Interpretation and General Clauses Ordinance (Cap. 1), section 339(2) of the predecessor Ordinance, as in force immediately before its repeal, continues to apply in relation to the notice and the company.

section.name: s137
section.heading: Notice of dissolution
section.content: If, on or after the commencement date# of Division 7 of Part 16, an agent of a non-Hong Kong company sends a notice and other documents to the Registrar under section 339AA(1) of the predecessor Ordinance having a continuing effect by virtue of section 23 of the Interpretation and General Clauses Ordinance (Cap. 1), section 339AA(2) of the predecessor Ordinance, as in force immediately before its repeal, continues to apply in relation to the notice and documents and the company.

section.name: s138
section.heading: Striking off

subsection.content: Section 291(2), (3) and (6) of the predecessor Ordinance, as in force immediately before its repeal, continues to apply, by virtue of section 339A(2) of the predecessor Ordinance as so in force, in relation to the striking off the register of the name of a non-Hong Kong company if, before the commencement date# of Division 8 of Part 16, the Registrar has sent a letter to the company under section 291(1) of the predecessor Ordinance.

Section 291(6) of the predecessor Ordinance, as in force immediately before its repeal, continues to apply, by virtue of section 339A(2) of the predecessor Ordinance as so in force, in relation to the striking off the register of the name of a non-Hong Kong company if, before the commencement date# of Division 8 of Part 16, the Registrar has published in the Gazette a notice in relation to the company under section 291(5) of the predecessor Ordinance.

Section 291(6) of the predecessor Ordinance, as in force immediately before its repeal, continues to apply, by virtue of section 339A(2) of the predecessor Ordinance as so in force, in relation to the striking off the register of the name of a non-Hong Kong company if, before the commencement date# of Division 8 of Part 16, the Registrar has published in the Gazette a notice in relation to the company under section 291(4) of the predecessor Ordinance.

section.name: s139
section.heading: Restoration
section.content: Section 291(7) of the predecessor Ordinance, as in force immediately before its repeal, continues to apply, by virtue of section 339A(2) of the predecessor Ordinance as so in force, in relation to an application made before the commencement date# of Division 8 of Part 16 for the purposes of that section 291(7) as in force immediately before the repeal.

section.name: s140
section.heading: Certificates previously issued

subsection.leadIn: This section applies to a certificate—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: that was issued under—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: section 333(3) or (5) of the predecessor Ordinance as in force from time to time before 14 December 2007; or

subparagraph.name: ii

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: that was in force immediately before the commencement date＠ of Part 16.

subsection.content: The certificate continues in force and has effect as if it were a certificate issued under section 777(4)(a) or 779(1)(b) (as the case may be).

part.name: P17
part.heading: Transitional and Saving Arrangements for Part 17

section.name: s141
section.heading: Application for registration

subsection.content: If, immediately before the commencement date# of Part 17, there was a pending application for registration under section 310 of the predecessor Ordinance, the application is to be regarded as an application for registration made under section 807.

subsection.leadIn: Despite section 811, the applicant is not required to pay any fee to the Registrar for the registration if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the company is not registered as a limited company; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the company is registered as a limited company, but the liability of the shareholders was limited by some other Ordinance before the registration.

part.name: P18
part.heading: Transitional and Saving Arrangements for Part 19

section.name: s142
section.heading: Investigation by inspectors appointed under section 142 or 143 of predecessor Ordinance

subsection.leadIn: This section applies if, before the commencement date# of Division 2 of Part 19—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an inspector was appointed under section 142 or 143 of the predecessor Ordinance by the Financial Secretary to investigate the affairs of a company; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a final report on the investigation has not yet been published.

subsection.content: Sections 144, 145, 145A, 145B, 146, 146A, 150, 151, 152B, 152D and 152F(1) of the predecessor Ordinance, as in force immediately before their repeal, continue to apply in relation to the investigation.

In section 145B of the predecessor Ordinance, the reference to “section 161” or “section 161B” is to be construed as a reference to “section 161 or section 383 of the Companies Ordinance (Cap. 622)” or “section 161B or section 383 of the Companies Ordinance (Cap. 622)” respectively.

In section 146(3)(a)(ii) of the predecessor Ordinance, the reference to “the fee appointed under section 305 for a certified copy of a document where the copy has been prepared in the office of the Registrar” is to be construed as a reference to “the fee prescribed by the Financial Secretary for the purposes of section 860(1)(b) of the Companies Ordinance (Cap. 622)”.

section.name: s143
section.heading: Expenses of investigation by inspectors appointed under section 142 or 143 of predecessor Ordinance
section.leadIn: If, before the commencement date# of Division 2 of Part 19—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an inspector was appointed under section 142 or 143 of the predecessor Ordinance by the Financial Secretary to investigate the affairs of a company; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the expenses of and incidental to the investigation has not yet been settled,

section.continued: section 148 of that Ordinance continues to apply in relation to those expenses.

section.name: s144
section.heading: Report made and information obtained by inspectors appointed under section 142 or 143 of predecessor Ordinance

subsection.leadIn: Section 147(1) of the predecessor Ordinance, as in force immediately before its repeal, continues to apply in relation to any prosecution arising from—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any report made, or any information supplied, under section 146 of that Ordinance; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any information or document obtained under section 152B of that Ordinance.

subsection.leadIn: Sections 147(2), 168A(1) and 168J(1) of the predecessor Ordinance, as in force immediately before their repeal, continue to apply in relation to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any report made under section 146 of that Ordinance; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any information or document obtained under section 152B of that Ordinance.

subsection.leadIn: Section 147(3) and (4) of the predecessor Ordinance, as in force immediately before its repeal, continues to apply in relation to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any report made, or any information supplied, under section 146 of that Ordinance; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any information or document obtained under section 152B of that Ordinance.

subsection.content: Section 149 of the predecessor Ordinance, as in force immediately before its repeal, continues to apply in relation to any report made under section 146(1) of that Ordinance.
Section 152C of the predecessor Ordinance, as in force immediately before its repeal, continues to apply in relation to any information or document obtained under section 152B of that Ordinance.

section.name: s145
section.heading: Requirement for production of books or papers under section 152A of predecessor Ordinance

subsection.content: This section applies if, before the commencement date# of Division 3 of Part 19, the Financial Secretary, or a person authorized by the Financial Secretary, required a company or body corporate to produce books or papers under section 152A(1) of the predecessor Ordinance.
Sections 152A(2), (3), (4), (5) and (6), 152B, 152C, 152D, 152E and 152F of the predecessor Ordinance, as in force immediately before their repeal, continue to apply in relation to the requirement.

Section 147(1) of the predecessor Ordinance, as in force immediately before its repeal, continues to apply in relation to any prosecution arising from any information or document obtained under section 152A or 152B of that Ordinance.

Sections 147(2), (3) and (4), 168A(1) and 168J(1) of the predecessor Ordinance, as in force immediately before their repeal, continue to apply in relation to any information or document obtained under section 152A or 152B of that Ordinance.

section.name: s146
section.heading: Order under section 168A(1) of predecessor Ordinance

subsection.leadIn: This section applies if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: before the commencement date# of Division 2 or 3 of Part 19 (as the case may be)—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the Financial Secretary, under section 147(2)(b) of the predecessor Ordinance, presented a petition for an order under section 168A(1) of that Ordinance; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the petition has not yet been determined; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on or after the commencement date# of Division 2 or 3 of Part 19 (as the case may be), the Financial Secretary, in reliance on section 144(2) or 145(4) of this Schedule presents a petition for an order under section 168A(1) of the predecessor Ordinance.

subsection.content: Section 168A(2), (2C), (3), (4) and (6) of the predecessor Ordinance, as in force immediately before its repeal, continues to apply in relation to the petition.

section.name: s147
section.heading: Application for disqualification order under section 168J(1) of predecessor Ordinance

subsection.leadIn: This section applies if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: before the commencement date# of Division 2 or 3 of Part 19 (as the case may be)—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the Financial Secretary made an application for a disqualification order under section 168J(1) of the predecessor Ordinance; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the application has not yet been determined; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on or after the commencement date# of Division 2 or 3 of Part 19 (as the case may be), the Financial Secretary, in reliance on section 144(2) or 145(4) of this Schedule, makes an application for a disqualification order under section 168J(1) of the predecessor Ordinance.

subsection.content: Section 168J(2) of the predecessor Ordinance, as in force immediately before its repeal, continues to apply in relation to the application.

section.name: s148
section.heading: Investigation by inspectors appointed under section 152(1) of predecessor Ordinance

subsection.content: This section applies if, before the commencement date# of Division 6 of Part 19, an inspector was appointed under section 152(1) of the predecessor Ordinance by a company to investigate its affairs.
Section 152(2), (3), (4) and (5) of the predecessor Ordinance, as in force immediately before its repeal, continues to apply in relation to the investigation.
Section 152(6) of the predecessor Ordinance, as in force immediately before its repeal, continues to apply in relation to any report of the inspector on the investigation.

part.name: P19
part.heading: Transitional and Saving Arrangements for Part 20

section.name: s149
section.heading: Inspection and production of documents if offence suspected
section.content: Section 351B of the predecessor Ordinance, as in force immediately before its repeal, continues to apply in relation to an application made before the commencement date# of section 897 for the purposes of that section.

editorialNote.content: ＠ Part 16 came into operation on 3 March 2014, except sections 791(4) and 802(4) and (5). See L.N. 163 of 2013.
